review: I’ve used this several times and have had problems each time. The first time the car was to arrive in 4 minutes. Every minute or two for over 20 minutes it kept delaying the pick up time. Had to call customer service. The suggested canceling the ride and trying again which worked but resulted in a higher price. On the return trip the car went over 100 yards past our location on a dead end street. It then took a trip through a neighborhood to get headed back in the right direction. Upon dropping us off it almost hit a parked car and didn’t leave enough room for us to fully open the passenger doors. It blocked a parked car that was trying to leave as it figured out how to move without hitting the car it got too close to. Today I tried to use Waymo again. The ride was 9 minutes out and a car came past us but didn’t stop. The app updated to day it was 8 minutes out so it cancelled. I got a warning that there is a $4.99 cancellation fee which is ridiculous since you have to prepay for a ride that doesn’t show up on time. Our
title: Unreliable

review: My two agents Pauline and Selyn were completely rude and unprofessional. I actually have worked in customer support before and when a customer asks to be transferred to a supervisor to escalate the call the correct procedure is to transfer to a supervisor. Both agents closed the chat in my after literally offering NO SUPPORT about my item. I keep explaining the situation but they keep sending the same exact scripted messages. I have been talking to customer support for over 2 weeks in order to receive help and NOTHING. Meanwhile the driver that stole my phone doesn’t even get a slap on the wrist. All I get from Uber is ‘we tried but he’s not picking up, but we’ll let you know once he picks up’ FOR 2 STRAIGHT WEEKS. What kind of amateur customer support is this? At LYFT they ACTUALLY provide you with help when situations like this happen. I’ve been a long time Uber costumer but it’s constantly the same issues with customer support being unhelpful. I recommend Lyft or just taking a cab for anyone that values their time and money. It baffles me that Uber buries their heads in the sand.
title: Driver stole my phone and TERRIBLE customer support

review:
My daughter who was a new college student called Uber took her to and back from an appointment. The trip going there charged total $17 which was the normal fare. On the way back the base price was about $20 when she confirmed the trip. However, when the receipt came after the trip, it became $44! It showed a surcharge that was 1.1x the original base price was added to the fare! On their website, it clearly stated that any surcharge should be shown up in the price before the trip was confirmed. Obviously, this is not the case! (Also you can see the similar things happened in other reviews.) How can they charge $44 for a trip of 2.6 miles and fair rate was under $20? Looks Uber just allowed the driver add more charge arbitrarily. 
What’s even worse is there is No customer service you can call. I submitted an online complains that requested the refund of the extra charge they added after the trip and no response from Uber.  What a shame! I will dispute this charge plus the tip with my credit card company.  I will try Lyft from now on.
title: A surcharge that doubled the original price was added after the ride

review: So I I’ll start off by saying that I initially liked uber because it was convenient and the prices were reasonable compared to cab prices. Now, uber overcharges on fares and lies about having discounts. I had an uber pass that I paid for monthly for discounts since I was a frequent user but I found out after a while that uber doesn’t actually give a discount and if it does, it’s by a couple of cents. They inflate prices and claim it’s due to “being busy”. Also, once you look up a price, you pretty much have to be ready to purchase right at that time or else the price will be increased since it’s logged that you wanna go to that desired location you just checked. Also, I am a diamond member due to the amount of points I have and I purchased a 20% discount to avoid paying an $70 fair for what’s really supposed to be $50 at most and and when I put in my desired location in again for the discount, the price stayed the same and claimed my fair was $80!
title: Overpriced/Uber Lies on Discounts

review:
Recently I applied to become a Uber Eats driver. Come to find out that’s someone used my information to become a Uber driver. By the way this was never resolved and the individuals that work on this type of situation needs re trained. I talked to over 12 individuals and all states they could tell that individual fraudulent used my information but nothing was done. However, through all of this, somehow my information on my Uber rider account was all deleted. So when I used my rider account this morning, I had to reset it. Oh, by the way!  Through all of this mess, somehow my language of choice is not Spanish!  The person that used my account fraudulent spoke Spanish so everything I received this morning from UBER WAS IN Spanish until I switched it back to English. I would not be using UBER, but I really don’t have another option!

Bruce
title: Not drivers fault

review:
Loaded app for that ‘just in case’ we needed for traveling.  
While in Las Vegas we use the RTC bus Deuce to get up and down the strip and back and forth to Fremont Street.  During our trip a couple times the bus was not showing up.  It was so easy as your phone and this app always know where you are.  All you need to do is put in your destination. I did not need the address, just typed in hotel name.  The app brings up the vehicle choices with what will be charged to credit card, being only 2 of us we picked 1st option.  The app has vehicle model, color of car and license plate.  EZ.  You can follow along with this app to destination.  Once out of car you receive notification from app that trip is complete and if you want to add tip.  We tipped the driver directly so I checked no tip on app.  You receive a email of your credit card charge from UBER.
title: USER FRIENDLY

review: I saw Uber rental on the Uber app. I thought it looks easy so I booked a rental car for a day. Car pick up time was 5pm but I was wondering that I can pick it up little early. I called the rental car pick up location and he said I saw your reservation online but I am not going to reserve car for you. I didn’t understand that what he say. He said it is online booking and I don’t want to book you rental car on my book. I couldn’t say nothing else so hang up and I checked Uber app for my status.  I still had my rental car reservation. I called the pick up office and asked I can give you my reservation #. He said I know you # but I don’t have any car for you. Next time when you book your car, call pick up office too check first. I didn’t get that but hang up and contacted to Uber rental. The email says my reservation is still good and my car is ready at the pick up location. But it isn’t. I can not trust Uber rental. After a few emails, Uber says that they can not do anything else because Uber didn’t take the payment when I booked on their app. That’s it.  DO NOT TRUST UBER RENTAL!!
title: Uber rental DO NOT TRUST!!!

review: My driver never showed up for my ride. I attempted to call him multiple times and it went straight to voicemail. I messaged him and he never responded. I literally watched him on the map drive straight past the street of my pickup destination and continue on to my drop off location, WITHOUT ME IN THE CAR. When I reached out to Uber about this, they stated that since it appeared he completed the drive I would not be entitled to any form of a refund. So let me get this straight, the driver lied about picking me up, he still gets his money, Uber still gets its money, and I’m stuck footing the bill and had to find another way to get to my destination, showing up late for an appointment? It’s an absolute scam. Since you can only email with them, I have been going back and forth with several different customer service reps saying they can only base refunds off of info in the app, even when I provided screenshots of when I attempted to call the driver and they can see the message I never received a response to. Do yourself a favor and opt for Lyft or a taxi.
title: Driver didn’t show up or respond to calls/messages

review: I attempted to request a pick up for a secondary person today. A driver had picked up the request. The secondary person got the notification and then that driver canceled the pick up and another driver responded but all of a sudden the pick-up point changed from the drop off point to now being the pick-up point and the pick up point became the drop off. I tried calling the new driver, I tried texting the driver and I tried changing the pick up point back to the correct place but it kept telling me it was outside of my zone. Then when I canceled the trip I was charged a fee for the driver’s time, which I don’t mind, but come on why did the pick up and drop off points reverse themselves when the first driver dumped my request for no good reason. I have had nothing but problems half the times I use this app and today was the worst. It is also frustrating to see each time a driver refuses to pick up a ride. Once I went through twenty different drivers before someone finally said yes.
title: What happened?

review: I would like to echo the feedback from other users about the abuse of distance and time charging in the app and the “help” maze that the app offers.  Lately there is a huge number of new drivers in my city that do not know the roads.  And each time they are lost, I have to open a help request to adjust the ride fare, which is adding up to my daily routine.  Moreover, the other day, the car had a flat tire which the driver attempted to fix quickly, but 15 min later, he advised me to get another ride.  To my dismay, I was charged for the time the driver was trying to fix his flat instead of comping the fare for wasting my time and making me pay a higher rate for the next trip.  What drove me to write this feedback was a worse behavior that I just noticed.  After getting a pop up with the correct fare amount and a request to rate and tip the driver, the receipt was modified with a time and distance charge.   Had I not reviewed the app to follow on another charge from the previous day, I would not have even known.  This is very alarming and needs immediate attention from UBER!
title: Fraudulent App

review: My driver connected with me for a ride and i watchd them drive around in circles in the same area rhat they connected with me in and continued to drive around said neighborhood even when i was the current ride being picked up, pickup time said 10 minutes and by 15 minutes after the pickup time they were still driving around that same neighborhood 10 minutes away and wasnt even deivibg on the route i was on. There wasnt even another ride being dropped off before me. On top of that i was using uber to get a ride to work and now im late, you call it convenience, i call it inconvenience when you employ drivers like that who purposely ignore their route, so i cancel the ride bwcause its absurd when im the current trip for that driver and they are more than 10 minutes behind their pickup time driving around in circles, i try to get another uber and it gives me the same deiver again and i cancel my ride again, but im charged a fee because it was clear that said driver wasnt going to pick me up, then i switch to lyft and there are no drivers, tereible services
title: Convenience or inconvenience?

review: I reserved a car 6 hours in advance. I was assigned a driver as we got close to the time requested but then it defaulted back to looking for driver. I was going to the airport prior to Thanksgiving so prompt arrival was necessary. App just kept saying looking for driver. I called the Uber tel # but was only given automated prompts then to check website. There was no way of knowing if Uber would ever locate a driver again. I then contacted LYFT. Ultimately the Uber app did locate a driver but after the pick up time. This is not acceptable as I had 4 suitcases, a baby a car seat and 4 people so last minute changes was not possible. I have been an UBER customer for years but I will never “ reserve “ an UBER car again! There should be a telephone number that someone can speak to a human being who can confirm a car was coming or not. I also did not want to be charged for a cancelation that was caused due to Uber’s lack of finding a driver in time to not possibly missing the flight.
title: Car Reservation

review: I’m in Florida for a work trip and had to Uber to get food for dinner. I was with my coworkers and found a ride that was listed for $26 and some change that we decided was okay to spilt together since we were waiting to get our stipend for food and didn’t want to pay a huge amount for an Uber. I reserved the ride and we took the Uber the exact route listed and with a nice driver. However once the ride was over my card was charged $80 for that one Uber instead of the original price of $26 that was listed when I reserved the ride. Uber support refuses to give me a refund or even partial refund of the overcharge of $50 back on my card because they swear “the amount listed when the ride was reserved is the same amount that was charged.” Even though it was not and I most definitely would never have agreed to an $80 for a 20 minute drive straight down the highway. We took the same route back and we’re charged less than the original asking price of $26 within an hour after having taken the ride there. Extreme Fraud, Do not use Uber.
title: They scam you out of your money

review:
I’m here trying to help my 80 year old mom fix her Uber, just to find out it won’t work on anything older than iOS 13. This is literally stupid. She barely uses her phone, except for calls and Uber, and now, if she wants to use the App, which she’s accustomed to, she has to buy a new phone? That’s dumb.
Her phone is working perfectly, just got its battery replaced, and will probably last her for as long as she needs it to. 
Book Uber on the website? Try teaching an 80 year old a bunch of new tricks when all she wants to do is enjoy the rest of the time she has left.
If could give Uber negative 9,999,999 stars, I would. Combine this with other frustrations like Uber not allowing you to delete your ride history unless you live in like Belarus. To get rid of your history, you have to cancel your account and wait for a long time period before the account is closed. This is a serious security risk for some people (such as with domestic violence victims etc) and this type of policy is super aggressive against the customer’s data sensitivities, for no good reason.
title: Won’t work on iPhone 6

review: apart from uber destroying taxi companies by eating up their VC money to keep costs so low that other companies could not possibly compare, and then pulling the rug out from under a dedicated user base by raising prices exponentially once the rideshare market was completely conquered, this app is a user’s nightmare. the app is ugly, hard to use, and the call to action buttons constantly change with each update. moreover, the entire logic system of how to call rides is incredibly flawed. if you’re in an area with no ubers, it won’t tell you that. and then you’ll call and uber and have a “guaranteed drop off time” immediately, leading you to think a car is coming. then you’ll wait 25 minutes for a car, all the while watching the guaranteed drop off time getting later by the minute. meanwhile, uber will offer false placations of “the drive is booked and driver is found. finalizing driver info now” when there was never any driver. then the app will cancel on you suddenly with not even a “sorry”, making you late for your event.
title: support your local public transit options instead

review:
This amazing chic picked me up from first stop in tx otw to support after fleeing Hawaii& domestic violence to take me to my parents who were at work upon my unexpected arrival. She saw me in one of the worst times/days of my life, looked at my scattered self in disarray, shaking with nerves& still listened with without judgment otw to my safety.  She was so much more than a ride to me this morning! 
This woman offered advice about shelters in the area- as I'd just arrived from living in Hawaii the past 10 yrs trying to get get away from complete chaos& danger of an abusive, truly terrifying relationship; and she gave me some insight into her experiences not easy to share. She even said a prayer for me as we got to my arrival. What an amazing experience with Uber!! I used this service all the time on island& never have I had such a wonderful, caring soul drive me. Thank you Uber and Alice!!!❤️
title: Alice! May 24 from Addison

review:
I just Recently moved to a busier area. I don’t have a car so I have friends give me rides most of the time, but when they can’t I try and use Uber. I have never had any luck trying to request a ride on the spot. I end up waiting for 30-40 minutes for a driver accept my ride request and give up and have to find another way home. 

Scheduling a ride has worked for me on a few occasions. Yet I have had even more occasions where I scheduled a ride 5-6 HOURS ahead of time and still nobody accepts the request. 
You only get notified at the very end of your pickup window that you aren’t getting a ride. As a rider I have maintained a 5.00 rating, I am not rude with drivers and I engage in conversations if the driver is willing, I ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS tip no matter what (because I was raised by a kind human). My ride request are never longer than a 20 minute trip, so I don’t really understand why my scheduled rides aren’t being accepted. 

I have also had experiences when scheduling rides where I get a notification that someone has accepted the request and then as soon as my pickup window time comes, I no longer have a driver… sooo what happened??? Did they just think to themselves “you know what, nevermind.”

Scheduling rides is unreliable there are no guarantees that you will get a driver, and getting rides on the spot is unreliable. But because I have no other choice sometimes, i will continue to try and use Uber. But ill give Lyft a try too.
title: Scheduling a ride is unreliable.

review: I’ve used Uber in the past and was pretty happy with the experience. Yesterday, we tried the “schedule a ride” feature because we had a group of 8 people going from our house to the baseball game downtown. We scheduled two different Uber XL rides (since we could only fit 5 people in one car) about 6 hours in advance. A driver for one of the rides showed up and took half the people while the other scheduled ride ended up getting cancelled after the scheduled pickup time had passed. By this time, half our friends were already on their way and we were already late. We tried getting another ride and there weren’t any available drivers in our area (exactly why we had scheduled it in advance!). We ended up finally getting another ride but we arrived downtown an hour after the first half of our group got there and missed the first inning of the game. Will not trust the scheduling feature for anything where I absolutely need to be on time.
title: Scheduled rides aren’t guaranteed - might happen if you get lucky

review:
The service in the car was great!  The mobile app is horrible. If you rarely need Uber, like I do, you forget how to use the nuances in the app. Too many steps. Too many moving parts. The mobile app is way to complicated for the infrequent user. My Uber history helped me find and rebook the destinations I wanted. My credit/payment method was old and needed an update. The process was unnecessarily tricky. Your app suffers from too much information. I was PO’d that I had to wade through all of the promotions which greatly hindered me from booking my ride. You need to use more “To:” and “From:” when re-booking. I had trouble quickly finding the correct destination. 
    I’m a senior citizen. I hate to say it, but the app needs dumb down to accommodate older and new users. I produced American Airlines first website. Not everyone fits into the target market you built the app for. 
    I wonder how many people have up using Uber out of frustration. You should know that. It’s what focus groups are for. The most important website qualities are keep it simple, simple. K.I.S.S. for “Keep it simple stupid.”
title: K.I.S.S.

review: Have taken Uber a few times and in the beginning I had a couple of bad experiences then didn’t use them for awhile but then I had to stop using a car 🚗 due to medical issues so started using Uber this past summer and other than one time were the inside smelled of cigarette smoke I’ve had no issues with taking Uber. I like that I can track the ride especially when I have to send my daughter to school 🏫 when she misses her school van 🚐 and I also like all the security features that have improved over the years so it makes me feel safer and safer for me to send my daughter to school 🏫 by herself as she has autism. I hope 🤞 it stays safe and up to date on security precautions as that’s my number one concern as well as making sure that I can get a ride round trip because that’s what happened when I took Uber a few years ago and why I stopped until this year.
title: So Far, Good Experience

review: The application consistently identifies my pick-up location correctly and then populated the address field with an incorrect address that, if it existed, would be on the other side of a fence from my property. The first two drivers who came to pick me up yesterday recognized this disparity and, after having me wait for their arrival, canceled their pick up. Only the third driver figured it out and actually came to pick me up at the correct address. This type of address error has also occurred regularly on the destination end whereby I have twice been driven to an apartment complex which is on the other side of a very high wall from my destination, an auto mechanic. I am inclined to believe that there are many other customers experiencing these type of mismatches between physical location and physical address so I hope Uber keeps working on it.  Otherwise, the application has worked quite well for me
title: Mapping function still needs work

review: I've never typically had an issue with uber but these last couple of rides i have. The wait times to get to places is outrageous and if it's a long distance ride some drivers just out right decline it which i get it, but it's crazy whenever I have to spend over 10 minutes to get connected with a driver along with a 10 minute wait time for them to arrive. Another issue i've had is with the shared rider feature or ordering a ride for a family member or loved one. I had sent out an uber for my family member and the time to get there was 13 minutes which we didn't mind but once i check the app again to see if they are almost there, the driver starts the route to the destination without my co-rider/family member in the car. I tired contacting the driver but it was straight to voicemail so it had to result in me having to cancel the ride and reorder. and because the ride had basically started i was charged a fee since it cancelled in the middle of it but no one was even in the uber when i asked my co-rider/family member
title: Wait times and over charging

review:
So the app works, but often to the advantage of greedy drivers over customers.  To be fair, maybe half the drivers are good ones (the half that pick me up).  Cancelled trips are a huge problem.  They’ve created an atmosphere I liken to walking into a restaurant where the servers can choose to seat you based on what you tell them you’re going to spend and how long you’re going to take up their table… while half the tables are empty.

Some drivers don’t know the name of the towns 20 min around them, let alone how to get to a pharmacy in under 20 min, but why not outsource navigation to your customers - you only charge us $20 every 10 minutes we’re in the car (yes - that’s $120 an hour).  And that’s that’s not b/c of some altruistic Fair Trade philosophy. 

As with most tech companies you started out solving a problem then lost your way chasing valuations and profits.  Look up customer service, hire more hard working people and remember you have competitors… oh and find a new customer to replace me.
title: App works, drivers 50-50

review:
The driver was great and was also very accommodating. I tipped him in cash but there was no way to indicate this in the app during review time. Not really an issue.
My payment card information stored in the app needs to be updated.  when I attempted to do that to complete payment for my last trip (because it initially accepted the previously stored card which was subsequently declined), the app would not allow me to select any of the (seven) payment card entries. I could see no information about these entries other than that they are credit or debit cards . They were completely inactive  (no clickable link) so I selected ‘+ add new payment method’. The only options there were ‘Venmo’ or ‘PayPal’ which I do not want to use. There were no options available to add a new card or delete or modify one of the old cards. So I am stuck and it took me some digging to find this avenue to reach out to customer service which is apparently otherwise nonexistent. I need some help here Uber folks. Please reach out to me to help me fix this (AND HELP ME PAY FOR MY RIDE). Thank you
title: Troubles with Uber payment

review: So a couple of nights ago me and my pregnant spouse took an Uber home, was probably a 15 min ride with the car smelling like alcohol, then the driver completely passing our house and dropping us off in the corner, after that I had left my coach men bag in the car, and right away I got in contact with Uber to try and call my driver, no answer from him after probably calling him 10 times and leaving countless voicemails and nothing. I went on calling and keeping in touch with the “support team” from Uber and all they did was respond with the same exact statement “we have contacted your Uber driver and waiting on a response “ for two days the same exact answer then finally they answered with “he said he didn’t have it” there was checks an expensive wallet and the bag and Uber did nothing to try and contact him directly . It’s crazy that they let him get away with my belongs after he clearly took more than two days to respond back, while I was checking for updates almost every 15 mins. I’m under suspicion that he was intoxicated and got alway with robbery.
title: DONT EVER TAKE UBER.

review: The absolute worst customer service. Actually, it’s not fair to even call it customer service because it doesn’t even exist. This has happened many times, but tonight just happened to be the last straw. I called an Uber, tracked it all the way to me. The GPS told me it was right outside on a side street, I went out there within 1-2 minutes of them arriving. Nothing. I was literally standing in the spot the GPS said the car was, and there was no one there. I tried calling the driver multiple times, no answer. After a couple minutes, the app told me the ride was cancelled and charged me a cancellation fee. Are you kidding me? What on earth am I supposed to do? I’m out there waiting for a car that the app is telling me is there, trying to contact the driver to find them, and I still get charged a freaking cancellation fee for a trip I didn’t even cancel?! Uber was great for a minute, but their time is gone. It’s way too hard and expensive to find a ride anymore, and is so unreliable. I was once an avid rider, I’ll go back to taxis and public transit from now on.
title: Terrible

review: I’ve been using uber since 2016. I trusted that if there was any issue I could report it and it would be diligently dealt with, as this was my experience with customer service after 2 negative ride experiences among so many good rides. However, recently the feature to report issues and complaints changed and has become limited. Before there were some categories to choose from and then you would write about the issues experienced, but now there is no option to detail the negative experience and get support for it or be sure it was fully communicated. This DECREASES my TRUST in the app and the company’s care. I would suggest that you switch back to the previous method or add a text option for the customer to be able to provide an explanation of what the problem was with the ride, to ensure you get the full and accurate feedback that enables you to improve the experience
title: Improve complaints and issue reports

review:
My wife and I were first time Uber clients.  We were very unsure of the process and had a lot of anxiety at the time.  But both drivers were excited at getting us to the airport and 10 days later getting us to our business parking lot to pick up our personal vehicle. Thanks for the great service.  Both Gregory (who took us to the airport at 5:00am) and you (Raysan) did a phenomenal job with getting us where we needed to be.  No hiccups and were very professional. Also texting us their license number and color and type of car reassured us that we were being picked up by the Uber driver.  Thanks to you both.  I wish all people took their jobs as seriously as these two.  It’s all about service and these 2 can have a job with me anytime.   Thanks again. 
Dave and Mary Jo Simon.
title: Gregory and Ray San drop off and pickup from the airport

review: Uber has recently implemented something called “dynamic pricing”, which essentially means their app can show you one price when you reserve a ride, then charge you multiple times more at the end of the ride with zero insight into the cause of the price change. This happened to me less than a week ago when I booked a ride with a cost of $40. Without any notice, or reason to believe the price would change (added stops, delays, etc), I discovered shortly after the ride ended that Uber charged me $160 for the ride when I saw the ride summary! I nearly immediately reached out to Uber to determine the cause and have my fair adjusted back to what I was originally shown. After much back and forth, I received zero explanation for why I was charged 4X the original price, other than “dynamic pricing” was used to calculate it. They did finally agree to though to rebate me 25% of the inflated cost after multiple complaints. I consider this sort of deceptive behavior by a service provider to be nothing short of fraudulent. Would not recommend Uber to anyone.
title: Fraudulent

review: I love the fact that they had added a Halal selection of food. For whoever is reading this, Halal means that the meat is hand slaughtered and it is important in certain religions for the meat to be done this way. This rule does not apply to fish or seafood. I’ve had issues where I would have to do research on Google, restaurant pages/menus, calling restaurant management and food blogs about the authenticity of a restaurant being Halal, and there have been times where the restaurant was not even Halal. This only has made ordering and picking up a lot more convenient and fast. I wish other food apps would follow as well. This also has made me feel included as a customer and opened the opportunity to find halal restaurants in the area. I feel like this has benefitted both the restaurant in terms of putting themselves on the map and the customer to start building more business.
title: Convenient

review: Just use Lyft , or any other app other than uber. They’re facing a lawsuit from people getting charged for a subscription they never signed up for. They have absolutely nobody looking out for their customers and absolutely nobody to talk to about the problems you may have with their app. There’s no number you can call to actually talk to anyone and having to email about certain issues is a blatant joke. I have proof of every 9.99 charge I’ve gotten this past year and it’s at least $60 worth of money Uber has stolen from me. It may not be much but when you’re a broke young adult it makes the world of a difference. Todays charge was the difference in me getting to eat or not, thanks Uber - a horrendously dissatisfied customer. There’s is literally nothing more I can do other than to comment here and warn other people, sure I could get a lawyer but I don’t have the time or money. I’m going to have to get a complete new card before the next payment, please just use something else and don’t give Uber or Uber eats your card information.
title: TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE SCAM SCAM SCAM

review: i recently took a trip with my family to the airport which is about 45 minutes away. the trip was supposed to cost $65. however because it took the driver 20 mins to enter my neighborhood because he refused to listen to my directions i was not only late for my flight but the trip price went up. while he was driving us he was not following the laws nor rules of the road and would slam on the breaks and swerve the ENTIRE TIME. not to mention his attitude was awful. then later that day after the flight and everything i received a notification from uber saying my payment couldn’t be completed, confused i opened my app and it showed me i needed to complete my trip payment of over $200!!!!!!!!!! when i contacted uber and HOURS later they answered said it was for a cleaning fee for “vomit” which is completely false. i asked them to send me a picture of the evidence and s receipt of what car wash cost that much, the picture showed no vomit. they refused to refund my money. never using this app again, drivers lie and customer support is the worst ever!
title: UNFAIR CHARGES

review: My Uber experience today was awesome my driver got me exactly where I was standing waiting , very friendly and even asked me if the directions he’s taking is the correct one and I truly appreciate him asking. Most drivers follow the Uber app and sometimes it’s the longest distance. Because of him I still have the app. But honestly speaking it’s getting more expensive traveling by Uber. I remember when I would get discounts on my rides ,now I’m getting discounts for groceries delivery something I truly don’t need . I buy food on Uber Eats often but when discounts offers come it don’t be for what I use. If Uber were to give a million dollars away to a customer it should be me because I’m about to end up homeless because I be giving all my money to them . Thank you for letting me vent ,have a great rest of the year
title: Professional Drivers

review: Honestly, I wish I could give this a good review. It seems like a really helpful app. However, I just recently tried to access my account, and I was told that my account was disabled for both Uber and Uber Eats. I haven’t even used it to buy ANYTHING. There are NO resources online that help with this problem, the “Help” page is entirely unhelpful, the support email isn’t monitored, you have to pay money to get a texted response, and you can’t use the phone number, because it’s only available to drivers. The only other time I even TOUCHED my account was to create it, and then I didn’t buy anything with it because someone else already had what we needed. I’m sick and tired of this and honestly just want to speak to a person who can help, because the first thing I was advised to do online was call a number that isn’t available to customers. Then, I was advised to use a Help page that doesn’t help with this issue. Then, I was advised to contact an email that isn’t monitored. I’m exhausted and just want this nightmare to be over with.
title: HORRIBLE Customer Service

review:
Generally the app does what it’s supposed to do. Good integration with the maps. Good description of driver and arrival time. However, it can’t handle multiple vouchers. I know this is a rare issue but I had 2 vouchers on my account. I applied both to my ride but I was still charged on my credit card (couldn’t apply second voucher). What’s really awful is trying to get support. I went though 4 agents and none could fix the problem. The help system is awkward to use and there is no way I see to actually talk with a human. They even told me the issuer of the voucher was responsible. I spoke with issuer of the voucher and they obviously don’t have control over the Uber app. Email replies were rejected so you have to use the app to interact with support. They also quickly close conversations and issues so it’s obvious they are rewarded for closing issues even if not resolved… So, beware if you encounter an out of the ordinary situation!!!

[follow up]
Contacted developer as requested. Heard nothing. Do not expect any support if you have problems with this app!
title: Multiple voucher issue
developerResponse: {'id': 28083361, 'body': 'Hi! We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you, we will fix this for you. Please fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE\xa0. We shall get back to you at the earliest.', 'modified': '2022-02-16T11:27:22Z'}

review:
If I could give it zero stars Uber wants to take your money and has no remorse! I typed in my EXACT address and the route took the driver to a completely different location on the same street and had the nerve to charge me more to type in the same address again and still give the wrong directions. After the second time, I had to look it up on Google Maps and manually guide the driver. UPDATE YOUR FREAKING MAPS.

I tried it again the next day and the same thing happened and the driver used google maps because the app refused to point him in the right direction.

The apps customer service is horrible of course. I tried it dispute the charge since it was neither my or the driver’s fault and all I got was a series of questions that lead me to not being able to dispute due to “time and distance” and it let contact support. They never got back to me. People should not get charged more do to the app’s incompetence. Seems like at this point there’re just doing it on purpose. Not to mention the ridiculous price gouging during the pandemic.
title: Scam and Trash

review:
I had a short ride from my automotive repair shop where my car was towed to my home, which is within 5 miles. However, I told the dispatcher at Uber, my exact address, and then I was in a business -automotive repair. But  they directed the driver across the street, which is a major traffic arterial to a 7-Eleven. I have an injured hip I walk with a cane, and there’s no way I can scoot across the street with two bags full of the contents of my car so I communicated with Vincent the driver and he accommodated me by coming across the street to pick me up at the original location which I had given to the Uber to the dispatcher. Thank you Vincent! 

 I think uber needs to add to their “script” when dealing with clients to ask if they need assistance at a specific address or if they are able to move to a different location.
title: Vincent was terrific

review: One of the most annoying things about companies is that they assume because you use them for one service, you will go to them for all others. Sometimes, we just rather stick to what we know, which leads me to why I am writing this review. I am two seconds away from deleting my account if I get another Uber Eats email/notification. I can’t even unsubscribe or block notifications because that blocks all ride related notices. Every. Single. Day. You want me to try Uber Eats and I really do not want to. Honestly, you advertise it so much that I’m starting to think something is terribly wrong with it. Please, constant advertisements doesn’t make me want to cave and try the service and truly just makes me want to double down and use the competition more. Reevaluate your marketing strategy for this arm of the company.
title: Uber Eats

review: Had an extremely unsafe situation last weekend where the app crashed when I was already in my uber ride. The app cancelled my ride and my driver charged me whatever he felt like charging me (double the price of what the app calculated) and used his own gps for my ride, asking me to pay through venmo. It was late at night and after a few drinks I just wanted to get home with my friend. This ride was undocumented as the driver did not use the app or make me re-request a driver. I could have been in a dangerous situation with no gps tracker to verify my location. This driver has a history of venmo transactions with other chargers such as “taxi” “uber” “car service”. This goes against the entire point of the app and the services being paid for/tracked in the company’s app. In addition, the car/name of the driver did not match the car/driver I was with/paid. The customer support only refunded me the cancellation fee and did not provide an update on what will occur with the driver and his sketchy behavior. I will no longer be using Uber for any of my trips.
title: Unsafe app and unsafe drivers

review: I had a driver come and pick my girlfriend and I go from a hotel. We were waiting without our masks on and were going to put them on when we got in. The driver stops and says no masks no ride and drives off without giving us time to respond. He then reports me and Uber send me a message saying action has been taken against my account and I will need to now take a picture of myself wearing a mask before my rides. I responded to the service message explaining what happened and letting them know I would not be doing anything since I was falsely reported. They replied that no action would be taken and they’d reverse the picture taking. I tried using the app again and still asked for a picture. I messaged back saying it was still an issue and a new service person responded asking for the original story again even though it was written out in the same chat. I explained again and then never got any more responses. I am deleting the app and not using Uber or Uber Eats again if this is how they treat false reports by drivers
title: Terrible Customer Service

review: As of 2021 I have noticed a huge uptick in drivers canceling rides after waiting for several minutes for them to arrive. A new driver isn’t assigned until they cancel. In Las Vegas it made me late for a business meeting after being canceled twice after waiting for 20 minutes for each driver. If the rider/user cancels they charge us a fee, but if the driver cancels we don’t get a discount or anything. We just waste our time. The convenience of a taxi and competitive rates have made them a better choice as of lately. Nothing worse than needing a ride, waiting for it to arrive and then having them cancel you. My rating is a 4.98 so it’s not me. I’m using Uber for business purposes and haven’t ever had any personal issues so the fact that Uber allows this to happen makes the app much less attractive. If you are punctuate with your time, and value being on time then I would reconsider this app until this issue is addressed in some form or fashion!!!
title: Dying business model because of cancellations

review:
If you are looking for a form of reliable transportation, Uber is not your ideal choice. My friends and I used Uber in Los Angeles and got cancelled on 4 instances (for one trip we were cancelled on twice). The trip that we were cancelled on twice for happened to be for a reserved dinner and it was an absolutely unsatisfactory experience. We scheduled rides ahead of time and set it so that we’d arrive early even if we had the maximum amount of traffic possible. After being cancelled on twice, we ended up getting an Uber almost an hour after we booked it by using a different account. 
We may have been less upset if the drivers cancelled in a timely manner, but both drivers cancelled when they were supposedly less than 10 minutes away. Not only this, the consistently increasing ETA and lack of efficiency was incredibly stressful. As a result of Uber’s inefficiency and lack of ability to deliver as promised, we ended up losing the reservation for our dinner. Even after calculating for delays on Uber’s part, we had an awful experience.
title: Unreliable and shouldn’t be trusted

review: Uber is an app that that get you to places and I have no problem with that. But what I do have problem with is the fact that a driver canceled my ride at the last minute and by the time another driver takes it, I am always late to work. I tried to cancel the ride but a cancellation fee was there. Of course, I don’t mind the fee if I canceled pass the grace period on my own term, but it was the first driver canceled at the last minute! So I post the fee even though it was the fault of the driver. Also, Uber charged for waiting time. Again, I don’t mind if it was my fault making the driver wait, but it was the driver fault that he couldn’t find the place and didn’t even call me; even after I specially text him on the note section to call in case he couldn’t find it or have any questions. The app alerts me that he’s outside but although he is at the wrong place, I still get charged. Uber driver just want the extra money. In conclusion, if you got other app such as Lyft, just use Lyft. Uber is not worth it. It really isn’t.
title: Don’t use Uber if you got other apps

review:
The ability to reserve a ride is great functionality. I recently used it needing a trip to the airport at 4:30am and I was much less stressed about ride availability (not in a big city) knowing the ride was posted the day before so drivers could plan to be out at that time... driver was awesome, right on time, and he told me he likes seeing those reserved rides and makes sure he is out to get them. 

One bit of functional improvement would be to allow a note to be input when selecting the pickup location... like a hotel room number or other note. After the driver accepts the ride the app sends you a prompt asking for more pickup details, but it would have been nice to just enter them when I ordered the ride. 

Overall I found the app intuitive and the service I have had using Uber has been great.
title: Reserve a ride

review: First off I want to say that the drivers in Michigan are a joke. Their cars reek of cigarettes, the music is obnoxiously loud, the cars conditions is in a questionable state. Uber will approve anyone who has a valid license and car insurance. The conditions of these cars and drivers mentalities are questionable. I do NOT ever feel safe when taking ubers in Michigan. It is embarrassing. We have taken ubers in Vegas, Mississippi, and New Jersey, which have all been spectacular. It is sad that Michigan is such an embarrassment. I wish uber would have inspectors that would regularly inspect these cars. As sometimes I feel safer drinking and driving which defeats the purpose of uber all together. Uber has to do better in regulating these really sad Uber's that they send us in Michigan. In a total of 100 uber trips that I have taken since 2016; Too many times I experience Ubers that reek of cigarettes, marijuana, drugs, and just stank all together. It is a disgrace!! Even the engines, tires, and the conditions of the cars are questionable. Sometimes my Ubers car is shaking and I fear for my life. DO BETTER UBER!
title: Ridiculous in Michigan

review: So I have Uber and Uber eats, I’ve had issues with drivers and with how my food comes obviously I’m going to reach out to customer service because it’s their job to deal and fix those issues and be made aware. Well when I do they’re like you’ve made to many complaints uhm no I made one for last week about a driver who was rude and one this week for food that wasn’t what I ordered which they didn’t give me a refund for. Today over charged me for a ride because driver wants go make extra money was supposed to be a double trip and this driver acted like they waited just to cash out more . Charged me 5$ extra for this ride because of it and then told me basically I message them to much (3rd time) this month for obvious reasons, I’ve have app since 2014 you’d think their loyalty would be to customers who’ve been using it for that long but no . Now I see why people use Lyft more and have better to say about them and their lower fares .
title: Need to work on better customer service

review:
I had been using Uber for years with no issue (all my experiences with drivers have been great). However, on a recent trip I had to update my payment methods and despite repeated attempts I kept getting errors when adding credit cards. 

After calling multiple helplines and even speaking to the Driver support team, I was informed there is no customer service contact for riders and that I would have to wait for an email response within the next few business days. Every online query directed me back to the same useless FAQs about “Adding a Payment Method”, and there was zero ability to get any sort of real time assistance. 

After being stuck for nearly half a day without transportation, I finally found a way to get home. I am extremely disappointed to have experienced this issue with the Uber app but am even more appalled that Uber has no option for customer support for riders and is willing to leave them without any assistance in situations where Uber may be the only transportation option readily available.
title: No Customer Support

review: I had an Uber Driver go to the wrong house and call and tell me he was there. I came outside and there was no one insight. I tried to call back and it would t let me. The app then showed that he canceled the trip. I then see him back out of my neighbors driveway and speed away as quickly as possible. I l presume since the cancellation was the fault of the driver, I wouldn’t be charged. YET I WAS. I sadly didn’t see the charge immediately and it was past the 30 day window, so Uber won’t investigate. From my understanding this can happen often. Many times the driver will just pull up near your house, wait the required 5minutes and then cancel and collect the money. Terrible business who lets ANYONE drive for them. McDonald’s uses a better background system then Uber. You could be getting a ride from a person with a long criminal record, even violate offenders can work for Uber. Just as long as you don’t have a DWI in the last 5 years, you can drive for them. There is no drug/alcohol screening for drivers either.
title: Uber Drivers abuse the app and you pay for it

review:
It is very fitting that there’s zero place to leave feedback or a review for Uber the service, because in the app they leave you no way to leave reviews on lazy drivers who cancel for no reason and charge you a fee for the privilege.  

Imagine you’re at the airport with your family and 8 bags.  You request an Uber, and message the exact gate and app pickup zone you are in.  If the driver then parks 2000 feet away and tells you to walk to them, requiring you to wrangle everyone and 8 bags, and then cancels while you are halfway there, you have zero recourse.  You are, in fact, charged a $6 fee by a Uber for that experience, and cannot rate the driver, dispute the fee, or say what happened.

 Oh, report a rude driver on the canceled trip modal? No, that won’t work either, it comes up with “sorry, there was an error” and doesn’t let you dispute the fee or contact anyone.  There is no way to give feedback for bad Uber drivers, and there’s no way to leave feedback for Uber the service, which is terrible, and which I suggest avoiding if at all possible.
title: Zero accountability

review:
Oh my, where to start…My husband and I have had quite a few issues with the Uber app.  Recently, we had an Uber driver arrive at the location we needed to be dropped off at instead of picking us up at our home.  Because we would have been late if we waited for another driver or for him to turn around and come to the actual location he was supposed to, we drove ourselves.  
Last night we had an event to attend which we arrived at without issue, but upon trying to schedule an Uber ride back home at the end of the night the app simply would not work.  For anyone at this event!  It kept showing each of the different parties that any payment option is declined.  This was a large event with a lot of corporate folks attempting to access drivers.  We tried for an hour and finally gave up and downloaded Lyft.  I had no problems getting a driver scheduled with Lyft.  He went above and beyond for us, helping any of the parties he could.  We appreciated Lyft so much after feeling stranded by Uber.
title: Uber has let us down too many times now!

review:
I have so many complaints. 1 - there is virtually no customer service at all. You are unable to communicate with an Uber representative unless you’ve already died in accident. 2 - driver’s don’t get paid well. Therefore, many drivers are unwilling to continue driving during these times. 3 - due to lack of drivers… the customer now has to wait 2 to 3x longer to receive a ride. Additionally, on top of having to wait even longer, the fare is 30-40% inflated. Why is the customer being punished, because Uber has poor process methodologies. 4 - I could understand if the drivers were the getting the additional funds, however, it’s the PM’s and executives who benefit from all this. 5 - why do we write these reviews if Uber isn’t willing to conduct internal investigations and find ways to better benefit the users making them millions. The only positive thing I have to say is that I know I will eventually get a ride.

Signed - a diamond member who also an Uber one member….
title: Not Customer friendly!

review: Uber has had its ups and downs for sure. It used to be a staple for living in Los Angeles, but for the past 6 mo it has been a complete waste of time and money and has showed me that I shouldn't trust it with my life. Occasionally, there's no major issue with the trip. Other times, it'll say drivers are <5 min away, then after you request the ride it'll send you a driver *15 minutes* away. Thereby completely throwing off the expected time of arrival, thereby making you extremely late. Of course, there may also be traffic on the way while the driver is getting to you. Then, the route they are given is not even the fastest one. Sometimes I'll take uber to work when I drive other days, and I know that the route they take goes right on the road that is guaranteed to have traffic. At least the smart drivers will use waze or google maps separately to help with this. Overall, it feels like uber is asking me not to use it, which is a massive disappointment for me since I loved using it before the pandemic.
title: complete trash to use in LA lately

review: I’ve used this app only for the convenience of not having cash on me so it’s easier with a app but it truly disgust me how no one in the Uber management team or cooperate can be an adult and except responsibility for their own actions this app has a bad problem with allowing drivers to pick up a ride when there no where near the person or do not know the area they are driving in so it creates problems , Uber let’s drivers 10 mins away from me pick up my ride the. Drop me after making me wait 10mins and then we redirect me to another driver after I’m already now late for work , Especially now since they decided to raise the price on their fares when I was originally taking Uber only because they had lower prices than a normal cab but now I see I’m wasting my time and money on a company who doesn’t care if I lose my job as long as they get their money if that’s the case not only will I no longer be using the service I will advise every single person I know not to as well and to use alternative services instead
title: Horrible accountability

review: The driver was very offended because he didn’t like it that I asked him to turn one direction and he went the opposite way which started a tirade on his part during which he asked me repeatedly did I want him to let me out as he was driving. I did get upset and he used that to further that I was picking on him. I finally told him to drop me off at a Starbucks. He overbilled me for a different location miles away. Extra $5 for supposed wait. And extra 2 miles at least. I did say one word that he mistook as unacceptable  and he lectured me repeatedly while threatening to drop me in the middle of the street. I am an elderly disabled person who had a great deal of trouble even getting into or out of the expensive van he drove so this was very frightening. I have a receipt from the coffee shop showing exactly where he dropped me off. He lied about the drop off location. There was NO wait time. The next cab driver from American cab company was very polite and charged only $6 for a similar distance. I won’t be taking Uber again. I’ve never been asked to get out of any vehicle ever.
title: Terrible scarey experience

review:
Uber has gone so down hill ever since they removed the Loyalty system. Now you have to pay $9.99 for the world’s smallest “discount” (you get it back as Uber Cash) and SOMETIMES free delivery. Only worth it if you’re taking 15+ Ubers per month. 

Uber also has the tendency to straight up lie and steal from their consumers. Over the last month Uber gave an estimated driver ETA of 5-7 minutes and then the only drivers they actually offer it to/get the ride are 15+ minutes away. Canceling with the “wait time too long” gets you nowhere 99% of the time - usually gives you a driver either same ETA or longer ETA which is completely counterproductive. They’ll also randomly charge 5x the price for going to a common destination of yours, but normal price for 2 not even 0.5 mile away from the same destination. Very good business model you got there - mistreat the people who use your app the most. 

Overall, if you use Lyft. Stick with it. They typically have better prices than Uber and most of the Uber drivers drive with Lyft as well. Win Win.
title: Use Lyft Instead

review: Today morning I was running late to school and I requested a Uber, the app took like two minutes to look for an Uber driver that’s okay tho, then I was waiting for my Uber driver, I waited like 5 minutes and he stayed in the same direction, therefore I was forced to cancel the ride bc it was getting too long I couldn't wait any longer, In addition, the Uber driver was 20 mts away from me when the location where I was going only take 9 minutes to arribe. After I canceled they charged more than the ride cost. I’m so upset because this has happened several times that I started thinking that uber drivers are making people wait to force them to cancel the ride and get easy money. This is not professional, Uber drivers getting money from me because they know that one may be in a hurry and need an Uber as soon as possible to get them to their location, and they make them wait which leads one to cancel the ride. I am so disappointed because this is not fair we need honest Uber drivers not people who take advantage.
title: TIRED OF LOSING MONEY

review: Understanding that The 5 extra stops is not always the most economical way to use Uber, is most important to someone like myself who is a Uber NEWBY.  Sometimes it is better to go to one place where you wish to spend a little extra time and let that driver go on to his next rider.  This way you aren't rushed into doing your shopping while you driver hangs out with the clock ticking and the fare going higher than it needed to be, if you had scheduled the ride properly it will cost you less as you learn more.  The more you learn about Uber the more you will enjoy your rides with Uber! Debra Sayre is still learning and going back over the past rides as I am doing now is helping me to understand so much more that I hope will also help me in scheduling future rides.  Sincerely, Debra Sayre
title: UNDERSTANDING UBER IS VERY IMPORTANT TO LOVING UBER

review: I left my uber to go get something from my apartment which took 2 mins and I told my uber that I was in a hurry so I would be back, I would be back. He drove off with my backpack. The trip hasn’t ended it yet. He ended it by himself. If he refuses to give me back my items despite having them in his possession (bc i understand that the next passenger could have taken it), that makes him a thief, which is a criminal. But he would be still out there making money and driving when he knows that he happily took my belongings. And uber wouldn’t do anything about that except for “we contacted him already, we left a “voicemail” and “email”, we can’t call him multiple times, and we can’t even give you his number”. I just want uber to really try to contact him, once every 2 hour wouldn’t be that hard, JUST TO MAKE SURE THAT HE HAS IT OR NOT. but no, they wont do anything, they won’t even reply my message. So No More Uber, until you take action to get my things back or to get that driver to call me back.
title: Uber don’t care about passengers at all

review:
I booked an Uber in advance to take me to a train station. My first driver cancelled my trip an hour before my pickup and I was assigned another driver. My second assigned driver finished her trip and was on her way to pick me up. I kept track of where she was and when she was 10 minutes from picking me up she cancelled the trip. The third driver I was reassigned to was not able to pick me up for an hour at which point I missed my train and had to wait 3 hours at the train station until my next train. This resulted in being a huge cost to me and a lot of valuable time was wasted as I didn’t arrive to my intended destination until midnight.

Seeking a reasonable solution to this issue, I contacted Uber support. I am surprised that their solution to my issue was to only refund my tip but not my whole trip. After several attempts to come to a reasonable solution, it was apparent that Uber support was not willing to compensate me for my troubles. 

I hope that Uber will take responsibility to improve the customer experience.
title: Poor customer service

review: I called an Uber at 6 am this morning . mark driving a white Toyota was 6 minutes away. I’m standing out in the cold waiting . Get a text 10 minutes later he is out front! Well so am I for last 10 minutes worried I’m going to miss my plane because he is waiting at a house not even my address? I call him . He is lost and doesn’t even know how to get to my street after I gave him the address? Now I’m doubting his intelligence but he assures me he is on his way. I don’t trust him after 10 more minutes of waiting . I dial another Uber. Bob shows up and does his best to get me to the airport. I see this mark guy wrote in I canceled! Still charged me for cancellation when it was his stupidly and he knew I had a plane to catch and did not even bother to call me and say I won’t be there! Furious with Uber! Terrie Cox
title: Furious with uber
developerResponse: {'id': 7058363, 'body': "Hey Terrie! This certainly sounds frustrating. Let's make sure we follow up with you on this. We request you to reach out to us at t.uber.com/contact or via the in-app Help section and we'll follow up.", 'modified': '2019-01-29T07:19:06Z'}

review: I have been using Uber for over four years and have never had a bad experience. Drivers are polite, cooperative, and on time. however, two weeks ago I purchased and set up a new iPhone 14 and since that time my Uber app on my phone shows a zero cash balance and no trip history. On my desktop my account has a balance of approximately $88 in cash and the four year history of my trips. In spite of talking to four or five support Reps on the phone, no one has been able to fix this problem.  This now renders Uber useless for me at this time.  I believe this is a system glitch at Ubers end and there must be someone in the company that can fix this error for me so that I can resume using the service that I value.
title: Four years of great service but now I have a problem Uber can’t solve!

review: I’ve been dealing with really horrible drivers not for their driving but the way they’re services, they have either not been cooperative or left when I said I’m on my way and it wasn’t a really long period, I would literally be right out the door and they would take off and I even TEXT THEM letting them know I’m on the way and they still leave, what’s worse is the customer support system? DOESN'T DO ANYTHING cuz I would still see them every now and then as a driver, not to mention you don’t get a refund for the issue you went through or no type of accommodations at all, Uber doesn’t care about it’s customers and y’all have stolen money from me for the last time, I’m losing money trying to get too and from work, luckily one of the drivers actually picked me up so it wasn’t in total vain, also I tried the support hotline or number directly, the company need a secure line to be called on cuz the company literally be lying to customers, that’s just my two cents tho
title: I’ve had bad experiences with this app for the past week

review: Every couple of months I forget how awful the experience is ordering food with Uber. I have probably cancelled more orders than not due to late delivery. And on top of that half the time there is some other issue with my order that results in a credit/discount. Nothing upsets me more than being assigned a driver and watching them drive around my town not picking up my order while it sits at the restaurant waiting. I tip well, I have reasonable expectations, and yet Uber cannot figure out how to manage a simple delivery system. The support team is a joke. I’m not sure why they have a live support team when all they do is send automated responses and ignore the customers complaints. The worst part of all of this is there is no accountability, Uber can operate at pathetic levels of service and there are no consequences. If any local or small businesses performed at such substandard levels, they would go out of business. So many better options out there for delivery. Pick anything else but Uber. Literally anything else.
title: Uber eats on the Uber app

review:
The app should make it clear that we won’t be charged until we confirm our ride. I was hesitant to look through my ride options because the way they’re set up it looks like I’ll be charged just by clicking to look at an option. They need a statement saying you won’t be charged until you choose and confirm your ride.
I chose and confirmed my ride and thought I was waiting for my ride to the airport to catch my flight. I looked at my phone for my ride update and it said to confirm my ride. I don’t know what happened in between choosing, confirming, and selecting payment. I was waiting but no ride was coming because the app went back to “confirm my ride” but it wasn’t obvious that this had happened.
I like how Uber has so many ride options now. Especially Ride Assist.
My driver to the airport was great.
title: Uber is convenient but app is still clunky

review:
I am a blind rider. The quality of the service totally depends on the competence and attitude of the driver. 
Last night I needed a pick up from a store outside a mall. I provided the name of the store, and the exit number, posted above the main door. I waited outside and described myself as wearing dark glasses and holding a white cane. 
The first driver called me to say that he had arrived. He was not where I was. His GPS had taken him to the next main exit of the mall. I told him where I was. He said he did not know where that was. I told him to just drive to the other side of the parking lot, and to please call out to me when he arrived so that I would know which car to get into. This was the same direction I had messaged him. No response. A few minutes later my phone told me that he had canceled. There was no way to rate his non-performance. 
The second driver neither showed up nor contacted me. My phone just told me that he had canceled. 
Fortunately, the third driver, Pauline, was professional and competent. She called me, and upon learning that gps had directed her to the wrong entrance, drove to the correct door, called out to me, identified herself as the Uber driver, and helped me with my bags. No problem.

I wish Uber would maintain higher standards for driver competence and professionalism. Mandatory training In customer service to riders with disabilities is needed.
title: Good when it works.

review: A long time ago, I called a car service to take me to the airport in a dark morning hour and some random car stopped. It took me a minute to figure out it was not my designated driver. Luckily I got out of this potentially dangerous situation and all was okay. After that,  I was slow to buy into the concept of Uber, but I kept an open mind. Whether I need a lift to the airport, traveling and want to skip car rental, or just need a lift when my car is in the shop, Uber is my go to service. The app is super convenient. The safety ratings give me more confidence in the drivers. Every car ride I have been in has been immaculately clean and the driving safe. And, I know that my location is known so I have more trust. I recommend Uber if you need to get to your destination safely and comfortably.
title: Uber is my go to

review: Ive been using uber for the past month for means of transportation of course. it gets you to where you need to go but I found so many issues regarding this apps service and one of them being the Uber One trial. first thing if it’s offered do not try it. i started to use it and yeah sure it gets you a dollar off but ive been noticing that its giving me drivers far away its not useful when you already set 30 -45 minutes to request a ride and you’re still late to the appointment. last thing and worst thing because uber does play with your money. okay so you need to keep an eye on your receipts and your bank because Uber does adjust payments and hit your card for for no rhyme or reason on an unexplained amount of money. they will over charge you if you’re not paying attention. theyll say the ride was this much (which is significantly higher than the initial price of the ride) save your money folks dont use Uber.
title: Please dont use this as a transportation method

review:
The app functions like garbage, the drivers are the slowest sharks with no idea where they’re going, who don’t pay attention to their own app that literally verbally tells them exactly where to go and will leave after the first stop of a trip because they are simply that inane and then you’re forced to call a new ride if you can or WALK from an unsafe location, too many lazy drivers that won’t take a fare that’s a quick trip nearby so you end up having to wait for some driver that took your fare that’s twenty-thirty minutes away and you shouldn’t have even been matched up with, then they’re not smart enough to cancel the ride so it can connect you with a driver that’s actually anywhere near you, and you can’t cancel because it will charge you $6.25 for nothing. Half the cars are way too old and dirty to be driving as Uber cars. Even “priority” customer support is garbage.
I literally hate this app and using this company, but Lyft drivers aren’t always available when I need to call for a ride.
title: Still trash after years
developerResponse: {'id': 15441140, 'body': "Hi! We appreciate you writing in regarding the GPS. Feedback such as this will help us improve the app and experience with Uber. If there's any specific incident we can look into, let us know by heading to t.uber.com/contact and we'll be sure to follow up with you from there.", 'modified': '2020-05-20T09:25:54Z'}

review: When creating a new trip, there are three stages where Uber ALWAYS fails to give a time estimate. The first is when you are selecting your ride type. The estimation for arrival time is usually half an hour earlier than reality. The second instance is after you choose a ride type, your driver’s arrival to your location will be incorrect as uber will display a reasonable time until the trip locks in, in which case that time immediately changes and since you’re locked in, you must then pay a close to $6 fee to cancel the trip. I constantly experience this feature, seeing something like 4min away while the trip is loading, then an immediate switch to 25+ min away as soon as the trip locks in. Finally, the trip always ends up being roughly more or less than 30 min longer than in the original estimate. Today is the final day I will use these services, I will try lyft to see if they are more reliable but under no circumstance will I ever attempt to use Uber for any type of service again.
title: Extremely Unreliable

review: I used the app one time and one time only. I had a man come up and ask about taxi services around 8:30 at night, he was trying to get about 15 miles from where we were. I tried to call an Uber for him and he would give me cash. It was 26 dollars at first then 15 minutes later I get a notification saying there are no drivers available. I tried again but this time for the same trip the price jumped to 39 dollars. The ride never did show up yet I was still charged. When I tried contacting customer support not only did I not get an answer for a long time, but when I did they said they couldn’t find any record of that happening even when I sent pictures of the ride being confirmed and the bank statement showing the charge. It’s been over a month now and still no word of a refund nor anyone from the company trying to reach out and look into this. I’ll never use this service again it’s more to you’re benefit to just walk then be screwed over by these people.
title: 1 time used, never will again!

review: This is all true and I can’t believe this has happened. I downloaded the app on 1/18 and redeemed a $25 gift card that was accepted and no flags came up. My first ride was going to be more than that so I got another gift card for $20 on 1/19 and that was accepted no flags. I have both cards, receipts and activation slips. The card I purchased both with is loaded into the Uber site and the Apple apps store. The Uber app would not allow me to move forward with a ride. I put in a support ticket and first was told I violated a policy. I have never used Uber how could violate a policy. Then Uber came back and said there was suspicious activity on my account. Uber accepted both cards and I have all docs to prove I bought them legally. The credit loaded into Uber matches the one I purchased the gift cards with. The Apple apps store has the same card and I have made 25+ purchases with it on the App Store no issues. I know I will never get my money back and I’m open to a compromise but Uber has stolen from me and I want people to know.
title: Uber has stolen $45 from me

review:
I enjoy using Uber and use it a lot but I don’t think it’s right you give me Uber cash to use but still take the full amount and make me wait 3-5 days when you should have only took what was said in pricing and also I don’t get why if there are close by driver give me someone far away then charge me a fee because “they are already on the way “ well if you gave me someone with a shorter wait time then I wouldn’t cancel to find someone closer . I’m going to stop using Uber as much if I continue to have these problems.

Update: If your in a rush don’t rely on Uber because they allow you to wait over 5 minutes for a driver and be close to you but the driver can cancel . As a rider if I cancelled the ride I would have to pay the driver . You ask drivers a question because they aren’t driving for Uber 5 minutes and they cancel the ride then Ubers gives you a driver further away until you cancel an pay more for the same ride and get a closer driver
title: Disappointed
developerResponse: {'id': 8055838, 'body': "Hey there! This doesn't sound right. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.", 'modified': '2019-04-04T08:33:33Z'}

review: If you order an Uber to pick you up outside your hotel, please please please please ask the driver to come to the front of the hotel. I am 80 years old and this is awful because I didn’t even know he was texting me anything and I don’t use Uber much because I don’t travel much anymore. But finally, I realize he sent a message message that he was in front of a restaurant which I could not find. And I didn’t want him to leave but finally finally he called me. Oh my God I am exhausted. Stop with this bad about doing this, but I didn’t think Uber would do it to me. If you’re ordering Uber at a hotel or at a restaurant, don’t have them tell you to go a block or two away from that area because you were safer in front of a hotel. Thank you very much.
title: Rating Uber in general

review: I rode to Westend with Demetrius . He was very rude condescending and made what I view was racist and condescending remarks about my race. I’m black he’s Greek. I had a 1 yr old and 3 year old with me. My children, went to get WIC Card for my children. He put us out his car while I awaited another driver, Dashana. She was a Lyft driver. It was more expensive but more pleasant. I live in an exclusive neighborhood in Lovejoy GA. I went by downtown Atlanta where you go in and get out. He actually didn’t seem to care and appeared to wish us harm. Lyft came in 6 minutes. Demetrius should NEVER be allowed to drive another African American around let more to represent your company. I will think twice befor calling Uber after this experience and I told him the same. And by the way we drove 25 miles without seat belt nor car seat for my 1 and 3 yr old
title: Dashana vs Demetrius

review:
The Uber app does not work very well in Brazil. Drivers cancel rides frequently after picking them up—there should be a driver penalty for this. It wastes everyone’s time, and prevents the ride from being available to other drivers, extending the wait time. 

Other times drivers will accept a ride and then sit still for a while instead of driving. I have noticed this because I’ve been on the street waiting for a ride and I can see the entire block. They have been sitting still without moving. With no traffic. 

But the worst issue I have had repeatedly is that a driver will drop me off without ending the ride on his side of things. Then the ride will continue indefinitely, and Uber sides with the driver, stating that I was not dropped off at my actual destination. I have had to file multiple disputes for this. If they are going to take the drivers word for it that I got out at a different destination when it is actually the driver that is continuing to drive just to bill extra money, that is not fair.

The simple fix for this, which often happens in the US, is that if I wish to change the final destination, the driver requires me to enter it into the app for the sake of transparency. Please fix this in Brazil. 

I have also had multiple rides in Brazil where the driver stopped to get gas mid-ride. This is also easily fixable and preventable and not once happened in the US.
title: Reliability issues

review: Took a trip a few weeks back. Agreed on the price it showed and was picked up. Make it to my destination and tip the driver 25%. Get an email from Uber confirming the same price I had agreed on and thanked me for using the service. Then about a half hour later I was charged an “adjusted” rate. Adding an additional $18 on to my already $23 trip, almost doubling the price. This also adjusted my tip amount to 25% of the new amount. I’ve been trying to use their terrible customer service help line through their app. For two weeks they’ve insisted they are “investigating” what happened and will get back to me.
