Now they have completely avoided my last to messages asking about my refund. I don’t even need a full refund, just for the amount I didn’t agree upon that was added after the fact. No explanation, no nothing. Horrible business and probably the worst “costumer service” I’ve ever dealt with. I’ll be using Lyft from now on if I need a ride and I suggest anyone do the same.
title: Charged an additional charge after dropped off

review:
I’m never one to write a review let alone a nasty one. I rely on Uber to get to work and countless times I’ve scheduled a ride hours in advance and when the time comes around for the ride to appear 1. They cancel the trip or 2. There are no drivers available. In addition, drivers have way to much freedom to charge riders crazy amounts for any inconvenience and when you try to contact Uber for a repeal you can’t get into touch with anyone. Further more, when I schedule a ride snd they come BEFORE my scheduled pick-up time and I communicate with them to wait because I’m not ready, (Uber even sends a message saying your driver will arrive early and wait for you) they canceled the ride and leave, saying that I wasn’t wearing a mask when in fact I always wear a mask. Lastly, if you live 8 minutes from your destination expect the ride to take 20 minutes because the Uber gps maps aren’t updated and route you in circles around your destination. 
Not to mention it’s way too pricey and include way too many fees.
title: Never use Uber

review:
Here’s the thing, the app “works” just fine. There are small things like it doesn’t work with Apple CarPlay, if it is plugged into your car the sound can get all outta whack and get quieter and louder for no reasons, sometimes it crashes out of nowhere… all that is annoying but no big deal.

 The real flaw with this thing is the way you accept a delivery. 

The button to accept a delivery is in the EXACT same spot as when you want to type a quick message to the person your delivering too therefore, you can be typing a message like “have a great day” and while you type that, a delivery can pop up and you just ok’d a $2.80 delivery that is 6 miles away and will take 18 minutes of your day. That’s the biggest flaw in the app by far. 

How to fix this: 
- move the accept button to a different part of the screen (especially when already on a delivery)
- have double confirmation instead of just one tap to accept and move on, there’s a tap to see the info and a tap to accept.
- make the accept button a “slide to accept” instead of “tap.” (This is how every other button works in the app (almost) but this seems to me to be the best way.

Like I said, the app works fine. It’s not flawless or even great but it gets the job done. 

There’s room for design improvement for sure.
title: The app is “fine” improvements can be made

review:
I don’t know if it’s only in New York City, but the navigation on this app is absolutely horrendous. It will show the  car icon on a totally different street saying four minutes away and within one second it shows the icon in front of where it’s picking you up saying zero minutes when there is absolutely no car there then it switches again and will say six minutes away and show it on another street and then two seconds later it will say zero minutes and it will show the car icon in front of you when there is actually no car in front of you
Also, my home address has been on this app since Uber started and I’ve literally never had a problem with being picked up or dropped off and now it literally pulls up half a block away and it always tries to drop me off across the street from my house instead of in front of my house so I do not know what’s going on with this app but I hope somebody can figure it out and fix it
title: There is something seriously wrong with this app

review:
I have had 2 recent experiences, that (for 1st time) leave me hesitant to use Uber when I must be at appt by specific time. 
I live in NYC. I do not own a car. On Nov 11th I ordered an Uber to take me to 50 West 57th St in NYC. I have taken an Uber here many times I just selected the address from frequently visited ones that propagate on App. 
I was doing work on iPhone when I looked up and noticed driver heading south for a northern address.  He reassured me "going in right direction to address." It was the 1st time an Uber ever took me this way I told him, but he reassured me his Uber navigation said it was ok. 
When he was ready to drop me at west 50th and 6th Ave, I said wrong drop off point.  I was 15 minutes late for appt. He tried to drop me as close as possible to accurate address and I walked the remaining distance. Driver told me, you sometimes give them incorrect Navigation. I guess you REALLY did for that trip. I think I should be created for part of cost?
Today- looked up from phone, going to med appt in NJ from NYC.... same issue. Drive was going in wrong direction and heading into backed up traffic. No English spoken, but I put drop off address in my phone and he updated his navigation. I got here fine.. but not sure where I would have been dropped off, or what time - if error not picked up!  Also- difficult to communicate. 
What is happening on your end?

Marianne Brower
title: Issues with recent rides. User for 5+ years

review: I loved using Uber in Mumbai. Very convenient and easy to use. Unfortunately I had an issue adding a new method of payment (due to Uber, not a problem with my card). I’ve read about this happening to others. There is no support service by phone or option to talk with a real person. I tried for over a month to resolve the issue. The AI support kept saying my issue was resolved when it in fact wasn’t. I was left with a functioning account but no working payment method. I’m upset and I think that Uber’s lack of support may continue to make them lose customers. It’s not simply that I am unhappy and am walking away from Uber, it’s that I’ve been blocked out of any options or any way to use my account because of the lack of human help. I wish there was something I could do. They earn two stars because the drivers are kind, hard-working, people. But the company and the app I’m very disappointed with.
title: Mumbai- drivers are great; customer support non-existent

review:
Whatever you do, do not purchase gift cards via the app.  The first would not let me send to the person I was buying for, actually could not do anything with it.  

Then in the process I ended up with a second one I could send and of course Uber charges me for both.  I tried to deal with them and explain only line was sent and I could not do anything with the other.  No response from Uber do I put a dispute for one of the charges with my credit card.  Uber never responded to them either do they refunded the money to me.  

Uber then adds the $100 to my account and won’t let me use the app until I pay.  I again reached out to them and spent hours via in app text message to resolve and just kept getting told I owed the money.  I kept asking for them to show me where the 2nd gift card had been used and they ignored me.  And I never could speak directly to a person it all had to be done via app which left communication issues.

I finally just deleted the app and will never use Uber again.  I still had about 6 months left on my annual pass.  The value of that became 0 to me based on the customer service and help.

So no more Uber for cars or UBerEats(which I used a lot).  Hello Lyft and Grubhub.  And for those who don’t know it, Postmates is owned by Uber now, so I will not be using them either.

Maybe one of these days Uber will realize customers are not finite and they need to work with them to resolve issues.
title: Very bad app and customer service

review: I am a currently college student and I used to use the Uber app for when I go out with my friends. I used my credit card for the first two rides. The second ride was when I was in Disney Springs with my friends back in March and I’ve tried using the app to go back to the campus because we were taking turns paying. While the app said that my card didn’t go through, eventually the bank said that Uber charged me over $90 for a ride that was canceled due to credit card issues. That was why my mother gave me a Uber gift card during Spring break. Eventually, we went back to Disney Springs and that time I’ve paid for the Uber with my gift card. Although I only used my gift card, Uber decided to charge me around $60 for another ride that I didn’t pay for the next day. I had no choice but to talk to the bank about it and Uber ended up shutting down my account, so I can’t use Uber anymore. That is why I don’t recommend Uber to anyone and I deleted the app on my phone.
title: The worst experience I ever had using this app!

review: I had the Uber app for maybe a month and it randomly stopped working. Everything was fine before and nothing changed but all of a sudden it started to say there was a service error and something went wrong. I ended up deleting the app and restarting my phone then reinstalling it to try and fix it. I did this process many many times and there was no result each time. When I try to register into the app by using my phone number, once I press “next” it pops up with the same text saying “server error, something went wrong”. The app works fine on other peoples phones I’ve seen but just not for me for some odd reason. I tried reporting a problem but there’s no section to manually write a review that I could find and you could only report one of the five problems they had suggested. I don’t know how to fix this issue but I would like for somebody to maybe reach out to help. I haven’t been able to use the app for over two months because of this issue.
title: App randomly doesn’t work anymore

review:
It had started to rain in Orlando that afternoon (rain?  In Orlando?) so my plans to walk the four blocks to my hotel, pick up my suitcase they were holding for me, and walk the additional two blocks to the Lynx bus stop were washed down the drain. 
Instead, my associates helped download the Uber app on my phone and supervised scheduling my first Uber ride. 
Shortly thereafter, Pablo showed up on time as indicated by the Uber app, took me to the hotel to retrieve my suitcase, and then took me to the airport in time for my flight despite the horrendous traffic. 
His car was clean and comfortable. 
I also had an extremely enjoyable conversation with him as we were traveling, learning (at my request) that he was from Venezuela with a chemical engineering degree, 14 years of experience in a now closed paper mill, and was working for Uber to support his family (married with two sons) until his English skills got good enough to get a job as a chemist. 
His are the type of skills and personality that we need in our country.   I felt pleased and honored to be his passenger despite the fact that the ride to the airport cost $52 more than I had anticipated from my original plans. 
As a need arises I will definitely try Uber again.
title: My trip to the Orlando airport.

review: For reference, I work at a childcare facility with kids ages 5 to 12. I usually bus home but I decided to uber today because I was very tired. The driver picking me up had anime stickers all over his car, and one of them covered 2 of his doors and was an anime girl wearing only a bikini. This was pick up time for the kids, so there were parents and kids alike watching me get into this uber with a half naked anime lady on it. The car was also very dirty inside. I tried to contact customer support about the issue and there is no way to actually speak to someone or actually write your own report to send in! And none of the issues on the help center page matched the issue I was having with the stickers. Uber, why is there no way to talk to support or at least send in a report that I’m able to write? None of these issues matched mine so I was unable to even submit a report! I don’t know who to reach out to. This was very embarrassing and I want to prevent it from happening in the future.
title: Why is there no way to contact support?

review:
I have been using Uber for years and have found it to always be reliable. Well that’s changed, first of all the prices they charge were reasonable now they take advantage of situations…I ordered a car to get to the airport the next morning, flight was delayed so I cancelled and rebooked for a later car that same day, that price went from $58 to $128. On the return flight I requested a car at LaGuardia at 9:20 pm, they assigned car and 10 min later they said driver cancelled and found me another car which we waited another 15 min and they didn’t show, cancelled and requested black car and they could never assign one, requested another car and they finally came an hour after first request, got home an hour and half after first call which I live 25 minutes away.  I’m feeling that they are playing games with your time and taking advantage of prices of trips, when there’s delays and there’s so many these days they jack up the prices.  
Switching over to Lyft and giving them a chance.
title: Disappointed

review: Do not use this company. I had an uber account that I rarely use and next thing I know I get a message saying payment cannot be processed and I was confused what that meant so I checked and they have been charging me 9.99$ a month since September for an Uber one membership?? I immediately canceled the membership and contacted Uber. They said they could refund me one month and again my membership is canceled. Well, two days later they charge me 9.99$ for the membership that is canceled?!? I have been messaging them and they’re saying they can’t refund me but only the one month. Every time I message I get an automated response and someone different. I did not sign up for Uber one and if you check my account I do not use uber barely enough to justify getting a membership? Their practice is fraudulent, they will charge you without your permission and then they say they can’t refund you and their customer service is a joke. Cancel your account or double check all your transactions because uber is stealing from you
title: Fraud!
developerResponse: {'id': 34475440, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-01-25T10:12:28Z'}

review: Uber in Mexico has been good overall and safe, but there are many things that consumers (including myself) have no control over. It is very normal when a driver decides to cancel the ride after accepting. Many times you find yourself waiting 10-20 minutes for the driver to arrive only to notice that they cancel once they’re closer to your location. My account has a good rating overall, and I continue to be as polite as possible to Uber drivers, but there has to be some accountability. It is very frustrating to wait on a ride for 10-20 minutes  only to have the driver cancel and then find another driver that is 8-10 minutes away. There is no support for the consumer in this matter, and there are no penalties for the drivers cancelling rides. Riders receive fees or low ratings for canceling rides and drivers should be held at the same standard. Our time is valuable as well.
title: Overall good

review: Borderline fraudulent practices happening over at Uber.  Filing a complaint with the FCC and Better Business Bureau.  The app would not allow me to cancel my membership before it renewed and when you google their customer service number, unlike every other large company, nothing comes up other than instructions to click the Help button within thw app then tap phone support, but it goes straight to a dial tone before hanging up on you.  Had to reach out through Twitter and after explaining the situation they contacted me with instructions for their other completely different app which didn’t make sense.  Luckily, I figured out all I had to do was update my app. Completely dissatisfied with their customer service which is sub-par to a startup company. Had another issue with a driver leaving me stranded in Florida because the traffic was too bad so he told me to get out.  Tried calling for help through Uber then and had the same issue.  Overall, just use Lyft or call a cab.
title: National Business w/no Customer Support Line

review: This app and the drivers are progressively getting worse. Twice today I called for 2 passenger joined Uber ride and both times a two door sedan pulled up with two passengers.. also I have had many drivers come close to my pick up location and when I call them they act like complete jerks and hang up and cancel the trip.. that is a ridiculous feature I didn’t even get the drivers information before I had to wait another 12 minutes for the next driver. While I was already standing outside for over ten minutes. Also this app is notorious for giving you a driver who is coming to you from the exact location you need to go. I am at the airport requesting a ride to Inglewood and my driver is 12 minutes away coming from Inglewood like huh???
title: Dissatisfaction
developerResponse: {'id': 6656180, 'body': "Hi, this certainly sounds frustrating. If you had a poor experience with the driver partner, the best way to record this feedback is by rating the driver partner on the Uber. If there's anything else we can look into, let us know by sending a note to t.uber.com/contact and we will follow up.", 'modified': '2019-01-03T10:37:49Z'}

review: I have used Uber many times and had mostly positive experiences. Then I moved to the Netherlands (The Hague, to be specific), and it is nearly IMPOSSIBLE to get an Uber. EVERY time, the drivers are between 10-20 minute away from my location, and then they cancel the trip and I have to wait yet another 10-20 minutes. If this only happened once, I wouldn’t say anything. But it’s every time, especially late at night when there are no other transit options. I find it a joke that Uber considers itself a “no stress ride” when for the past two years I’ve only had stressful experiences. I hate to act like a Karen, but today was the tipping point for me. Uber is completely unreliable here, and I’d rather load 3 luggages onto my bike or use public transport than know for sure that I will waste 30 minutes or more of my life waiting for a vehicle and be completely stressed. It’s probably just a Netherlands problem. But for the time being, I’m not using Uber anymore.
title: If you’re in the Netherlands, forget about Uber

review: Do not use Uber, Uber is not trustworthy, for starters there are always charges that have nothing to do with you the driver or the ride you scheduled or have taken, secondly they will charge you twice for the same ride and send you an automated response saying how they assure you they haven’t charged you twice total lie, because if you look at your bank statement it will reflect the two charges, third they will tell you the issue has been resolved and you should see a refund or a void charge within 3-5 business days complete lie, you can wait for months argue with your bank etc. and after months still no refund or voided charge, plus they have no customer service department, having no customer service department is completely unacceptable, they have no customer service because it’s there way of not dealing with customers, but they have customer service for the drivers, why because it is 100 percent there main goal to rip you off and take advantage of you as much as possible..
title: Rip off

review:
This app is beyond worthless, and the very frequent updates aren’t fixing the problems.  It routinely reverses trips, sending drivers to the destination instead of the pickup location.

At large airports, if you want to be picked up at General Aviation, good luck.  No matter how many times you enter the full address of the pickup location, it keeps shifting it to the terminal.  And if you set Current Location as the pickup point, it’s a complete roll of the dice where it sends the driver.

For example, as I write this, I am waiting for pickup at the West Palm Beach airport, on the east coast of Florida.  I set pickup point as Current Location, in hopes of adding some precision as to which door to come to at the terminal.  Where did the app send the driver?  To Ft. Meyers airport, on the WEST coast of Florida.

I’ve gotten in the habit of immediately contacting the driver after booking the ride, to make sure we both know the plan.   If my company didn’t require me to use Uber, I would delete it from my phone forever.  How do drivers make a living with nonsense like that making them waste time and gas?

Oh, and let’s not forget tipping.  During the entire ride, it bugs you to give a tip.  I’m certainly happy to tip, but I don’t know how good a job the driver did until the ride is over.  What happens then?  The screen resets to the home page, and you can’t go back to set a tip amount!!

In case any doubt remains in the mind of the gentle reader, I HATE THIS APP!!!
title: Absolute Trash

review:
I have loved using Uber…until today, when I had two no-show drivers, and was charged for both. Luckily finally found a cab, but missed most of my meeting. 

I then went to Uber’s help page, to try to find out what was going on. (From watching the map, it looked like they were sent to wrong locations….nowhere close to me.  I double- he led to see how I had booked ride, and I had clearly booked from my hotel.  

When I got to the help page, I was given all kinds of options on what to complain about.  But not a single option addressed the issue of a no-show. 

I kept pressing « Something Else », and then the  App just sent me back to beginning of Help Page, which basically said I was charged for a trip I had not taken.  No recourse.  

Uber is a great App, and drivers are almost always professional, courteous, and punctual. 

But…If I’m having problem with App, then “Something Else” really should let me to report “something else”!

There is no apparent Customer Service contact info, thus I am leaving negative review… which I would be happy to  remove if someone could help me solve the problem that I actually have, instead of ones I don’t have.
title: My ride never came.  I was charged cancellation fees twice.

review:
I would like to warn those who use this app that there’s disgusting people out there who are on this app. 
For example today I uber home in a car that is not sanitary what so ever. The driver previously smoked a cigar and left the widows up during a pandemic. It was me (15) and 11 year old and my mom. Who does that? 
Number 2 there’s people out there that do not control themselves if you are young (ages 20 and under) who will straight up to your face and say “sorry i can’t take you if you’re under 18” um… i’m paying you right? so take me to my destination. I don’t mean to sound like a karen but really? he didn’t even give my money back. Anyways i’m sick and tired of not being able to write a review to let others be warned of this problem with the drivers. Especially those concerned of age. I’m so sorry for those who have gone through this.
title: Warning (app really needs to put in a “write a review for the driver”

review: Overall I love uber & I love it a lot better than Lyft . I love how you can add up to 5 stops & how you earn points too . I've only had 2 issues and one was with Uber eats and they handle my problem well . The only thing I can say is I wish Uber eats had a better way to get ahold of someone . I had to reach out to them on fb . But the person on fb really did help me and was fast . Now the only bad I do have to say is I had two Uber drivers who were VERY inappropriate  ! The one was asking what I was doing after and if I wanted to kick it with my Uber driver and cuddle & the other one was asking me if I wanted to drink with him . I was very uncomfortable because they were dropping me off at home so they know where I live so I didn't want to be rude and have to deal with them doing something .
title: Love it !

review: This app is emblematic of the tone deaf design in many apps and software today. I am an infrequent user of Uber, and have not logged into the app in some time. Since I last logged in, I have changed my phone number to a prepaid plan. So I try to login today, and the app prompts for my mobile phone and email address, but does not allow for a simple log into an existing account. When I enter my email address it says that account already exists and to create a new one. Why in the heck would I want to create a new account I simply want to log into my existing account? I am a fairly tech savvy 55-year-old but I get annoyed having to jump through hoops just to use a simple app. What are my mom and my other senior citizens more advanced in age supposed to do in figuring out this nonsense? Shame on you, app developers for your limited and self-centered concept of what comprises good software design.I cannot use this app as it currently stands and I’m not gonna bother with logging in on a browser to sort out your mess!
title: horrible design, no way to log-in to existing account

review:
We ( 2  87yearold) for over 40 minutes- first notice 15 minutes coming from waikele seemed pretty far out for our ride.

The ride map counted down from 15 minutes to two minutes and jumped back to 5 a couple of times We were at the correct pickup point and the 15 minute time became 40+ minutes- AN CHARGED WAIT TIME!!!
Driver said he was there- I walked the line twice and he was not-several people tried to help including two Uber drivers !! Finally made contact driver said he was there and went around. Hard to accept he was there when several other folks waiting for Uber and were aware of his car and plate number.
Driver very safe- car clean smooth ride . Cannot understand the fluctuations in the arrival time. First disappointment with Uber!
title: Wait time

review:
Don’t to pleased with Uber! When I first signed up a few days before I needed it I kept getting the message of “Uber doesn’t pick up at the location “. Tampa International Airport! So I had to call a taxi to bring me home BUT low a behold there was someone standing next to me that had a UBER driver picking him up! Thought UBER doesn’t pick up there????
 Another issue I had was I got a ride to go three miles away and was charged $36 an then 30 minutes later got another ride back an it was only $17! Same UBER plan? Why the cost difference??? Tried to malt a complaint to UBER but good luck with that because they are always right!
   Free rides to the Covid-19 shot? Omg I was going to be charged $30 per trip an thru the app they gave me choices 20 miles away! Good thing I contacted Walgreens up the road from me an they could give the shot 1/16th of a mile away from me! Oh UBER told me I didn’t use the app originally! Well then why was a ride being set up for me?
Be careful everyone
title: Eric

review:
While I’ve only had positive experiences with drivers, the app and support team are the WORST. I had a concert where I knew I was going to drink so I decided to take an Uber there and back. I clicked on a standard ride which showed a price around 13 and when I arrived to the concert I got my emailed receipt and was charged over $20. I didn’t add any stops or change my destination, so there was no reason for the ride to cost $7 more than the upfront cost. 
I tried using the app to get some help to see why I was charged that much but the computer generated response was that the $13 was correct but that was not the amount that my card was charged or what my receipt said. After trying many different options of support since they do all they can to make sure you don’t talk to an actual person, I was able to message a support person and still haven’t received a response to my original message. I regularly use rideshares and will no longer be using Uber.
title: Charged fees don’t match what they show upfront

review: We were picked up by Don in New Orleans this morning at our hotel. We stood at the back and side of his car for a minute and he never budged out of the driver’s seat. I walked up to the driver’s door and he put his window down, and still never acknowledged me. I told him we have luggage. He never responded verbally, he just popped the trunk. My husband managed to get the big pieces in the trunk, and we had a carryon piece that wouldn’t fit. I told my husband to hand it to me and I’d carry it on my lap. Don never offered for us to place it on the front seat, so I just held it along with my purse and another bag. He never once, said hi to us, or said have a nice trip or anything when he dropped us off at the cruise port. His profile says he has a diamond rating. Maybe he was having a bad day, but regardless, I have never had a driver that didn’t get out of their vehicle to greet me, or to help with luggage, much less not speak to me. The only word he said, was when I asked him who he was picking up and he said, “Cyndi.” Horrible experience.
title: Impolite Driver

review: I have been using Uber to get to and from work every day for over a month now because I have no other option and the amount of times I wasn’t able to get to work because they tried charging me well over $80 to $100 just to get to work is crazy that I was left without any more pto from having to use it  because of there prices. I have also had multiple times where I have payed for a ride and the driver has canceled on me or Uber just said they couldn’t get me a driver and I was still charged and never reimbursed even after contacting Uber support multiple times. They claim to have payed me and I never got anything back I have in total lost around well over $100 from Uber screwing me over and not getting me a ride. Do yourself a favor and find any other way to get to work rather than Uber because you will be wasting your time and money. They are not helpful and drivers can cancel on you at anytime without punishment so in the under you get overpriced rides and unhelpful staff.
title: Don’t use

review:
I had an issue where I think the driver either forgot to end the ride after dropping me off or maybe there was a bug in the app in their/my end. Either way, my $24 ride suddenly became $65 due to it not being flagged as completed for at least an hour or so AFTER my trip was finished. I really tried to report this bug/error however it doesn’t fit at all into Uber’s very narrow support pipeline, so I had no way to fix this except to click “this charge doesn’t reflect what I was presented up front” which is a very blunt fix and doesn’t reflect my use case. They offer no methods at all to write in your specific issue. 

As a result, I felt trapped and almost thought I was defrauded because the driver didn’t seem to notice or care that it wasn’t marked as completed and I only feel lucky that they didn’t actually steal an extra $40 from me, because I did at least have the ability to contest the charge. Since I have no other way to share this situation Uber, they get a bad app rating for such a bad support experience.
title: Good unless there’s an issue.

review: I drove my young adult sons to a football game this afternoon. I could not pick them up afterwards because I had to go to work. Uber seemed to be quite a bit more expensive than Lyft at the end of the game so I decided to send them a Lyft. Well… they waited and waited and 40 min later the Lyft driver canceled the ride! It was canceled when he was 4 min away and I can see that the car was already in the stadium general area. It was obvious that he probably did so to make another pickup for a few extra dollars 😔. At that point, the place they were hunkering down is was closed and it was cold! I ordered and Uber and in less than 10 min they were picked up and safely driven home. Yes, it was still a little more than Lyft but it’s reliable and the boys are home safe. Thanks Uber!
title: And this is why Uber is best

review:
This was my second time using Up bet and I was very disappointed in the quality of service I had received Monday night, 9/24. I just finished working a 12 hours shift at the pier and called for an Urber which was supposed to come in 4 minutes. I was awaiting starting at 8:04pm. Well 4 minutes and counting changed to 0 minutes, then looping to another 4 minutes, then standing still at 4 minutes to the driver canceling. Then informing me that another driver was coming in 4 minutes which resulted in 15 minutes. However, you did not have any problem taking my payment in less than 1 minute. I stood out in the cold waiting for an Urber of 4 minutes that resulted in over 30 minutes. This is not a reflection on the changed driver who finally pick me up, but the screw up service I had received.
This is not a good first impression.
I will try your service one more time and hoping this does not incite again.

Diane Claiborne- New Customer
title: Rider

review: I’ve been using Uber as well as Lyft for a few years, and while it usually works as intended there’s been a few times where the drivers have canceled on me RIGHT as they get to my destination. Idk if it’s because the fare has gone up in the time it took them to drive to my location and they’ll get a bigger pay if they cancel and take a different ride, but I feel like it’s happened too often now for there to not be a coincidence. If YOU cancel you get charged a cancel fee for their time, but if THEY cancel after a certain amount of time there’s no feature in the app that lets you report it. You can’t even call Uber Customer Service to get any compensation of some sort. Lyft at least doesn’t allow that to happen, even if it’s generally more expensive I’d rather pay to get a guaranteed ride instead of paying for a ride that may cancel on me. Please Uber fix this!
title: Wish the drivers wouldn’t cancel as soon as they get to me

review: I was in need for a driver on multiple attempts and my card wouldn’t go through. I called my financial institution I was currently using my card with and they told me the card wasn’t declined  it was that the driver’s rejected the rides (I could actually see 4 drivers just sitting in the map). I actually went to purchase an Uber gift card to add Uber cash and once again was neglected a ride and stranded. It would really help the average US citizen, who relies on transportation apps to get where they need to go, to not have to stress on their appointments, errands, etc. because of the lack of drivers in a community or the option of a driver rejecting a service. A person who is willing to pay for a service, should not be neglected. There are times when we go to work and don’t want to do something, but we do it because it’s our obligation to represent the company in a professional manner. The same should apply to Uber representatives.
title: Need Driver’s in Fairfield County, OH

review:
Within the last month I’ve been charged for 2 rides that I cancelled within SECONDS of confirming. I’m more than willing to accept a $5 cancellation, but that’s not the case here. I’ve been charged for rides that I undoubtedly cancelled. 
I wish that was the only issue. The real issue here is how difficult it is to get in touch with Uber on the backside of the transaction. There’s no phone numbers anywhere and one of the rides in question isn’t even showing up in my ‘recent rides’ in the app, so I’m not able to contact their support about it online. It’s been well over 3 weeks since I submitted the first issue, and now I’m experiencing this. I’ll use Lyft as a rideshare service moving forward and I’ve only used Uber since it’s been available.
title: Poor service.

review: I have finally had enough with Drivers that accept a ride and then cancel.  The reviews are misleading because if the drivers cancel the rides you have no way to give them an appropriate poor review.  Case in point, I just arrived at Nashville airport and checked the price which was $38 to go home.  After I got my bags 10 minutes later, the price had risen to $50…whatever…after 8 hours of traveling, I just wanted a ride home and did not care.  We to the appointed pickup location and was waiting and driver sent a message that he was there.   I asked where, since we were in front of the b1 pickup sign.  Asks if he could move up since we had been carrying luggage all day.  He wouldn’t budge.  Moved down to him and pointed at the b2 sign and he drives off.  Well as I have been finding over and over again with Uber, cabs are still and easy and effective method to get where you need…oh and most of the time they are less $ now too!!!  Ride at your own risk with Uber!
title: Uber is the worst ride hailing app on the planet.

review:
I currently don’t have a car and use rideshare apps to get to and from appointments. I have over 60 rides on Lyft and have a 5 star rating. I’ve never had a problem with anyone. 

I started pivoting towards Uber because they were starting to become cheaper in my area. Almost immediately, I had a negative experience.

I was waiting to get picked up to go to an appointment, and one of their drivers started harassing me through the messaging interface. At first, I was confused because I didn’t even realize there was an option to communicate from within the app. Then, I noticed that they were parked somewhere and not moving while they were insulting and berating me for having a low rating as a passenger (which I’m not sure how I got because I’d had maybe five rides at that point). I’m thinking maybe they were hoping I’d cancel the ride on my end so they wouldn’t have to pick me up.

I decided the safest thing for me to do was, as a single woman who travels alone, to cancel the ride. It just isn’t worth the risk. I called a friend and they gave me a ride instead. I reached out to Uber and haven’t seen any progression in this case even though I took screenshots of what the driver wrote to me. It’s clear they don’t properly vet their drivers and won’t have your back if something goes wrong. 

The numbers speak for themselves: 60 rides with Lyft with no problems, and one unresolved problem with Uber after less than 5 rides.
title: Terrible Experience

review: I’ve been using Uber for a few years now but every since the pandemic, it’s been the worst option for a riding sharing app. I shouldn’t have to order an Uber 40 minutes before I have to be somewhere (which is 15 minutes away) and STILL BE LATE. Not to mention how expensive the rides have become. I have to pay nearly $20 for that 15 minute ride at 6 in the morning. I know there is nobody using Uber in my area at that time so WHY is it so expensive. All in all, the wait time is ridiculous and will make you late no matter what, they’re ridiculously expensive even for the shortest rides, and if you decide to use something else after checking out the REAL wait time and cost, your money is on hold for that uber (i know most apps do that but you at least know the actual wait time before you try to order the ride). They also put my money on hold and charged me TWICE for an uber I didn’t even take. You will be losing a long time user.
title: Make you late. If there are other options, USE THEM.

review: I personally would have to say my overall experience with Uber has been an exceptional alternative. Most drivers are either quiet or very cordial. Of course your going to get thrown for a unfavorable ride but you don’t get along with everyone you meet every day. Or you may not prefer their driving “techniques” but I would say the over all odds of a bad ride are very low. If you are unsatisfied with the ride you chose try selecting the upgraded rides they may cost more but you may just prefer a more professional charter. The pets option is usually my go to side I have my dog usually with me. so no worry about a ride cancellation last second because you have a pet with you, Unlike Lyft. I would give a solid 9.5/10
title: Give them a break you can tell they are trying.

review: So overall the app is fine I guess, a little pricier than Lyft but it gets the job done, the issue comes when one day I ordered an Uber and the app said there was a problem with my card and to try again later, I thought no problem I’m just going to use Lyft, but when I checked my back account Uber did make the charge to my credit card. This was an easy fix, should be as easy as contacting Uber, showing my bank history and then my ride history so they could see I never got the ride, I send a message to Uber and after three days of arguing I got told that the charge was for a trip I took over a month ago, then I send them my bank history to show I was indeed charged in time for that and this was a different charge, long story short, after three days of fighting i got an Uber gift card smaller than the amount that I payed to begin with, to be honest, get Lyft, it’s cheaper, faster, and iver all better
title: Uber stole my money

review: You can learn a lot about a company from how hard it makes it for customers to talk (or chat) with a real person in customer service.  Buyer beware.  Uber is just a little too eager to outsource everything to a non-person, including customer service.  So: Uber drivers think they are agreeing with Uber to take X max people in their car but Uber tells the actual customer it’s X+ max! This means if you’re in any kind of hurry you’ll end up deciding whether to force too many in the back seat or wait for another vehicle (probably with the same exact issue as the first!).  Incompetent at best, deceptive at worst, and who’s knows which is more accurate.  Sadly if you follow the prompts it seems Uber just wants you to blame a driver when in fact it’s Uber that can’t do the 3rd grade math on how much room a car has if you subtract  the front passenger’s seat.  Taxis hold fewer surprises so that’s what I’ll do next time.  Uber apparently sees customers as cattle: stuff ‘em in! Mooooooo-not!!!  I’m done.
title: Drivers are usually good, it’s Uber that stinks

review: My wife and I have used this app for the last 3, almost 4 years. We took a trip to Austin, Texas and tried to request an Uber. We kept having issues with payment method and decided that adding Uber cash might fix our problem. It took the $50 out of the account and put it on our Uber cash however we still had the same payment issue message. After spending several hours trying to resolve the issue, I finally got an email stating that I had violated the terms and service agreement. We have never had any prior issues with Uber or any of the drivers. I’ve always left very generous tips to the drivers and I’ve never messed up an Ubers vehicle. My account was deleted on April 25th, 2022 BY UBER. They refuse to refund the $50 Uber cash that I bought hoping to resolve our previous payment problems. 0/5 stars on everything about Uber. Worst experience I’ve ever had on vacation. I think I’ll be contacting an attorney due to the lack of refund.
title: If I could leave a zero star rating I absolutely would

review: Uber allows drivers to not arrive at the pick up location then cancel the trip charging you on your credit card. If you ask for a refund they will just give you a credit for your next trip. This is actually not a fair practice and it’s considered fraud. I hope the SEC can investigate them for these practices. At some point there will be a class action lawsuit once the lawyers figure this out. I’m posting here so I’m sure at some point a lawyer will read this and go after Uber. I suggest Uber changes their practices and credits the refund to the credit card. I also suggest that if the driver hasn’t reached the destination and hasn’t given the person a phone call, they are not allowed to charge a cancellation fee. I waited in the freezing cold and snow for a driver who is still one minute away from his pick up destination and then canceled the trip. I had to wait for a new driver and a higher cost for the next trip to the same destination.
title: Uber allows drivers to cancel your trip and charge you.

review: Within the past week I have gotten 15 separate charges to my account from Uber when I haven’t used it. Some of them have been refunded but this is ridiculous. I’ve only used Uber eats and I’m getting charged for Uber trips I never took. When I finally got ahold of customer service they told me another account had my payment information and gave me the first name which is the name of my fiancé. He downloaded the app but never ordered anything and doesn’t even have a payment method added. His account has no past trips or orders at all. My card isn’t connected to his account at all. I got my card locked for fraud and received a new one and I’m still getting charges. I don’t understand how I’m still getting charges when I never gave anyone my new card information. Customer service isn’t helpful whatsoever. One charge that was over $90 made my account overdraft and now I’m stuck with the fees. I just want my ALL my money back and to never deal with this nonsense again.
title: Unauthorized charges

review:
I have lots of Uber Cash, and had planned to add more whenever I run out. I just took an $80 ride yesterday. And now they are requiring “payment info” to see rides? Talk about a slap in the face to the customer. I’m disappointed.

Do not buy Uber cash, as there is little to no advantage, since they still farm your payment info. They get your money NOW, you just get an insulting paywall later. In my mind, giving my payment info is the same as physically paying. This feels worse than paying for an auto-renewing product. Scam? Selling customer data? How are they allowed to require payment info before they even show the service they offer? It’s not like they can claim the app itself has any utility and is the service itself. Even forgetting my history of rides, is this Illegal? Suspicious.

Support hides and hides and hides. Uber goes out of their way to make it difficult to use their service once they have your money and information. Lyft time?
title: RUN: Requires giving payment info to see if rides available.

review: I live in New York and after years of seeing the effects of Uber and similar apps I can say with certainty that level of road safety has gone down. The majority of Uber drivers have very little driving skills and even less regard for other drivers. They are not professional drivers, they don’t know where they are going and so they are constantly staring at their phone for directions. I drive a car and motorcycle, and ride a bicycle. Im not exaggerating or embellishing when I say that 100% of the time that I see a car driving in a negligent and unsafe way it is always an Uber driver. Furthermore your company isn’t even profitable. It’s just constantly expanding for the sake of staying around while offering a service that was already in place to begin with. I can now say with complete confidence that your company is detrimental to society. The fact that someone can take their car and drive around to make a few extra bucks doesn’t balance the negative effects.
title: This app has made roads less safe
developerResponse: {'id': 4747238, 'body': "Hi, this doesn't sound right. We're always looking to improve your experience with Uber and we would certainly like to know more about this. Let us know about any such specific incident by sending a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2018-08-21T08:39:47Z'}

review: I get off work at 1 am I work near several bars and I call my Uber at around that time before the club rush of several people trying to use the app at once. Tonight I got off work at 1am Uber notified me that in one hour prices will increase due to a surge, which should be no problem because I should be home within an hour due to Uber advertising 10 minute wait times. Well after waiting for 20 minutes and having my ride request cancelled because Uber drivers are “busy” at the moment I made the mistake of simply trying to request another ride under the same advertised 10 minute wait time. Another 20 minutes goes by and Uber has cancelled my request once again due to drivers being “busy”. So now it’s been 40 minutes almost an hour and Ubers prices are now surged due to it being an hour from the time I originally requested…. So now I am paying double the price due to your buggy app seems unfair & purposeful to get more money from your customers👎🏾
title: Screw this greedy app

review:
It’s absolutely insane how invasive Uber’s data collection and sales policies are and how difficult they make it just to opt out. Despite notifications and data sharing being disabled on my phone and being signed out of the app, Uber still sends push notifications and sells my data.

Apple should ban this app from the App Store until these issues are fixed. Uber says they don’t sell your information “without your consent”, but then hide the real consent beneath a deceptive “opt out” in multiple layers of privacy settings and separate menus. All of these issues are automatically present in without being reasonably notified. A user shouldn’t have to read a novel and help menu on the website to find how to opt out. All of this should be opted in. 

Designers/engineers at Uber: you are awful people for continuing to allow this.  To make matters worse than the above, the way you market the ride selection and expected experience is garbage and wholly inaccurate compared to reality.
title: Invasive, deceptive, garbage

review:
6 months of on going battles to clear my background check due to a misdemeanor for crossing the street the wrong way(only on ubers side)… battled through 20 different support agents to get a defined answer of “Wait 90 days for checkr to clear”. Meanwhile i am accepted for delivery on grubhub & doordash. Ive gotten sent back and fourth from Uber support to Checkr support where a checkr rep says “Im not to sure why they would tell you to contact us”. Ive asked many many times to resubmit my background check. Ive filed with checkr to update my background, which they did in less than 3 days. Uber update yet? Not at all.

Now that my background check is STILL NOT CLEARED, i can NOT access my 1099 form. I called support and they said they will email me a link, the link is the same exact one i have problems with, as i called for. Its almost like im not being understood in ANY of the situations ive called for. 

Mind you, i have over 500 deliveries with uber, and ive proved over and over again that the misdemeanor was dropped in court. For some reason uber is the ONLY company having problems through checkr, hard to believe.

Save yourself the trouble & go for a better company with good communication skills. Absolutely disappointed ive wasted hours on end delivering for this company.

(Btw ive emailed my “local uber rep” about every single situation and havent gotten a reply to a single one)😂 You cant make this up.
title: Single handed WORST support team ive experienced.

review: A few incidents have happened so often lately, I use Uber almost daily and there is always issues weather the drivers just go to a completely different spot and ask me to charge costing me money for the waiting time or them simply not picking me up after making me wait for 20 minutes EACH, this happened 3 times back to back on the same day, and the worse thing is the passengers can’t say nothing or rate the Uber drivers for doing that, one driver made me wait 20 minutes for them to cancel when they were 3 minutes away, another made me wait 10 minutes and then canceled after they saw I did not cancel, be aware drivers will do this and expect YOU to cancel so they can get extra money for no reason. These incidents are very annoying and unprofessional I wish there was a way to tell Uber about these drivers but there isn’t and I don’t think they’ll add that anytime soon.
title: Good for drivers TERRIBLE for passengers

review:
I started using the app a week ago without incident when all of a sudden, the app just inexplicably stopped accepting my method of payment. I thought this was a problem with my bank but I reached out to them and they said there was nothing wrong on their end. I used the card for other apps and transactions and it worked. Just not Uber. I contacted their in app customer care but wasn’t given much help there. I was asked to wait on the special support team to contact me via email. This took 2 days and when they finally got to me, they were no help. They asked me to do stuff I already did. I’ve re-entered the card details multiple times, updated the app and even contacted my bank. I only have one card so I can’t use another. I’ve deleted and reinstalled the all as well.
Nothing is working, I might just have to delete the app all together as I’m out of options.  I’m frustrated with this whole process. Didn’t expect such poor service from Uber. 
Would give no stars if I could.

What a let down. When I urgently needed a ride to a major airport there were absolutely no Uber rides available for me. My location was only two miles from a major interstate but there was nothing. Fortunately I found a regular cab company to accommodate me. Yesterday my Uber driver spoke absolutely no English at all. He tried to dump me off at the wrong building at the VA medical center in Las Vegas, grunting at me, instead of taking me to the main lobby entry point. Meanwhile while with my ankles & my back hurting, I had to struggle to explain to this guy “hospital”. He was impatient and had NO IDEA what I was saying. I have nothing against non-English speaking people. He was simply not a good fit. I was already in a stressful situation, the guy made it worse. By contrast my Uber driver later the same day was absolutely wonderful. Only one of them got a tip. I enjoy the app but one cannot count on getting a ride not even in a large metropolitan area during daylight hours. Sad.
title: What a let down

review: After of being a loyal customer with Uber for about 5yrs I will be discontinuing with their services unfortunately they have been giving me such a hard time to get anywhere lately for the past 2/3 months now, When booking a ride to home from work it will take at least 5 or more mins to still continue to connect me to a driver I will then receive a message from Uber on the bottom that informs me for an extra 25$ you will have someone who’s about 10-15 mins from my location which is ridiculous because my job isn’t far from home it’s only an 8 min ride and for me to have to pay 25$ more just to have a guaranteed is absurd! I would normally have to pay anywhere between 6-8$ to book a ride from home to work. This is just very upsetting because this was my only reliable transportation because where I work is in a dangerous area and I get off late from work. I’m not in a position to be spending 20+$ for trips that’s only going to take me 8 mins. Therefore I will discontinue with Uber very disappointing.
title: Don’t Recommend!!

review: Uber itself is a good idea and a very helpful thing, but recently within the past 3 months, Uber has been charging me with an “Uber Pass” subscription which I never even knew about. It’s been 3 months now fighting with Uber about how to get a refund and stop my subscription as they keep telling me to go into my app and select cancel, however, Uber Pass isn’t even an option in my side bar and they make it impossible to get ahold of anyone from customer service. I am incredibly disappointed because I’ve never even used Uber before yet I was automatically signed up for a $10 subscription each month that I have been unable to cancel. I know I am not the only one having these issues. I removed my card information in hopes of them not being able to charge me anymore but I hope that I am able to get a refund. As a college student who doesn’t need this subscription and hadn’t even heard of it before, I am incredibly angry at Uber for enrolling me in this and not offering any support on how to cancel.
title: Uber Pass Help

review: Obinna was the driver. I had the pleasure of riding with today. Today was a very big step for me and he was the one to drive me to the location where I would be taking this step. Not only did he help me soothe my nervousness, but he was extremely funny absolutely awesome outgoing and his car was so clean, smelled so good and it was the coolest Tesla I’ve ever ridden! We truly had an awesome time from the moment he drove me to my location to the moment I came home. If I could give this man 1000 stars and driver of the absolute world, this guy would be him! He is absolutely amazing and I am truly honored to have been able to meet this man and I hope nothing but the best for him! Please acknowledge this young man for his kindness, his outstanding, Customer Service, and talent with Customer Service
title: Best driver ever!!!!!!!!

review: Worst case of bait and switch by dollar value. Advised in advanced booking that the fee would be $36. When we received the email with the actual cost the price was more than $10 higher due to an eight dollar booking fee never disclosed and a $2.11 never disclosed fee because we need this money to maintain our cleanliness or somesuch. If any of this was based on time, we were the losers. Heading to the cruise port terminal in Boston. We repeatedly told the driver that our ship was at terminal one but he told us the crowds were too large and he was going to drive father down. arriving at terminal two where  after he unloaded the bags was told by a porter that he needed to go around the block and follow in line again for another long wait while  he got us back to terminal one.
title: Deceptive pricing

review: When I arrived at the Denver airport . It would not recognize the credit card a wanted to charge the ride to. It kept asking for the expiration date on another card which I was not going to use. I could not proceed without updating the old expired card which I did not have with me. I had just used in Paris last week the same card which Uber said was expired. I had another valid card and it would not let me use it. I checked my activity log and they confirmed that it was billed to the so called expired card that I used last week in Paris.I could not use Uber as a result at the Denver airport. I got to my hotel and entered a new card and it accepted it. There definitely was a problem with your website accepting my cards
title: Trouble when I arrived at Denver Airport

review: I don’t have a car and my place of work is 40 minutes away by walking, so I end up taking Ubers whenever I’m running late for work or if I’m too exhausted to walk home. However, it seems I have to play a guessing game every time I call an Uber, because the predicted arrival time has been correct maybe 10% of the time, and that’s generous. The issue I’m having is that the app doesn’t seem to have a good grasp on the availability of drivers in my area. Sometimes the drivers are only a couple minutes further out than initially stated, but other times they are over 20 minutes away. For a drive that takes 9 minutes at its slowest. I don’t blame the drivers for this, because it’s unreasonable to expect them to always be in the area. What this means is that the blame has to fall on the app, and it will remain there until the app becomes at least 70% accurate in its predictions. It doesn’t have to be perfect, but it should at least be adequate.
title: Unreliable or straight up wrong

review: This is the first time I have ever used Uber. Our our car broke down in the pouring rain and it took us 6 hours to get road side assistance and a tow of 2 miles to a repair shop. By the time we got to the closed repair shop we were cold and exhausted. The Uber app said our driver would arrive at 8:50 PM. We had just waited 5 1/2 hours to get a tow truck after being assured our wait time would be no more than an hour. The Uber app said at 8:35 PM that it hadn’t found a driver yet so I was pleasantly surprised when Yon arrived at 8:49 PM. He was courteous, intelligent and an excellent driver. We arrived at home just before 11 PM. Under the road conditions at the time that was excellent time. The price was very reasonable and and I would not hesitate to use the service again. Kudos to Yon and Uber.
title: Impressed

review: I typically turn my phone on “low power mode” to get my battery to run longer. However, I recently found out that the Uber app senses when your phone is on low battery mode and charges you more money. The algorithm is programmed to notice low battery mode, and increase ride fairs. Why? Because according to Uber, you are more likely to not pass on a ride, and wait for a better fair, if your battery is low and you must get home to charge it. When asked about this in an interview, the Uber CEO smirked and called it an interesting take on the human psyche. Screw him. I use Uber much less after seeing him say that on video. Uber takes advantage of people, jeopardizing their safety for dollars, by increasing prices when batteries are low. I’ve even experienced a price jump after agreeing to a lower price at the start. Uber is just playing with peoples lives. Lyft gives better prices, it seems.
title: Algorithm increases ride prices in low power mode

review: THIS IS NOT MY FIRST PROBLEM WITH UBER. I’m a frequent user & I’m beyond frustrated. Uber has tried to charge my card 4 times for the same ride that I already paid for and I can’t find ANYTHING about a customer service line to get this resolved so I keep having to move my money out of my account so they won’t take any more!!!! There were also 2 additional charges; one for $5 which they said to be a cancellation fee (the driver pulled up to my location, immediately cancelled the ride and then left), then another $10 charge for a ride I NEVER BOOKED!!!! This is all on top of 4 additional charges of almost $20 each!!!!! How can you operate as a business with no way to contact customer support???? The FAQs don’t help, there’s not even a chat bot or anything, not that a chat bot would be any more useful. I just want my money back & I want Uber to stop trying to charge my card for a ride I already paid for!!!!! Will never be using Uber again! I’d rather take the bus at this point.
title: No Customer Service?!?!

review:
I guess Uber going down the bad customer service route and trying to cash out on their reputation. 
Why? 
1) Uber drivers cancel rides after they accepted it and you have waited for them for a prolonged time - Wasting your precious time at the very least, but many times your money too. Since they often charge you a cancellation fee. 
2) this is a widespread problem (Google it) yet the company does not provide you with a customer service or an option to put such complaint on their site. (As if they are unaware of it)
3) the fact that Uber doesn’t take any serious steps to fight this means that in one way or other this works in their favor. And they don’t want to antagonize their precious drivers. 
4) they will refund your money if you ask for it. But then you not only wasted 5-10 minutes waiting for the car that never arrives, you also wasted another 5-10 minutes figuring out how to file a complaint and get a refund. (This is not one their standard quick list of problems). 
5) Uber provides no way for you to rate a driver which didn’t show up. So you don’t know which of the high star drivers do this frequently.
title: Drivers cancel the trip and charge you

review: I’ve used Bird and Superdestrian to ride scooters. Disappointing. Had issues both times. Decided to try Uber Lime. I didn’t have issues for three weeks. I had my first problem yesterday. My bike wouldn’t park even though I was right on a parking spot. I had to haul it up half a mile uphill (the bike stopped working) to get it to park. I angrily messaged customer service. Despite my tone, they helped me and refunded me immediately for unused time. Today, my scooter wouldn’t park. Instead of taking the scooter back, I messaged customer service right away. Within a couple of minutes, my ride was ended and I was once again refunded. I’ve never had such a painless process when it comes to issues like these. The customer service people are nice and resolve issues immediately. There was no fight to get my money back.
title: Best 2-Wheel Service

review: I ordered an UberEats delivery from the Uber app and tried to cancel it, only to find that the Uber app had no cancel button and the help page was extremely unhelpful. The “contact a representative” button brought me to an empty page. I had to download the UberEats app to cancel the order and by that time they refused to give me a refund because “5 minutes had passed”. I tried contacting their customer service, but it turned out to just be a couple of bots because no matter what I emailed them it was clear they had not read my message and kept reiterating the same few words about how 5 minutes had passed, even when I clearly expressed it was because Uber had not put a cancel button ANYWHERE on the order page. This is ridiculous, Uber. You can’t even be bothered to hire real people even when you’re the spearhead of a billion dollar industry? I was a Platinum user before but after this terrible experience I’m taking my business to Lyft instead.
title: Terrible UI/UX and HORRIBLE customer service

review: On April 4 I requested a ride to a destination approximately 12 miles away. The app indicated that a driver was on the way & charge would be $34. Then another driver named Marcus said he was taking over & price would be $50. Reluctantly I agreed since I was already late. Then there was some message that said price might be higher. It was a Sunday afternoon & traffic was light. Marcus shows up & takes me to the destination without problems. When I received the receipt by email, I was stunned that the total charge was $125. I went to the internet to try to contact Uber. But there was no contact number. Then I read further that drivers have liberty to charge what they want depending on difficulty of the route. There was no difficulty here. Traffic was very light but Marcus chose to charge me almost $100 over originally quoted fare. I attempted to dispute with my credit card company but was unsuccessful. This seems so unfair & dishonest. I was previously a good Uber customer but have now taken my last Uber ride.
title: Total rip-off

review: I was in Philadelphia for a business meeting for the first time after a long, stressful day it was time to head home. So I decided to Uber to the parking garage. I had accidentally left my parking ticket in the car and was turned around trying to find my car, I literally got out of my Uber realizing I was nowhere near where I was supposed to be and started walking to my surprise. My Uber driver drove around the block and saw me and pulled over and showed me where the parking garage that I parked in was she didn’t need to come back around and she didn’t need to offer any assistance with her credit she did. What an amazing individual. She was humble respectful nothing but class. Thank you so much for your help. You literally made my day. Thank you respectfully, Keith, Mitchell.
title: Amazing!

review: The driver was a complete idiot.  I have lived in my house for almost 40 years and nobody has ever failed to go to the right place. This guy parked on the wrong street. There was no excuse for this.  The addresses are entirely different on that street. I saw him through a window and struggled through trees and down a terrace and told him he was in the wrong place and to come around to the right one. My luggage was sitting outside.  I went in for a minute while he was coming around. When I came back out, he pulled away. I had to leap in my car and risk a ticket speeding to the airport, incur the expense of valet parking. And the $$##%%^^^ at Uber, after telling me the driver had to cancel the ride (a lie), they charged me $30.  Then they would not let me send the review until I chose a nickname!  All the ones like “Victim” were already taken. As was everything else. I went through at least 10.  I have a feeling they know when it’s a negative review and pull this stunt to keep it from going.
title: Nightmare thanks to Uber

review: This app is really helpful with getting me to the places that I need to get to. Though I have many problems with it. I randomly get charged extra for a ride that was completed a few days ago taking money from my cash app and sometimes putting it in the negatives. No they aren’t round trips, I don’t make anyone wait, they are one way trips that don’t take that long. Another thing I have wrong with this. Why are the drivers able to cancel when they are halfway to my pickup spot with no consequences? If I cancel a trip and they’re halfway, I have to pay them 7 dollars but I get no money back if they cancel? When they do cancel that makes me very late for work and I have to wait a good few more minutes for another ride. Can you add the option for silent rides? I don’t really like it when my driver talks while I’m trying to listen to music.
title: I like Uber but…

review: Today my Uber experience was the best!!! I accidentally left my phone in the drivers car and had no way to reach him. I panicked because I have so much vital information stored on my phone. But fortunately I have an apple device which allowed me to pull up the location of the phone in the Find My Device option. I coordinated with Uber support who helped me to get in contact with the driver who agreed to meet me right away to drop off the phone! As as I walked out the front door of my building her was driving up the street and stopped to hand my over to me from out the passenger window! I’m happy to be an Uber customer and an apple customer today! Both services came through like a champ for me in my time of need!
title: Excellent Customer Service Experience!

review: After arriving to pick me up, I notified her that there was still some things I needed to do in order to leave.. She said no problem ,whatever you need to do.. at that point I thought to myself what a nice person not giving me any problems about hurrying up and getting in the car and let’s go so she can get through this ride. It was just the opposite so after we left she had to take me to my destinations and still I had problems and she waited to make sure everything was OK, after notifying her, everything was OK. She just smiled and said have a nice day. I was having a bad day. My truck just had broke down and she pick me up from the service shop. she arrived with a smile, and was very polite and helpful. So thank you very much.
title: What a great driver 🙏

review: After a long wait, a driver cancelled on me. No biggie, but I’m not willing to wait for another driver. The app locks up when I try to cancel the next driver that was automatically assigned to me. I restart the app, try to cancel again, and it locks up. It does this multiple times. I try calling the new driver, no luck. I try interacting with the automated text service, no luck. I look for a number online to call, and Uber tries to avoid sharing their number but I find one.  After navigating their menu, I finally get to cancel my ride and am then charged nearly the full price. It hangs up on my automatically. I call again, navigating their menu for assistance. It tells me to use the app/website for assistance and hangs up on me. I try using the app. The app only pretends to give you options to report issues. After getting the runaround for every way I’ve tried to resolve it, with no reasonable way of addressing an issue like this, I am done with Uber.
title: Furious. Bad app, bad customer service.

review:
TRASH….. How do you describe trash? Well the dictionary would say it means , “discarded matter or refuse”. I believe these two meanings are unerring, for UBER. In this review I will attempt to accurately present why UBER fits the definition to a T of TRASH. 

   What do you think of the mean discarded matter? Obviously you would think of your trash. Disgusting food, broken items, not working things, etc.. UBER as a company has successfully gotten so bad that it is, not working, delivering cold late and disgusting food (inedible more time than less). 

    Now for refuse, refuse means “show that one is not willing to do something”. UBER as a company, or service, is not willing to help you in any real way customer service wise. They choose any way to avoid any way to really do anything for there true customers ,while never delivering there service in any way up to standards. 

  I recently decided to start ultimately delete my account and throw this app (and company )in the trash as you will, after a bad interaction. My food fell over everything , after receiving my food almost two hours after it was made! After fending of all 16 of my rescue Pit Bulls , 12 cats, 3 Komodo Dragons, 4 tortoises, and 3 Burmese Pythons. Successfully cleaning up the mess while fighting for my life that my food UBER delivery caused into chaos, I never took a picture of the food in the trash I never took a picture they refused to give me a refund. I got reamed. Hard. Dry. Unrelenting.
title: TRASH

review: Tried something new and Bought from Dairy Queen. I’m assuming they left my food out and ants got all in my food then they just wrapped it up without checking and gave it to the uber driver. Took a few hours trying to reach out to someone but I was able to get a refund. I don’t know if I will ever order from uber eats because of customer service. But I know I will never but from Dairy Queen EVER. They need to shut them down!! I was give to small slices of bread instead of biscuits, and 5 chicken tenders instead of 6. Didn’t even have enough money that same night to order anything else. Thanks uber for the refund I really appreciate your understanding of receiving ants and the fact my whole order was wrong and poorly packaged.
title: Uber eats - had a terrible experience

review: He got pick up after midnight. He got out car and forgot to get his stuff. I called the Uber driver this morning asking to see if she had it. She called back and said she didn’t. I asked could she confirm address I am tracking. She said that address is for high way. It was weird because she automatic knew it was a high way. I didn’t mentioned high way I just read address. She said she would call back within 15-20 minutes to give us a number to call she didn’t and blocked my number. Uber needs customer service number to be contacted with situation like this. We can’t report anything because he doesn’t have his phone. This is horrible customer service and now items are still missing and purchases was made from his account. Your Uber driver should check there car after every ride to confirm items are there’s and report. This did not happen and my friend item was thrown on high way. Unacceptable and I will never use Uber again!
title: Uber driver stole my best friend items

review:
Uber says it will give some sort of refund for the rides taking longer than expected, I have been using Uber constantly to get to and from work for around 8 months while my car is down and rides typically take longer than expected. (Anywhere from 5-15 minutes longer than estimated) On top of that a lot of drivers are rude (even the seemingly-nice talkative ones) and will ask you a lot of personal questions then assume they know everything. I’m pretty talkative but a lot of drivers want to give ‘therapy sessions’ then interrupt you and assume things after asking questions without letting you finish then assume they know everything. I’m going to get a brand new car once I fix my old junker so I will (hopefully) never have to use Uber again besides emergencies. 
Tired of getting rude drivers and feeling bad about giving bad reviews because I don’t want to mess up someone’s livelihood.
title: Uber estimated arrival times

review:
I ordered an Uber from my house at 7016 Barwater Ct, Bethesda to  go to Capitol Hill visitor center at 3 pm today, May 9, 2023. We got into the car but my friend could not put on the seat belt. The driver stopped the car at a stop sign about one block from my house. He got out of his seat to help my friend put on the seat belt. When he went back to his seat, he swiped a wrong button, the trip was canceled. He tried to call Uber to ask if there was a way to “un-cancel” the trip. It took at least 15 mins for him to talk to a person to find out that there was no way to reverse the cancellation. He was in a bad mood but continued to drive us. The traffic was very bad. We got to the by destination 20 mins late. I feel sorry for him with the traffics so I gave him $20 cash. 
Because the trip was canceled with Uber none of my fault. Can I get the money I paid back? 
Thank you
title: Problem with an Uber ride

review: I have been having extraordinary difficulty using both the Uber app and the online website to book trips. With no other explanation, it will say that there is an error processing the request. This is not an error related to funding or to a hold on the account. When I reached out to Uber to explain the issue as they request that you do, I did not hear back.  Instead at random, one of the 30 or so attempts I made finally went through. This does not seem to be about location either because I booked successfully from locations I no longer can in the past and attempted to book today from the same location I did yesterday and it still failed. As I write this, I am still struggling to book myself a ride home from work today and may instead just have to put out one of my colleagues rather than waste 30 minutes trying to do something that should take 60 seconds.
title: App Glitch

review: I’ve been a big fan of Uber for a long time, and i have many friends and peers who vouch for this all hand over heels. Now that I am in Madrid for vacation, the Uber app/website is not functional for my account. Despite having my email, phone number, and American Express card verified, I receive error messages every time I try to request an on-demand ride, and the option to schedule a ride randomly disappears from the app menu options. I tried reaching out to Uber support, and after a quick back-and-forth, Uber support simply stopped responding. This is especially upsetting since I utilize the premium Uber Black option, yet am not receiving premium service by any means. If this issue isn’t resolved before my arrival/departure to Madrid, I will delete my Uber account and utilize a town car service instead. I’m beyond disappointed in Uber’s app functionality and customer support. A company this large and successfully owes better to their patrons.
title: App not functional, support non-existent

review:
I was satisfied with this app. Sometime the estimated fee is lower than the actual fee but in an reasonable way. However, I took an Uber from my home to nj. The estimated fee is around 80. The six avenue is blocked. Clearly the driver knew the traffic but did not tell me. He drives in a very crowded area and told me the road is blocked, and recommend me to use subway. I cannot because I carried six luggages. I told him to follow the guide app but he did not do. Also he barely speaks English so the communication was terrible. Finally I found a way to NJ. Guess what? He passed that road even if the guide app in his phone tell him to do so. He change the route frequency so I doubted if he was really trying to help me. In the end, the trip took me one hour more than estimated and cost 130 dollar more. I was disappointed and disgusted. I try to contact the Uber but nobody responded to me. I am considering not to use Uber anymore because of their ridiculous logic.
