Also, if someone from Uber see this message, my trip is on May 1st.
title: Risky app

review:
This young man was prompt and pleasant right from the start.  He was an excellent driver got me to my location promptly and we had a nice chat while on the way. However, when I got to my room, I realized my phone was missing. Luckily, I had a second phone with me so I called my phone and my driver promptly answered and he already had another person in the car and was going to bring it back shortly after but she said no, fine we’re close enough so he came right back with my phone to my hotel immediately  I had left my phone in the back seat. The driver And the new passenger in the vehicle were both very kind. I would highly recommend this young man.   
Kind regards, 
Robert from Newfoundland Canada
title: Fantastic driver who saved my day and vacation.

review: Paul was great.  I sent a Uber to pick up my daughter to get her to the airport. She is procrastinator and always runs late. He had to get her from our storage unit. I order the Uber and he gets there and she is nowhere on site.  I pleaded please don’t leave! And he didn’t, he went above and beyond, drove around the complex looking for her and then went inside and spoke to the gal. She said, she knew where she was.  He got her and drove her to the airport, and got her there on time as of course she was cutting that short also.  Paul was a blessing to our family today as getting her on that plane today was imperative. And if it wasn’t for Paul it wouldn’t of happened!!!  Not many people if this crazy world of ours now a days would do what Paul did!  THANK YOU PAUL!!!!
title: The best!  Caring Uber Driver EVER!!

review:
I had requested and Uber for my daughter very late at night. 
John was the one who got the Uber request - first thankful for him being out so late. Two he messaged to say he had arrived. Three I told him that the Uber is for my daughter and she would be right out and to please bring my baby home safe. He responded quick and provided reassurance that he will, and she will be fine. 
I waited out side for them to arrive. His driving speed was professional. He even turned around to allow her to get out of his well kept car, safe and sound. I thanked him and he saluted. Thank you so much - it may seem so small to some but a big impact for myself. 
May he be blessed with all he deserves. 
Cheers too Jhon for being available
title: He brought my daughter home safe

review:
The day started out very poorly with Uber. I had made a reservation last evening with my son and daughter-in-law both. I have used it many times make sure I did everything right confirmed a reservation for pick up at 9 AM and nobody showed up and then I checked and they said I did not have a reservation which they made sure I had correctly marked everything for a reservation, after calling a couple neighbors a friend who is very ill got up out of bed and drove me to my appointment and I was a half hour late because I had scheduled it to arrive early. My return ride with Uber arrived as scheduled a very nice man named Tom, and it worked out perfectly. He got a nice cash tip. yesterday when I arrived at the airport. With help from a very nice gentleman I requested a ride he came on time. And took me home safely so that was good so two out of three have been good.
The end
title: First experiences with Uber

review:
I am disappointed to receive a $6.25 charge for a so called canceled pick up today. We saw the driver driving around as we were walking from our room to the reception area for pick up.     by the time we got to the reception area,  I saw him pulling out of the driveway into the road.   I asked reception if the driver had come in to ask about us. They said he had not.. This is the first time I’ve ever used Uber.     Along with the pick up request I did send a message saying to wait as I wouldn’t be there for about a half an hour. Evidently that message didn’t get through or was ignored. I re-ordered the need for a driver and second one showed up very promptly very politely asked if I was available and did a good job..   I rated him a 5.   The first one I rated a 1.    
I would like the $6.25 charge reversed as I perceive his leaving as a “no show” rather a “cancelation”
title: “Cancelled” trip fee

review:
Today I order an Uber to pick up a older woman from a clinic in Denver, I order an Uber for her and the ride was cancel by the driver before the pick up.  I called her to let her know the car was 3 min away.  I sent special instructions to the driver.  I didn’t received a text, nor a call or any information why the ride was cancel but yes I received a charge of $5.30 for cancellation fees.  This is not the first time I go through these kind of situation.
I order a second car and the driver was very kind and did a great job.  That is why my rating is satisfied but no very.  There must be a better way to have all drivers be kinder and considerate with customers.  
I will contest the cancelation charge, I don’t want that driver to benefit from inconsideration.  I know you protect the driver but who will protect the customer?
Adriana Marrero
title: Honestly

review:
Uber has always been an issue for me because it rarely uses my precise location. I was in a dangerous part of town late at night and my driver was across the street where I could not cross, we couldn’t understand each other and I tried telling him to wait. I was scared for my safety. I was lucky that my friends didn’t drive too far yet and they came back to pick me up but I think I will stick with lyft, which I haven’t had any issues like this with. 

Besides that I did have some great drivers/service so I don’t want to completely discredit Uber. I was also able to get a refund for the cancellation fee of that particular ride. Still kind of upset that happened though because I am a young woman and this driver knew that and he couldn’t wait for me, but also this app never ever uses my exact location as a pickup spot unlike lyft.
title: Stranded in Hollywood at 11 pm

review:
My fiancée’s account was hacked. Her password was changed and 2FA steps were enabled effectively blocking her out of the account and we were charged $200. We tried to contact Uber but there was ZERO way to contact Uber except through a form on their website. We were forced to escalate the issue to our bank to dispute the charges WITHOUT any help or support from Uber. When they finally froze her account and started responding to the forms, they provided NO support and requested our full credit card info which screamed sketchy to us. We found another form which we submitted. That form managed to escalate to an actual person. That person reset our password but refused to help any further when my fiancée was still locked out due to the 2 step verification. I am now uninstalling Uber and Uber Eats in solitary with my fiancée. DO NOT USE UBER AT ALL! I would NEVER recommend Uber again after this fiasco. They DO NOT care about you or helping you. They want your money. 

DO NOT USE UBER!
title: Non-Existent Customer Support

review:
I was extremely disappointed with my most recent uber experience, especially the customer support I received. I recently booked a trip with uber in which my driver cancelled on me and I was informed that a new driver was on their way. After completing my trip with my second driver, I noticed that I had also been charged for the cancelled trip with the 1st driver ($30). I reached out to uber multiple times with the same response - I would not be refunded because it was against their policy. I received very little information as to what this policy was. The customer service has ignored my latest message, and I have still received no refund. This is not the first time that I have experienced a lack of response from Uber’s customer service, as well as a lack of a refund for similar experiences.

I have been using uber for years, but with so many similar issues occurring, I will be looking into other options. I am disappointed at their current regression.
title: Bad Customer Service

review:
Every time I take a ride Uber charges me an additional $189 due to a “glitch” in their system that happened over a year ago. I’ve had to contact them 3x’s regarding the over charge and every single time they remove the charge from my card but for some reason it still continues to happen.  
This is beyond frustrating to contact their customer service. Sure I get a response fairly quickly that says they’re looking into the matter but then it takes another 5+ days for someone to respond and in most cases I need to reach out to them again to follow up. 
The app itself is fairly easy to use but having to contact them EVERY TIME I take a ride is absolutely ridiculous and is getting very old. Not to mention it takes weeks to resolve. 
I’ve downloaded Lyft and plan on giving them a try for my next ride. Hopefully I have better luck with them.
title: Uber system “glitch” Beyond Frustrating

review: That’s basically what it is. Drivers numerous times chats with me negotiating higher fares and after I tell them no, they go around the blocks and then cancel. Next thing Uber is charging me for not showing up. I have events recorded in camera of our chats and their merry ride show. While Review/Help Department knows about this Uber still send me a bill saying I just pay the 5 in cash the next time before I can hail the next ride. But what do I expect ? I’m also a victim of Uber’s Customer reviews. I used to drive for Uber. I was terminated in 2000. With no clear and definite disclosure as to what was the complaint. Uber basically shut me off without recourse to rebuttal and make a counter claim because I was never told what was exactly the reason to deactivating my driver profile. It’s been 2 years not driving because of this unfair treatment. Please review and reactivate my account. If I do some wrong I need to know what it is exactly I did so I can straight the situation.
title: Uber Accessory Helping Drivers Skimming Cash
developerResponse: {'id': 32608152, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here:\xa0https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-10-17T06:37:45Z'}

review: I have beeen using Uber for more than 5 years now as I travel a lot …experience changers from driver to driver and I understand that but what I realized lately is the customer service and attention to customer has declined drastically…they used to really care if you forget /lost something in the car, if you had a bad experience with a driver etc…nowadays especially with the congestion and need in Miami Beach,I think Uber gives everyone the right to be their driver..some of these people literally belong to a cartel or something ,so scary,so rude and harassing almost…and when you reach out to UBER , No resolution or an effort to compensate you in anyway ,shape or form..Terrible customer service lately so I switched to LYFT even though I think Uber has a better application software,the service is not there anymore …I was a loyal customer for so long and I just had too many bad experiences lately..unfortunate
title: Terrible customer service..Uber totally changed in 5 years…they just don’t care anymore

review: FIVE Days in advance, I requested a nicer/newer Uber ride to take our party of 3 to a high-end restaurant to celebrate a Graduation. The restaurant is very clear on their website that they will only hold your reservation for 5 Minutes! So about 20 minutes in advance of our scheduled pick-up time we started getting notices that our driver was on his way. Great! He’s 15….10….5 minutes away. Great! We all put our coats on and picked up our keys… Only the next message from the Uber App says “Our Driver is completing ANOTHER ride and will be with us in 23 minutes!?!? Wait! What?? Now that he picked up another rider, we’re going to be OVER 20 minutes late for our DINNER reservation!? NOT COOL! So we HAD to cancel; HAD to pick someone to be Designated Driver and not enjoy wine with dinner and HAD to pay $5 “Cancelation fee” for our driver’s time!?!? I don’t know if the screw-up is with the Uber App?? Or with the Driver? But either way, NOT GOOD!
title: Very disappointed AND charged $5!!

review: At first I really liked Uber, but I’m starting to realize it’s a scam it’s like I have to order my ride and get out the house hours early just so I won’t be charged 3x the originally price. I live 5 mins away from my job when I’m driving and 20-30 mins away if I’m walking depending on how fast I’m walking. My ride USED to be normally 5 dollars maybe $10 if it’s rush hour which is fine. But lately If it’s traffic or anything Uber is charging me $40,$30 just to get to where I gotta go on top of charging me that ridiculously price I’m waiting 20-25 mins JUST TO EVEN GET PICKED UPED! I feel like they are taking advantage of there riders just cause they know we will pay for it 🤷🏽‍♀️ we have no other choice. I’m really starting to stray away from Uber and I’m liking Lyft more better their drivers are more professional I’m getting to where I have to go on time at a decent price and it’s just all around better to me and I don’t think I will be using Uber anymore 💯 big scam 100% would not recommend
title: Scam

review: Once upon a time, I loved Uber, used it constantly but now I am 100% a Lyft user, let me explain why ... one evening we got an uber very late, I wasn’t feeling well, hadn’t even consumed alcohol but felt ill. The driver was convinced I was going to get sick, to which I suggested he pull over and I would get a different ride, he refused! We safely made it home, however the next morning I was charged for “throwing up” in his vehicle. First and foremost, I didn’t get sick. Secondly, I reached out to uber to which they responded with photos of what looked like water stains? - what happened here was the driver was tired of driving, took advantage of my illness, wouldn’t pull over so I could get a different ride, and then I was charged the most you can get charged for a cleaning fee. Just because you have my card info does not allow you the right to charge me, this is stealing in fact. I immediately deleted the app as this is not only terrible customer service, but also completely wrong. DO NOT USE UBER! If I could give them negative stars I would.
title: Awful

review: So a couple years back I got stranded on the highway, the driver claimed to be at my location and wasn’t. As I reached out to the driver to give my location it was not the person on the app nor was the car to pick me and my 3 other passengers big enough for us all to get in. Well of course I was charged a cancellation fee because the driver wasn’t the driver on the app. Now 4 years later I can’t use my account or my Uber cash but something keeps taking from my $50 Uber cash balance. Make it make sense. I’m not paying for services not rendered and the wrong car sent to me. I ordered a suv and got a car. I’m not paying to be cramped up and the driver had no room in the trunk. Then the nerve to say just leave your stuff in the car. Um in what life.. we all go and we all stay. Driver takes a minute before pulling off. Which I knew they caught the cancellation fee for me not going. I sent my complaint in to explain I ordered a suv and a car pulls upz
title: Trying to charge for unsafe ride

review:
Uber used to be great. Multiple cars in the area ready for pickup within 5 minutes no matter where I was. This time, it took 20 min to get one at the airport! Then the driver canceled after 5 min, which is happening more often probably because the driver figures that they could make more money with another fare. I switched to Lyft which is a little better.

7-7-23 update: I’m kicking myself for using uber again. When I reserved the ride, the estimated cost was $85, but when the ride was done I was charged $126 with no recourse other than trying to sit on hold with their customer service hoping they would refund me. Also, I ordered an uber XL (6 people with luggage) for my return trip, the largest they have and was told by the driver that I have to choose uber XL Black in order to fit my 3 small kids, wife and myself with 3 bags. When he couldn’t take me, I was charged $5 even though he didn’t take us! Burned too many times.
title: Uber declining and getting too expensive

review: $45 for a 21 minute ride??? Lately (the last 2-3 months) these prices have been absolutely absurd! I was hoping things would calm down by now before leaving a review because I’ve had no issues with Uber in the past. Outside of the occasional rude driver that is. Now, i can no longer sit back and be ok with this. There’s no justification for it. Inflation? Whatever! The same ride cost me $17-$28 at the beginning of the year. I know gas has gone up as well as other demands but this type of increase is just ridiculous. There’s no way this should be allowed. Whoever I can complain to about this I WILL. I’ll be sure to have enough ppl (trust me I will get a good following with me on this) to hop aboard with me because this is there is no way this type of increase should be allowed. I’m all for making a profit. Especially during hard times but certain things will not be tolerated and this is one of them.
title: Just ridiculous

review: I’ve had a few experiences with uber and a couple were okay but a few were not. The only ride on my account my uber driver made me extremely uncomfortable. He took off mask in the car and asked how old I was (I’m an 18 year old girl). He asked if I had a boyfriend and then at some points in the ride he talked about how he would treat me if he was “my lover.” Really weird and creeped me out. The rides my boyfriend called for me on his account were okay except for two. One driver was texting on his phone a lot which made me feel unsafe and another’s phone “lost service” (mine was fine) and pulled over on the side of a highway which made me nervous for my safety. The upgraded ubers are alright because they’re safe but I don’t feel safe in the regular ones. Despite this, I tried to schedule an uber to the airport for my flight home tomorrow and it won’t let me. Safe to say I’ll be using lyft tomorrow and hopefully it’ll be safer and easier.
title: Never using uber again, I don’t recommend anyone does

review:
Pre-Booked an Uber 24 hours in advance to the airport for an early flight. They gave me a 10 min window for a driver to show. No driver came or even connected for my ride. I cancelled it and tried to hail one the regular way and still nothing. Ultimately had to drive my own car to the airport or risk missing my flight and had to pay the daily parking fee.

Recommendation: don’t expect Uber to honor a pre-booked ride. Pony up and pay for a legitimate service that can guarantee a timely pick up, like an airport shuttle. Uber is at the mercy of driver availability and has no obligation to abide by your plans. They didn’t charge me for the cancelled booking, but I almost missed my flight waiting for their driver.

Used the app for years and general use is rarely a problem. This advice is for more time sensitive plans
title: Early Morning Flights

review:
It’s getting ridiculous how long waits are becoming. I have not had a good experience for over a month but since Uber forced other taxi companies to close I have no other option but to wait 
One was few weeks ago when I was wait for an hour to connect with a driver when I said one was 7 minutes away from me but it stayed like that for hour till a nj transit cop said I had to leave or get ticket for loitering so I wake 3 miles home in snow 
And then today twice once going to work I waited 45 minutes for a Uber the after work it connected me to someone who was coming from the Edison area and I’m in Hamilton a hour away from there either I wanna talk to representative or someone cause this shouldn’t be. And drivers shouldn’t be able to discriminate against you because your male or female Ive had conversations with drivers of them saying they usually expect dudes like that but this was my last call. Y’all need to do something cause if not you deserve to get punched in the face
title: Y’all can’t meet the demand anymore

review:
Losing the rewards was a mistake. There is no incentive to stick around considering the false estimates, and constant price hikes (once a ride that usually cost $8 was estimating to cost $32 because of a light sprinkle of rain. I just walked)   Also many times trying to get home from work they just randomly triple , or even close to quadruple, the cost (usually $30-$35 max ended up estimating $119) when it wasn’t a typical rush hour or even “bad weather” related.  Even if it was super busy that price is ridiculous. If I see it even hover above 40 bucks I’ll hail a yellow cab and still only have to pay the 30. 

Most drivers are nice enough. They tend to pull up on the wrong side of the road a lot but that’s not the biggest deal.  I can maybe name a handful of unpleasant trips but mostly because certain services that cost extra weren’t delivered, like paying for the comfort and getting a small cramped car. Or dishing out extra for the pet friendly drivers to the vet and the driver canceling because they don’t take pets. 

The list can go on, but ultimately the only thing really keeping me was the points to sometimes get 10% off a ride or whatever. Without it, I’m even considering quitting uber eats because of their own price hikes with delivery.  

Be better again, Uber. What happened to make you so bad now?
title: Considering a new service

review: The latest versions of the Uber App contain a major bug that is not only inconvenient, but could be extremely costly and dangerous for blind and visually impaired users who utilize the Voiceover Screen reader. If I try to search for a destination such as McDonalds, obviously more than one location shows up. It is no longer possible to see the addresses of each result. Rather, each result simply states the business name, in this case, McDonalds. It goes without saying that this is completely unacceptable. People in this situation have no idea of the address they have selected, and could get brought to the wrong location. This needs to be fixed Asap, so that the address of each search result is read by Voiceover, like it was up until very recently. Issues like this should not happen. Do better Uber, and test new versions of your App for accessibility before they are released. That's not too much to ask.
title: Latest updates introduce major bug for users of Voiceover

review: I've been trying to order food literally all day but it keeps giving me an error when i put in my card. I've ubered before using apple pay and never had problems. So I downloaded the UberEats app to try to use apple pay, but it was the same error. I called customer service for help and they told me to uninstall and reinstall the app. i already did that but i did it again anyway. i even waited an hour like the guy told me too, still didn't work. I called again and the lady told me my card was declined because of my bank? which i knew wasn't true because i had already tried with multiple different cards from different banks. but i try what she tells me anyway and sit on hold with my bank for an hour. And just like I thought it had literally nothing to do with my bank. It's been about 4 hours now since I first made my order. I just want my food man, im really hungry out here. 😔
title: Terrible help and awful customer service. I'm still really hungry 😔

review: This was my first time using Uber and my last time. The whole thing with the driver was super weird. It started out fine, he greeted us and helped with our bags. After getting us loaded I think his knowledge of English went out the door. We tried the best we could to understand what he was saying, he showed us his phone and it wasn’t in English either. He pulls us into the next hotel that wasn’t but about 500 ft away. Again he tries to speak to us but not in English. It then calls someone on the phone and they are both speaking in another language. He takes us back to our hotel and starts trying to speak again and show us his phone. We then decided to just cancel the ride because it was too weird and we knew he could speak English from him greeting us and helping load the bags. As I thought about it, this was probably his way of canceling the trip because he didn’t want to take us to the airport that was 30 minutes away.
title: Horrible experience

review: I have not had issues with Uber before until recently. Apparently I was signed up for UberPass back in November 2020 at a rate of $24/month and was charged for 4 months. However, I have never used Uber in October, November, December or January 2021 at all for transportation. I only found out recently because it was my mother’s credit card being charged when my credit card is the primary mode of payment. I reached out on the app, but was not helpful in resolving this issue. The agent did mention that they were trying to solve this issue as multiple customers experienced this too, but never reimbursed me for a subscription I never signed up for or used. I DON’T RECOMMEND UBER OR UBER EATS FOR THIS REASON. BEWARE OF FRAUDULENT CHARGES. Before this issue, I had no problem with the apps and have preferred it over other competitors. However, the lack of help regarding my issue has swayed me elsewhere and will ensure friends/family to use other means if this doesn’t get resolved.
title: BEWARE OF FRAUDULENT SUBSCRIPTION CHARGES

review: Im a student in high-school i have very little money because i cant work for medical reasons. I have a debit card with money on it and i wanted to get a ride home early while feeling sick and having a migraine.  Uber wont let me verify my account i don't have a license with me because I'm AT SCHOOL and have no need for it because i don't drive.  It wouldn’t let me verify myself through my card either which means obviously i can get a ride home to take my meds the doctor gave me.  I find this app to never work and its stupid and useless how i cant get a ride home with no troubles like advertised.  I even tried connecting to support and the app AND WEBSITE completely kicked me off.  I think if im willing to pay someone to drive me home there should be no issue.  I shouldn’t have to sit here and suffer because the app cant identify me so i can go home. There’s no reason for this to be an issue. And im done using the app if this is going to keep happening to me.
title: Wont work and useless for me

review: I was lost walking and in distress while visiting a city I do not live in. My friend ordered me an Uber to try and get me to a safe place. The eta was 4 minutes. I waited over half an hour on the street. The driver picked up someone else, even though my friend told him I was in dire need of help. I called and asked when he was coming, he said two minutes. But then I asked where he was going to pick me up, and he said “I don’t know.” He was giving me the eta when he didn’t even have a destination. I was lied to and abandoned. I ended up just walking over a mile until I could get somewhere to meet my friend. He never came. I tried to call Uber, and they took no disciplinary action against him. He is still driving, doing and saying whatever he pleases, without consequence. I am lucky that I made it back to the hotel. Uber put me in danger by telling me to wait on the street, and they do not care. They do not enforce safety standards. This is not a safe app to use.
title: Abandoned in a strange city

review: I never write bad reviews, but Uber in boston is the equivalent of walking. Has me requesting a ride for 20 minutes until it cancels because there are “no drivers”. I paid $20 for uber plus but it’s useless because there are never any drivers. If uber paid their drivers more than a fraction of the cost of the ride then this wouldn’t be an issue. Do better. They also “increase pricing due to demand” and say it goes to drivers, but asking drivers what they make off of a $20 ride can be as low as $5. During the recent new york subway shooting they raised prices to where a 10 minute ride would have been $100+. they try and backtrack but it’s useless, literal price gouging off of people in danger is not okay. They say drivers can make $25+ an hour but every driver i’ve met makes barely minimum wage. This company is a disgrace to their workers and needs to do better. Their competition isn’t great, but much better price wise and treating their employees. avoid if you can
title: horrible

review:
1) Acceptance calculations only ‘works’ for rejected rides. Counts of accepted rides does not go up
2) 3rd party ride arrangers (hospital. rental car..) rides = zero tip 100% of times; not fair since the riders don’t have ‘skin’ in the game. Also how should we rate the rider if it was arranged by a 3rd party
3) The idea of drivers providing an instant rating for the riders is not fair. After providing an excellent service and not getting a tip, how should we rate that without knowing 
4) When using destination and long pickup is accepted (> 6 miles) a long pickup fee for distance and time is not added which is wrong. Driver is still driving a long distance to the rider even if it is on my way home or when I try to reach a busier area
5) There should be an overall option for the driver to select how far he/she is willing to drive for a given ride as a maximum so proposed drives will not result as rejected
6) The popup screen with proposed rides has small font size for crucial ride/distance information and should be bigger so it can be read
7) Customer service is biggest waste of time, nothing gets accomplished 
8) when a ride reaches the destination and the vehicle stops, maybe don’t send new ride proposal popups since the driver might be unloading luggages or helping the riders get out
title: Developers and testers should ride along with actual uber drivers

review: I had to re-download this app (deleted a couple years ago because the prices got to high). Lyft was not getting any drivers and it was 40 degrees outside. Uber said it had a drive that would be there in 12 minutes! Score! Not really. I canceled my Lyft request and Uber went from 12 to 8 back to 12 to 9 to 11 to 12 and finally to 8, 6 and the driver arrived. The driver was super friendly and awesome, however Uber definitely lies about wait times. What it said would take 12 minutes initially ended taking over 30 and it was pretty cold outside. Just deleted the app again because like I said in the title, use it “only if you have to”. I’ve only have to use Uber over Lyft once every couple years which isn’t awful. Uber just isn’t as affordable or reliable. I ended up spending $32 on Uber instead of $19 on Lyft when Lyft would have taken the same amount of time in the long run.
title: Only if you have to

review:
For the most part my Uber experience has mostly been good, i had 3 experiences that were ridiculous 
1.A driver claim to be a paster and was trying to convert me while driving ,blasting his religious music, turning to look at me while driving ,not paying attention to the road creepiest experience !!!
2.Driver pass me ,swing back to get me kept shouting at me when i was finally in his car. Would not stop carrying on that i met him at the wrong place when there is only one place i have pick ups for uber.
3.It was poring rain,the pavement was wet and slippery , i’m barely walking with my cane,Driver flashes pass me and parks ,i call him to come back and get him he refuses and tell me to come to the car, even when i explain to him i can’t, he still refuses. He caused a pain flair up ,i had to cancel drive.
So i got refunds for theses rides ,but these drivers are still out there and allowed to drive for uber & even tho they are at fault ,they are still allowed to impact our ratings!
title: A mix bag

review:
I have been using Uber for YEARS. I recently noticed double charging.  When you use Uber, you get an email and you can see your Uber trip history as well. As the daughter of a lawyer, I keep all the evidence. Meaning downloading  statements and doing screen shots. On March 4, I did cancel Uber and I happily paid the cancellation fee but Uber charged me two times for that cancellation fee. I only got ONE  email regarding the cancellation fee. The Uber app only showed ONE cancellation fee but my credit card showed TWO cancellation fees for the same amount.  I have the statements and screen shots and I get generic messages. They are not looking at the objective EVIDENCE. I have sent screenshots of everything and I get the same generic message.  I pay for  all my fees and cancellations but when they double charge it’s fraud. They don’t investigate nor look at the evidence you submit. Been using LYFT ever since.  It’s not about the money. It’s the principle. 
They don’t investigate. 
They don’t look at the evidence you submit. 
You get the same generic message over and over again. 
I will pay what I owe but I won’t pay for a fraudulent double charge. It’s that simple!! 
A dollar here and there adds up. Look at your bills!!  They are not looking at my evidence and asking me to double pay which I will not.
title: Uber double charging. Look at your bill carefully!!

review: Arriving at an airport at 9pm, I expected to just pull out my phone and find and Uber driver close by. After waiting for 20 minutes outside the airport, I get a notification that there are no available drivers nearby. I get that, it’s late and at least I tried. To avoid this mistake again, I booked an Uber ride 2 DAYS in advance to take me back to the airport. The morning of, my card was charged the fee for pickup/drop off. The app gave me a 10 minute time frame the driver would be there. After the 10 minutes were up, I get a notification that once again there were no available Uber drivers in my area. THEN DO NOT TAKE OUT MONEY UNTIL A DRIVER HAS CONFIRMED THEY WILL PICK ME UP. I ended up using the other very similar app to get me to my hotel and to the airport the entire trip. I would never recommend Uber to anyone. The other app (you know the one) is by far superior. I just hope I get my money back for the ride I was charged for and never got to take.
title: Very unhappy customer

review: Visiting Washington DC. Requested a car, got notification that it was 8 minutes away, then watched on the app as the driver headed toward my location then drove loops as my wait time increased to more than 18 minutes. Supposedly the driver was “dropping off another fare.” I canceled and requested a new ride. Same thing, except this time I tried calling the driver only to have HIM cancel the ride without answering the call. Uber reassigned me to another driver without my asking but then Uber canceled, assigned another driver, then canceled again. I missed my dinner reservation as I was trying to reach support (impossible—I think Uber support is a myth) and request another ride. I’ve used this app in the past and had bad experiences with cancelations and lateness, so avoided using it for nearly two years. I was encouraged to try Uber again because it had “improved.” Never again. Uber has permanently lost me as a customer. The only improvement I’ll believe is the dissolution of Uber.
title: Cancelations galore

review:
To be honest, there's a lot to appreciate about this app and its service offerings. Not only does it facilitate ride-sharing, but it also empowers individuals to create their own job opportunities and provides a platform for growth.

While some drivers might not always meet expectations, and occasional issues like missing items occur, it's commendable that Uber is open to feedback and responsive to customer concerns. I appreciate the reliability of the service.

The only aspect that can be frustrating is when drivers take a while to cancel, or even cancel when they're nearby, potentially causing a chain reaction. Despite this occasional inconvenience, I've found that someone usually comes through to provide the service eventually. Given the competitive nature of the platform, it would be great to see more discounts available, even for less frequent users. Times can be tough, and having more affordable options would be appreciated.

In my experience, Uber lives up to its purpose. For these reasons, I'm giving them a 5⭐️ rating. I hope this review proves helpful. Have a wonderful day, everyone! 👍
title: The platform of which is: Uber

review: When we had our vehicle break down when we were driving kids to school one morning we had to call an Uber to help us finish delivering our children to 3 different schools and then they helped shuttle us over to drop off our broken down car to the auto repair shop, and finally home…. I was terrified to see the final results of the bill but it was surprisingly not that bad!!!! We actually could AFFORD it!! After ALLL that running around we only managed to pay $55 and that included the drivers tip! And I did not mention that the driver was super kind and patient with our kids and our whole situation. I would definitely use them again and refer them to family and friends!
title: Extremely helpful

review:
Recently decided to use a rideshare for getting in and out of Boston on a Saturday night as we would be drinking at a function. We live in the suburbs about 25 miles West of the city

Ride in was quick and very reasonable. No problem getting a driver. However when it was time to leave around 11pm we found it difficult to schedule a ride even though there were numerous drivers in the area. The problem was that nobody wanted to take the fare because the likelihood of them getting a passenger for the ride back to Boston after dropping us off around 11:30pm was very unlikely. We tried multiple services and had the same issue.

Thankfully we got a driver to take the fare and he was great. He also explained the issue to us which I have shared here so beware
title: Dicey late night option

review:
My Sw plane landed at about 11:50 p.m. on November 28. Since I did not know if plane would be late, how long it would take for a bathroom stop or how long my it would take to get my luggage I did not make a reservation in advance. When I stepped outside the Southwest terminal to make a reservation & it was already very early on November 29 your system would not accept plane already had arrived, or November 28 date & flight number. Had to return to inside of terminal to flight information help to assist me. Finally able to book an Uber but just car type appeared on my screen. License number disappeared & no name of driver. Luckily driver called out my name in waiting area. Experience was very unsettling in wee hours of the morning for an elderly woman traveling alone. Your computer program needs a tune up.
Sincerely,
Gennevieve Seletsky
title: Uber computer program needs fine tuning
developerResponse: {'id': 33467049, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest", 'modified': '2022-12-01T07:02:05Z'}

review: Since the pandemic my company has provided us with access to Uber to get workers to and from work as an alternative to using mass transit and it’s mostly been a positive experience. However, some drivers seem to give a low rating to passengers regardless of the experience. Since our company pays the cost for these commutes they don’t want us to include tips. I have tipped out of my own pocket for many of these trips but find my rating continues to drop, though I have done anything wrong that someone should rate me poorly. It’s a small thing but I feel it’s unfair for Uber to “rate” a paying customer. I don’t have my own car and I’ve been using Uber primarily out of necessity. Please change the rating system. Allow a customer a way to raise or better protect their rating against drivers who feel the need to degrade a user’s good standing.
title: Rating Rot

review: I used to really like Uber, but their prices for pre-booking in San Antonio are now double to triple what a normal trip costs. Pre-booking used to be the same price about two or three weeks ago. Uber claims it’s due to when “a lot of people in the same area are requesting rides at the same time.”  However, this doesn’t make sense since you’re pre-booking a trip and are not competing against the current market.  Plus, “now” trips are still the same price. I tried to discuss this with Uber support and proved the situation with screenshots (a trip at 0310 on a Monday was the same price as a trip at 1510 on a Sunday-about $40-but a current trip at 1210 on a Sunday was $15), but their responses seemed very automative and kept referring back to the lack in drivers.  I also couldn’t find the “call Uber” icon in the app so had a very difficult time getting in contact with them. Eventually used Messenger, but Uber needs to make real-person support more accessible.
title: Pre-booking price increase

review: Delete this app. It is horrible. The drivers are ableist. They refuse to serve people with service dogs or other service animals and they don’t have enough accommodation for people with wheelchairs. They also barely do background checks on their drivers and have hired MANY criminals, knowing full well they didn’t do background checks on any of them. There are also many racist uber drivers who refuse people just because they are mexican, black, ETC. If they do let them ride in their car, they call them slurs without caring because they know they won’t get fired or terminated by Uber. They don’t care about their customers, they expose them to many dangers, and discrimination from their drivers and the customer service keeps making up excuses that they are “working on it” when people confront them with these claims. NEVER use this app unless you want to be verbally assaulted or discriminated against because of your disability.
title: Ableist, Discriminatory, Racist and Criminal Drivers.

review: Augustine drove me and my companion from Dallas airport to whataburger then to our hotel. That was kind of him.  We got to the hotel and got out bags and went into the hotel. Walked around for a while then went to check in. At my turn I noticed I didn’t have my wallet. Nope no check in for me. We were able to get ahold of him thru the app and told him what had happened. He found my wallet, took a picture of it  and let me know he was on a job headed  across town and would be a while but would let me know when he got back in the area.  Yes he did exactly that and had the wallet in his front seat when he arrived back to give it to me.   Thank you again Augustine. I’m very grateful for you time and trustworthyness.
title: Augustine a driver in Dallas

review: was calling customer service due to a very bad glitch on their own app gets paired with the worst customer service person ever where they didnt know what they were talking about was literally no help what so ever kept repeating things even though i explained everything in more then enough complete detail they also kept hanging up on me (also not the first time this has happened as well where they kept hanging up on me repeatedly) when the app was being super buggy they refused to help me any further let alone at all and just seems uber themselves just kept protectng this employee who was clearly not cut out for customer service let alone any form of customer service and in my opinion they honestly should be fired in all honesty otherwise leaving this as a 1 star review until uber can fix this issue at hand and preferably fire the employee in question is more then willing to change this review into a more positive one if uber themselves can fix this issue properly along with preferably firing the employee in question if they can also do that as like i said this person in paticular should not be working in this line of customer service let alone any form of customer service at all and its honestly a shame uber is willing to protect even the lowest of their employees who were in the wrong to begin with as is
title: they’ll hire anyone for customer service

review: Mixed feelings about Uber, it’s a safe way to take transportation, kind of. As a female passenger a few of the drivers can be irresponsible, rude or straight up creepy. One driver acted high and made weird jokes towards me, he got seemingly upset when he realized that I had got the Uber share and someone else was going to carpool with us. As soon as the man got in the car, the driver acted completely different and more mature, but once the shared rider was dropped off, the driver acted weird again. I’ve also had quite a few drivers drive irresponsibly and close to crashing and trying to play it off as the other persons fault. On top of that Uber seems to get more expensive each time you use it. A ride to work for me used to be $17 but has now gone up to $35. Wish I could rate it 2.5 down the middle because of the pros/cons that Uber has.
title: Uber is okay but

review: Hands down the worst experience with an app I’ve ever had. In the middle of a vacation and all the sudden they have issues processing my payment methods and are blaming it on my bank, which I’ve spoken to twice and am assured there is no issue on their end, it’s on Ubers. I have had 4 email threads going and 6 chat threads and they have horrible organization. The customer service portion of the app is so full of bugs I cannot see my responses, and have to close and reopen every time they respond just to see them. All after deleting and reinstalling the app. 2 hours now and I have had zero progress resolving the issue. Repeatedly ending my chats due to not receiving responses, because their app is so bugged! NEVER again will I use this service. Astounding how much lack of communication between there support staff on this issue. I’ve had to re-explain the issue to half a dozen people at this point and they’re talking in circles.
title: Horrible Customer Service

review: I was heading to a restaurant with some friends of which 1 of them brought a drink with them. A little bit of the drink spilled onto the drivers backseat. As i went to check my account to see how much the ride was the total came out to $167. Come to find out I was charged with $150 cleaning fee for a spill that was a simple fix (as the picture showed). Uber and the driver accused us riding that it was a “Major Cleaning and/or Bodily Fluid Fee”. It was the maximum cleaning charge you can have. I have tried to reason with customer support for days to no avail. They have responded with automated messages that are no help to you. If you are thinking about downloading this app or already have it installed I ask of you to be cautious. All it takes is one bad driver to over-charge you and then you are stuck with a ridiculous charge and having to deal with customer service that does not care about your business or your hard earned money.
title: BE CAUTIOUS!!!! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

review: I use this app daily and it’s pretty good the only issue is that when I schedule a ride the Uber driver gets it and I’m still getting ready so they get to my house ten to 15 minutes early and then I get charged for their wait time. That really makes me mad because if I schedule a ride at a later time and the driver get there early why and I getting charged for their wait time that is not my fault it is the fact that Uber send the scheduled rides too early and the driver don’t check it’s not fair to those of us who use Uber everyday and we credible rides so we aren’t late to work. We shouldn’t be getting charged if it’s before our scheduled time pickup. For example today I scheduled a 9:35 pickup time but the driver came at 9:23 so I was still getting ready and I was charged for the time. I’m not happy about that
title: Used daily
userName: why cant i uae my name

review: In the most recent update, they no longer show how long wait times are, so it’s now even more of a complete guess when your ride will arrive, because even previously the wait times would change between the second of seeing the wait and booking a ride. It also took three times of attempting a ride before getting the message of no drivers being available before I had to give up and get a Lyft. I was charged first before I could even get a ride each time, so I just have to hope those $30 charges are refunded because I never got to get what I paid for. I’ve been using this app over 6 months consecutively, and it’s been worsening since then. The only good part without a hassle is the rewards tier system, which will occasionally get you a free ride if you’re a frequent user of the app. Other than that, not so much worth it, I’m likely to cancel my subscription and start looking at other apps to use for transport.
title: Recent and gradual changes have made it worse.

review: Hi! Thank you for building a great app for us travelers to find a ride to wherever we want. A quick feedback I have is about the star-rating system for both driver and rider. I don’t think a 5 star scale is a helpful or necessary metrics when it comes to rider and driver relationship, sometimes some riders may not necessarily know how to rate (thinking 1 star rating is the best rating for example), or just don’t treat the rating seriously. And when a “bad rating” brings down the overall rating, people wonder what has happened with the driver/rider when nothing really happened before. I think simply a list of comments about the driver/rider instead of a 5 points system would be sufficient!
title: App improvement suggestion

review:
We were immersed walking around Las Ramblas. Having dinner at midnight followed with gelatos at 1 am. Going home, we didn’t know that the metro (subway) closed at midnight. Therefore, we had to take an Uber back to our hotel. 
The wait was longer since it was the only option aside from the taxis. When we finally got assigned a ride, it was fairly quick.
This is my initial use of Uber and I am very pleased with the driver assigned to us. Even though his English language was limited, he still made the attempt to communicate. He was very informative with the city when I used google translate. Very nice person and very careful driver according to my wife. He reminded us to buckle our seatbelts. His name is Jose Maria. Thank you!
title: Anniversary trip to Barcelona

review: I’m in an area I don’t know and am not to comfortable in. Ordered Uber to go to connivence store, can’t order there and back, got in, asked if he could bring me back. Yes he says. We pull up to first store, ummmmmm, super shady, I’m nervous, shady areas, please watch and don’t leave, this driver was so amazing. First store was closed, he found one that was open, brought me there, waited and brought back to hotel. Tipped very well, twice, only to find out that they don’t get the 100% tip! Is this real??! If it is, I will make sure I always have cash on me to give to them! My driver was super fantastic and I wish he was around where I actually live!! Thank you Marcelo, for making me feel comfortable and at ease, and getting me from and back!!
title: Driver Marcelo

review:
A Uber driver from NY, Leo (Toyota Sienna KXB4403) arrived this morning in Nantucket to take us to the airport. Upon arriving early, this borderline crazy driver told US to hurry up because HE needed to go to the bathroom. Again, HE arrived early. He proceeded to block our neighbors driveway and refused to move, not allowing her out of her own driveway. After my wife locked up the house and fearing we would miss our flight, I reluctantly told her to just get in, only to have this driver say he wouldn't take ME and then screeched away with our luggage. When he noticed he stopped and told my wife only to get in the car. Fortunately another Uber driver taking our friends witnessed the whole thing and allowed us to pile in her car, narrowly getting us all to the airport on time. This irritable, crazy man is unfit to drive for any service. 
Please advise how this circumstance will be addressed with this driver and if Uber is planning to do anything to apologize for this most unfortunate incident.
title: Horrifying experience

review: My roommate has been successfully driving Lyft for a couple of years. A friend of hers referred her to Uber and encouraged her to join as an alternative so that she could use whichever app was busier than given moment. Uber promised that friend of hers a big bonus, $750, if she completed a certain amount of rides in the first 30 Days she drove for Uber. They also promised her a nice bonus if she could complete these rides. She did so, and Uber refused to honor either her bonus or the bonus for the person who referred her, because she began the process of setting up as an Uber driver a few months ago but never completed it. In other words they knew she was in eligible for the bonus but still offered it to her and like Lucy in the peanuts with the football yanked it away from her. These people are scum they don’t keep their word.I strongly suggest that you don’t use Uber to get rides and I cannot suggest strongly enough that you don’t count on Uber as a driver.
title: They Screw Their Drivers

review:
The app set the language the same as your phone settings. If you want to change it, you need to change the setting of you phone. Why you want to decide what language I want to use?
The receipts are also sent in the same language the time you took the ride, which I didn’t know when I requested the receipts. I need my receipts in English so I can reimburse them but there is no way I can find help on that. They don’t even have a phone number for help. All you can find are a couple of buttons in help explaining simple stuff you don’t even need to google the solution. If you have your trouble, you don’t get help from a real person. What a nice experience!
I just uninstalled and would never use it again. BTW, the Uber Eats are ridiculously expensive as well. You want to buy a couple of coffee plus a sandwich from Starbucks a mile away, you wait half an hour and pay 50% more. Jesus Christ!
title: No language changes and no contact if you need help

review: Ride service is fine a bunch of the time but beware of having to deal with customer service. There is no phone number to call and if you do need to contact Uber, be prepared to wait. I had to deal with a fraud issue that somehow happened through uber in there messaging customer service portal. Took over 24 hours initially to get a response and each time we exchanged messages it was a different agent and over days I have yet to get anything resolved. Fortunately my bank is handling things well in the absence of actual help from Uber. If I could give Uber negative stars for their customer service I would. As someone that worked in customer service and call centers for years, I would have to say this is the worst I have ever encountered ever. I’d normally be patient and understanding but my patience has been exhausted after having to tell Uber multiple times to stop letting someone fraudulently use my personal info.
title: Customer service nightmare

review: I used Uber from the beginning and always loved it. Then I moved from Boston to SF Bay Area and noticed my ride requests would always get canceled as the driver got close making me late to everything. I learned they changed the format so the driver can see your destination as they are approaching which is why my rides always get canceled when they are 1 min away. Only works for the airport which is 20 miles away. I think if your driver has a history of canceling short rides, on our end we should at least get notice that they are a ride canceler so we can cancel and get a different driver rather than lose precious time waiting for a ride only to lose it last minute.
title: Impossible to get a ride anymore

review: It’s been two response trying to reach out to anyone to help me pay a 45 cent tab. I’ve email response and sent screen shots I wish I could show and no one can figure out the issue. I’m so disappointed and definitely losing my business. It’s going in circles speaking to agents me re-sending screen shots and no one can help me. It’s so unfortunate and a pain repeating myself over and over. 2 months.. added all my cards to pay off 45 cents from a bill years ago. Makes no sense. Even connected pay pal.. UBER needs new agents and relook at all the archived messages. I never post anything like this nor Yelp. I’m deleting this app and hope UBER can reflect on this. And reads this because I still have all the screen shots from emails and archived messages. No one is responding to my messages anymore… and I’m burnt out giving them all the details I have to help them fix this problem… if I could they deserve NO STARS.
title: No help from senior management..

review:
When I use the suggested tip option, many times it charges the tip differently than the percentage I clicked. For work, I am only reimbursed on tips 15% or less. My travel claim got sent back to me on my most recent trip because the tip on the receipt was larger than 15%. It was close (like 10 cents off), but still greater than 15%. I checked my other ride, and the tip was actually less than 15% (by 71 cents). Im not really sure what is happening, but I am not going to use the suggested tip option anymore. I will have to calculate the tip manually on work trips until this issue is resolved.  

Other than this the app is fine, I am just writing a review to provide feedback to the developers (tried to report through the app/developer website but I couldn’t find the correct location). This issue only came to my attention because I have had two travel claims returned to me because the tip was larger than 15%.
title: Errors with Suggested Tip Percentages

review: I requested a ride and the driver started the ride in the app about 5 blocks away from picking us up. Maybe an honest mistake but the app let him do it! Then he lost our pickup location because we were supposedly “picked up” and started driving all over trying to find us while the app thought we were with him. He called and held me on the line,  and I tried to tell him where we were but his English wasn’t great so there was difficulty communicating. When I saw him on the app driving away from me for the third time and I realized it was hopeless I canceled the ride and then Uber charged me for it!!! I even got a cancellation fee!! Oh man what a disaster. Then good luck trying to get help through the app as the help paths are incredibly limited as if nothing outside of what they specify could ever possibly go wrong, so who knows how long this will take to iron out. Made me almost miss my flight.
title: Critical flaw allows driver to start the ride before the ever pick you up.

review: I am new to uber and used it twice to get to work and back home on saturday. worked fine and everything was great. but then on sunday i went to buy some food on uber eats and none of my payment options were working and it wouldn't let me add my card. naturally i went to the support chat and everything was helpful until they sent me to the specialized team for more help. after 30 min of waiting for them and a total of one hour of waiting from my original chat they finally answered just to let me know they were disabling my account for not following their terms and conditions. i asked them to explain what i did wrong since i was originally just asking why my payments weren't going through but they answered again with they were disabling it for longer because of fraudulent activity. DO NOT USE !!! the customer service is TERRIBLE and they may end up deactivating your account for NO REASON!!
title: Terrible customer service

review: The uber interface is filled with bugs and glitches. One of which wouldn’t allow me to contact my, me and my family were being picked up from hollywood park at disney land. However the app would not allow to call or text my driver before being picked up so we could inform him of where he needed to pick us up at. Along with that we’ve had several problems with the customer service being unresponsive, not explaining certain charges, and allowing their driver to get away with ripping the customer off. They don’t even have a customer service contact number which is insane for a corporation as large as uber. The app can be solid at times but far too inconsistent. I would recommend trying lyft or even a taxi at this point. Uber please improve you customer service and app interface before you start losing business
title: Glitched and Unhelpful customer service

review: First of a glitch caused me to lose over 30 USD I called support and they said this is for drivers only this company could give a darn about its customers only it’s employees get a private line takes forever to be refunded and when they don’t show up and state they do you can’t even get refunded as fraud. Multiple times I told Uber drivers where I was they kept saying come here I am not coming to you. Wrong! This a service IDC if I am in the middle of a desert on a hot summer day I am not walking to you in the shade you serve me you have the right to refuse and thanks to this scummy company and this ridiculous excuse of an app I have run into a bazillion issues of well it doesn’t matter you still gotta pay seems this company is a commune except I am not a rich son of a gun you can squeeze I will be filing a lawsuit, sorry go learn law tech and business cuz this company is scum.
title: Scam Company Multiple Fraudulent Payments High Fees For No Show No Contact Number For Customer ETC

review: I have contacted the Uber Support on Twitter since last November. The Uber technical team *please* read this review and take this feedback into consideration in order to update your app. It is such an easy-to-understand feature and I have lost thousands of Uber credits because I cannot use them. As you know, Amex partners with Uber and issues monthly Uber credit for eligible cards. These Amex credits are supposed to expire at the end of the month in which they are issued. However, the current Uber app applies credit for rides/UberEats in a “predetermined” order and applied Uber Cash (which will never expire) first, and Amex credit (which expire first) the last. This is a BUG that needs to be fixed. And I have lost thousands of credit due to expiration and being unable to use them towards Rides/UberEats orders. It’s so stupid and companies like Uber cannot let this issue remain for so long. Stop using those outsourced support team who act like Bots!
title: The app has to be updated to allow Amex credits to be used

review:
Their deliveries are up and down. Lately I’ll have a item just missing with no communication, and by the time the delivery arrives the driver has no idea whats missing, they just hand it to you and speed off.

Most recently I made a grocery order, went outside at 2 minutes away to meet the driver. Then 1 minute, then they disappear off the app. No contact info, car info, eta nothing I panic and refresh it and it shows my order as “completed” even though it was not. I never  received a call or anything from my driver. I contacted uber support and all they say is “wait 15 minutes, its an app issue, we cant contact them.” I wait and receive nothing, start to ask questions and get a generic message about leaving a rating. It was very frustrating and the lackadaisical response from support sealed the deal.
title: Good to get around when needed, but support and app is lacking

review: Best Uber experience I’ve ever had!!! Don’t get me wrong this might have been the first Uber ride I have ever taken, but that’s the most important one right? It’s the one that makes you feel safe, the one that makes you want to come back for more. Not only did this Uber driver encourage me to keep using Ubers she made me feel safe. And above all that’s what you should be asking of your drivers. My driver her self deserves the best of condolences for her above and beyond effort for her trip today. Not only was I having a terrible day I had just suffered a loss. So for the brief half hour she made me forget about everything and connect on a personal level. Above 5-star performance! Are you
title: First Uber is the important Uber!

review:
I can barely remember life before Uber. It’s become an essential utility in my life. 

Years ago, living in London, I remember being horrified by the cost of getting a taxi. I was a reasonable well paid management consultant but taking a black can from Zone 1 to 2 at the end of an evening felt it hollowed me out. 

The technology behind Uber is great but I want to celebrate the customer service. When things go wrong, they do a pretty excellent job in making amends. Refunds are fast. There are few quibbles. 

In 8 years of use (I guess? Maybe more?) I once a tech problem where my receipts were going to my old employer. It was a bug in the expensify integration. This was the only time I struggled to fix something - and eventually got there with the help of someone at VP level who I contacted blindly on LinkedIn. It wasn’t perfect, but still , you often can’t fix problems like this at all with most companies . So Uber gets credit. 

It’s a great product. I know drivers may sometimes question whether it is “too cheap”, and that is another story. But as riders we can opt to tip more to help solve that. 

Uber, I love you.
title: A love letter to Uber

review:
I hate writing reviews, especially negative ones. HELP! Within the last couple weeks, I used Uber for a meal delivery. They charged my account, gave me an ETA, but never delivered the food. They never even acknowledged that they didn’t deliver the food or say that they were sorry. Now I notice a credit on my Uber account for the amount. Shouldn’t the credit go back to my payment source?

Then, the next week I ordered a ride. I was standing in front of my house when I ordered it. You can’t get much more ready than that! I got a confirmation and within two minutes I got another text stating that the driver canceled and they would get me another driver.

The second driver arrived promptly and was very nice. However, they charged me a five dollar fee for canceling the first ride. I’m not sure what’s up with that, but I can’t even find a place to ask for my money back. How do I get a credit on that five dollars? It was a bogus charge?
title: Uber - please read !

review: I ordered a grocery delivery order from the app (just a few snack items) and requested it be left at the door, no meet or door knock necessary. A few minutes before the order was due to be delivered I checked the app for an update and it said the order had been completed. So I went outside to find the groceries and they were not there. Spent an hour communicating with the service team via the chat (it is impossible to get someone on the phone) and they assured me the items were delivered because they could see via gps tracking that the driver showed up to my house. And based on that they told me I did not qualify for a refund. I spent $10 in fees/tips for a $25 grocery order that I never received and Uber has no care in the world. I’m going to have to dispute the charge to my credit card company to not pay for someone else to have my groceries. INFURIATING. use instacart and grub hub for food, NEVER UBER EATS. never.
title: driver stole my order, no refund issued

review:
I have been a frequent Uber user for the past couple of years, and I don’t know what happened to them, but the service is horrible now. I am currently living in Madrid and I’m not sure if it’s only a problem here, but wait times used to be literally 1-4 minutes, maximum 5 minutes since I live on a pretty central street in the city. For a couple of months now, you can’t find a driver for gods sake that does not take 20 minutes to get to your house and the worst part is that they ask you to cancel the trip halfway through. One time I waited about 40 minutes to get one, having to order about 8 different Ubers since they all canceled or didn’t move at all. Ended up taking a taxi from a different company. 

Also, multiple Uber drivers told me that they don’t take the trips in the city since traffic is bad and they don’t get paid well for those trips. Please fix this!
title: Horrible waiting times and being asked to cancel

review: I frequently have to utilize Ubers services and have never been the biggest fan. I guess I’m just not thrilled with paying a bunch of money to catch a ride with a random stranger with whom I have nothing in common with and zero topics seem like a good conversation starting point. But knight, Uber made it worth it. Amber was really laid back and we had plenty of things to discuss.  I wish I could request her to be my all of the time driver! I wasn’t uncomfortable in the least bit. Having been a bartender and hair stylist most of my life, I can talk to anyone, but I’ve come to learn there’s a huge difference between talking to them and enjoying the conversation. Tonight, I enjoyed my ride very much. Thank you Amber!
title: Best experience ever!

review: If I could give this a 0 stars I would. I have been using Uber for a while, but after this experience I have deleted the app and am now exclusively using Lyft. I ordered an Uber, as I approached the car, the driver locked his doors and drove away. I believe it was because I was going to NYC from Newark and he didn’t want to go to the city. From there I had to wait 10 minutes in 30 degrees outside. As I got my second Uber, I put my bags in the back and sat down in the back seat only to get completely soaked because the seat was wet. When I mentioned this to the driver, he ignored me. I had to sit soaked for 30 minutes and pay a $40 ride. When I brought this up to Uber support, they were “generous” enough to give me a $5 credit when I demanded a full refund on the entire ride. After 5 days of back on fourth with customer service, needless to say, I have deleted the app and will never be using them again...
title: Driver drove away, next driver I sat in a puddle

review:
In my area, rides are constantly unavailable. I repeatedly get the message that “there are no UberX drivers available,” even if I preschedule my trip in advance. I have had drivers cancel on me and ask me to leave their car because “they’re not driving that far” - after over 30 minutes of waiting for them. (I work 30 minutes from my house and rely on Uber to get home; this is a reoccurring theme with drivers this year.) 

When Uber DOES connect me with rides, they’re always 25+ minutes away. Recently, they connected me to a driver 57 minutes away from me! Needless to say, that driver cancelled too. 

Not only have rides decreased in availability, they have decreased in quality. I thought Lyft was low class, I literally am FEARFUL to get into some of these cars. It seems Uber will take anyone they can get with no regard for the safety and comfort of the women who use their app. 

I also believe Uber should allow you to select the gender of your driver. Sorry, some women are sick of the men driving on this app harassing us when we’re just trying to go to work or go home. The things that have been said to me could make a grown man’s skin crawl. Well, maybe not the grown men on this app, but an upstanding one with a moral compass perhaps. Two stars for the fact that it does get me to work and home, but it’s not what it used to be.
title: So much has changed.

review: I kept having trouble getting my payment to go through. I was always needing to go to work, so I’d just switch to Lyft and not worry about it. Finally after a few months I uninstalled the app and reinstalled it. No good. Tried support-who finally told me it wasn’t my payment that was the problem it was ME! I am banned from Uber after about 7 years for “violating their terms of service.” Yet after numerous attempts to speak to customer service no one can tell me why. They just keep saying they’ve talked to me already or this matter is closed. I have never been drunk in an Uber. I have never been rude to a driver. I have never threatened a driver. I have always worn a mask. After something like seven years using them, I am banned for no reason and no one will tel me why. So much for loyalty. Funny thing is-I was still using Uber Eats app. I wasn’t banned from that. That app is now deleted from my phone.
title: You cannot speak to a live representative

review:
I scheduled a ride last night for this morning. I get a message about 15 mins before my scheduled pick saying  the driver just got my ride and wouldn’t be there for 65 mins, which was obviously way to late. I called him and he confirmed that to be true. I ask him to cancel sinse it is so hard to cancel a scheduled ride with being charged. I tried twice and finally got someone that picked me up, but 15 mins later than my original time. 
This is the second time that a scheduled ride has extremely late this week.  It’s very concerning, if I need to catch a flight or like today have a medical procedure being late does not work. I have counted on Uber pre schedules rides for a long time and to have this start happening is very concerning.
title: 2nd ride that delayed or canceled on me

review: I was at Disney Springs and needed an Uber ride back to my hotel. The ride options were anywhere from $15 - $18. I selected a ride for $15 that was 4 mins away, received a notification from my credit card company that it went through, and waited for my car to come. The app seemed to be loading. It would go from driver to driver and never actually land on a car. Eventually the app “glitched,” kicked me out, and when I got back in, my ride was gone and the only available rides were $38 and greater. My friend needed a ride to a different hotel and the same thing happened to her. Needless to say, I was not happy about having to pay an additional $40 on top of the $15 I already paid but didn’t get a ride for. If it costs $15 for a ride, it should stay at $15. Luckily my driver was incredibly kind. But what the heck Uber?! I should’ve gotten a ride for the first price I paid.
title: Glitch

review:
I finally started taking Uber in Manhattan but after several trips decide to stop! Why?! Uber’s GPS yells the drivers to go up/down on the two highways, the way they do in Bombay or the Middle East, where the old cities were not built for fast car travel, but Manhattan was built on a grid for fast horses and horse-drawn carriages. Many avenues were a direct shoot. It was unfortunate that city planners have been ignorant and from other countries and made blockage at the diagonal B R O A D way so that has become dysfunctional. 
STILL depending on traffic time of the day and day of the week, moth and year, the quickest way up and down remains to be through the city streets in a zig zag. But now most of the drivers are not from Manhattan  don’t know it’s traffic patterns. Have no desire to learn, nor do dispatchers have any inclination or knowledge to brief them…they all rely on a less than perfect program and the dumbest one to boot — the Uber GPS for Manhattan🥹
title: Uber gps often out to lunch

review:
I’m new to my city and met a friend at a bar. In the app the address of that bar is wrong. In their app it is on a street not an avenue and the street number, while close is also wrong. So I was driven to a place that had literally nothing. I had to call a Lyft to get out of there.

Their help function is a joke. There’s no way to say that the address was wrong. The only option you have is “wrong drop off or pick up point”, which just leads you to a site saying that your price was fair. This is a joke. When you email them through the app, they blame the driver. Its not the drivers fault that you have the address wrong. The address on google and Apple Maps is correct. It is only your app that has the wrong one.

The customer service is a joke. Of course Uber outsourced customer service to India, just like every bigger company. My agent was almost incomprehensible because the background noises were insanely loud.

I will not drive with Uber again. Being dropped off at some random location is incredibly unsafe and the fact that you don’t have a chat option or any other fast avenue to fix issues like this quickly, is absolutely deterring.

On top of that my drivers car sounded like it was falling apart and he would not slow down for pedestrians in the road. Overall terrible experience.
title: Poor customer service and faulty directions

review: Easily the worst customer service provider. They also give horrible background checks and reviews on their own employees. They will allow anyone drive for them and it shows. I was robber by my own driver and they took hours to contact me back and left me with very little area to explain with the cops. Do to how long customer service took to help and what they did to try and help I was left with nothing because the cop said it’s too late. They trust these drivers word more then anyones even though they personally don’t know any of them. If I was you I’d go local or use a different app such as Lyft or so on and so forth. They may have the same system but cheaper rides and safer background checks. I promise you I had the worst ride of my life with Uber and simply would never do it again. I’m scared for life and would go into deeper detail but it’s too triggering. I want to make this clear…. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND IT’S SO CLEAR. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE.
title: Stolen Item.

review: Uber scheduled rides are now unaffordable and completely made up prices. I have literally tried to schedule a Uber for next day and last week the price was only $25 and is now near $50 for the same ride. I then decided to move from scheduling day before for rides to scheduling same day for a ride I needed. Scheduling day before determined that $50 was a price for a ride and when I decided to schedule same day the price dropped back to 25. FOR THE SAME TIME that was just saying the price was $50 day before trying to schedule. My destinations are under 10 miles unacceptable for prices that high. Especially when you pay for the Uber one membership. At this point public transportation has more perks. On top of the fact I have tried to get a ride and had near 7 drivers cancel where is the rider protections when this happens??? Literally end up stranded thinking Uber is reliable.
title: Scam

review: I never had an issue with uber. However, just a few days ago, someone from my county reported a driver for being creepy & making her super uncomfortable and they did NOTHING! They told her they would reach out to her within 1-3 business days and she never heard back. She has called back multiple times and now they’re telling her that the number she had called to make the report is only for drivers NOT for costumers. So they won’t even let her get an update & won’t transfer her anywhere like they did when she first reported it. And to top it all off this guy is STILL working for uber. After hearing this along with other stories I’m officially never using uber again. I can’t trust a company that refuses to help customers especially when a safety issue is reported. I’m not going to take a risk with a company that clearly does not care enough or have patience to help customers especially involving safety!!
title: No longer feel safe

review:
