I ordered food through Uber Eats via the Uber app and after waiting over an hour they changed my delivery time and then canceled it outright 5 minutes later. The owner of the pizzeria told me that Jennifer the driver was annoyed that the food was not ready yet and left the restaurant.  The owner then received notification that I canceled the order and I received an alert that they canceled the order. I had a house full of children and was forced to find a way to feed everyone at what was now a late hour.    

Uber Eats users beware as you will have no way to contact customer support on a canceled order and you have no recourse other than to try to find a new restaurant to cook your food which isn’t easy on a weekend for a large group.  All this on an order that I received an Uber coupon WOW30OFF.  Probably Uber’s way to scam and cheat clients after enticing them with a $30 voucher.  Never again and they have lost a client forever and I just deleted the app.
title: Food Order Canceled and No Reason Given

review: My husband and I turned our rental car in after arriving in San Francisco because we didn’t want to hassle with parking or driving in a big, unfamiliar city. We stayed in a location in walking distance of Pier 39 and walked to many locations on our “to do” list. There were things further out that we also wanted to experience, so we hired an Uber Driver to take us around. He had a few additional suggestions that we were excited to see. He took pictures for us and pointed out points of interest along our route. It was great, personalized and less expensive than taking group tours offered around town. This will be our plan from now on when visiting a large city.
title: Personal Tour Guide

review: Down and out?, Order a Uber! Friends can’t pick you up?, Order Uber and make a new friend with the driver! Girlfriend found you in bed with her mom?, while you’re arguing just order an Uber! First date going horrible?(secretly order a Uber) & Tell her you’re going to the bathroom, when’s she’s not looking run out side to your Uber!! You can Uber to work, and if you feel like leaving, tell your boss, someone stole your car out of the parking lot and the cops found it and you have to leave, What are you do? Call a mother loving Uber! No joke Any reason at all!! Ubers got your back and will get you to where you need to go! Don’t hesitate download it now and Ditch the broad while using Uber!!!!
title: Greatest thing since spray cheese

review: I have to say that many applications and services are always similar in type and they constantly push to become better but therefore become more expensive. Some food services for a delivery of two small meals for $40 is just outrageous. I congratulate Uber on giving many people jobs and trying to keep the cost of taxi transportation down. I’m sorry it has hurt other companies but there is no reason they couldn’t adapt. I wish Uber added a little more rewards to there program but I Understand. Don’t stretch it too far guys into many areas. Keep it simple. One suggestion maybe a program to help people get home safe from bars and restaurants?
title: Keeping up with the times

review: Uber app has been good for the most part  there have been a couple of glitches 1- ordered a top of the line large SUV, for a party of 4 with luggage   To my amazement a Prius shows up !!  We are all laughing and I’m a little embarrassed because I was the one who ordered it.  I asked the driver “ how is this car listed as a large SUV on the app?  He went into “ no speak English mode “  somehow we got all for of us and pelican cases into the car, but the car was literally sitting on the suspension bump stops.  Made it to the airport… 2- need a way to know exactly what kind of car I am ordering,  had a car show up that was a POC, 30 years old, And loud as heck and filthy, driver didn’t drive very safe  felt lucky that we didn’t get into an accident ….
title: Good but needs a little improvement

review: Twice it has happened to me that I made a reservation, and at the time of the reservation, they contacted me to let me know that they did not have someone for me. The very first time, it was early in the morning, on Long Island, and at the time of the appointment, they texted me. That the next driver would be here in 45 minutes. If you’re not familiar with Long Island traffic, that’s gridlock. I called in the Lyft, they came 30 minutes later and i wound up missing my plane at the airport, LGA, I had to Uber to JFK, pay the change flight charge, I went to the Delta club for a few hours, and then I had to take an Uber when I reach Florida to my destinations, it was included with everyone else flying on those lights. It wound up costing me around $950, and Uber told me after many repeated request, they are not responsible. F that.
title: you can make a future reservation, but they do not have to keep it.

review: Today I happen to take a screen shot of how much money I made up until 2pm. At 6pm today I received a notification from Uber stating I’d received an $8 tip from a week ago. This is normal. The customer can tip anytime. I checked my earnings wallet and I noticed the amount changed exactly $3 from when I took the screen shot earlier at 2pm. I called support and they had no explanation. Uber already takes 40-50% of the ride. They are being greedy and taking drivers tips too! Tips are for service. Drivers provide the service. Uber provides the customer. We drivers rely on the app to keep record of our earnings and pay us correctly. There is no way to be successful with Uber if you have to keep track of each ride and how much you were paid. I am disappointed at the greed of this company and the mistreatment of the drivers. If there are no drivers there is no Uber. Uber is not autonomous yet so value the drivers.
title: Savagery. Uber Steals Tips.

review: This morning I needed a ride from a residence in Far Rockaway to La Guardia Airport.  Brian arrived, and put my bags in his trunk.  He was personable, pleasant, and very kind.  We talked about living in New York, his family, St Louis, MO (where I’m from), and a few other topics.  Brian made my ride to the airport so pleasant!  He was a bit unsure as to where to drop me off because his navigation had him going to a different terminal than I’d suggested; but he got me to my terminal in plenty of time.  He helped me get my bags, wished me a “Happy Birthday” (I’d told him my birthday had been on 5/8), and safe travels.  Brian mentioned recently starting driving in Far Rockaway.  With his kindness and care for his customers, I believe he will be very successful!  He was fantastic!!!!
title: Brian - New York

review: In the app it has a button that says “RIDE”, and another button that says “schedule”. It’s not clear which one to use. If you want to distinguish between right now versus ride later, then say that on the buttons. Ride Now and next to it put Ride Later. It took me forever to figure out that I had to click schedule in order to book a ride for the next day. I still need a ride whether right now or later so call it the same thing. Then there’s the address problem. The app seems to have a hard time keeping the address that I entered. I get all the way through booking, and then it asked me to confirm pick up location. Things just get worse from there. If I take the time to enter the full address in the beginning, why does the app keep losing it by the time I’m ready to book. Very frustrating.
title: Confusing to use, Address function very poor

review: Uber is no longer the cheap alternative.  It’s better to take a taxi. From my experience, the surge charges are ridiculous.  I took an earlier flight into San Francisco, Uber prices were 4x the price.  Over $130 dollars for normally a $30 ride.  On the 4th of July, it cost me only $32 to get from outer mission to downtown San Francisco. The driver left me and my girlfriend stranded 2 miles alway from our drop off because of traffic.  I reported this issue to Uber, Uber only gave me $5 credit. ONLY $5 in credit for an incompleted ride, they still charged from the full amount.  The ride back costed over $85!  You have to be rich to pay for there surcharges.  I had to take a bus on the way back through shady neighborhoods.  What a terrible experience with Uber, you lost my respect after seeing how much your surge charges, you also lost me as a customer.  Uber eats California prices cost double the amount of ordering right from the restaurant.
title: Uber became too expensive

review: I scheduled an Uber ride to take me to the car rental as my car is in the shop over 18hours in advance. At no point between making the reservation, getting the reservation confirmation, and waiting as my app said “your pick up is soon” during the 10 minute allotted time the ride was scheduled for. did they ever notify me that I did not have a ride. They never did! I am missing an entire day of work with no pay because UBER scheduling Failed me! This is clearly NOT a reliable feature or company. Though I’m out thousands of dollars, I’m glad I’m not missing a flight due to their clear negligence. To top it off? There’s no where for me to contact them to complain. Their entire help line is automated and since the ride never happened (even though I have email confirmation it WAS scheduled properly To happen) I cannot use the ride reporting feature. Uber you owe me $$$$$ for today.
title: Missed a day of work because they never showed

review: Well, there is no doubt that it is a good tool for taking a ride. But I got low ratings as a passenger for no reason I can tell. I always wait at the pick-up places before the rides come. Just sit there without breaking anything in the car. Respond in a normal way to the driver when being talked to. I learned from some online good passenger guide that some drivers will give low ratings to passengers who close door not gently enough. Paid special attention to this after learned that. But still getting low rate. It just stressed me out because I can not think the specific reason for this. If it is just because I am quiet, then it is just too harsh. After all, I stopped using it for rides to avoid being further stressed out and feeling worse about myself. In addition, the recent price increase just make me cannot afford it any more.
title: Being Rated is stressful

review: I have used this service for five years and I have not experienced more difficulty finding a ride until this year recently. I go to work every morning at 6:30 and every morning there are plenty of drivers available. Yet I have to wait 20 mins to find a ride or use Lyft because drivers are constantly rejecting my rides. I am not sure if the drivers have access to my information or my image, but I feel like I am a target of prejudice and it was s disappointing that this service continues to perform at an unsatisfactory level. I would not recommend this service for those who use it for work. Either use the bus or Lyft because either one is way faster.
title: Drivers

review: I haven’t died, so I guess I shouldn’t give it a 1 or 2 rating. But what a piece of rubbish! I changed my Apple Pay card a long time ago, and select the correct card every time I use the app. So why do I have to jump through hoops to get it up through correctly? Why is it trying to charge an old card I deleted YEARS ago? Not only that, but they didn’t even tell me about it until the next time I needed a ride. As much as I hate getting emails, telling me something is wrong is a legitimate reason to email me. It also took a good half hour just to pay my account and tip my driver. I have NO IDEA if anything is actually fixed because my account looks exactly the same way as it did before. I guess I’ll find out the next time I try to use it, which will probably not be any time soon.
title: I haven’t died

review: The application didn’t let me use any of my credit cards for payment, every time I entered a new card it said it couldn’t be used and I need to enter another one (In spite of them all being perfectly valid cards). Then I wanted to use the cash payment option but it would not allow me to use that one either. Finally, and reluctantly I decided to add some cash from my bank account to Uber cash, but when I tried to request a service using the Uber cash it did not allowed me either, and told me once again that I had to select another payment method. Now I sent CUSTOMER SERVICE a request to get my cash back to my bank account, but and I got an answer saying that I need to use another payment method. I guess Uber will end up stealing the money that I transferee from my bank account to Uber cash! This is outrageous, who knows how many people they are doing this to and stealing their money!
title: Horrible experience! Nightmare!

review: Today marks the second time I have requested a luxury Uber, only to be told at the last minute that it was not available.  I would not have an issue if they notified you beforehand, but both times they notified me after the Uber was already late, making it impossible to make it to my appointment on time.  Today was my birthday, so I scheduled a spa day and I really didnot want to drive, in case I decided to have a drink after my massage.  The luxury Uber was scheduled to arrive between 11:00-11:10.  The app instructed me to be outside at 11:00, and I waited on the street- I was worried that they had not sent a description of the car or driver yet, but since it gave me a countdown for the arrival, I presumed someone was on the way.  No one ever showed up, and they deleted the trip from the app, so i was unable to complain or comment.  So Uber earned this 1 star review for screwing up my birthday plans!  I will try Lyft next time.
title: Luxury option does not exist

review:
Hi - 

I recentlySwitch from Lyft to Uber after Lyft charged me for damages to their vehicle, however they were unable to tell me what I did. We were traveling with six passengers, myself three children and two adults. We had a very short ride 15 minutes max. 

The driver was unable to tell me how we damaged the vehicle. They charge me $80 in my response to the allegations. I mentioned that if they were unable to clarify what happened to the vehicle that I would no longer be utilizing their services again. They were unable to that tell me what happened so last week I signed up for Uber and I’ve been very pleased. Thank you so much for your great service and user-friendly experience Mahalo - JNLi.
title: Awesome service

review: But the real problem is you UBER need to fix your maps for your drivers.  South station bus terminal pick up is on the right hand side of the street.  The last 2 drivers blamed your app for trying to pick me up on the opposite side of the street which means I have to cross some serious traffic to get to my black car service.  This is dangerous.  Today I was almost clipped.  I tried to report through your “safety” feature but was admonished by adt for not having an emergency.  Next time it just might be a life threatening one.  Be better.  Fix your map issues.  Your app also had my address 15 Gloucester street in the wrong place.  After years of being picked up in the wrong spot you finally fixed that.  Now fix your customer service (or lack thereof) and fix the app map for more accurate pick ups.
title: Bad customer service on app (this is not new)

review: I got lucky, first it happened to my boyfriend. He was charged for SIX MONTHS! Without his knowledge or consent. To this day, he’s only used Uber once for family but was signed up by Uber for Uber One. That totaled to 60 dollars! And he spoke with his bank thinking it was perhaps a spam charge from some fraudulent ‘company’ but the bank investigated and saw no fraudulent charge. And when we searched online, we read some stories of others being hit with the 9.99 Uber One renewal charge as well. With no reimbursement. I checked my bank this morning (as I usually do) and Boom got the 9.99 Uber one renewal charge despite not opening or using Uber for maybe 6 months now. So I reopened the app to see what happened and somehow I was placed into the Uber one membership, set for monthly renewal. I couldn’t believe it. I’ll contact Uber directly and see what happens but I’ll also be deleting the account completely at this point.
title: NON-CONSENTED CHARGES!! App Users Beware!

review: I would love if the app actually tipped the driver when I put in my percentage before I make it to my stop. Weeks, months later, and I have no idea I never tipped my driver because the app never followed through. If you don’t check your ride history or monthly recap you will never catch this error. Has happened multiple times and tips only work after I go into the app later on and set it from my receipt…. Even though you can pre fill a tip amount while the ride is active…. Have caught this before several times, luckily days later but this one was from 3 weeks ago no tip on my last ride… and now I don’t have a 5 star rating anymore. Time to use Lyft
title: App problems

review:
wait and save today, checked the app 30 minutes before i should have left i saw i could “wait and save” for like $1.50 less than the price of leaving now, ok no problem! i love to save even pennies… and predictably i waited the full time they gave me. and waited more! now rather than getting to work a few minutes early (as advertised) i will be getting there late. 
I am constantly surprised that an app with possibly the most accurate data regarding traffic flow and peak driving times, that they are unable to even build in extra padding for customers, had i known that wait and save would have added 20 minutes onto my 10 minute trip, i would have sprung to pay the full price. Uber is a necessity and a constant let down.
title: wait and save? more like wait to wait for pennies less

review: I wanted to use this app and ordered a pizza, and as a new customer, the app offered me a $25 promotion, which is what tempted me. But it didn't work out as well as I thought it would. I ordered the pizza, waited for it for an hour, of course I left a tip for the courier, but in the end my order strangely disappeared, the money was debited, the tip for the courier was debited, the tax was also debited, and additional funds were debited for waiting (I still don't understand why I was waiting). I immediately contacted customer service, and they said they were sorry and refunded the money for the meal. And what about the promotion? My tip to the courier, who probably didn't exist at all, and the extra money for the tax and waiting. In general, I wanted to take advantage of the new customer promotion, but it turned out that I just gave my money to Uber, wasted my time, was hungry and not satisfied! I do not recommend using this app to order food!
title: Problem with deliveries

review: I have been so disappointed with the Uber app's predicted times — it is impossible to plan a trip, because the app is so poor at predicting how long it will take a driver to arrive. Twice in the last week it has taken >20 minutes longer for the driver to arrive than the app prediction. The first time, I waited 15 minutes only for the driver to cancel, making me wait another 15 minutes for the next one (this in central San Francisco, in the middle of the day). The second time, I scheduled the ride so I wouldn’t have the same thing happen again, but because the app didn’t account for the Bay to Breakers run, the driver took too long on his previous drop off and didn’t arrive until 25 mins after the scheduled time. If the pickups are going to be so unpredictable, you need to account for that in your predictions, and you need to be more careful with assigning rides to drivers with scheduled pickups! Inexcusable
title: Inexcusably unpredictable

review: Uber is often times inconvenient to use because they allow last minute changes that can make me late to work. They waste my time by making me think I have a driver on the way for up to 30 minutes. Last minute changes to the arrival time of my driver are often made, but the price doesn’t change unless it’s going up which I think is unfair because I could’ve called a cheaper ride for the same amount of time if I knew Uber would allow this kind of change after I already confirmed the money order. Last but not least, if I were to cancel a ride, there’s a chance I’d be paying the exact same amount or higher in cancellation fees even if the driver is, say, 20 minutes away, which makes the process much more stressful and difficult and overall frustrating for both the customer and the driver. All of these experiences happened to me in real life.
title: Uber is inconvenient to use.

review:
Uber relies on three equally important pillars: the punctual, efficient drivers, the low prices, and the intuitive app. 
With prices constantly rising to pass traditional cabs it’s more important that ever that the app provides value. Unfortunately, every version gets more and more cluttered with nonsense. Half the main screen is taken up by junk illustrations like “Ready for the game?” With some meaningless icons. This would be acceptable if it didn’t come at the total expense of showing critical information. Today my car arrived at SeaTac and the app didn’t even display the Stall number. With over a dozen white Priuses spread over 10,000 square feet this functionality is super important to have at a glance. 

Come on Uber, stop adding buttons and icons. Go back to the minimalist UI that made you best in class. Or just copy what the competitors do, they haven’t yet destroyed it.
title: App is getting to be a mess

review: Drivers are usually very good and nice. However it irks me that drivers can suddenly cancel right before they are supposed to arrive yet I can be charged for doing the same. Also I do not get most of the notifications or they are incorrects notifications. You are not told when a driver contacts you, so you can easily miss a message even when you have the app currently open. Sometimes it refuses to load for me and/or the driver and forces us to rely on a different map until it does load. Share your ride also sends different or no notifications to people I do share them with. Family constantly gets “ I’m on my way” when I am currently waiting for a ride to leave. Best thing about Uber are the nice people you meet driving you, not the app.
title: App doesn’t always work for passenger or driver

review: I’ve always used Uber because it was a good app at the beginning, but now, it’s the worst. I always schedule my Ubers ahead of time because I need to be at work on time, but lately they send me Ubers that are almost 30 minutes away. And the drivers choose to grab the ride even if they know they are busy with another person. Today I had an issue where I scheduled my Uber at 7:15 and this person whose name was Emir canceled it just because and left, so I was obviously late for work and had to cancel cause they were then sending me an Uber almost 40 minutes late and I ended up paying almost $45 for this trip that usually costs me around $16 and it’s happened multiple times. I think Uber need to have a better system for choosing the drivers and how they send them to you.
title: Long wait times

review:
Hello,

I have been a long time customer of Uber and Uber Eats. Today I canceled my Uber Gold membership. Their response to my cancellation prompted me to write this. 

To keep it short and sweet, last night there was an ice storm. I placed an order through Uber Eats, the estimated delivery time was 20-30 minutes. 

The merchant didn’t send the order out for delivery until over an hour after I placed it, and because I was sick in bed and grieving the death of my mother, I was asleep by the time it arrived. My bad, but I could not have gotten it anyway, as it was left out in the snow and I could not open my front door that late due to frozen ice.

Given circumstances, I politely requested a refund, as my order was inedible after it arrived. Uber Support claimed “actions outside the merchant’s control” caused the delay and refused to issue a refund. 

They responded with the same canned email 4 times, refused to address any of my concerns or actually give a human response. I said I understood their stance but would be canceling my membership due to the poor experience. 

Their “priority service team” responded with the EXACT SAME CANNED EMAIL and said nothing about any concerns I had raised. I am disgusted and offended by the lack of humanity shown by Uber’s customer support. I will be canceling all products associated with them and not using them again.
title: Uber Eats Merger - Hope You Like Frozen Food

review:
I haven’t used Uber in a while, and now I don’t think I will again.

I used to use Uber a lot for business trips, it worked, nothing fancy or special, but it got the job done and that’s what I needed. So I’d say 4 stars back 6-7 years ago.

However this past weekend was horrible. For the second time on the same trip the prices fluctuated wildly. I booked a trip to get to the airport, $45. Not great but not horrible. I had to restart the app, and then the trip $65. Annoying,  but I lucked out and a friend was able to come through and give me a ride at 4:30AM. I got to the airport, flew out of state, flew back and needed a ride due to unfortunate unforeseen circumstances. The trip was supposed to be $60, and then a minute later when I tried to submit the pickup destination the app transitioned back to the main screen, and now the price was $100. I tried again because I wanted to get home after seeing my grandmother dying, but it reverted to the main screen again and now the prices were $120. This was all for the cheapest option too. So I downloaded the Lyft app, and paid $50 to get home, using the car ride to craft this review.

I’m not just going to vote with stars, but with my money. I’ll choose Lyft every time now over Uber.
title: Oh, *now* it will actually cost this much…

review: I took an uber from the airport to my hotel and had a gift card balance + another card on file. The trip was about $70 and my gift card was $50. Uber proceeded to use some of my gift card for the trip’s tip and then took another “holding charge” out of my debit card. The next day they told me I had an insufficient balance on my card (I didnt) and that I owed $50 on my debit card, and they didn’t even use the remainder of my gift card balance. Talked to multiple customer support people who did not understand my situation and told me the wrong information. Like any other app, I just want to use my gift card balance and pay the rest on my account but not a single customer service agent wants to listen to that, and they’ve now locked my account out until I pay with my actual money first for that difference I refuse to use this nonsense app again. Switching to lyft
title: Customer Service Refuses to use my gift card balance

review: Used Uber for 1st time today. Usually walk but had injury. So made reservation to and from my destination. Driver to my physical therapy session showed up early, was courteous and drove me to front door of the medical facility.  Pick up driver was late and I had to walk the perimeter of the facility to find her in the rain with an injured leg  I searched the app for a way to contact her before I started walking- but I found no way to contact that driver. I was surprised and annoyed that she didn’t drive to the covered entrance (designed for pickup and drop off). At just under $26 for each ride (5 city blocks- 4 minute ride) there should be consistent excellent service. And - at this price - I thought the tip was included. So surprised to see that it wasn’t.  I recommend my 1st driver- but not the 2nd. And - unless I have another urgent need - and can’t find other transportation - I won’t be using Uber again.
title: Very uneven service - ridiculously expensive

review: My driver John picked me up at 6:30AM and his car was incredibly clean and John and I had a great conversation and even turned out that we knew someone in common. I’ve used other taxi/ride services in the past but UBER has been above and beyond any past experiences I’ve had. Even in Paris, France the drive used a translator just  to hold a conversation about my visit to his city. UBER…..keep taking great care of your drivers and may your focus always be on exceptional customer experiences and not only profit. Too many companies have lost that most important aspect of conducting business, but you have a great work force that has always gone the extra mile to make doing business a pleasure.
title: Great service

review: I’m 51 and I used Uber for the first time. The devastating cold rendered my truck useless. The truck is being towed and I needed a ride from Burlington to Norwood. The app worked perfectly. The driver was fantastic. Of course being me I left my cell phone in his car. An iPhone which I just picked up last night. I called my phone and the driver picked up. He brought my phone directly to me. It’s scary how attached we are to our phones and just how much of our info is in them. My driver with his simple act of kindness saved me a mountain of problems. I can’t thank him enough. He is an incredible asset to Uber and I hope he flourishes. I will tell this story of how my first Uber driver saved my life to many…….
title: First experience

review: My only real issue with Uber is that there’s no way to reach customer service. If you leave your phone in the Uber, you have to find a way to log into your account (from a different device, and they make you confirm your log in VIA A TEXT MESSAGE so if you have indeed lost your phone you’re out of luck!) Once you (miraculously) get into your account you can find the driver info and call them directly. This is a real issue, I’ve had it several times and my boyfriend had it yesterday AND today. There needs to be an emergency contact line if for no other purpose than lost phones, which I’m sure happens all of the time. Otherwise I have had wonderful experiences with many drivers over the years.
title: Only one complaint

review: How much money is Uber wasting on their customer service? They would be better off axing the whole department, because as it stands, engaging with Uber customer support actively does more damage than if it were nonexistent. A truly incredible feat, one I haven’t seen before. Long story short, a driver stole an item from me (like stole stole, I put it in the car and he drove away, I did not forget it after my ride) and customer “support” did absolutely nothing, even going so far as to antagonize me and send me unprofessional and rude messages once it became apparent I wasn’t going to take their copy/paste template answers as any kind of admission of culpability. Uber doesn’t care about you, they don’t care what their drivers do to you, they only care that you’ve got a good credit card. (This is also my second time posting this review, wonder why the first one never got published?)
title: Customer Service is so bad, it does more harm than good.

review:
You would think having passed a multi step safety screening, Uber drivers are safe and trustworthy. I usually have good decent rides. But the way Uber dealt with this incident made me realize their regulations are lax and unsafe. They also don’t care about what the situation could’ve been. 
I had a doctors appointment and needed a ride home. I was in pain but it wasn’t noticeable. I just wanted to go home. My driver seemed nice. Tried to offer me his “service” where he offered free rides and gave me his number. We talked and he wanted to “hang out” with me. I am noticeably younger than him by 15-20 years. I was getting uncomfortable. We arrive and I tried the door. He had his CHILD LOCKS ON. WHO THINKS IT’S A GOOD IDEA TO HAVE IT ON?! AS A DRIVER?! I  understand if he gets drunk people regularly but I felt unsafe and put off by it. I brought it up as a concern to customer service. All Uber did was give me a $5 credit. Thanks Uber, made me feel so much better.
title: Unsafe Ride and Uber Didn’t Care

review: I had to pick up vouchers for a tour at the Wyndham. Originally the stops were in backwards so he asked me to change them. I change them I added a small fee (just to reverse them). There should be a way to mark your stops without this change especially when you’re going to both places.  After picking up the vouchers they tell me to go to scoreboard bar instead of what they previously told me (Opry Resort).  When I shared this with the driver he suggested I update the app even though it was on the way he said. So I update the app to yet be charged again.  Dumb!! I think he told me to do that do he could get another fee but yet I tipped him $10 cash for his time of 25 minutes. I should of had to update each time that’s crazy.  I could have said I don’t feel good please pull over and I would not have been charged these fees. Just saying.
title: Ridiculous Fee Change

review:
Overall, somewhat satisfied with the app and process. However, they need to change how drivers will sit and wait for fares to “go up”. If you are at a sporting event or other highly trafficked area. They will wait until there are tons of requests and prices go up,  before they start accepting rides. 

Next huge frustration, drivers canceling on you. I have had multiple times waiting on a driver for a couple of minutes. Just to have them cancel the trip on me. Leaving me searching for another ride. The driver should never accept the trip in the first place. Just pass on it and let someone who actually wants to drive, accept the job. This happened to me 5 times today for example. Driver accepts the job, only to cancel a couple of minutes later. Leaving me searching multiple times for a ride while sitting in the cold.
title: Needs improvement

review:
In early years, had mostly good experiences with Uber. Now they’re mostly bad. After scheduling a ride the day before to get to the airport, they texted me the driver would be 5min early. At 60 minutes AFTER my scheduled time, the drive hasn’t moved in the entire hour and wouldn’t accept my phone calls or return my in-app text messages. At risk of missing my flight, and after trying everything to reach Uber for a resolution, I tried to cancel. The app said they would charge $32 if I cancel.

Other recent experiences, involve ordering a ride that is supposedly 6min away. Then, 10min later, they are 15min away. Then, out of nowhere, the driver cancels and you have to start over. You can ask Uber for help with a prior trip but not the trip you’re currently trying to take. This is common!

If you want features for woke-ness, this company and app are all about that. If you simply want a ride somewhere, there is no way to get help when the service goes sideways, and that happens a lot.

I used Lyft for the first time yesterday. Barely caught my flight after the Uber fiasco. Selling my stock in Uber as well. This model of no customer service isn’t going to work. Airbnb gets this right. Uber should copy their resolution process for current problems.
title: Getting worse, and no pax support

review: I arrived at the Portland airport and used the Uber app to hail a ride. I was connected to Ahmed. I can see from the app that he is sitting in the Cell parking and not moving even though he accepted the ride. Eventually I called him, but no answer. I texted him and he called me back saying he is on the way. I see his car and wave at him 100 feet up from my pick up point location. He called me and said I needed to come to him because the airport point is where he is supposed to pick up passengers. He opened his trunk from the driver’s seat but offered no help for our luggage or to rearrange the stuff in his trunk. His car reeked of cigarette smoke. He missed the turn and route suggested by his own GPS. He did not seem to know the roads in his own town. The final straw is that he charged me for wait time. I normally tip and am generous with my 5 Star ratings, but I left no tip and rated him 1 star. Uber needs to provide Ahmed with some training.
title: 8/20 ride with Ahmed in Portland ME

review: The app is awful it has not worked all day. Half of my app is in English and half of it is in Portuguese. I do not understand Portuguese and have no idea how it could possibly have gotten this way. The worst part of it all is there is no way to contact customer service. You have to try to change your name on the app which they will not let you do it and that’s the only way to send them a message. No other way to contact them or call them. I was left in the lurch because this app did not work and even if it did work I needed a translator to speak Portuguese. I finally had customer service do my name change for me but they didn’t even read my entire message and they only fixed one of the problems in an acted like it was all done. The customer service level for this company is the lowest for any major company seriously do not use them use the competition
title: Awful. Seriously use the competition

review: This driver came from 13 miles away to get me for $6!  I drive too!  I don’t think I would ever do this unless i was working my way towards home or a hot area.  I drive too!  My brother, aka, driver  gets a $20 tip because he took a chance!  Gracias mi amigo!  I hope that’s correct!  People in the wait staff, bartender, whatever, we know how to tip our fellow workers!  Thanks for coming all the way out here for little money!  We work hard every day, and my favorite part is when somebody goes up and beyond!  You always have a number in mind per hour when you drive, and it’s so cool when somebody hits you up above and beyond! It makes our day!  My driver made my day!
title: Taking a chance on a bad trip!

review:
Arrived to FT Lauderdale today and went to the designated ride share area: Terminal 2 Station H. Was told to look for a white vehicle with the drivers name, would be there in 2 minutes. As I was already standing that, after more than five minutes, I started communicating with the driver via text message and phone calls. Bottom line:

The driver stated that he was in a blue car, located outside door 224…not where he should have been..and…he stated that he doesn’t know why it showed him in a different vehicle. So I walk my $&@ up to the second floor of terminal 2 to connect with the driver. When I arrived at the new pickup location, the trip was canceled by someone other than I. No I’m dragging my bags back down to the original pickup location and had to make a new request for service.

In the words of the Late Elijah Cummins..”Come on man!”. Let’s get it together please!
title: Let’s Get Ot Right

review: I had to submit for an Uber three times before I got a ride. The first Uber I submitted for said she could not make it to me at my hotel. All the roads were closed. I explain to her the roads were not all closed as cars were going by me consistently as we speak. I called her back , I could not understand her as she spoke on the phone. She said the call for another Uber. I said fine I called for another Uber and got the same person who ignored my phone calls as I wasn’t sure if she changed her mind. I finally got a ride on my third call with someone else. That driver was excellent and was to me within five minutes.  Very frustrating when you’re heading to the airport for your flight . It’s a good thing. This driver was as good as he was or I would be taking another ride share in deleting the Uber app.
title: Ride

review:
I used to use Uber a lot and it always worked but the past few times over the month that I used it it’s been a hit or miss. My app is updated everything is up to date, and yet Uber still doesn’t work more than half the time for me. I got stuck in the LAX airport the other day because the app wouldn’t work even though my internet was fast when I googled and my other apps that rely on data or wifi worked as well. Just not Uber or Lyft. Luckily after an hour my friend was finally able to order one for me from where they were at. I don’t understand why Uber is so unreliable. Fix it please, it’s dangerous. Now I 100% can’t rely on Uber or Lyft and will need to figure out other ways to get, maybe resort back to Taxis. Anywho, yeah, this app is unreliable for no reason. 

(Lyft is as well so going to write a review for them too. Ridiculous)
title: Very unreliable

review:
Our driver, David, is a very nice and capable person.
The returning flight left Tampa late because of weather delays and we were also held up when we landed because our gate wasn’t ready. This made us over an hour late from the originally stated time.
David contacted me by phone as to our status because I hadn’t been getting any information on the app due to the lack of WiFi and met us at Central parking. He was a calming influence, immediately helping us with the bags and making sure we were seated comfortably.
He got us home as soon as he was able-because it was now rush hour.
We enjoyed talking with him during the ride. It turned out he knew the area very well.
title: Return from Airport

review:
The Uber concept has literally been a game Changer when it comes to showing the potential of “share” apps. Through the years it’s had it’s rough spots (mainly individual contractors/ worker maliciousness) but all in all the potential it still holds is limitless. 

But with all good things comes good size problems and minor ones. Still needs a better. Map/ gps system for drivers and a better system for Adding stops or deciding halfway thru travel you want to go round trip. Like a simple (ROUND TRIP) button the driver can press and you verify by text or app as well at payment time or right then. 

Still all in all UBER is still a a great business for riders and drivers needing to make a living! Just make sure and stay safe no matter what seat you use in the vehicle!
title: Game changing! Sometimes exasperating

review: For the past year, I’ve been experiencing some bugs. One that occurs every time I open the app is the home page continuing to load and not display anything except the loading animation. I’m not sure if that’s due to my location being off, but it’s annoying. However, what’s more annoying is that, some days, when I attempt to order an Uber, I put all my information in for a ride, and when I click confirm.....nothing. The screen merges out to the map, and that’s it. No car coming soon, no finding your ride; it just freezes on the map. It’s really frustrating, especially when I’m in a rush to get to work some days and then I have to resort to more expensive rides through Lyft because Uber’s app is being difficult. And this will happen for up to three days in a row, or the whole week even. Please fix this.
title: App bugs

review: Lyft was scheduled to do medical rides, which included me.  This system worked well during the first few days, but utterly failed this Saturday.  Lyft said they would pick me up early this morning, but then said the driver backed out.  Then they said someone else would come, but never did. Finally, I booked a ride on Uber and got to my appointment (barely in time due to Lyft’s delay). Then, for my return ride, Lyft was called again per their agreement with the medical center. After showing I would get a ride, no one ever came for about 40 min. So I called Uber again and was picked up in 4 minutes.  I’m  someone who needs a walker to get around, and Uber saved the day for me!!
title: Uber saved me today

review:
Uber has so many ridiculous problems that it’s down right annoying. The only good thing about it these days is that there is always an Uber driver, but that’s really it. For one, Uber drivers cannot see the location of where the person wants to go before the trip starts. This is truly aggravating because I have so many Uber drivers canceling on me once I find out I need to head into the city (I live in the tristate area). On top of that, tolls also come out of the Uber drivers money, so it makes no sense to charge extra when Uber doesn’t even compensate it’s employees in the first place. 

Finally, Uber drivers do not have options to navigate how to get into the destination. Either this is just carelessness in the app or the company’s greedy for every little mile. 

Either I might go back to using lift or maybe their system will change but I doubt it
title: Terrible set up for both the workers and consumer

review:
I’ve been using Uber religiously for YEARS since I don’t drive, and is usually cheaper than a Lyft ride. Over the years the Uber app has just gotten worse. The bugs and glitches have gotten worse, the map is usually inaccurate for me. There’s certain places I go that no matter where I pin the location, the app almost always takes the driver to a different place. I’ve heard multiple Uber drivers complain of the gps inaccuracy. 
Not sure if this is an Uber problem or not - but I’ve attempted to call/text several of my drivers while they were on the way to help guide them to the correct location, most times the driver tells me they did not receive any texts or calls, which is unusual.
Overall I have to use Uber because it’s convenience and cheaper than other options, but I really wish it would start improving over time, rather than worsening.
title: This app used to be so much better!

review:
Very clever on Uber's part, I missed an Uber pool pickup, my fault, but didn't know I'd be charged $5 for it. After that I accepted another ride quoted at $15, but didn't see any messaging that this price was contingent on finding another passenger en route. When I was dropped off, they charged me $25. Lyft charges the price that is quoted instead of crafting fine print that allows them to invent any price on arrival. It's perfectly legal that Uber does this, but also a great way to generate 1 star reviews and some anti-brand advocates.

Also their voucher program is designed so you will mistakenly not redeem it and instead pay out of pocket.
title: They make Lyft look pretty good!  My airport ride became $30 when I expected $15

review: CALL the Better Business Bureau because it seems that they are making it as hard as they can to talk to someone. Then you have to wait on a email that never comes. Hoping you just forget about it. Don’t help if the driver leaves you at the first stop you make out of many you have set but make you pay full price still. The prices for food are ridiculous. ITS ACTUALLY CHEAPER to get a Uber to the restaurant to pick it up and Uber back home. Don’t have a way of contacting the driver at least through not asking for their personal number but the driver I probably could’ve resolved the issue easily. I didn’t even want my money back I just wanted to get back home at least. We didn’t have any altercation what so ever. Or at least gave me the money in the Uber app to spend with them again to get home would’ve been great but I didn’t spend 4$ to get there so how would I get home with 4$.
title: IF YOU HAVE A PROBLEM

review: Been driving for 3 years off and on. Started off good and made good money earlier in the day everywhere I went with not too many problems with the app.(10am to 3 pm is my preferred time to drive). Took 2021 off because of freeze damage to my house and started driving again this year(2022). Now it’s constant problems with the app, you don’t make good money unless you drive the areas and times that are pushed and pushed and pushed by the app.  And Uber takes well over half of what the fare is charged when it’s the driver taking the risk in crazy traffic  super high gas prices. The app route’s you through tolls like crazy before passenger pickup dropping hourly average. When you can understand the reps at Uber support there usually no help also.  Constant glitches in app, before and after passengers enter and ride started. Hourly average went from 30$+ to almost 13$ so don’t be fooled by what the app projects.
title: Robbery on wheels

review:
I have been *trying* to use the Uber app for 4 years in the United States and the United Kingdom. I’ve never had a good experience with the app, there is always issues with technical support whether it’s the app or prices or Uber eats. I’ve made reservations where I had to end up paying more until I disputed the fee for the company to refund me. I’ve made Uber eats orders where the drivers just never show up. Most recently I had a problem with Uber eats, the Uber support helped me with the order then locked out my account so I couldn’t use it anymore. I’ve had countless conversations with the Uber technical support and they told me yes my account is locked but can’t give me a reason. Then they tried to play the “Uber wants everyone to have a comfortable experience” card on me, even though not being able to use the app isn’t comfortable at all 🤷🏻‍♂️🤷🏻‍♂️🤷🏻‍♂️⁉️ but whatever floats your boat bruh.

I never write app reviews because why should I, but this has been the most unprofessional experience I’ve ever had.

If you’re in the United States, I highly recommend Lyft which is fantastic, user friendly, and cheaper.

If you’re in the United Kingdom, try Ola, Gett, or Bolt. All excellent services. 

Y’all imma laugh so hard if I actually get a response from the Uber team trying to justify this🤣 don’t even bother.
title: Don’t waste your time on scammers. Use other services (below)

review: Had a lovely driver, but it is very hard to communicate with Uber.  First, how does one cancel?  Second, if you have no knowledge of an area, there is no human to help you find a pick up location.  If you need to be picked up at a park, for example, you are stuck if you can’t talk to someone to give you a landmark.  Also, we had to pay for wait time not knowing our driver isn’t allowed on the airport driveway.  At 83, it was a hardship for my husband and me to finally learn we had to walk 100 feet to the car.  We paid for his wait not knowing he couldn’t get us; my husband had to make two trips to the car, and we had to “borrow” a wheel chair to get me to the car.   I found Uber very difficult due to no direct communication.
title: Uber
userName: I do not wish to choose one

review:
This service has become very unreliable with drivers often cancelling midway to pick you up or even refusing to take you to your destination (eg, airport) after you wait some time already. This never happened to me before Covid. Moreover, there is no way to communicate these issues through the app, probably a deliberate omission on the company’s part. Looking for options but there aren’t many (hence the 2 stars)

Update: no improvement to issues above PLUS the system over relies on GPS for directions. This together with drivers that barely know the area leads to absurd and unnecessary situations.  I’d like to have the choice of entering the addresses and the drivers sees them. I also would like the option of deciding which route to take. Uber is relying on a technology that is faulty and not under their control.
title: Declining quality of service and app

review:
Today on my way from LaGuardia to NYC, there was a Parade down 5th Ave and all the through streets were blocked, on top of the volume of traffic because of the parade. I felt so badly for my driver as he tried in vain to find a street to turn on and get us to our hotel. In the end he circled back and dropped us off as close as he could and we walked, and even then had to wait to cross until the police allowed. 
While I love a parade, I think, just like street closures for repairs are communicated to drivers, activities such as these should also be communicated. Had the driver known, he would have been able to choose another route to the hotel or we would have exited his Uber 45 minutes sooner and walked the rest of the way. On top of my frustration as well as his embarrassment, a $65 fare turned into a $116 fare!  I don’t begrudge him is $$ but I think UBER should provide this kind of info to their drivers.
title: Travel delays

review:
If I could leave negative stars I would. I’ve used Uber hundreds of times as I live in San Francisco…and…it’s hilly. I’ve always had my frustrations with Uber, but this situation takes the cake.

I was looking for food on the app and my app kept glitching out. I restarted my phone and everything, but the app was still running weird. I went to see what the total for a delivery from a restaurant somewhat far away would be, and when I tried to back out of it my app glitched out and submitted the order. 

Obviously I wasn’t trying to do that (just browsing), so I immediately went to cancel the order. When I went through the steps to cancel, the app only gave me the option to chat with a rep. The rep I got told me she had to transfer me to the Uber emailing team who could better assist me.

I thought that was ridiculous because I didn’t even try to submit the order, and they’re now telling me I can’t cancel the order in real-time and within seconds of the order being placed? Make it make sense.

Long story short, Uber has charged me $75 for this…just to cancel my order and “compensate the driver”. Even though I reached out immediately. I am still fighting this and will dispute it with my credit card company.

I just honestly hate Uber and on principle alone, I will never spend another dime here.
title: Uber is the Worst!

review: I had two Uber rides tonight, one after another. The second one was necessary only because the first driver drove me to the wrong place and left me there. He brought me to Cabrillo Inn even though my requested destination was Castillo Inn, 22 Castillo. I had mentioned i didn’t recognize it in the dark as I had just got into the inn early this afternoon. He should have waited or check to make sure. He was quite nice otherwise but without realizing it, he left me in an unpleasant situation. I could not find a way to explain the problem with the choices in the app. I believe I am owed a refund for that first ride tonight because the driver took me 1.5 miles away from where I should be and it would have been hard to walk in the dark. So I had no choice but mail another Uber ride.
title: Cannot explain problem

review: Uber is an easy and convenient way to catch a cab BUT rates have drastically changed , when I first started Uber I took my child to school and paid between $10-14  no more no less if it was less it was very unusual… NOW I pay between $20-28 for a 10 minute drive to my daughters school ARE YOU KIDDING ME !? If I was able to walk with her I would but on foot it would take us 30 minutes and getting an early start to walk is not easy with a child …. Anyway I just wanted to point out that those rates are craaaazy and what’s even crazier is that the app asks if we want to tip our driver … it’s not their fault the rates are high but imagine paying $20-28 a day five days a week for a 10 minute drive !? And a tip ? AND I Lost my job bcuz of the pandemic but even if I was working why double the rate ??? The Uber drivers complain that they get paid not so well either so IDK!?
title: RIDICULOUS RATES

review:
So I ordered a ride to go to my work location. They assigned me an Uber driver right? The Uber was 18 mn away from me. He was gonna pick me up and I was waiting . The driver was now literally 10 mn away from my home then suddenly they changed my Uber . The new one was actually 25 mn away and he was dropping someone off. So I add to wait at least 1 hrs in total !  You all completely messed my schedule up. What is wrong with this company ? I hate you all Because of you I took work 1hrs later after the starting time and I will probably get fired !!!!!!  
I am sorry but LIFT WOULD HAVE NEVER PULL THAT CRAP ON ME. THEY ACTUALLY GIVE YOU DRIVER AS CLOSE AS POSSIBLE WHEN THEY SUDDENLY CHANGE YOU A DRIVER.🤬🤬🤬
title: They change my Uber at the last minute!

review: When I was in high school there were many days I depended on Uber to make it home. My mom had two jobs and I wasn’t able to get a ride home any other way. One day, I was using it to get home as usual and when I approached the driver’s car, they speed off really fast and nearly ran me over. It was extremely unprofessional, especially considering I still had to pay money out of my own pocket to cancel the ride after they were the one who speed off. I got another Uber and made it home safe. The next day, I needed to use it to get home again. I found my account was permanently suspended and the only way to get it unsuspended was to upload my identification. I had no identification papers since I was a minor, and was terminated for no reason. Because of this incident, I had to wait until 8 PM to get a ride home after school for several days of the week. Ruined that year of high school for me
title: Terminated

review: Garbage customer service!!!! I got an Uber with someone and lost an item in the Uber. I filled out the forms immediately for the driver to contact me and they never did, as did the other person who had booked the Uber. Next I tried to contact Uber customer service but I couldn’t because they literally have no number to call. I filled out other forms for help, but still no response. Next I then called drive support, and they tried to help me out, but told me that I’d have to wait for a message from another department that specializes in lost items. I waited for 2 days and have not received a message from them, and called them multiple times to see if they can hurry the process up. It’s not that hard to just get me in contact with the driver so I can see if I can get the item back, but it’s been a few days already and the likelihood of me seeing my item is getting smaller and smaller.
title: Lost item

review:
I’ve been using Uber for almost 3 years, but the following started happening recently. Whenever I would try to request a ride within these past 2 months, the app asks me to add a payment method and overall add a payment, even though I have money. The reason why I didn’t write this review earlier is because I thought this problem was going to be resolved.

I would have to refresh the app a few times in order to request a ride. However, the following started to happen since recently.  I would still not be able to request a ride, even when I would refresh the app a few times.

I assume this is some kind of bug problem, which I hope will be fixed as soon as possible, because I happen to use this app quite often.
title: Payment method error

review: Uber easily has the worst support system team of all time. If you have an issue, just forget about it! As their support team will only tangle things up with automated replies & make things even worse! It’s so bad that I think their leadership principles are now strictly focused on customer dissatisfaction instead of customer obsession! Billion dollar company that doesn’t properly train their team is just a recipe for disaster and causes frustration amongst consumers. Most companies get better & better with time, but Uber & it’s support team goes literally downhill year by year in the customer service aspect. Uber is so bad now & frustrating to use that I’ve literally been considering ordering taxi’s again moving forward….great job new uber team on killing what was once a great platform & idea for a short period of time. Back to a taxi cab we all go as it’s less stressful dealing with a cabbie than uber support.
title: Worst Support & Team Ever

review:
I have to give credit where credit is due...über always seems to commit to a 10 minute drop of time. The proclaims, as if it is a good as gospel, that you will arrive at you destination within ten minutes; despite several facts: 
1.) You are further than ten minutes away from your destination - Über doesn't care. Anything is possible when you have the power of app controlled ride sharing at your finger tips. If that wasn’t enough, the creators of über have been able to defy the laws of physics and space/time to be able to move mountains and make miracles that only seemed possible in Disney channel movies starring Kirk Russell.
2.) Über makes hard, fast time “Drop Off Time” commitments without there being a semblance of a driver in the near vicinity. They do, however, afford the Customer the tremendous service tremendous service of providing them the obligatory opportunity of paying a cancellation fee. Despite the fact, again, that no drivers are available. 

All in all. This is a garbage app, that affords driver absolute autonomy. I would love to boycott all apps of this nature, but; alas, I like to drink and am in need of these services. I will begrudgingly continue to use these services. I just think some light should
Be shed in these two issues in particular.
title: Time Commitments without a  Driver available

review: I’ve have had the Uber app on my phone for over 5 years now. I use it a few times a year. This year is the first time that I was quoted a price up front and and then after the ride the final prices increases by over (not including tip)30%. I understand there are certain fees depending where your at that Uber has to charge but before I hit the button to call for an Uber, I should have it all up front so I can make the decision whether to pay or not. My ride experience has always been great with the vehicles and drivers, but this new system of telling you about the fees after the fact is enough to keep me from using Uber in the future. I will gladly come back if Uber does the right thing and gives you up front pricing.
title: Uber is starting to be sneaky with hidden fees

review:
I used UberEats and had a fantastic experience, so I figured I'd give Uber a chance — huge mistake and waste of time.

I traveled to Texas from Colorado on May 24th to visit a friend who had just moved out there for work. I arrive at the airport, order a ride, and the first driver to accept gets to me no problem — everything seemed in order. I walk up say "hello and give him the PIN", and he asks "is this address correct?" I tell him "yes" and he goes on to explain that it's not worth his time, "that Uber doesn't pay enough for that destination". Then why accept the ride? So he cancelled it and left. I try again, and the same thing happened with the second driver. But this guy tried to tell me "if you pay me directly, I'll take you." Absolutely not! Where's the safety in that? Then he proceeded to leave without canceling the ride on his end even though he refused it, so I was charged a cancellation fee. Thankfully that's being refunded, otherwise I'd be blowing up their customer service until this problem was resolved.

I ended up taking a Taxi, which was only slightly more expensive — and completely drama free, which was worth every penny.

You couldn't pay me to use Uber again, I've already trashed the app and have zero plans to return in the future. Thanks Taxi, you succeeded where Uber failed miserably.
title: Never Again

review: I literally downloaded it once and they both couldn’t take me and my family home because it was “too far”. One asked for us to pay him again because for our trip we payed $204 but they only received $122. If you didn’t get the money from Uber then isn’t that a problem to pick up with Uber? We payed what we had to and it showed that we had payed the full amount so why are you asking us for more money. We then ordered another Uber with a different name and the guy drove here just to tell us he can’t take us to our location unless we give him a tip because it’s “too far” and he has work in the morning. If you know you have work why accept it in the first place, Uber literally shows you how far everything is and where the destination is, so why would you accept just to complain the it was too far? I’m so tired of Uber and I will never be using it again!
title: Bad drivers

review: My Solano bus had cancelled 2 bus rides and El cerrito Bart station where I was located was experiencing an extreme cold snap and I was freezing even though I was wearing a coat and gloves. Uber then cancelled 3 car requests on me and finally after 35 minutes Our driver LAU was assigned as I had taken along 3 passenger so we could use the Hov lanes. His car was small but we made the best of it as we were grateful it hadn’t been cancelled. There had been a horrid crash earlier on interstate 80 westbound that caused the Solano bus to cancel and all traffic was backed up. Driving to fairfield transportation center we came upon 4 accidents. LAU was cool calm and collected.  He put the heater on for us when we told him we were frozen.  We thanked LAU for everything and getting us to our home base safely.
title: Friday ride

review: I use Uber quite a bit and it has been very positive experiences for the most part. However, when I try to schedule a ride for a certain time lately drivers have either been showing up like 15-20 minutes early or too late. Once a driver accepts a ride, I would get charged if I cancel it even if they were too close by or far away based on when I scheduled it. It literally defeats the point of scheduling a ride because I would schedule it for a perfectly reasonable time and then end up being late for work anyway, or they would arrive super early and I would be scrambling so they wouldn’t have to sit there for 20 minutes. Many of the drivers tell me they didn’t see that it was scheduled for a certain time until after they arrive, so I don’t think that they are to blame for this. If there’s something that could be done that would be great
title: Need to fix Scheduled Ride Feature

review: I have had all good experiences other than this morning. I asked for an Uber 5 hours in advance for 7:30am it said someone will be there between 7:30 and 7:40am which was acceptable. Then it said the Uber driver wouldn’t be there until approximately 8:02am. That’s unacceptable and would make me late to work. So I cancelled and they charged me almost 6 dollars and change. I think 6.67. The fare itself was 8.87. Why would I want an Uber well past the time I asked for. People should t be able to sign up for rides past the time range designated unless approved by the passenger. That was Uber’s fault for allowing that to happen. I had to pay almost full fare and didn’t even get a ride. There are other transportation services. Perhaps I will go to them if this is the treatment I am going to receive.
title: Bad policy

review:
My card was used by someone else, and I did not give them permission to do so. I’ve been trying to contact Uber support for 5 days now, and everyone has just pushed me to the side. They keep saying my problem is resolved or they’re gonna transfer me to an expert team. I’m very upset and stressed out over this situation. My card has been used twice since reaching out.

UPDATE: I’m still getting pushed to the side. They refunded me for an Uber I didn’t even ask about. Uber staff, I’m more concerned with the fact someone has my card on their account and the TWO other charges that were charged to my account AFTER I reached out to them when I noticed activity on my card. This is the most pitiful customer service I have ever dealt with. I’m still hoping someone will help me out so I can fix this review, because everything else about the app has been great.
title: I have not received any help in the last 5 days

review:
These goons left my elderly mother stranded on the side of a highway near her drop-off location. She couldn’t get a ride back home because the driver either did not turn off the ride once it had been completed, or it was simply another Uber App error. I had to call in and have a driver pick her up, because there was an Uber error on her App. I confirmed it was not just her phone and/or knowledge of how the App works — we have all needed screenshots. This has happened too many times to count, and it would be prudent of Uber to refund the past several trips she has taken. Plus, her rating is far lower than mine, and much lower than it should be. 

My mother wears her mask, is polite, kind, and always considerate when getting in an Uber. Unfortunately, Uber does not return the favor. Instead; Uber leaves you stranded without a way to get home, and gives you a poor rating. -1/5 Stars.
title: Left Senior Citizen on the Side of a Highway
developerResponse: {'id': 4627320, 'body': "Hi, this certainly sounds frustrating. Let's make sure we follow up with you regarding this. Send in a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2018-08-13T07:45:50Z'}

review: Two of us age 85, both with walking difficulties and  needing transportation from our auto service repair center at 9:30pm back to our house  decided to risk trying Uber. It was a huge success.    The car, easily trackable,  arrived in one minute.  It was a beautiful SUV. The  woman driver Marina was very friendly and helpful.  She got out of the car to hold the back door for me and the front door for  my husband and also gave him guidance getting into her SUV, and when we arrived home, she again got out, opened and held the door,  and guided him getting out.   The ease of the Uber app and the gracious driver who responded combined to make our first Uber experience a 10 out of 10.
title: Our First Uber experience

review: The last 4 trips in a row now I’ve been overcharged for wait times that did NOT happen! Today they charged me again for a wait time when I was outside when the Uber driver got here and I was in the store for “2 minutes”!!!! So, if Uber, Lyft and Uber Lyft drivers are going to continue to do this, i will no longer tip the driver! I will leave 1 star reviews with no tip. I’m letting ALL social media platforms know to do this as well!! My whole round trip fare today was 7 minutes total. If I spent 6-7 minutes in the store, how could this be possible that the round trip took only 1 minute? Uber, Lyft n Uber, Lyft drivers are cheaters and thieves!! Two days ago my trip took 8 minutes total but they claimed I was in the store for 7.5 minutes. How is this possible? That’s ok lyft will pay a heavy price for cheating people!! I’ve deleted my Uber app and I’m going to delete my Lyft app as soon as my payment clears
title: Uber are thieves!!

review: I was doing a one time use of Uber while I let someone borrow my car. I was looking to see if there were drivers in my area as I was pressed for time and was left on a loading screen for 10 min as it was looking. At this point I decided to use Lyft, amazing service btw.  Keep in mind that I never accepted a ride from Uber or confirmed anything. I simply left the loading screen. Come to find out several days later they charged me a cancellation fee of $8. When I contacted them about this they credited my money back only as Uber Cash. Only to be used for their company to justify their mess up. When I checked my Uber account for the amount it was not added to my wallet, come to find out they had taken that $8 back. Long story short. This company is a thief and should be ashamed of themselves. Use Lyft instead, I’ll be giving them 5 stars.
title: They’ll charge your account without providing service!

review: The app does not allow you to rate a ride experience less than five stars without you selecting specific issues. The issue options in my opinion would mean the ride would be rated a one or two at best with the type of issues you’re given the option to choose from. The problem I have is sometimes you’re in a ride where you don’t care for the music being played, the driver doesn’t talk at all, and perhaps the car doesn’t smell overly fresh, even though it looks clean. You should be able to rate the ride to three or a four that having to select preset defined issues from Apple.  By doing this, it inflates the ratings of all ride experiences, because most people don’t want to take the time to select all those different issues when they are experiencing something not quite as harsh.
title: 5 stars or bust?

review: I use uber once a day if not twice to get to work in the mornings. Every driver ive ever had is amazing, thats not the problem. Its the app itself. Recently ive been noticing a problem where the drivers apps lose signal and will need me to direct them where I am going. as a young woman this scares me, because I don’t know if they have ill intentions or not. Again this is not a problem with the drivers but the app itself. They cannot find me even though I put a marker on the map of exactly where to pick me up, and as soon as i go on a manhunt in my neighborhood for the correct car they tell me they don’t know where Im going because they lost signal. This is not my neighborhoods issue, ive been using the app for months and havent had the problem until recently.
title: Using Uber Daily Is A Nightmare

review:
Hi!

I just started using the Uber app to help transport my father who can’t drive anymore. I’ve had fairly good experiences using Uber for myself. I now have to schedule my father’s future appointments and to get back and forth easily. 

I tried to schedule a pickup ahead of time for him with Uber reserve but it only gives me the option to schedule for myself currently with reserve. I know that I can schedule instant pick ups and designate them for him then but I would prefer to schedule them for him a few days ahead instead of the day of for his appointments. If you could add the “add a rider” function while scheduling for Uber reserve that would be GREATLY beneficial
title: - Please Allow us to schedule a ride ahead of time for another person with Uber Reserve

review: Being trans, I was born with one name and then changed it to another. I am in the legal process right now of getting my name change, and I get major dysphoria every time I go into an Uber and hear a named that is from my past and I no longer identify with. Uber is a great ride share company, as are several others, but I usually stick to Uber. Nevertheless the process of getting my name updated at Uber was nearly impossible. I tried updating in on the contact field on several occasions, and although I attempted multiple times and explained that I was getting a name change, every attempt of mine was rejected and left unresolved. This led me on several occasions to feel humiliated in front of my friends explaining that my Uber driver may pull up and call out for a different name. If an Uber executive reads this, please make it easy for trans people to change their name on the app.
title: Not letting me change my name

review:
It’s been some years since Uber and it’s uniquely design and fast service of getting from point A to B , has established. The concerns at early stage of its development within the transportation industry and the taxi industry in particular was at a high-level , it was forecasted by some experts that it’s gonna wipe out the taxi industry and creat hardship for the business’s that cater to them . 

Taking a look at the overall impact that Uber or lift have delivered to boost economy  is vividly visual. Starting from the Automotive Repair industry as the Uber cars are in need of by applying more miles to the vehicles in fleet to the assisting the community with transportation at the time of shortages on new car dealerships .
title: Concept of Uber and it’s magnitude

review: I never write reviews. But I’ve been using Uber for about 10 years, I stoped using in for almost a year and when I came back to it I noted that literally EVERY TIME I request and Uber, it finds me a driver and then 5 minutes later the driver cancels. Sometimes this will happen 3-4 times in a row. It sometimes takes over 20 minutes to get connected with a driver. Yesterday it took us over 30 minutes from the time we called an Uber to the time we got to our destination (which was only 10 minutes away). I ended up late for my meeting. This has been a frustrating experience that has rendered this app unreliable. The fact that Uber allows it’s drivers to cancel trips so frequently is terrible. IF YOU ACCEPT THE RIDE, YOU MUST FOLLOW THROUGH. I can understand emergency situations, but the frequency at which this happens tells me that the drivers are picking and choosing.
title: Driver cancel rides constantly

review:
I have been using uber very often, especially at night and the ubers cancel me and send me to another but the fee appears in my bank account and when they refund it the amount is less and they charge me as if I had canceled, trips of $50 that I doubles appear because the uber cancel me, that should not happen especially when they cancel and not me.
I am very upset about this and will switch to Lyft, 😡
The numbers do not seem clear to me in my account, they do not send an explanation of the refund, it is very annoying that being a company with so much demand and serious, it is incredible that these things happen without any justification
title: Double charge

review: I got in to the airport at 12:50 AM had trouble getting on app when I finally did I made a pick up reservation when the guy arrived he loaded my luggage I got in the back and he said Cooper was having a lot of problems with Maps and was almost shut down. He told me he could take cash or Venmo. I told him I wasn't comfortable he canceled my trip and I knew trip said they were on their way. Being uncomfortable with this I canceled and was charged $4.95 . I did not cancel with this person he canceled with me because I wouldn't give him cash. I did not order another driver and should not have been charged. This makes me very uncomfortable. I then made another reservation with an Uber driver and asked him about this he said there was no problems with Uber and that drivers do this usually on weekends to get paid cash. I feel this gives Uber a bad name and I will be requesting my refund
title: Nashville international airport

review:
The app’s interface is easy enough to use. Better than Lyft’s by a country mile. The drivers are usually friendly, and the cars are all usually clean. And their prices are generally competitive with Lyft’s. Depending on demand they may be higher or lower (usually higher).

That said, Uber’s definition of a luxury car may not be the same as yours, especially when you’re charged upwards of $120 for a 45min trip. If I’m paying car service money, I expect a quiet, comfortable, sophisticated Lincoln Town Car, or a Mercedes, BMW or Audi of some sort. What I got was a 6 seater Chevy Suburban. I wouldn’t spend $120 to buy a Suburban outright! Now, if I was spending $40 on an UberX, that would be one thing, and I wouldn’t complain. But for an Uber Black, with the promise of a luxury car? No.
title: Fine in a pinch, but premium options aren’t.

review: don’t sign up for this. they’ll find your credit card information and charge you for premium membership services without your consent. they bank on you not checking your credit statement every month. they only give refunds up to ninety days in the past. I didn’t notice they’d gotten my info and “gifted” me an “uber pass” — something that doesn’t even exist anymore —and cost me ten bucks a month ($100 in my case) for not noticing it. i def learned from this mistake to pay more attention to the details of my bills for sneaky companies that do stuff like this. I lost a hundred dollars to an app whose services i didn’t know i was paying for, didn’t want in the first place, and never even used!! i didn’t know they’d been charging me until it was too late. be smarter than me and check your statements often, but also avoid this company. they’re predatory. do not download!!!
title: scammed me out of $120

review: I’m starting to think I no longer want to use Uber. I’m always on time, say hello, wear a mask, I don’t eat or drink in the car, am rarely even on the phone, but my ratings have suffered.
