I’m not much of a chatterer but I don’t think I need to be. I don’t think I need to have a conversation with the driver. I often like to decompress in the car and often stare out the window. Thinking of using Curbed, the NYC taxi app. I’m done fretting over my ratings. And I read someone else’s review and I do agree that tips should be earned. When I get into a car, I should be asked if I mind their music, etc. If I do decide to ride with Uber again, I’ll be more honest (harsher) with my reviews of the drivers. They seem to be judging me rather harshly. It would be helpful to know why I’m getting bad reviews. Obviously, I’m repeating the same behavior but I have no clue what I’m doing.
title: My Uber rating

review:
I recently deleted the UberEats app upon realizing that I could order food from the Uber app. I try to keep my phone clear of unnecessary apps, so I was excited for the prospect of eliminating a redundancy.

I was mistaken. My second food order via the Uber app I had an issue, but none of the order help options are available (change order, cancel order, chat for help). By the time I had downloaded the UberEats app it was too late to make any changes/cancel without being charged the full price in penalty, though then I at least had access to refund policies and the chat feature.

Uber, please don't offer a service via the app if it doesn't include all of the basic service features.
title: Multifunctionality would be nice

review: I used to LOVE Uber back in 2019 but since the pandemic has cooled off a bit it seems as if Uber decided to just SCAM people. A ride up the block costs me $30! Not to mention the driver himself was 30 minutes away. On top of that he came late. I wanted to cancel my ride right there and then and  decided I could just walk, but they wanted to charge me $10 just to CANCEL it? I was extremely upset. I’m paying so much for such delayed service. The prices aren’t worth it. I’d rather put that unnecessary large amount towards a restaurant where I am getting fed and actually talked to by the server…. I spent 5 minutes in a car with someone who doesn’t even talk to me. I feel bad I don’t even tip because I’m spending such an unbelievable amount on NOTHING. Down graded like CRAZY!! I might just stick to Lyft for now on. Uber needs to step its game up quick.
title: DONT WASTE TIME/MONEY

review: After a long uncomfortable flight, arriving in Charlotte at 8 o’clock in the evening, traveling solo as a woman, dragging all my luggage it was such a relief when Aaron was prompt upon arriving, he loaded my luggage. He had a very clean vehicle. It smelled nice. He had nice music playing at a nice level. He did not mind that I cracked the window a little and during our 25 minute ride to my home, we had a pleasant conversation as we had several things in common as grandparents, etc. it was quite a pleasure talking to him. It was actually the most relaxing part of the whole entire day of traveling. I would highly recommend Aaron in the gold Lexus, great job,  very delightful fella and very safe driver.
title: Aaron Uber in Charlotte

review:
She is so professional and helpful, and truly exceeded my expectations, ESPECIALLY on Christmas Day, by delivering a bag of forgotten food to my family at another location while I am home recovering from illness & injury. THANK YOU, SABRINA!
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
UBER CORPORATE: You would be severely and regretfully remiss if you do not give this excellent example of a driver a monetary or gift as ax tangible recognition of her going above and beyond on CHRISTMAS DAY, and apparently everyday, of her career as an exemplary employee of your company. It’s employees like HER that make UBER a good service. Thank you for your time, and I trust that you will treat this top-notch female employee in a way that truly reflects YOUR thankfulness for Sabrina, a supreme driver employee. Best regards, Megan H., RI
title: SABRINA WAS LIKE SANTA CLAUS TODAY!

review: I’ve used Uber so many times and I always tipped great but then they overcharged my ride by double amount by giving the driver a ridiculously long route . I then tried to go through the website and complain and that is a set up catch 22 and there is no chat and no live persons you can speak to. On my way back using Lyft the rider explained that Lyft charges what is quoted at request , unlike Uber who charges more if caught in traffic etc . When I got home by a way shorter route than what Uber took me I was charged half what Uber charged!!! Use Lyft !!! Lyft has my business now and their drivers will be the ones to get my good tips now.. Lyft is great and With Uber No Recourse!!!
title: Overcharged

review:
I ordered a Uber for the second time ever and the ride was going to be $27 which I was fine with but before I paid the Uber app offered a discount if I signed up and used UberPass and told me I’d save %10 on my purchase. I went ahead and did that and like and behold they charged me $24 for UberPass and $27 for the ride still. That’s very deceptive and they don’t have any real customer service, so they only replied that they charged me for UberPass and ignored all the information I just relayed. This is a terribly deceptive move. I wouldn’t ever recommend Uber because of this

Update: They fixed the issue and Uber now has my business again. I appreciated the fix
title: Ripped me off with deceptive moves

review: Ive never been more frustrated with an app in my life. Downloaded it in Turkey. Drivers kept picking up the ride but would ask me “where are we going?” and “I don’t where you are!” Even though they have a freaking map to show both things. Then they would not arrive at all and I would have to cancel 4 rides in a row and then Uber charges ME a fee for canceling the ride. What the actual …!   The I arrive in South Africa. My credit cards suddenly are red flagged for no reason so I start using cash. Once I order the food with cash, the guy comes and says oh sorry my phone died. He drives off with my money and does not put in the app that I paid. Now theres an outstanding order that I cant pay and I cant order more food or rides. I tried to contact uber but they purposely have no way of contacting them. Total horse crap. Just one thing after another. Will never use it if I dont have to.
title: Absolute Crap

review: What a fantastic Uber trip ride from work in West Des Moines to my home in Waukee. My first time using Uber and just installed app the night before after getting home with some car trouble of my own: the App was easy to use and setting up a driver was easy. James arrived in a short time later. James was very friendly, knowledgeable and knew right where he was going . No second guessing. His car was clean and ready for his customers. Extremely happy with James and as my car gets fixed I hope to be able to use him again during this week and I would definitely recommend James to other customers. Thank you for a awesome trip!!!!!
title: First Uber Trip

review: Yuki picked me quickly at my home. He provided me with good conversation. My son had my car and he ran out of gas. I was perturbed to say the least and through the ride there Yuki calmed me with cool jazz playing in the background. The scent of his car was neutral that I also found appealing. My tension about my car being stuck in the left on busy route 27 in Hainz City dissipated thus proving me a relaxed manner to resolve my cars situation. I do so hope should I need Uber that he be available to drive me wherever I need to go. He is an asset to whoever hires him and he is easy going arriving at the destination in a safe and rapid manner observing the rules of the road. I wish him well.
title: 911 ride to assist my Son

review:
I have been trying to cancel a reservation for the last 45 minutes. My reservation was confirmed by email, however the message I continue to get in the app is “your connection does not work; we cannot connect you to our network. I have no problem getting into the app and seeing my ride history, however not the current 5:30 am reservation. I began trying to cancel this reservation at 11:45 pm and it is now 12:45. I will not pay any charges for this ride!!!! I see their terms about how easy it is to cancel - nope, not so!!!
Now I can’t rate this as “all nicknames are taken; try again. Even XxxxxxX taken???? Really???
title: Cancelling a ride

review: I ordered an Uber ride the day before my flight from NJ to Philadelphia. When my ride was about to be at my home it cancelled. I second Uber driving was coming instead at at least minute again he cancelled. I was getting nervous I’d miss my flight. A third Uber driving finally arrived at my house and had no idea where I was going and when I said Philadelphia he did not want to do it but was amazingly sympathetic that 2 Uber drivers cancelled on me last minute he took me. He explained that the other 2 Uber drivers cancelled once they found out I was going yo Philadelphia. How could the company Uber confirm my ride the day before and the drivers do not know where they are taking a passenger and when they find out last minute where they’re going, they can simply cancel you ride. Thankfully I made my flight on time. Horrible company. Beware which is why I have to share my experience.
title: Cancellations

review: I’ve had several issues with Uber in the past, but I’ve continued to try to give it a chance. This time, Uber’s poor customer service almost cost me my flight. I scheduled a trip ahead of time to make sure there were no issues, but on the day of, my driver stayed in the same location for 30 minutes before I eventually called a Lyft and cancelled my ride. There is no way on the app to report a driver not going anywhere and Uber does not provide a phone number for service, instead forcing you to use a narrow set of options on the app which do not cover the issue I faced. The worst of it all, the driver did not come to pick me up but I was still charged over $20 in cancellation fee. If you need a rideshare, you’re better off trying your luck hitchhiking. You’ll probably receive better customer service that way anyways.
title: When good, it’s good. When bad, it’s horrible.

review:
I had mostly great Uber drivers in Augusta, Georgia, Las Vegas, and Florida, over the past few months. However, March 4, I took Uber to see Metallica in Vegas, and another Uber back to my hotel. The traffic was bad on the way to concert, but driver was great. During the ride back, the traffic was much better. However, the Jerk male driver constantly talked to me about all his family problems in China, and drove me out of the way. When I asked where he was going, he mumbled something. The same trip was TWICE as far, and his conversation was irritating. I Know he was trying to distract me, especially when I asked where was he going. 
I complained to Uber, requested some of my money back, and gave him a 1 star rating. I haven’t seen a reply???!!!
title: 90% great

review: If the restaurant turns out to be closed, Uber eats will just continue to send delivery drivers there with no option of actually canceling the order. The delivery drivers have no clue what is going on so they keep accepting the order. And the app is so broken it won’t even notify during the preparation phase when the order is actually able to be cancelled. I had to literally close my whole app before is told me the place was closed and by then it was too late to cancel. What a scummy thing to do to your own employees on thanksgiving, they’re supposed to be getting pay incentives today; not driving to random closed locations because your software devs couldn’t be bothered to add an easier way to cancel orders or ANY form of support when the customer support phone line is down. I don’t support businesses that don’t care about their customers or employees!
title: Don’t order on holidays, it’s broken

review: I used Uber for about 4 years with very little issues. About a year ago it stopped letting me log in. This was after I bought the premium pass. They refunded my premium purchase but still wouldn’t let me use their rides? Then I just deleted the app and forgot about it. After traveling a few weekends ago I wanted to try to get back on the app. I went through their customer support and they said I had made two accounts, but they would merge them for me. They wanted to use an old phone number so I gave them my new phone number to use. Then I got an email back that I had violated their terms and conditions. I’ve been playing email tag trying to figure out what term I violated but they refuse to give me a straight answer. It’s crazy how a billion dollar company doesn’t have a phone number for customer support. Well I guess I’ll just keep using Lyft since they refuse to help me.
title: Banned?

review:
Happy to say I am no longer a virgin passenger. 
First ever ride was tonight. It was a quick round trip to pick up a cell phone for someone who left it behind in my car that someone borrowed for work  3 miles one way in a small town. Downloaded the app, it was very user friendly to navigate. Popped in the address (had to google how to do a round trip but simple). Added the destination, wasn’t going to stress how to save my pick up location/final destination as “Home”, so simply typed it again. Literally, from when I thought 
“Hey maybe I’ll take an Uber” thru the app download, ordering the ride, retrieving the phone, to when I walked back in my house with the phone…… 16 MINUTES!! 

I was nonplussed. I believe it’s taken me longer to leave the driver a tip and a 5 star rating along with typing this review, then it did to make the initial decision to take the Uber for the task at hand.  

Big shout out to Jackson for his professional service. My first impressions of Uber went above and beyond how I’d imagined it. Definitely wouldn’t hesitate to use it again.
title: First impression

review:
I’m an Uber driver. Platinum Driver with a 4.98 Star rating after driving for 8-9 months. I’ve been ripped off with my money and fair and Uber stole it from me. Make sure if you become a driver to have yourself protected by taking screenshots of your rides and fairs and all the money you’ve earned within the day/week. Make sure Uber doesn’t blame you for things Uber did, not the driver. Have proof and evidence, it does help.
Support is not much help at all. “We are only here to support. Not fix the problem”…. What is the whole point of support if you can’t fix the problem. Very false advertising for the ranking to have the “best of the best support” with a high rank… do you have to be diamond rank to get the better support??? All drivers should get as much support and help as possible. Not wait for the problems to be fixed, especially while they were trying to make money that night/day.
title: Uber Driver

review: I have used Uber for year's now. Recently, the quality of rides have gone down hill so severely that I am no longer going to be using the app. It is a shame. I gave Uber three strikes. First, my girlfriend and I got in an Uber where the driver was posing as there grandmother on the app. Second, I was assigned a driver that was not the one driving the car. And finally, my girlfriend and I got in and Uber that disregarded the map multiple times despite us voicing our concerns. This is the first negative review I have ever written about a company because my loved ones safety has been comprised multiple times. We used to love having Uber as an option, but now the risk is worth is not worth the reward. We will be trying other alternatives for our travel needs from now on.
title: Severe Safety Issues

review: Uber is a really great app! but sometimes it has its glitches such as one time I was ordering an uber to work and the usual time would be around 4-7 minutes for my uber to come. As usually I decided to order my uber and It came up as 4 minutes but then once it chose my uber it told me I had to wait 31 minutes?! I was so shocked but I quickly canceled it so I wasn’t charged which is also a good thing. I’ve also had more experiences like that but never too later like it would tell me 4 minutes and then send me an uber 8 minutes away. I think this is the only thing i’ve had trouble with but besides that It’s a really good app!.
title: Minutes

review:
I recently had a rather disappointing experience with the Uber app due to what I perceived as discriminatory policies and deceptive practices.

Firstly, when attempting to cancel my Uber One membership, I was offered a 40% discount to encourage me to renew my membership. However, despite selecting this option, the discount was never applied, and Uber failed to honor their offer. It is advisable to take a screenshot of the discount at the time of application to provide evidence, as Uber may not follow through.

Furthermore, as an Uber One member, I encountered a genuine issue with a couple of rides around the same timeframe. Unfortunately, this resulted in my profile being flagged. When seeking assistance from customer service on a new serious issue, I experienced rude and unhelpful behavior. Simply mentioning any trouble I was having with my ride was met with threats of profile suspension or blocking. This treatment left me feeling frustrated and unheard. At the end, I had to accept it and move on as it was never corrected. 

Overall, I found Uber's policies and customer service practices to be highly disappointing. The lack of transparency and respectful assistance when faced with valid concerns is concerning. I hope that Uber takes steps to address these issues and improve their services in the future.
title: Terrible customer service

review: The app of Uber is probably the best look wise which is why I gravitate towards it but honestly it’s double the price of other apps which makes me not use it. A 4 minute car ride would’ve cost me $19 on here and on the Lyft app it was only $10 but I had a small wait time which I’d rather do then pay double. When it’s late night and your trying to get picked up fast Ubers probably better but Generally I use Lyft because of the different pricing options ( such as u can wait 10-25 minutes to make it cheaper but they almost always come in 5ish minutes despite that time frame) and I wish Uber had that type of option other then choosing the type of car which doesn’t make it cheaper it just makes it more expensive
title: Better options

review: My suggestion is to be patient and give it time. Take account of what people suggest. As in taking two orders at a time or taking orders after midnight. Call them every time you have an issue. Be kind. Each time I’ve had an issue I have called and they resolved it. Door dash is not accepting any new drivers and some are in holding status like me cause too many in my area. Grub hub is also on hold. So this is my only option. It’s not perfect but what job is. In any job if they don’t treat you fairly then leave but again o can’t stress enough to call on every issue and be kind. Some complain they don’t make enough when some of us need that 20 even if that’s all we earn. Just a thought.
title: Give it time

review: I’ve been using this app for a few months now and for the first few rides it was great but whenever I had to set up a ride for a later date every driver would be unavailable and if I did magically get one they would flake on me and cancel the ride. Now I’ve had a few great drivers and I really appreciate them but the system itself is horrible and so difficult to actually even get the ride it makes me not even want to use it. Do with this information as you please but if you NEED to go somewhere on time I just wouldn’t recommend them. I’ve had to cancel multiple appointments because of the no shows as well as not even being able to use the Uber rewards that they’ve given me for all the canceled rides :( I hate giving a bad review but I just can’t give them anywhere close to five stars
title: Unreliable.

review: I needed a ride to the airport 60 miles away, in the very early AM on very short notice. I planned to drive myself, but had car trouble the night before my trip. A family member reserved a ride for me at 4:00 AM -  to the wrong airport. I found the error at 3:20 AM. I was able to cancel it easily in the app at no charge, book the correct trip, and get a driver. Mitchell was timely (early, in fact!! For a 4 AM trip booked at the last minute!!), polite, helped with my luggage, friendly, played reasonable music in the car, and got me where I needed to go when I needed to be there. Thanks, Uber. You really came through when I needed you.
title: Great Service on Short Notice

review: Wanna guess how many times, in the past 4 months, the Lyft app ha sent me a random, unsolicited notification about how much money I can save on my first ‘Lyft Eats’ order…. None, the answer is none. Stop it, Uber. Quit with the incessant notifications about UberEats, or how you’re ‘ready to take me somewhere’. I get it, I know what you do, that’s why I’ve got your app. No, I have zero desire to use UberEats, quit pestering me about it. I totally understand you have drivers ready and waiting to fulfill my every personal-taxi need. Unless you need to tell me something that directly affects a ride I’ve either scheduled or have on the way, leave me alone. Every time (and it’s pretty darn frequent) I look down at my phone to see yet another Uber notification (that has absolute nothing to do with anything I’ve asked Uber to do) I question why in the world I bother with the annoyance. Seriously, quit…
title: STOP SPAMMING ME WITH UBER EATS NOTIFICATIONS!

review:
For years I have had problems with Uber, particularly in France. If you need a ride you can count on, order a cab or real limo service. 

I have had many drivers cancel last minute on me. This morning was the worst. I scheduled a pickup to go to the train station at 4:55 am. All looked good on the app and we got on the street. Then, nothing. No drivers and they silently made my reservation disappear without warning. Then we tried to book on my wife’s Uber abd they rejected her payment. We updated to a new Visa card and it still wouldn’t accept payment. Frustrating and disappointing in every way. Having had years of bad experiences with Uber in France, I suspected this would happen and left enough time to walk the 2.5km to the train station ourselves, which we had to do as there are were no buses or taxis. Next time I’ll just book a black car service I can count on.
title: Unreliable in France

review: I’ve been using Uber for about 3yrs and haven’t had a big problem, but the other night I had an Uber driver that made me feel very uncomfortable and unsafe. Telling me that I don’t need to wear my mask and when I said I wanted to wear it, he put a thong on his face saying that it was his mask then continued to push me to take off my mask. I reported this to Uber three times and the only responses I got were that the drivers are supposed to wear masks and nothing about the actual situation. I proceeded to tell them I am not going to be using Uber anymore because of this, a line was crossed and nothing was being done. They then sent me $3 in uber cash and said thank you for reporting. Which is pointless because I told them I will not be using their services anymore. Overall the app is okay, there’s just a lot of scary people and I feel uber itself could of handled the situation a little better.
title: Bad support team

review: Five stars all the way. I’ve used Uber with old accounts and the one I’m using now sooo many times! Always had great drivers and experiences. I recently had my first and hopefully last a bad experience with a driver. Long story short I was only taken part of the way to my destination and had to walk the rest of the way. I was very upset because I have never had such an experience with Uber, but I know you can’t control some of the drivers. I wrote my concerns to Uber, I actually asked for a full refund, but they reasonably gave me about 50% off of my ride. They heard my concern quick and did something about it. I love this app! Thanks Uber.
title: Love this app!

review: Uber is randomly charging people $9.99 a month for a subscription to Uber one. I never signed up and I never wanted it. I only ride Uber once or twice a year when I travel other than that I do not use it regularly and I would never sign up for Uber one because I don’t use it regularly but yet this charge showed up and I never signed up for any of it and after looking at all the posts on Reddit it seems like they are randomly adding this charge on peoples credit card and unless you’re checking your credit card statement regularly you could be charged 9.99 a month without knowing it. I went to the app to try to cancel and it is not that easy. You have to actually talk to somebody. This is a piece of crap that they need to stop. I’m contemplating just deleting the app and only using Lyft. Companies that do scam stuff really don’t deserve anyone’s business.
title: Uber One

review: I tried to add a family member to the family profile. Everything seemed to work fine, until that person tried to request a ride, and, despite the fact that the entire profile was set up exactly correctly (he shows up in my family profile, and the family profile shows up on his app, and he has the correct profile selected), it kept giving him an error message, and it wouldn’t work. I attempted to request a ride on my end, and because he was in another state, the Uber app kept defaulting back to my location for the pick up spot. This family member nearly missed a train because of this. This should be easier. The app is not intuitive, it is not visually clear. This app is fantastic when it works, but this was completely ridiculous. There’s absolutely no reason for this. I am absolutely furious.
title: Family profile not working

review: Overall it was a little touch and go to locate a driver for a 2+ hour driver. The frustration with that is I made the reservation ahead of time to only have the driver cancel the ride that was assigned to them (more than once)  Not sure how that works when you need to catch a flight or are expected at a specific time somewhere. That said, The driver that accepted the reservation was committed and even arrived early! I hope in the future there is a better way to be assured of a driver ahead of time without them cancelling. Also, the bank put a hold on my account because of so many pending transactions. I’ll be watching my account to make sure all cancelled rides were refunded.
title: Long distance drive

review:
I try to always write good reviews, but sometimes your drivers very much make it challenging. Last night first driver 
had to wait 15 minutes. He was 1 mile from my location and canceled the ride.. second driver was 13 minutes out that within a half mile of my location and canceled again… third driver nine minutes out. Got literally one minute from my location and canceled. it is ridiculous !!!
4th driver was 13 minutes out, and I begged him to come and told him I would tip him…
Nicest driver ever and didn’t want my tip and felt really bad that I have been sitting out in the cold for 45 minutes waiting for a driver that would just show up.. Uber needs to figure out if a driver excepts the client they cannot cancel..
Makes me want to go back to yellow cab
title: Drivers canceled

review: I’ve been trying to become a driver for Uber and one of the things they require is a background check, the last time I tried was in 2019 and they denied me because I had a ticket from 2017. I’m now trying to do another background check and the only way I can do that is if they send in a request to “checkr” except when I ask them to send in a request they just send pointless canned messages that don’t get you anywhere, when I called into checkr they told me that I would need to have Uber send in a request on my behalf so for the past week it’s been a back and forth game with both customer services and it’s gotten me nowhere. You’d think Uber would have the capabilities to reset your account so you could resend a background request but they refuse. Mind you I’ve been driving for Lyft for 4 years and they’ve never given me this issue.
title: Incompetent customer service

review: Takes 3-4 days for a response. They tell you to try things you’ve told them you’ve already done like updating app, verifying location services on, etc... I still haven’t been able to get the app to show me the Uber Rewards program option, have provided them with screenshots but every time you reply they assign a new mouth breather who doesn’t read the details of the issue. Waste of time when this process takes 3-4 days between messages. Also the “messages” portion of the app doesn’t work.  It shows new messages all the time but nothing available to actually read.
title: Customer Support for the App is Severely Lacking

review: Uber is great when your car breaks down and you need a ride. It’s also great when you can ride as a group and split the cost of the drive. You can also add stops when heading to your destination which is great when your needing some groceries or to pay a bill before going home. You can also see the location of your driver arriving and correct and destination needed. You can also give your driver a tip and 5 stars for doing an amazing job unless you had a bad time which can happen but is very unlikely. The Uber app is overall easy and amazing to operate. I’ll definitely tell my friends about it. Thanks Uber.
title: This Uber App Is Amazing

review: My driver, Bradley picked me up in his Tesla Model 3 and my first impression was how “cool” it was to finally ride in a Tesla. However, I had to “shoe-horn” myself into the back seat due to the low roof line height. Afterwards, I was truly impressed by the acceleration of the car and the quietness of the cabin. Finally, it obvious that Bradley had no time to waste because my trip home was over before I could begin to ask the litany of questions that I had about the car. I suppose it is a function of the fact that senior citizens like me don’t need super cars like Teslas as grocery-getters but the experience was worth the extra expense. Thank you and God bless you and your family.
title: My “Tesla” Ride Home

review: reason I rated it so low was because of uber eats! uber is great but uber eats is horrible. first of all it takes 45-60 minutes or more for even small orders. when i finally got my order, which was a simple coke, it was not only flat but also warm like it had been sitting outside. then when i reached out to customer services I sent a picture and described exactly what was wrong. they than said my refund would arrive 3-5 business days later. days later guess what! no refund so i check the app and they tell me i asked for a refund to late so it was not processed! i asked 5 minutes after i got the drink. so i contact costumer support and i get the worst help ever. in the end after 30 minutes of talking to support they said they are not doing anything and then ended the chat. doordash is way better!
title: Uber Eats is trash?!!

review: I am severely having a problem with changing the profile pic for my account, but for me, on my end, the app will only show the family profile, instead of labeling a button specifically called, change profile, and yes, it is absolutely driving me nuts as well. No one should be having to go through this awful experience with the application, especially when they are just trying to specifically change there profile pic, when the app will not allow me to do so, and it stinks. but otherwise, so far so good. And I still love it however it is. anyways, please continue to keep on making this app more accessible to those with visual impairments. Thank you for your service.
title: No accessibility issues here whatsoever, only 1 problem.

review: So my Uber experience has been great for the past two years. Before that I hadn’t used it for a while because of one altercation with what was clearly an intoxicated driver. I had switched to Lyft instead. But I decided to give it another try and Uber is not only cheaper in prices almost 90% of the time, but since they shifted and focused their efforts into more in depth customer service training for their drivers, they have definitely surpassed Lyft drivers. Basically what I’m saying is if you had a bad Uber experience in the past and haven’t used it since, give it another try. They have definitely stepped up their game.
title: They turned a new leaf

review:
Hello Uber,
I have had two drivers cancel on me because although my location IS correct, the driving location is wrong.   I have messaged the drivers too my location and how to reach me and most find me, others have passed me and circled back, two canceled on me.  
Also I have had other drivers cancel right before reaching me and when I order another driver, the rate has increased.  Are they canceling to get paid more??  I hope not.  This has also happened to my son.   Besides these incidents, I do enjoy using Uber.   I have a fractured foot so driving is not something I can do at the moment, so I am using Uber more than ever.
title: Driver map directions

review:
How can you improve the Google maps for drivers that are coming to you on a surge situation— the route that the driver had to take was totally a circle way around where I was waiting to be picked up and the driver could’ve easily gotten off at the interstate and made one right turn and drove 1 mile instead of driving 8 miles in a complete circle downtown and back up again according to your infamous Google map! 

Get a better algorithm with those maps. Period.  This has happened more than four times in the rides I’ve taken with various drivers over the past month. FYI-they’re frustrated too!   As a customer and an investor I am beyond annoyed. 

Kindly resolve this because I paid not only a surcharge but paid a fuel charge to watch someone drive 10 miles outside of where he could’ve just made one turn to drive 1/4 mile to a surge paying customer. 

Again SURGE the efficient of the Google Maps to provide more efficient and time saving routes ASAP. 

I remain a loyal yet dissatisfied customer 

Marjorie Ocho Kouns
title: Requesting a more efficient Google map for drivers to get to customers directly.

review: Honestly the Uber service is not what it once was here In the capital city of Colombia. Uber has become such a pain to use. Uber drivers need to be trained that they are doing a service for the community, not the other way around, where the community is doing a service for Uber drivers. They cancel on you constantly just because they don’t want to go far or they ask you, the client, the cancel. Once, I almost missed my international flight because I scheduled for a ride in the early morning before rush hour, but then the Uber driver canceled without me noticing and it took nearly 45 mins to get another driver willing to take me due to rush hour. I narrowly made the flight. This, coupled with a few other incidents has really change my perception and use of Uber. Uber used to be reliable but it no longer reliable.
title: Bogotá, Colombia

review: I rented a Tesla for almost two weeks (14 days and 13 nights).  Although I had highlighted ore-existing damage before I drove away to begin the trip, the owner claimed I had done hundreds of dollars damage to his car.  I was the only driver and I know I did not damaged his car, and after about two weeks of having a deposit taken from my credit card and taking a lot of time to outline the truth and how I didn’t damage his car (and promising I’d take it to the Better Business Bureau, Consumer Financial Protection Board, etc.), I was found to have NOT caused the damage.  But what REALLY irked me was the factual review I submitted for the car owner was REMOVED BY TURO.  I’ve asked for an explanation about why my review was hidden with no answer.  I will never use Turo again and I will warn others so they don’t make the same mistake I did.  It is not even close to being worth it, believe someone who tried it…
title: Systematic fraud

review: This app never works never lets me add my card to it. Tells me “unknown error” and that’s literally all I gives me, no troubleshooting, no customer support it’s just like “nahh” every time. Even when I circumnavigate the need for my card by linking other payment methods, it requests my card for further verification, which it will then not accept. Had this app for years and it has never once worked for me. Absolute trash eating up space on my phone. —— It’s been some time since my first review and all I can say is that I still despise this company with all of my heart - They simply cannot do anything right any time I call on them. I cannot say enough negative about Uber. Any situation I’ve ever relied upon them in they have hung me out to dry I will here on out try to convince everyone I know to use Lyft. Thanks for endlessly sucking, Uber! I wish anguish and stressful failure upon this company.
title: This app is garbage

review: I will be uninstalling the app and telling all my friends to do the same. Today was the last straw I had with this app, im tired of spending TONS of money when 9/10 they get the order wrong every single time. If you like to order something and get something different after waiting for an hour+ and spending money for delivery fees, tips, taxes. You spend 25$ for a 7$ meal only to get the order wrong. Oh and the best part is, I’ve been looking online for the last 30 minutes for their phone number. But they don’t have one. I found a link in the app to request a refund, but it just gets denied. So now I get to sit here with my 25$ medium fry. Will never recommend this app to anyone, and will actually be encouraging people to use better apps that actually have a customer service. I expect better, especially when I’m paying this much.
title: Worst Customer service ever!!!

review:
WORST customer service!!! My account got hacked (password was changed and two step verification was set up by someone else) and I received no help. A week later, 620EGP (I live in the US, that is Egyptian currently) was taken out of my account. Uber support did NOTHING to help, and closed out my “help message” saying the issue was resolved, when the last message they had sent was “We’re sending your message to an expert team”. 
So now, even though my bank and Paypal have both filed the charge as fraud, Uber refuses to remove the charge, and continues to allow a hacker access to my private information. 
Fun fact! If you “owe” Uber money, you can’t deactivate your account, so now I have the constant fear that money will leave my account without my permission at any time.
Do NOT use this app if you appreciate a response from Uber after your sensitive information gets stolen.
title: BEWARE
developerResponse: {'id': 24995273, 'body': "Hi! Sorry to hear about your concern regarding the account being hacked. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve to your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE . We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2021-09-09T06:42:51Z'}

review: Uber is amazing for allowing other forms of payment such as plasma cards  , Uber also allows you to add 2 stops before you final destination Lyft only allows one stop additionally Uber does not believe in leaving their riders behind so if you go past a certain time limit you could get charged more money but you will not be left unless you are gone an excessive Ammount of time such as 20 plus minutes with out getting the driver to agree to wait ,  over all it is an amazing app , with the exception of your occasional unstable driver due to mental illness being on the rise in the USA after Covid , UBER is 99 percent a safe traveling app !
title: Uber /best for my donation card

review: Whenever I get ready to schedule an Uber, before I hit the “confirm” button, it usually says it will take about 10 minutes, give or take, for the driver to arrive, but after I hit confirm, it jumps to 25 minutes! I schedule my Uber rides early so that I can be early, but that’s rarely possible because of this. It’s really problematic, at this point. I just scheduled an Uber (to go to work) that said that the driver was 8 minutes away, but when I hit “confirm”, it jumped to 24 minutes! Yesterday, my coworker took me home from work because my Uber driver canceled my ride, but when I tried to schedule another ride, the rate doubled and then tripled! I can’t say that I like this app. It gets three stars for getting me to my destinations safely.
title: It’s very difficult to be early

review:
Uber charged me $20 because a dog’s paws got water on a seat cover. 

My friend and I were going to a party and wanted to bring his dog. I was willing to get the Uber pet service so the guy could go along (this does cost extra compared to a regular Uber). The car arrives and has a seat cover on the back car seat. We all sit in the back. After finishing my ride without incident, we get out and the Uber drives away. The next day, I was charged a $40 cleaning fee. I challenged the fee. 

Uber responded by telling me that there was a “drool mess” and sent me a photo of what are clearly paw prints left by some water. The dog had walked through some water on the way there. I point this out and they respond with “our bad, it should only be $20.”

 I am understanding of having to keep the Uber clean and paying a reasonable fee accordingly. However, $20 for some water on a seat cover is criminal. Customer service refused to explain why it should cost so much. They also did not actually understand my complaint and at one point apologized to me about the “time it took to clean” when I was the rider.  I ended up giving up on getting the other $20 back.

Do not use UberPet, and know that if a driver sends them a picture of water on a removeable seat cover that they can charge you $20 too.
title: UberPet is a scam

review: From the point of review of iPhone 5 user. - Too much screen space is taken up with advertising about me using Uber to order food. - Too much screen space is taken up showing me my last several destinations. - When I start typing a destination, use those first few letters to match possible Destinations With Destinations I have recently been and show those first. Would like to see that space devoted to the map of where the Uber cars are. Or, at least have the option of allowing this possibility. Won’t tell you about the good stuff about the app because that does not help improve the application. I had Rated Uber Customer service Among my 10 worst experiences in the last five years. I have updated that now — it is my worst in the last five years. I try to get help and my issue doesn’t fit the standard pigeon holes. So, what next?
title: Suggested application changes
developerResponse: {'id': 14074887, 'body': "Hey, we appreciate your suggestion on the app based on your device. Please not that we are working towards making this better for you. Also, we have noted down your feedback regarding our support team and are trying to improve your experience in the future. If there's anything else we can look into, let us know by sending a note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.        ", 'modified': '2020-03-18T07:34:24Z'}

review: I’ve been using Uber for about 5 years now but I’m going to start using Lyft when I need a ride. Today is Wednesday and Sunday I noticed to unrecognizable charges from Uber on my bank account. Neither of the charges are in the Uber app and it makes sense for them not to be because I haven’t used Uber in 2 weeks. Doing a little searching online apparently this is a common thing for them to do. I read some reviews of Uber taking hundreds out of some customers accounts. To make the situation worse they have no customer service number for you to call. The only thing you can do is leave a message. Like I said I found this out Sunday and today is Wednesday. I’ve left 3 messages with them and they haven’t even responded to one. I don’t know how they choose who to steal from but I’m not going to give them the opportunity to steal from me again
title: Uber will steal from you

review: I use Uber way too much so now I’m a good member which allowed me to use points earned ( I think it’s 1 point per $ is what the app says) anyways I used 1,000 points for 20% off the ride that was originally $37. Once I applied the discount the ride was not 20% off. It should have been about $29 but instead the discount made the ride $32 because the jacked up the original price of the ride as if I didn’t just see what it was before I applied the discount. LYFT is still cheaper even with the discount & I should’ve just used lift but I wanted to use my points & save a couple of dollars. Anyways Uber will quote a ride & wrongfully charge for things that didn’t happen on my ride. I also don’t understand the “market place” fee which is really high. It’s as high as the base fare. Lyft will be my new primary I’m done with Uber.
title: Deceptive & Market place fee??

review:
Scheduled pickup times do not reliably work as advertised. Use at your own risk.

Yesterday I scheduled a 3:45 AM Uber, with an estimated dropoff time at the airport of 4:10 AM, to be there 2 hours before my flight. This morning I wake up early; 10 minutes before my pickup time, the app says it’ll be 10 minutes late. At the pickup time, it says it’ll be 20 minutes late. 5 minutes later the time’s still creeping up. I message the driver, who tells me he’s “way far off” — so now at 4 AM I find myself cancelling my scheduled ride (for a small cancellation fee, no less!), and praying there’s another car reasonably close by. The second car does get me to the airport in time for my flight, which is a lot better than nothing, but it was much tighter and more stressful than I planned.

Almost the exact same thing happened to me once before, but that was almost three years ago and in a different country, so I assumed it wouldn’t happen in the US. My bad, I guess.

If the app is going to promise scheduled pickup times, it should make them work! I *highly* recommend using a different service if you need accurate times, especially at off-hours. Next time I’m scheduling a cab.
title: Tons of unnecessary stress before my flight

review: Warning: For anyone who schedules a trip, keep in mind that Uber may cancel on you when their driver is scheduled to arrive. We have a 4:50am flight, so we scheduled a ride at 3:50am last night. Uber confirmed it (without even a disclosure - “Hey, there’s a chance your driver might not show up.”) When we woke up, the app said, “Pickup soon at 3:50am. Driver arriving in 1 min.” In fact, Uber counted down the second until the driver arrived so on the dot, we were at the front of the house waiting for the driver because the map showed the driver dot at the front. At 3:52am, Uber sent us a message that it couldn’t find a ride for us at that time which really screwed us over. It was too late to figure out a new way to get to the airport so we missed our flight. Really wish Uber hadn’t confirmed our ride and led us on to believe it was still coming up until the last minute.
title: TLDR - Don’t trust scheduled rides!

review:
Tried to book Uber to go to an important dinner last night. None of the time estimates were accurate. Trusted what the estimates were saying and waited till appropriate time to book. Rates kept changing drastically every time I looked at the app. After selecting the type of vehicle it just kept spinning and not finding any drivers. Had to keep cancelling every-time and starting over to try to get a driver with a different vehicle. Couldn’t get anyone within reasonable timeframe, no matter what cost. Ended up driving myself and spent a ton of time looking for parking downtown. Showed up to dinner super late and super frustrated. 
Just livid with this company! What am I missing here?? Why are you putting completely inaccurate time estimates on your app? If I had known no drivers were available would have booked way early or a different company? Never had this issue pre- pandemic. Figure it out Uber! Shame on you.
title: Unbelievable

review: You can’t contact the driver until he’s already at the destination. Not able to communicate with the Uber Company until 10:00 am with issues or questions which at that time most morning trips are already completed. Not able to adjust or edit a trip request after you already placed an order without having to cancel the whole trip. Passengers can’t seat in the front. But front seats passenger side are set all the way to the back leaving little leg room for the passengers. Pictures of vehicles are cut in half. You only see half the vehicle & pictures are too small.
title: Poor communication

review:
Today was the 2nd Uber trip of my life.  A year ago on my maiden Uber drive I was picked up by Mark.  We had a great conversation and he made that 1st trip a very pleasant adventure.  

Today I was picked up by a new electric vehicle.   I thought the driver looked familiar but he was a different car than my initial voyage.    I said to my driver, you look familiar and asked him a question.   His response confirmed my suspicion and it was Mark from last year.  The pilot of my very first Uber and now also on my second ever Uber ride.  

 I think that is a very good omen.  As we shook hands we said maybe there’s a charm.   We’ll see what the future holds for my next Uber.  😀👍
title: What are the Odds

review: On April 12, 2023 I was stuck at the Dania beach casino due to a tremendous storm. I could not get in Uber waited for three hours. Finally got a response from Jean what an awesome man we were together for two hours for only a 10 minute normal ride back to my hotel floods everywhere he had to take several different routes. He finally got me to my hotel. I then realized I left my phone in his truck. OMG boy was I upset alone with no phone I called my phone Jean answered. I didn’t expect him to come back because there’s no way he was going to make it, but he told me he promised to get my phone to me today the 13th and he did I am so grateful for Jean, the Uber man👍👍👍🌈🌈🌈
title: THE STORM!!!!

review:
Until today, all of my Uber experiences have been very good, very pleasant drivers with very clean cars. Today’s ride was very disturbing. The driver’s car wreaked of marajuana, so I can assume that he was “high” while driving??? I could hardly breathe, it was so pungent. I did not feel safe at all. 
The upholstery in his back seat was so disgustingly filthy, with staining everywhere, that I didn’t want to sit on it, but I had no choice. I walk with a cane & was pulling a suitcase on wheels. I thought he might offer to help me with it when I asked him to open his trunk, but he remained in his car & never said a word. I put it in myself. He repeated the same poor behavior when he arrived at my home. I shouldn’t have given him any tip, but I did. Uber needs to be aware of situations like mine. His name is Daniel & he was driving a gray Volkswagen Passat.
I hope I never have that experience again.
title: My Uber Ride Today, June 11, 2023

review:
Unfortunately, Uber has redesigned their app either intentionally or accidentally to make really hard to dispute cancellation fees, which paired together with poor visibility on scheduled trips makes really easy to double book a ride by accident, with just a few clicks.

I have two other friends having the same issue when using the app for first time but I didn’t believe them until it just happened to me.

The app could have easily detected a double booked trip and flag this with some type of warning. Something as simple as asking for an extra click/confirmation when detecting a second ride request from the same user at the same location. It could be as simple as asking for the name of the additional passenger/user.

Instead, the app lets you double book a ride and the company cashes in the user error while not allowing you to dispute the charge. These types of systematic errors are corporate stealing and a shame.

Moreover, Uber choose to take hostage the driver when putting forward the cancellation fee as the way to compensate their effort. Is isn’t the drivers or users fault, it’s Uber.

I’ll report this to the FTC, as this is corporate abuse in large scale and someone should initiate a class A action against the company. A shame!
title: POOR DESIGN - LEADING TO CANCELLATION FEES

review: I really enjoyed the 4:00 AM to 4:30 AM trip with Jesus on November 27, 2022 !!!  He was promptly on time to pick me up in route to the Phoenix airport from the home of my niece. We had a great conversation. Because of some recent back surgery, I asked if I could sit in the front seat, and he was more than happy to oblige. He lifted my luggage into and out of his vehicle, and placed it curbside for me at the PHX Airport, Delta terminal. He stated he had only been in town for one month, but he knew the layout and his Tesla was a beautiful vehicle. I enjoyed looking at the interior of the Tesla, as he explained his satisfaction. This was quite important to me, as I am also considering a purchase in the future.
title: Jesus -THE best

review: when I accidentally put the wrong address in the nice man was kind enough to take me to the right address without difficulty. So when I arrive home I get an email saying I am charged $35. When the initial ride was $10 and the app the Uber app would not let me change the destination or add a different destination so the kind man went out of his way to take me to the right address, which wasn’t super far in difference to distance, so then I proceeded to tip the man for his act of kindness for taking me home to the right address, a little more than I would’ve wanted, but that was before the added charge. The ride was now charged double by Uber not by the man because he did not change anything so I want to know.
title: Didn’t appreciate the extra charge…..

review:
The Uber Black “limo service” estimates are completely false. I was charged DOUBLE the quoted fee (over $80 more than estimate.) with no warning. I was charged an extra “time fee”, presumably because the driver couldn’t find me (because the app was malfunctioning on his end and wouldn’t show my location). I normally use a private service, which charges a flat fee, not an estimate. The Uber app doesn not warn you that your fee may differ. The only initial way to complain is via a check box so, now I’m addition to my medical treatments, I have to fight a bill with an app - I’m sure that will be fun.

Update: Uber credited me back most of the extra charge without me having to call. I had submitted a ticket through their support system. Updated stars to 3.
title: Uber Black, massive overcharge

review: My problem is that you guys charge for a wait time but yet you say that I should arrive to a destination at a certain time but the ride does not come until the time that I’m “supposed” to be dropped off. Then you guys charge a service fee... A SERVICE FEE for a driver that’s going to get paid... you guys are ripping people out their money. You guys need to have a SET time to pick up and drop off. I need to be to work at 8:30am I order Uber around 7:30-7:45am there is no way that I should be waiting 20-30 minutes for a driver. The whole point of me downloading Uber is to get to the place I need to be ON TIME... Then your drivers don’t even call to notify when their at the pick up location. Also it is not our fault that you guys do not have enough drivers so please stop charging people extra because you don’t have enough drivers.
title: Issue that needs to be fixed

review:
My days started out with bloodwork at the clinic. I
Was blessed with 2 rides with Uber drivers that were so kind and thoughtful I was made to conversation and thoughts that made me feel important, smart and safe. Thank god for Uber drivers. They my day and rides seem priceless. I’ll be calling Uber again today to go to work and I know I’ll be satisfied with the driver than too, j just know best the best Uber drivers took me on the best rides I had in five years I’ve been using a variety of company that provide rides for people whom don’t drive themselves. Thank you Uber and more thanks to my drivers. Diane B Smith
title: My ride today was delightful. . I’m going to continue using Uber.

review: We are a homeless couple with many bags and when James picked us up it was just me in the car but all of our belongings he quickly asked about our situation. He listened to my story and then spoke from his own experience about his life and how he has overcome some difficulties as well.  He gave us hope for the day by giving us our dignity.  He did more more for us than we could have imagined. His kindness and generosity are which true believers that have the ability to help and want to help are supposed to look like.  Thank you James front to back and top to bottom from our souls.  You’re a true blessing.
title: Unbelievable acts of kindness

review: I need to use Uber in the mornings to get to work since I don’t have my license yet. Uber has royally messed up my timecard on multiple occasions, causing me to be late multiple times because they take too 15-20 minutes just to locate someone. This is ridiculous some of us have jobs we need to be at in the morning and I shouldn’t have to leave EXTRA early in the morning just because the drivers keep declining rides. Luckily my manager is understanding of the situation, but you’re wasting people’s time and actual money at their jobs when you cause them to be late. Even when they request a ride early. It shouldn’t take me this long to find someone on an app that used to take 5 minutes at the most.
title: Used to be good, now it is terrible

review: Uber will severely price gouge when it suits them: in Vegas what is normally a $15 trip was hyped to over $80 during peak times, similarly an airport trip in chicago was gouged to above $130 when its normally $50. In the middle of nowhere the Uber app claimed they had good coverage, however when I tried to flag one back, nothing was able to come for hours; why mislead and suggest availability. I call this big tech tyranny, considering this is part of a new transportation vision, where no one needs private vehicles, all vehicles are electric and autonomous, and we all live harmoniously with ride sharing technology working seamlessly. Better not look too closely at that utopian vision, as it is nowhere near any kind of reality, like a lot of these big tech utopian visions,
title: Not the great service it’s hyped to be

review:
I had requested a ride with Uber this afternoon
and after waiting in the Texas summer heat for many minutes. A gentleman pulls up three stores away from where I was located. I walked to the car and was about to get in when he asked for my ID, said I looked to young. (I’m 20, but have a slight baby face) after he refused to drive me, I asked if I would be able to get my money back so I could pay for my next request. He said the app would handle it and left. Luckily I did get home just before I get the email that says my account was deactivated due to a report of a possible minor. I use Uber in my daily life and have been a loyal customer, I shouldn’t have to deal with some guy feeling vindictive because he isn’t getting paid. I have made a claim for wrongful deactivation but have not received any response from an agent. I am also awaiting that refund.
title: Wrongful Deactivated Account

review: It’s took me 10 seconds to figure it out. I contact Uber asking them to give driver extra payment to return it. He didn’t responded and Uber said they can’t give me driver number and if he refuse return it they have nothing they can do. I try to explain them it’s super urgent and very important and they should not let him take more riders (that potentially take my documents) till he give my backpack back. After 30 hours of craziness, which of course I lost my flight, was stuck out of my country without money, any kind of Id and no able to cutch flight home, with the assistance of the local police I finally got my documentation back. Uber seems not care of all the situation, it’s seems like in their opinion it’s all my fault of forgetting my bag and they have no any problem with what the driver did. I’m still shocked
title: I forgot my backpack with all my documentation at the Uber

review:
I have a few compliments about Uber. 
1) Why are my rides and my friends rides not the same when we are leaving from the same place and ordering to go to the same place. How and why is that possible that I had to pay more money fro the same ride as my friend? 
 2) Why doesn’t Uber give options of different route to rides? I would like to see different options of rides.
3) Uber need to stop letting drivers accept rides so far away. My driver shouldn’t be able to accept it from 15+minutes away. When I choose to get an Uber I make sure I’m still early yet every time I’m always late because you’re letting drivers accept rides when they are like 10-15 minutes away so by the time they get to me I have to rush.
title: Few complaints

review: I lived in London 5 years when Uber revolutionized finding a cab in London.  Not today.  Uber gives unrealistic wait time estimates.  Drivers now can, and routinely do, cancel without consequences. Can you blame them, as Uber reportedly now takes 40% of the fare (vs 20% historically)? Further, the black cabs have become more competitive, now accepting credit card payment (finally) and driving generally newer cabs.  And new premium service Apps like Wheely have launched, offering the best cars and vans (for larger parties) without risk of the driver canceling.  It is sad to have seen Uber fight so hard to achieve a leadership position and then watch it destroy itself.
title: Disappointed in London

review: To be honest the service is good as it is, Although there are a few things that could be improved like being able to accurately see where the driver is. In my experience some of the times the drivers location could elsewhere when in reality they have arrived and only when the driver calls that you know that they are outside. Also sometimes either with Uber eats or to get a ride for some reason drivers become delayed or motionless, What I mean to say is that there should be a feature to allows users to change drivers if I feel that the driver won’t come or unresponsive. Other than that most things could be solved by setting or contacting the driver.
title: HONEST REVIEW

review: I normally drive so I didn’t use Uber often so I’m sure I won’t be missed. I took 2 rides today. First driver sent a notice to Uber that I wasn’t wearing a mask. I’m not sure what his problem was. I tipped $5 on a $12 ride AND I was wearing a mask! Second driver couldn’t understand what side of the street I was on. When I crossed the street because the app said my driver was there, even though he wasn’t the driver waved me off. He drove to the corner, still on the wrong side. I crossed back to where he was supposed to pick me up only to have him cancel the ride. When I tried to get another ride the app told me I had to wait. I walked 3 blocks before it would let me try again. The final ride was fine but after the first 2 I no longer have a need for the app. I’ll just take my own car next time. I’m done.
title: Just deleted the app

review: My driver came to pick me and my son up and waited till we got till the end of street to stop and tell me that his debit card was stolen and he didn’t have gas. He said he didn’t know how far we’d make it then said we can go somewhere so I can give him money to get gas. I still haven’t been able to to find a number to customer service I had to use the chat which wasn’t helpful they heard my issue but didn’t explain how or if it’s going to be resolved. I was charged $53 for that ride and additional $6 when I canceled the ride and another $42 to get home with a different driver. And my issue has not been resolved. I shouldn’t have paid so much money for something that wasn’t my fault! Uber needs to do more to make sure we are safe when we get rides this has been the scariest experience and so stressful.
title: Driver made me feel unsafe customer service not helpful

review: Uber has always been convenient if you need to get someone and don’t have a car, but recently drivers have been expecting you while they are still going to drop someone off, which leads you wait times to be 12-15 min. I understand they want the money but they shouldn’t be allowed to accept someone if they haven’t dropped their current person off yet. I can’t tell you how many times I go to order an Uber having to be somewhere soon, and I end up having to wait 15 minutes for someone to pick me up because they have to drop someone else off first. Uber needs to fix this problem and add a feature where the driver can only accept someone once they have dropped their current customer off
title: Wait time

review:
Had a good experience scheduling a trip in advance. 

When heading back, I requested a pickup and was routed to be picked up > 3 blocks from where I was standing in < 2 minutes. Was not able to get my bearing for a minute as I was in a familiar part of town but sober so I had that going for me. Not only was my ride cancelled, but without me having a chance to deny a subsequent booking/confirm or deny pickup location, an additional automatic pickup was scheduled with the same deal - blocks away and no time to get to the pickup. Lo and behold, I get charged for both driver-cancelled rides and have to get a ride from a friend. I was charged ~1/2 of the price of each ride. Scam scam scam as these are features programmed to extract as much from the user with as little effort as possible.

It is one thing to be denied service, but to be charged for denial of service twice seems on to be on the fringe side of the law...
title: Scammed

review:
I had a $25 voucher from a conference and ordered lunch thru the app. My first time using UberEats. It said it would arrive at 11:50 latest. I waited 20 minutes after which is fine. Then the order status on the app changed from current to “past order” and I didn’t have an option to contact the driver. I call the restaurant asking if the food was ever picked up and my order was picked up. But no food arrived. No call. No customer service available over the phone. No custom service representatives available thru the app. I requested a refund for Uber Cash given I also paid out of pocket. Nothing on the app documents the potential refund, nor was there a confirmation email about receiving a refund.
UberEats is a headache. I gave the delivery one star and the food a thumbs up. I hope my review doesn’t affect the business, it’s only UberEats that got the one star.
title: Food never arrived

review:
This app has been helpful not only at home in the states for its convenience but also in my travels as an expat. I especially appreciate having an app like this in a foreign country as it’s easy to loose track of local currencies, as well as, sense of direction.  This is especially important now during covid when I am looking for contactless options.

So imagine my surprise when I found myself in Egypt  and the app is not allowing me to use the credit option.  After reaching out several times I am told that helping me is against their terms and conditions…. Using a credit card? Interesting as it was not against their terms and conditions when I used the app with credit in India.    

Needless to say I will be looking for alternatives and now better understand why Uber is not really an option in Asia.
title: Unable to help because of our terms and conditions

review:
When i first began to use uber, everything was fine. The trip to work from my house was at most 10 to 15 dollars. I dont know what algorithm uber uses to dictate how much youre going to pay, but the price for this trip has escalated to a 22 to 40 dollar trip, sometimes 50. This is flat ridiculous. Theres no reason why this trip should be that much. App says its to give the drivers more incentive, that theres no drivers around- and thats a blatant lie. You hit pay and suddenly theres an increase in drivers around your location but its too late, you already paid a chunk just to get to work.  

This is going to be the last time i use this app. Id rather subject myself to the bus. Not going to pay this outrageous amount of money anymore. Probably get healthier by just waling up am hour earlier and walking to work honestly.
title: Awful pricing, not affordable at all

review: A couple years ago I was traveling out of state and when I attempted to order a ride it said my account was locked due to unusual use (may be a neat security feat. but it was my first time using the app so there was nothing to compare to). Either way, it left me stranded for a few hours while I was trying to work with the robot that is Customer Service, finally I gave up an called for a taxi service. That night I explained that I was traveling and it was me, they said they would fix the problem and DISABLED my account. Fast forward to today trying to get this to work again, after dealing with “customer service” again for the past week going in circles with the robot responses, their final email to me states they are deciding to not life the hold to an account I’ve never been able to use and have given no explanations for anything yet. If it were possible to give 0/5 stars, I would.
title: Good Luck

review: My Driver was nice and I tipped him because I felt bad for him because he had only had three rides (I was his third customer) since 5:30 am and my pick up was approximately 8 am, and considered a short distance. He was friendly and professional except I wouldn’t recommend he share such info with his riders. They may not be as understanding and misinterpret it for an attempt to be tipped higher. I would also recommend that between rides he check the floorboard to maintain cleanliness prior to picking up another rider especially if time allots him to do so. Overall my ride was pleasant and I hope business picks up for him in Conway.
title: Review - Excellent Driver

review: I made an order today with $66 in food. The delivery driver called me and I picked up, apparently he was confused or lost so I spent 10 minutes directing him on how to get to my address. The driver then said some inaudible comment and hung up. I tried calling back and it went straight to a “full” voicemail. Afterwards I contacted Uber and they said they couldn’t refund my order because the driver was “waiting for 5 minutes and I never responded” which was a blatant lie. I asked for a reason as to why they couldn’t refund me and they gave some round about excuse about their system but still weren’t able to give a solid answer. They told me to contact them again tomorrow after their specialist team looks into the matter. I’m hoping I get my money back but needless to say this company is endorsing scams for drivers and screwing over customers.
title: Scammed out of Delivery order and No refund

review:
Uber uses a system called “surge pricing” where anytime there’s any demand for rides they’ll triple the cost. I would recommend grabbing a taxi as these are consistent with prices. While it can be cheaper to grab Uber in many situations, you might want to try your luck with other services as I’ve been able to lock down rides for much cheaper than Uber does. 

Plus, at least you know you’re getting a good car. Uber has severely dropped in quality in terms of the vehicles they pick you up in. Often times the vehicle is damaged, dirty and smells kinda weird inside. From what I’ve heard, Lyft has a much more solid system for this but still charges surge prices so watch for that. 

Ultimately, if you NEED it, grab an Uber. But if you can spend a little time comparing prices, you’ll come out on top most the time with someone else.
title: Charges that seem off? This is just Uber!
developerResponse: {'id': 7174097, 'body': "Hey there! We're always looking to improve your experience with Uber. Anything specific we can look into for you? Let us know by reaching out to us via the in-app Help section or by sending a quick note at t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.", 'modified': '2019-02-06T06:25:31Z'}

review: It takes longer and longer to find a ride and I’ve noticed the quality of directions is getting really bad. I take an Uber to my brothers place once every week or two and have for about 3 years. Lately, I have to wait longer and longer for a ride to show up and the quality of the directions provided to my driver by the app have been getting worse and worse. Most recently, late at night on Christmas Eve when there was absolutely none on the road, the directions gave my driver the 4th or 5th fastest route to the freeway. I checked and there was no traffic or closures anywhere else. Last week, a similar thing happened except it told my driver to get on the wrong freeway. Their greed is ruining the business. I’m going to start using Lift or go back to using cabs.
title: Declining

review: I go to my girlfriends house quite often and while there are 4 routes to get there, there is only 1 fast route. Now every time I get in the Uber, I look at Waze, google maps, and Apple Maps to see which route is the fastest. And all three apps recommend the fast route that I usually take.  There is no reason for the circumference routes! It’s absolute nonsense! I would understand if there was some traffic that Uber may pick up on that the other apps do not pick up on, but that is simply not true! I don’t know why Uber does that, but I am super tired of it. While I still will continue to use Uber over lyft due to the availability of cars that Uber has, I will still rue each ride I take with them. I really hope Uber focuses on their customers priority rather than just add data to their maps by taking alternate routes.
title: So tired of these “faster” alternate routes

review: Overall. Every single driver ive been in the car with was fantastic at there jobs and had great customer service. The problem comes when uber says its limited availability and you are a regular uber user and everyone knows if you have work to call an uber ahead if you want get to work on time with limited availability or at least not WELL over the clock. But then you get hit with an uber driver that says he will arrive in 3 minutes, Then boom your now 20 minutes earlier at your job. There needs to be new mechanics that allows the person to have a choice while they had bought the uber already to choose if they want to accept the ride ahead of them depending on the time and location of the driver.
title: Need New Mechanics

review: You are the sweetest, most generous man, this side of the Mississippi. Family has been struggling and going through a lot recently and you’re like an angel from heaven. This is Ms Bartow and I am the woman that lives at the apartment complex that you were bringing Angela to. I cannot believe how you have helped us and you just proves once again that God still has pleasant wonderful people in this world. We are all here to help one another, whether most people realize it or not and that we can and you certainly did so I thank you from the bottom of my heart and you will be in my prayers nightly I have a list. Lol God bless you and have a good weekend.
title: Garrett

review: The app is good when it actually works but if you’re somebody like me who has to work early in the morning, be to work at seven and they live a few miles from work it’s horrible. These drivers refuse to do the job they’re being paid for I don’t know how many times I’ve had to call Lynn or be late to work because I was looking for an Uber and hour before I had to be at work and couldn’t find one or I did find drivers but then they canceled because they didn’t want to drive me 5 miles to my work. You’re being paid for it and they didn’t want to do their job. I’ve been dealing with this the whole time I’ve used the app and it just I’m almost done with this app at this point or they start charging over $20 to get me 5 miles which is absolutely ridiculous
title: Horrible drivers
developerResponse: {'id': 13780595, 'body': "Hi there, sorry to hear that you had concerns with the fares charged for the ride and the availability of rides near you. Please note that the trip fare is subjective to demand and supply in the area at the time. It constantly changes with the rise/fall in either factor. Also, note that the chances of you getting paired with a driver-partner are highly based on the demand in an area at the time of the request. This usually varies depending on rider demand and driver-partner supply. For further queries, reach out to us at t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2020-03-01T05:02:18Z'}

review: I wish I could give negative stars. I’m a very positive person and love bragging on companies and individuals when they do a good job. However, I have never experienced such incompetence as with the help feature on Uber. The agents are obviously outsourced and they don’t actually read or even comprehend your issue. It literally took me three days of messages to get an issue resolved that was an Uber issue. I am currently two day in on trying to get an issue resolved from a technical problem with the app and a refund for a trip I never took. It’s a shame that the customer service is so inept and there’s no way to get a person on the phone. I take Uber frequently and do Uber black when available in my area. I’m not cheap I just want to get the service I paid for. If the drivers, vehicles or app doesn’t meet that standard then I expect resolution.
title: Terrible!

review: The rides are usually pretty expensive so I end up using Lyft, tried using the delivery option on the app thinking maybe it’ll be better than DoorDash, but I have been sorely disappointed. As a pregnant working mother I ordered a pizza to be delivered since my husband and I both work pretty strenuous jobs so I figured ordering a pizza from a location that is 15 minutes from the house wouldn’t be too long of a wait and wouldn’t be that hard to mess up. Our driver decided to pick up 2 orders, which I get happens but they decided to take 1 order 47 minutes out of the way and then come back with our food, I just don’t understand how the app works where I would figure the closer location would get their food then the 2nd closest would also get their food. Definitely not how the app works but will not be using again
title: Incredibly disappointed

review: MaryoryI picked me up on time at the ShopRite market in thornwood. I have several bags with me and she Said hello and introduced herself, and then asked me if I would like some help loading my bags into the trunk. I said yes, who couldn’t use a little help these days lol and she did and we spoke a bit. we proceeded driving to my home and Chappaqua and we got to talking more I was telling her about a situation in my family and she was so kind and lovely to talk to. She actually made my whole day feel better. Very good Driver personable lovely young woman. I normally don’t write reviews but in this case absolutely. Merry Christmas happy holidays to everyone!!🎄🎅
title: My Lovely Ride home from the Market.

review:
Upon requesting a ride to get to work (my first time using Uber), the app asked me to confirm my phone number. I enter the number, and am asked to put in a 4-digit PIN. I put in the PIN, screen darkens for a second, and it just hangs. I try over a dozen more times with different PINs, yet it will not advance to the next screen.
