Now late for work, I finally manually edit my phone # through ‘settings,’ and it finally goes through. I request the ride, and now the app asks me again to re-enter all of my card info (which I had already done). The app will not accept the card no matter how many times I try (app keeps resetting to the card info entry screen). I was forced to select the ‘pay by cash’ option to advance to the next screen, and now I had to upload pictures of my driver’s license. 

I finally get the ride (I’m now 20 minutes late for work), and at the end of the ride the driver tells me payment went through on my card, even though I chose to pay via cash. Using Uber was an extremely frustrating experience, I arrived 30 minutes late to work, and it authorized payments on my card when I chose otherwise. (I have screenshots of everything). Who designed this app?!

1/5 - will not be using again.
title: Terribly designed app

review:
I haven’t used Uber for some time and it has been taking out monthly subscriptions on my INACTIVE account, totaling nearly 400 dollars. I understand it’s all automated but I’m not the only person this has happened to and it’s not like there’s no way for the company to setup a passive cancellation system on inactive accounts. What company continues to siphon money out of an account that’s been inactive for over half a year? It’s not like nobody on their end can see/check that.
To be clear, I share blame but I would recommend people start shifting towards other apps for casual use.
title: Needs better help website, also subscription management

review:
For the most part the rides are alright, some better than others, but I’ve been in multiple Ubers recently that have no AC, seats are ripped more than casual wear and tear, and some the driver didn’t know where they were going even with the map on. I know that the cars don’t have to be perfect, but it seems like Uber is missing the “quality ride” mark they used to hit to boosts sales on more expensive rides. 
My problems with user interface are more focused on support than the drivers: there’s no way to call and talk to an actual person to resolve an issue and the prompts on the help tab can only do so much. 
At this point taxis and ZTrips are easier to arrange and cheaper than Ubers, and they won’t charge a false “cleaning fee” for a quick ride to work.
title: Bad user interface, quality’s gone downhill

review: I’ve used Uber at least three times a week for years now, and have had a good experience. But when the pandemic started, drivers started canceling almost every time I request a ride, and many times they will sit in the same place or drive away and wait for me to cancel, probably so they don’t get penalized. Also, I feel like recently they have been driving like crazy people; many accelerate very fast and slam on the breaks each time they get close to other cars. Sometimes the cars are so dirty or are in a condition that makes me worry about the safety of the vehicle. There are some good drivers still, maybe 30%. This review would have been five stars two years ago, but because of the decline in the quality of service, I am no longer satisfied.
title: The service has worsened significantly

review:
The app essentially does what it says, so for doing a basic job well I can’t argue with it being 3 average stars. 

The problem is that when you open it you have to really look at the front page to not press one of their “upsell” buttons.  They have their other apps and services far more prominently displayed than the product I am paying for. I think this is to manipulate you further into their ecosystem.  So a big zero for that.  

In an effort to try to keep you from closing their app so they can track you while you’re not using it they make it “bounce” out of the way when you try to close it on the tab view. This causes me to waste a lot of time because it does this 3-4 times before it lets you close it. When the white line shows up on the bottom it will finally close.  This doesn’t happen with most other apps. I assume it is to keep it running in the background to track movement and other behavior. 
So another big zero for that. 

Tipping.  I am a generous person. I like to tip a lot. I often tip 100%. Because I can. Because if you’re driving for Uber the odds are you like money. Guess what? I can’t tip more than 30% because the app doesn’t allow me to. Why? Yet another big zero for the app.
title: Another data preying bouncy app

review: For the past month I been trying to get Uber Eats or/and Uber driver to accept my payment methods because It doesn’t matter which Debit or Credit card I use it keep saying “Try another payment method” in every single attempt that I do to purchase food or to get a ride. Not even Apple Pay works, I called my bank and they said I have no problem with my accounts, also all my cards works perfectly fine except in Uber. I attempted to contact Uber in many different ways including support and all I am getting now is an automated message saying “ We are aware of this issue and we are working to get it fixed” but nothing gets fixed, I always treat drivers with respect, great feedback and a nice tip. I am now using DoorDash and Lift. This is not how you treat your customers, specially after I had done absolutely nothing to your company to deserve this.
title: I QUIT USING UBER EATS AND UBER

review:
I recently had the pleasure of riding with the most amazing Uber driver. From the moment I got into his car, I was impressed by his professionalism and friendliness. He greeted me with a warm smile and asked me how my day was going.

Throughout the ride, Admed was an excellent driver - he was attentive, careful, and made sure that I felt safe and comfortable. He was also incredibly knowledgeable about the area, and he gave me some great tips on places to visit and things to do.

Overall, I cannot recommend admed enough. He is an amazing Uber driver who truly cares about his passengers. If you have the chance to ride with him, don't hesitate - you won't be disappointed!
title: Great service

review: Losing Uber Rewards “to focus on Uber One” is really stupid, as I am a Platinum Uber Rewards member AND an Uber One member, I feel like I’m losing out on this deal. Also, as of the new update on like Aug. 29, I cannot schedule a ride ahead of time ANYWHERE IN MY CITY. Only can get on-demand rides, if you can find one. I’m not good with timing, and the randomness of wait-times makes trying to get to work with Uber harder than it should be. I was scheduling rides to get to work just fine until the last update! This is ridiculous. FIX your app or FIX your business strategy. Bc all the recent reviews are terrible, so it’s not just me who feels cheated.
title: Worst Update Ever

review: When I use the app, it would report potential driver are like 4 minutes away after I select that option. The driver is reported as being 8 minutes away. It is misleading to me. Also I would like for the app to disclose if riders and/or drivers have disabilities. Sometimes my ride pulls up and they have a handicap sticker in their car. As a rider that is concerning to me because I do not know what their disability is and if it could potentially affect our ride. Also your company should have frequent inspections of cars because some rides have been dirty on the inside and outside. One driver’s car had “bad gas” their words and stalled twice before I hopped out before making it to my destination.
title: Driver wait times not accurate and more

review:
Give you drivers access to more trip information. I should not have drivers arriving to pick my passenger or myself up only for them to bail because they don’t want to do any real driving. 
It’s super shady for me to be charged for a full trip multiple times and have to wait several days to get my money back. 
My passenger was there. We did our part. The problem is with your software not Informing the drivers as they should be about trip distances. I can wait  for a bit for a driver willing to drive the distance , but I should not have to deal with multiple holds on my card trying to get a driver that will do it. Nor should the driver purposely go to the pickup location after I informed them it’s long distance, to collect a cancellation fee when they have no intention to do any real work.
title: Charged cancellation fees for drivers refusing my destination

review: I’m leaving this review after a horrible holiday experience that left a single mom and her two children stranded on Thanksgiving day.  I ordered the ride for them three days in advance so they could be with our family on the holiday which is 3 hours away.  The ride was accepted and scheduled but when it came time for them to leave the driver called me and asked how far of a drive it was.  Then I got a notification that I cancelled the ride and was charged an additional fee.  What happens next?  We call Lyft and a driver takes my sister and her two children home to Orlando from Sarasota Florida.  Thanks Uber but no thanks
title: Left a mother stranded

review:
Same like many other Uber users, I tried to reach an Uber support person since years - and like like most of us failed.
I try to get Uber stopping writing me in Arabic.
I speak 4 languages but Arabic is not one of them!
The Uber help service is just a joke. I send memos or tried to reconfigure the preset help issues - without success.
I also tried tireless the App, but it always goes back to the cloud version and I can‘t change anything.
In my desperation I also approached many Uber drivers and asked them for help, but my setup shows English and they all gave up.
May be I reach somebody from the Uber team with this note or if there is somebody out there who knows the solution to the problem, please let me know!
In general I like to drive with Uber, but the Help service - with no chance for a self written verbatim or a person you can talk to is just a joke!
If you agree with me, please speak up. I am sure they will change their Help system if enough people complain about it!
title: Uber sends me notes and my receipts in Arabic

review: Unfortunately Uber standards in Jordan has significantly deteriorated.  Also there is a common issue of drivers not taking payment on credit card as a preferred payment method so when you book for a ride the driver cancels your booking once he finds out that your payment method is on credit.  The driver has to specify a reason for cancellation where he lies and report that you were not wearing a face mask.  This happened to may and many others many times!  Also since Uber raised their fees to 30% charge of the fare, the service has deteriorated, for example, ACs are switched off when the weather is too hot!
title: Uber in Jordan

review:
Right now according to Uber support page: “5 stars means there were no issues on the trip”, which means that getting you from point a to point b is the best you can do.  To me, that’s table stakes.  If can’t do that then that’s zero stars.  But what if a driver goes and makes your driving experience amazing… providing water bottles, asking you what kind of music you like, setting the right temperature for you before they pick you up, that’s all going above and beyond.  But if I get most points just for showing up and getting you to your destination, why should I care?  

Change you rating system away from stars to “meets some”, “meets most”, “meets all”, “exceeds”, “greatly exceeds” expectations.  Where “meets all” means there were no issues.  Incentivize your drivers to do more for their riders and reward them for it.
title: Your drivers are not incentivized to do better

review: I used to love Uber, my friends and I always used it for going out. But yesterday was a whole new story. We took an Uber to the bar and had a great experience. When we left we ordered a ride home, coming from downtown Kansas City to a close by Waffle House. We somehow ended going west into Kansas... the complete opposite direction. So when we asked to change locations our fee went from about $30 to almost $240. For an Uber. I understand changing the location could increase fees, but this is ridiculous. I haven’t been able to contact anyone, and the “help” app didn’t do justice. Our driver was also not even telling us how the location change would charge us so much. He seemed like he just wanted to get more money from us. We were very kind to him of course but we didn’t get much help out of him. I am just very disappointed in how this ride went. Travel at your own risk.
title: Very frustrating.

review: Unreliable! I literally schedule a trip almost 10 hours before and the driver was super late! This is unacceptable! When I booked it, it clearly said the driver would arrive from 12:40-12:50 but did not arrive. So I checked and it said that the driver was 17 mins away! So I cancelled it, hoping someone was closer and nada, everyone was around the same distance. Now I’m late for work and got charged a cancellation fee! I dispute the fee, got it back so I can use for my next Uber ride. Which I honestly don’t want to book again after this experience. I think Uber needs to start returning the money back to the accounts they charged it under, this is ridiculous. I also don’t like that I’m always getting charged a different price every time I schedule a trip to work. It’s the same place, same location, same time but a different price ever time.
title: Not so great

review: Without question, my best experience riding with Uber! My driver “Lovely” was on time, extremely courteous, solicitous and professional. Her vehicle was spotless and I believe I detected a subtle, but aromatic scent of lavender. I asked if she had any chewing gum, and she immediately retrieved an unopened pack from the tidy console to offer me a slice. You could tell she was well prepared for such requests! The ride to the airport at 4pm in rush hour traffic would normally be somewhat hectic; however, Lovely’s safe driving and navigation skills helped me to relax and I actually enjoyed the ride, plus arriving to my flight ahead of schedule! Highly recommend this expert Uber driver!
title: Lovely Ride with Lovely!

review:
Dear UBER 

First, I would like to say, since the app started, it has made traveling to new places very easy. Thank you for that.

However, there are some things I would like point out. The definition of an extra large vehicle is not correct. Please view the list of what an XL vehicle is.

1) Van
2) SUV
3) Mini Van

These vehicles can fit four or more grown adults with bags comfortably and still with in the lines of safety.

Regular vehicle.

1) Mini SUV
2) Car
3) Hatch back
4) other vehicles smaller than Van, Mini Van and SUV.

Common issue I have is, I request an XL vehicle and get a mini SUV. A mini SUV even with more than 5 seats is not a large enough vehicle to fit more than 3 grown adults with bags comfortably and safely. A large amount of time the people that sit in the back seat end up sitting on the vehicle door due to lack of space and it makes it very difficult to wear a seatbelt.

I would like to recommend that UBER puts an options in for people who have a large family and had lots of bags.

Please take this into consideration for I am really starting to not want to use UBER any long because I have to cancel my UBER due to someone owning a mini SUV and cannot handle four grown adults with bags.

Thank you
title: Mini SUV

review: I’ve done instacart too and I can easily say Uber is better! Be wary of the Walmart orders cause they don’t say what/how much you’re picking up. I had a whole trunk full of stuff I could barely pick up and it was for like 8$ 😂. But the lady saw me struggle and tipped me 20 after! But the people are so nice 7/10 times they’ll increase the tip. And if you stay on it you can easily make up the gas plus more! I drove in a circle when I first started and the orders kept coming! I made over 130$ after like 4hrs. Anyways good way to make money I think I’ll keep doing it in the future :). Just wish they would add more promotions after u hit platinum I like the motivation. Other than that it’s good.
title: Shmoneyyy

review: I had scheduled the car for 4:50 AM this morning, November 17. I got up at 4 am, had a cuppa coffee and was surprised I hadn’t heard from Uber. So I checked and there was no record of the scheduled car and yet I have an email from them saying I had a scheduled car. As well as the app. But that was yesterday thatI got both confirmations, and here it was today and they had disappeared! So I quickly went on to Uber to get another car because I was going to be late to the airport, and they kept looking and looking for cars and couldn’t find one so I went to Lyft and got a car and then Uber came back with a car and I canceled but I still got charged five dollars even though they are the ones who didn’t show up. I have been told not to use Uber and I believe I will not in the future. I’ve always had better luck with Lyft.
title: Surprise!!! Scheduled car cancelled by Uber

review: First, there is no way to contact Uber for immediate assistance. Apparently the drivers don’t have constant communication with this company either. I had 3 stops to make, which was able to make a request for. The driver arrived on time, but was rude before I even got in the car plus was a crazy driver and he almost crashed into parked cars trying to pull over and arguing with me. Long story short, the app only showed him 2 destinations and when I realized it and let him know he was even more rude and told me to change my destination in the app and that he was following my request. While trying to explain to him, he argued back, kept driving crazy. I cancelled my ride and ended up walking 30 minutes to my house. I still cannot find a contact number to get a refund for my cancellation fee or rate his service.
title: First Time User, Horrible Experience!

review: I am tired of scheduling rides and requesting rides then having a driver except and sit in one spot until they feel ready to start the trip. I am also tired of Uber charging me money for them to sit there and do nothing because of a cancellation fee. Why should I have to pay any fee whatsoever when I didn’t receive service, I am the one that had my arrival time delayed but 15 MINUTES and the driver gets to collect off of doing NOTHING.  I was charged a $5.15 cancellation fee on a trip that costs $9.95….OVER 50% FOR NOTHING and also mentioning how many times drivers have cancelled on me minute before pickup.  Sometimes, I’m actually better off walking miles to my destination rather than deal with this.  Since this company has basically plugged it’s ears by manipulation of communication to address this problem, I’ll just leave it here.
title: Might as well be a scam

review:
I’ve had so many rides either cancel, show up late, and even arrive way too early. You might think arriving early is something positive, but when you’re packing for a trip (and plan time to say your goodbyes and what not) AND SCHEDULE FOR A SPECIFIC TIME, NOT 30 MINUTES EARLY, the uber driver has the right to cancel if you don’t show up within five minutes or so. This is obviously not the drivers fault. This is solely the company/corporation. They send out the pick up calls whenever they feel like it AFTER YOU’VE PAID FOR A SPECIFIC TIME.

Uber, it’s owner’s and top executives will inevitably crumble down from their own faults. I can’t wait for more competition to arrive and drive out this pure money hungry inane corporation into oblivion. I only hope that the competition will hire their hardworking employees.
title: Uber the company/corporation doesn’t care at all about it’s customers or employees.

review: I am a diamond member and have spent thousands of dollars riding with Uber. The cost has risen 79% since the pandemic started. My “favorite” route never gets discounted and rides to go home from work have more than doubled. I will just have to take the bus again or just buy a car despite not liking to drive. Better to pay for my own car where I can use it whenever I want than spend over 900 bucks a month going to and from work. Uber used to be fair. Lyft has risen exponentially as well but the same routes at the same times are still about 10 bucks cheaper than Uber. What a bunch of crooks. Just to sit in a filthy car and smell a drivers farts 9 times out of 10. Don’t even get me started on their absolutely useless phone support for diamond members. The rewards mean nothing and all the “features” you get as a diamond member are nonexistent.
title: Highway Robbery

review:
For the past 5 years I’ve always used this app with confidence, and I am beyond disappointed with the app and the company.

3 times now I’ve been stranded because I have scheduled an Uber a day in advance. One of these times was this morning when I needed to leave early for the airport. It told me to go to my waiting spot and then canceled at the end of the pickup window, with no other drivers available. Thank God for Lyft otherwise I would have missed my flight.

Then, at my arrival destination, pricing surged to $100 from $60. It’s the end of a long travel day so I booked it understanding they were in demand. When my driver was 400 feet away (after waiting 15 minutes), it canceled. The same thing happened to 5 other people nearby. I asked another driver nearby that was idling what happened and he said that the app crashed and he couldn’t take anyone until it came back up. I tried to book again right away and now prices were $170 and I was yet again out of options because I had missed the train when I booked my original Uber.

This is an unreliable mode of transportation now, and you can’t get in contact with anyone when you try to file a complaint. I am officially never using this company again.
title: Uber has gone down hill

review: A few years ago, things with Uber where okay but not this last time I used them. Customer service was awful and non-existent. They transferred my call numerous times to people that barely spoke English and would not help. The website and the app would not work and has serious problems.  Every time I requested a ride, either I received error messages that didn’t tell you what the error was or the screen would go blank and I had to start all over again. I must have typed my address 11 times, but the GPS would change it to my neighbor’s address down the block that ended sending the driver to the wrong address when he came to pick me up. I had to chase the driver down the street when I saw him drive past me. Horrible experience and I had to get to my dentist’s appointment. Even leaving this review was almost impossible. Never again!
title: I will never use Uber again!

review: I’m going to give this app as a driver 1 star because Uber always makes everything hard for drivers to earn more money 😒😤 the quest I choose it was 80 rides because they were giving $775 if you make 80 rides in 3 days and not even 3 days let’s say 2 days 🤦‍♀️ plus every ride in Uber they sent you like 20 minutes away to 30 minutes with tolls just for one ride... how the heck I’m going to make 80 rides for 3/2 days if this app keeps sending me long rides ? You guys really needs to fix this if you want drivers to work here and not go to other delivery apps😠😭😞 I work doing doordash and doordash doesn’t even do that 🤨... I’m sorry if this bother anyone else but I have to say it! Please fix it so that way you don’t make drivers go 25 to 30 for almost every ride and for a ride that is $7 for 20 minutes? Doesn’t even make sense to me. (Tolls, plus gas and long rides) 🤦‍♀️
title: Disappointed driver

review: Uber is an awesome way to get from one place to another.  There are times I need to attend appointments that would require me to drive through the city—with it’s very congested, one-way streets.  Although I have a GPS in my car, it’s just easier for me to “catch an Uber” and have someone else deal with all the traffic.  I really like the “reservation” feature and always use it when I can’t be late.  I also like that the app sends me the driver’s name, a description of the car (make/model/color), tag number, and name of the driver.  Makes me feel very safe getting into a car with someone I don’t know.
title: Safe and Easy

review: First experience at Vancouver airport was a nightmare cuz my phone died and I didn’t know which vehicle it was so I got charged 4.50 for the person to show up. That’s fair . I took a taxi. Went back to airport today and the service was flawless. When I got to Maui around 10:00 pm the app said 50 bucks and i flipped cuz I was going maybe 4-5 minutes from airport yet the app said more expensive cuz it was busy so I waited a little over 5 minutes and the fare went down to less than 15. With a 5 dollar tip , I am safe and secure for less than 20 bucks and very pleased with the service and will recommend to everyone!
title: Uber Review

review: The very first time using Uber my driver was Michael and I was staying in Altoona for business which led me from the hotel at the Hyatt to Walmart for a few needed items. I used the app not knowing it all worked and was very green at all of its usage but wound up being very thrilled with my driver whom I had a wonderful experience with for a pleasant visit. I could have talked with Michael for quite some time. We ended up making it a roundtrip booking as he patiently waited for me to grab three items quickly from Walmart. What a wonderful experience it was and looking to use it more in the future when I travel.
title: My first experience with Uber.

review: I always pay for shared rides for some reason because I live right down the street from the freeway the jump on the freeway and my job is literally exiting the freeway. How is he supposed to get another ride? Since I’m paying for sharing Lyft. It’s been happening more than one occasion.. and I could’ve just gotten a Lyft, since it was cheaper than what I actually paid for on Uber. I’ve never had issues with Uber other than the drivers either smoke in the car with a car smells like cigarettes.. or they don’t know how to drive. I just don’t get why I have to pay full price if I’m paying for the shared ride and it’s not my fault that the drivers take the freeway and not the streets I would rated five stars. But right now no.
title: Why pay for shared ride if your still going to pay full price

review: First time user. My driver was quick to respond and friendly. KUDOS for that. Major problems with the App! I was sent $100 credit from Tesla but couldn’t use until I switched from Apple Pay (automatic) to credit card or Pay Pal. Took 3 attempts to input credit card numbers as alternative payment. Finally got help from Tesla front desk to accomplish. Took her 2 tries. Got in Uber and couldn’t input my destination (home address). 4 attempts by me and 3 by him. We finally gave up and he MANUALLY input my destination in his GPS. Was able to manually drag the destination symbol to my destination…but that was OBE (Overcome By Events) as we were 5 minutes from my destination. Will be interesting for my return to Tesla. In all … the idea was interesting but the execution there of was abysmal!
title: Great Ride … Poor App

review:
From a drivers perspective the app would be so much better if Drivers could control the distance from their starting point that they are willing to travel on their days journey! 

Sometimes ride request take you out of your local area, this is ok but some days drivers would prefer to stay within a 30 to 50 mile radius from their starting point! And sometimes drivers would prefer to stay within a 20 to 30 mile radius from where they begin their shift!

Then there are days where it is more lucrative to stay in a certain hot spot it would be great if the app allowed drivers to only except rides that will keep them within a 5 to 15 mile radius from their starting point!
title: Radius/Range/Distance Control

review: Right now there’s a glitch going on that when you swipe out of the app it stops running in the background. So if you want to play music, lock your phone, etc the app completely stops working and sending requests. The location icon in the top left corner disappears. I was forced to sign out, delete the app, restart my phone, redownload the app, and log back in just to get it to work properly again only to stop working again an hour later. Please fix. It makes using the app almost unusable and after driving for Uber for 4-5 years this is the first time I’ve considered switching to a different app. Even when it’s working properly I seem to get far fewer requests than I ever have. I’ve read up on other people having the same or similar issues since the update this year but expected a fix by now.
title: Glitch??

review: I honestly don’t how else to put this. I am really disappointed in using the app. I first downloaded the app and then created my uber account. Then I added a 50 dollar uber gift card to my uber cash. Later, I wanted to use it for a ride that I was about to book. The ride really was around 13-16 dollars, but the payment wasn’t going through even though my uber cash was more than the amount ordered for the ride. Not to mention, I also added my payment method to it and still it didn’t work. It was showing to me that my payment method failed even though I had a $50 cash in uber cash and my debit card had money in it. So later I contacted the uber help like 3 times. I explained to them my situation and still they failed to solve it for me. I honestly don’t know what else to say that now my $50 is just gone!
title: Bad app and a bad customer service

review:
Disappointing customer support !!! Very hard to reach  out to them ! I tried to send the a message on instagram , to finally get  a reply , but it seemed like an automatic reply !!  I requested a call from the support team , instead they kept on sending the same useless reply ! ! 
I have been dealing with this company for more than 4 years , and It was not  bad , however when I needed the help from customer service , it was veryyyy disappointing . I cannot believe how i was charged 14 US $ for a trip that has by mistake the same pick up and drop off location ! And When i reached that area earlier that day , i payed 12 $ from my location ! When I settled in the car , the driver told me that the trip has ended ! We didn’t even move a feet ! They kept sending me that they cannot change the trip price after booking 🙃🙃🙃🙃🙃
title: Costumer support

review: Why is it so difficult to help when your issues is not listed on your app and website. As a rider I expect to at least be able to use a chat box or email if everything else falls through.  But no there is no such option. I have experience so much trouble with you and your drivers ive had to go through the near impossible way to delete my account. When it comes to uber eats you guys are good but when it comes to your riders you must not care. I’ve had some many trips to were the drive could not find me or would take the wrong route to my destination.  Because of your inability to update your GPS  the drivers would constantly make the wrong turn take me home from work costing me 40-50$ more plus tolls all because they followed your gps instead of using Google maps.
title: Make it so that we can talk to a human

review: For some reason unbeknownst to me Uber has decided to terminate my access despite having told me initially they fixed the account issue. When I pushed for reasons the bot humans who have no real ability to explain the issue replied in canned responses. The sad part is I work in CX and know what level of poor assistance this is. I can’t wait for the robotic reply to this complaint. All I wanted was a ride 20 minutes away for an urgent appointment to an area that doesn’t have public transportation, and now I’ve been given 0 access to the choice because of this company’s terrible customer support and inability to explain why they’ve done what they’ve done. I said it before and I’ll say it again. This is actually disgusting. They force you to leave a star but of course the rating actual would be in the negative.
title: Severely inappropriate maintenance of account

review: I will never use Uber again.  We live 2 miles from our pick up/drop off location.  Literally 5 minutes.  At 7pm, our ride cost $9.  At 11pm returning home, it was $27.  This is highway robbery.  There was an event downtown where literally thousands of people gathered giving drivers and Uber the opportunity to make a substantial amount of money, but they chose to gouge during this time. That’s what we get for getting out an about and giving back to our local economy.  Our first driver’s car was filthy.  And, our driver on our expensive return home trip was awful.  She picked up our trip and she was 15 minutes away.  She passed us, despite having our EXACT location pinned, and we had to wait a total of 20 minutes.  When driving, she couldn’t even follow the map and we were having to navigate for her. I vote for having cabs back.
title: Gouging

review: This app works with me 90% of 10% of the time. I’ve counted on Uber to save my job four times and it’s come through exactly one of those times. It’s hard for me to recommend an app that fails at its primary function during all daylight hours. I spent forty-five minutes trying to find a ride to work this morning, and every single ride (UberX, Comfort, all of them) canceled after about 5 minutes. I ended up getting my boss to drive me, instead of the ride-share app. Two stars because when it does work, it’s great. It’s gotten me to and from many late-night parties, though it did fail me even last time I was trying to get to a party. I think I’ll be shifting to Lyft unless I can start getting better short-distance service because as it stands, Uber has failed me too many times to be trusted.
title: A wonderful app some of the time

review: I’ve been using Uber often the last couple of months and I used it at the end of last year like every day, and I’ve noticed on my bank statements that I’ve been charged twice for the same ride. Several times has problems, not been solved and needs to be addressed by Uber and I’ve called and complained several times in the issue was still going on and this is seven months after the original complaint. I’m happy with the service and the promise of the rides. The wait time is very low but again if I’m paying twice for a ride it’s not worth the wait.
title: Double charges

review:
I was trying to cancel a ride but the app refused. So I tried texting the Uber text messages, and I got no response. So I tried texting the driver, and no response. So I tried resetting the app, nothing worked. So I waited until the drive came to tell him that I tried canceling the ride. He didn’t like that, he said that his rides had a “high no cancellation rate”, to which I did not know and found irrelevant to the situation. I showed him the texts I sent, and he showed me his phone and app and we both found nothing. I told him he could leave with the charge(which is about $30 estimated) but before he left he mentioned the word “sueing” under his breath, so to derail that upcoming conversation, I said I would call a representative to handle the cancellation for us both. So far no number to contact. 
In the end, I deleted this app.
title: Terrible Contact and Coordination

review:
English lacks the words to properly describe how worthless Uber has become. The estimated wait time is a joke, both before and after a driver is selected, and then it becomes a battle of the wills waiting for the driver to start moving. God forbid you cancel on a driver that hasn’t moved at all after 5-10 minutes; you’ll get hit with a cancelation fee to compensate the driver for their time that you’ve wasted. I feel like I’ve been punked.

If you then try to dispute that fee all you get is a credit towards a future ride, and there’s nothing further you can do because there are zero options for any real customer support or interaction. Uber’s pricing has steadily gone up while it’s quality has steadily gone done. At this point I’m just going to delete the app and rely on Lyft and old fashion cabs. That’s how bad it has gotten.
title: Just Delete the App

review:
Honestly, Uber has become not worth it. If you need to be somewhere by a specific time, usually there aren’t any drivers nearby or like 20+ minutes away. Okay, then I’ll schedule one a good amount of time in advance right? Why is it now $45 to schedule an Uber?? For a $12 ride? It makes no sense. Oh and now the app is so desperate to push their paid membership, they’ve removed rewards. It was nice every so often to get a little discount after booking so many rides, but not anymore. You have to pay to get a 5% frikin discount on rides! This app has turned into a joke. Use at your own risk, I do NOT recommend it if you live in an apartment complex, and honestly I only recommend as a LAST RESORT.

I see a lot of reviews with similar awful stores, yet the “rating” is 4.6? I smell scam.
title: Use As Last Resort!

review: I am using Uber for years and I use it lot. But I noticed last  few times they started to steal money from me. When you check upfront price they show something and they charge something else. Like today they show me upfront price $32 and they end up charging me $40. It’s happened many times with me. My point is allow me to decide if I want to pay $40 or not don’t decide for me. If you want to charge $40 then show me $40. Don’t show me $32 and charge me $40. Since you are taking money from my account without my consent it’s stealing because I didn’t agree with $40. When I try to tell them, they are telling me they return to me so many times and they can’t anymore. You are not giving me any favor by returning my own money which you stole from me to begin with. And  You didn’t return my money last few times.
title: They started to steal money

review: Everything about Uber has declined. The app NEVER loads rates properly, just spins that it’s loading rates but never populates. No way around it and I end up on Lyft by default. I have always had my 12lb hypoallergenic ESA sit on my lap or in his carrier, but now have to book an even more expensive trip for him to come along. I tipped drivers a little extra for being accommodating, but now Uber takes it.  Prices are outrageous regardless though, it cost $30 w/out tip to go less than a quarter mile down the road & back w/out my dog. I know gas prices are wild, but get real… < 15 mins in the cars and < 2 miles round trip for $40 once tipped? I know most of that isn’t even going to the driver. The app doesn’t work properly, costs are ridiculous, and customer service if you have an issue is a nightmare to deal with.
title: Used to love Uber, couldn’t hate it more now

review:
I’ve never had a problem with Uber before and it’s been overall pretty great. However last night I ordered one to be picked up at 1:15, I got notified a driver took it and they proceeded to show up to the house at 12:50 then cancelled a couple minutes later with no messages to me. I checked my email later on and Uber charged me for canceling my ride when I did nothing. When I went to try and get it fixed through the app, every time I hit proceed the website would say no internet connection. I find it odd how me trying to get my money back was the only part of the website that couldn’t work due to internet issues.
I’m honestly just disappointed and will probably stick to Lyft from now on to avoid losing more money.
title: Not sure what to rate

review: I don’t normally have a problem using uber. But recently the wait times have been ridiculous, they’ll say 5 minutes away but then when I choose the ride I have to wait anywhere between 10-20 minutes. Some rides I request will have a driver that won’t move from a spot and will give me a warning that the driver will be delayed. Today I requested a driver and when they finally got close to the destination they stopped and stayed in that same spot for 10 almost 20 minutes with no contact from the driver at all. They could have told me to cancel and find another driver instead of keeping me waiting. Not very satisfied with my current Uber experience.
title: Long Wait Times & Driver Not Moving

review:
Ordered our first food order through the Uber app around 8:30pm. I never received a phone call but when I checked my app it signaled that my food had arrived. After it became apparent that no food had arrived, I contacted support who told me their driver “had trouble delivering my order”. I received a refund, but the driver was able to keep the $13 tip. After support told me they couldn’t fix the tip refund, I pointed out how backwards this was, magically my tip was refunded.

So we ordered from another restaurant AND THE EXACT SAME THING HAPPENED. These drivers pick up the food, don’t deliver it, and then say the order is complete. We are now 3.5 hours past the initial order and back to square one, not to mention each order was ~$120. My family is sitting here at 11pm with no dinner and I will never be using this app again.
title: Worst customer service experience of my life

review:
I am in Argentina, I used Uber twice yesterday but today the app is rejecting my payment. I tried my debit card, also rejected because they say the ride is too expensive. I called my bank and they confirmed that there are no transactions declined and advised to call Uber, of course you cannot call Uber, they have this crap-question-like help center, very confusing and when finally I submitted my issue the response was to change my payment method, with a copy-paste response that didn’t addressed my issue. I tried again, this time adding a lot of details but still same copy-paste response.
Worst customer service, not a phone to call especially when you are in a time sensitive situation like myself when I was trying to get to the airport.
I really hope this company fails. I will use taxi cabs in the future
title: Worst customer support

review: People Who Pick Up Rides And Cancel Them Half away There When I Been Waiting And Than Cancel It Is Not Fair Some Of Us Is On Our Way To Work I Even Wake Up Early To Avoid It But Drivers Still Pick up Rides Be Almost 7Mins Away After I Waited The Other 10mins Of The Ride Is Not Right Yall Need To Do Something About That send A Message Out To People Not Only Is It There Job And Time People Also Have Jobs And Time To I’m Not Sure How Much You Make Picking The Ride Up But I Know I Pay Almost $20 Everyday To Get To Work I Should Experience Better Than That If Anything I Love The App But The Drivers Have Been Testing Me The Last 3 Days Making Me Late To Work Because Other Drivers Want To Pick My Ride And Cancel It 5-10mins Later That’s Wasting My Time And They Should Not Accept Ride While Driving If They Know They Do not Want To Do It
title: Rides
developerResponse: {'id': 33491086, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest", 'modified': '2022-12-02T07:45:50Z'}

review: The scams aren't all from the drivers (although you have a decent chance of those trying to scam you by intentionally not picking you up and trying to bait you into cancelling the ride), but Uber themselves will try to scam you at every opportunity. My most recent interaction with them was having them sign me up for a monthly uber pass subscription without my knowledge (even though I use their app maybe twice a year), charging me $10 a month for it for 6 months, refusing to refund me afterwards, then charging me it for 2 more months even after their support had sworn it wouldn't happen again. And apparently this is a common practice and the general consensus is you need your credit card company to put a stop on the card. If you do have no other option then check your card statements carefully every month.
title: Uber is a scam

review: The drivers never want to work. Lately, everytime I purchase a Uber ride to go to my home which is 30mins - 35 , Uber drivers pick me up just to say I don’t want to drive that far. Apparently I heard Uber drivers don’t give the driver the option to see where they’re going until they pick you up and it’s very inconvenient, rude and unnecessary. I know policy is that a Uber driver can’t cancel unless it’ll take them longer than normal or if they have another ride in progress but to have them cancel while you’re already inside their vehicle just to get out is so annoying and makes you feel like you have no other option but to call a taxi. Drivers should be at least notified where they’ll drop off customers and can not cancel or have the option to cancel when they have already arrived.
title: The drivers are very lazy

review: I like taking Uber because it’s convenient but lately these prices are unbelievable! I refuse to pay $68-$75 for a ride that’s normally between $14-$18 because it’s busy. Yes I know I have the option to decline it which I do and I wait 5-10 minutes for the price to drop down but these are rough times everywhere for everyone and to raise the prices because of a surge in the area is ridiculous not to mention the poor drivers may only get $20 of the $68-$75. Another issue is that they say it’s busy and they have no cars available and 3 minutes later it’s cars available but that’s where the prices are extremely high. I want to continue to use Uber but not if they trying to sell you a $14 ride for $60!!
title: Price gauging at its best

review:
I haven’t used uber in years for a ride. I tried to use it once last year,(big mistake btw) & when I did a little something called uberpass was offered to me upon updating and opening the app. It was a subscription apparently for rides and delivery food service. I declined and updated my card info so I could proceed to order dinner. I didn’t realize until 6 months later that , that Uber pass subscription that I had actually declined to sign up for was actually in fact charging me a monthly $9.99 a month, 

When I called my bank to cancel they tried but uber disputed it and apparently with no proof they were eventually awarded the funds. 

Keep in mind when you have a problem with uber , there is no customer support number whatsoever.  and nowhere to describe your problem. There is no way to unsubscribe, even though uber pass isn’t even available anymore. If you look up this problem online you’ll see many people have had this problem when attempting to cancel a subscription with uber that they never were aware that they even had. 

Uber has had a lot of shady business practices, they’re drivers are completely fed up with the false advertisement that the company offers. Thanks
title: Feels like Fraud

review:
Our food was late for almost two hours, and the first driver simply dropped our order after he had been sitting on it for over one hour (I already called restaurant and the order was ready to pick up). The order also arrived missing the major item and we didn’t have any time to cook rice since it was 2:30pm already. During this all time, app status shows “preparing order” - seems to me Uber is trying to make customer think that the restaurant is slowing things down while the fact is that it’s own driver is irresponsible.

Uber also tried its very best to cut you off from providing feedback.
 1. Customer service called for less than one second and hang up before I can answer. 
2. The above number won’t allow me to call back 
3. They sent an email after the restaurant contacted them for the issue, pretending they care and ask me to provide feedback, but this email will not allow me to reply (all my email responses got reply that they did not get my message)
4. An app that does not provide any customer service phone number or chat function

The only feedback I can write is here on Apple Store… so sad and angry after spending another two hours trying to make a complaint!
title: Avoid Uber Eats at all cost

review: My Uber driver, Winston, got into my account and changed the password and the two factor authentication. It has been 3 entire days and Uber support keeps pushing me off to new representatives who have no idea what’s happening and no one has been able to secure my account. I have several credit card linked to this account and Uber doesn’t take any complaints seriously. I can’t imagine any other company handling one of their employees hacking into a customer account with such a laissez fair attitude. DO NOT USE. Stick to Lyft and DoorDash. This company is a piece of trash run by trash people from the top down.
title: UBER DRIVER HACKED UBER ACCOUNT NO HELP FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE

review: I contracted with Uber for transportation from the Coachella Valley to Temecula. During our journey, I had occasion to need to scratch in an area in my upper groin which was itching badly. when I did so, my Uber driver pitched a fit and threatened to reject me from her vehicle approximately 20 miles short of my destination, in the middle of nowhere. Such disrespect is simply intolerable. What she was doing looking in my direction does not concern me except that she was doing it;I do not expect Uber drivers to be staring in the direction of my crotch. I find this conduct unacceptable and reprehensible, and intend to pursue. Add to that the fact that the drivers speed was such that I arrived at my destination 25 minutes prior to the time I had budgeted, makes my journey and altogether unpleasant one. This driver should be fired for such conduct. It will be quite some time before I avail myself of Uber again, if ever.
title: Disrespectful Driver

review: Omg not only are some of the driver car not clean but now Uber has disabled my account for absolutely no reason at all. This is Insane and I still have Uber credit that I had already bought ahead of time and now my money is gone they are thieves and they disconnect your accounts for nothing and then they never return emails you can’t, you have to email them and I have to email them they do not call you back at all ridiculous. And have you noticed that they still haven’t put up details about there privacy details that is a huge red flag every time I sign up Uber I start getting spam calls back to back then when I uninstall the app they stop calling. I think I may build a app that shows what companies are selling ppl info to Scam callers or scam companies or to other companies in general because it’s very illegal so I guess you would call it a Sue app
title: Very disappointed

review:
I use Uber to get to my job at an assisted living facility. Come to find out a driver falsely said I’d left something in his car. Apparently this cost me 15 dollars but never left anything in a car. Apparently when you are robbed the clock starts ticking when Uber will even review your complaint. Apparently I was too late and this driver got away with robbing me. Guess being too busy caring for the elderly during a pandemic to double or triple check their drivers aren’t stealing from customers is not a good enough reason but hey they told me if it happens again be a bit faster with my complaint . If it happens again?! 
Update: Support reached out after telling me tough luck a number of times. Will keep results posted here. Update: so first they say nothing they can do after 30 days and now it 90 days. Uber is allowing their drivers to steal from customers. Horrible service.
title: Robbed by a driver

review: I love the convenience of this service and the promptness of response. What I don’t care for is when the person that shows up is not the person registered on the app as the driver. This is concerning for obvious reasons. The whole reason a picture and a name and vehicle description are provided, is for safety reasons and if you have a different vehicle or an entirely different person than the one described, how are you supposed to ensure the legitimacy of your driver? I wish there was a way to report these things when they happen. I haven’t figured out how to do that or if it’s even an option.
title: Unidentified Driver

review:
The explanations for pickup should have been a little better explained (Example) ……. After exiting where the baggage claim building by I-G ….Go across the street then go to right where you will find your waiting location….. N through P…… stand by you loading area …….Now Once you click pickup we will send you your loading area and the Uber driver car with there name NOW THEY are on the way. THANKS FOR CHOOSING UBER ENJOY YOUR RIDE.

This was my first time scheduling/booking/riding with Uber. I was so scared but had to eventually give it a try. I had a awesome top notch driver, she made me feel so safe and relaxed. She was so friendly and pleasant to talk with. Her vehicle was clean inside and out, smelled clean not smokey. She offered me fresh air or AC I would love to be able to request her always.
title: Location for pickup/First Time Rider

review: I was able to  let him know where to pick me and my family up at but also told him my phone was going to die. My phone died and was scared he wasn’t going to pick us up from where we were at, we were outside of SAP center late night after a Mana concert in a neighborhood not so good to be at with a child.. we waited patiently and then he showed up! He asked if we were the ones that asked for the Uber and we said yes! He got us to our hotel safe and sound!! 20 min drive nice conversation! Nice guy! Really recommend him . We are staying in San Jose another night..will try to request him again!
title: Life saver!

review:
My first Uber ride I set up days in advance. I was going to the airport and I picked a time that would allow for some delay but the airport was Westchester which is less than 15 miles away. The driver arrived 40 minutes late making me very nervous and anxious about missing my flight. The driver was nice but he was almost clueless about his tardiness and what airport I was going to. We were lucky by not getting any lights and got to the airport with enough time for me to catch my flight. I’m sure there is a charge for a driver’s wait time, there should be a credit for the passengers when the driver is that late. 

Chuck  Vitolo
title: First ride

review:
My big gripes are:
    -the tipping doesn’t get updated right away. I took a ride to the airport. When I had time at the airport, I opened the app back up and tipped 20% because my driver was cool. I then started looking at my old rides listed (ah, sweet memories) and when I went back to the main campus age with my history, it said my latest ride didn’t have a tip. “Weird, but ok?” I thought as I added $6.00. Right after, it said I tipped $11 (original 20% plus the $6 i added when the app told me I hadn’t tipped). Again, the driver was cool, so I’m letting it slide.

   -I wanted to let the driver know, prior to requesting a ride, that there would be three passengers and one small, non-yappy dog. I think it’d be a nice feature to have.
title: Good when you need a ride, BUT

review: While depending on Uber I have been stranded on more then one occasion due to technicalities and the unnecessary channels that Uber requires you to go through. The first time I was stranded for hours do to some mishap that THEY had with my card. I was so upset I deleted the app. I really needed it them and decided to try again and I’m stranded now as we speak because my license is still attached to the first account. I reached out to support and still haven’t heard back. I honestly feel like the stipulations and procedures that u have to go through in order to use Uber is systematic racism. I wish I would stop seeing your advertisements and I really do wish the worst for your company.  U advertise something that people can depend on. But it’s really not that. Uber is made for the upper class. And silver spoons are meant to be choked on.
title: Very disappointed. Very in convenient

review:
In case you were wondering, Uber does not honor gift cards from their own company. Let me clarify. 

We had received a $20 uber gift card that we had planned on using and paying the rest of our cost on our debit card. Decent enough ride, had a long wait but we didn’t mind since we again had a gift card that covered most of the cost. We thought the driver did a decent job so as most people would, we left a tip. 

This is where everything went wrong. 

The app took out the tip from the gift card instead of putting the remaining balance on my card. After this error, the app then said we did not have sufficient funds to pay for the app and had to use my card to pay (when originally, it used all the gift card and the rest of my debit card). Now we had to pay the whole ride except for tip on my debit card. Meanwhile we still have money from our gift card that is unable to be used in our account. 

This is a flaw in the app and your business model and you should not be making promises to customers who plan to use a gift card if they change. 

For those still reading, take Lyft. Equal in ride experience, cheaper, and not a pain trying to use a gift card.
title: They don’t honor Gift Cards

review: I ordered a Uber I’m advance yesterday. I tried to change the destination address because I was provided the wrong one initially. When I tried changing the destination about 2 hours prior to the scheduled trip the app keeps saying accept new charge which is almost 10 dollars cheaper than the original charge. But every time I click it it says something went wrong try again. Here comes the Uber driver telling me it’s impossible for the new address to be cheaper. And that he has to take me to the original address and I have to request a new Uber rider from there. So I’m other words. Instead of me paying less now I’m having to pay more for a new ride because your useless app won’t allow to change the destination address and don’t have a way to chat or call a live representative to resolve the issue.
title: Useless app

review: My driver was 4 min away from me and proceeded to drive 24 minutes AWAY from me in the complete opposite direction and I couldn’t even talk to anyone!! The driver kept forwarding my calls and wouldn’t pick up the phone and after sitting in the 98 degree sun for literally 30 min I canceled the ride and they CHARGED ME!!! Not to mention the absolute rediculous prices my Uber was a 7 minute drive and they wanted 44$!!!! I’m absolutely disgusted at where this app has gone in the past couple of years. It’s really sad. I remember when you could get a ride anywhere quick and good prices. Now it’s like they charge you more for shorter drives! I just cannot believe it and I’m extremely disappointed with the entire service/app/system. Pretty much the only good thing about this app anymore is most of the actual drivers are pretty nice people.
title: Absolutely rediculous

review: This was my first time using any ride share company. After getting off the plane in Phoenix waiting for my luggage I ordered a ride. It was a reasonable price. Unfortunately it took ten minutes or so for me to get my luggage, and the car I ordered couldn’t wait. For that I was charged 5 dollars for which is understandable. So after I got my luggage maybe 12 minutes or so I ordered another ride. It went up 30 dollars in that time frame!! Then when the car arrived he informed me he didn’t have a face mask……even though COVID is winding down….not cool to not wear a mask with someone that close. No way to roll down the window. It’s Phoenix….way too hot. The guy was very nice and we had a good conversation. But because of the sudden increase in prices and the driver not wearing a face mask I don’t think I will be using the service again any time soon.
title: Not too impressed

review:
I was having trouble calling an Uber due to my phone dying. I ended up getting a ride home from my boss, and never took an Uber home. When I got home and charged my phone, I was charged $67 for a ride I never took! The pick up was a few blocks down from my work, and the destination was somewhere I had never been, an address I had never looked up! The driver obviously claimed I completed the ride which is untrue! 
I tried to dispute this and they’re response over and over was similar to “since your trip was completed, we will not be issuing a refund or adjusting the fare”
After trying to explain further that I was never completed the trip and was never in the vehicle, that the driver must have claimed I was in the car but wasn’t, they started ignoring me! 
I have used Uber for years and never had an issue like this before. So disappointed
title: :(Long time customer-so FRUSTRATED!

review: Omg Uber drivers have been giving me a hard time lately!! First some drivers don’t even want to drop me off at my destination because “it doesn’t show them where” when I can clearly see that they’re lying!! Then I had a driver that had to stop to get gas, like why did they accept the rise if they’re tank is low?? Also, why are drivers accepting rides when they can’t even make it??!! It’s so frustrating when it says that they’re two minutes away but they’re just parked somewhere without moving and they get to me 10 min later. I cancel and try again and the same Uber driver accepts it, why are they doing this? I try to contact them and they just ignore me. Uber needs to fix this so that I don’t waste time on drivers that don’t want to drop me off at my destination and also just accept rides and are just parked somewhere for a long time!
title: Unprofessional Uber drivers
developerResponse: {'id': 13866662, 'body': 'Hi there, we appreciate you writing in about your experience with our team. Feedback from our riders is vitally important to us. We’d look into the same for you.', 'modified': '2020-03-05T06:31:25Z'}

review: I use this app every single day and I love it but lately it’s been a little bad. It doesn’t make sense I waste 20 minutes trying to get a ride just so the app tells me my driver will be here in 16 minutes. That’s way too much time spent while trying to get ready to go to work. And the just so the driver cancels last mines now I’m late for work. I never leave bad reviews, never liked doing that. It’s just feedback because I’ve been late for work many times lately because of Uber. Please try to find the closest drivers and stop making me wait so long. Thank you
title: Please better the service

review: Emmanuel and I had quite the “adventure”. Hwy 75 was backed up delaying our trip by 30 minutes. so I searched for an alternate route. When I first searched, the route was clear. But then we got stuck there too, probably because everyone was coming from the Hwy 75 backup. Emmanuel was a great companion and conversationalist and very patient in our dilemma. But we made it! Thank you, Emmanuel, for the great company! By the way, I found out the cause of the backup… a UPS truck had crashed in the median and the debris was actually blocking BOTH north AND southbound traffic. Be well and safe out there, Emmanuel!
title: “Adventure” from Love Field to Mckinney

review: I am sad to say that I cannot use my Uber cash to pay for my teen’s rides using Uber family. This messed things up for me as my child’s after school program awarded me financial assistance in the form of an Uber gift card to assist with transportation from school to the program. Now I can’t use it, and I had to pay for the rides myself, which is an issue. Why shouldn’t a parent be able to use their own Uber cash to pay for their child’s ride? It makes no sense. And good luck getting ahold of a live person to talk to if you have an issue. It took me an hour to navigate the help section and finally find a way live chat to an agent, for a chat conversation that would have taken 5 minutes on the phone. This needs to be fixed now if you’re going to market Uber teen as a solution for parents.
title: Screwed over the parents

review: My review I’m gonna write them a three out of five because numerous times I would book a ride and for some reason my ride gets lost and I don’t get a ride for the price it’s told me the ride was going to be at. Sometimes the drivers rate is higher than even a yellow cab. I’ve had situations where they would want me to get out of the car because the previous ride changed the location when they booked their second ride. This is very dangerous if you’re a woman in a big city at night it should be illegal. Overall Uber needs to have a lot of improvements but for the most part it gets me home … sometimes but usually not on time
title: Fluctuates prices but still at the end of the day is the best price
developerResponse: {'id': 33423298, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest", 'modified': '2022-11-29T07:22:05Z'}

review: Was arranging a scheduled ride for some friends about an hour away from them & having trouble understanding how it worked - you have to restart every time a future book doesn’t work or for whatever reason is $50+. Accidentally pressed confirm as I thought it said continue & I had to flesh out details. But no, it tried to book an hour long ride without a second thought, $70. And you know that it will immediately charge a 15%+ cancellation fee even if you immediately cancel. My card declined for some very lucky reason but I am appalled that this happened. Do NOT EVER give it your card - just use apple pay. Horribly designed app that’s out to get you in any way possible. I switched to Lyft, which has a sensible, clear UI, and didn’t get charged almost $100.
title: Almost charged me $70 because the app is poorly designed.

review:
I preordered a ride for 445; at 420 I was able to leave work so i thought i was changing my preordered rides time. The rate was $10 less AND driver was 7mins away. When I got the notification of my driver arriving, I also received another notification for the 445 ride advising a completely different driver with the higher rate!
I kept attempting to change the time, and of course the app wouldn’t allow the time change! So I had two choices, pay the rate for the same ride or cancel the trip and for thst I was charged a $25 cancellation fee. The cancellation fee cost the same as the most expensive trip!!! Why would Ubers app not ask if the ride coming to the same location 10 minutes apart problems with notification of are these rides being combined? Do you know you have a ride scheduled already? Something??
title: Yet AGAIN OVERCHARGED

review: Fuming right now. Just had two drivers in a row cancel after waiting 10+ minutes for their pick up. Watched one driver sit in the same spot for half the time. Didn't answer text or call. Tried to find a way to contact customer service and they don't even have a phone number. They direct you to the help section of the app which is impossible to find. It's actually on the website. On the website there are extremely limited options and none of them lead to a customer service line. I'm now going to be 20 minutes late after ordering a ride with 40 minutes to spare. Wouldn't have bothered leaving a review if it was even remotely possible to get in contact with customer service. Won't be using this app again, after using it exclusively for rideshare for years.
title: Horrid Customer Service

review: I ordered food for $25 and immediately canceled the order because the address was wrong. However I was still charged the amount for the food because the restaurant “had already started preparing it”. Pretty hard to believe that the restaurant had started to prepare the whole $25 order within the less than one minute I canceled the order and reordered it with the right address. So my $25 meal ended up costing around $50. I understand that we should be charged if we do genuinely cancel the order after it was made, but I think there should be a grace period about 5 minutes or so that we should be given to cancel the order. Because I’m pretty sure the restaurant didn’t have my $25 worth of food made within less than a minute of my cancellation.
title: Cancellation fee

review: This is incredible and outrageous. Customer support is none existing and when they get back to you they state that I have to pay for a robbery occurred by a driver (double charge) because some of their stupid policy has passed. Oh yeah? Where were you when I’m contacting you and no person can respond and resolve the situation. So I go to a capital to bring my car for maintenance and use Uber, after sometime I open the app when I need it again to find out that I have magical unpaid bills I have to resolve otherwise I cannot use the app. I mean seriously? Your customer service refused to respond neither you have a phone with a human being who can talk and respond, not your bots which respond within a week of time while I’m stuck on a highway with no mean of transport. Surprise…you can’t use the app because you’re being robbed!
title: Driver’s theft
developerResponse: {'id': 32375100, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here:\xa0https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-10-04T07:07:27Z'}

review: I recently acquired uber one and got an apple card with 3% daily cash back on uber through apple pay. This was great initially. Now the apple pay payment method has disappeared on my trip to costa rica and the support staff has been completely incompetent in answering why, or even acknowledging what the issue is. The only answer I get is that there must be something wrong with my apple pay or apple card, which apple has confirmed is not true. This has been extremely frustrating and disappointing, as the app would have been very convenient and useful for my vacation. If the apple pay payment method doesn't come back when I go return to the US, I will uninstall the app and cancel my membership. Shockingly bad display from such a well established company. I will be avoiding using the uber for the remainder of my stay.
title: Incompetent support staff

review: Most of the time I need to get where I go.. but I rarely like my uber drivers. At first when I used the app, I was getting pretty good drivers.. but now I just get old men who tell me how grateful I should be that their in the area or criticize how I use the app (I put in my address, but apparently that’s not specific enough?) or just cranky old conservative men who make me uncomfortable. I get it, this is your retirement job, but you have to understand that most if not all riders are just looking to get to a place, not to be criticized and generally made uncomfortable. Maybe I just experience this or it’s just because where I live. Personally, I’m switching to Lyft and if that doesn’t work, I guess I’m walking. I think out of over 100 drivers, I personally loved maybe 3. USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!
title: Do Not Suggest

review: I recently took an Uber home and realized the next day I had left my phone in the back of the drivers car. I had my mom call my phone that morning to get a hold of the driver who refused to drop my phone back off even though I offered to pay and said I would be able to pick it up tomorrow at 3pm and gave an address. I show up at said address today and he is no longer answering the phone. Uber customer service was also no help because they say when they “reached out” to the driver and he said he didn’t have it contradicting the fact we had already been in contact. Mind you I have Find My IPhone on and can clearly see that my phone is at the location the driver gave me. Uber should have a better way of handling the thieves they hire to drive for them instead of just blindly vouching for them.
title: Stolen Phone

review: They canceled my order because they were no drivers around and they still took money out of my account and on top of that their rides cost five to ten more dollars than what Lyft does I go to get a ride to my dads which is 10 minutes or less away Lyft will charge $10-$12 and you guys are charging $16-$20 that’s just outrageous like seriously why such high charges??? I’m tired of you guys ripping me off and I’m no longer an Uber customer!!! just horrible service overall and to but the cherry on top they don’t even have a support number for customers to call??!!! You have to contact by messaging through the Uber app so stupid! but yet they have a support number for the drivers? Smh so ridiculous get a support number for customers making it so complicated for no reason!! And I want my money back!
title: Horrible app and customer support
userName: My god is so big and so mighty
developerResponse: {'id': 28102430, 'body': "Hi! Sorry to hear about your concern regarding the cancellation charges incurred. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve to your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE . We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-02-17T08:52:58Z'}

review:
I was a die hard Uber user until today. Honestly I have had a bunch of terrible drivers who either made me feel uncomfortable by either hitting on me, propositioning me or just plan dirty with yesterdays throw up still in the back seat. I used Uber through the pandemic because my job wouldn’t let us use the train. So I got kind of used to it. 

Since being back at work I did miss the connivence of it all. So when my boss gave me a gift card I was like yeah why not treat my self to Uber so I won’t walk in the cold… I should have walked. I got charged on the amex given to me for Christmas and my own card because it was “declined” but seriously if it was where is my money!! Can’t talk to anybody or explain that now I’m out of $40 because their system messed up. Forget all my reward points I’m so done and I’m switching to Lyft.
title: Can never talk to anyone

review:
I had no problems with the Uber App until today. 
It’s the worst app I have ever used. I guess you thought you were updating it to make it better but you made it worst. First things first I could not change my credit card number…I could not tip the driver… I couldn’t rate the driver. Not sure my payment will even go through as the card that’s on it is no longer valid. I am very frustrated and there’s no one to call as the information I found on google is totally useless. Whenever there is something that works for us laypeople it should be left as is or there should be some sort of tutorial to guide us. I will try one more time and if I don’t succeed this time I’m going to totally delete it and try someone else. Very very disappointed
title: New Uber Application:

review: I read a few of these reviews & some are definitely valid Uber complaints related issues but majority are complaints of the drivers. These Uber drivers aren’t in front of or around a supervisor or manager at all so I don’t really see the need to be professional and proper as someone would behind a counter or over the phone. If I were a driver I’d be very laid back, I’d engage in a convo depending on the vibe I get from each customer, & definitely let them hop on the aux. that’s just my personality maybe but a lot of these reviews seem to come from Uber users that have their standards too high for Uber drivers. I’m from Philly and I use Uber occasionally. Most of my drivers were laid back & took care of getting me from point a to b without an issue, which is the goal anyway. Who cares about the ‘experience’ was 🤷🏻‍♂️
title: They’re regular people

review:
I was a loyal customer to Uber for a few years now and have used their service globally but since moving to Canada I have been extremely disappointment in their service.
Not only have I been receiving charges from them on rides or food I didn’t order (which would be refunded after a couple days even without me contacting them… weird?) 

But recently I had a driver who lied and said I made a mess in their car and was charged $80 on my card without even a notification from Uber. I was on my way home from work and had no liquids or anything in the car and even checked the car to see if I left anything behind before leaving AND I’m pretty sure the ride was recorded so if I had made a mess I think the driver would have surely said something. 
I have been trying to get into contact with Uber support over this issue for 2 weeks now with no response from their chat system and no help number to call. 
You guys lost a loyal customer, I will be switching to Lyft and telling my friends to do the same.
With such a lack customer service like this it’s almost as if you don’t want to hear or deal with your customers issues/complaints at all. 
Very disappointed.
title: Loyal customer turned former customer!

review: Ive always used uber since day 1 , it facilitated my life the past couple of years.  But man what has happened to you guys ?? Not only your rides are insanely ridiculous.  They ore than tripled in value.  But the drivers themselves will not accept any ride that’s under 25$ that easily.  It’s really sad to see how greedy you guys have become, and it’s not to help the drivers with their income because you guys take a good chunk of the money for yourselves.  It’s sad to see why you guys have become as bad a yellow taxi and thus why you’re paving the way for tesla to start their own taxi business.  You had a good thing going and got greedy.  It’s only a matter of time before this company and Lyft go down to the ground, because of how ridiculously expensive it has become, and many people around the community agree as well, don’t dig your own grave.
title: Rip off

review: This beautiful man drove me to the airport on a day that was a huge challenge for me. His care and comfort compassion is beyond exceptional. He not only helped me with my bags but his heartfelt kindness gave me strength that even my own family couldn’t do! If the world of uber had even ONE MORE RAFEAL… I believe it could change the world for the better. I’m not just saying that or being cliche. He is a true gift and I will never ever forget him! Please recognize him as he did what most would not even consider. I could thank him a million times and it still would not feel like enough. The simple kindness of this is profound!!!
title: Rafeal

review:
This man showed up within 3 minutes one minute earlier than expected in ordering his Rave Toyota hybrid which turned out to be surprisingly rather spacious as both my friend and I noticed breaking down my newish Giant mountain bike that comfortably fitted within the back area of the Rave!
John clearly understood what he was doing when he purchased the vehicle because he proudly announced that his Rave would get approximately 400 miles upon one tank of gas!
Ripping through our small town he put us on our destination before we could even realize we were already there at the CVS on Lighthouse Avenue.
title: Quick ride with John

review: Seriously this is all just marketing, big companies like these that heavily rely on “real people reviews” I believe that it’s all just paid to make good reviews to offset the terrible ones seriously.
