Just look at them, you read it and it’s obvious, nobody takes their actual time to review twice a company, even more so Uber Lyft and others were you’re already post several conflicting reviews from trip to trip, or from each service in app already. I know it’s part of the trade but at least add truths here and there to make it believable. A real person after a terrible ride would come right back and post a negative review right away. To the fact that people actually believe reviews up to 3 stars and are skeptical about 4 stars, but FIVE(5) stars… puff seriously that’s pushing it.
title: I bet all this is paid to make fake reviews

review: My charge should only be $19 the same as my ride 4/20. Pool ride from Newark to Fortlee. The driver pick me up with another passenger going to Elizabeth!! I told him I’am going to Fortlee! He said ok you’re in the pool. This is the first time I had this bad expirience with Uber. I have no choice bec I thought this a pool so I went along . Then I saw my charges $46 . First this is a pool. I’am so dissatisfied with the driver even though I told him that I’am going to Fortlee not York! I could have gotten another Uber! I was late for my appointment due to a long way from Elizabeth for the 1st drop passenger. Please advised and I need to only be charge for $19. Thank You Melinda Jose
title: Uber ride
developerResponse: {'id': 3501992, 'body': 'Hi there, we can understand your concern. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact so we can connect.', 'modified': '2018-05-17T13:05:03Z'}

review: Please stop showing prices to drivers before they accept the ride! It takes me at lease 30 mins to find a driver that accepts the ride, when I pull up the app to find a car, it shows multiple Ubers near me but none accept because “the price might not be worth it for them” this is causing drivers to only accept rides that they feel is beneficial to them! Leaving us, the people who need a ride with less options and making us late to our destinations. Uber drivers are getting lazy to accepts rides if they don’t get more than $10 for that ride! So please just go back to how it was before! You are screwing the customers over with this feature.
title: Don’t tell drivers how much the ride will be!!!

review:
3 drivers tried to drop me at a location I didn’t live, 2 said no problem n took me to correct location, I took me where his gps said to n said get out. He called police, I only lived 6 blocks away but, no! His gps said I lived there..get out. 
Then a hospital called 2 times so two cars came n they charged me. I was told they do it all the time, think it’s funny.
Got reimbursed for issues, over a year old, called for Uber yesterday n was told these bills had to be paid first????!!! The 3 they reimbursed me for! Last nights driver was nice as I her his gps tell him take me 6 blocks from my home! He said don’t worry I’ll take u home. 
I want the $ I got back last year that u forced me to give back last night in order to get home:(
title: My home address keeps coming up wrong

review: I reserved a car to the airport last night for 7:30am this morning.  At 7:00am I received a text that my driver was there and was going to wait.  At 7:14am I received a text that the driver had canceled but that someone would connect shortly.  Almost 10 minutes went by and the app said no drivers available.  This was quite alarming.    The app did not give me the ability to schedule another ride.  Around 7:28 it said my driver was 8 minutes way.  Turns out he had been assigned the ride last night and then it was taken away from him.  He received a notice that he had to pick me up in 6 minutes to this am.  I am grateful to the driver that was able to get there so quickly but highly disappointed in Uber for putting me in a panic.
title: Reservation canceled

review: I take Uber often it has been several times when a driver accepts my ride but has something else going on it says they will arrive in 6 mins but they are literally in the same spot for 15mins one driver accepted my ride knowing he had a flat tire and was in the process of getting it fixed then if you ask them to cancel they don’t want to gets really rude about I have something to do and somewhere to go WORK I reached out to customer service and asked them to cancel because the driver wouldn’t they told me I had to wait for an email from another department didn’t cancel my ride till a hour in a half later tried to send me another Uber as if I waited that long then charged me 4 times for that ride I am ready to start a civil suit because I know I’m not the only person this happens to
title: Poor customer service

review: I’ve used Lyft fairly regularly without issue but may be done. After I booked a ride based on the estimated wait time being quite a bit less than Uber, my confirmed driver ended up being much further away and was finishing up another ride. When I tried to cancel due to the delay, the app indicated I would be charged a cancellation fee because the driver purportedly had already started driving “one minute” toward me. Except he hadn’t. The map showed he still had 10 minutes left before he finished dropping off his existing passengers. No thanks, Lyft. I do not like to be scammed.
title: Cancellation fee scam

review:
I had trouble finding a TAXI the other day, then waited 25 minutes for it to arrive. I live in a fairly large city. So I finally caved and downloaded the app, and took my first ride BACK to the dealer where I left my truck days before. 

The Uber showed up in 7 minutes. The car was cleaner than the old wore out taxi I took 2 days before. The app is awesome, it tells you EVERYTHING you need/want to know. I especially like the way you can include “custom” amounts for tipping without any discussion with your driver.  The cost of my ride was about HALF the taxi ride. 

I’m sold. I’ll be using Uber from now on!  👍🏻
title: My First Uber Ride

review:
This annoys the crap out of me.  I keep getting notification “reminding” me to use Uber Eats. I’ve never used Uber Eats. I don’t want Uber Eats. I don’t want GitHub. I don’t want anybody’s half-cold styrofoam food delivered in my house. I cook what I eat or I enjoy it at a nice restaurant. Life is too short for delivered soggy crap food that needs reheating and still is not as good as when it comes straight from a kitchen — mine or the restaurant’s. 

And yet Uber keeps trying to push this. The only Uber app I have is the one for rides and I have gone into the app and shut off the very marketing and non-ride notification option available to me. And yet Uber still insists on littering my notifications with their ads for a service I don’t want and never will. 

STOP IT ALREADY!
title: Stop with the ads in notifications!!!

review:
I noticed something on most Uber drivers that they are not looking for the convenience of the customer, they are looking for ways to take as much money as possible from the customer, such as: (slows the speed to the lowest possible degree) (goes from other ways to increase the distance) (it is impossible to turn on the air conditioner) Thus, the car is like a furnace in the summer) (unnecessary and unjustified stops at: traffic lights, at market places, gas stations and pharmacies with cheap and meaningless pretexts, “They always delay us in our work”) (and finally, the unwanted talk)
After the experience, these things are very annoying and Uber must solve them.
title: these things are very annoying and Uber must solve them

review:
Diamond driver here. I like the app. But if you’re a late night delivery driver and the restaurant is closed (which can happen quite often) the order stays active. If you accept the order and you get there you only get $3 for your time. But this keeps happening and now I don’t even get $3 for driving there when gas is really expensive right now. Support are the opposite of helpful on this. 

Another thing, if you keep declining bad orders (even manually) the app can decide to stop your requests without asking you. 

Also, they outsource their customer support out of country to save money. They barely speak English and are not helpful for more complex issues as they basically only know how to use copy and paste. 

One last thing. If you’re playing music this app often messes up whatever you’re listening to by either pausing it or making the quality go down after you get a notification for an order request. They said they made an update to help this it really hasn’t helped.
title: Stop Punishing Late Night Delivery Drivers

review: I used to love Uber but was trying to prove my husband wrong in thinking it was better than Lyft. Turns out I was wrong. In just the span of two days, they confused my drop off location with my pickup location and charged me $5 to cancel the pickup (since the driver was 30 minutes away from the actual pickup spot). Then I scheduled a trip to the airport the night before for 7AM and it was showing a $40 trip. No big deal. Was told my driver would wait for us and we’d incur late fees starting at 7:05. The driver showed up at 6:45 AM. I let him know we’d be out closer to 7 AM (the scheduled pickup time). We got outside of the hotel at 7:04 AM. When I promptly got a notification that my driver cancelled and I needed to book a new trip. Awesome. Went in to book a trip.. fairs were now over $100. Nope. We’ll be using Lyft. Thanks for nothing, Uber.
title: Not impressed

review: I have been using Uber for a while since it came out but sadly over the years its quality of service has declined drastically. Drivers now more than ever accept a ride and cancel within seconds while some accept the ride, drive halfway to my destination, and cancel so it’s impossible to trust the App when needing it as a way to get from point A to point B. Wait time for a ride is extremely lengthy, and there is no online or In-App direct phone number to have verbal communication with someone to assist on an issue. So if you need a phone number or method to contact support for direct help? You can forget it! The chances of you seeing pigs fly are higher than the chances of you actually getting the proper customer help that is needed. Wouldn’t recommend this app for anyone and will personally stop using this app from this point on.
title: Ridiculous and Unreliable service

review: I haven’t used Uber and a couple of months. I’ve been trying to stop the subscription. I’m not getting any luck AT ALL so far I’ve lost $48 in two months and I haven’t used the service. It’s practically impossible to speak to a human everything is over the phone and the Internet so there’s no human connection. I don’t have 24+ dollars to donate to a service that I don’t use anymore I need help!! I want to stop my service I will no longer use Uber I’d rather go to Lyft. This is huge inconvenience for me. Uber was quick to stop my service  they thought I was another customer who gave a driver a hard time.I couldn’t get a ride until a number I wasn’t able to call back (Uber)called me to dispute a situation I had nothing to do with. I just want to stop the service you all are stealing from me at this point and I’m sick of it and I want my money back.
title: I no longer use Uber

review:
So, my dear friend called me. She’s at the car shop. Vehicle dead. Nobody there will drive her  10 minutes home —don’t get me started on that.
I go to a mechanic that will absolutely take you home. I heard the mechanic say to her “the brakes are bad on my car!!! 😡!!
She doesn’t know how to use the App— it did require some extra information from me since I was a third-party, but it was easy-he was there in nine minutes and then he texted me back that he had her and then I called him on the phone and he answered because I needed her to call me. $27. Of course I gave him a $10 tip because I know they don’t make anything on that $27.!!!
It’s not the money it’s the fact that she was sitting in a broken down car and she needs to be home….
And I’m gonna call them tomorrow to have up and taken to get her car!!!! 
I’ve used the service seven times now and I’ve been very lucky and had amazing drivers!!!
I’m a very happy customer 🎵🐾🙏🐈‍⬛🎵❤️
title: It amazes me these drivers come like a knight in shining armor

review:
Uber divers use their phone extensively this application to get rides and navigate. Unfortunately this app is a total failure when it comes to battery utilization and keeping the phone cool.
While plugged into apple car play, this app makes the phone so hot that I can’t touch it. Plus you must open your phone to click navigation in order to show navigation on the apple car play. For any ride which is 99% ends near the destination, again you moody open your phone and end navigation. This is a serious issue resulting in distraction and definitely will case an accident. 
Another funny thing, pretty much all Mercedes Benz cars are eligible for Uber comfort… like GLA, GLB, GLC etc… but EQB which is electric version of GLB  is NOT eligible for Uber comfort. Apparently a big SUV can’t give passengers a comfortable ride.
title: Why can’t make an app which really works?

review: Uber is literally charging me $40 for I don’t even know what. I have charges on a day I didn’t even ride uber. This is the first bad review I have ever written because I believe it is necessary to warn other people about this as well. I tried contacting customer support. Guess what? Non existent. There isn’t a phone number (even though it is advertised there is online) and the only way to contact them is through automated texts. It’s been an hour, no reply but will update. All in all this experience has been horrendous to say the least. I am a doctor with very little time which is frustrating when I am dealing with this instead of enjoying the little time i have with family but this is fraud. I will sue if it comes to that. I am never using Uber again for these reasons and advise you to do the same.
title: Worst company ever

review: I dont think its fair that you can wait 18 minutes for a driver just for them to cancel once they get here. I literally just got a call from my uber driver who was 90 meters away to ask me where i was, i told him i was literally walking out and he cancelled on me. I ordered an Uber for my friend yesterday and he asked us what our destination (the destination is already provided information to the driver) and he wouldn’t come unless we told him. He literally drove further without cancelling the ride and we couldn’t get another one
title: How is it that drivers can cancel once they are already here

review: The general use of the app is easy, I’ve used Uber for many years. But I’m giving 3 stars because when on the odd occasion that I want to leave a 4 star or less review and set a tip I CANNOT pay until I give a reason. Sometimes I just don’t gel with a driver or they talk about politics. I don’t hold it against them, just not a 5 star experience and I don’t want Uber to penalize them if I give some arbitrary reason. Make it easier to leave less than a 5 star review so ratings aren’t skewed by inconvenience. 4 star isn’t the end of the world
title: App is reliable but leaving less than 5 star rating is cumbersome

review: Works just fine if you really need to get somewhere, but avoid scheduling a ride ahead of time. They allow their drivers to pick you up as late as they want with no penalty or refund. Several times I’ve scheduled a ride at a set time only for the driver to arrive up to 40 minutes late. Don’t try to contact Uber support regarding the issue since they’ve made it impossible to actually speak to anyone regarding this issue. Drivers shouldn’t be allowed to be late to pre-scheduled rides under any circumstances without accommodations being made
title: Decent if you really need to get around

review: Good luck getting a toll back paid, even if the app requires you to go that route. Good luck “high demand areas” - it will be high demand/extra pay everywhere except for where you are. Good luck with costly car repairs, good luck with a 1099. Good luck living paycheck to paycheck. Uber does NOT care about their drivers. Good luck waiting an hour for support after talking to a automated voice message for 25min. This app truly keeps the poor, poor and the profit goes to the executives who don’t drive. Maybe actually pay the drivers a respectable wage.. have fun driving 25min for a trip that’s less than $5… have fun with traffic. Don’t forget you are mainly giving rides to drunk adults, and that’s a whole different area to complain about… Don’t waste 2 years of your life, as I did, learn from my miss judgements.
title: You get what you pay for.

review: I’m going to keep this brief because I’m tired of writing paragraphs to Uber that result in an automated, 100% irrelevant response. Ubers app failed on me and I have been trying to contact them for over a week, and have been ignored repeatedly, cannot find a way to SPEAK to someone, and receive cookie cutter paragraph replies that make it obvious no one read my previous emails. This company is immoral and apparently has gotten too big to fail. Anyone who enjoys this app has just been lucky enough to never have to communicate with their staff or try to get a problem resolved. Worst experience with a company I’ve ever had. If all else fails and I cannot find a phone number for rider customer service, I will have to do a chargeback on my card, and will gladly never ride with Uber again if that is the case.
title: Bot Service Reps, Absolute Thieves

review:
Although I am opted out of all advertising, the Uber app has started sending “push” advertising spam to my devices. The crazy thing is that their own customer service acknowledges the problem but doesn’t know how to fix it. They say they can stop email and text message advertisements but not advertising pushed directly to the device by their app.

We have now disabled the Uber app on all business phones but some people on my team cannot get around using Uber on their private devices. Short of uninstalling the app as we have done on our business phones, disabling notifications on the device solves the problem but degrades the user experience. If someone at Uber is reading this, please regain your sanity and stop sending advertising to people who have opted out. Thank you
title: Uber doesn’t understand privacy

review: I couldn’t even get a ride. I downloaded this app In case I needed a ride to my college or back home. Haven’t had to use it until right now as writing this and it won’t work. I’m trying to add a card to my wallet and it keeps saying there was an issue with my payment when I’ve added everything correctly. I tried different zip codes and nothing worked. I tried to use a different card and still doesn’t work. Decided to try to get some support and the faq doesn’t help at all. I tried to see if you guys have a customer line and you guys don’t. You only have a phone line for frickin drivers. Why isn’t there a customer service line for riders? I’m so ticked rn because I have no other way to get to my college class right now so I’m forced to miss a day because your app isn’t letting me add my debit card.
title: Just horrible

review: I'm deleting the app and will stop using uber after being a fan und using uber for business and privately for many years. I received an email after a trip that the driver reported me regarding face covering and I got threatened to be removed from the app. In a world full of humans I believe that people should communicate to each other. The driver did not mention anything to me. There should be a checkbox for the driver 'Asked rider to put on mask' and not the reporting to a system for non-compliance (we have to keep in mind that there are exceptions to the rule and that this especially hurts already vulnerable humans). Think about which direction behavior and encouragment of this behavior can go. In addition to the checkbox masks should be provided for each rider if that is the (current) rule. I'm happily removing myself from the app.
title: We received feedback regarding your face mask

review: In the last year Uber’s reliability has steadily worsened. Drivers frequently accept a ride and cancel often after the passenger has waited 10 minutes or more; the app should track that and penalize such drivers. The direction given to the drivers by the app are often off by 100 meters or more; this should be corrected and drivers given an address rather than a mark for the pickup or destination points. Uber gets more costly to the riders daily and drivers say they receive less and less of the fares. We used to use Uber in our household 3-4 times a day, but recently bought a car because it saves us money and headaches.
title: Unreliable

review: Hope you never have a single issue/double charge/payment issue etc because these greedy jerks don’t even have a support team/number you can only submit tickets that are auto filled and suggest to submit more tickets to solve issues for an endless loop. Strait jerks, half of my family cannot use the family payment even though I approved and filled the same steps with all of them while the other half of my family can use it but then still gets double charged on their personal accounts half the time. With a normal company this would be a minor error to be solved with a support staff call however these dip sticks don’t care about the customers they just care about money so there is no support team or help whatsoever and because of that, 1 star is all you greedy sloots deserve
title: Support nonexistent

review: So I need to go about 1 mile I got a Uber Cito be there in three minutes about 30 seconds came up I got a random phone call from the Uber driver saying that if I don’t tip him an extra $10-$15 it’s not worth picking me up then he canceled and I had to order another Uber and it said 4 minutes away then it turned to 27 minutes away when it was a 15 minute walk so the time changed on me so I canceled and they’re going to charge me five dollars and I ended up walking the mile… try reaching out to customer service does no good you can’t find a one 800 number all you have to do is message them and hope for the best!! Don’t waste your time or money on this app!!!!! And there’s absolutely no customer service to help you out you call the number it tells you how to do it on the app and hangs up on you…!
title: Worst experience ever!!!!

review:
Their help section does not have an answer to my problem and there’s no posted number or email to contact for customer support. Here’s a tip for big businesses, stop relying so heavily on FAQ. My question I’m sure could’ve been handled in no time with a live person. But now I have no means of sorting it out at all because apparently your FAQ’s have all the answers. I’ve got a lot of patience but not when you take things from me and then offer no solutions. 

For anyone wondering what my issue is, I was looking through the rewards and tapping to see the information on them, for some reason this instantly redeemed them with no confirmation. So now im out of points that I racked up on like $500 worth of rides. Would have liked to use those on a more useful benefit considering I spent $500 on your services.
title: No Direct Support Contact

review:
Long story short, because I’ve already sent Uber about 7 messages with no response in two weeks:

I received a $40 charge for a supposed “mess” made inside a car during a ride. Cognizant of the fact that someone else was driving us, I ensured there wasn’t a mess when I left. Like any other good person or customer on ride sharing. Was hit with the charge the next day.

When initially inquiring, they said “$40 fees come as a result of a MODERATE EXTERIOR mess.” The photo of the “mess” that was sent to me was dust and dirt on a foot mat INSIDE the car. Once I pointed this out, I did not receive any response from any customer support agent.

A reminder, it’s been two weeks since I’ve pointed this out.

Uber’s utility as a taxi service is barely sufficient. Nothing special at all about it. 

But their customer service is quite honestly the worst I’ve ever received in my entire life. And I work CS for a living. The inability to get in contact with someone to clarify inquiries is, without a doubt, incredibly more frustrating than (an unwarranted, per their own policies, fee for) $40. 

If you desire half-decent customer service, Uber is significantly far off from that. Horrible, horrible experience.
title: Non-Existent Customer Service - Literally.

review: I’m livid right now. Last night I scheduled a ride to the airport because I had a feeling it would be tricky to find an Uber at 6:30 am. The Uber was running late, which is fine we scheduled with plenty of time in advance. They cancelled after already being 15 minutes late. We booked another ride, waited 15 minutes only for them to cancel again. Tried to book another ride, it won’t be here for another 30 minutes. We couldn’t take our chances so I booked overnight parking for $200 total. But before I was able to do that I had to call the bank because charging then canceling 3 ubers in a row caused them to put my card on hold. The absolute worst part is that they seemed to have disabled the ability to file a complaint. I just cancelled my UberEats pass and will not be supporting Uber ever again.
title: Such a shady company

review: This was our first experience using Uber. Felix was super nice and very pleasant to visit with. He  had to call and find out where we were waiting, he did find us, and on top of that even made an extra stop so we could get things for my daughter, that was in separate vehicle, whose driver did not speak  English.  I felt so bad when Felix drove away without me being able to personally tip him. I would say that anyone requesting an Uber ride would be lucky to have Felix as their driver. Thank you Felix for making our first experience using Uber a pleasant one. God Bless You and your family Felix. 😇
title: Felix

review:
USER BEWARE! Uber recently made it so rides would also add additional costs based on time for the drive! This is shown NOWHERE during the ride booking process and no warnings are provided that this would happen so you’re aware before booking your ride. I had what was supposed to be a 15 minute ride, I took Uber Black as a treat, $63 no problem. The driver ended up taking a longer way so it was about 25 minutes, but I had no issues and wasn’t in a rush, and was enjoying the nice car.

Was going to tip maybe $20 to the driver. The next day, I find out my trip ended up being nearly $60 more for “additional time”!! I cannot even make this up. I feel scammed, the driver likely knew what he was doing and in the years I’ve used Uber, this was the first time I’ve seen this. Will not be using Uber/uber eats moving forward.
title: WARNING FRAUD!

review:
I love the convenience of Uber. So much better than public transportation.
I feel there’s could be some tweaks.
Why not have 1 app for rider, driver, eats, other shopping, instead of all these different apps.
Sometimes we make things more complicated than they need to be.
There’s no way to add a stop or destination once you have booked a ride or are in transit, unless you put a secondary stop in prior to booking the ride.
Sometimes, not all the time we can leave comments for the driver, beyond the star rating.
It would also be nice to just have a customer service direct chat box that’s easy to find.
I would also like to be able to change my picture without permission. I was going to drive and had going through alll this stuff, to not be able to and now I’m stuck with a picture I don’t like of myself. Besides when they custom service rep merged the driver and rider accounts they messed up my rider account.
Making it easy to toggle between things in one app would be the. Eat solution.
Thank you for taking this into consideration.
title: Wonderful, but can use some updates

review: I was picked up at midnight from the airport. I believe all Uber drivers should ask the customer if they would like to listen to music, and what kind. My driver right away put on her music, and even had the volume up - not blaring, but louder that was comfortable for me. I told her that I had to be at work in the morning and wanted to take a little snooze, and would she mind turning down the music. She right away turned it Way Down, but in my opinion should have turned it off completely. Uber drivers need to adopt the attitude that they are there to not only drive the customer somewhere, but offer them a pleasant experience
title: Music in car

review:
I have been driving for Uber for a decent amount of time now and I have two big concerns. 
1) the complaint process is practically nonexistent. I was told there is a “suggestions” section in my app by Uber support, but there is no such section available in my app. Yes I checked the location they told me to check and everywhere else.

2) (more importantly) Uber does not take preemptive action regarding updating my background check. Uber decides when to do the background checks and for some reason they choose to do the background check AFTER it expires. Since the background check takes about 5 business days I can not make a living for those 5 business days. If they chose to do the background check ANYTIME IN THE LAST YEAR this problem would not happen. Since they choose to wait to do it when it expires, and since my background check expired at the end of the month, with no prior notification by the way, I now am short on my bills. When I go to complain I’m told, “we are busy try back later”. 

What a great system, 50% of my earnings isn’t enough you have to have a bad system so I can’t pay my bills too? Thank you Uber!
title: Random Periods of Time When I Can’t Earn a Living Due To Uber

review:
There isn’t a way to leave app feedback that I could find within the app so I’ll leave here. 

You should verify if a trip seems oddly short. For instance I checked Uber and Lyft for a trip home to a doctor appointment. I chose Lyft to get there. On the way back I thought I entered ‘home’ as my destination, but it in fact was still quoting me to the doctor’s office. So I got picked up and driven around the block and dropped back off again at a different entrance. Not the driver’s fault. It was mine for not checking closely enough, but I would think you’d have something built into your system for user errors like this. Disappointed in user experience and taking a Lyft home right now.
title: App feedback option in app

review: There is no help options or ability to report a driver that cancels a ride before picking you up.  I requested a ride and the driver was 15 minutes away.  The driver made multiple wrong turns getting to me and ended up getting lost.  The driver would not answer their phone or respond to text messages in the app.  I walked to them on a different street and when I am 25 feet from them they cancel the ride and take off.  I waited the original 15 minutes and another 15 while the driver was lost.  I then have wait for another driver to be assigned and pick me up and putting me at risk for missing my flight.  I ended up making my flight but the complete lack of customer service for issues like this needs to be addressed.
title: No Help when the Driver Cancels

review: There are some things Uber does well, although at times it can be difficult at large events to get a scheduled ride, but that’s somewhat the nature of ride sharing. The lack of control over notification and messaging is a little annoying. I primarily use Uber when traveling away from home so I don’t need constant emails reminding me that Uber is ready when I am or to try Uber eats. I want notifications for things I have booked and scheduled not reminders that I have the app installed. Yeah thanks Uber,I know I’m not away from home sitting on a beach needing a ride back to the resort.
title: Overall not bad

review: We prebooked an Uber to get to our son’s graduation in NYC. According to the app, it was properly booked. No one showed up at the appointed time. After 15 minutes we started looking in the app- no messages, no number to call, no email or text to find out where the driver was or report the no-show. Google produced only a number in South Africa that didn’t work. After 30 minutes, we called a cab and were late to the graduation. I left feedback about what happened. 4 days later I got a reply: sorry for the inconvenience but no driver was available. Could you not have let me know you didn’t have a driver so we could have made other arrangements?  Or at least provide a way to contact you to find out why no one was showing up?  Definitely will never rely on Uber again.
title: Unreliable, use at your own risk

review:
My 93-year-old father has used this app to arrange his transportation for the past five years. The developers have continued to add on needless additional options to the point where it is no longer usable for him. It’s too complicated. 

All he wants to see is a button to request a ride. He does not want to see all of the other buttons promoting things like Uber Eats and other services that might be helpful to others, but not to him. You’ve made the app so complicated that he has deleted it from his phone and he’s only using Lyft now. The Lyft app is simpler for him to navigate. 

Perhaps in the Settings you could put some radio buttons for the user to choose which of the many Uber services they want to see on the front of the app. That way my father could turn them all off except for Ride.
title: Revised app until unusable

review: If I could give less than one star I would. Deleting this seem to be impossible even if you open spp and look for settings as directed. Customer service is impossible to reach. It seems even though the claim is no one data was lost in 2016 data hacking incident my entire account is in complete disarray. When I put phone # in it say welcome “ someone else’s name” when I put my email in it says welcome to “ my name” but shows different email. Tried contacting customer service but necessary to “ login” tried the calling option “ no answer” tried deleting through the app. Once opened it doesn’t give the option to even enter settings . Maybe if you could login you could get settings not sure. Used this twice about three years ago worked fine , horrible now
title: Uber app is invasive and corrupted

review: I was trying to order my Uber today. It was supposed to be around $17. But then my payment was declined, so the app was telling me to update my payment method, while I only had to choose a different payment, it was telling me that the price of my Uber had increased to $22 and change because my pickup location was updated, I did not update  my pickup location and it was the same. Even after canceling the ride. I tried again, and it again told me payment method was not accepted even after I had changed it. Original price was $19 and when I changed the payment method once again, the price went up to a staggering $25 and change. I had to take it because I was already running late to work. Uber is the worst because they just increase the prices for no reason.
title: Increasing the price for no reason

review:
These hidden fees cost more than the ride. It’s an illegal practice to have 4-5 different hidden fees. 

1. Of course it’s a reservation and/or booked, that’s is your service. Click pick up and drop off locations. Nothing else. Think about the reason for your app, pick up and drop off. You can’t charge again for booking it and/or call it a reservation. That’s the point of your app. 

2.  there are no tolls fee in the kc area. Once I found out about the receipt options on the app you see the hidden charges may cost more than the ride.

3. Wait time? I’m the client waiting for your service.

These are Illegal practices, cheating the consumers fraudulently to double charges. Just a mitigation nightmare for all ride share services with hidden fees like this.

The airlines, bus, cab, rail services don’t charge you again when you are done for the same service, how do you think this is legal in the United States of America. You are double dipping and that’s deceptive to the consumers only for your company to generate revenue. Build a better business and stop the scam. 

Uber is offering an service to pick up and drop off. You can’t tack on booking/reservation fees!!!! That’s what you created the app for.

Respectfully 
J
title: Deceptive practices

review:
The car was had plenty of room for our golf clubs and was certainly clean and comfortable.  Kervin himself was very pleasant  and really  just let us talk business. It’s after that when he showed the  type of person he is.  I left my phone in his car and unfortunately it was on silent, so by the time  he saw the phone ringing he was quite a ways on his way home.   Without hesitation and expecting nothing for his good deed, he drove over an hour round trip to return my phone.
Honorable, moral, kind, selfless!  We all could use a little kelvin in our life.

Thank you!!!!
title: Consummate professional!

review: I was very, very, very drunk and drunk texted a boy to drive to meet me. He drove from houma all the way to New Orleans after hosting a band competition for 13 hours straight. Even though he was very tired and sleepy, he drove an hour straight to see me and pick me up and take me home. And then we went dancing and we got drunk and had to order your Uber to get you home. I was falling asleep on his shoulder and he and you had very detailed discussions about how to make the most money driving, I pretended to be asleep. Anyway, we are married now. Thank you for driving me and my husband home.
title: I met my husband on you Uber

review:
Exhausted after a long day/flight, we were picked up by a smiling, gracious driver in Jeffrey. He carefully took our luggage and had the car doors open into a clean, nice-smelling, well-maintained retreat of his car. 

His safe driving and knowledge of the area were exemplary. Jeffrey is an intelligent, interesting, respectful conversationalist. 

He found our destination easily and quickly and helped us with our baggage again. We could not have been more pleased with Jeffrey’s care, consideration, and professionalism. We highly recommend him and believe that Uber is extremely lucky to have him.
title: Wonderful Ride Home

review:
This was The Best Uber Ride!! Anton was early & the Uber app had pre-notified us he would be, and it also indicated that he would wait. It was So refreshing that Anton was early for us, as we were ready & had never used the advance reservations so we were nervous about getting to the airport on time.  Anton was extremely professional and friendly and engaging with my husband and me. Since it was so early in the morning, our ride to the airport was effortless & quicker than anticipated with hardly any cars on the road. Such a pleasant experience with our driver Anton!!
Thank you so much!
title: Anton - Driver  on May 22, 2023

review:
I’m an Uber,  Diamond  driver myself, I spent 45 minutes when I had a rental car waiting for me trying to get the payment method to go through. None of my cards would work. They all work everywhere else,  but they wouldn’t work with this app. I finally took a Lyft on the way there and then I was able to use my Uber cash on the way back .  And I had a voucher for a $40 ride, what good as a voucher to pick up a rental car if it can’t be used
I had to load money on the Apple Cash then load the Apple Cash onto a prepaid $25 amount and then I could order a car
title: Great app except

review: I became locked out of my account because I tried to open an uber driver account that they never verified. It then created a whole bunch of problems for me as I tried to create other accounts associated with my phone number to work around the freeze. As of today I can still not order a ride because I have four accounts open under my number. I called customer service multiple times and they said they cannot delete accounts on their end or fix the issue. Was hung up on by three different people overseas. I will note there is no management to talk to. I have now been left stranded with no way to get a ride anywhere by a company that killed all taxi companies. Absolutely appalling. If anyone ends up suing this company please reach out would love to help.
title: Absolutely terrible customer service

review:
I remember I had complained twice about Uber drivers not honest. One time was Uber passed by in-front where I was waiting and driver didn’t stop but he charged me. Second time I complained the Uber drive refused to take us to NYC and used excuse to say I didn’t wear mask. Uber gave me credit but I don’t know how to use it. Now my English getting better, where were those credit? Can you please check for me? 
Also my credit card # changed several times, when I put new #, is that mean I lost that credit they Uber gave it to me? Thank you for your help 🙏
title: Where is my refund credit money?

review: Uber App is incredibly smart about location accuracy and communication with drivers. But Uber App does not allow you to contact Uber directly thru phone or live chat to ask a question. Uber provides lousy service to its customers. I need to clarify in advance whether I can ask an Uber driver to meet me in a specific location due to elderly parents who cannot walk to the designated Uber wait area at the huge Atlanta Heartsfield International Airport. There is no way to contact Uber, nor to leave a note on the ride request. Uber App does not allow you to leave a note for ride request regarding number of people and luggage expected either. Hope this can be improved.
title: Cannot contact Uber from the App

review: Today ride was accepted by Damian (not the last ride, one before. He was at 1 or 2 minutes straight in Kendall drive, suddenly he went the opposite way, i waited a little, but then it said 4 minutes and more. I called him snd he didn’t pick up. He passed again and again the way back. Called him again with no avail. I was asking him via Chat to drop the ride, why i will be charged for canceling and also cancels in my record, but again with no avail. He cancelled when he was 14 minutes away. Then i don’t know why it took some minutes for the next ride to be set. Never happened before, just want to inform that if a ride goes from 1 or 2 minutes to more than 6 or 7 minutes the app should make the driver inform the user
title: Late for appointment

review: Had multiple drivers do this most recently a Caucasian man Named Jon who Had 4.9 stars and I don't understand why . Driver was 18 min away and I  had to go to work . Thinking I'm finna be on time the driver is literally driving away from my pickup location . Doing this for 15-20 min straight trying to get me to cancel and lose my money.  Eventually he cancelled and I got another driver but yup you guessed it I was late for work. Thing about it is you can't even contact customer support for the driver you have problem with . Sad sad sad. Never using this app again . If you can stay away from Uber because you WILL get a driver like Jon . Recently switched to Lyft and haven't had this problem again . You have been warned . App doesn't even deserve one star more like zero for how poorly their drivers treat the riders. Good riddance
title: Sad Company

review:
It’s cheaper to get a cab and the cab drivers don’t leave you stranded. 
The rates coming home from the airport are ridiculous! Trying to jack up the rates because of “peak hours”. 
There were several bad experiences trying to get back to our hotel from Disneyland. One driver pulled in and left while we were standing there and then UBER charged us for the trip. 
There’s no answer at customer service either. They tell you to do everything on the app but then there’s no response. 
Taxi cabs are a much easier and cheaper option. 🚕🚕🚕
title: UBER will be replaced by cabs again soon🚕🚕🚕

review:
Some drivers forgets the concept of UBER which is transportation and don’t take in consideration that riders are customers paying for a service. If they don’t do give a service how it is expected, they can’t expect customers to give them a 5 stars rating and/or tip. It’s not correct and fair to give a customer a poor rating and damage their score putting them in risk to get in a point where they will not be able to use the transportation service just because they didn’t fulfill the customer expectations by not giving a service accordingly and expected. 
The rating (evaluation) system should be modified or even eliminated for the sake of the company.
title: Rating (evaluation) system should be modified or eliminated

review: The app is fine beyond one huge detail…the “add or change” option for your destination often disappears. Uber claims that you can change your destination at any point during your trip, which I often have to when plans change, but I’ve needed to do this maybe 10-12 times and the option is just not there. I quit the app and then reopen, and it may or may not reappear. Sometimes it reappears for a split second, but not long enough to tap and select it. This is INTENSELY FRUSTRATING when I have a client who wants to switch our meeting spot and I’m essentially being held hostage in arriving at the original destination. Drivers aren’t allowed to simply go to a different place, obviously, what with prices being different. Uber needs to address this NOW. It’s been happening for months.
title: Unacceptable glitches

review: I’ve had Uber for awhile now and used to love it, recently i’ve had so many issues with it. First I got the Uber pass because I thought it would be more beneficial when it’s really not. I used to have no trouble getting rides now I can never get a ride and when I do they take forever. I’ve been late to work many times because drivers took longer than what was expected. I used to schedule rides because it was easier to get a driver that way than not scheduling but now whenever I schedule a ride it tells me there’s no drivers available for my ride then I exit out of it and go back and the prices are raised and they tell me there’s drivers available. Today was terrible I paid $22 for a ride that’s usually $6. Uber is getting worser and worser by the day. I wouldn’t download it or waste your time!!!
title: DON’T GET!!

review:
Biggest waste of time of your life. App works fine until there’s an issue. After that they’ll submit you for four background checks (all within one month) meanwhile you’ve been driving with them for a long time. Everyone you get transferred to is a “specialist” and each one has a different answer (though none of the solutions actually work)

I have spent 24 hours— a real 24 hours— on the phone in the last month trying to resolve my issue. No one cares, no one has the proper training. You’re on your own. They just hang up if they feel like it and then you can give the entire story and info again to each new person you call

If you can run from Uber, run now. They don’t have a clue and it’ll only cost you your sanity at the end of the day
title: Customer service doesn’t have a clue

review: My Uber account got hacked while I was traveling internationally. I had over 20 fraudulent transactions from different countries within a matter of minutes(Europe and Australia). Had to put blocks on the 4 credit cards associated with my Uber account. Uber did nothing to help me.  Can only deal with Uber via email as there is no phone number to call. Got the Uber account temporarily deactivated until I resolved the fraud.  I ordered new credit cards once I returned from my trip. Two weeks later I get the Uber account reinstated. First time trying to use the service since the fiasco and Uber won’t let me order a ride. Tried to reach out to customer support and all I get via email is I violated the terms and conditions. I’m the victim of hacking/fraud but no one willing to help. Worst customer service ever!!!!
title: Worst customer service ever

review:
There was a day when Uber was better than a taxi. Not anymore. I requested a ride and when I confirmed it, the price increased by more than $15. I didn’t get the option to accept a higher price than was presented. It just changed and I was confirmed at the higher price. Then it paired me with a driver that was 20 minutes away. That’s fine, but when the driver was down to 5 minutes away, they canceled and I got paired with another driver that was 20 minutes away. 

First, the price should be what was advertised. Otherwise it constitutes criminal false advertising. Second, if I canceled when the driver was 5 minutes away, I would still pay for the trip. Why is it different for a driver to cancel? At least a taxi will still get you to your destination without all the shenanigans.
title: Fraudulent pricing; long wait times

review: What can one say about safety and inclusion…well I can speak on both after riding with this young lady. The night began under her prompt pickup of my wife and myself. Soon into the ride we were graced by the lovely voice of comforting conversation, embracing us with the sweet sound local conversation. The glory of community was almost overwhelming but left us urning for more. Just when we thought the night couldn’t get any better, the climax of the journey was over. My wife and myself, dropped off safely, wondering when we will ever have a ride like this again.
title: The eternal gratitude of a safe transport

review: Between waiting 40 minutes for a ride only to have the driver cancel the pickup and no notifications are given. Leaving by you waiting in the rain for a ride home from work that will never arrive. I’ve also had drivers mark me down on a rider score and I have no idea why. I don’t engage conversations myself, preferring to remain quiet and allow them to focus on the road and always tip over 20%. Sometimes nearly 100%. I also always leave good reviews as well. Then there is the Uber eats side of the app. Drivers apparently can’t read a house address posted in very visible places. Delivering food to the wrong house which also has a very visible address. At this point I don’t know if its Uber or just the drivers that are incompetent.
title: Works 50%

review: Booked an Uber XL ride with Tichayenda from V&A Waterfront to Sunset Beach Bay Beach Avenue with my family on Saturday 7th Jan 2022. My husband unfortunately forgot his iPhone in the vehicle at the time of drop off and only realized after Tichayenda drove away. Upon realizing that he didn’t have his phone with him. My husband called his missing phone and Tichayenda finally answered and told him that he was in his way to drop off his phone at our apartment which he did.  We were so amazed and grateful that there are such people of high integrity and all they want to do is serve the people. Thank you once more 🙏🏼
title: Amazing Integrity and Professionalism by Tichayenda

review: I found my credit card was charged a Uber One monthly fee but I did not buy membership. So I asked customer service and they said there was another account using my name and credit card information. I requested customer service to terminate this account, but they refused and said only users can terminate themselves. Then I asked for this account’s registered phone number and email. Customer service said they could not tell me because it’s user data privacy. How come a IDENTITY THEFT keeps charging my credit card and I cannot have their information??? I asked twice and customer service just stopped responding. I reported identity theft to the police and bank give me a new card for avoiding fraud. But this company Uber just did nothing but protects identity theft. Just ridiculous!
title: A company that helps identity theft

review:
I had a double food order go through on the Uber app 5/19 that the rep refused to resolve in an acceptable manner.
The app told me my cart had been emptied during checkout, so, without receiving a confirmation or seeing any indication on the app my order had been placed, I had to place the order again.
The Uber delivery driver showed up with double my order and laughed while she told me “the restaurant asked if this was right since it’s the exact order twice, and I told them yes it is!” without reaching out to me to check first…
Who would purposefully put in an order twice, spending double on the delivery/tip/other fees for the SAME delivery ride?? That makes NO SENSE.
I’m sure she just wanted twice the tip for the same trip. 
To “resolve my issue”, the rep offered $5 credit to my account and applied it without me even giving the verbal go-ahead. When he tried to walk me through where to find your placed orders in the app, what he could see was different from my app so then he told me just to place orders through the UberEats app from now on to avoid this happening again. EXCUSE ME?? Not okay.
I want one of the double orders refunded and I don’t believe that is an unreasonable ask at all.
title: Double Order Issue

review: I pay a lot of money of my devices including the Watch ultra. Why is the watch ultra only for people in Fitness for some thing that is $400 more than the series 8 I think it’s ridiculous like for those who don’t want to carry around their phones they can’t order an Uber or Lyft on the watch they can’t do a lot of stuff on the watch because you have to access your phone to get into it. I use Lyft and Uber every day and the fact that I can’t get that app on that watch. I just want to turn the watch it and forget about it but I can’t because it’s already passed that time frame. So far the only thing that I like about this watch is that the battery is so much better other than that there’s nothing else on this watch that I want or use. But Lyft and Uber need to be added on to this watch.
title: Uber/Lyft

review: Lately I have used the Lyft app more than Uber, not only because it has better prices but their customer service is better too, they do not charge the extra time and waiting time and add it to is already supposed to It is a fixed charge.  In addition to all these problems, what about prices?  They go up and down as they please.  I live in Miami and a ride where I pay between $13 and $15 every day increases to $44 and $55.  does that seem fair?  They should do something about their prices.  is more than double!  you guys are stealing from us!!
title: It’s shame!

review:
Uber has been pretty reliable overall, definitely had it’s glitches but whatever.  
I tried to order an Uber for my preteen daughter to come home from a sleepover 7 minutes from the house, since the parent was asleep and couldn’t drive her.  She no longer felt comfortable there and as much as I wanted to grab her, I was home alone with my toddler and couldn’t leave them sleeping.  I ordered 12 Ubers for her trying to find a female driver so she’d feel comfortable (her request- as well as I’d stay on the phone with her),
But despite the advertising that you could pick a female driver late night, there was no option for that.  And of course there’s always cancelation fees.  
So all in all, Uber doesn’t care about passenger safety.  Just about collecting fees when you cancel under uncomfortable circumstances.
title: Not up with the times

review: Spent two hours disputing an increase from an original estimate of 30 $ to a final delivery of 100$ - with 3 substitutions . One of the items substituted was feta with a sticker price of 8 dollars which appeared to become an 18 dollar item - even though item doesn’t come up when you search for it - and non of the items cost as much in Uber After talking for 2 hours with support and them telling me - that they can charge what ever they want and not provide an itemized receipt that would show how the coast of my order increased by 70$. Not responding Uber one employee Shivan Gupta started to teach me about fairness. And in the end completely ignored my questions and stopped responding at all. So it was my final experience with the platform, And how lovely was it especially after paying a 10$ fee for such a privilege. Great experience
title: Fraud

review:
I’ve only had one negative experience with Uber, and that’s when a driver gave me less than 5 stars because of a “short trip”. I can’t help it that I live close to the airport…

But that isn’t a reflection of Uber, or the app. Uber has many strong points. I like getting 3% cash back on rides when using Apple Card/Apple Pay. But for some reason, I can use Apple Pay to schedule rides in advance. Lyft allows this, so I’m confused as to why Uber does not.

I’ll also miss the rewards program that Uber had a few years ago. I really benefited from that, but business is business I suppose.
title: Usable ride sharing app with room for improvements

review: A half a month ago my parent went into a heart attack and wasn’t able to get a ride from him so due to that i has my sister that was at work at the time to send me money to order an uber so she was able to do that. Then I ordered the uber around 9:30-10:00 fast forward the uber came it was an elderly man when i got in he asked if i was 18 or up I told him no I’m 17. Then he told me due to uber new policy i have to be 18 or up to ride or be with a parent and then proceeded to not cancel the ride and kicked me out his car even after I asked can he just finish the ride this one time and report the account fast forward a few minutes i walked an hour and 30 minutes home because of that. Problem 2:every-time i order an uber its far as an 10-20minutes or always have far destinations before me.
title: Problems

review: App updated today and now I can’t access any of the controls at the top of the screen while on a trip, and I can’t move the map or access the navigation button. Also Prompt popped up to send a message to a customer whose delivery I had already completed, while an offer popped up. I couldn’t close the message prompt and therefore couldn’t see the offer. Kinda hard to do deliveries when you can’t use navigation. But hey, we get a stupid coffe cup button that is basically the same as the stop new requests button. The app still screws with the audio player. That problem has been around for at least a year. It’s also stupid that the app keeps trying to get me to turn on rides, seeing as how if I did I would be deactivated because my car is too old for rides.
title: Another botched update

review: No matter what I do I keep receiving “oops try again later error processing your request” when I try completing a reservation for a ride to the airport early morning 2 days away? I’ve updated the app turned phone on and deleted all payment options and also added 2 different debit cards with 2 very well known banks. Tried through the website and app multiple times, very very frustrating there’s not a help line to call iv only found a “help chat” that had me wait over 30 minutes for a representative before I left the chat! Deleting the app because you would think such a successful company would have a easier way of fixing the issue non of the steps recommended or provided helped me! How could something so easy be so difficult ?
title: Tried everything even waited for representatives!

review: Remember back when Uber used to be the less expensive alternative to yellow cabs? Those were the days. I know that as a company grows, the deals tend to fade away and costs more and more operational costs are passed onto the customer, but I feel like ever since Uber went public, the prices have gotten ridiculous. I consistently get rides that cost about $30 to go less than 3 miles. Going from Queens to Manhattan, or Manhattan ti Brooklyn now costs anywhere between $50 and $70. I mean, for the love of god, seriously? I’m lucky my job covers my Uber rides to and from work (because of the pandemic), but that’ll be ending soon. I can’t justify using this service for my personal rides tho.. it’s NYC yellow cabs from here on out.
title: Lame

review:
I live in the suburbs of NYC and have been trying to price how much a ride to one of the NY airports would be. What I’ve always loved most about Uber is that you can say “hey, I wanna go at x date at y time; how much is that likely to be” and it’ll give you a good estimate. Also, it lets you schedule ahead. For the first time in my six years of using this app it is not letting me look ahead or schedule ahead. It keeps saying that the “pickup area” is not ok and to get a on-demand car or choose a different location.
This is the absolute opposite of helpful and is seriously making me consider using other apps that will allow me to do this. JUST BECAUSE I’M IN THE SUBURBS DOES NOT MEAN I’M NOT A CUSTOMER!!! Y’all might’ve just lost two $100-something rides with this catastrophe.
title: Scheduling Ahead - Seriously?!

review: This happened to me twice. The first time the driver told me it’s not worthy to actually take me where i was going, then he asked for more money other wise he can’t and he asked me to cancel the trip from the application. When I told him that I will contact uber to complain he claimed that they are aware of this as long as the passenger agrees to pay. Then it happened again, the driver picked me up 30 minutes late, and when i arrived he asked for double the number that was charged on the application. This is fraud and embarrassing for the passenger, and actions must be done. It’s either you give the passenger the accurate charge for his trip and notify drivers to abide by it, or you acknowledge drivers that if they ask for more what the trip actually costs, there will be consequences.
title: Drivers are asking for more charge!

review:
Many times I am located at a different spot on the airport for pickup but the app defaults to the main terminal even though I am miles from this location.  I have tried talking to the driver after ordering and even sending the proper address but many times drivers are confused by all of this and don’t show up. 

I am able to get an Uber back to this location so why can’t I set my location for pickup? When I enter the actual address the map just slews back to the main terminal. Lyft doesn’t have this issue. There are other business locations on airports other than the main terminal. 

I have tried extensively to find a way to give feedback to Uber but it seems impossible as it is all automated answers.
title: Airport issues

review:
Good luck trying to resolve any issues needing customer service assistance.  If your issue isn’t resolved via the app, then you have to submit a request to hopefully have someone from customer service contact you.  The only customer service available immediately is for those with an emergency situation.  All I wanted to do was make sure that I didn’t double book a trip, because their app acted like it booked my trip, but then nothing showed up in my upcoming trips.  So I tried again, and it was the same thing.  Very frustrating.

Update:  It took Uber 4 days to respond to my original issue when I contacted customer service online.  That’s 4 days too long!  Seriously what company has a customer service response that takes 4 days?!?! Completely unacceptable!
title: Customer service inaccessible

review: Today I took my very first Uber pre-scheduled that I booked two days ago. Usually I schedule on-demand. The driver arrived early and it was an excellent experience!! He was polite, professional (which is a big deal for me as a professional) and the car was nice and clean. Also, the driver’s fragrance was not “high octane” and the music was not LOUD. All of these things matter to me. I normally take a professional coach or limo. But today’s Uber driver made my experience feel like FIRST CLASS! Thank you! I would recommend this driver to anyone who wants a professional and courteous experience!!
title: Professional and Outstanding!!!!

review: Uber are scandalous thieves. There’s no reason when searching for an Uber, it’ll be a reasonable price and then you’ll see it bouncing off the cars that are 5,7,9 away. Then it starts reaching above 10 & any person is going to cancel due to them either heading or leaving somewhere. Soon as you cancel, it’s all of a sudden “busier than usual” and now you’re being charged an arm and a leg. How is it busier than usual? I just ordered an uber 2 seconds before & once cancelled, now my Uber to travel 10 minutes away is $40? Seriously. Now some people, even myself before, would just pay it because they need to go somewhere: work, court, airport. But then soon as I pay that surcharged price, the app wants to send me a notification how prices have all of a sudden “dropped?” Uber is getting over on people!
title: Thieves

review: Everything went like clockwork.  It was estimated that the time of atrival would be in 4 minutes.  I walked to the edge of the street to stand and decided to contact Charity to let her know what I was wearing. To look for an orange jacket.  My back was turned to the road.  I turned around and saw a red car, Uber described to me, she had  just parked.  We identified each other.  The trip went very well, we talked about the past, present and future.  I felt very comfortable with her during the ride to Ford.  Charity,  I hope you find your dream job or something worth investing your time into.  It was a pleasure and thank you and thank you Uber.
title: Home to Lithia Springs Ford

review:
I had the most amazing driver tonight from San Diego international airport to my home in La Jolla. His name is Shahram and he had an immaculate 2015 Honda Accord.
And he was the nicest and most professional driver I’ve ever had from Uber. I can only hope that everybody gets him as a driver. He is second to none. Thank you Shahram for being everything Uber could possibly hope to have in a driver. I wish you all the success in the world in your future. You totally deserve it and if there’s someway I could have you as my driver in the future I would, you are amazing.
Here is to your future success, cheers!
All the best, Alan
title: Shah ram the driver

review: Had delivered something Walgreens to me it was supposed to be hand to me the delivery person dropped off my package and then he put the text in that he will be there in 5 minutes the only reason I had it hand delivered because I’m on crutches and just got out of the hospital and it’s very painful to walk Waited at the door for a few minutes. Got another text that it was delivered so I called the delivery person. He couldn’t speak English that well didn’t understand what I was saying he just hung up on me then I went to call him back. I got information about the ab Uber app  it’s hard to have packages delivered if the person doesn’t speak English but you can get away with it thank God I still drive my own car and I usually get my own stuff there’s no way to get in touch with Uber
title: Poor service

review: Not for sure I have the words to say how awesome Donna was! She picked up a patient of ours who is recovering from back surgery and drove him home! This was a three hour trip one-way! It was quite apparent that this gentleman was going to need a little extra help getting in and out of the vehicle along with his wheelchair in the back, which she graciously helped put in when she picked him up! She didn’t judge she welcomed him in her vehicle graciously! They were talking and laughing as they pulled out of the parking lot! Thank you so much, Donna… The world needs more people like you! Five Stars just isn’t enough for this lady!
title: Donna

review: Drivers should not be allowed to cancel after accepting a ride, They should be able to see where riders need to go before accepting. This is a huge inconvenience as it can make riders late for their business. People choose a specific time to request rides to make it to their destination accordingly. Some people have faced penalties or missed their opportunities due to drivers cancelling. I feel that drivers also need to make pit stops on their own time and not after accepting a ride. I was late to work a few times while waiting on a driver to gas up and get snacks and I could have been connected with a new driver if the first one hadnt made me wait on them for so long. I just feel like the app could be better altogether when it comes to interaction between driver and rider
title: Manage the app better

review: Arriving at the airport in an unfamiliar city decided to try Uber for first time. Ordered ride had driver assigned twice, both drivers canceled, then the app apparently timed out, so I tried to order another ride and kept getting error. Several people tried walking me through the process only to get the same error message. We watched at least 50 people get their Uber after we started trying for one. Lyft showed up on the first try. I can’t figure out the useless app. Will use either Lyft or an old fashioned taxi going forward. They actually show up.
title: Drivers cancel?

review: The driver was a complete gentleman. The actual ride very expensive. I usually pay half if I call a car  local car service. Uber charges unexpected fees to make it a really expensive ride. A almost $3 dollar fee south of 96 street, taxes, and another fee that altogether was another $10 fees to the $46 dollar ride. That same ride I usually pay a car service $35 dollars plus $2.75 easy pass to cross the bridge. The Uber driver was so nice, I gave him a $10 dollar cash tip. Altogether I paid $66 dollars to get home from work. Way to expensive, ready to delete this application (app). It’s not worth it .
title: Driver was very nice

review: I used to like Uber because usually I never ran into any problems, and if I did I expected that a company like it would have no trouble with their customer service. Well I didn’t have any trouble with their customer service since it’s impossible to contact them! I got charged for a trip I didn’t take, and instead of even having a bot answer me, I got absolutely nothing. For 20 minutes, I was “supposedly” waiting for a customer service representative to help me, and nothing. Not to sound spoiled, but I’ve never had to wait so long for an online customer service representative to respond. Take the chance if you want, but I’m not dealing with the lack of assistance after this. It may be nice for rides every now and then, but the minute you need to contact them for help, it’s a lost cause!
title: Lost Cause

review: I have been taking Uber since 2018.  In march the 27th I had one of the worst experience of my life I was involved with a very dangerous driver who has his hand of the steering in the highway instead of looking at the road he was fixing his hat I never been that scare in my life I tought for a second I was going to die and when I told him he laugh and says he have been driving for a long time. I call Uber to report the incident so many time but any actions was taken or any apologies and in one of my call the agent dare to tell me are you looking for a refund I was like the only thing they care is about money and today I got a slap on my face when they told me that all my reports was close without asking or investigating about my experience this is very putty all this for the sake of money pathetic !
title: They don’t care about your safety !!!!

review: Lsst night I was stranded after work because uber drivers that were over 30-40 minutes away kept accepting me and they weren’t even finished their trip it was to the point where the uber driver rode pass the highway where I was under going 30 minutes up the highway from my destination. Please allow a change driver function it would be helpful even in different situations. I got charged a cancellation fee and got connected to the same driver that was unfair and I was late after that. I accepted defeat when the price increased to 40$ for a 6 minute ride. I can use uber a million times but I was just like some more customer side adjustments in the future!
title: Wait times/Accepting rides

review:
1. In the morning I will schedule my ride to work early at the typical price of around $25. They will cancel my trip and tell me to try again only to charge me $80 - $100. I have to spend 15 minutes refreshing the app so that it goes back to the normal price, sometimes it’s instant. Drivers that know more about this than me have admitted on multiple occasions that they feel it’s a rip off to get you to pay more. 

2. Two destination rides ie. The stops feature. EVERY SINGLE TIME I schedule a stop in my ride the driver will abandon me at my destination. Uber then charges me for the ride and the ride home at a much higher rate. Absolutely unprofessional from the company and the drivers. If you abandon your customer at least charge them the same rate to get home.
title: Two major problems when compared to alternatives

review: When i ordered my uber the price was 20 dollars from a park to my house i don't even live that far from the park so that already was a blow but i had to get home quick so i ordered it anyways first i had an idiot driver that was going the opposite way from me after he accepted the requested and had me thinking he was going to do a u turn or something but than he cancel. than another driver took the request this driver now was so busy trying to converse with me that he missed the exit even tho i let him know when we was at the exit he was supposed to take which made the trip even longer wasn't cool at all the dudes car smelled like corn chips and to make thing worst i check my account and uber charges me 31 dollars for the uber drivers mistake never again will i use uber very unprofessional
title: Very unsatisfied

review: Prior to our trip we had several calls and texts back and forth verifying the details for a shuttle ride to Edisto Island after a midnight arrival at Charleston airport.  After repeated calls to our scheduled driver he finally answered the phone only to tell us we “weren’t on his calendar.”  No rental cars were available.  I downloaded the Uber app - that was easy! Vusal, our Uber driver was there within 5 minutes to pick us up. He was polite, friendly, and a great driver.  The route was, at times, winding, foggy and bustling with deer. His vehicle was clean and comfortable.  Vusal - you were an angel!
title: Vusal Saves the Day!

review:
I don’t really ride with Uber unless I am on vacation so this is probably the 2nd time that I have used an Uber. The driver was the best and when we conversed it was like we had known each other for years. Sometimes when we get into a vehicle with a person that you may not be familiar with it seems to be tension among the two people but during the ride
We talked and talked and we were almost to where we were going and at that point I introduced him to my wife and daughter who was also riding with us! I would recommend him very highly
title: Wonderful experience

review:
Over the past few months, I have repeatedly raised an issue with Uber about being unable to update my profile picture. Despite my attempts within the app, it consistently prompts me to contact Uber support. Presently, my account lacks a profile picture, and the option to update is unavailable. 

I sought assistance through Uber's online chat, but the representatives continually and repeated provided generic, robotic responses, instructing me to update the picture via the app. This was despite me explicitly mentioning my inability to do so. I was then advised to reach out over the phone. However, the phone representative claimed they couldn't help because I was a rider, not a driver. My request to speak with a supervisor was met with an abrupt end to the call.
title: Profile photo issue and unhelpful customer service (and there lack of)

review: So I use Uber often on and for the course of four months I have now been charge roughly 9 dollars and a chunk of change that has slowly been increasing to almost $10 every day every week and when I’ve tried reaching out to Uber I was informed that there is no phone line for customer service and the chat but that they have is worthless when it comes to helping I do not have premium and I only order food and there’s never less than $15 so I do not understand why Uber cannot help me resolve why I’m being charged almost $10 every day. I have to move my money from my actual bank account to my savings so they can’t take it and I have even deleted every single card off of Uber and unfortunately I still haven’t figured out how to delete Uber
title: Uber is charging me for no reason

review: This is probably one of the worst uber experiences of my life. Besides the costs being astronomically higher than previous months for no reason at all. I had a ridiculous wait time trying to get a ride to work. The driver was very unresponsive and literally sat in place for 20 minutes at 10:30 at night where there is no traffic. A simple 15 minute ride turned into a hour ordeal. And uber would not let me change drivers til i already was late for work! Absolutely not using this app again.
title: You are better off using a regular taxi.

review: Uber GPS uses a single address for DC museums (and for any large building in any city), so if you’re not waiting at what their GPS thinks is your location, you’ll be charged “Wait Time” or even cancelled, with a $5 fee for drivers who won’t move to where you really are. Think calling the driver helps? Today my wife and I called two different drivers to say “We’re at the corner of F St and 8th St” in DC, so ignore what Uber tells you is our location: Smithsonian Gallery of American Art. First driver just cancelled us: $5 fee; second driver couldn’t find the intersection and cancelled us: another $5 fee. We walked a block away, tried Uber again, and this driver was able to find us. Way to go, pathetic Uber developers.
title: Lousy Uber GPS
developerResponse: {'id': 8326208, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear about the inconvenience caused due to cancellations. This is certainly not what we want our riders to experience. Can you please update the trip details where you had to face any issues at t.uber.com/contact so that we can have a look into this right away?", 'modified': '2019-04-23T06:45:51Z'}

review: I try and surf the app to learn and keep ending up in the wrong areas. At one point I apparently signed up as a driver 🙈 LOL  confusing day today with three Ubers… First driver didn’t send arrival notice or exchange messages as we are accustomed. Second driver canceled minutes before our flight landed, no explanation. Third Uber, we were at pick up departure location told by airport staff, driver had us move to a different pick up location… and added a late fee. Don’t really mind the fee but driver acted annoyed and ignored conversation effort during drive. I don’t look at Uber as just a ride, it’s an experience… today was not the best.
title: Confusing App and Service

review: Uber experiencing some huge problems with their app.  You’re paid to fix technical issues and when calling Uber you’re left on hold for hours and your support team is very unprofessional and is not able to fix the problem.  You can not understand their names nor are they are able to fix the technical problems.  So let me ask why are they getting paid so much money and are worthless?  They are very unprofessional an agent by the name of Daniel asked me why was I frustrated?  Good question.  The Uber app does not work and no one wants to be held accountable on your end so you place the blame on the drivers and make it look like they have canceled when in reality the problem is a technical issue on your behalf.  Fixed the problems and stop playing the blame game on the drivers.
title: Uber Issues

review:
