Anyone else having issues with waiting 15-20 minutes just to GET a driver to ping you then wait another 13 minutes for them to come to me. Idk if it’s the storm or they don’t have enough drivers but it’s ridiculous how unreliable the app has been lately. Before I would get a rider coming at least within 5-7 minutes and few years ago it would ping in 2-3 minutes. 
This has made me late to work on multiple occasions. I even started ordering 10 minutes earlier just “in case” it takes 30 minutes for a driver to come get me. And then I’m still late because you just never know! The bus is more reliable than Uber now 😂 
Seems insane to have to wait that long just get a driver.
title: Taking upwards of 15 min to get a ride

review: I’ve been trying to get in contact with Uber Support about my lost my ID in a Uber trip for more now than 2 weeks!  they never contact me but only sending pre-en registered messages that they will call the driver about the lost item then contact me. I received a bunch of the same messages again and again each time I tried to solve the problem with Uber support. I’m still here waiting…I finally decided and went to their office they said couldn’t help I still gotta wait them or the driver to contact me! And I’m still waiting… with the service that you bring lately it’s just question of time for you to move your platform from the Dominican Republic! This app has became a real headache for us customers, Uber is just about the money they have no empathy for their Users!😡
title: Lost item

review: This has happened to me multiple times. The drive I requested couldn’t find the location I was at so they canceled and I was charged a non refundable fee. This particular time I called the drive multiple times and the driver did not answer. I also used the in app text message to tell the driver that was in the correct location and also looking for them. The driver replied “be right there” then canceled. I don’t feel it’s right that I have to pay for a service I never received and that the driver didn’t provide. Uber I have been a loyal customer using your services to get to and from work for years. You need to fix this. I don’t have the money to just donate to your drivers because they made a mistake. Fix it or I’m going to the better business bureau!
title: Driver canceled I get charged that’s not right

review: Awful!!! Every time I try to book a ride the app notifies me that I can't set that location as a pickup location....... Charleston International Airport ...... seriously?!?! I've never been able to easily preorder a ride from anywhere either. When I finally am able to set it to what I want, it costs some ridiculous amount ($80 for a 25 minute ride as the cheapest option). I didn't realize until after I had attempted to order a ride twice that even though no driver ever accepted the ride, THEY CHARGED MY ACCOUNT ANYWAY...... Apparently it was a "hold" but the money didn't return to my account for over 24 hours! I was only using Uber because I got a $75 gift card but now I'm thinking I would rather give it away since I'll never use it. I've never had a single issue with Lyft, so I will keep using their services.
title: If I could give zero stars I would

review:
I am a professional truck driver. I broke down and the service tech was unable to fix today. I have no A/C as the truck won’t start and a small dog with me. 
I called 3 cab companies and none of them would come to pick me up and take me to my hotel. None!! Not even if I waited two hours!! I am in West Salem WI about 10 miles from lacrosse. 
So I downloaded the Uber app and within 20 minutes I had a ride and pleasant conversation with David! Thank you Uber for your availability and ease of use on the app!! From one driver to another… I appreciated it.
title: Very positive first experience with Uber

review: I reserved a trip the night before to get to the airport at a certain time, the driver called me at 8:45am stating he won’t make it until 9:20am the rude was scheduled to be picked up at 9:05am I told him to cancel, he became rude and hung up in my face. I tried to cancel but they said It would charge me $25 I tried to find a number I can call so they can cancel it for me and I get another uber but there’s no number to call or text to cancel so I had to go on a different app and request another ride which was a big inconvenience, It called me to be late and miss my flight and I still ended up getting charged $25 when he arrived 20mim late and canceled the ride. this was a horrible experience and I don’t think I’ll ever request uber again I’ll just stick to lyft. So beware when reserving a ride. Smh this Is sad
title: Worst service ever

review: I have had nothing but the worse rides with Uber. I had a driver literally make it to me I open the door he looked at me and said “I got something else to do and pulled off with the door still open. The time before that I had a driver pull up I front of me I go to open the door and she just pulled off and canceled the ride. I don’t understand if you don’t want to make the trip don’t pick up the trip. I’m tired of getting drivers that have bad sense of direction, texting and driver on face time calls paying more attention to the phone then the road just flat out unprofessional. And what makes it worse when you contact Uber they give you the full run around and never solves the problem. Smh is disappointed in the whole operation do better Uber, do better 😠
title: Disappointed to the HIGHEST degree

review: wait times are rediculous i’m only trying to get a ride for somewhere that’s 5-10 minutes away and i have to wait 5-10 minutes before someone will accept when it shows there plenty of active drivers around me, if they do accept it’s a gamble of whether or not the cancelled it as theyre on their way. not even an issue that i have a low rating i have 4.9 stars as a rider. uber drivers are just constantly complaining about how horrible it is to work for this company, i’ve had drivers accept me and drive the wrong direction so either i cancel and i have to take get the penalty and they still get paid or they were taking another rider on a different ride share app like lyft ,giving me false wait times. been using lyft more and more cause uber is starting to become not usable as wait times are highly inaccurate. it used to be such an easy fast way of transportation living in a big city, but now it’s easier and faster to either take public transport or even walk now, it’s sad to see a big company become greedy and tie advantage of their employees and customers, making the quality of the app usability drastically plummet….
title: useable maybe 50% of the time

review: Driver Parminder was a professional and a gentleman under extraordinary circumstances. It was a very nice car and my dog is very large with big paws and claws that might give anyone concern for the seats and upholstery of a luxury car. But Parminder when he saw my anguish and pain and emotional distress for my dog who needed emergency care from Animal Medical Center, he was so calm and he reassured me it was ok and he drove like a pro thru the traffic and got us there in no time. He understood it was a potentially life ending emergency and he even told me he would pray for my dog and asked me if I believed which I do. God bless Parminder and God bless Uber luxury.🙏🏻👍🏻🐶❤️‼️
title: Lexie My Dog Driven to ANIMAL MEDICAL CTR ER

review: Tom was fantastic! I was stressing about getting to my rental car place before it closed where I would be left with no transportation to get around in Fla. He kept reassuring me they would not close and that he would get us there as fast as he could (yet safely) because of the traffic congestion at that time. I had to run out of the car and have him deal with my teenage children to empty the car. I never got a chance to thank him! Thank you Tom for being so patient with us and getting us to the car rental as fast as you possibly knew how. You’re a good man!
title: Patient driver

review: I have multiple promotions for $ off my first order. I have attempted to use it at 10 different restaurants. It has worked at zero. It allows me to add the promotion to the order, but every time comes back with the same message, that’s it’s unavailable to be applied to my order. I tried local restaurants and national chains. It’s not working on any. Do you have any idea how frustrating it is to compile a restaurant order for a family at 10 different restaurants and for zero of them to actually get placed and eaten? Do you know how much time that takes? The promotions all say “for your first order”. So I’m not ordering anything until one of these coupons works. I’m deleting these 2 Uber apps and I’ll go pick up my own dinner, like I did last night when this didn’t work.
title: Worthless promotions

review:
I love uber except when they are mostly late,
 so I have to call a cab.  I now call them at least 30 minutes before I need them.  
Uber eats came last  night to the wrong side of the hotel. (to the back).  
My brother and I called and asked him to come around to the front. 
He just put the food out and left. 
If it wasn’t for my brother, who ran down to the other side as fast as he could, to get the food.
I never would have received it since I physically don’t have the ability to go that far.
My Uber driver today was very kind and polite
and prompt.  
I don’t like the taxi because some of the drivers charge you a lot more than you should have to pay. You never know exactly what they’re going to charge you until you arrive.
There has been some nice, honest drivers.  
Yesterday a driver overcharged me significantly. 
I brought it to his attention and he said I had to pay it, or he would take me back where I came from. I should have said OK, but I just wanted to get away from him.
title: Uber

review: Please bring back the rewards program that you had. They came in so handy. And also, please get better with GPS navigation system. I had request 3 different Ubers, two of which canceled because they couldn’t locate me. Each time the pinpoint was way off. When I tried correct it, it won’t allow me. I had to DM the last driver to my location, and it was still off. Another time before, I was about a minute away from my destination, and the GPS had my driver on a detour. Making 5 minutes late. For such troubles I really think y’all should bring back the rewards program. Otherwise, we’re spending money on getting lost.
title: Bring back the rewards, please.

review: While Lyft seems to have quadrupled their prices for rides, Uber has stay almost exactly the save. Maybe a little more, when gas prices are high which is understandable. But I don’t know what Lyft was thinking. I’m 100% Uber, and have started tipping more than I did before. Just when I think it’s too late at night or too early in the morning, Uber comes through!! I hope the Uber Company appreciates their drivers as much as customers/people like me do! Excellent Uber ride tonight….showed up very quickly and was very pleasant. Happy New Year!!🎊🎈🎆
title: I deleted my Lyft App and kept Uber😋

review: This is literally the worst app they tell you they charge you one price then after you get out the car they charge your card for a higher price. Plus some days I pay $7 for a ride then the next weekday it be $20! They are. It honest about the safety background checks and how many rides the driver has done I’ve ask my driver how log he was doing it he told me just started so only 2 day but the app said he had done over 1200 ride not possible. I see why Uber is banned in so many places I am done with this app completely. Not to mention Uber eats aswell the dang lady was eating my food so me and her exchange words and I canceled it . they refuse to refund me because I canceled and she was already there. Yeah busy eating. They don’t even always do safety seal to protect your food. Never again!!!
title: They drivers rate the app!!

review: I took a trip to D.C from Baltimore. It was just an hour away by taking the train. I had a great time, I saw the cherry blossom trees and got ice cream at a food truck. At 8pm, I decided it was time to go back home. I went back to the train station, but for some reason there was no more trains going back to Baltimore. The only way I could get back home was to get an Uber ride. The price of the ride was expensive. I placed a request to get a ride from the app, but it notified me that I didn’t have enough money. Uber allowed me to process the ride because I was a loyal member. Forever grateful.
title: Loyal customer forever

review:
I tried to get help with an app issue. It was impossible. They only give you limited options to ask for support. None of which applies to my issue. I tried for half an hour to get help. Finally called and was told I had to use the app. Even though I already explained that the app help was useless. She simply hung up on me!!!!
Then I was sent a link to review my support experience. It just crashes whenever I tried to submit a poor review. 
Add to this my last four rides were horrible with rude drivers, drivers who picked up the wrong person, high drivers, drivers who wouldn’t wait the five minutes, etc. and I’m done. On to Lyft and taxi’s from now on. 
I travel throughout the country every week and this is one of the worst travel experiences I’ve had in a long time.
title: Impossibly frustrating and rude

review: There is no consistency in the quality, punctuality, cost, etc of each ride.  Drivers will cancel on you when you put in a destination, be 30 min late for an airport spot you made the night before and prices can jump from $56 to $117 in 3 minutes.  Just happened to me on the tram ride at LAX.   Lyft from here on out.  Even if they are somewhat the same.  They are working harder to compete w Uber so prices are better.   Update. It feels like it’s getting worse and worse. Every approximate time for drivers is doubled. Then you watch your driver on the map either not move for five minutes or finish another ride and then maybe stop by a Starbucks? I have no idea what they’re doing but it’s always double the time that it says.

I have used Uber many times and the drivers were always very nice and friendly. I have had only one drive where the driver was not sure where to turn in but he quickly figured it out. I was always charged exactly the price they quoted me. My grand daughter lost her wallet and when she realized it she panicked. She started calling the places she had been to the night before. She started to call Uber but before dialing it she received a call and it was the Uber driver from night before. He told her he found her wallet and he was bringing it upstairs to her. This happened in NY!!!
title: Lilith

review:
I’ve enjoyed a couple rides from Uber drivers, some pleasant, some with vomit on the doors. That is Uber at its best. Getting the job done. 
If you have Uber, and get a promotion for an Uber eats coupon, you are directed to order through the Uber app as opposed to the Uber app, when this happens, there is no application of the coupons, and no confirmation to confirm your order. As soon as you put things in a basket and press next, an order is purchased. This would be no problem, if my accidental purchase could be cancelled and refunded immediately. Despite my cancellation within 60 seconds of ordering, I was charged $25 to cancel. It was a 25 dollar order. You see why I might be concerned? 
Abysmal 
If this doesn’t bounce on my credit card I’ll be astronomically more disappointed
title: Uber eats through Uber app portal is a nightmare

review:
Just now I received an email from Uber claiming that supposedly I had not been wearing my face mask properly. First, it is not true and I would like to see the footage.
Second, it is not even indicated when this supposedly happened.
Third, there is no proper option to communicate with the company about this lie.
Fourth, I can only suspect either a disgruntled driver in Philadelphia last weekend, a woman by the name of Stephanie, who sprayed her hair (and mine and my wife’s) while speeding after midnight through the icy streets of Philly or the guy Sala who drove me just now and farted three times disgustingly during the ride. Both received no tip, but an inaccurat 5 star rating for their subpar rides.
The fact that I as a customer get lied about and have no easy way to complain is bad customer service and certainly missing in the app.
title: Unacceptable and insulting
developerResponse: {'id': 6204866, 'body': 'Hi, this certainly sounds frustrating. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we will follow up.', 'modified': '2018-12-03T04:30:42Z'}

review: I had fraudulent charges to my Uber account, rides taken in San Francisco, New Jersey and elsewhere within minutes or hours. I reported the fraud to Uber and to my bank, and was sent forms to certify that I didn’t make the charges/rides, which I did. They have not, and would not remove the fraud from my account. They only allowed text messages to resolve this , and there is no phone number or person they would let me speak to. They texted responses that made no sense. The fraud against me is still on my account. Note that I was a 5 star customer. Uber does not care. They allow fraud through their app. Don’t use UBER if you don’t want hundreds of dollars in FRAUDULENT  charges against you from Uber. I’m a 60 year old person with never a bad mark on my credit. Terrible practice.
title: Horrible Fraud Experience with Uber company

review: Use Lyft instead! I lost my phone in the car, and tried to contact the driver through calling my phone, and playing a sound to notify her. I even left an message on Lock Screen saying I’m willing to pay her. She just turned my phone off so I cannot track it anymore. Then I went online to try to contact uber. I filled out all the forms online, and they said they had notified the driver, it’s completely up to her if she wants to bring my phone back. Nothing happened! She never called, and I have no way to contact uber customer service because it’s none exist. Use at your own risk and pray that your driver is not a thief. My driver’s name is Regina and she lives in Pittsburgh. If you see a Honda with license plate LJV6353, protect your stuff.
title: They don’t do anything to get your lost item back!

review: Ride share apps are great… when they work for the user (you and I). But when you have a driver just hit accept to an assigned ride and then decide to cancel on you when they realize your destination is not in the “right direction”, they can just cancel with no consequence, leaving you with a longer wait to find a new driver or increased fees. The fact that Uber can charge us (the customers) with cancellation fees but their drivers are free to cancel at any “inconvenience” is the epitome of hypocrisy. This has happened more and more often, and since there is no way to rate the cancelling drivers they will continue to repeat this problematic behavior. Either fine drivers for cancellations or allow users to rate them for wasting our time. Protecting this behavior only encourages it.
title: Drivers cancelling with no consequences

review: I’m in Boston and there are no drivers at all around here. Any place I want to go, I’m unable to find a driver. And finally if I find one, he is 13-1mina away and doesn’t start moving towards pick up point for 4-5mins. The situation finally ends up like I don’t save time going in Uber instead of train. And if I do cancel, they charge a cancellation fee. The ETA they give before booking the ride never ever are true bcos drivers are far away and only start moving towards pickup location after 3-4mins. And when you are forced to cancel the ride bcos the Uber estimates were bad, you pay the fee! At least Lyft respects its customers! Phone calling local cab services is better idea if you’re in hurry and can’t take the train. Uber will eventually take the same time as train and useless waste of money.
title: Very bad customer care

review: Uber is terrible now. I hate this app, I would much rather pay a little higher for Lyft who doesn’t treat their customers like you’re in an auction. Uber will literally quote you a certain amount for a ride and say a driver is on the way then randomly decide not to honor that price and try to bait you to accept a ride at a significantly higher price from a different driver for a quicker pick up, meanwhile abandoning your original price and if you don’t accept it, they’ll randomly quit your entire ride request. When this happens, I just simply go over to Lyft and request a ride and they always come through. Tired of being treated like a number instead of a paying customer that has invested consistently into Uber since the beginning. Cancelling my account today for good.
title: Customer Service & Value

review:
So far I had very good experience using app and with drivers around where ever I have used this app.

But recently on one of booking driver refused for ride as he wants me to cancel the ride and pay him all the cash so he can drop me to my location privately.

I took initiative to file complaint against such practice and make aware such things on Uber support platform. As ride wasn’t taken so it won’t be available in my ride history but I spoke to Driver using “Uber call option on app” so I asked them to fetch details from there end as neither I am having any more details , though I gave details of my pickup location, driver name as it appeared on my recent list as “ xxx Uber”, time for requesting ride.

Besides all above things that I did in courtesy I re-shared details so that other fellow passengers shouldn’t be framed such way and their trips can be tracked on Uber till drop off location (safety reasons only)
But Uber support mocked me repeatedly by same copy paste messaging lines and asked to share details on help option and further asked me to write everything in English (that I was doing , with very few grammatical errors).

Anyway thanks for such ordeal Uber team.

I am giving 0 stars for such support team. Thanks !
title: Bad Customer Support

review: This was my first time downloading the Uber app and taking an Uber.  Both were very pleasant endeavors.  I really appreciated the security conducted for both the driver and the passenger. I appreciated the real-time aspects of the experience via the app.  Alan, my driver, was extremely nice and professional.  We had great conversations about working and living in Austin.  It was also my first time riding in a Tesla which was pleasant as well.  I will definitely use Uber again and will request Alan if I can.  Five stars aren’t enough for the convenience and professionalism that I received today!
title: First Uber Ride

review: I love the fact that I can go to pretty well any city and get an Uber without having to look up the local phone number or something like that. I love that everything is completed through the app also. I do find the app somewhat confusing, and I find that things that I want to use or sometimes hidden way in less predictable places. And, it’s frustrating when drivers cancel on you for no particular reason. Additionally, there is no simple way of seeing your actual expenses on Uber in order to include them in an expense report. That seems to be a serious omission. I have to resort to including screenshots of multiple screens.
title: Great concept but needs work

review: My truck was in the shop and I needed a ride home and then a ride back when my repair was complete, it was my first time to use Uber, and I was impressed with both drivers, the vehicles were both late models, clean, cool, and comfortable, the drivers (Andre first and Pamela on the way to pick my truck up) were professional, safe, polite, friendly (but not TOO overly chatty, which I appreciated) and got me where I needed to go safely and on time,.. I highly recommend both drivers (I don’t know their last names) and Uber,.. and will use them again when and if needed.
title: Andre and Pamela

review:
His car is luxury and clean, his car was such a positive vibe with inspirational messages throughout, one of which said "beautiful start to a beautiful day"... that meant everything to me considering it was raining extremely bad from the start of my day.. my son enjoyed his fast car on the way to school and his energy was so warm, friendly, and mind. I wish him more blessings and i missed my school bus and he decided to take me free of charge but I tipped him because like Wow, theyre are still some good people out here. 

Love lashae. All money and abundance will be returned to you, 10 folds.
title: Awesome Customer Service

review: I love Uber but I hate that it lies to you about wait times most of the time. It could say “you’ll have a driver in 5 minutes” before booking your ride then you end up getting a driver that's really 10 to 15 minutes away from you. I really don’t understand it sometimes. I’ve been late multiple times to work because of Uber saying the wait is 5 minutes then I end up getting a driver that is far away from me. Before Covid the wait times use to be so accurate but now their not accurate sometimes. I normally use Uber because it’s cheaper than Lyft and sometimes quicker than Lyft.
title: Wait Times

review:
I always get booted out of my app each time I travel to different country. It works a bit the abruptly stops and locks me out, leaving me with no option to order rides. Several times I had to ask a relative to order rides for me. What an inconvenience! Each time I tried to reset the app it would seem to work then I get booted again.

One time while in the US, we believe we left our shopping in an Uber but then I got booted out of the app soon afterwards leaving me with no way of tracing back the car and driver. The Uber website was not very helpful and there didn’t seem to be a support number to call.

Quite frustrating for an otherwise great app!
title: Could do better

review:
If you have a complaint don’t even bother to be heard by UBER. To talk to someone is time consuming like 7 days wait time and still no response. But they have no problem charging your account. Uber driver can’t even show up when you book a car. However if you like to order NOW. Wow there is the car. Uber eats is the worst when they did you wrong they still steal your money even when the restaurant called their Uber drivers a thief. While they didn’t even delivery the correct food. Worst customer service I truly hope someone will come on the ride share market and give them run for their money. If you want to be a global brand you have to give the same customer experience. Not a phone line where no one answers. It’s a joke this place. 
HORRIBLE !!!!!!
title: Worst company to deal with

review: Awful UI and doesn’t even let you change your order after you’ve submitted it. Have had too many incidents because of their system and inadequate customer service. Ubereats sent my food to some random address which I have never input into the app (nor does the app have any history of the random address). Uber just pulled an address out of thin air and set it as default and I didn’t notice until my food was “delivered”. So please check your delivery address because Ubereats will screw you over. That was the last time I’ll ever use this useless app, deleting forever. Developers should really pay attention to the bugs in their app and cater to user experience so they don’t have to jump through hoops just to get a refund for THE APPS fault. Strongly advise to use other apps.
title: STAY AWAY FROM UBEREATS

review: I did not have an uber account before, Until we were stranded in Ohare Airport in Chicago and no personal transportation available to us( we were from Michigan) going to a hotel. City taxi was the only available option at that time but, it has alot of hidden charges that made the overall fare a rip off. My wife suggested me to open a Uber account and setting up a ride back to the airport was convenient and less stressful. The fare was very reasonable and the uber driver was very friendly and helpful. I regret not to use Uber before😊.
title: Way better than taxi

review:
I had 4 drivers cancel after accepting my trip when they saw that my destination was 30 min away and Uber wasn’t paying them enough to justify the trip. It was only a 30 minute trip going from Santa Cruz to San Jose CA- so this should not have been an issue. 

Also, each driver took 30-45 minutes to arrive in the first place so as a result of being cancelled so many times I was stranded for over 4 hours. I was only able to make it home because a friend drove over 1 hour to come and pick me up. I had no problem getting into Santa Cruz that morning, but no driver would take me anywhere outside of the city. 

Uber needs to 1) show drivers the end destination before they accept a trip and 2) pay them more so they aren’t incentivized to cancel if it is inconvenient for them. 

One of the drivers said if he wasn’t short on time he would have made the trip if I paid him in cash.  The price he offered was half that of the Uber cost. So, they must be paying these drivers little to nothing on these trips. 

Really poor experience and Uber customer support is terribly difficult to contact.
title: 4 drivers cancelled after I entered the car- stranded for hours

review: If you need to be anywhere on time be ready to order your Uber 20 min early plus, besides how long it takes to get there. You are at the grace of them getting to you on time. The app will lie to you and tell you “10 min” for a rider, when in reality it is more like 15 min.  A driver can cancel on you for no reason at any point, I guess that is fair Because a rider can do the same but, that is at no cost to them. For how much money this service cost I would expect it to be more streamlined. I have had some very good rides with competent drivers/ fun people to talk to. And some drivers who scare me on the road. Anyone can be an Uber driver, but maybe there should be some drivers test beforehand. I had a driver almost run a red light the other day.
title: So inconsistent

review:
Somebody hacked into my Uber account and charged my card for a ride in a different state than I live in. I immediately called my bank about the fraudulent charge and the bank refunded the money. 

When I tried to use the app again, my account had been locked. I emailed Uber support and told them that I thought my access to my account was removed because of a fraudulent charge made in December. In the email I stated that the bank forwarded me the paperwork to prove that this charge was due to hacking, but I kept getting automated responses from Uber saying that I wouldn’t get my account back until I paid the charge.

I switched to Lyft and like it a lot better. I’m really disappointed in the lack of support from Uber. If you get hacked, you won’t get your account back!
title: Fraudulent charge with no support from Uber

review: I Was getting a reoccurring charge for 9.99 Uber pass I did not recognize. Called their support number only to find it’s for drivers only.  They provided me an email which took them a week to respond to. I answered all of their questions only to be told they could not find it and sent me to a specialist which told me the same thing. Every step of the way just giving generic copy and paste responses telling me to call my bank. My banks only solution was to cancel the card. I asked multiple times if they were associated with any other company and they did not answer. I re opened the case hoping the person helping me was wrong and they pin pointed the issue right away. Customer service definitely not handled within the states and they could care less.
title: Poor customer service

review:
For managing Uber rides, the app works very well. No complaints.

Uber also uses the app to promote their services using iPhone Notifications.  This morning at 3 am HST, Uber sent such a notification about Uber Eats, waking us up.  We use iPhone’s Focus feature to quiet our devices at night, but Uber’s notification still made a sound and woke us.  We’ve had to turn off sound notifications for the Uber app — something we do not really want to do since we still want to receive notifications about rides.

We would have sent Uber a more direct communication about this issue, but they seem to support only communication by twitter and App reviews.
title: Mostly Good.  Annoying Notifications

review: My first experience with Uber was a good one until I figured out the receipt.  The driver tells them when he has arrived at the pickup spot and then the clock begins to tick.  I planned ahead to allow time to drop my car off and speak to the mechanic.  The Uber driver arrived before I could get out of my car.  He arrived early and I got charged for it.  It was only a small amount but if they do that to all customers it would add up.  Made me mad.  I used it a second time and the back seat was so small I had a hard time getting out of it.  I hesitate to try it again.  I am 70 years old and not as strong as I used to be.  There should be a limit as to the size of the car.
title: Wait time

review: I needed to get to work quick so I checked both Uber and Lyft to see how many drivers are nearby. Uber had one car down the street from my home and another 5 minutes away at the mall yet still gave me a driver 11 minutes away and in the middle of another ride instead. I called and told him if he could cancel my trip to save me from being late to work and he never did. had to wait so I don’t waste $13 and got I trouble at work. Uber NEVER EVER asks drivers if they want to accept a ride when I’m in an Uber, they just get added on. So why give me the FARTHEST and LEAST WANTED person in my area? Uber gets on my nerves because this happens 3/5 times when I want a ride. Always gives me the most farthest rider and it’s annoying for someone who just wanted a quick ride and could’ve used lyft which would’ve been faster.
title: Poor drivers choice

review: Hey so I bought an Uber from my house to my school in the morning. When I had bought it and looked it up and stuff it had said my Uber was 2 dollars so I was willing to pay for it so I can make it to school on time. But when I paid for it finally, the Uber had changed the price of it and the price changed to 40 dollars and I had no  way of going back to see what was going on with my pricing and why it went up AFTER I PAID. And I asked my uber why it happened, but he said he didn’t know why that happened aswell. And not only that, but he said he is only getting paid 8 dollars. So can y’all please fix that issue and can I get my 11 dollars back please? Not everyone has money just to waste like that. Thanks
title: Price change

review:
I’ve been using Uber for over a decade. It’s been a primary mode of transportation for me. My monthly expenditure is quite large for a private individual. It used to be that riders were rewarded for this kind of loyalty. At some point I was considered a diamond member, received priority driver selection and had access to concierge customer service wherein an actual person would answer the phone and help me with my concerns. At some point it must have been deemed more profitable in the short run to do away with with the program. It was a “loyalty program” designed to instill loyalty in riders. In my case it worked. At some point the company said to loyalty customers that it simply no longer cared and that customers like me could bugger off. It really no longer cared.

Outcome: I use other services and options as much as possible and will soon cease using Uber all together. I intend to make this happen as soon as possible. I used to love Uber. Now I have an extreme distrust and dislike of Uber. 

Doing my part to grease the wheels of customer service physics.

Sincerely,
A once extremely loyal customer
title: Customer Service in The Can

review: After years of riding I started to check my receipts. Come to find out mostly all my quoted fares were changed. If you quote a price that I accept to pay then that should be the price charged but no all my fares were higher than what I accepted. I will be deleting this app and using Lyft for now on. Everytime I seem to catch a uber my price quote is always increased by $2 or more in the updated receipt. No matter what. Their excuse is surcharges and fees which makes no sense when I’m ready when it arrives it never has to wait. I’m not going on toll rides just local driving.  Tired of my fares being adjusted so I will just use Lyft I have never had this issue with them. Make sure to always check your receipt after your ride.
title: Scammy

review: For the most part i've use uber for a while now but as it's gotten popular the prices are just ridiculous. For a 15 min ride into the city was 35. I decided to get 10% off your next ride with my points. I went to put in the address again and the same ride is now $50 but with 10% off so 45. 😐They change the prices to be the most expensive at the most inconvenient times. I've seen uber prices for 80-90 for a 20 minute ride. They know it's messaged up because there are times where I leave the and go to the lyft app and then back to uber the price drops a few $$. I hate that the company is at a point where these reviews won't even make a difference. It's not fair what they do and they don't even pay their drivers a fair price. Back to taking taxi's.
title: Basically a scam.

review: I received a text about 15 min. Before being picked up that my driver,  David was on his way. On the Uber app I was able to see exactly where he was so I was outside and waiting for him to arrive. David got out of the car and helped me with my bag and we got in the car and we’re on our way. We had good conversation for my trip. Upon arriving at my destination David helped me with my bag again and we said goodbye. David was early to arrive and I got to the airport with plenty of time to spare. I even got a message thanking me for my tip I left him. Thanks for the great experience.
title: My first Uber Ride

review: Very expensive . I had to wait for 30 minutes for someone to request my ride. Gladly someone did but when he came to my house , and I got into his car , he told me he could not drive me to this specific location . So basically he drove to my house just to say that he can’t drive me . Anyways , I went to find another ride and Susan came to the rescue and requested my ride. She was very kind , and didn’t have a problem driving me somewhere that I wanted to be at. The people and I who had any type of problems,  should at least get a discount . But unfortunately Uber doesn’t do that . So maybe Uber , you should take this advice and make your app a better app. 🤷‍♀️

I use uber 1-2x a day and will likely continue but for an app w that relies on locating pickups there approximate location is 10x less accurate than apps that barely use locations like Snapchat.  I’ll order an Uber, not move and the driver will end up 2 blocks away then we have to call or walk to find them.  Driver doesn’t pick up or you can’t find them and you get charged. 

Likewise I’ll order an Uber 2 mins away and after paying it says “driver is dropping off another ride” and then they drive 10 minutes off in an opposite direction before they start the drive back to you.  

The drivers are great and half the time the above issues are not a problem but for such a large mkt share service they really could do better
title: Horrible Location Services and Directions

review: About 2019- early 2020 is when Uber’s app designed peaked, since then it has gotten increasingly more complicated. Constantly moving important items and changing the way menus work has made it incredibly frustrating to find simple things like trips and the worst offender is changing how to access contacting the driver/chat. That should be very prominent, front and center; instead it is buried, hard to find, and buggy. Additionally, there are so many steps now before booking a ride it takes away a lot of the convenience of the app. I used to just push a button and get a ride. Now 1 out of every two times there is so box I forgot to check or hoop/hurdle I missed that means the ride was actually never called. Horrible UX design. Needs big improvements
title: App Design Too Complicated

review: I had a driver who told me they had arrived when they were still down the street (around the corner) and kept telling me he wasn’t going to stay there long even though my pin was marked where I wanted to be picked up, he than sped past me after I asked if he was the car across the street stopped at the very end of the strip. I also asked him was he in a white car and got no response other than he was going to leave. and once I got in he made jokes about “having to speed” because “I waited long” I was than returned my money but charged a wait fee and could not use Uber and it’s going on 10 hours that I contacted support. I’ve paid the amount of I shouldn’t have paid that driver or the company I’m always charged more than the price that is given before I order.
title: Bad service

review: I went on vacation and needed to use Uber/Uber eats and it was such an awful experience. The drivers, when I was able to book a trip, were great (I have to say something nice) but when the app wasn’t working and I couldn’t book a trip because of a “back office” issue I couldn’t fix on my end and nobody I was able to get a response from understood what I was saying or the error messages I was getting it became incredibly frustrating. I sent multiple emails and it took forever to get responses, an in app messenger disconnected our conversation mid way after they didn’t help in anyway. This experience makes me never want to use the service again. Why there isn’t an accessible customer service number with competent people really doesn’t make sense.
title: Communication is awful- BEWARE

review: This girl that was assigned to my sons trip cancelled his ride 10 mins before his ride! He was getting off work and (had recently started using Uber regularly as he just got the job) so he had to stand outside after closing in the cold and wait for me to get to him! To add insult to injury, she reported him for not wearing a mask and he keeps one on him because he follows rules!! He knows the rules and always wears one in the ride!! Maybe she gets to keep part of the money from the ride for being a liar, not sure why she would report him for any other reason!! This company is awful, they don’t have a way to contact them directly without creating an account. I’d never join their monthly subscription service or make an account because no accountability fir the drivers!! Use Lyft instead.
title: Driver was a liar!!

review:
I had difficulty to find the way to let Uber to know that my request for ride with a couple of stops wasn’t done. Uber driver left me with groceries instead waiting for me according by my order/ request. I was walking around the parking lot of the grocery store, looking for his car…. Finally I ordered another car. It happened today December 3rd, at 10:52 am I was outside and looking for Uber ride. Ordered another car. Too bad you don’t have customer service  1-800… phone number, your “Help” didn’t have a right description for my situation. I’m very upset  with  that kind of service.
I hope you will come up with solution   for customer service phone number for riders as you have phone number for Uber drivers. Without the riders you will not have a business.
title: Customer Service

review: Terrible, terrible, terrible experiences. On top of ridiculously high rates already. Will tend to elusively add charges on to your card. You will pay an initial fare or what’s prompted you will then see it increased in the app when you return after the trip as well as overcharged on your card. My advice just use Lyft or a straight up taxi or something else, your money will be safe/ you won’t be duped etc. Zero Stars if it was an option 💀 I don’t understand forcing ppl to give a star in order to review either 😤 Stupid. Oh yeah also the worst customer service/support I.e. it’s actually a scheme/scam/non-existent, they seem to only provide a number/correspondence for drivers and not riders/ the public gaining them this enormous wealth/sums through their capitalistic/devious schemes and scams. JUST A WARNING ⚠️
title: Fraudulent, Scam Central… Use anything else fr.

review: I have to use Uber to get to work sometimes. I have to make sure to call an Uber almost 2 hours before I have to work just to make sure I get one, and sometimes I’m left sitting there waiting for someone to pick up for an hour. I live in the middle of a huge city.  Now, if I cancel the ride and pay MORE because their prices suddenly changed and weirdly also took forever “trying to find a driver” then I can find one faster this is ridiculous.. don’t expect to ever be where you need to be on time is all I’m saying and expect to pay more because if you get a cheap price it may have you waiting endlessly until you cancel and pay more.
title: Stupid system

review:
, they call before coming to location to harass me on where I’m going . Or sometimes they’ll come to my location to see where I’m going and then cancel, we should get an cancel fee back to our bank account, then  , if we cancel then we have to pay them 5 dollars smh I don’t like lyft or Uber anymore too much games being played . I don’t have time for it anymore ( IF YOUR READING THIS PLEASE SOMEBODY MAKE A NEW APP FOR US , please lol 😆 we need a new app to download ) 

Half the times it’ll give me a price but then charge me for wait times or extra even tho I be outside waiting right there , or if I’m walking to the car I don’t even be 5 mins , it be couple seconds n they start charging , it’s been couple times my money was getting snatched out of my bank account, from Uber as well Smh 🤦🏽‍♀️
title: Not good anymore

review: Uber's policy of not removing a photo of yourself from the Uber app is ridiculous. I had downloaded the Uber Driver app and wanted to deliver meals occasionally when I needed to get a workout on my road bike. But I work full time and have no time to do deliveries. The Uber Driver app requires that you take a photo of youself before doing a delivery. The app takes VERY UGLY photos. Now that photo has been transferred to the Uber car service app and I hate it. I feel like drivers treat me worse because the photo is so ugly. But Uber doesn't allow you to change it. So, I'm here to let Uber know that unless I can remove that hideous photo of me from the Uber car service app I won't be using Uber anymore. At least Lyft drivers won't harbor prejudices and mistreat me because of that ugly photo.
title: Uber will not let you change a bad photo

review: I continue to be amazed at the amount of air fresheners that many rideshare drivers have hanging in their car.   The scent is awful and can give riders severe headaches.   As well our driver really did only that - drive.   We were picked up at the airport and had to load our own luggage and then take it out at drop off time.  That’s just lazy.  I’ve driven for 4 years and always assisted every fare by placing luggage into the trunk and removing it.  Also - never, never, never used air fresheners to hide the smells in a car.   My car was always clean and NO fragrances.   We may have to rethink future requests.
title: Why are there SO many air fresheners ??

review: my account hasn’t been used in almost 10 years the email they have on file from my phone number is a bogus email that I never used. They keep on asking and requiring the last four digits of my credit card which I would have no idea since my credit card number have changed over the years. Requiring this number to fix a hacked account even though I was able to verify my phone number with them is ridiculous. They have taken Security and made it to impossible standard. Worthless app if you can’t use it worthless service if they have such security that they basically allow Account accounts to be hacked but then don’t really require or allow you toe discover them.
title: Account hacked no way to recover it or use Uber afterwards

review: Today I ordered my food around 3pm and It has been “delayed” until now, almost 5pm. I have texted and called my driver with no response. When i checked the driver location, they were driving around tampa and other locations, very far from my order location. I reached out to a customer service chat and I was told the order was placed on a guest account and disconnected, while clearly I placed the order on MY account which I am currently logged into. I was offered at $1 refund which does nothing for my $12 order. I am very upset with this driver and your customer service representative. I have tried to reach out many times but nothing helps. This is not the first time that this has happened, in fact it happens almost every time I order
title: Horrible service every time

review: The app claimed I had no connection while riding and the on my end it never changed from my location at home. It said the driver would be there in 0 mins and continued to increase my estimated drop off time. I even turned my WIFI off and still nothing. I started sharing my trip before I got in the car, while riding the people I was sharing with said they didn’t have anything shared, when trying during the ride it didn’t allow me to share saying action failed, failed to create contact. For a good ~5 mins I felt panicked and anxious about the whole situation, the only relief I got was knowing through my iPhone I was sharing my location with my family, but other than that, this was a terrible situation to be in.
title: Connection didn’t allow app to work while riding

review: Not a big fan of the recent update where the app forces you to go somewhere else (even though it’s nearby) for pickup when you explicitly put down a location where you want to be picked up. I had to request a ride around 5am from the hotel to go to the airport. Even though the app just made me go across the street for pickup, as a woman traveling by herself in an unfamiliar area, I did not feel safe standing in poorly lit area by myself while having to look down at my phone to check the vehicle status. Would have much preferred just to be picked up from the well-lit hotel entrance. It seems like not much thought has gone into considering the safety needs of women.
title: Safety concerns re forcing rider to go somewhere else for pickup

review:
When Ed pulled up, he realized there was a “sandwich board” that might have caused an obstacle for my ability to get into the car safely. He pulled up (without my asking) and when I got into the car, he explained that he moved his car for MY benefit. 

Through the ride he was pleasant to talk with, and I was incredibly grateful his radio was off and I did not need to request it be turned off (which is the case with 90% of Uber cars I get into). 

If I was able to reserve Uber rides with a specific driver, Ed would be someone I truly would request for future rides!
title: Polite and respectful

review:
Uber Complain 

Uber driver refused to take me to my destination and threatened to cancel my ride. After much pleading, I had to shorten my trip half to distance so I would be stranded in the cold. This level of service is despicable. I spend thousands of dollars each year using  your  service  and to be treated like this is unacceptable. 

This was the second time today as the first driver, who could hardly speak English also refused to take me to final destination because it was too far. Are you kidding me.  This after reserving my ride and waited for 1.5 hours.
title: Horrible Drivers

review: Love the app! Hate the fact that when you want to complain about something you can’t without it being specific with the topics they have and you can’t write what is actually wrong!. I just want a way to change the place that the location is saying to drop me off, the locations is wrong like its my place but it drops me off at the other street like a 3 minute walk yes its 3 minutes but I’m paying to get dropped off at my place not where this app wants to drop me off. Just want a way to change where I get dropped off i don't want to pay to get dropped off in a different location where i have to walk more than i have to the other services drop me off at the correct spot is only this app that i alway have trouble with my drop off location.
title: It's a love hate app

review: I’ve literally had this happen to not only me - multiple times . But me and my girlfriend at the SAME time beside each other right after an accident , trying to get a quick ride (which users who have a history with the app should be able to do easily) and it’s asking us yet again, to verify a phone number . And very rarely is it ever just that simple . Errors , crashes , for whatever reason it just has no chill about the phone numbers. I have /had one of the newest phones out , granted hers isn’t as new . I have the newest version of the app these errors are just text book . But other than that ,when I can actually get it to work . Uber is alright .
title: Constantly asking to verify phone numbers

review: Ok let’s start off by saying I understand that the drivers are  contractors . I get that they can cancel their rides at any time .I was In Las Vegas last October and I had ordered an Uber and a driver had accepted the ride. The driver canceled be fore he even showed up because he got a better fair . Ok I get it however he committed to mine and then another driver accepted the same fair and hold and behold the same thing happened that should not be allowed if they make a comment the should be forced to follow threw with it . That is why I give the Uber corporation an over all 2 star .Now  in February, I used the application again and had no problems in any way in Phoenix AZ . Makes you wonder if they fixed it or it just the area. Today’s date February 25 th 2023 .
title: Uber review

review:
I wrongly assumed I would be able to use the Uber app while being abroad. 
I am in a country with lots of tourists a well developed country, with a bustling city not in the middle of no where !
After requesting the ride, it kept going back and forth for over a half an hour saying the driver would be there in one minute, then six minutes than one minute back and forth. 
I was waiting outside all this time and the driver with indicated plates never arrived. 
Yet they had the audacity to charge me for the driver cancelling saying he came there but nobody was there !!!

Later when I kept requesting a ride at a busy shopping mall, where other drivers were picking up shoppers who had contacted Uber well after I did, were getting picked up right away ! They kept saying ‘no cars available’ but there were plenty of cars available as they were coming every minute to pick up other people. 

Horrible experience and service. 
When I sent them a message about this, they were quite unapologetic. 
They had no concern for me or my safety at all. 
Very disappointing service. 
Will look for other services going forward.
title: Horrible service and no accountability taken

review: App is great, experience really depends on the drivers you get. However, the GPS continually messes up the route for the driver during pick up. The GPS keeps trying to take the drivers through a gate that does not allow entrance, even when I set the pickup location to the front of the complex. If I send the drivers my apartment address and they use Apple Maps it’s never an issue. This has happened multiple times with myself, my roommates, and my guests trying to Uber. Definitely a first world problem but maybe others have been having the same issue with pick up.
title: GPS/Pick Up Issues

review: My daughter left her nice sunglasses in an Uber in Tampa - she IMMEDIATELY realized it and contacted the driver right back - no response.. She called him repeatedly and  after 24 hours, contacted Uber as directed - mind you, there is no actual phone # for service to call, so you continually email things. To even the Uber help area. After 4 times of sending the form for Uber to contact the driver for us, we got a standard response of left back to you”.  NEVER HEARD BACk.  So if you have problems with Uber, you are in your own.  Never a person to actually talk to.
title: Poor customer service

review: I honestly cannot give this Company 2 stars.  It is the worst company I have EVER experienced, and I am not exaggerating.  Buyer beware!  I’ve been using Uber for a few years, but as I examined my finances, I noticed that Uber has been charging me $9.99 monthly for the last eight months.  “Ok, fine,” I tell myself, “I must have signed up for it somewhere in the past.”  When I went to cancel the Uber Pass subscription in the app, this service was not listed in my app anywhere to cancel!  I am stuck paying $9.99 monthly for a service I never knowingly subscribed to!  Reddit users are also experiencing similar issues, and a class action lawsuit is being called for.  The company is completely NOT trustworthy; I will never have anything to do with Uber and will advise others to do the same.
title: Not Trustworthy

review: Price manipulation like theirs should be illegal , $20 ride can easily turn into $100 ride during busy hours!( and this have started during hard Covid times when people are actually struggling). Timing ,their 8 min is actually 12-15 min in real time ! Plus charging after this for wait time , sometimes waiting on Uber 20 min , sometimes 1 min , you want me to wait 20 min all dressed in a coat inside !??? Give people reasonable amount of time , I’m used to waiting 1 min always on Uber , now a lot have changed! One star , not to mention being on highway with open window, got sick !!! 😡 also for paying this much for every ride , every single Uber driver complaines abt their pay check , they don’t wanna go far , I had people canceling on me when I was in a car that’s crazy !
title: Worst prices manipulation

review: I remember when Uber use to be affordable and understanding! Over the last year the customer service and overall company has gone downhill. I have been up charged more times than I can count and they say it was the price shown upfront and that is a lie! They are silently robbing customers and I am a platinum member, I was gold but I retracted that membership due to poor customer service! We should not be charge for wait time or due to traffic so it’s a longer route or when drivers take the longest route to make more money on the ride. Do better Uber, I’m afraid I’ll be taking my business elsewhere after being refunded .43 on a ride that I upcharged $2 on. I would give 1 star but it’s combiner still in today’s society.
title: Overpriced ride fares

review: I scheduled an Uber for between 12:30-12:40 pm because I was at a friends house drinking and didn’t want to drive. Being responsible, I had my mom drop me off and made sure to schedule an Uber for the time I wanted to be picked up at. When it got to 12:30, I waited outside thinking the Uber would be there soon. It didn’t. It is now 12:40 and the Uber still isn’t here. Since everyone was drinking nobody could drive me home. Thankfully I was able to call a Lyft and it came in 11 minutes. Lyft is MUCH more reliable than Uber. I’ve also found that Lyft drivers are nicer and are safer on the road. A lot of Uber drivers speed and I think it is because they feel rushed. I have had many problems with Uber, but this is definitely the worst considering I was almost stranded. Thanks a lot
title: Not reliable AT ALL

review: I prefer Lyft , this app is ridiculous, but Jen you pay a fee , after you get dropped off and settle it’s an additional fee taken off my card or my Uber cash , I do t understand whatever price it says at the beginning it should be only that price , it’s ridiculous, I’m getting charged for every ride extra and I don’t be late or nothing , what is the money coming off my card for now I could’ve seen if I always late but I’m always on time outside waiting for them to come and then I look extra funds are being charged I don’t care if they’re in Africa it’s ridiculous that I’m paying an extra fee atleast let me know first if that’s how much I’m paying , it’s crazy , I work too hard for my change and got it to be taken stupidly is ridiculous and I obscured
title: Uber issues

review: The first driver I had was as good and he was cool. The other two drivers I had got lost and gps don’t help them. I feel like what ever area they know better should be the area they drive in because I had to be at work until 12 and had to get my daughter to come out in the cold why she pregnant. One was polite the other one was kinda rude but overall I want complain because they are always on time. The thing is if you can go out of town to big cities why you can’t come to small towns when you getting paid like Johnston sc when you getting paid I talk to the Uber driver they get to pick where they want to go. I do meet amazing drivers and talk with them.
title: Drivers

review: I use Uber A LOT but only because Lyft cant recognize my address… your app have let people cancel the ride right in front of my house with no consequences to them. I am NEVER late when someone picks me up but if I were you’d charge me, put a little more responsibility into the drivers… another thing, now you won’t let us write reviews about drivers. A driver commented something about my race SOLELY because he wanted to. I am very fluent in English and have good pronunciation but he implied that people of my race can’t speak English well. I wanted to report that but guess what? You don't even have that option to protect him. This is my last Uber ride, I’m going to talk with every Lyft driver to position them in my address but I can’t stand your policies anymore
title: You are more pro YOU and your employees than customers

review: I’ve tried multiple times to deactivate my account…(which was deactivated out of the blue and to my knowledge for no reason)… if I can actually get my request to get my account to be deactivated to submit I will get no response and no fix to this issue. They don’t have a customer service line to call and basically lack everything that endeared customer satisfaction. I’m giving this a two stars out of generosity because I know some people don’t have the same issues and are fine with Uber, but if you ever have a customer service issue or your account is randomly deactivated you will have  better luck using Lyft than actually getting a response from customer service.
title: Customer support tab doesn’t work

review: Sometimes you need to schedule rides ahead of time when you have a busy schedule. This app is not for this. If you have a ride scheduled and there are no Uber’s nearby available it won’t tell you; instead, it’ll let you go on thinking the ride is all set and won’t even notify you 10 minutes before that one isn’t available. Even when it’s 10 minutes *past* the scheduled time it still will only say “your ride is arriving soon” while there isn’t even a driver displayed like there would be if one were *actually* on the way. Seems that much communication is just too much work on Uber’s part, they still have the time and money to lobby state legislatures to allow them to continue paying their drivers the bare minimum they can get away with though.
title: No communication from the app

review:
My very first Personal Uber ride. From app download to the first ride I found the experience user friendly and efficient. The ride itself was exactly what I ordered and on time. The app providing the car, driver and tracking worked as designed and I felt informed and comfortable. The driver was pleasant, the car clean and what I needed to get my travels started for the day. Pricing was competitive with a local cab ride. Being able to use various payment methods again adds flexibility to the traveler.

As easy as it was I will definitely use UBER again.
title: Fresno short hop

review: My father had to have a procedure at the hospital and his car battery was dead.  My daughter got us there, but we used Uber to get home.  High traffic time.  Scott was there in 20 minutes. They described his car, license plate, how others rated him, how many trips he had taken.  They tracked where we were and where he was, so we could get the nurses to get him down just in time for pick up.  They also specified all the main hospital entrances so we knew where to meet.  Scott was a good driver. Friendly and professional.  The price was reasonable.  First experience with Uber, won’t hesitate to use them again.
title: Excellent service

review: The option to pay with the official U.S. American currency should be given to every American that doesn’t want to have their debit/ credit card stored in the Uber servers. The chances of companies being hacked exist and is inevitable sooner or later. City taxis accept cash. There are other good reasons to allow customers to pay with cash, including the option to tip with cash; besides being subjected to Uber’s data mining; and as other apps do, and as Uber have does and has done in other select cities. It should be the extended to all American cities as well, or Uber will keep losing revenue. If they fixed that I’ll increase the stars rating.
title: Cash payment needed as well!!

review: I waited in the cold 45 minutes and the first two drivers did not come to the location. The third time was the charm. Finally arrived and took me to LGA. Luckily I left early for my flight. Hopefully I can count on UBER drivers in the future. Also the message was the first driver cancelled and not sure what happened to the second driver but the third driver arrived and was pleasant. UBER charged me as if I had cancelled which was annoying. Hopefully they credited my account. It wasn’t easy to figure out how to get the 2 credits. Thanks to driver #3 for picking me up and getting me to LaGuardia for my flight. The 3 stars are for the final driver arriving and taking me to the destination.
title: Two Drivers Didn’t Arrive

review: Paul was VERY professional… I had reserved a pick up from West Palm Beach airport for my parents arriving from NJ.  The flight was delayed and my parents don’t speak very good English and my dad is using a walker…make a long story short Paul worked patiently with me with finding  my parents and dropping them off.  He went beyond what was expected by dealing  with airport police giving him a hard time as to pick up areas for Uber being that my parents couldn’t walk to Uber pickup area.  I think he takes pride in his job and goes the EXTRA mile.   Thank you for your help!
title: West Palm Beach pick-up

review: We were scheduled for pick up at 4:30 in the morning. They don’t let Uber pick up on Market Street so we had to go down towards Union Square for the pickup. When we started heading down to Union Square, we found the road was closed. We wondered what to do and then we heard our driver calling our name. He helped us load our stuff into the car and we took off for the airport? That’s when we found out Our driver had work all Saturday night. He was very pleasant and a careful driver. We hope you have as good of experience as we had.
title: Early Morning ride

review: Hi I been driving Uber almost 4 years I am very disappointed by Uber. It’s been 2 yearsI’ve been having a issue with my promotions it’s been two years I am not getting any promotion request and I called hundreds of time to solve this issue all the time I hear by agents I will get the promotionsBy next week Which never happened there is no one who can solve this issue especially nowadays when the gas prices are at peak at least promotions help with the gas money but Uber people don’t care about their drivers what kind of the problem they are facing
title: Driver

review: I don’t usually write app reviews but needed to get this one out there. Uber used to be great, I have been using it since maybe 2014. The issue with the app now recently is that it gives way too much information to the driver prior to the trip. The reason this is bad is because drivers are incentivized to decline any trip that they feel is too far. A driver would make more money just staying in the same vicinity using less fuel and getting more trips (trips have a base amount) than driving further out. I understand Uber can’t exist without drivers and this is admittedly good for them, but they can’t exist without their customers either. If I’m standing around all night getting my trips declined I’m going to use their competitors and never look back.
title: App ruined by one dumb decision

review: On a recent rainy trip to Washington I requested an Uber cab from JW Marriott Hotel to the National Gallery. I got a message saying that the driver would pick me up elsewhere, a block and a half away. It was raining and I had no idea where that would be, and in which direction. After asking a couple of shuttle bus drivers I headed for the meeting spot which was quite a walk. I decided to call the driver to tell him that I was on my way but would get there as soon as the traffic lights would allow. He then told me that he was at the lobby of the hotel. It is a known fact that Uber is not allowed there, so I had to try to run back through the rain, and just as I got there I was informed that he had cancelled and left. Of course I have been sent a bill! I am annoyed and very disappointed.
title: One star is generous

review: This holiday weekend was disappointing, especially because aparently i didn't realize that now that drivers can refuse trips.  This  happened about three or four times before my driver came 20 minutes later than i requested to have a driver to leave. It was really annoying because initially it appears that drivers accept rides for a minute or two killing precious time for riders causing me to miss the one boat out that i had this weekend paid for and now i missed the entire weekend i paid for with family. Disappointing.....
title: Memorial mess

review: I tried to order food from a restaurant and it told me that I ordered multiple times for some reason. I then tried to cancel it and the Uber app would not let me access the help button until after my order was sent. I wasn’t able to cancel or change the other orders and had to pay several times the amount for one order of food. Works great until you have a problem and then it doesn’t help solve it at all until after you’ve paid for it. DoorDash it is from now on:(
title: Bad food ordering service

review:
After Abdul safely drove me home, I realized I couldn’t find my small purse. I looked everywhere and called him back. Initially we had some trouble communicating in English but his wonderful son helped us. I had indeed left my purse in his car- back seat. He told me he’d take about 1 1/2 hrs and as I nervously waited, he ensured my purse was delivered. That had never happened to me before but we recently moved to the area and things are slightly “off”. So happy for his honesty and prompt return of my purse. Gave him his well deserved tip!! 
Thank you guys!!
title: Awesome service also after I forgot my purse

review: Luiz picked my husband and I up at 3am. He was bubbly and friendly. Assisted us with our luggage. Since it was so early he was not over talkative in the car and respected our space. The most chivalrous and honest thing Luiz did was after he dropped us off at RSW my husband and I were in the airport walking towards security. Luiz came back in the airport and gave me my backpack that I didn’t even realize I left it with all my personal belongings. I’m so glad he checked the back seat immediately after we exited the car. That was amazing. Thank you Luiz.
title: Luis the Uber driver on May 29, 2023

review: This was our first time using Uber so we scheduled a pick up in advanced from the airport. When we landed I had a message driver was on his way to terminal A problem was we were going to terminal C. I tried navigating the app to change it but could not. I tried calling the driver but he only did chats. He called me but his accent was so heavy we had trouble communicating. He then said to go to pick up area 6 but did not show. I then canceled the reservation and made a new one. The new driver was there in 10 minutes.  Israel was super personable plus the ride was $20 cheaper which I don’t understand but worked for me.  Bottom line mixed review. May give Uber another chance.
title: Mixed reviews

review:
I’m using Uber in Tokyo, and used the app to book a taxi. A moment after my taxi drove off, I realized I left my wallet on the seat. I immediately opened the Uber app, but the app provides no way to contact the driver, or even his license plate number.

 (These were visible a moment before, while I was riding in the taxi, but hidden as soon as I exited.) 

 I clicked support for “left item in car,” but the app only told me to try contacting the driver (which I could not do as the app provided no information). 

Uber support page repeatedly says to reach out to the driver, which they have made impossible. I have been sending messages to Uber support for 10 hours, and have not received a response.

I’m supposed to be flying out of the country 8 hours from now, and desperately need my wallet. 

I reported it immediately after being dropped off - if the app provided any way whatsoever to contact the driver or his taxi company, I would have gotten it back within 5 minutes.

Instead, I am anxious that I will miss my flight because their support system is utterly useless and no one on their team is getting back to me.
title: No ability to contact driver after ride

review: While Uber can be reliable at times there’s more times that it is unreliable for those going slightly longer distances. Drivers have the ability to cancel a ride if the distance is just inconvenient as doing more short trips in a shorter period is more profitable for them. Meanwhile I’ll be stuck waiting for a driver to decide to take me on as a customer for upwards of 10 minutes and then I still have to wait sometimes upwards of 10 minutes to even get picked up. Quite frankly the service and it’s now skyrocketing prices have made Uber lose its purpose: a cheaper alternative to taxi services to get where I need to go reliably.
title: Spotty service

review: Sheila was a very pleasant person to drive me to the airport. Sheila let me know that I was the second person that she ever picked up. Sheila was very honest with me and I thank her for her honesty. I hope I made her feel a little bit more comfortable. Great experience, great conversation and an excellent driver. It’s not many times you get a message from a stranger that you need to here but I believe our father in heaven arranged this ride for me. Thank you Sheila for the words, wisdom and love I needed to here. God is good.  Bless you and your family and what you are doing for the kingdom of God. Thank you.
title: God is awesome

review: I officially hate Uber now. We requested a pick up at Logan airport in Boston and were at the designated location. The driver never showed up and I could see on the map is car just keep circling the airport. I tried calling him 2 times and he would not pick up the phone. I texted him and he said he can’t find the location. The location had about 100 people waiting for rides - so it’s not some hidden site. He finally texted me and said he can’t find the location and that I should cancel. This was about 25 minutes after his arrival time. I cancelled and was charged $5.25 for the inconvenience to the driver. HE TOLD ME TO CANCEL THE RIDE. No matter the reason for the cancellation, the passenger is charged.  You guys should be ashamed. I’m using LYFT from now on
title: Why cancellation fee when driver says to cancel

review:
This is one of the best Uber rides I’ve had this guy was just unbelievable. Driver was awesome.

I’m up in Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, from Miami I got into a motorcycle accident, badly injured and in a wheelchair. have to be wheelchair-bound for a while, and when I called him he can’t pick me up super helpful from getting me from across the street to wheeling mature over locking me in and just making sure I was comfortable during the whole ride. This is the first time I’ve taking an Uber in a wheelchair, but I am extremely pleasantly surprised at how amazing the service was.
title: Wheelchair Accessible Uber and Driver

review: I have been in the city just overnight and used Uber four times getting back and forth from the Universe of Pennsylvania hospital to a hotel.  Of the 4 drivers all but one were fabulous. Courteous, friendly and their vehicles were clean. The first guy was very benign. Like a beige crayon. He didn’t help me with my suitcase, it was small, meaning he didn’t open his trunk or even ask if I “ had it” ..  I had to fumble 2 bags into the backseat. He spoke not a word. The other 3 the complete opposite. So I’m giving 4 stars for the fabulous drivers that are great at their job. Number 1 should work on his social skills.
title: I would have given 5 .. but…

review: I used the new app today since it was a while since I had used Uber . I found the app getting stuck , first as I tracked my  driver , then the route to the airport . It did work eventually just took a while ,but when my ride was over , there was no pop up screen to rate or tip my driver . It started on a new screen as if I wanted to book another ride . No tip box still , so I tipped in cash . Really my phone is not that old and I had no trouble before the new app .Of course later it reminded my I needed to tip as it didn’t know I tipped With cash .
title: Frozen app

review: This has probably been happening for longer than I knew. I live in Jersey City so I take regular trips into Manhattan for work. I noticed last week that I was charged $20 extra than the upfront price I was quoted for the trip. I complained and they refunded. Today, I took a trip into Manhattan and was charged $2 extra than the upfront price. I contacted support again and was told about their 3% surcharge for black cars. After discussing it with a few drivers, Uber is attempting to force NJ residents to pay extra simply because NJ drivers cannot pick up passengers once they are in NYC. They can only drop off. This seems like an issue they need to take up with the state instead of passing the issue along to passengers. I’d rather take a taxi than deal with these ever-changing prices.
title: Beware of shifting prices

review: I was an exclusive Uber user for the past four years (stupid I know). I wouldn’t use any other services but Uber only. Not anymore. Uber is the last resort due to deceptive pricing. On a one way trip I paid $18. For the same return trip the cost was $56. I know busy times can be expensive. But I know for a FACT they are not paying their Uber drivers 3x Base Pay during these busy hours (I used to drive for uber before) This is Uber using it’s popularity to rip it’s customers off. I actually started using their competitors app and have been liking it much more. They have improved a lot. The same return trip on the competitor app is HALF what Uber was charging. Always seek alternative options when booking trips. I’ll probably never use Uber again.
title: Don’t depend on it. Keep options open.

review:
I used Uber all the time.  Now the cars are gone.  Before entering your request, check to see if there are even any Uber cars on the rode.  My last drive from the airport cost me $86, and the driver didn’t speak english.  He also kept cancelling incoming requests.  Used to be $49.
