Most of the time I look, and at least the app now says cars unavailable.  A month ago I looked and only 2 cars on the road,  both over 40 min away.  They would probably cancel.
This used to be a great service….. Covid killed Uber in both Los Angeles and Sacramento.
title: Uber is gone

review: App works nice but I can’t use it because it’s too expensive! $20 for a 7 mile drive? Really? I normally drive 40 miles to drive from my house to work. They charge about $60 for 40 miles and that doesn’t even count taking the ride back after work. Imagine if something happened to my car and I was desperate to get to work, I’d have to pay $60 but even then their prices FLUCTUATE depending on the time or whatever. You also have to be careful because sometimes they don’t have any rides available! My car is having transmission issues and I don’t like to drive it except to get to work so for my birthday I wanted to go for a hike in a city about 50 or so miles away in the mountains. I go and check Uber  and they wanna charge about $90. $90 ONE WAY! This is so depressing.
title: Too expensive
developerResponse: {'id': 11418097, 'body': "Hey there, sorry to hear that you felt this way and have concerns with the fares. Please note that the trip fare is subjective to demand and supply in the area at the time. It constantly changes with the rise/fall in either factor. For further queries, reach out to us at t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2019-10-23T09:08:59Z'}

review: I live in a small-medium sized city and in the past never had a problem finding an Uber.  Now no matter the time of day I’m playing roulette getting where I need to go with Uber.  Tried the “schedule a ride” feature thinking “hey this will give drivers a head’s up that I’m looking to be picked up at a specific place and time”....WRONG.  All the feature seems to do is make a ride request for you at the time you scheduled.  Doesn’t seem to give advance notice to anyone, useless and misleading feature.  Uber needs to treat drivers better, because no one seems to want to drive for them anymore.  They came in the market, killed the taxi companies, and now they pay their drivers nothing and you can’t find a ride anywhere.  Thanks.
title: Uber has chased drivers away

review: I’ve been using Uber for a couple of years now and have never had an issue with the app untill recently. It took me a couple of tries just to schedule a ride and anytime i did it keeps telling me i already schelued one. So i look in the upcoming trips tab and i see nothing. So i go ahead and do the same thing to schedule a trip. Still the same thing, so I just decided to use a different service in order to get a trip to work. And later on when i go to check the upcoming trips tab on uber it suddenly had a trip scheduled. When it wasn’t shown earlier. I tried canceling it but it keeps giving me the “ something went wrong” measage.
title: Would be 5 stars if it weren’t for the lousy service

review: You can never talk to anyone and half the time when you have an issue you can’t even have it dealt with because it’s not on their list of issues. The canned responses from customer service are rude and it’s insulting when you spend so much money with a company that they take your feedback like it doesnt even matter. For a app that is supposed to help you all this app is is a waste of time and money. You’re better off getting a actual taxi. Although done do it through this app because they will show none available when other apps show them nearby. This companies dishonest, dirty and low down customer service practices are a disgrace. Don’t waste your time or money unless you just want to pay to be told you’re not important and your opinion doesn’t not matter.
title: pay to be told you don’t matter

review: Patiently waited for me to get to the car, spirit was so high, not knowing I have had the worst day, he asked permission to pray with me, which completely brought me to tears and spoke so much life into me, which completely turned my whole week around. I don’t normally have bad days, but this man was the perfect person to run into today I’m so grateful to have been in his presence, definitely the best experience I’ve had in a long time and it’s crazy because it was just a simple ride to the gas station. Thank you sooo much Sir 🥹
title: Best Driver I’ve came across hands down

review: I will never use Uber again. The last time I used this app, my car had broken down while my partner and I were traveling for the weekend. We had spent hours waiting for a tow and finding a shop in an unfamiliar town. We were relieved to find a driver to take us the remaining 45 minutes of our trip. Our driver was texting and calling his wife arguing the entire time. With 15 minutes in the trip remaining, he suddenly cancelled our ride and dropped us off at a closed police station. Since the police station was closed, and he refused to take us somewhere I could charge my phone to call for a new ride (mine had died), we were forced to walk a mile with all our belongings to a gas station. Uber refunded my trip, but I’ll never use Uber again.
title: Never again

review: I made a reservation for an X by mistake because that was what came up as your recommendation. The driver complained we should have requested an XL and would not take us unless we paid him $20 cash. It was very cold and we are 80 and I didn’t know how to get another car so I agreed. The trunk took ALL our 2 big and 2 small suitcases. The driver shouted at us until I told him to shut up. Was he drunk?  I don’t know. I would have given him the $20 as a cash tip but after he made us remove our own bags he would not accept the $20. Then it proved difficult to find where I could submit this note. I think the real issue was he did want to drive us to our home as he would not find a fare heading towards Downtown.
title: App is not helping

review: My wife and I were going to take a trip to Florida for a week. We decided to use Uber instead of driving to the airport. It was so convenient! We didn’t have to worry about parking at the airport. It always seems like the economy lot is full anyway. We got taken right to the door, and then, when we came back, the driver was less than two minutes away from the airport so we got a quick ride home. My wife has laid down the law that we are now taking Uber every time we need to go to the airport for a trip.🙂
title: Such convenience! ❤️

review:
Yesterday I took an Uber from RDU to home. I received an email asking me to “Rate or Tip” the driver. Clicked on the button and it took me to a page where it said I haven’t taken any rides lately. No activity. So no way to rate or tip and no way to contact anyone for help cleaning up my account. I
Also, the driver talked on her phone the entire trip. Often complaining about Uber and how rude they are for continuing to send her requests for rides even though she was suppose to be off duty. Deciding hotdogs we’re on the menu for dinner in great detail with her friend. Seriously?  I don’t need to hear it.  I guess I’ll have to use another company going forward.
title: Can’t Find A Live Person For Help

review:
After a driver who claimed they had room for 6 passengers showed up with a car that only had 3 seats available and after we waited 6 minutes longer than the estimated arrival time, AFTER we waited at least 5 minutes to be connected to a driver, we thought we’d give Uber 1 more chance, so we ordered another. The driver was such a jerk. We couldn’t find him so we called him multiple times and he never answered, 3 girls alone wondered around the street we finally located him and were met with the biggest attitude because he had to wait, we explained that we tried to call and he said I don’t answer unknown numbers. WHAT?! You have riders who are obviously waiting to be picked up and you choose not to answer calls? 
I’m so done with Uber.
title: Just took my last Uber ride ever.

review: What is the hiring process for uber? Last night my partner got me an uber and my driver (a white man) was telling a story about a woman with dementia calling his friend (who is also an uber driver) the n word. I heard him starting to allude to it and I was like “oh she called him the n word? That’s crazy.” To try to hurry the conversation along, and even after me, as a BLACK WOMAN, chose not to say it, he still proceeded to say the n word with a hard r…. thinking it was okay because of the story… I was so uncomfortable I didn’t even want to be in the car anymore. THIS IS STILL A JOB AND YOU STILL NEED TO BE PROFESSIONAL NO MATTER WHAT IS BEING DISCUSSED?  And then there’s no way for me to leave a comment after something like that. Uber only has a few options for complaints.
title: Hit or Miss drivers

review: Playing the tourist in Orlando this was my 2nd time using the app ever. It was super easy to update my years-old profile and get a ride.  I appreciate the many features designed to keep me informed so I could feel comfortable that the ride was coming and then on the right route to our destination. However, I almost double-tipped the driver. When checking my receipt, there was the same “Add a tip” option that I had used while riding.  I did some quick math to be sure that I didn’t mess up during the ride. When my charge includes a tip, the option should be to “Change” the tip, not “Add”.
title: Near perfect

review: The drivers are great and I've never had an issue. The only problem is the customer service from Uber is ridiculous because it’s only a messaging feature through the app, they don’t have a way to call in. I have an Amex platinum and you are supposed to get $15 of Uber cash a month. I didn’t get it for the month of September or October because of a bug issue in the app that automatically “unenrolled” me from the benefit. They will not reimburse me on the cash I missed out on because it’s not supposed to “roll over”. They also automatically close out the support ticket and transfer you to a new support person every time. Absolutely unprofessional and frustrating.
title: Great Drivers… Terrible customer service

review: I was generally satisfied with the service but recently i had an event where Uber charged $150 to my ride without a prior checking or warning, initially saying it was for a surcharge for NYC congestion. After a few emails back and forth, it turned out eventually that the driver claimed I caused a mess with a dog and what looked as its pee, which had nothing to do with my short ride to an airport.  The whole process took a few days to get the credit card charge reversed and required a significant amount of time to find out what’s going on and resolve the situation. The interactions I had with the customer reps was also kinda argumentative and assuming of my fault. I have been a loyal customer to this service since it’s early days but it’s time to give Lyft a try.
title: Uber not good to customers anymore

review: Was in City Center Philadelphia, making a quick one day turn-around visit from DC. Went to get a cab for return to 30th Street Station, with about 50 minutes before departure. No taxis!!! Went to my hotel’s valet for assistance, and he said it would take 10-15 minutes, maybe 1/2 hour for a car to arrive. That was not a viable option, so pulled up Uber app. Driver arrived 4 minutes later, dropping off an arriving guest and taking me to the station. EXTREMELY pleasant driver, had great conversation. Arrived with PLENTY of time to spare, and a nice memory of my Uber ride. Thank you!
title: Rescue!

review: At 12:50pm I ordered a burrito from a local restaurant with an expected delivery time of 1hr. After waiting 1hr the order was “cancelled” without warning or notice or even a reason. The app said the order was canceled before the food was prepared. However, I called the restaurant who mentioned the order was actually made and was picked up by the driver. The driver was 5 minutes away when order just disappeared. I didn’t get to eat my lunch at work and had to go the whole day without eating because of this. There is no way to reach customer support and the app doesn’t acknowledge the fact the driver just didn’t deliver. All my co workers use DoorDash. I’m going to delete this app and use another food delivery service. Would rate 0 stars if I could.
title: Failed delivery after waiting an hour.

review: Problems at Uber. Have used Uber several years without a problem. My last 2 trips were from the airport to home. In both cases I was quoted an agreeable price and as soon as I accepted the quoted price the price doubled because of “congestion”. In both cases I asked the driver if he had been subject to unusual congestion and was told no.   I have been at IAH when it was busy and you had to be careful to chose the right cars and in these instances there was no congestion charge. The 2 trips in question suffered no congestion at the pickup or in progress. Both drivers saw no exceptional traffic. I’m using this platform to raise the issue because Uber has no means to contest the errant application of congestion charges. I’ll give them a chance to correct their errors before I remove the app. Tomorrow I’ll be taking Lyft for the first time.
title: Problems at Uber
developerResponse: {'id': 3720734, 'body': "HI, this doesn't sound right. Let's connect. Please send a note to t.uber.com/contact so we can follow up with you.", 'modified': '2018-06-05T04:37:28Z'}

review: Very dissatisfied. I recently downloaded this app and had to cancel my first trip and pay a cancellation fee because the Uber map kept taking my driver to the wrong place and he couldn’t find us. Secondly, the app charged me $25 for a pass I never even signed up for. Now I typically don’t write reviews, however getting ahold of Uber’s customer service is absolutely impossible. The email they give you bounces back, doesn’t even work. They don’t have a phone number I can call to take care of this issue privately, therefore I have resorted to writing this review. Please have someone cancel this transaction that I did NOT agree too. I will definitely be disputing this charge with my bank, as well as deleting my Uber account once this is taken care of.
title: Charging transactions I did NOT approve of. Customer support does not exist

review: Honestly I’m used to using Lyft and only Uber sometimes because I thought Lyft was less expensive. I started using Uber a lot more since July 2023 and over the past 3 months I noticed a huge difference in the drivers, timing on arrivals, and everything else when compared to Lyft. I love grown to truly love Uber because of the convenience it gives me on showing up on time while going to work every morning to the airport. I’ve never waited over 3 minutes to get picked up for a ride, that’s what I love most!
title: Most convenient app ever for rides!

review:
I love Uber and sometimes even though Lyft is cheaper, Uber has more bonfires and with the membership you save money on rides and Uber eats too. I can’t drive cause I’m disabled so Uber is like my life line. I know Uber came along way since they started. They have it know where they show you the license plate number to ensue your getting in the correct car along
With the car type and model and photo of it as well as the name of the driver. Uber eats can be pricy but you can get discount codes to save money and free delivery
title: Been using them for over 5 years

review: This is like the 3rd time I’ve had a random $9.99 charge on my account a WEEK after taking a Uber. They make it extremely difficult to contact an actual person through support without having to call. Took a $52 trip then if you click on the receipt it pops up and says $62 and shows a 8.99 booking fee like what?? Then a week later I’m getting charged a additional 9.99 which I’m assuming is bc I changed my drop off destination during the ride but hellloooo you I was charged extra for the extra distance and you’re trying to charge I’m guessing a cancelation fee for the original address being changed?? That’s straight robbery. I will be calling y’all today. I’ll never be using Uber again. I guarantee it.
title: Random charges and no way to contact support!!!

review: As a long-time victim of the same group of stalkers I know that stalkers can mess up the drivers’ GPS.   They seem to be able to choose drivers who are farther away from me in order to increase my wait times as well.  These same stalkers have caused a few different drivers to leave me at a stop when I am already scheduled with multiple ones on the Uber app.     Drivers have taken off before waiting as little as 3 minutes even when I have verbally confirmed that I will be returning to the car in less than 15 minutes. This is potentially dangerous for any passenger.
title: Not Stalker Proof

review: This guy is awesome.  I’m at a fraternity convention, I run into a brother who survives quite nicely in a wheel chair with cerebral palsy headed to the airport and we share a ride.  Our driver went over and above by helping my brother into his vehicle…including helping pick my friend up from the ground on a mishap that I caused.  Even if I would have done really well at the tables, there’s no amount of tip money anyone could give to repay this gentleman for this moment in time!  I continue to be blown away by God’s love and sending this man to this place at exactly the right time!
title: Over and above the call!

review:
The driver was prompt and nice so no problems there. I’ve never used Uber so I guess it’s my fault (again no way of knowing because no way to call them or send a message). I was charged a $22 “reservation fee” on top of my trip that there was no I don’t know if this is for all their rides or I did something wrong by picking a time 20 min from when I asked for the pick up. I didn’t see anything about this fee and the ride I picked said it would be about $22 for the 12 minute ride. I was charged $53. I feel like I should tip even though the receipt says my driver got $35 for a 12 minute ride. 

This is probably my fault but there is NO WAY to call and ask or send them a message to ask. 

I guess it was a $53 lesson not to use them again.
title: So discouraging no way to contact them

review: Love that it’s available everywhere I’ve traveled to internationally. It’s saved me a few times when I wasn’t aware that it’s available in those countries! So convenient and provides peace of mind when you can’t speak the languages of the countries you’re visiting. I also appreciate the safety PIN feature. There are sometimes hiccups with payments not working and it’s annoying to deal with in the moment when you’re looking for a ride but overall it’s an app that I can’t live without!
title: Can’t travel without this app!

review: The driver was fantastic very personable and very customer service oriented. However, Uber overall is unfortunately not terribly reliable. They went through three drivers before they got to the driver they sent. I kept getting messages that my ride had been assigned to a different person at least three times within an hour and 15 minutes. They are not bad if you need them early in the morning, but late in the evening after for quite a few of the drivers have difficulty finding addresses even after you call them or text them, but having said that the driver today was absolutely fantastic.
title: Mostly Great

review: I looked up a location that I needed to Uber to. I looked at the app twice waited 30 mins getting ready. I finally was ready to leave around 7 it was $40. Originally when I looked at the app it was a $14 dollar Uber ride. Mind you this wasn’t to a packed or busy location. I understand if this was a concert or venue but this was just a normal night. Uber said it was due to more traffic then usual. My girlfriend told me she would check Lyft and when she did it was $14. We booked it right, please reference other apps Ubers tries to rip you off when you leave the bar. They take more then half from the drivers. There’s a 90% chance I won’t be using Uber again unless it’s a lot less then the Lyft.
title: Price increase

review: It’s really kinda criminal how little they pay their drivers for food delivery. They exploit the law to avoid paying minimum wage. If they had to their argument might be that prices would go up, and that is okay. It’s better than having a workforce of foreigners from other countries that are okay with accepting 3 dollars an hour. I hope the legislation changes soon and exploitive companies like this one cannot pay such extremely low wages below even the federal minimum wage. Do yourself a favor and delete the app and find something else for work. They’re just gonna keep lowering the bar on pay until they’re paying cents per hour to drivers because our government is slower than molasses when it comes to regulating them.
title: They pay their drivers 3-5 dollars an hour

review: Uber needs to perfect their pickup service. They always put pickup location as near this or near that. And when you try to pin your exact location, they don’t allow it. Making it hard for a driver to find the rider, also wasting both parties time. Before a rider can redirect a driver, the rider is already late to their destination. Just because I’m inside my room when I order a ride doesn’t mean you should pin my window or backyard as my pickup location. I can’t jump off my balcony or window just to get a ride. Allow us a feature to choose what our pick up location is. Get rid of the near here location , it’s crap
title: Pick up

review: I get things delivered from this place a lot, and every single time I have at least one problem. Either they got the timing way off, forgot something, my food is in horrible condition, or they don’t even deliver it. Today was my last straw when I placed an order for chipoltle and saw that the total was way higher than I wanted it to be so I tried to go and cancel the order but every time I tried clicking the help button, it never worked. tried restarting my phone, reloading the app loads of times, and even reloading my wifi but the help button didn’t work, so I was stuck with an order I no longer wanted. It was very frustrating, and they need to do better.
title: Horrible customer service

review:
Trying to schedule a pick up from the airport is a maddening experience. I can appreciate that adding flight information helps. The driver in the event of flight is delayed, but I that I can’t override that is absolutely ridiculous and a prime example of over engineering. All that like to do is return a rental car and then get a ride home. unfortunately, I’ve been fighting with the app for the last 10 minutes and have decided that it’s not worth the trouble.
What’s the sense of such limiting design? I haven’t begun to question what Uber does with flight information, how and for how long is it stored, and whether or not, it’s resold.
I don’t understand engineering that creates unfriendly user experiences. Being helpful is good. Deciding there is only one correct way to interact with software is shortsighted.
title: TMI

review: Well I’ve used this app quite a few times when I need drop the company’s vehicle off at maintenance shops and/or to pick them up. Today; I just dropped a vehicle off and now the app is having issues processing my payment. Mind you I had enter a new card since I had lost my wallet awhile ago. First before I could enter the information “add credit/debit” option isn’t even available so just improvising I just resetted my phone. The option became available then however when I tried to enter my card it’s not processing it. I tried my other bank cards and it’s saying the same so in the past almost 45 mins I’ve been stranded still trying to get it to work. Thanks Uber.
title: Processing issues…Stranded

review: I went to the Dolphins/Steelers game on October 23, 2022 in Miami and had to use Uber several times to get around. I had a very bad experience. When trying to get an Uber some of the drivers did not speak English so that was very frustrating. Other drivers could not find me even after I gave then the exact address or told them what I was wearing so they could easily find me. The other problem I had was the drop off and pick up spots. I don’t understand why the app can’t make it so the driver can pick you up exactly where you are. You shouldn’t have to go to a pickup point to meet the driver. Don’t use this app if you don’t have to. There’s lots of things wrong with it and improvements need to be made
title: Review

review:
My review is related to a recent trip I took in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. I took uber to meet friends at a restaurant. I did not have change so i handed the driver a 500 riyal bill ($133). He said he will get some change from the gas station. He never returned. Unfortunately i did not have any internet data to get back on the app. I figured i don't need to worry since its Uber and it will be taken care of. 

The worst part is the customer service provided by Uber. I contacted them to report the issue and they came with a generic message on the app saying this issue cannot be resolved. There is no customer care phone number that i can contact. 

My last time using Uber. Beware of scam drivers on the app. Never in my imagination did i think this would happen on uber but i was proved wrong.
title: Scam drivers

review: The app made various charges for an extra scheduling fee for $10 and $2 for reservation fee when before I would always schedule the same ride for $7 and no reservation fee. Then they also made a $25 extra fee for re touting my Uber because there was a construction going on which is not my problem but Uber’s. I would have been ok if they had mentioned or warned me of these extra charges before because I was supposing the fee of the whole ride would me at most $8 like it always is and not $44 which is an exaggerated amount for what I always pay for. I tried working with Uber support but they were useless and just gave explications on how there are charges for everything basically.
title: USE AT YOUR OWN RISK

review:
My husband needed food before going to work, I placed an order and was notified at the end of the checkout that the latest arrival time would be way too late for us (1:20pm -2:05pm) so immediately sent a cancel request only to find out from the rep if I cancel I would be charged the full amount… I explained the situation to the rep who stated that “I understand your disappointment
over this matter. Since we have
already informed you about the
resolution that we could offer. we
are closing this chat here. Please
feel free to contact us for any
further queries or assistance.” 

Basically saying that there’s nothing to do and deal with it… this is a UI issue also a disclosure issue… let people know the time the latest time of arrival before hand please also that once you place an order there is no refunds even if you cancel less than a minute later. Ps. Possible UX solution could be hitting an undo button or cancel for 1 minute (back end: delay order placing by 1 minute). Thank you!
title: Canceled orders will still be charged

review: After my great $50 Uber ride Uber asked if I wanted to tip driver. I chose a $5 tip. Apparently I entered incorrect amount bc I was notified by Uber that I had tipped $50 instead of $5.  The Uber app says tips cannot be decreased once entered. There is no customer contact at Uber to help customers rectify the tip  situation. When I spoke w my credit card company to dispute the tip charge the credit card company said ‘ if I file a dispute with Uber, Uber will cancel my account’. This comes across as Uber considers itself a monopoly and lends into a bullying policy over customer satisfaction. So conclusion is that my Uber driver received a great tip, of which I’m glad, and I learned the lack of customer care behind Uber. I will no longer be using Uber and will enlighten others to Ubers lack of customer satisfaction.
title: Uber’s lack of customer satisfaction

review:
Generally speaking the app is fine, but I put 2 stars because it’s impossible to talk to anyone. 
When I got my account hacked, it took a week of back and forth emails to resolve the situation when it would have been much more effective if I had been able to chat or talked to someone. It ended up being solved but it was very poorly handled. Felt like I was being asked questions by a robot, not a person who could get and integrate various info. Same when there was an issue with a ride. You can contest but then they make a computer-based decision and you have to deal with it. On the last one I understand they want to be efficient but as a customer it doesn’t feel right.
title: Impossible to contact Uber

review: So I have spent over two years trying to get my email address changed. Every 3 to 6 months I send another request to change my email address and they give me the token response of they are working on it. Now I find out that they have gotten rid of the family profile so when a member of my family takes a ride, I have no idea where they went, how much they paid or if they are safe at all. The devs obviously have no idea how to program an application at all. I don’t expect a response from anybody at Uber because the only thing that they seem to be able to say is they are working on it. Well in the real world, every single one of those people should be fired since they’re totally incompetent to do anything.
title: Customer support and Devs are a joke

review:
I have numerous problems with the app for more than a year, contacted support via in-App help and still no response for 7 months!!

1) At some point in time, Uber switched my account to “driver”, while I never intend to become one. Now I can’t change my photo and get wrong advertisement messages (“prices increased in your region, hooray!” 🤦🏻‍♂️) Support just ignores the request to deal with this, and it’s no way to reach actual human for resolution

2) Years ago I’ve setup family profile, to pay for my family’s trips. While the feature works, any options to change settings simply disappeared from the app! I neither see list of my profiles, nor am I able to change their preferences. Again, support message is simply ignored by Uber.

3) From usability stand point, when you enter address, the street is auto-suggested, but when you click on the proposed variant, the field looses focus. To enter the house number you need to retype the street again. Very frustrating!

In general, the app is ok while it works, but should you have any problems, you feel absolutely alone with your problems, and no one to help.
title: Customer Service Ignores You

review: I so far have taken two trips with Uber. The first one went fine, even considering my driver missed his turn but took the next one. No problems there. The main issue and the reason I’m writing a review is that on our way back to the hotel, the address Uber put in was incorrect. I put in Holiday inn express and the app took us to an different nearby inn. Had my dad not been in the car we wouldn’t have been able to communicate with our Cuban driver that the location he was taking us to was wrong. The driver was fantastic and took us to the correct hotel after having to dig up the hotels actual address. I have a screenshot that proves that the location of the Holiday Inn was entirely false.
title: Destination issue

review: When I started using the app it was fine I only used one time and I was going to use it lot about a week later Uber charged me about something and it wasn’t for the Uber job where someone picks you up and after that the money you oh automatically gives it to them but it charged me for something else besides that I know that Uber should deserves 4 or 5 star but I kept on getting charged for something beside when they pick you up I don’t really know what was going on so I delete-Ed the app you should what they are going to charge you for but these weren’t things about the person picking you up, so sorry but you need to stop downloading this app because it’s going to give you hidden receipts
title: Money

review: I ordered from Uber eats of the Uber app. After getting my order several days later I went into my bank account and noticed that Uber charged me twice on two separate days for the same amount. My order was placed on December 31, the first transaction was on January 2, and the second transaction was on January 4. When trying to contact Uber to get my refund of at least one of the transactions. My help options were very limited in fact I couldn’t even find anywhere where it says contact us. I’ve never had any trouble with Uber or Uber eats before I don’t know what happened with this transaction. But the customer service is absolutely ridiculous. I still have not received a refund for one of the transactions that hit my bank account.
title: There is no way to talk to an actual human when you need help.

review:
It was very congested at the airport. I was looking for the driver’s car and the license plate. I walked up and down the sidewalk looking for him. He was patient and was about to leave. I did not know how to message him and turn on notifications so that he’d know where I was.
Something changed with Uber’s setup.
I use to track the Uber as it headed towards me.
Finally I asked him where he was and we found each other.
I was very appreciative. Do understand it is very difficult to stand in Zone 8 with a lot of people and cars.🚙
title: Driver waited for me at airport

review:
Tried to book a trip in advance by 4 days. Went through booking process but did not find option for date and time of pickup. Trying to reserve dispatched a driver immediately. Could not find a way to cancel trip. The driver was very polite but told me that he must complete the trip before he is eligible for another pickup. I told him to finish the trip so that he could get paid and be able to get to another ride. 
Organization of website should allow review of order before commitment is made. Both the driver and myself are victims of this lack and driver would have been in an impossible position if I had not let him do trip without me. 
Allowing review of order should be done by Uber before it is forced to do so by legislation or litigation.
title: First use of Zuber

review: I ordered $90 worth of food on Uber eats, immediately cancelled and reordered due to putting in the wrong address (where I previously delivered to)- within a time span of a few seconds. I immediately contacted support, but they refused to only charge me once and instead charged me twice (although I only received food for one order). I ended up doing a charge back through my card, which was granted. Now when I use Uber, they won’t let me call a car until I clear these charges. I ended up downloading and using Lyft instead for the first time. Makes no sense to bar a well paying customer for years from continuing to purchase because of an error that the user should be able to rectify within the app within a short time frame.
title: What happened?

review: I requested a pick up at DFW airport. The driver that was assigned initially showed as being 7 minutes away. After waiting 15 minutes and seeing the driver very close to my location I called to confirm my pick up location. The driver who answered did not speak English and was unable to communicate!!! I tried to cancel the request and Uber wanted to charge me a fee. After waiting another 15 minutes and calling back again a new driver was assigned. I’m not sure if the driver canceled or if my first request timed out. The second driver dropped me off at the wrong address so after a long day of travel me and my young child had to walk a block to the correct address in an unfamiliar area. HORRIBLE experience.
title: Driver lost, unable to communicate, wrong drop off location!!!

review:
I’m consistently disappointed with Uber. I’ve used it while living in three major US cities and while traveling. Over the years I’ve noticed a decline not only in drive quality (drivers, cars used, routes taken) but also Uber’s support team. The drivers don’t seem to know how to work the app, as I’ve had issues where my driver forgets to end the ride and charges me all the way to their next pick-up. As for Uber support, it’s virtually impossible to provide them with insight on your concerns unless it fits into their limited, multiple choice options of feedback.

In short, I’m done. I’m tired of trying to report ride errors and throwing my money away. Uber has shown no efforts to better their support to drivers and customers soooo… get Lyft.
title: TLDR… this app can bite me.

review: I use Uber to get to work during the pandemic shutdown. Getting a ride to work on time did happen; however, of late, I've been late to work every day even with scheduled rides way ahead of time. I finally had to find a neighbor that can take me. Don't get me wrong the drivers are nice and appreciated, but when I have to constantly deduct time for being late and getting in trouble I had to do what is best for me. I would not use this service for getting to work, but it is good for casual rides.
title: Not for people who need to get to work on time
developerResponse: {'id': 12225058, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry to hear about your concern regarding the fare. We'd like to sort this out for you. Hence, we would really appreciate it if you could send out a description of this with details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll look into it.", 'modified': '2019-12-05T08:36:57Z'}

review: I have been using Uber frequently for a decade. However for the last 6 months the service has become almost unusable. I frequently have drivers accept the ride then cancel it - often 3, 4 or 5 times before I actually get a driver. Once it happened 8 times in a row in downtown DC. And by then I’ve waited 30 or more minutes with all the drivers accepting then canceling the rides. Also the wait times have gotten much longer especially where I live in the suburbs. Several times I’ve given up after waiting for a ride for 20 to 30 minutes and I walk it take the Metro. Either way - this rating is not for the app which is great - it’s for the service overall which I can no longer rely on for transportation.
title: Unreliable and increasingly unusable

review: I’ve done gotten Uber so many times and every time I have I paid the price they charge me I paid $46 bucks yesterday to catch a Uber then later on that day they charge me 58 bucks for the same ride they’ve done this so many times to me it’s to the point I’m getting a lawyer to see can I file a lawsuit because it’s not fair charging someone the price they see and then Uber switch it up and charge way more and then will take the money out your bank account with your permission or saying anything to you it’s to the point there go lose alot of people because they will double charge you for one ride. That’s not fair to anyone they will update payments the next day after you’ve paid for a ride so know they scamming people out of money
title: Uber will crew you over

review: I’ve tried to schedule a trip and the app informed it wasn’t confirmed, that it would inform me when a driver accepted it, what didn’t happen. Before the time scheduled I opened the app and there was no register of the trip I tried to scheduled on “my trips” and on the part to schedule a trip. Then, I’ve received a notification from my bank that I was charged for a cancelled trip that the app never confirmed. I’ve searched the app for a means to report what has happened but there is no suitable place to do it, as the app per se would never present bugs.
title: Scheduled trip not confirmed nor notified, but charged cancellation

review: Uber has gone downhill. I have been using Uber for years now both to catch rides and get food from Uber eats as well. I have had a solid 5 star rating. Apparently drivers can lie about whether you wore a mask in the car or not and ruin your rating. I had a solid 5 star rating for the past two years until this month when a driver reported me for not wearing a mask in the car. I WAS WEARING ONE the entire time and not touching it either. I take the pandemic extremely seriously, given I am immunocompromised. I don’t know if the driver was jealous of my perfect rating or what but because of him, he ruined my rating. Absolute crap. Thanks Uber for letting this type of stuff happen. Several customers have complained about this. Guess it’s time to switch to Lyft and Doordash.
title: Absolute crap

review: I’d say 80% of rides I go on are decent, never special, but decent. But after this most recent one I find myself incredibly disappointed in Uber and will likely be using Lyft as my primary in the future. The driver never offered air conditioning during his ride, only played music in Hindi (a language I don’t speak), and, to top it off, I still left a 20% and five starred him to be nice and his version of thanks? Lying about me not wearing a mask. I had a fellow passenger with me who was willing to confirm I was wearing a mask but even after his malicious lying I still have not been giving the opportunity to rate him accordingly or rescind my tip. I see now why he is one of the worst rated drivers I’ve ever seen. Morale of the story? Just go use Lyft.
title: Dubious Drivers

review: Uber drive keeps charging me for an issue that I've had with UBER EATS since January.  I had an issue where food was never delivered, therefore they were supposed to give me a credit which is stated numerous times in a customer service chat but the credit was never given.  I had to have my bank reverse the charges.  But then when I would order an Uber car it charged the amount that was supposed to be credited to me and actually canceled the car even though I received a confirmation that the car was ordered and I never knew the car was canceled until I was left waiting and then late for work because the car never came.  I am still trying to resolve this issue.  They have charged me 3 times now.  Needless to say I am furious!
title: Terrible Customer service

review:
Have been using Uber for years. Recently noticed I was being charged $25 / month. 

After spending an hour trying to figure out how to contact someone at support (it’s almost impossible to find), through one of the FAQ’s I found a support chat option (in an unrelated topic). 

The rep confirmed I had been subscribed to Uber Pass for the last 6 months. I don’t know what Uber pass is, don’t know what it’s for, don’t know how or why I was being charged for it. I hadn’t used Uber once, let alone this service (whatever it is) for the last 6 months as well. 

All they said was they would refund one payment.

To me, that seems wrong.  Didn’t know I was being charged, and hadn’t used it once. What was I charged for? But they can refund me for one month? Why not.. 2? Or 3? Nope, just one. 

I’ve been using Uber for probably 8 years. Spent hundreds of dollars. No recognition of that. They’d rather keep their $100+ from an unused Uber pass subscription, then keep you as a lifetime customer. 

I’m guessing I must have checked some box at some point which triggered it. Sneaky move Uber!
title: BEWARE OF UBER PASS.

review:
I recently relocated to Los Angeles there’s literally going to be at least 2-3 drivers that cancel your ride before you can actually get one. Legit every time I use Uber I have multiple drivers cancel on me before I can finally book my ride. As I write this I’m on my 3rd driver and have been sitting on La Brea Ave in the same spot for over an hour and my Uber is completing another trip. Hopefully this one doesn’t cancel after like the first 2 or try to get me to cancel so they can avoid a fee. Some drivers even say they showed up and waited despite not being there just so they can collect the fee 
I don’t know what’s going on w LA but , getting a uber out here is like pulling teeth or finding a needle in a haystack. Shortage of drivers ? 😩 idk but it’s very frustrating and inconvenient
title: Is Uber dying ?

review: My driver never showed up to pick me, however, he drove toward my direction and sat “nearby” for 5 to 10 minutes. I called my Uber multiple times all to no response he cancelled my ride and I was charge a cancellation fee. I had to navigate through the “help” which was very unhelpful. I understand the cancellation fee is to make up for gas and time lost. This was unusually case, I felt like I just got cheated. I was unable to get proper assistance for days. I have a 96 rating on Uber and have been a customer for years. I couldn’t speak to a representative or even get my money sent back to my account. I was finally given a refund in Uber cash. Uber cash. If this is the assistance I’ll receive when I run into issues they could keep the Uber cash I’ll go to lift.
title: Horrible customer services

review: Just like for us who pay if we cancel mid way through from ordering our trip we still get charged for wasting the drivers time to get to us, there should be consequences for Uber drivers as well. There’s been multiple times where a few drivers have failed me(like getting to work late) and just like today another Uber driver failed me. They were making a trip nearby but close to my location shouldn’t be a problem by the looks of it I was clearly at least 3-5mins away and all the sudden the Uber driver just canceled the trip on me. I was counting on that ride because i ordered on time to take  me to work and now I’m real late and it doesn’t show the history of the driver who accepted it so I can’t give them 1 star either
title: Consequences for Drivers too

review: I've been an uber driver for almost 2 yrs now and i had to renew my papers. My mechanic filled up my form for the vehicle inspection and put on the wrong date so he just made a little erasure to correct it. And this guys banned my account for that reason. I told them i have receipt for proof to show that its real but they still went and banned my account. The next day I went back to my mechanic to fill out a new form with the correct details but nothing has happened still. I contacted them a lot of times and they keep telling me the same thing to wait 3-5 days to review my account its been 2 weeks and nothing has happened still. Whats the point of being a gold driver and having support 24hrs if they can't even help you.
title: This guys dont care about their drivers

review: I’ve always had my own car, so I never had to use Uber before unfortunately I got hit and my car got totaled so the past week I had to use Uber for the first time ever I can honestly say every driver I got was great not one complaint all the cars were extremely clean some drivers had complementary beverages. My first Uber driver actually asked me if I wanted a bag of chips and a drink while he was at the gas station pumping gas which I politely declined. In a nutshell unbelievable service in every way possible thank you
title: No complaints at all

review: They prices I see are always higher on my account then my girlfriends and I use mine more then her. Everyday I use Uber to go to and from work and if the driver decides to take the gps route shown, I’d sit in traffic for longer then needed then get charged for it and some drivers don’t like for you to tell them where to turn to avoid the traffic. Another thing is I get dropped off at my location but for some reason the ride is still going and get I charged extra! If this happens to many times they tell you you’ve reached your limit. They are scamming people out of their hard earned money. They need to do a better job at training their drivers and stop stealing from people.
title: This app is horrible especially with all the money I spent on it

review: I have been using Uber for YEARS and almost on every vacation I went on. Though I had an incident in Egypt that will never make me want to use Uber again. Our ride in Cairo, Egypt was cancelled 3 times by the system and it kept glitching and they kept charging me. Then when we finally got into an Uber, our ride canceled in the middle of the highway and I know our driver did not cancel it because I was watching him the whole time. (This also happened to my family when we met with them.) Our driver almost kicked us out in the middle of the highway and where forced to pay cash. I tried calling Uber and chatting with them but no one could help me. I even tried for days after to see if I could get answers and no one would help me.
title: Horrible Customer Service

review:
I took some time away from using the Uber app for my transportation needs (about 4 years) as their taxes and fees were increasing drastically. I was not a fan of paying the increase in fees on top of the cost for my ride, but I just got back on Uber and I am enjoying it thus far.

Uber’s customer service team is exceptional. Whenever I need assistance or to address a complaint I always receive a prompt response. I appreciate this. However, they can work on their interface. The Uber app is a bit confusing to navigate and can be refined to combat this issue.
title: Back on Uber After Some Time Away

review: I have my preferences set at 3.5 miles for food delivery and the Uber app constantly gives me trips that are 9-10 miles away with no tips. Basically I have to reject those trips or I won’t be able to make a living. On top of that I’ll reject the trip once and 2 seconds later I’ll see the same trip pop up again and I’ll have to reject a second time and that causes my acceptance rating to go even lower. Rejecting the same trip 2 times in a row shouldn’t  go towards your acceptance rating!! This is why the acceptance rating is a joke!! They should even have a acceptance rating column period because Ubers whole system is fraud. Makes it seems like a scam to trip and manipulate drivers into picking up orders they can’t possibly make a living on!
title: Terrible trip requests

review:
I don’t drive and haven’t for over  6 years and rely on Uber and Lyft for my only means of transportation. 
I was having a horrible day, tracking for work and missed my flight and my debit card wasn’t working right.
James picked me up and immediately made me laugh. He continued to make me laugh and forget about all my problems and stress and for that 15 minutes I was laughing, at peace, not stressed, and just interacting with a fellow human in real time in the real world- not through social media or my head in my phone. Just two strangers talking. 
This was the best ride I have ever taken with a driving service. Ever. 
I work as a medical director and hire and fire and understand what a successful business needs to grow and remain profitable. It’s good employees.
James should be recognized for how he represents Uber, and also specifically why. 
Best and shortest ride. Maximize your use of an employee and quality person like him.
title: James “bond”

review: As a longtime customer in one of your largest markets, NYC, I am appalled at how awful my customer service experience was the first time I had an issue that needed resolving. I was mistakenly double charged for a ride, submitted proof of this overage, and have had to go back and forth through the app messaging service while being bounced around to different agents and/or bots trying to resolve this issue. It’s been 24 hours and it is still not resolved. I just keep getting the same line about “fees, booking fees, and tolls” which isn’t the issue. It’s ridiculous that Uber doesn’t authorize agents to refund money to customers in good standing quickly. Why pay for the convenience of Uber at all if this is the way they treat valued customers?!
title: App works great, customer service is terrible!

review:
Reserved a ride the day before. The morning of the app informed me that Michael was on his way. The app then told us he was running late. We waited anxiously for our tide to the airport at 6 am in the cold Grand Rapids street.  Finally I called Michael who informed me he was not coming! I canceled and got Sergio. I called him he said he was on his way.  It soon after I was dropped and Kristina ended up picking us up. She was a professional and got us to the airport on time. The hilarious part is I got charged a $33 cancellation fee for canceling Michael! Bogus bull. I will be working to get a refund. 
Freshdog617
title: Will seek refund

review:
I’ve had no problems with Uber in other countries, but in India there are a number of problems. There isn’t a way for me to contact Uber so I’m writing this review …
1- drivers accept the trip request, then cancel after 5 or 10 minutes. This is a waste of my time. Then I have to start again. 
2- after accepting the trip request they call and ask where I’m going. Don’t they get this information before accepting my request? 
3- Sometimes they accept the request but don’t show up. When I cancel I get charged. This has happened a few times, and again is a waste of my time. 
4- I have had a few drivers request more money than Uber quoted me. This evening I booked a ride and when I met the driver he asked for more than twice the rate. Since it was evening I was willing to pay 1.5x rate, but I refused to pay more than double. I had to cancel the request and got charged a cancellation fee. 

I know things are different here in India, but using Uber has been a hassle on multiple occasions.
title: Uber India is a joke

review: He tried to drop me off at the wrong address and continued to argue that it was the right address 6297 however I was going to the next complex 6280. He parked the car and told me to get out. It was dark and I am 79 years old so I told him no he could not leave me stranded in the dark. He used a few inappropriate words again telling me to get out. I finally convinced him to go to the front where the complex addresses were posted. He then went one complex over to finally get me to the correct address.  It took about 10 minutes to convince him and I was scared because he was a big man I wasn’t sure what he might do. He should NOT be driving for Uber. I tried to give him one star but 5 stars was already filled in by someone else.  Whoknew33
title: Previous trip with Christian

review: The last driver we had was excellent.  He was courteous and very helpful since I was traveling with two people that needed assistance in and out of the car.  However, my experience with Uber was not always good.  A couple of times, including one today, that Uber drivers would simply cancel or disappeared without any reason given.  I would see the cars on the map coming toward my location at first but they would start to turn into an opposite and went farther and farther away.  For this reason,  I hesitated to use Uber, especially for any time sensitive appointments.
title: Unpredictable

review:
I reserved a black car to airport the day before.   I was assigned a driver,   At the appointed time he was about 30 minutes away. I cancelled and took a cab— and had difficult time getting fare cancelled.  Very hard to get response from complaint , but finally refunded.  Uber advertised that if black car is reserved and is late, they give you $50 credit.  Good luck ever getting that since Uber has ignored that request with no response.
Uber is fine when it works but is bad a dealing with the times it does not work.
title: Don’t count on a reserved ride

review: I don’t use this app much. I’d rather walk two hours than deal with drivers who yell at you for their own mistakes. There’s no parking at the front of my house and I make sure to tell them but they don’t ever listen and I’ve got yelled at for “not informing them” of the parking situation. One Uber driver refused to let me out of his car one time because his phone was acting up and had trouble processing the payment my friend used. I didn’t pay for that ride, a FRIEND DID and that Uber driver refused to let me out. Just recently I had to call an Uber for me a and my bf. I had forgot my jacket cause everything else I had with. I’ve contacted the Uber driver several times to get my $40 jacket and my $40 earbuds back and he refuses to contact me or my bf.
title: Confusing and I hope you like getting yelled

review: The drivers I have interacted with at Uber have all been very courteous and professional. The customer service is terrible. I received multiple texts from the usual Uber number stating that my driver was arriving. I had not requested a ride. I tried to contact Uber. The only method to do so is to contact their safety issues line. They have no sense of urgency when it comes to telling you if your account has been compromised. I was told someone would get back to me sometime in the future, but could not tell me when. With all of the data breaches happening now it is not worth working with a company that does not follow up immediately on potential security threats. I’m going back to calling cabs. Convenience is not worth what this could cost.
title: Poor Customer Service

review:
When this ap first came out it was such a welcome change from the poor service I was getting from yellow cab. Today, I can’t say uber is much better than the old lazy taxis. 

When there are regularly no cars available—or worse, when I wait 15 minutes for a ride only to realize that the driver isn’t coming at all and just wants me to cancel—one is left wondering if there is any advantage to this ap anymore. And by the way, their main competitor isn’t much better. 

I’d gladly pay more for reliability. For now I’ll be looking for an alternative to uber. I hope I find one. Or maybe just maybe uber will improve to the service they first provided when they came out.
title: Hardly useful anymore

review: Seems like after Uber got their legislation passed, their service has gone way downhill. It seems like they will do anything to screw their customers to make a buck now. Every time I order an Uber, I can count on them being at least five minutes late. Somebody I know now has indicated to me that their Uber not only canceled one of her scheduled trips, but when she went to set up a new trip,The price was much higher. Then when she finally got something scheduled, do you were driver was late. This made her late to her destination by 30 minutes.I think lyft is going to be my go to from this point forward. We’ll see how that goes, although I am not real sure about that one either. May need to go back to using taxis or limos from now on.
title: Used to be great

review:
I will NEVER EVER use Uber services again! ). They charged me for using their services for no show rides. I tried to contact driver(s) and never heard back from them. Tried calling Uber itself  and that was a joke! In one instance the  driver contacted me  by text)1 minute before my ride was due (by text) telling me my ride was cancelled to the airport  causing me to miss my flight, which in turn caused me to miss the birth of my granddaughter. 😡. Then they had the nerve to charge me for the invisible driver and car that never showed up, which in turn caused me to have to shut down my bank account to have the charges removed. 
   That being said unless you  really enjoy invisible cars,  invisible drivers,  and a ghost line where nobody answers the phone I advise you to invest your REAL money with a reputable taxi service! 👎👎👎👎👎
title: Incompetent!

review:
I used to use Uber a lot in NYC, but haven’t used it much since moving to LA. Since when did we agree to a price then EVERY AVAILABLE RIDE OPTION we receive a “your ride is now at a higher price. Open the app to accept”??? Never using this again. Feels like a bait and switch. Just tell me the actual price up front and it would probably be fine.

Also... The estimate says a lower price than what the initial charge was which doesn’t make sense. I get that it’s an estimate, but what’s up with all of these up sells. Just tell me up front what you’re going to charge. 

Then the eta seems to go way past the initial eta after denying paying more than double for a “ride now” many many times. This app WASTES time, is misleading, and cannot be trusted. UBER, what happened???
title: Agree to a price then all rides around are more expensive???

review: It’s cool that the Uber rides app doubles as an Uber Eats app, but unfortunately the Eats portion barely works.  There is NO way to communicate with your delivery driver through the Eats part of the app, and I never receive any communication from the driver either.  The “eats” portion of the app only has about a 60% success rate.  4 separate times I have just not received my order at all, and my order says complete, and I can’t get ahold of the delivery person and they never call me.  (I live in a downtown apartment and I don’t have these issues with Postmates or doordash.)  I’m sure Uber is tired of refunding me for orders I never receive so maybe you guys should just add a call button so drivers can contact me when they can’t find my apartment.
title: This review is in regards to the “Eats” portion of the Uber app

review: To be honest I am a truck driver I have spent 2 months on the road I was so stressed out exhausted at the same time couldn’t wait to go home but when I started communicating with him i felt like such a relief because throughout the whole months I was alone so long story short we had a great conversation talking about men things he was very professional the whole time,even though my accent is kinda heavy he still made me feel comfortable talking to him I wish most of the Uber drivers were like him 🫵🏾🫵🏾🫵🏾salute my guy haitianforlife🇭🇹
title: Great ride

review: Uber apparently partnered with NJ transit Access Link, and it has been the worst decision. My disabled client would often get notifications of the ride being outside, but the drivers would repeatedly go to the wrong address. Which honestly wasn’t the problem, after calling and explaining the layout of the complex, drivers would often get verbally aggressive or cancel the ride. I’m drivers may not be aware that they are picking up people with intellectual disabilities and cannot just “walk over” to wherever they are at. Imagine being disabled and trying to get to work, calling your ride to tell them you’re outside, and their reply is “The ride is cancelled, have a nice day.” They definitely need to figure this out if they want this partnership to work!
title: The worst

review: A dedicated lovely person!  I was at NYIT and the roads were very confusing. The way the GPS was directing Abdul had him go to a dead end. I began walking to where it appeared his car was. He got OUT if his car and began walking towards me! Found me! I then realized I had left my phone charger on the bench where I originally waiting. See I that I walk with a cane he ran back and retrieved it for me, met me at his car and off we went. We had the most wonderful conversation on the way to my destination. I cannot say enough about this wonderful young man!
title: Above and Beyond!

review: Very reliable service very quick to get a driver and very respectful drivers never hade a problem with the service or anything like that . I literally drop 1400 dollars in the back seat wearing sweatpants and the driver went out his way to drop the money of he really could have stolen the money but he didn’t so I gave him 150 dollars tip for being a honest person I respect people like him God bless him and his family ..this is a tuff job to deal with the public not knowing who’s going to get in you’re car overall great service…..👍👍🚙
title: Fast fast

review: Uber is good for the most part but it messed up a multi stop trip. I was charged 26 for the whole trip and during it I looked at my account and they took 50 dollars. Which is not what the total was when I ordered. Then my driver left me at the first stop and not only that but it was the wrong location that I put in for. And they said they would refund me and only refunded me the 20 that they added during the ride. They haven’t compensated for me not taking the entire trip. So I was charged $26 to go 2 miles up the street. Plus I still have not received the 20 back into my account. On top of that I am constantly getting charged 2-10 dollars everyday without me ordering any ride.
title: Uber review.

review:
for alternative transportation and maybe primary transportation Uber is the best service  way above any other service of this type. They always show up in a timely manor. The are very safe drivers. And the drivers I encountered have always at the very least been very polite and if you engage them ive have some great conversations. What I mean by engage is they usually will not assume that you want to talk however if you start the will engage as well ive had nothing but the best experiences.

The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is ever since the  Pandemic the fares have risen steeply
title: Very good alternative transportation

review: Is this some kind of drama being run by uber?? almost every single uber driver is accepting the ride and cancelling it as if it is a game. when a customer is trying a book a ride , he/she expects the ride to arrive as shown ,once they book the ride. A lady, or a girl or any other person trusting a mobile app to book an auto or cab at odd timings is not fun , just by playing this accept and reject game. I humbly request you to please train your drivers properly and educate them about a wide range of customers and their needs. I completely agree uber being an app which is trying to make money by giving opportunity for the local drivers, users were not given respect that they deserve.
title: Scam by uber drivers

review:
Uber is so unreliable when it comes to needing a ride to work. I have been using them for a week now and I haven’t had any luck with getting to work on time. Every time I try to order one, I get either canceled because I live somewhere a little farther or it takes 2 to 3 hours to find a ride and don’t even get something back in return for waiting so long. Unbelievable.   

Update on review: come to find out Uber takes more than half of the money that you spend barley giving drivers what they deserve. Maybe if they were fair; I wouldn’t have a problem with them. Also, they should at least give you a coupon as an apology for having to wait so long for a ride.
title: Ridiculous

review:
Uber has no customer support system, there is no helpline and no support for issues in the app. It is absolutely ridiculous.

None of my payment modes are working since a week, the app gives errors for all payment modes even after trying multiple ways. Chatting with the support in the app is like chatting with a bot - all they respond with is “thank you” and “we’re sorry to hear…” with no resolution. On asking if they can help resolve the issue, they say that we will send your request to a “specialised team” and that will email you. I’ve waited for 2 days but not received any email. On raising the issue again, on the app because there’s no other means, they simply say the same thing about the specialised team and end the conversation in the app. They don’t provide any contact numbers or route to any teams in the chat. 

Also, there’s no point of resolving the issue after a few days when you’re looking for a cab at that moment. This has been happening for a week. 

Uber really needs to have a better customer support experience. Worst support I’ve seen in many years.
title: Most pathetic customer support and app

review: 1 and a half weeks ago I started to use Uber for a 2 mile commute, a couple days in and today my regular trip that would cost 10$ tops has came up as high as 21$ remember to go 2 miles and a driver showing up a block and a half from me, so I get dropped off at my stop by a friend 6 minutes after With 4 1/2 miles to go I look up how much it would be to go that far and it says 13$ As soon as this app sees that you have a pattern or need they hyper inflate the cost, two words corporate greed I didn’t want to write this review a month ago I tried using it 1 day ago previously had checked normally says 13$ so I figured worst case scenario 28$ for a 2 mile destination. I woke up and it said 43$ . These rides are becoming a luxury not a service.
title: When Uber sees your needs

review:
I used Uber almost everyday because I’m saving up for a car so Uber and the bus were the way I got around. Everything was great at first and I had no issues but continuously problems started arising.

• Navigation Problems 
(I live next to a senior home and there’s a wall dividing the two neighbourhoods, every time I would ride Uber I would have to specify my address (that was already on the pickup information) otherwise it would go to a completely different side to pick me up)
• Dropoff
(I’ve had a time when I set for two drop offs, one at the store then the last stop at my house. I paid for the two stops because I was grabbing frozen items and didn’t want to walk the rest of the way home because it was 115 degrees outside. The Uber driver just left and finished the trip while I was in the store, forcing me to walk the rest of the way home and when I contacted customer support they said there was nothing they could do so I just decided to stop all Uber usage on my end, and decided to make a comment to help others avoid these issues.)
title: Good at first

review: I had placed a timed ride and it found one but then when I went to click on the app it sent me to the Home Screen and I couldn’t see that I had one anymore so went to get a new one and it let me, soon I got picked up by the one I just ordered then I got a text saying from another driver that he has arrived then I had to cancel the other that I didn’t even know I had and it charged me $20. It’s honestly so frustrating because it didn’t even show me I had one and even when It sent me back to the Home Screen I was like refreshing to see where the ride I scheduled went and I even want to upcoming and nothing showed up.
title: Scheduled ride fails

review:
I’ve ridden with Uber for at least 2 years now, with great service, no complaints. Today I scheduled a ride for my brother from the train station and I texted the driver that he was on the other side of the platform and he was coming. The driver, who only texted me in Spanish sat there for a minute and then cancelled the ride!! He hadn’t even waited
 that long! I was charged the cancellation fee even though the driver was the one who cancelled. 

Then I booked another ride for my brother and made sure on the pickup notes that I wrote which side of the platform he was on. The driver, Kenny was on his way and then also cancelled on my brother!!! Uber automatically set up another driver who was 15 minutes away. My brother said forget it, if he walks he can be home in 15-20 mins. Forget about this nonsense. So I cancelled the automated ride and got charged another cancellation fee. 

Altogether I got charged at least $14 just for failed rides. I want my money back!!!
title: Terrible ride experience

review: Somehow Uber signed me up for Uberpass after my last ride five months ago. I hardly ever need to use a ride share, like I said I haven’t used one in five months so I never would choose to sign up for a monthly subscription.  I don’t know how I missed the charge on my credit card statement but I did for five months. Their customer support is basically nonexistent.  They have no service over the phone and it took me about 15 minutes to make my way through the app to figure out how to talk with someone via their messenger. They said they have processes in place and would only refund me one month.  Apparently they have great processes in place to sign people up for things they don’t need or want. Done with Uber!
title: Wrongly charged for Uber pass/terrible customer support

review:
These are scammers. A Free UberX ride up to $30 is worth 2000 points, but if you don’t redeem it immediately they raise the cost of the free ride to 3500 points. Then their algorithm identifies you as someone who saves points, so before you even reach 3500 they change the cost of a free ride to 4000 points. I have screenshots. And it’s uneven and unfair, on other people’s phones with less points a free UberX is listed as 2000 points.

They also steal from you. They have overcharged for rides on my bank statements and on friends multiple times. A ride was ~$9. They charged me ~$20. 

They hope you don’t check your bank account so it slips by you. But they know they can’t actually steal, so when you bring it up they fix it. But why should I bear the responsibility to do that? 

The stealing is so common they have an option in their app “the price I was charged does not reflect the upfront price I was shown”

Stop scamming your loyal and respectful customers and users. I spent thousands on this app and didn’t complain when prices in LA shot up along with wait times. 

Unequivocally ridiculous.
title: Scamming. Changing Point Value & Overcharging for Rides On Bank Statement

review: This is a good service but they will take you out the game if you have low rating so if you get 83% be advise they suspend your account i email them and try to apple yes good luck with that because that apple don’t work for nothing of them apps I don’t understand why they have a apple option if they don’t care about the driver just like the same energy I been feeling is driver don’t get appreciate so be careful on y’all rating if you all delivery with Uber they don’t solve no problem I’m Edward Peterson I been working with Uber 2years I only use that for extra income but screw em now I did everything in my power to get my account back all these delivery app are bad to make money on they will take your account away from with out you knowing
title: They deactivated my account

review: So, I get the fee purpose but I think it’s stupid what just happened. I reserved a ride for 4:30 and it paired me up with someone that was 10 minutes away. I was not gonna be ready by then because I get ready at 3:35 (and I’m never late). You really need to get that fixed why pair someone up with someone that is gonna get there way before the scheduled it? I asked the driver could they wait maybe until 4:10 and they said “I can’t wait for an hour”. That’s not the diver’s fault but why do it before I’m ready I reserved a time for a reason, and then it charged me a 7.25 cancellation fee. Did it as well charge me for the ride or just the fee?
title: Cancellation Fee

review: Drivers were rude and they refuse us for the pick up as they could not find the drop place we told him that we’ll guide you just pick us up then he ask us to cancel our ride and then we are charged extra because of them I told him that you cancel he said he’ll cancel in 2 minutes so we left the place in auto but then we didn’t knew our pickup was transferred to another driver then started calling us we said we left the place but he was like no you have to cancel the ride then I was so frustrated with all this finally cancel the ride and I was charged extra amount without any reason and my fault very very disappointed with the service and behaviour of the drivers
title: We are ask to pay cancellation fees though it was not our fault

review: Multiple times using this app. Switched to Lyft but would occasionally look into Uber for quicker pick up times . And after today I can say with confidence that I will be permanently deleting the app. On multiple occasions I’ve requested an Uber and have had a driver already confirmed and minutes before they are due to arrive they cancel. They drive pass and pretend not to see you and the next ride isn’t available for another 30+ mins. Absolutely unacceptable. Or even when another ride gets automatically scheduled and they are 15 more minutes away. So you end up waiting a total of 30+ minutes to get picked up. Save your precious time and just call a taxi or stick with Lyft. Uber unreliable and unapologetic. Terrible service.
title: Terrible Service

review: The Lyft bike gps does not accurately show where you are when you are done with you’re ride, so if the bike’s gps thinks you are outside the service area when you lock it, Lyft will charge you for as much as 8 hours or more of bike time even if you lock and leave the bike!! I biked for 35 minutes and was charged $107. In no way is this reasonable. I tried calling customer service, there is actually nobody answering calls for customer service. Redirected to send a message through the app. While waiting for a message back, the only message from Lyft is that my ride is finally completed 8 hours later and I am charged $107. Beware when using Lyft bikes. They don’t have any customer service and will way over charge you.
title: No customer service!!! Beware if using Lyft bikes!!!

review:
Uber has literally been the worst customer support experience ever. I requested a ride to work, however even though the funds were taken and processed, my ride was never received, nor was I ever sent a driver. 
I reached out (the only way I could, via submitting a request online and reaching out via Twitter DM). Was told that there was nothing they could do based off their “refund policy”, even after I’ve confirmed that that funds were taken shut my ride was not received. They simply stated that next time “make sure to verify things” next time, and to set up extra security measures. I asked for a credit at least for the funds that were taken; and they stated again, per their refund policy, there’s nothing that can be done. 

Customer service was absolutely no help at all.
title: Worst customer support

review: I had the most beautiful ride with Danilo today! He is courteous, friendly, engaging, knowledgeable… many traits that are often lacking in drivers. In contrast, 2 days earlier while using Lyft, I got the rudest driver, blaring his brand of “good” music. He wouldn’t listen to my requests and treated me as though the simple ‘pleasure’ of his company was worthy of gold. Some people forget that they are handling paying customers. These people expect something of value when they pay. Danilo and Uber win hands down!! Thank you for such a valuable employee!!
title: Danilo is a SUPERSTAR!

review: I think that UBER is THE best ride - sharing apps that they have available, honestly. I’ve NEVER had issues with uber. They have upgraded their already secure safety features so uber and whomever you choose to share your current location with know where you are #LiveLocation. Which makes me feel Safe. And ANY issues I’ve ever ran into with uber they went above and beyond to resolve them . It’s safe to say that I will continue to use uber ANY time I may need to go from one location to the next. Thanks , uber ! 👏🏾👏🏾👍🏾👌🏾☺️😊💕💕💕
title: UBER REVIEW. 👌🏾👌🏾

review: Since 2014 Baby! I haven’t used the app in 5 years due to me having a car and walking short commutes but whenever I needed it Uber was ALWAYS there man! Even if you don’t use your account these jokers are good at remembering all of your information and making quick and sleazy to sign back in as if you never deleted the app. Today is officially my first time in years using it and they put me back in the game… so thank you Uber! I wish the business and it’s drivers nothing but the best
title: Always been reliable

review: My app says promo, I click on the rental car option to take advantage of the promo, nothing is mentioned or clarified. I chat with support they explain the promotion and let me know that even though I don’t qualify I will receive $50 credit after my rental. I screen record this whole chat and confirm with support that I will receive this despite not qualifying. 7+ days after my rental no promo and chat support keeps saying the promotion expired months before my booking and dismisses me continuously.
