No escalation no credit no regard. Cancelled my Uber One membership won’t be using Uber again. Trust lost and customer lost. I should have left when they wouldn’t refund me for Uber Eats orders that were incorrect/missing items.
title: False advertising bait and switch false promises

review: After I enter my credit card details, there should’ve been a notification letting me know I had to upload to Uber cash so that I can get a ride. It took me 45 minutes to get through to your chat room and them to say they don’t know how to help and then for me to check with my bank why Uber is telling me my card was declined and which my bank said it wasn’t and then for me to go back to the Uber app and realize on my own that I needed to upload funds from my card to Uber cash. There should be a notification that let you know that. All this took 45 minutes and I was late for work.
title: 1st time user

review: So excited for the day that I get my final refund from this godforsaken company and get to delete the app. Almost every Uber eats delivery order comes wrong. I have to call customer service and wait two days to get anything corrected. Of all stores and companies I’ve ever worked with, Uber is actually the worst. I love telling all of my friends and family to stop using them and watching them delete all their accounts and not support them. Please use Lyft and DoorDash for any of your needs! Uber should be ashamed.
title: Big Hatred for ALL Uber :)

review: I use Uber as my main source of transportation along with Lyft sometimes. I like Uber more bc they are more consistent and usually have a better response when you have an issue with a ride. But I noticed something. Uber will claim that it’s busy and that fares are higher during times they know you go to specific location. So I go to work around 5:25-5:35 and almost every time fares will be abt 2-3x times higher. And when I look to see how much it is to go to different destination in the same area it’s alot cheaper. I could be going further than my job and it would be cheaper. I wish I could attach photos  I was very shocked to see that and it’s honestly ridiculous that they do this to people.
title: Conveniently but Uber is taking advantage of customers

review:
The price that you agree to before the ride can be VERY different than what they stick you with after your ride! Agreed to a price on two different rides in two different cities last month. Both were more than twice the agreed upon price - one was nearly $100 and was quoted as ~$40. A side note is that the rides themselves and drivers were extremely excellent, but I felt like I got screwed and had I seen the actual price up front, I would have made other arrangements.

**Update: I did submit a request through the app for the ~$100 one and my fare was adjusted back to the upfront price - and within 30 minutes. So, looks like they do pay attention.
title: The Price is WRONG! Buyer BEWARE!

review: You’re stuck in the past if you’re still using Uber. Lyft has taken over 1000% and takes care of their customers much better over the years ,Uber has done nothing for its customers. You can’t even review a driver anymore. Cost about $10 to drive half mile. There’s two 7-Eleven locations by my house. One of them is an Essex, and one of them is in middlesex . Apparently Uber doesn’t know the difference between the two but they are definitely different places. In summary, I paid Uber $10 to drive me 3/4 of a mile to the wrong location so I could walk a mile to get to my location. Never again will I use this app. Let’s be real nobody uses Uber unless a Lyft driver isn’t available, but not anymore apps deleted I’ll wait for the Lyft driver
title: Trash

review: I was in San Jose trying to schedule a ride home in Chicago. I wanted an xl since we had four large bags plus carryons. The app insisted on a flight number (the prompt for flight number needs better formatting examples) , the app then changed my pickup time to the flight arrival so the driver had to wait 40 minutes until we got our bags. The app also needs to allow you to enter the number of people and number of bags. The app only presented me with Uber black options with no luggage capacity specified. So we ended up with us crammed into a car with luggage in the front seat and at our feet.
title: The driver and the ride were great,the app needs improvement.

review: I work at a hotel and a guest had accidentally left her wallet and her phone in an Uber this evening. I googled a customer service number and there wasn’t one , you have to download the app so I download the app for her and go in through my account well , no luck there . She couldn’t log into hers because to verify we need her phone. So I call the driver customer service number the robot didn’t even give the option to talk to an actual person and hung up since we weren’t a driver. The main phone number didn’t work either.  Like a total mess when all they need is a phone number.  To my knowledge still doesn’t have her wallet and phone.
title: Ridiculously difficult to contact cust. Service

review: There are many uncertainties when booking a ride especially during the busy hours: When we booked an Uber for “save time”, the drivers may cancel the ride and throw one off their schedule. Our ride would say the driver will be there in 10 minutes and then 10 would pass by and then we’d get a message that the driver would be there in 8 or 12 minutes. It was confusing and frustrating. We experienced this multiple times while in Miami and we felt we couldn’t trust the services. Also, we faced a few Uber drivers that didn’t speak one word of English!!! How is this possible?
title: Uber in Miami is a challenge

review: This was a. Horrendous experience. After a long cross country flight I needed a ride from Newark airport to Manhattan. Uber promised a pickup 13 minutes later. I tracked the driver who kept circling, changing the arrival time and basically not showing up. After repeated phone calls and a failure to communicate in English I told the driver to forget in and took a taxi instead. I see you charged me a cancellation fee, whereas I feel you owe me for time lost, standing in the rain, and stress. If I were you I would cancel that fee and send me an apology. Thank God for taxis and Lyft.
title: Disaster

review:
I was at the Stanford airport in Florida exactly where the airport staff informed me to be prior to calling an Uber/Lyft. I called once stationed there and the Uber driver could not find me. It was an urgent situation so I specifically made sure I was located where I should be. I was charged a cancellation fee. Completely ridiculous. I will be calling Lyft for now on. 

I have to add I was also in an Uber in Newark NJ where the driver made a pass at me. Pretended not to speak English. The only reason I called Uber is because they could get me to an urgent doctors appointment that my mother was attending AND I was with my husband. 

This is unacceptable. You should be ashamed of your company. You wonder why the rates are forced to be reduced. Nothing like taking advantage of the audience who keeps you in business. For now anyway.
title: Cancellation fee is absurd

review: Uber is always more then Lyft. It never has a driver available. 4 rides in a row, the drivers cancelled half way in to the ride. The other 5 rides the drivers except my ride and are sitting in there house twiddling there thumbs. We does uber allow drivers to answer calls sitting in a house probably pooping take a ride offer. My last ride i waited 18 minutes before i cancelled since the driver never moved. Literally stayed still for 18 minutes and i had to dispute uber to get my money back. Its beyond ridiculous.
title: Worse and worse

review: They left me stranded in an area where Uber is the only rideshare available over a disputed charge from two years ago. A charge I disputed cause I was double charged by them and they refused to refund me no matter how many banks statements I showed proving I was double charged. They refuse to reinstate my account unless I pay them for their own mistake and I’m now unable to get any sort of ride service like lyft as they’re not available in my town. I was stuck in a sketchy area for 2 hours until someone picked me up. I have gotten stranded multiple times since cause of this. This is so disgusting and the disregard for peoples safety is mind boggling. I hope their aware of the fact that they’re putting peoples lives in jeopardy with this greed.
title: No care for safety, terrible service

review:
When checking my bank account I noticed a $9.99 charge in San Francisco. My husband & I are not only not currently in California but have never even been to California.

Right away I emailed Uber. While emailing back & forth with them trying to get this taken care of my bank called & said not only had the pending charge gone through but that it is now showing as a recurring charge. 

In the meantime, Uber representative emailed me back stating that since my account is linked with my husband's that they would not be refunding my money. I immediately emailed back (as I cannot find a phone number for them anywhere) stating that I was confused because we are married so we have joint bank accounts. 

I will contact my bank to get the issued resolved but rest assured, not only will we not be using this service any longer but we will not recommend it either. We will strongly discourage family & friends from using it as well. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend a service that apparently has no interest in running an honest operation. We have deleted the app & will be using & recommending Lyft in the future.
title: Fraudulent Charges

review: I have been attempting to contact so I may to pay my bill. Without my knowledge my bank has been rejecting my Uber bills. Then my account was deactivated. I have been trying repeatedly to get into contact with a customer service representative so I can pay with a new card. After several ending loops of ‘go here to pay’ and when I click the link it won’t let me because my account was deactivated and no help from a representative a manager named Rayan sent me an email saying my account was deactivated which I already knew but has not been replying to my emails on how I can pay. It’s sad when your basically begging to pay your bill but customer support won’t help you. Guess I’m only using Lyft now.
title: Rayan from customer service won’t let me pay my bill

review: Uber is a greedy, careless company that has no respect for people’s time or money. I have used Uber several times going to and from the airport - and I travel 2-3 times a month) and this last time, after waiting 40 minutes and getting accepted rides canceled EIGHT TIMES, I finally gave up and found another way home. Not only that, but the cheapest price of all those attempts was still over three times the fair price. Do not trust Uber or their drivers to get you home safely. All they care about is draining as much money as possible out of people with limited choices and even though they take your money, they don’t deliver on what they’ve promised.  I will never use Uber again and they will never see one more penny from my wallet.
title: Stranded in a Busy Airport - NOT TRUSTWORTHY

review: Well considering my soon to be exhusband has been able to get away with setting his iPhone 11 up somehow as my Apple Watch with using my phone number, imei and phone information he’s getting all my phone calls, texts, emails etc and keyboard setting of his is mixing w mine bc he’s figured out how to turn his actual phone over to look like an Apple Watch but connected to me. I have my phone in my complete name and I pay for it all and my internet but he’s being able to change and control settings etc even from my bill!!! I’ve noticed this is one of his added apps!! And now I see this is an app w history of updates on a frequency just like the rest of the copy cat and hacked apps I tend to see all over my phone, App Store etc!!!
title: Horrible

review:
The trip to my son’s daycare is a 1 minute drive (I only use Uber when it’s raining). It used to take between 2-10mins for an Uber to arrive but now it takes several minutes to even find an Uber (if it finds one). The fate used to be $7.78 but now on average it is $20+ for a 1 minute drive! 

Taking an Uber to Walmart used to be between $10-$11 but now is more than twice that. I spent approximately $40 just to go get baby formula. It took 17 minutes for the Uber to pick me up to go and 22 minutes to pick me up to come home. 

It’s scary. So many people depend on Uber. Uber needs to stop punishing the customer (common sense) because they (the company) won’t fix the problems they are having. I won’t be using Uber much longer. I think the company believes that most people are so dependent on them that they will pay triple the price and wait 3-4 times as long but nope. There are independent drivers now, people are using Taxi’s again and taking Lyft. 

I understand that the money has to come from somewhere but the customer shouldn’t have to pay triple the amount. Maybe the company should look into a solution within their finances.
title: No Drivers Available & Increased Fare

review: I like Uber over Lyft app format. Mostly use for friends or, chauffeur, to and from occasionally. Unfamiliar, Feedback from many I know say Lyft is cheaper… So if Uber wants to look into that part, two thumbs up for that market share points. I’m sticking with Uber. I want my rating to stay up, in doing so Uber drivers are great with customer service in each drivers own way. Making a living driving or driving for extra money I leave 5 stars and a tip resulting in 5 stars back with a thank you. Thank you Uber staff and drivers.
title: Uber

review: I recently had the pleasure of using a driver for a journey I needed to make and I have to say that the experience was fantastic! From the moment I got in the car, I felt completely safe and secure, which is so important to me. The driver was extremely professional and the car was immaculate - I couldn't fault a thing. It's great to know that there are such reliable and trustworthy drivers out there, and I would highly recommend this particular driver to anyone looking for a reliable service. Top marks all round
title: Excellent experience!!

review: But from Uber website, Driver’s license plate number was shown different. That was a little bit confusion at the start. Customers are going by Uber’s word for our safety. Since this trip is for my husband he carried on with trip without much worry. If I have to send my teenage cousins I might  have canceled the trip all together with built in fine for canceling. We hundred percent don’t appreciate this Uber’s miscommunication with customers. But the driver is a amazing smart guy. He did professionally well. Thanks.
title: Good trip. Everything is good with the driver and trip.

review:
I’ve been using Uber for a while and it has gotten more and more expensive. Apparently most of the price to get an Uber doesn’t even go to the drivers.

Anyway, it would be nice if Uber brought back the option to change the driver and it would be nice if they told you that there currently driving someone when they accept your ride. Most days I don’t mind waiting, but sometimes I need to get to work or an appointment. Waiting extra time for the driver to finish their current ride is not always ideal. I book my ride a hour early and still manage to make it to my destination late.
title: Uber needs to do better

review: Seriously the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced. I never received my delivery and was never contacted about it being delivered. When I tried to contact support about it, they told me that the driver said it was delivered so there was nothing they could do about it. When I asked another question trying to explain that I never received my order, two different agents ended the chat and wouldn’t even try to help me resolve the issue or even listen to my side of things. I was still charged for everything and never got my delivery. I will NEVER use the Uber eats ever again. The worst service and the worst I’ve ever been treated. Do yourselves a favor and use doordash instead because these guys don’t care at all.
title: Uber Eats Delivery Section: Negative Stars if I could

review:
Such an intelligent, thoughtful, polite man who is focused on delivering quality service in transporting his prized customers from Point A to Point B.  

John picked me up from Atlanta’s international airport in quick fashion—less than 3 minutes after I submitted the request in the system.  His auto was immaculate.  He took meticulous care on the roadways to ensure a safe transport.  

John reflects what America likes best about Uber—quality, personable service with a genuine smile.  I customized the tip because 20% of the fare does not reflect my appreciation for a job very well done!
title: John is a Superlative Uber Driver/Host

review: The app is geared for people whose going now. I have to plan ahead and it’s hard to find the reservation setting. The first time I had to go thru the app a few times. The second time I still didn’t find it and accidentally called a ride. I found my old reservation and found a button to reserve another. 1) need a better confirmation page like EBay, list what I put and have a confirm an reserve button. Second ask SOMEWHERE during the setup is this for now or schedule a time. I’m happy with Uber services but I’m tempted to try a competitor over this.
title: Great app if you’re on the go

review: Uber deliberately excludes the excessive airport fees from their quoted price on trips to the Newark airport. They added an additional $50 in fees after the ride was completed. This made the Uber trip much more expensive than the private driver or Lyft ride I had initially priced out for this trip. Uber is deliberately hiding the airport fees so they get the business over competition. This is unethical business practices and makes me question if they are taking shortcuts in other areas of their business such as rider safety. I will not be using Uber again.
title: $50 hidden airport charges in NYC

review: In the past, we have been happy with Uber. However, the location drop offs have been awful today. We were just dropped off and forced out of our car 15 minutes from our actual rental property actually took our bags out of the trunk and said that the trip was over and put our bags on the street and drove away. We were left in a place that we had no idea where we were. We had to pay for another Uber to get us home. we are canceling our Uber app because of this. We will try Lyft and see if it works. If it doesn’t work we will stop using these apps overall. The worst part about it is if anyone is listening is contact anyone if there is a problem. So you are stuck and screwed.
title: Terrible location drop off

review: Uber may be great during the day time but using their scheduling option for the first time has been a fiasco!!!  Needed a ride at 3 AM so I scheduled three days early!  I waited and waited for car info and it just gave me countdown to 3 AM then said “no drivers available”!  Couldn’t you have told me that earlier???!!!!  Like text we that bo one has picked up your ride 24 hours out and the. 10 hours out and so forth, helping prepare me to figure out what to do???  Very unhappy right now with the lack of foresight this mega company has shown in “ride scheduling”!
title: Scheduling a ride ahead DOES NOT WORK!!!

review:
I got this app a few years back but didn’t use it bc they didn’t have coverage in my area. Used it last night but I wasnt used to how the app worked and accidentally scheduled a ride that I was trying to plan for later. I just wanted to see if there were drivers in the area so I wouldn’t get stranded. Ended up getting charged for it. 

All it would take is either an active drivers in your area notice or a confirm button so you know when it’s going to actually charge you. Or maybe a welcome back tutorial and a notice you are still logged in bc I wasnt even sure I had an account at all. Disappointing experience, next time I’ll try lyft or a cab.
title: Not very user friendly for returners

review: This app will hold hundreds of dollars for rides you didn’t take. Then take a week to put it back in your account. Lyft does not do this at all. They don’t actually charge your account until end of day. Also the split fare feature is only available after the ride is requested. Which is also not smart. This option should be an available method of payment available to request the ride. Obviously these reviews are for other customers. Because Uber doesn’t care what we think. Because as long as we need transportation and pay them. They could care less. Fellow travelers please tread lightly
title: Poorly designed

review: Lots of bugs in the app lately that resulted in running late to or missing the appointments. That’s truly frustrating to use an unreliable rideshare app. I’m requesting a car and then the app freezes focusing on an obscure piece of the map. I reloaded the app and contacted customer support multiple times but, alas, to no avail. After being a loyal Uber customer for 5+ years, i guess it’s time for me to move on and explore other rideshare options that I can rely on to be on time. Uber steadily raised the prices which is understandable but  at the same time the quality of the service and reliability declined. Who wants extra stress and hassle for more money than a regular taxi?
title: The app doesn’t work properly, not reliable

review: I would never wish this app on anyone. It is by far the most money I have ever thrown in he garbage. There are few decent people driving. Many creeps. I was in a wreck while using this app. Not only did Lyft hide my ride history, so they could say I wasn’t in a wreck. But they didn’t help the driver who broke his arm and totaled his car. That’s the Lyft app. They only want your money. They offer absolutely nothing in the way of customer service. Like absolutely nothing. I googled their contact info. When I call, it’s automated and it says “ we have help topics in app”. Then hangs up. Their in app help topics are also made to help nothing.  Run from this app you do not want it. At some point; a decent group will hopefully make a trustworthy app. Lyft is not that app.
title: Worst app ever

review:
I used the app 2x, to catch a ride to work when my car was in the shoppe. No problems there. But ordering food? Oh honey, no! Suddenly, there's a HUGE issue. My order was placed at 0945, & AN HOUR LATER, still hadn't been picked up. Tried to use the chat feature on the app to request the order be cancelled, & OHEY LOOKIT THAT! The chat feature just loads A BLANK SCREEN. (Note: yes, the app is up to date.)

I tried to reach out on the phone, only to find out the phone number has been disconnected! Social media is utterly worthless, bc they might get back to you in the next week or so. Maybe. So the money I just spent on breakfast has been sent into the void, & I might get it back? Might not? Who knows?! Bc I sure as heck don't. And there's no one answering any of my attempts to reach out to get either my order, or my refund.

If I could leave zero stars, I would. Simply bc the dude that I last rode with kept staring at my chest while I was riding with him, asked me if I would "meet after work", & tried to touch me as I was getting out of his car.

But, hey, our parents tried to warn us about getting into cars with strangers.
title: Tried to order breakfast

review:
Why can’t our drivers ever stop at the exact location? Why do they drive past my pick up and drop off point, making me walk or even cross the street in both directions? Google Maps works perfectly when I am driving to a destination. Please fix the inaccurate GPS the drivers use. Stop wasting everyone’s time and you (Uber) will make even more $$$.

Please fix the App’s estimate for pick up time. I’m getting frustrated with how often I am quoted a 2-5 minute pickup and then it turns into a 9 minute estimate and it ends up being 12 minutes. Fix something. It use to work well.
title: Just use google maps to navigate

review: I just finished booking a ride (which took half an hour to get because there were no drivers in the area. When I first booked the ride it was quoted at a $12 trip. A bit expensive but not too unreasonable for the 10 minute ride to Walmart. I had an enjoyable talk with my driver and so I opened the app planning to give a generous tip. However, upon opening the app I saw that I had actually been charged $32 for my trip. $32 for a 10 minute drive is outrageous and I never would have booked the ride had I known I’d be paying that much. I would’ve just sucked it up and took the hour walk to Walmart instead. This is absolutely unacceptable and I will never again even consider using anything associated with Uber. This entire app is a giant scam!
title: This App is a Scam

review: I no longer see the Family profile on the app but I am getting charged every time a family member uses uber but And I am not able to change the payment method. UBER customer service does not have an answer as to why this is happening, we need to know why UBEr removed the Family profile but is still charging us for it which sounds like a fraud tactic from UBER to charge someone for an account they do not have control of.
title: Family profile not showing but being charged

review:
My trip home from Colorado was stressful. When my Uber driver picked me up at the airport I finally relaxed. Zoro was very kind and helpful. It was very late/early and he was prompt arriving exactly when when he said he would be there. I felt very safe with Zoro. His driving was excellent and his car was clean. I would hope all the Uber drivers are this kind, respectful and responsible. 

Uber I hope you realize the responsibility these drivers have to their riders and pay them well. Uber would be out of business without them 

Connie Smith
title: Trip
userName: Stop with this has been taken

review:
Uber has too many surcharges so almost every ride ends up being $2-3 more once the transaction goes through your bank . Uber drivers that I have spoken to say that they don’t pocket those fees .. Uber is just a big corporation that is trying to pocket every penny they can . Here are some tips 
1. Go to the app and request your ride and then close out .. a few minutes later the app will alert you with a cheaper price . 
2. Find out the cheapest times in your city to ride and choose those times.
3. Convince your Uber driver to pick you up and you will pay them out of pocket …. I just did that for the next month with someone until I get a car it’s helping out the little man instead of a greedy corporation.
title: Here are some tips …

review: So many drivers cancel your service so that leads to having to wait for the app to find another driver for that one to do the same thing for you to have to wait for another estimated time … for someone using your app as a means of transportation to work I am satisfied with the service and this seems to be a very common issue I am beyond frustrated with this as a loyal customer I’m late to work because your drivers move when they feel like it they pick up time takes longer than what it tells you I highly recommend you look into this matter. please and thank you…
title: Just not what it used to be

review: Booking fee of $7.99 and airport fees are ridiculously high even at past midnight! I was charged airport pickup fee when I wasn’t even picked up at the airport on one of my recent rides. A couple of drivers told me how much they were getting paid for the trip and they were outraged that I was getting charged more than triple of what they were making, so was I! We do need rides but it would be great to get fair& transparent  pricing  that doesn’t feel like I am being taken advantaged of with surge pricing, fees and the customer facing driver getting me from A to B is making a living wage. Also perks for frequent riders and discounts on certain rides that used to be offered several years ago have disappeared.
title: High fees

review:
Uber no longer gives accurate estimate of pick up time anymore. Uber should ask my permission whether I want to wait for another driver who is absolutely further in distance. I don't want to wait ten more minutes in the cold wind than the estimate. It's unbearable seeing the time keeps adding longer.

That being said the customer should have the right to re-consider the deal if driver's side keeps canceling and the waiting. I am not willing to pay for a cancel fee because YOUR DRIVERS KEEP CANCELING FIRST.  If I had time to wait for a further driver why would I consider a uber?? I'd call for a friend.
title: Driver can cancel on me but I cannot cancel on driver for free?

review: Yes I was pleased with my drivers attitude and prompt way of driving she was great . I also lost my bag she took the time out to correspond I still haven’t received my bag yet but hopefully I will soon being as though it’s so important to me the contents that are inside . Once again thank you . But I would be grateful if I could get my bag item that I left with you . It’s had all my debit cards, jacket ,watch ,shoes , everything all my information literally everything. So please return that . I tipped and left a 5 /star rating .
title: Need my bag .

review:
Does this sound like good business to you:

I recently reserved an airport pickup for an employee. The displayed estimated fare was $46. After confirming my pickup date and selecting a card to use, I get a notification from my bank that I’ve been charged $103. WHY WAS THE CHARGE DOUBLE THE ESTIMATE?

Short answer is, because I used their reservation service to get picked up from an airport. Even aside from the outrageous pricing, this felt highly dishonest because:

 1. I was never shown that there would be a reservation fee,
 2. I was charged without being taken to a confirmation screen or being shown a total, 
3. After my reservation was done, the app would not let me view my reservation, showing an “error screen” for hours until the departure time of my flight when it was too late to change my reservation. 4. Even after I could view my reservation, I STILL WASN’T ABLE TO VIEW THE COST OF THE RIDE.

I design apps for a living. This isn’t bad design, it’s intentional design. And I don’t understand it, Uber. You milked $103 from me this time, but neither I nor my employees will be using this service again.
title: Dishonest business practices

review:
I love using Uber.   The only problem I have is the location where I live does not come up on GPS.  The complex  live in is 25 years old.
So, every time I book an Uber I have to type in a novel with my correct directions so the driver will not follow GPS  directions.  
Not all the time, but most of the time they still will follow GPS. We communicate after they are in the wrong location, and it still takes awhile for them to pick me up.  At times, they just give up and leave.
Thank you.
title: Location

review: We reserved an expensive Uber the night before our flight. At the appropriate time I put our suitcases on the porch and went back in to get my husband. Two min later the driver had moved around the corner so we took our cases down the street to speak to her. She claimed to have cancelled the trip and refused to take us. This is an outrage. We were then forced to call another Uber. This person was very pleasant and did his best. I am going to learn to use another service as clearly Uber is rude and not willing to take a rider standing in front of them. Christine Burris Washington DC
title: Reservation Uber left us on porch

review:
Carlo was vey helpful and courteous to both my wife and I. He made this ride a very pleasant one after 2 drivers, 1st was a Prius the 2nd was a Mazda both were unable to load my luggage’s. The Prius attempted to load my luggages to no avail, the Mazda driver did not even stop after he saw the number of luggages I have. I reserved the previous night a vehicle that I know is big enough to accommodate the 5 luggage’s I have. 

CARLO came to the rescue and saved the day for us. We made it to LAX with plenty of time. I hope I will encounter him (CARLO) again.  Thank you very much!
title: Courteous CARLO

review: I just had the most polite, wonderful driver…named Ralph, take me home when my medical transport bus failed to pick me up and I could not get through to their dispatch. I am disabled and use a collapsible walker. Ralph was very helpful and a bright light in my otherwise bad day!! This is the first time that I had the pleasure of meeting Ralph and he is an extremely safe driver. I do hope that I meet Ralph again when taking Uber!! I’m sure I won’t be so cranky like today…which is totally out of character for me!! Thank you Ralph!! It was a great pleasure meeting you!!
title: RALPH WAS AMAZING!!

review: Will never use Uber in my life again . It’s not the drivers it’s the Uber employees. They took money from my account multiple times without permission cuz they automatically put you for a pass that’s $25 out your account each month on top of ur rides unless you click on it and press do not renew .. they should ask before signing up for auto pay then no support number so you have to go through a lot of hoops for your money back answering computer questions smh this app really is a scam
title: No customer support

review:
The notifications settings are buried in the PRIVACY settings, even though the UI explicitly states that they’re in the communications settings. An obviously deliberate, underhanded move so that Uber can spam you with “notifications” that are in fact advertisements. I’m addition, if a ride is subpar, you are forced to explain your rating, and you are forced to use only the options Uber provides. For this reason, people continually rate drivers 5-stars, just to avoid going through the restrictive UI. Terrible drivers get 4.9 ratings as a result. Beware.

Ride a bike. Take public transit. Walk. Uber is crap and always has been.
title: They deliberately—and deceptively—make it hard to turn off spam notifications, etc.

review: I literally give up I am deleting the app from my phone it’s not even worth it to check anymore if you have to get somewhere in a certain amount of time do not choose Uber because it will lie to you and say a time that is half as much as the actual time it takes for your driver to get to you it is a complete lie just now it but I was waiting for my driver details he told me it would be four minutes to pick up when you connect me to a driver the driver was 14 minutes away there was just no reason not to mention the safety issues and the fact that they don’t screen or train their drivers as well as Lyft
title: Inaccurate pick up times have become too much

review: Uber has gone insanely expensive in Puerto Rico. I use it everyday to go to work and back home. Usually, my average spending per ride is $6-$8, but on “busy hours” it can go up to $40+! Mind you, I live like 10 minutes from work, and to pay what equals two hours of labor just to go to work is insane. Additionally, I don’t know why but Uber drivers have a tendency of cancelling trips once you’re waiting for them. I’ve been late to work and other important commitments due to this. And what’s worse, no compensation whatsoever. If we cancel an Uber drive, we get to pay a penalty fee for making the driver waste their time, oh, but if they cancel us, we’re just screwed. No discounts no nothing. Just a bad experience and an anxiety attack. Thanks a lot.
title: Uber Puerto Rico prices

review: Uber has always been something I’ve seen as inventive. How convenient for someone if they don’t have a car or say their car breaks down. I think one thing I wish is that there was a place I could write a comment about my Uber driver, because recently I had the most amazing driver. They first made me feel safe, offered me water, and was beyond amazing. So it was unfortunate that I couldn’t write just to comment on how amazing they were. I wish all the best for my driver, and I appreciate the conversation greatly because it was something I needed to hear in the moment.
title: Great experience

review:
I’ve used Uber in the past and loved it.  This past getAway we didn’t like this option as much.
1. We found it much cheaper to rent a car.  It cost us $30 to go about 8 miles.  Looking at our plans and this rate we opted to Uber once more to the car rental place.  We figured for 3 rides per day it would be cheaper to rent a car.

2. The app asked for a tip mid ride and I added a 20% tip then after we got out it asked for a tip again.  I assumed the first tip didn’t register so I added another 20%.  I was surprised to get my receipt and see both did register.  The driver was great but at these prices a 40% is way too much.
title: Be aware of the tip process

review: Uber has the estimated time but they are missing the mark with it. It’s frustrating and annoying when I see 4 minutes to get a ride then get connected to a driver 12 minutes away. It’s annoying when it tells me I’ll get to work in 25 minutes just to get in my ride and it takes 45+ to get to work. I can use google maps and it’ll give me an accurate time with traffic. Why is it so hard for the uber app to predict time in a decent time frame. You’re prices have went up drastically and I understand gas prices are high, but don’t mess with my time. Literally paying $45 right now for a ride I have to wait 12 minutes to get here for. My food on Uber eats can make the time mark, why can my actual ride???
title: It’s starting to annoy me.

review:
While en route to the Las Vegas airport at 5:30 am, I foolishly left my black iPhone on the black upholstery in a dark back seat while it was still pitch black outside. 

As I was walking into the airport, I suddenly realized that I had left my phone in the Uber. Panicking, I ran back to the drop off zone and sprinted down the line of cabs and cars praying my driver had noticed my phone and stopped. 

And there she was, all 5’-1” of her waving to me with the phone in her hand. I was so grateful, I gave her the $30 in my wallet. I wish I had had a $100. I wished I could have given her a hug, too, but we can’t do that anymore, unfortunately.
title: Many thanks to my Uber driver

review: Lately I have been having issues with I’m presuming the driver why would they tap and say I wasn’t wearing my mask when the moment they see you you have to have the mask on or you can’t get in yet they after ether not tipping or just because I get hit with a your not wearing your mask I need to be careful or I loose the only way I can get to work because of someone not getting a tip it’s ruff as it is 20$ for a 4 minute ride because I’m near a highway I have to get into a car they need to check into this it happens way to much if the driver feels like he doesn’t get the 5$ tip but 3$ crazy
title: Used Uber all the time now there’s a face mask issue

review: I’m a platinum member on Uber and I order food/ get rides all the time, spend about 700+ per month. With all of that being the case uber treats me like crap. I keep getting wrong orders and missing items, food quality only drops more and more, I have to pay only more and more. save your money and don’t use this robbery of a service. Absolute crap. After all the time using this app and being a great customer I had a problem with my order and Uber support pretty much told me “ oh well” and did not resolve any issues at all but made me mad. Talking to me in a very condescending way acting like I’m just being a cheapie. Not even a apology, blatantly ignoring any complaints I give them. Do not use this app and save your nerves and money!!!!
title: Just use DoorDash or something else!!!

review: Joseph what is one of the better drivers I’ve ever had using Uber… He was pleasant. He have a very good conversation with me and seem genuine and interested… There was a mixup with where we were going, and Google maps gave me the wrong address and he was very kind and fixing it very quickly and got me there within a few minutes of the original destination and most drivers would not do that much less with a great attitude so kudos to you Joseph and hopefully, I could use your services again!! Sincerely Buddy!!
title: OUTSTANDING DRIVER

review: Years ago Uber used to be a great and safe way to traverse but between creeps trying to snatch people and the reckless drivers they hire it’s not longer the ideal option for travel anymore. Customer service also used to take safety and satisfaction way more seriously. I don’t know if I just got a bad rep but my driver was going 70 in 45 mph zones. Was swerving onto the side of the road and in and out of traffic and drove very closely to cars to the point where they had to sudden break constantly. No compensation was offered nor was there any reassurance that they’re going to take hiring safer drivers more seriously so this doesn’t happen again. 0/10 won’t be riding again. Not worth my life especially with how expensive it is to ride now.
title: Gone downhill

review: I apologize for any grammatical or spelling errors, but I was in a car accident and can’t use my fingers to text. This was by far my best Uber experience in many many many years of using them. Vita went out of her way to make sure I was comfortable in the car. She helped me out of the car and into my location just holding the doors in itself was such a big help and she was delightful to talk to. The car was spotless, and she is such a genuine, caring person. I wish I could have her for all of my rides!
title: Vita is an angel!

review:
I am very appreciative of the Uber service. It helps me out a lot when I am in a transportation bind. 

Today, was a rough day because I got a flat tire. I was a little stressed because I have no friends or family in the area to help me with transportation - and Uber always saves the day for me. Moreover, I got a ride with Raul; he is so amazing and full of great energy. He made my day better with his laughter, upbeat spirit and welcoming and friend conversation. 

I have my vehicle back and Uber bridged the gap for me with transportation and friendly personality. Thank you!!
title: Awesome Service.

review: I haven been using Uber for a while, therefore I was not totally prepared for the changes on the App interface so I am not sure if I like some of then, perhaps it worked then maybe it is ok. Once I pick the right ride for me. The driver cancel the ride! That’s new. Then it took too long to get a new ride. The 5 star rating is for the driver and ride itself. Confortable, friendly guy and under pressure for a very heavy traffic.  So congratulations and thanks. I arrived a little late but safe.
title: Best ride! Worse tragic and an App that I am not sure about.

review: The app is good but a lot of the drivers are trash between not showing up driving the other direction on purpose until you cancel to protect their rating and when you hit up Uber instead of them taking these drivers offline they offer you a 5 buck credit for wasting 45 minutes of your time then when. You request another ride the price doubles in you making the coupon worthless, it’s like they punish you for the driver not showing up. Please do better
title: Good app

review: We ordered a meal from Uber eats and set to pick up. It was a restaurant I had never heard of. Everything was normal until we showed up to pick up the meal only to find out the restaurant doesn’t exist - at all. Not only did it waste our time, make us very late for eating dinner, and wasted our gas money driving there to pick up, but it was also completely sketchy. We were lucky that the scam restaurant Uber listed was in a well lit public area near the main road. Imagine if someone listed a scam restaurant with an address of a dark alley and robbed unsuspecting customers. You could be robber or hurt! This is super dangerous that Uber isn’t screening it’s restaurants and verifying they are real and safe locations. So dangerous !
title: Uber Eats hosting advertising scam restaurants- beware !

review: In general, I love Uber but just had something happen that other users should be aware of. Chose the option to wait 1-10min for $2 off the ride ($25 instead of $27). At the end of 10 min, Uber said it was still searching for a driver and needed 5 more min. I was starting to get stressed about the time needed to get to PHL airport so I canceled the ride thinking I’d go back and pay the $2 extra for the driver to come immediately. Instead, the price had gone from $27 to $40! Lesson learned: Never try to save $2 by waiting a little because you’ll end up waiting indefinitely and paying a LOT more for the same ride!
title: Bait & switch warning

review: This review is for the Uber Car Rental service. (I have had mostly good experiences with the regular Uber service). I made a reservation through Uber for a rental car at the downtown Portland Oregon Thrifty agency. Uber offered many cars available at that Thrifty location. So far, so good. I made the reservation, it was confirmed by Uber with a confirmation number. Since this is my first time using Uber to rent a car, I called Thrifty to be sure that they had my reservation. No, they did not. And, they had zero cars to rent. Not the small SUV I had chosen, not any of the cars shown by Uber as available at that time - no midsized sedan, no economy sedan, no intermediate sedan, etc, etc. Nothing  that was shown by Uber as being available at all.  Thrifty has zero cars. Thanks, Uber!
title: Uber Rental that doesn't exist.

review: My car was stolen with my wallet in the car. I had to cancel all my cards and needed to update the cards on my wallet. Unfortunately, the app was having technical issues and would not let me update my wallet. I called technical support and was told the issue needed to be escalated to the next level and there was nothing they could do for me. The operator then hung up. I was stuck at work with no food got lunch and no ride home. I probably wouldn't be as bummed if I wasn't an Uber One member as well as a former driver.
title: Very disappointed

review: Been using the app for a years with no issue. My wife tried to use it at JFK airport and she was left stranded. The app would not accept payment, tried it with a different card and kept saying to update the payment. She had to take a taxi and used the same payment she was trying to use in with Uber for the taxis with no problem. The big issue I have is there is NO WAY TO CONTACT UBER customer support unless except for Twitter or Facebook, I am not in any of them. I ended up downloading Lyft and been using it with no problem, and they have a form to contact Costumer support. Uber don’t leave people stranded with no means to contact you, especially in a major metropolitan airport.
title: No customer support

review: Uber has a very bad business model here. Drivers cancel after they make you wait for 30 minute while Uber said they will come in 7 minutes. There was no traffic jam or closure. He kept changing rites all the time and then cancelled when he was right in front of hotel. He did not pick up his phone or answered any text. Another day, I booked well in advance to go to airport. Driver arrived on time but refused to go to the airport. He also refused to cancel ride. If I cancel I have to pay cancellation fee to the driver.
title: Terrible in Hyderabad

review: I have used Uber frequently over the last several years, in many cities and towns. Over the last year, my impression is that estimates of how long it will take a driver to arrive and thus the drop off time is much less reliable, and is usually longer by an impactful margin. As a result, I am less likely to use Uber for time sensitive activities like transport between meetings across town, where another convenient and more reliable option is available. I have loved using Uber in the past and would appreciate this being corrected.
title: Transparency/Estimations of time seem less accurate than they used to be

review: iOS update bug - cannot use uber b/c it requires update which requires iOS update… Then the pop up says you can use earlier version of the app and nothing happens when you tap download besides same window popping up again… The reason I dont want to update iOS is that my phone is a couple of yrs old and last time i updated, it made it slower (and i dont want to buy a new phone right this moment, which is probably one of the goals with updates making your phone slower and more annoying to use…) so Uber - you may have just lost a customer due to dumb update rules…
title: Uber just lost another customer - they force you to update your entire iOS just to use Uber??

review: There’s no support whatsoever for services like Uber, which is always frustrating when something goes wrong with a ride or delivery, but what drove me to delete was I couldn’t change my name. I changed my name legally and wanted to update all of my profiles, Uber offers no way to do this. The fields aren’t editable in the app and I couldn’t even abandon the account and start a new one because my phone number is tied to the original account. As always, Uber has gone to an extreme to prevent any of their customers from receiving any kind of support whatsoever because that would involve actually paying someone so there’s no recourse. Fine. I’ll do without this service.
title: Had to Delete the App

review: Uber sends me a notice that my account will be deleted in 30 days if I do not sign into my account, even though I actively use Uber. —- So I try signing in, but Uber wants to verify my account by sending me a text message, I opted out of text messages with Uber so there’s no way for Uber to send me a text and there is no way to opt back in to receive texts, unless I sign in. —- They have no email support and no phone support. Why they don’t even offer an email support makes no sense. IF YOU EVER NEED TO CONTACT UBER, THE COMPANY MAKES IT IMPOSSIBLE
title: Worst app for customer service, there’s no way to contact Uber

review: If i could write zero stars i would. Took two rides no problem. Wake up the next day and my commute rides i scheduled for work (i dont have the car for a couple days) were cancelled. No explanation. No problem i think as i go to reschedule it. Now they wont take my card. I update it several times, redownload the app, try 4 other known good payment methods. Nothing. I even bought a gift card and loaded that onto my account. Still cant book a ride so thats 25 dollars I’ll literally never see again. Sent a message to support and as of now its been nearly 24 hours without even so much as an automated response.  My account is totally unusable and since its attached to your phone number i am literally up a creek.
title: Zero customer service.

review: My driver did nothing wrong. Your app is such trash. I live in a busy downtown area. Next available Uber was 22 mins away, sure. I accept. Immediately I receive a barrage of texts saying to accept a higher rate, then another even higher rate, then another!! I finally say F it and ask my friend to get me. Uber shows up and I never accepted the higher rate!! I never did, so my question to you is why did you even ask?? Don’t be annoying, either my rides coming or not. I did not accept. And I didn’t complain ON the app because then y’all greedy people would take the money from the driver. Absolute trash, I’ll just make sure I have a ride where I’m going from now on. You are way less reliable than you used to be, figure it out.
title: Because Uber doesn’t have a place for general complaints

review: Hello Uber I’m on the West Coast traveling East. When I schedule a pick up for 10:00 the app keeps changing my pick up to 1:00 after I confirm. Yes I know there is a 3 hour time change however I know what time it will be where I’m going and when I need to be picked up. I’m wondering if I set the time for 7:00 and the app changes it to 10:00 will it change the time again back to 7:00 once I’m on that time zone? I feel like this is a glitch that could be fixed. For this reason I’m not going to use the reserve a ride feature but I like idea.
title: Reserve a ride while traveling

review: The driver took the ride with no plan to actually drive us, after waiting 20 minutes (expected) he drove straight past our exit. After 3 exits we realized he had no plan to turn around. There is no way to get support that I could find in the app for that ride. I called the rider support number which I assumed they were the ones to call and they yelled at me because they weren’t the right department and that I called the rider support number they can only help to get me a new ride they can’t help with existing ride problems and could not transfer me to someone who could help. In a Lyft right now on the way to the airport hoping I don’t miss my flight because this mess took an hour. Terrible company with awful support.
title: No support from Uber

review: Last 3 times I’ve attempted to use this or eats I’ve been greatly disappointed, it advertises it can pickup or get your food in a set time. But when you order or ask for a ride you left waiting for sometime hours before it auto cancels for lack of drivers no notification so just keep an eye out that your stuck. Today I needed a ride to the airport, it searched for a driver 40 min and quit. But it’s charged my card already for a ride it can’t do. I’ve called and kindly asked if there was any compensation only to be laughed at, doordash passes out coupons in this situation.  If you are counting on a ride or dinner this would not be my first choice in my area anyhow.
title: This company frustrates me

review:
I used this ride as a test as the Uber Map doesn’t have our street correctly identified on their map. As soon as I saw the driver started heading our way I texted him to let him know our correct street name/address/location. 
Prior to ordering ride, I did my level best to try and mitigate the problem, including using the customer service/help in the app. I’m not sure Uber really wants to help after this experience!
I ended up having to pay for a ride to an incorrect address-then guide him to my address. 33$ for a ride a few blocks.
title: New DevelopmentHome, Uber map identifies m

review:
I recently downloaded Uber before a bachelor party a few weeks ago, but this past weekend I got a notification that I could get $30 off my first food order. My fiancée and I decided to try it, but when I placed the order, there was a pop-up that said “the discount couldn’t be applied at this time.”

When I reached out to Uber Support on Twitter (I’m never calling it X, Elon), they said the discount couldn’t be applied because there was a breach in the terms of use. When I asked what terms were breached, they just said “we understand you’re disappointed,” but never told me what the breach was. Again I asked, but I never received a reply. Don’t support this industry. If you want food, just go pick it up yourself.
title: Deceptive; terrible customer service

review: I’ve been driving with Uber for a while, and this is one of the best drivers I have ever had Mr. THONG was very cordial very professional and he was quite a listener. I enjoyed my ride with him. He was very, very smooth riding had excellent driving directions was very well coordinated and extremely kind, clean, friendly understanding, and all of the above the people look for when they need a ride home from a long trip from the airport. Thank you Uber for providing such outstanding service from a driver like Mr. Thong he needs a raise
title: Thong the amazing driver

review:
I have USA based Uber App account on my iPhone. I uploaded a gift card of Indian Rupees 2000 to my USA Uber app. 
Uber didn’t allow to use of this money for any of the transactions. If the Uber usa app doesn’t allow non-USD it shouldn’t have allowed different currencies to be added to the account at first place. 
Now, this is sitting in my account, and unable to use it.
I have requested Uber support to either convert to equivalent USD or refund back in a gift card which I can pass to someone else in India .
Pls help
title: Uber stealing gift card money from Uber usa account

review: Last time I ordered an Uber from the Marriott by the airport in Austin. After a short ride the driver told us we had to get out that our ride had been CANCELLED for whatever reason I will never know. Left two 71 year old females dressed nicely for dinner ALONE in Austin in a not so good part of downtown. Very very upsetting and scary. Called again and the second driver couldn’t find our location. THIRD try a very nice person finally got us to our destination (had already paid). I’m really hoping to get compensated for that experience as we are going to the same hotel on Monday, May 29th and will need a ride to downtown again. Uncomfortable with trying, but we will need transportation from Marriott at Austin airport to downtown restaurant. What do you suggest?
title: Terrifying experience

review:
They cancelled my lunch order after 30 minutes, can’t rate driver, can’t call the driver, no explanation, no lunch, and no accountability. Eventually refunded the money (most of it?). Was my tip too small? Was my order too far? Was…oh wait I’m done with Uber1. I order a lot of delivery lunches, and have never had a problem until I tried Uber1. 

Don’t get me wrong, it’s not all bad. Obviously Uber in general is a good idea and people like it for a reason. I’ll probably still use Uber on occasion to take me home from a bar. 

 Still no response from Uber even after submitting an email privately a few weeks ago. Any public response to this post is much too late for any credibility and almost certainly automated. Just please don’t respond.
title: Uber1 is not accountable

review: Hello Uber. I’m satisfied with my App and rides. But for some reason, you keep declining my credit card, which is an AMEX card, every time I order a ride. There is a lot of credit built into my card and you charge that same card every month for my Uber One subscription. But every time I attempt to use it, to schedule a ride or pick up, I’m declined. What’s going on? I’ve attempted to communicate this to you several times but none of the remedies work. Please help me figure it out. Thanks
title: Declining my credit card

review: I was in Mexico and had used Uber before pandemic era it went well.  So disappointing my experience this time around.  The app says the vehicle fits 6 people. We did not want to split up the group we were traveling with kids. Anyhow it was six of us and we told the driver the app said it fit six people clearly six people fit on the SUV. The guy was upset but let us in the car. Then my account was tagged or something and then I was not able to get Uber again. It was awful trying to find transportation.
title: International Experiance

review: Tonight we had a flight an hour away booked xl car for 6 people 3 days before he canceled 2 hours before pick up time, another driver picked up ride she calls me asked how manny people and bags tell her she says ok im not too far 3 mins later cancelled then we booked 2 small cars one came the other dude never showed up cancelled again booked another he took over 15 mins now were late leaving and we have over an hour drive it was a nightmare very stressful night but the last driver made it the plane was actually waiting for the last 3 people out of 6 never again make sure to get a car 4 hours before a flight this seems to happen alot with uber im told.
title: Nightmare!!

review: Uber has on plenty of occasions whether food or regular ride displayed the amount of time I would have to wait for a ride “example” 12 min ! Today It showed rise should arrive in 13 min, so I ordered it after looking for a driver for 35 min it cancelled and took my money and tried to charge me again! But unfortunately I had no more funds ! I went to try to chat someone and the help section is full of misdirected help no live person to chat! Why doesn’t it display no drivers available like Lyft idk! As a result I was late on my first day of work and sent back home! I will be now complaining about this app every day as long as I have a phone because this is too many times this has happened! Today was the last straw!!!!!!
title: THE WORSE EXPERIENCE EVER

review:
I’ve been a longtime user of Uber. I always found their UI more intuitive than Lyft. A few days ago I ran into an issue where the app wasn’t functioning correctly with the tip. I spent the whole evening trying to figure out how to actually talk to customer support in the app. Finally I had to just open the chat under a different issue. After explaining my problem, customer support resolved the chat with a blanket guidance that wasn’t addressing my issue.

I responded back to the resolved chat (which automatically closes, and the rest of the conversation goes to email) that my issue was not resolved. The response I received back was again just a standard blanket response on how to tip, but still wasn’t addressing my issue.

My conclusion is there is insufficient customer support. The fact that I could not talk to anyone and am stuck typing a back and forth response in chat / email is ridiculous. I’m not supporting a company that won’t support me properly when I have problems using the app. 

1 star. What happened to you, Uber? Too much cost cutting maybe.
title: App great until you need customer support

review: I used to love driving in uber but throughout the years the prices and customer service has gotten progressively worse sad to say it but it’s true i paid for a ride in april it’s almost july and they randomly let me know a few days ago that I didn’t pay a charge almost 3 months ago and i did and i tried to contact customer service due to the fact that I can’t get any rides because of this mysterious payment but of course they were no help and now I’m stuck with an account that can’t be deleted do to the fact that they want me to pay again! If you can stick with another app i would because uber is 👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽
title: It won’t let me delete my account!

review: I am really loving the Uber app but ever since the pandemic hit I’ve noticed one small thing that I would like to be fixed on the part where you get a chance to rate your drivers you don’t get to give them a complement like I used to at least with the voiceover functionality as someone who is blind. I’ve tried to write this voiceover feedback and it won’t let me do it for some reason. Just something small that needs to get fixed other than that I can’t complain about Uber
title: Uber is great except

review:
I set this app up on my phone. No problem. Went to to set it up on my wife’s phone. We share a joint email so I used our email - no notice during setup this could be an issue. Turns out Uber doesn’t properly recognize using the same email on a different phone number. Now our account is messed up because Uber never thought of this. Of all the married people who share an email, Uber never thought to recognize this so both spouses can use their account. Of course there’s no phone number to call to sort it out.
So I deleted the app so I could create a separate account. Nope, Uber sees the same phone number and won’t allow creating a second account.  Very bad set up process and terrible service!!!!
title: Account set-up is bad

review: Good if you’re stuck somewhere I guess. It’s ridiculous that you can’t decline a driver when they’re already completing another Uber. It should be an option to not wait for them to finish some people are waiting outside their jobs in the rain and you assign an Uber that’s not gonna show up for an hour or more because they’re “completing a drop nearby” nearby should not mean 30 minutes to their drop then 30 to you. It’s winter. People expect an Uber to get to them in 10-15 minutes so they don’t get hypothermia waiting outside for them when a building is closed down and locked. It should at the very least be an option to decline a driver.
title: Only if you have to

review:
They have been charging me multiple times on multiple trips and when they are asked they would tell you it’s just to make sure that there’s money in your credit card but the money never returns! 
 
Today they forced me to repay for a previous trip just so i could take ride with them again. When confronted they would reply with bot messages and it would take literally hours for them to reply, and when the do they ask me to provide them the details AGAIN AND AGAIN! Even though i have already presented them all the screen shots + bank statements.

I am never using this app again! They just want to take your money and tire you with their poor customer service!
title: Scammers + Terrible costumer service!

review: I hate that I am locked into a ride instead of giving the option to see where possible rides are and the *actual* length of the wait for them instead of the often false and unreliable estimate given before even looking for a ride. I feel bad for the actual drivers when I have to cancel and restarting the search. I use Uber as a literal last resort but after the past few experiences, I am definitely investing in an ebike or scooter because it is often such a frustrating experience trying to get a ride through Uber. You’d get more money out of me too: I’d upgrade for a shorter wait time if given the option to really,knowingly choose.
title: Very frustrating set-up; locked into ride without knowing full details

review:
After years of using Uber and Lyft instead of buying a new car I’m giving up. The expwnsw was similar to a car lease and convenient. Now it’s the equivalent of getting a luxury car payment. The app is no longer worth it. Can never get a ride, when I can it takes forever to arrange and the new price gauging via auction is criminal. Even if you accept a slightly higher rate,  they won’t match you with a driver and instead push a much higher rate. Sometimes 5-6 times the original rate. And the biggest insult in this new system is that the drivers don’t get the extra money. They get paid the same they would on a normal rate.

This app is trash and I hope some proper competition replaces them soon.
title: Giving up. Greed destroyed the service.

review: I have used Uber for almost 2 years. Recently I’ve been having problems finding one and when I do they are really far. I don’t mind waiting but it gets irritating when they agree to pick you up, and somewhere along the way they cancel. This happens to me so many times that I just might stop using this app. I understand they go to different parts of the city and have a long wait time, but to just end up cancelling just makes it so frustrating. For example, today I wanted to get home from work but three Uber’s cancelled on me until I found one that actually came for me. Honestly this app is not the same and I probably won’t be using it anymore.
title: Trips

review: I’ve been using Uber for the last three years and never had a problem with my payments. Today, I was charged for my ride and then I added a tip for the driver. Apparently, my Credit Card “doesn’t have sufficient funds to make the payment” and the app is requesting me to make another payment for the amount that was already debited plus the tip. I contacted my bank and they confirmed that Uber charged my ride but hasn’t charged my tip. I’ve been trying to request food and rides all day, since this morning, and haven had any luck because the app keeps asking me to make a payment for the amount I already covered. I already tried to contact support and haven’t got any reply.
title: Asking for payment that was already debited

review:
Until around 2am last night, Lyft was the only app on my phone. I’m a widow in suburbia. So after 10pm, even your bff’s and their husbands have put their phones to sleep. The hospital discharged me after a nightmare-on-UbanSprawl-Lane landed me a ride in an ambulance. After an awesome team of first responders left the hospital, well, it didn’t take long to wish I had stayed home and died. 
However I lived to tell y’all, use Uber and ask for Quinn, the superhero. A perfect young gentleman who made me want to keep on living. Chivalry is alive and girls love it.
title: Tender hearted driver, Quinn.

review: I love Uber, but every time we use it, the driver is led astray by the Uber map. For example, tonight I was being picked up and dropped off at home and the map for the Uber driver took them on a seven minute roundabout that wasn't even necessary. We went to Busch Gardens and used Uber and the Uber drivers were continuously getting directed by the Maps to drop us at the employees entrance which doesn't work. They need to make the map more accurate and let drivers put input into it so others don't make the same mistakes.
title: Uber is good but map and directions for drivers not good

review: I ordered food for my wife well she was in the U of M hospital. Visiting hours were over and she just got approved for a regular diet. Before that she was on one that didn’t give her anything so she was starving!! I was told by the hospital that i can uber eats, door dash or whatever i wanted. They said they deliver it to the desk downstairs and her nurse can come get it. So i ordered dinner for her before i left.  Only to find out the next day her food never came. So i messaged Uber and the restaurant and called as well. They also charged me a delivery fee and a tip.  To this day I’ve never got a refund, email or a phone call!
title: Never got my refund for food ordered and not delivered.

review:
Had to call an Uber to get my son and go home after work. Trip was a total of 15 minutes and 5 miles. It took me 30 minutes, 6 ride requests, and 20+ declined drivers before someone accepted my ride. I was 30 minutes late picking up my son. I LITERALLY could see an Uber driver sitting across the street from me about 500 feet away declining my ride every time. Absolutely RIDICULOUS!!!

Another time, I took a ride from the Fort Lauderdale airport to the Miami airport at 2am and the driver almost crashed 6 times and I had never been so scared for my life before. I filed a complaint and only received a $5 gift card for Uber Eats.

Uber is a joke. It is not convenient AT ALL. I will begin using Lyft or a taxi service. Uninstalling this app as soon as I post this review.
title: Useless

review: I took an Uber with my kid brother and his phone fell out in the car as we were leaving. After the driver left we immediately called him using the “lost item” feature in the app, and confirmed he had the phone. The driver refused to bring the phone back unless we gave him $20 in cash. We gave the driver cash and contacted Uber’s customer service to confirm the cash payment and get assurance that we would not be charged extra. Despite the assurance from Uber customer service that we would not be charged extra, we were still charged extra. I understand that having the driver come back to return our phone was an inconvenience, but they should not be able to hold our valuables for ransom.
title: They hold lost items for ransom

review: This is a complaint regarding the charge on my card for a cancellation fee in the amount of $6.21. This Uber driver drives up with tinted windows, loud music and didn’t even let his window down to speak until I knocked on the window. I asked him to please help us with our luggage then he says that it will be a liability. As my husband was putting the luggage in his trunk, I kindly mentioned to him that it would have been good customer service to at least speak then he got an attitude stating that I can cancel if I like then I did. Now I’m charged for this? If this fee doesn’t appear back on my card and I don’t hear from a manager regarding this matter then I will never call for an Uber again. My Stars for the company is a Big Zero!!! Sincerely,
title: Unprofessional Uber Driver

review:
There are some serious legal issues with this company. When I go to the store, I am told how much I have to pay and whether or not the tax is included in the fee before I make a purchase. How does Uber get away with telling me they will charge $X and after my ride is done and I have generously tipped then I get a receipt with TAX? (For a taxi ride? Why?), fee y fee x and fee z, all of which are significantly higher than Lyft? And then a $10 out of town surcharge? Out of which town? you robbers. 
They got too powerful and now do as they please. 
Lyft on the other hand, no “out of town”, no “Tax”. You have lost a victim today dear Uber, maybe nothing for you but I hope this review saves other potential victims. Just outrageous.
title: A robber robbing a victim because they are robbed= Uber

review: If you set up a rider and/or delivery account in on location, you may never have trouble. But if you, as I have, move your residence address several times and have a mix of rider and delivery activities, you may end up with a mess of obsolete but unchangeable address info. Plus, if you travel outside the U.S., you could end up getting push notifications in another language which won’t go away upon return to the U.S. and can’t be canceled. I find NO useful help for any of these issues, and neither the app nor any help pages address these things. Uber needs to fix this mess!
title: App creates a MESS if you move or travel

review:
I remember the days when Uber was awesome. It was convenient, a cheap fare, cars were clean, and there wasn’t a long wait.

Now, the wait can be long. I waited more than 20 minutes when traveling recently. The rate has increased, so it’s not necessarily less than a taxi anymore. My understanding is less of the fare goes to the driver now too. The cars are less clean than they used to be.

I recently waited an extra 5 minutes while driver wasn’t moving. Instead of a 7 min wait, it ended up being 12 mins. That’s not long, but I looked at where he was and he was at Starbucks, probably getting coffee.

After 5 mins, I went to cancel, but Uber wanted to charge me $5. so I could either wait while my driver finished his Starbucks run or pay $5 to cancel and get another car.  

Uber has also added advertising. While I’m waiting for the service that I’m paying for, I get the joy of seeing advertisements. Maybe that’s why the wait time is higher now?
title: Used to be great, now mot so much

review:
I’m personally tired of the unstableness of the Uber App. The app will tell you a driver is 5 mins away but then when they find a driver is actually 12-15 mins away.

I’m also tired of the constant price changes, why am I paying $20-$25 for a trip that typically cost me $10. Everyday When I have to go to work the price is always different. It doesn’t even matter that the times are generally the same, the prices is always different (rain or shine). This app has no consistency, Drivers are now picking me up without their mask on. 

I’m going to have to start using Lyft or get my own car because Uber’s quality continue to trend downwards with each year they continue business.
title: Tired of App Lying on Pick Up times and Constant Price Changes

review: App double charged my tip. When I tried to edit/correct, I was told it was impossible, tips go immediately to drivers. So my driver was tipped more than the cost of the ride! When I contacted support, I was give $5 Uber cash, not a credit back to my card. I told them this wasn’t a satisfactory solution, it wasn’t my mistake, it was an issue with app/their payment processing. I will never tip in app again, only tip cash. I will use my credit for one more ride then try a different company if I need a ride. I also don’t appreciate the spammy emails (1-2 a day!). Any company that emails me once a day for promotional reasons gets unsubscribed/marked as spam. I’m not happy with Uber, why would I do more business with them?
title: Drivers were excellent, support is the worst

review: This company is deplorable. I was informed I was subscribed on my private account for Uber Pass, which I would never pay for because I live in areas where Uber does not operate. I checked my bank account and they had charged me 250 dollars over 10 months and in that time period I used the app twice. When I communicated this to Uber they offered a one month refund and we’re unsympathetic to my issues. As I pushed to speak with someone about resolving the confusion, the representative ended the chat. I will never be using this morally bankrupt company again and will eternally encourage all of you and my friends and family to avoid them at all costs. Use other ride-sharing services, your conscience will thank you.
title: UnApproved Uber Pass Subscription

review: Waited for an Uber that was 15 minutes away at 7:00pm ended up canceling at 8:28 pm standing outside in the cold called my driver 6 different times was put straight to voicemail texted him 5 different times no reply looked at the location of my driver he was in the Buffalo Wild Wings parking lot the whole time (an hour) called Uber safety hotline since they have NO NUMBER TO CALL customer service was extremely rude and unhelpful I’m a 4.8 star driver 3 years strong I would not recommend this app to anyone my driver was the ONLY AVAILABLE DRIVER I had to cancel I looked at the app to order another ride it was 40$ for a 10 minute ride to my home after waiting an hour for my previous driver that said he was 13 minutes but never moved for an (hour) had to call a friend to pick me up
title: 7 months Pregnant and put in danger

review:
Uber couldn’t ask for a better brand ambassador than Robert, the individual who won the Golden Ticket of my first Uber ride. 

Robert was on-time and very graciously waited a few minutes as a result of a miscommunication on my part.  Robert was immediately welcoming and any hesitations I might’ve had about jumping in a random vehicle were null. (Now since I myself skew two ducks short of a goose, if Robert had any hesitations they certainly weren’t apparent!)

Robert spoke highly of Uber and how much he enjoys the work. He is friendly, engaging and before i knew our ride was complete.  Could not have text-booked or HR training “manualed” a more perfect, polished and professional first experience! Which is appreciated since having to save warrior mode energy for battling the worst new cell phone experience ever with evil Verizon. They need a Robert. 

Thanks again Brother!

The Twisted Starfish
Colfax • Ca.
title: Uber Newbie Uber Impressed

review: Thanks to Sonja I got a ride to a hotel from airport and when I got to my hotel that I booked a month in advance they canceled my reservation because my flight was late!!! Days Inn on Frontage road in Monroe LA by the way!!! And because my flight was late the rental car places were closed!!! So she was nice enough to take me to Best Western on Garrett Rd which is a much nicer establishment with much nicer people!!! Thank You LORD for always providing and watching out for me and God bless Sonja and Uber and those Who are willing to work!!!
title: Thank You Sonja! You went above and beyond

review:
First of all the driver was extremely courteous, and very friendly. The vehicle was spotless. The trip to the airport went well and he  dropped us off in a very convenient spot. NO Complaints here.

My concern is that there were six of us going to the airport along with our luggage. While the vehicle would indeed carry six passengers, it would not carry six passengers and their luggage. I do not use Uber that frequently, so perhaps I missed some fine point requesting the ride.
How do you specify that you need room for six and packages?
