title: What Dies “XL” Mean?

review: Since the beginning of this year, it was a change with Uber’s GPS. I live in a gated community and it is always sending the drivers to back gate that is near to my house but you cannot enter because you will need a key card. Many times, contacted the drivers to let them to go to a different route that GPS is showing but they never follow my instructions because they do not read the messages or they do not speak English. Drivers many times canceled my order from Uber eats or I am late to work or my appointments. How with other apps, I do not have this problem? I would like that Uber goes back to show the correct entrance for gated community places.
title: GPS nightmare

review: Worked perfectly fine to drop me off there, but when attempting to reserve a ride to the airport the following morning, it found my location completely Un-Uberable, or any of the surrounding local businesses, even though I checked and there were 5 drivers in my immediate area, but apparently 7:00am at the front office of a red roof was just too unreasonable a request to reserve a ride. Zero justification as to why,  just told me to request a ride. I mean I wouldn’t want to wait 10 minutes outside a red roof either I get it but this is just plain user hostile. Now it’s me waiting outside a red roof with all of my luggage instead of someone in a secure vehicle. Thanks Uber, really Moving Forward Together on this one 👍
title: Wouldn’t let me reserve a ride from hotel

review: Uber is a over priced, money snatching app. That charges customers a hefty price. That is not reflected upon placing a order for a ride. There is always extra funds being removed off my debit card. Hours after using the riding app, still being charged for other stuff. Then when you make a request to get your money back, they refuse to give a refund. Also the estimated time of arrival of the uber driver to get to you, is not always correct. Example; It will tell you the uber is estimated 3 minutes away. But then once you place an order, the uber is approximately 14 minutes away. So I highly recommend checking into app before using.
title: Uber is not a good app to use. Highly recommend checking app throughly before using.

review: The only complaint that I got is from Uber and not the drivers is that they didn’t give me any kickback on that long ride that I had to take from Destin Florida to Lockhart Florida had to make an emergency trip home is the middle of spring break no rental cars available within a half an hour their app got me a ride I had to pay like $600 with tip $800. I would have thought that the company would have thrown me a bone or at least a couple bucks Uber cash something a bumper sticker……..
title: Wonderful driver Uber could send more perks

review: As a mom of 3 little ones in Disney alone without Dad 14 hrs away from home, I was extremely nervous getting a ride from a complete stranger. But Juan, our driver, made us all feel completely safe & comfortable. It honestly felt like a family member was with us. My little guy absolutely loved him & wouldn’t stop talking his head off. Juan also made sure that I had checked in at the airport on our way there. If Juan reads this, thank you so much again for such a great Uber experience & treating us like family!
title: Mom with 3 Littles

review: I used Uber a lot the past week since my car was in the shop. It’s a terrible app that always glitches, which leads to extra fees you pay that wasn’t even your fault because you didn’t cancel it. The app won’t update (even on good WiFi or data) so you can’t tell when a driver is actually stopped with no intention to pick you up, and when the driver is actually on the way. Not only is Uber extremely overpriced, Uber also tries to force you to tip and rate your driver by making the exit “X” in the upper right corner “malfunction”, but of course it’s intentional. It’s like how  mobile game ads make their “skip ad” button no bigger than 5 pixels. Lyft is more expensive but at least they don’t screw with their customers.
title: Garbage

review: I’ve a wonderful experience with the Uber driver Seyed . I used Uber on 21 dec 2022 and after 1 hour of my journey I realized that I left my phone in the Uber vehicle . Calling from other phone I understood that he was waiting outside for long time to give me back the phone . No words to explain his politeness , honest and sincere attitude. After handing over the phone he left the place with a smile . Thank you seyed . Toyota Camry (8HTP817) is his vehicle . You are such a great person . You made my day awesome feel with full of human kind.
title: Thank you Uber driver Seyed (sanjose , CA)

review: None of the feedback options on your app are for an exceptionally positive experience — the options are for complaints only. No option allowed us to compliment the excellent service last night by our driver Javon in Tampa. He was outstanding. Skilled as a driver. Kind as a human being. Extremely appreciated. May I suggest at least one option for “above and beyond” or “exceptional”? We added $20 on top of a $20 ride. He was THAT good but this is the only place I have found to let Uber corporate know.
title: Javon in Tampa

review: Uber now allows drivers to accept their next ride while providing there current lift. Often times after accepting the ride and then taking up to 10 minutes to drop off their prior customer, they decide to cancel the ride due to the distance being to far from where they ended the last ride. As such, you wait the 10 minutes just to be cancelled on, wait several minutes to get paired with another driver, just for them to once again cancel. Was at an event recently and ended up waiting over 30 minutes to get a ride but was repeatedly cancelled on and as such, wound up downloading Lyft just so I could get a reliable ride home. Uber has become a garbage platform and incredibly unreliable.
title: Garbage

review:
In general I cannot complain, but in the case that a driver is too far from my location and accepts the trip. Then, I have needed to cancel to look for someone closer (and found it), and my rate dropped below 4.85 (being really difficult to keep it above 4.9)
That wouldn’t matter if some drivers wouldn’t reject riders with lower rates. 
If you cancel a trip and the driver doesn’t give you a ride, they wouldn’t have been able to rate you, that is not fair.
I don’t eat, drink, make noise, hit the door, I’m respectful… in Lyft my score is 5 stars…
I put this here, because I haven’t been able to find a place to contact management to complain about losing record for third time already
title: Not possible to contact them and my rate drops after canceling

review: The quoting is all off. How am I now getting charged almost $45 for a ride that is down the street less than 5 minutes away, driving wise?? I have to take an Uber to take my daughter who has health conditions to her class, she can’t walk the distance from our place to the destination. So, we catch an Uber since I’m having car issues right now. I go to the destination every week at the exact same time and from the exact same start location, every week on the same exact day. I am starting to hate this app. There is not really a real way to speak with a human to help you with certain situations. I just hate it now.
title: Pricing isn’t right.

review: It used to work fine but it hasn’t been working for about a month in a few weeks. I can’t even order or schedule a ride. It’ll just leave me on the loading screen and it’ll do nothing. And if I cancel a ride I can’t use the app for a couple of days before it works again. Then I could order a ride and it’s back to it not working. I’ve deleted the app, logged out and got in contact with customer services too. They’ve been telling me to do that same things that I’ve already did and the issue still has yet to be fixed. I have to start using Lyft and it’s been so much of an inconvenience when I need a ride in the morning and its way more expensive than what Uber had to offer.
title: The app doesn’t work

review: Uber is now 13 years old, in multiple countries, and valued in the multi billion dollar territory, but the app is still a buggy mess, and can really only be counted on to hail a ride. The Uber rewards program does not let me enroll despite qualifying and filing tickets for the last 4 years. A company with this level of dev resources should be well beyond the minimum viable product stage. It’s actually embarrassing. The support is awful as well. It’s clear that their offshore resources are not tracked or reviewed and their metrics are all tied to closing tickets, regardless of if the issue was actually resolved. I will be calling cabs when possible and taking my spend somewhere else. This is sad.
title: 13 year old, multi billion dollar company and still minimum viable product. Embarrassing

review: i’ve been using uber for a couple years to get to here and there. and every time they try to charge me 45$ or higher for a simple trip and they won’t have any drivers around. it’s so frustrating when you have to go to work or you have a time crunch. it’s overpriced in my opinion. and a lot of the drivers aren’t the kindest. i’ve had a few make sexual passes at me, which is disgusting. i’ve contacted uber about this and they did nothing. i’ve had other issues with drivers such as getting mad at me for no actual reason and giving me a hard time about a stop which i was quick about. Uber should start being more considerate about people and stop ignoring our commentary and do something about it.
title: be careful

review: I waited so long just to get one ride that was only a mile long. I had many people cancel on me even when they where only a block away. This is NOT acceptable! There should be a thing that once your are within a mile of your pick up spot the driver can’t cancel. Also there should be a profile tab where you can say that you tip well or some other things. Overall not to good unless you have a good driver.
title: When it works it’s great but it when it doesn’t you will be very mad.

review: It baffles me that such a huge company has the worse customer service I’ve ever had to deal with. So i tried to rent a car through uber and I thought wow that was so easy. Anyways I get to the rental company and they tell me that I can’t rent the car as I’m a local and to contact Uber for a refund. So I try to contact Uber they tel me to get into contact with Carttrawler, I do and I provide everything they ask me for only to be told oh we’re sorry we can’t refund you because the money actually was pulled from Uber. So here I go again trying to get into contact with Uber and they try to direct me back to ace and cartrawler and it’s such a nightmare. There’s no support number to call theres nothing! Never rent a car through them.
title: Terrible customer service

review: I ordered an Uber and the wait time was too long so I canceled. Well to my surprise when I checked my account my card was charged for $80. The driver lied and said I caused damages to his vehicle that I never rode in because as I stated I canceled the ride. I contacted the driver to ask why would he lie about me causing damage to his vehicle and he told me I had the wrong number and he didn’t work for uber but little did he know I got his number from the uber support line so when I confronted him about it he was very unprofessional and proceeded to hang up the phone in my face. It took uber 3 days to even respond to my concern and the best they could tell me is I’ll have to wait 3-5 business days to receive my money back. I will never use uber again.
title: I was Robbed by Uber

review: I’ve had nothing but bad experiences the past three or four times. I’ve been late to work because Uber cancels my original driver and gives me a new one minutes before the original driver is suppose to show up and I have to wait longer for the new driver to arrive and still get charged the same amount. I’ve also been charged a late fee because my driver was late. He passed my house and then pulled in on the wrong side of the building where I couldn’t see him which resulted in me having to pay a few extra bucks. If you absolutely need to get somewhere at a certain time I wouldn’t use Uber unless you’re just going somewhere for fun. I’m lucky my job is flexible or else I’d probably get written up or fired!
title: Thumbs down

review:
Uber has a lot of features that I love and are very helpful but it kind of bothers me how there was an important feature left out.
There are quite a few people who serve active duty, are part time veterans and even civilians that get on and off of military bases. If a location for pickup and/or drop off is in a public restricted base (CAC card is needed to drive on) the app should ask the driver if they have base access instead of us walking all the way to/from a gate even for Uber EATS. Defeats the purpose of getting a ride. Many people avoid getting rides because of it so that would be a helping tip for your money Uber. It would be helpful to the military community.
title: Knowing where you’re going

review: But the thing that constantly pisses me off about this app is it telling me it “found me another ride at a higher price” and when I check it’s 40 dollars more than I expected. I’m not going to pay $50+ dollars to go 5 miles to work. That’s ridiculous. The app tries to strong arm me into this too by repeatedly spamming me over and over again with messages about a ride at a higher price while i sit here for over an hour. If there’s no ride nearby at my price then there’s no ride nearby. Other than that. There are more drivers on Uber than Lyft depending on the hour I need them.
title: It’s more convenient than Lyft sometimes

review: I want to like Uber. Yet, there is a huge problem. I recently took a trip to Las Vegas. I needed to get to Cracker Barrel from the strip. I try Uber. No cars whatsoever. It stayed that way for the rest of the night. The next day I want to go to a BBQ place. We try Uber to no avail. Uber failed when I needed it most. This app did not do what I asked it to. I could not get a ride for two days in a row. Ruined my vacation. Useless. I can’t enjoy this app if it does not function properly. Uber is not working as intended and I am very disappointed with the service. Can’t get a single car to me in the middle of a city. Might as well use a taxi. I want to like this app but then there is stuff like this how Uber fails you when you need it most.
title: Can’t enjoy it

review: It was going fine at first. But I had scheduled a ride to pick me up the next day and I go back on hours before hand to try and cancel it because I needed to change the time. Well it says I have no upcoming trips and I’m very confused. Well I spend an hour to figure it out and out of no where, it shows my trip and so I try to cancel it and it says something went wrong and I can’t do anything. So I try to just schedule another ride and it didn’t submit at first and it said that something went wrong again. At this point I’m just very irritated. Finally after trying to figure out the situation, it let me see my upcoming rides and let me cancel my original one. This seriously needs to be fixed!
title: Annoyed

review: Lucy is a impeccable Uber Driver. She arrived to pick me up right on time. Her driving was flawless. She even reminded me of safety tips and how she prepares her clients for every drive. Lucy speaks Spanish and English and she also mentions how she communicates and caters for all her passengers. I I gave Lucy 5-stars but I want to promote my comments on  Lucy even more in the corporate site. Lucy typifies what Uber stands for and the perfect idea of ride services. Thank you Lucy for the drive this morning to George Bush International Airport. You are the best Uber Driver I have ever used all over the world.
title: My review on Lucy

review:
Haven’t used uber in a while. Went to book some rides for an upcoming business trip, but it kept changing the date by a day right after I sent my payment. Had to cancel 4 times for the same trip before it FINALLY worked. 

Since there is no help/support at all without paid memberships, I was about to cancel all of my rides and just use a taxi. Now that this is booked, it will likely be the last time I use it, since I don’t know if that was a bug or the standard behavior. I want to like it, but had I not realized it scheduled the wrong day 4 times I would have missed part of my conference and been left to figure it out at the airport.
title: Nice UI, but no support

review: On September 15, 2023 I was getting off work and I had ordered a Uber. When the Uber driver showed up I was asking the Uber Driver if there’s a way I could add a stop in he stated yes. After I ended up adding a stop it change my whole itinerary, which intern caused me to have to walk the rest of the way. Not only did that happened I was charged for the extra stuff that I was supposed to have made but never got a chance to complete my trip. I was so tired from working a 12 hour shift. Then I turned around I had to order another Uber would cost me $10More dollars on top of what I already had spent
title: My only bad experience

review:
As a company that connects its business partners to customers which is a very important however the fact that they raise rider rates to pay their business partners more without increasing the percentage made is a bit ridiculous. Not to mention the percent paid to their business partners is 26% lower than transportation industry standard. As a technology company if a computer is doing all the connecting then why are rates high  while pay is low.
Not to mention they don’t even speak to their business partners when it comes to their concerns as a business. Safety has been over looked. I even sent an email to the ceo on the email provided on the website never got a message or call back on that issue
title: Trash business model

review: I have had the Uber app for over 6 years, maybe longer and every time there is an issue, the customer service is just absolutely horrible. Someone else used my account once and hacked it and they said there was nothing they could do about it and I was charged for these rides I didn’t take. Another time, I tried to reschedule an order and accidentally cancelled and chatted in immediately to fix it and they double charged me for the order for a “fee,” when I just wanted to reschedule the order and this time, they charged me a month early for a subscription promo that was supposed to last three months. I’m done with this app.
title: Horrible customer service over and over and over and over again.

review: As far as rideshare functionality is concerned, Uber is pretty good. Heaven forbid you actually experience an issue and need to contact them though - their customer service is the worst that I’ve ever experienced. They don’t have a phone number, and their chat support is completely useless. Someone stole my debit card and charged over $900 on their their Uber account. Uber support’s answer to me when we chatted? “You must have authorized someone to use your card”. Uhhh, no. I contacted my bank and they refunded all of the money immediately, but it took Uber almost 2 weeks to finally block charges on the thief’s Uber account. What a joke. I deleted my Uber account and will be using other vendors.
title: The WORST customer service on the planet

review:
Had to resort to using Uber in this extreme circumstance. I had to go to the hospital to see my extreme ill mother for the last time. My car was in the shop so I thought that Uber would be the obvious solution… WRONG! I had everything set up the day before, but once I tried to finish ordering my Uber, it said I needed to verify with my Id, normally this wouldn’t be an issue but I didn’t have my id on me, and with no time, I had to run miles to the hospital just for me to miss getting the chance to say goodbye to my mother. Never and I repeat never use Uber, it will screw you when you need it most, as well as just being extremely expensive. They will be receiving a hand written letter from your’s truly shortly. 
ONE STAR!!!!
title: Worst Experience of My Life!!!!

review:
I don’t think I’ve ever written a review for a driver, but given my experience, I felt compelled to write a short review on my experience with my most recent driver, Hirshman.

My experience was nothing short of excellent. My apartment complex can be tricky to navigate, but he followed my instructions, and picked me up promptly.

He has excellent communication skills, and was extremely friendly and was an excellent driver. I highly recommend him to anyone and everyone. thanks for the ride, Hirshman!
title: Hirshman: Professional, Courteous and Extremely Friendly

review: What a Blessing it was for this Uber Driver to come to my Rescue! I had to put my car in the shop and needed a ride back to my house and I wasn’t sure that Uber would be available at that time of night (11:00pm); but they were and came right away! I was grateful for that Blessing! My driver was professional & courteous and I discovered that he was a very Spiritual person as well, which made the trip even better because I am a Minister and we Fellowshipped & shared Testimonies all the way to my home! Praise God for Uber!
title: Amazing Uber Driver!!!

review:
Whenever I use uber in the morning its to get to work. Normally I dont have a problem with getting an uber and all of my drivers have been phenomenal. But it annoys me when I give myself 20+ minutes to get to work to ensure I can get there on time. But when I call an uber they are about 10-15 minutes out! I am currently waiting for an uber that's ten minutes out when there was an uber 4 minutes out, but they didn't accept my ride.

Uber should have a feature where uber drivers shouldn't be able to accept a ride that ten plus minutes out.
title: Uber Pickups over 10 minutes out

review: I use Uber extremely often because I have epilepsy and can’t get my license. Uber is ALWAYS there for me(depending on location and time of course). I love Uber I love the drivers and the ease of using the app. Once when I was stranded and didn’t have any money Uber covered my trip for me since I am a constant customer. I ended up not needing the free ride and paid for it but just the offer tells me that I can trust Uber to have my back if I ever need it. I love this app. What’s lyft? Uber is everything.
title: Uber saves my life from falling apart

review:
I was having problem returning the Airbnb door key to the Drop Off Box and Anis was waiting patiently with my family and our luggage already in the van. Anis later tried to help me with the Drop Off Box but to no avail. I was then able to put the Airbnb contact on the phone and Anis was kind enough to explain the situation to the contact and we were told to just leave the key at the apartment. We then proceeded to go to the airport without delay.

Throughout the ordeal Anis was patient and helpful. Thank you again, Anis.
title: Anis came to the rescue

review: Rafael is not only a good driver but also a great person. I was looking for my car that I had left parked somewhere. I did not remember the street name or the  exact location  for my vehicle. From the little information I had about where my car was, Rafael was able to put that together and we drove around and found my car. He did all that without any rush on us and actually he got all involved in my search. He was great and I can say that for sure he is a great human been.
title: Excellent plus

review: I love Uber service . I think it is phenomenal. But I was recently charged $151 extra without my consent . My child threw up and we cleaned it before got off and apologized the driver . It might be a little inconvenient to the driver , we are sorry for that . But charging this much amount without consulting me is not a great practice . The driver even asked me to give some reference for his next degree which I provided happily during our journey . I really hope it will be settle down properly . Thank you !
title: Charged extra without consent

review: Jerry pick me up at my home Thursday morning and gave me a ride to the Lincoln dealership. It was only a $20 trip. He was the nicest Uber or Lyft driver I have ever had his car was immaculate top-of-the-line he had every device you could imagine to keep germs out and when he got me to my destination, I said you can just drop me off right here I'll walk to the back to the service department he said no ma'am let me take you around to the service department. He's the kind of driver you guys need to hold onto at Uber.
title: Best Experience Ever!

review: My driver was absolutely fantastic. He had a wonderful way of having a conversation and to show the world is a very small place. It turns out we knew one another from a long time ago. I cannot recommend a better Uber driver and I hope that I’m able to catch him when he’s working again and I need a ride anyway, I appreciate Ubers ability to get me a ride when I need to go. Ask for Preston and I’m sure he will take care of getting you from point a to point B this is my greatest trip ever. Regards, PAUL WALTON.
title: EXCELLENT DRIVER

review: Used the “Split” option to pay half a ride with my friend. He was the original requestor. I accepted with a single click on my app. The trip debited a card (and Uber cash credit) which I didn’t want it doing. Just did this automatically without asking since I wasn’t the trip requestor. There is no way to change payment method after the fact for a split that isn’t yours. Will be calling American Express. Please fix your app. One star until fixed.
title: Split - Payment issues

review: It used to be nice to ride Uber. Your expensive now and now I really need you I feel like sometimes I have to chose from paying a bill -vs- putting money aside to ride Uber to get where I really need to get to ie: my mom’s house to take care of her because she is terminally ill, work. Etc. Before covid you gave your customers nice incentives like 20%-50% for weeks at a time to help with traveling. Now I understand you may have lost some money during the highs of covid but we as customers lost too. I feel like your trying to recoup that money lost during covid and your taking it out on your customers. Very sad and frustrating. Sincerely a disappointed customer trying to make it like everyone else.🥲
title: Uber rides before and after Covid 19

review: I’ve been a constant user of Uber for almost four years. I have never seen the prices reach this high. 31 dollars to go 4.5 miles is absolutely atrocious. Nobody who uses the app regularly would pay that. This is a terrible business model. Not to mention the amount of times I’ve been late to work because I’ve called a ride, waited over 15 minutes, and had the driver cancel on me, just so I can wait 15 minutes for the next, paying the same price. And to add insult to injury, Uber rewards is being cancelled. So now, the taxi service is dead, (thanks to Uber) so the only option for people without cars is to walk or call a late, overpriced Uber. Please think about the customers instead of your California silk-lined pockets.
title: Rip off

review:
If you live in Anchorage Alaska you will need to request a ride at least 1 hour in advance of when you think you’ll need a ride. Drivers cancel all the time and at the last min too. This service is not reliable for commuters needing to be at appointments. It’s great for casual shopping and fun things where time isn’t an issue. 

Should you find yourself without transport and needing to get to work or appointments, you’ll bit be able to trust this program. I tip well and as far as I know I get good reviews from drivers. That’s said, the number of cancellations if just ridiculous.
title: Not reliable drivers cancel a lot

review: The Uber service charged me 5.44 knowing that the driver took 15 minutes to arrive, the only purpose of using Uber or any car service is to get where you are going quickly. The driver called me when he arrived after 15 minutes of waiting. I told him that I no longer needed his service and he told me to cancel it, I asked him how to do it and he told me that he would cancel it. The Uber service is getting worse and worse, for my part I will not use it anymore, it is an abuse. I asked for help and they sent me to a computer service that charges $1 for a certain amount of time. that is an abuse. I will change my account so that they will not charge me more.
title: Charging for cancelled service because the driver was late.

review:
I don’t want to review specific drivers and cause them to lose their jobs, but 80% of the rides I’ve taken since December have been in cars that smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke. One driver even asked if I’d be okay with them continuing to smoke (I said no, of course) and I noticed another one surreptitiously vaping at stoplights! I really hate arriving to an event with my eyes irritated and my coat smelling strongly of smoke. The only thing worse is the people that have 5 air fresheners in the car or douse themselves in perfume! 

Please let drivers know how unprofessional these practices are—and dangerous for those of us that suffer from allergies!
title: Please Re-train Drivers

review: Out of the past 5or so rides I have requested, 3 of the drivers have refused to show up. Forcing me to cancel the ride and costing me money. Drivers are gaming the system to get free money by accepting rides they have no intention on fulfilling. Many of them are completely unresponsive to cals or texts. The cancellation fees are exorbitant. Uber appears to be doing nothing to solve this issue. What’s worse, the estimated time to pickup through the app is completely fictitious. In most cases I am waiting significantly longer for a ride than advertised, and in some cases scheduled pick up times made well in advance have been late. I am giving lift a try, and I am about 5 seconds from looking up the number for a taxi company. Completely ridiculous.
title: Just awful

review: I’ve used Uber since 2017, and have been incredibly happy with the app and it’s service until this year. Post-COVID, in some cities such as London, the shortage of drivers is incredible. Those that eventually do pick up your reservation cancel, or will tell you after you get in that they won’t take you the full way. I have even had a driver accept a trip and tell me to cancel it myself, with me getting charged a fee. This is unacceptable. More safeguards need to be placed against these drivers. Moreover, perhaps higher cuts of the rides would attract new and better drivers. As of now, I stick to cabs and car services whenever I can.
title: Drivers not always reliable

review: The most frustrating thing about Uber is that it will tell you “an Uber is 3 mins away from you” but then right when you book the ride, you find out that the Uber is “finishing another ride” and is actually 12 minutes away. also Uber drivers purposely miss turns just to make the ride longer. you can literally watch as they circle around the block twice before picking you up. It’s just not convenient anymore. It’s become another hustle sadly
title: Uber lags

review: I’ve had uber for a while now. I loved the app up until my bank let me know that I was being charged for an Uber pass for the past 3months and I had no idea. I did not authorize this and when I tried to reach out, there was no support number or email to be found. When I did find it I got a kickback through email and when I called the number it hung up and told me to reach out online. Finally I got a hold of someone within the Uber app (that’s the only way to reach someone) and they promised me a refund within 5 business days. It’s been 2 weeks and I haven’t received my refund and worst of all I can’t talk to anyone about this!! Be ware of fully trusting this app.
title: Good luck trying to talk to a real person.
userName: I'll tell you how it is

review: I pre-scheduled an Uber to take me to the hospital for a scheduled outpatient procedure. The cost of the ride was to be around $20. 20 minutes before my scheduled pickup, not 1, but 3 Uber drivers cancelled the pickup on me, leaving me scrambling to try and schedule another one. Well, I was able to schedule another one for double the cost of the initial ride I signed up for. Uber refused to honor the price of the price of my initial pickup, even though the cancellations were of no fault of my own.  Uber makes it impossible to actually speak with someone regarding your issue, and their policies are in place to be profitable, so if you’re looking for something reliable and with great customer service, Uber is not the choice to go with.
title: Not Reliable. Terrible Customer Service.

review:
I scheduled a ride in advance recently, and instead of sending a confirmation notification via the App, it sent via email. Right before the time of the scheduled pick up I received standard notifications including a reminder of the scheduled ride and that “your driver has been assigned.” I never received a notification that the driver arrived. Then about five minutes after my requested pick up, I received two notifications that no drivers were available and also the driver had to cancel, then I was charged the cancellation fee. 

This process has worked well for me in the past (as recent as last week), but something was broken with this experience today.
title: Inconsistent Notifications

review: While the application is really awesome and helpful the developer’s team has to to do a better job in supporting the customers when there is a bug in the app. I have been messaging the Uber team for few weeks now informing them that there is a problem with the family profiles on iPhones and all what I get from them: we are working on it!! Last week I sent another message and the support team sent me the instructions on how to use the family profile!! When I sent them the previous conversations, they replied back that they have a problem!! You have just released a new update but no fix.
title: Awesome app but bad technical support

review: We came out to whiskey row from out of town. Called a lyft&uber at 1:45am. We are staying in Yavapi hills. 3 cancelled after confirming. He came to our rescue at 3am, had a clean and very good smelling car. His attitude was just a cherry on top. Could not of been more relieved when he pulled up EXACTLY where we were, as soon as he could. I was angry after waiting so long and being cancelled on, but John restored my faith of humanity . He has a 5.0 rating for a reason. Very pleased not with the company, but with a John himself. Thank you so very much!
title: John is a hero.

review: Never a fun experience. I ordered an Uber as I was having issues walking. I only needed to go about six blocks, but you driver took wrong turns on the way to pick me up then didn't even arrive at the address I specified. I ended walking since this whole process took forever. Then I am tasked with getting hit with a fee and removing it, since I had to cancel since the driver was nowhere near me. You provided a terrible experience and wasted a ton of my time. This always happens when I take pool, it's never optimal and has gotten worse over the years. When you used to pick up just two people it was fantastic. Is that enough more details? Did that help you understand how much fun you provided me?
title: Always a problem with pool
developerResponse: {'id': 12289587, 'body': "Hi, we are sorry to hear about your experience with the driver-partner. We'd like to sort this out for you. Hence, would really appreciate it if you could send out a description of this with details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll look into it.            ", 'modified': '2019-12-09T10:13:40Z'}

review: I’ve exhausted all methods for trying to connect Uber, so posting here. I use the app multiple times a week and for whatever reason about a month ago suddenly the app starting draining my battery like crazy and making my phone extremely hot when in use. Never had this issue before so certain it is related to an app update. I’ve tried restarting my phone and deleting reinstalling the app but nothing helps. Based on my observations battery drains approximately 1% every 2 mins during a ride. Have also noticed the phone performance throttling because it is so hot. Getting to the point where I’m considering switching to Lyft because I don’t want my phone to be damaged. Uber PLEASE FIX THIS ISSUE!!
title: Drains Battery & Makes Phone Hot

review:
I recently had surgery and had to go to the ER on account of a spike in symptoms. I am on a walker because I cannot weight bear in one leg. I also cannot drive yet. 

I told my ride I would Uber it home because it was very late when I was released. Christian arrived promptly at the hospital and carefully helped me get into his car. We had a nice talk about general stuff on my way home. I really needed help getting into the house and Christian was right there to help and to ensure I got inside safely. This was a great relief. 

Christian is a Uber driver!
title: Christian is great!

review: I really didn’t care for rights services. After all the bad press that has been on television. However, I had the great fortune of riding with the young man from the Uber company! His vehicle was nice and clean and he was very professional, and he had difficulty folding my wheelchair and getting it in his car. He was so pleasant from Belleville to Alton I enjoyed the trip immensely and I am not the easiest person to please. Thank you Uber! I will definitely use your service again and I will ask for the same young man!!!
title: Long ride

review:
I was very happy with my ride. The driver drove well and made me feel very safe. In addition, he was very friendly, not obtrusive, but available to chat. 

He spoke primarily Spanish and I speak only a few words in Spanish, but somehow we seemed to communicate. I found the conversation very pleasurable. We each made an effort, and it paid off. 

I try to write critical reviews, and I thought about what I could possibly deduct points for, but there was nothing. In short, I would recommend this driver to anyone.
title: Excellent

review: I used to LOVE all Uber apps. But in the past 3 years they’ve all careened downhill. 7 of my last 8 orders have been late by almost 2 hours. 3 of my last 8 have arrived with the wrong products. 2 of my recent orders came with reduced qty due to being out of stock but I was never given a chance or notification to select an alternative that was in stock. And finally today I was threatened with physical violence by a driver because I told him to not ring a doorbell 5 times plus bang on the door for a 1am delivery because kids are probably sleeping then. I’ve had it with Uber. If you want to complain you get template responses from someone in India, and when I asked to not be sent templates “he” disconnected me from chat support. Like I said - garbage.
title: Garbage

review: I use Uber on a daily basis to go to work. They literally make the drivers take a longer way to charge more money. If I tell them to go a shorter route they will still update my charges four and five dollars extra coming from a 7.50 ride to a $10 ride sometimes $20 ride because their Uber drivers took a wrong turn they do not want to speak to anyone they will keep stealing my money putting me in a negative ignoring me. This is not OK stop stealing people money if someone is using Uber obviously they don’t have a car or transportation. I will be contacting my attorney because within the last eight weeks they at 500 and It’s unacceptable not the first time I have to sue them either which is the crazy part.!
title: Uber is a joke

review: I signed up to be a driver with Uber and they messed up my account and disqualified me to driver with them. then sent me an email advising that my background didn’t clear me to drive for Uber and I had 5 accounts that’s why I’m disqualified. I don’t have 5 accounts I only have one. I later received an email advising that they updated my account to reflect only one account under my name. I tried several attempts to fix the issue through the chat and call support and neither was helpful. They customer service support is  located over seas (international) and they have the worst customer service. I will never use Uber again this has messed up my ride share app and now I can’t even get a Uber. This company is a joke
title: Uber Driver

review: The app itself works well. A bit tough to find special services like Uber Pet, Boat, etc. I wish users could set their preferred currency or there was an option to toggle between currencies in-app. Expensing international travel charges was difficult because the app and emailed receipts were in euros, my card statement is in USD. Drivers are hit or mess. In large cities, drivers often cancel at the last minute. I wish they were held more accountable for that to minimize it. Definitely not the Uber of 2014 but I suppose all good things must come to an end.
title: Constructive feedback

review: If your app starts giving you issues good luck trying to get help. I’ve been going in circles with the text support service for over a week now. They can’t resolve my payment issue and keep telling me the same thing over and over. Your payment was blocked we fixed it you should be able to use the app now.  I tell them it’s still not working they say we will escalate the issue some one will be in touch.  Next day same message your payment method was blocked we fixed it now……..but I’m still having the same issue.  No live persons to talk too so I’ve since moved on to Lyft where you can actually talk to a real person if you have a problem
title: The worst customer service I’ve ever experienced

review: App should have a feature, when the ride offer pops up to any rider, and after accepting the ride , program the Uber in a way , If they don’t move in dedicated minute, let the app cancel the ride automatically and warn the uber drivers for their rating deduction. It’s too late for us to wait for a aftermath when ride is accepted, and not being sure if I should cancel it or wait. Some of us look for a ride so we can reach the destination on time, I guess most of us does so. It’s better not to find a ride, than being accepted for a ride and we stuck.
title: Some people are strict to their time and schedule.

review:
I’ve been using Uber for 5 years now and it’s been helpful but the app and drivers can kill the concept.
App will calculate prices in a sketchy manner which usually favors Uber (even with discounted rides).
Drivers usually aren’t knowledgeable about how the app works (ESPECIALLY WHEN SHARING MY LOCATION WITH THEM & DRIVE RIGHT PASS ME). 
Car quality is unpredictable (vans that only open/close doors SLOW by driver or dirty clear curtain to prevent covid germs to driver).
Drivers taking longer than expected arrival time (set a timer to match the app countdown & you’ll see) or takes forever to even get a driver in any part of Los Angeles.
title: Great concept always room for growth

review: Can’t recommend this if you are looking to arrive at a particular time. The arrive by times are always wrong, often by >10 min. While that may have to do with which driver ultimately accepts the drive request, it makes it impossible to plan accordingly if you need a ride at a specific time. I’ve had better luck with a different riding app. If the ride may take longer, the app should factor that in and advertise it accordingly before asking for payment confirmation, cause otherwise I find myself wasting time cancelling the drive request and switching to a different ride hailing app to get where I’m going on time
title: Rides take longer than advertised

review:
I ordered an uber an hour before I needed to be picked up. As soon as I confirmed the ride, I left a note to the driver about where to pick me up. I live in an apartment complex and uber keeps showing the drivers the wrong gate, so I leave a note, clearly describing which gate to you. After waiting 30 minutes for my ride, and being delayed for another 20 minutes, my driver asked me “hablas espanol?” I said no and google translated my messages. Then my ride just cancelled! And the app said another 20 minutes for a new ride. 

NOW I AM SORRY FOR NOT KNOWING THAT I NEED TO SPEAK SPANISH TO BE SHOWN THE DECENCY TO NOT CANCELED ON. 

Needless to say I missed my class. If we miss 2, our grade gets dropped an entire letter grade. I WILL NEVER EVER CALL AN UBER AGAIN.
title: NO SPANISH NO RIDE. I could give them -10 starts if I could.

review:
I scheduled a ride some 24 hours in advance to the airport. I received an email shortly afterwards letting me know it was schedule, but then heard nothing else.

The day of the ride I still received no confirmation about the upcoming ride. I waited until 30 minutes before the time requested for that ride and having received no notification that driver was coming, requested a new ride which arrived within 7 minutes of the request. Shortly after that, I received a notification about the first ride, informing me it was 1/2 hour away. Obviously I canceled it, but I feel badly that the driver lost out on the fare (and it was a few dollars cheaper).

How does this happen? Did no one choose to accept the ride in that 24 hour period or did the request not go out until that morning?

Otherwise, for a first time out, it was fine (but I could have done with a little less stress leading up to it).
title: One problem

review:
I tried using Uber at McCarren airport on a Friday night. The first driver was 10 minutes away and cancelled. The second driver the app tried to match me with was 18 minutes away and I was positive he was going to cancel too so I took a cab to the casino instead. 

There must be a shortage of Uber drivers because I wasn’t able to get an Uber at JFK either. The wait time was over 10 minutes. The prices were ridiculously high ($37 to go less than 10 miles to Bushwick… seriously???). The line for yellow cabs was faster, more efficient and cheaper. 

I won’t be using Uber (or Lyft) unless the wait times and prices are better.
title: Taxi cabs are faster, cheaper and better now

review: It takes 15 mins for drivers to get to you and then when they do they get an attitude about being an Uber driver. I can’t blame them because they probably don’t make enough so they charge 20$+ to go less than a mile away. This app is trash now and it’s making it hard for people who don’t really have a choice but to use the service. It was supposed to be a cheaper less sketchy alternative to taxis but with the amount of sexual assaults and fact that going to work could be anywhere between $8-$40 is absolutely ludicrous and I hate it. Slightly better than Lyft at least when y’all charge $40 and say 16 mins your drivers don’t cancel 4 minutes before they’re supposed to arrive. Rant over
title: Went way downhill

review: So I’ve been using Uber for a long time and have never had this problem until as of late. I don’t know if it was an update but my god the past few weeks I would call for a ride, then the driver would be a minute or two away, then it would cancel my ride saying “the price has gone up” and would force me to tap the up cost of the new fare before asking for a ride again. It’s super scummy and believe this shouldn’t be an issue. So, yeah, get rid of that feature. It’s really messed up of you guys to do that (this specific instance that got my goat: I’m only needing a 10 minute drive which already cost me 23$ and jumped to 30$ for no reason.)
title: Hey Uber, what the heck?

review: About 50% of the time my uber driver cancels my scheduled ride partway through pickup and I end up having to wait (sometimes multiple times) for another driver to come pick me up. This causes me to be late often. I recently asked an uber driver why so many drivers have cancelled on me and apparently there is a greater penalization on uber for not accepting rides than accepting them and cancelling the ride, so drivers accept a ride then cancel to avoid decreasing their score. This means I sometimes have to wait up to 45 minutes after my scheduled pickup time with no compensation for being late. Tired of wasting money on this unreliable app and will be switching to left. Don’t make the same mistake as me
title: Driver Ride Cancellation Rules are Absurd

review: Mr. Walter was nooothing less than AMAZING  and Heaven sent! I ran out of gas this morning around 5am. It was pitch black out and I was alone. Terrified from the horror stories I’ve heard, I reluctantly ordered an Uber. Several drivers passed up the drive (I was going up the street to get gas and back to my truck! Mr. Walter picked up the ride, took me all over to find an open gas station and gave me pointers. He made me feel super comfortable and eliminated any fears that I had post his arrival. He was funny too! Thank you Mr. Walter for being so kind‼️‼️💕
title: My Uber driver Walter!!!!

review:
For Uber when it started in SF. The upgrades aren’t really the word for it, in as point they are blaring, but the algorithm tweaks for the company. Upgrades then become downgrades in as such so, for the drivers. 
I
Having helped build the algorithm, and as I take 3 rides a day. And for the last decades since I have watched the miracle too good to be true at first you think, and it was. 
Since I’ve been in every state lived in CA to NY to and London even. Talk about a dicey market with the legendary black cabbies. 
Uber persevered. 
But when you switch from market to market, I see obvious advances that aren’t. 
Point is the user and client should drive pun intended the making it work still pun also intended. 
The star rating, now a liability on drivers, is making you seem like Yelp. That is not a good thing. 
Thank you for all the rides and service, everything.
C
title: I helped build the algorithm

review: I used to love Uber. But they recently changed their cancellation policy and when I was reviewing the terms for a recent trip, I decided I didn’t want to book. The app prompted to review the changes just before completing booking and had an OK button to accept but no cancel or disagree button. So I just exited the app and booked with the competition. Later, I noticed an alert on my phone that an Uber driver was on his way. I called but the driver didn’t answer (went straight to voicemail), so I texted him and explained what happened, asking him to cancel. He said I needed to cancel. So I did and got charged a fee. This is not cool! Very shady! I’m deleting the app and sticking with the alternative now! I used to use Uber quite a bit, but forget it now.
title: App is shady now

review: I worked for Uber 6months was a gold member up to my last day . I was on a delivery and unfortunately was hit while working and even with all evidence (since driving is monitored) and they had the other person involved in collision at fault uber will not help with repairs for my car unless I come out of pocket with a 2,500 deductible I just can’t believe I’m forced to get no repairs and my car is just left in the condition i will never work for this company again its unbelievable that they won’t even assist me with the evidence gather so that I can go about legal pursuit on my own terms they closed my case because I can’t go through their policy . This company does not care about their employees do not work for them !
title: Worst experience

review:
Using this disservice in Lisbon is a disaster.  Many Uber black drivers ask me to cancel the trip because they are to cheap to even drive a few kilometers to the pick up location. It’s supposed to be Uber’s premium service, but it’s incredibly unreliable, and the experience grows more frustrating day by day. 
Uber X is even more terrible. Most cars are in rough shape (damaged suspension, super dirty interiors, tobacco smell) and one is greeted by the most inconsiderate drivers blasting loud music, and driving with all the windows open regardless of weather.
I switched to using public transit instead of Uber X and Uber black whenever possible as it is indeed a less frustrating experience.
What an unpleasant this once reliable service has become.
title: The Worst

review: This is the worst ridesharing company of all, first off the drivers can cancel anytime they want so you can be waiting for 30 minutes and then right before they come they can cancel which actually happens very often, so far I have been attacked by an Uber driver, another one trying to charge me double the fair and pay off of the app and I always use my AMEX, another one hitting on my friends when I send them an Uber. I am so fed up with this app I am sick and tired of it and I’m just going to delete it, they haven’t even made a profit for many years, any other business that doesn’t make money goes out of business, The whole thing just doesn’t make sense.
title: Dangerous drivers, no respect, always canceling

review: Uber of course has become a mainstream transportation mode. How disappointing is is when that stops working? It’s becoming almost impossible to get a ride in the way we were used to. It’s been a month that every time I request I car, I have at least 3 drivers cancelling and a waiting time 4x longer than usual. The last time the app just said there weren’t ANY cars available, at 9pm in downtown São Paulo. What a way of becoming meaningful and than destroying all that pretty quickly. I think we have to go back in time and start looking for cabs?? Two stars just out of respect for the company history, but honestly right now is 1 star.
title: Impossible to get a ride nowadays

review: I used to use Uber all the time. Then, they started surge pricing. The last straw was when they automatically upgraded me and nearly tripled the cost. Without my permission or confirmation. It took three attempts & 2 minutes to cancel a ride that was going to take 17 minutes to get to me and they had the audacity to charge me a cancellation fee. I complained to high heaven and they credited me the fee, but every time I go to search for a ride, they jack up the price so high, it’s ridiculous. The other company’s drivers have told me they stopped driving Uber because so many passengers were getting gouged on the price. I’ve deleted the app. I’ll walk or use other transportation.
title: I’m done

review:
I have been trying for over two months to get an answer from Uber Customer Support.  Had family members set up under the Family option in the app, but this option appears to have gone away. No notice, no explanation, nothing. Contacted Uber support multiple times trying to find out when or if this option would return. Have received the exact same reply four times now. Seems all Uber support is able to do is read the scripted answer. This is not ‘support’ but rather a way to shut the customer up until they become frustrated and give up. 

Take your business to a company that provides real customer support, which is definitely NOT Uber.
title: Horrible Customer Service

review: My very first time using Uber it was a pleasant ride Robert greeted me when I got in the car. I was confused was not sure if I could ride in front passenger or in the back so I got in the back. Robert was talkative and made me feel comfortable on my ride home I’m glad I was able to experience this Uber service and was way cheaper than a taxi $20 dollars cheaper to be exact thank you for the service and being available at time of booking. I’ll definitely use Uber again.
title: My experience

review:
This is the second time I have taken Uber on my own into NYC. I usually drive. However, now that life has taken me over to the East side, Uber is easier for me. I am a seasoned senior citizen, having worked all my life and recently retired from the government. 
I have found Uber to be among the most reliable, polite, safe , respectful & fairly priced Companies in the competitive market, for the type of car service I need. Thanks for safely getting me to my destination in a timely manner. 
Sincerely, MaryAnn W.
title: My Uber Experience

review: I do not drive and take Uber everyday. Every ride is a different experience which makes it a little bit fun because you never know what or who you will get. I truly haven’t had a bad experience yet. The only thing I would like to see from Uber is some type of loyalty program for riders like myself. Since I spend anywhere from $500-$700 a month on Uber, I would like to see a flat rate so there are no surprises, overhead charges, or inflated prices causing me to stress over using the service when trying to get to work.
title: Loyal Uber rider

review:
My driver, Anasir, was excellent. He took the time to actually find me he was most kind and helpful!  I give him 10 stars. Thank you, Anasir. Your tip is awaiting!
 I booked an Uber and Alexander was to pick me up. I called him to tell him exactly where I was. I am handicapped and couldn’t walk all the way to the highway where it said he was. He cancelled my ride and I was charged $19 anyway. It was not my fault he couldn’t find me. I put in the correct address. I would like to be refunded that charge!
title: My Uber experience. From Sharon in Orlando, FL

review: No customer service. There’s time I get Uber’s and the individual Uber drivers that avoids picking me up can not be reported, then those individual Uber drivers expects me to cancel so I have to pay the cancellation fee so the individual Uber driver that avoids picking me up still gets paid, and finally when the Uber drivers cancel that avoided picking me up the Uber app automatically gets me another driver after I already get to my destination using a different transportation app; which I being using is Lyft. So they have the odyssey try to take my money automatically instead of giving me the option to decide if I want to get another driver to my destination.
title: Reliability

review: This guy was amazing!!! I was driving in from Mississippi for work and was in an accident on the interstate. I spent 6 hours in the ER and had never used Uber before but had to get to my hotel. David came and got me and as soon as I got in his vehicle, I was hit with a lot of stomach pain and needed water asap for the meds they gave me. He whipped into a place and grabbed me two water asap and I was ever so thankful. He was very polite and very knowledgeable about Houston. I, as a single woman in Houston felt completely safe with him at 2 am. Thanks David!!!
title: David!!!!

review: For a long time I depended on Uber to get myself to and from work. When I first downloaded the app the route cost me around $15 max. I would order my Ubers every week day at the same time, but then I started to realize the more I used the app the higher the prices went up. This morning I paid $46 for the same route I paid $12 for in the past. My boyfriend then went on his account PUT IN THE SAME ADDRESSES, SAME ROUTE, SAME PICK-UP&DROP-OFF and it was ten dollars less. It was very obvious that I had no choice to spend the amount asked every morning in order to get to work and I’m sure Uber was aware of that and took advantage of me and my circumstances. That’s why LIFT (replace the “I” with a “y”) will now be my preferred travel app.
title: Competitor app preferred

review: I’ve used Uber since they started. One of the biggest selling points for me was having a customer service point of contact. I left my car key in an Uber. In the past, this would’ve been resolved in 24 hours or less, no problem. Instead, it took weeks to get a hold of the driver, only for the driver to offer my key for ransom, when he apparently needed money. This is exactly what cab companies used to offer. Only giving this 2 starts instead of 1, because most drivers have themselves have been great. It’s the company, Uber as a whole that I’m completely over. Uber eats has been a similar experience.
title: Customer service is terrible

review: My mom had a stroke yesterday so I went on a long walk after dropping off my car at the auto shop and about 2 miles in I decided just to take the Uber back home and Ricardo pics me up so I tell him my story and he just told me he went through the same thing. He fully helped me feel more positive about her stroke because I was sure she was going to die. Thank you Ricardo for all information you shared, I’m feeling 10 times better right now.
title: God put me in his car today

review: Uber has to be the worst business ever. The drivers I’ve had lately are refusing to take to my location, I’ve been dropped off several blocks away from my home and told they won’t go any further, I don’t live in a bad neighborhood they just refused. Uber gives zero feedback when you email them and there’s no customer service contact into anywhere. I rate the drivers and Uber still takes an tip after the trip even tho on numerous occasions I wasn’t taken to my destination. Only posting here because again, Uber doesn’t respond to emails or do anything about any issues mild or serious, I will no longer be using Uber or any other ride share app for these and many more reasons.
title: Uber is trash

review: I use Uber services quite frequently because I live in a town with no public transportation. I always happy with my service. The one issue I have is that I can’t schedule rides in advance, only on demand. That’s a big problem for me because I need reliable transportation to work and sometimes on demand can take up to an hour or more to get here. I really wish Uber would update so our town could schedule ahead, I’d be using the services even more!
title: Wish I Could Schedule

review:
I have been disappointed the last 2 times I tried Uber. I was in the Arcadia mall with my 83 year old mother and found a spot in front of Nordstrom upper level and called the Uber. I selected that spot as it is typically not crowded and easy for pick up. I was told by Uber to go across the mall to another location. This was a hardship for my Mom!
The convenience should be for the customer. I don’t want to walk across the mall to get the Uber! 
A few weeks ago I called Uber at the Burbank airport and was told you were busy and to try later!🤬 I downloaded Lyft and got home expeditiously! I guess I know who to contact next time!
title: DL Wilson
developerResponse:
{'id': 33953263, 'body': "Hi Wilson, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here:\xa0https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.


", 'modified': '2022-12-27T09:41:17Z'}

review: This is complaint about account updater program. It allows a merchant to update card information when a customer gets new card number for the same bank account. This is a major fraud loophole and visa allows it. My credit card got defrauded and there were fraudulent transactions from uber, ebay etc. I reported fraud and credit card was terminated and new card was mailed. Due to visa account updater policy visa allowed the fraudster to continue using my new credit card information on their uber account because defrauded card information was updated automatically to new card credentials through visa account updater feature for the merchant. This is major security and fraud loophole and it needs to stop!
title: Fraud loophole

review:
Deceptive. Misleading. Impossible to report through the app… I’m incredibly disappointed by this corporate misdirection after seeing them promote the false claim that they’re committed to getting people out to vote with reduced rates on ride to the polls. It was a full price ride, and they did absolutely nothing to communicate this to their drivers, without whom, UBER wouldn’t exist.

Sure, they dream of a day with autonomous, driverless vehicles to maximize their profits at the expense of their customers and drivers… we should all dream of a day when they implode into bankruptcy after their track record of lies, poor relationships with both their drivers and their customers, and inexcusable surcharge pricing.
title: UBER says they offer discounted rides to the polls on 11/8 but charge full rate

review: I depend on Uber a lot to get me to and from work since my car has broken down and has been in shop, and let me just say from the beginning it’s been a wonderful and nice experience. However, for the past month it seems every time I have ordered an Uber I have gotten terrible drivers that wouldn’t even pick me up, and some that candle literally cancel 3 minutes coming to get me after already driving the 10 minutes on route. It seems to me you guys let anyone be a driver and the quality in your drivers that work under you are just terrible.
title: Quality decline

review:
This service is good when you need it, but they often take advantage of their users as there’s no fare protection because they claim they’re a “self-employment” company… even though they can fire/ deactivate drivers..
It’s very disappointing because if you need a ride during an emergency and they are busy a 10 minute ride can cost you upwards of $47 (yes they have tried to charge me this much before.) I understand supply and demand but the expected prices can get outrageous and there is no protection for users against this. So gross. I’ve only used this app out of necessity but I would never use it if I had better options. Truly disappointing.
title: Takes advantage of users

review: The problem with Uber drivers is that they do not know where to go because your app is giving them all the wrong directions, also it’s very frustrating when you have to drive to work and take Uber and the drivers are getting lost trying to pick you up, Number 2, I can never enter a card number whenever I do, it keeps saying there’s a problem with your payment and it keeps rejecting all my credit/debit cards, I feel like it’s a scam just so Uber can use there credit nonsense as a way to steal all of our money, I’m done with this pathetic app, really it’s frustrating, everything about this app what’s me to destroy my phone So if you’re reading this, please fix the app Thank you
title: Fix your app!

review: Their are drivers that are lying about people not wearing a mask before getting picked up or for whatever reason saying that you removed your mask during transport. which is funny because both times this happened to me i was never picked up, they canceled then im getting a email from uber, whats more annoying is that its after 2 lies were told is when they have a feature to prove you have a mask on which now is good but i kept getting report for nothing. But its whatever at this point lyft os no better because they have drivers that do that there too.
title: Drivers are abusing the system.

review:
I’m sick and done and over with this unreliable service!!! Especially Uber eats!! I haven’t had not even 1 good experience with this service!!! Just now they said my food got delivered and go figure where it got delivered!! And there’s no way to reach out to support there and then! Only a refund and restaurants closed already and I’m starvinnnggg!!! And every time I order food it goes bad. Real bad!! What is this Uber??? What kind of a service is this??? With no instant tracking and customer support? No guarantee whatsoever that after an hour’s wait one will actually get their bloody food!!
And of course the constant failure to meet uber ride demands in Austin!!
Horrible service! Just horrible!! Y’all should be sued and out of business!
title: I hate uber and uber eats!

review: This used to be cheaper than a car considering gas, insurance, and repairs. But corona virus made Uber X mandatory increasing my average price since I usually use Uber pool. Many drivers don’t even drive to me and wait for me to cancel the trip. The eta is unreliable, so make sure you call the Uber at least 15 minutes before the eta it gives you (if you need to get somewhere on time be very early). And the worst thing this app has done to top it all off is that recently they double or triple the fare when it’s “busy” which is ridiculous if you count on this as your only way home ( I have seen a 20 dollar fare become a 50 dollar fare in the span of 10 minutes)
title: They double or triple cost when there’s a lot of business

review: But I’ve noticed that the last 20 rides I’ve had one person that spoke English and maybe 5 that spoke very little and the rest spoke no English at all. When it comes to a service where you are relying on someone and communication can potentially be vital. I’m all for opportunities and for immigrants working but i wouldn’t drive a bus in Guatemala and expect the patrons to be outraged .  There needs to be course on English taken or something.
title: I don’t want to come off as that guy because I’m not at all

review: Today was my first time using Uber rides. It took a while to get to the pickup location because of the distance, but the service is Amazing! Excellent, Friendly, and Safe Drivers! Pricing varies depending on where you’re going, but still somewhat reasonable, and good value. Would definitely recommend to anyone who needs a little extra help traveling but still yearns for the joy, fun, and adventure of travel.
title: Excellent Service, distance needs work. Excellent and Friendly Drivers!

review: Simple A to B, denied 3+ times, no notification of ride being accepted. Uber GPS shows different location from where pickup is, so making sure to be there is hard, driver finally shows after the 40 minute ordeal, not the place that was intended. Sprint to place after figuring out what was wrong. Call driver to say we’re there, ride cancelled, charged anyways, ordered Lyft. This shouldn’t have happened, but the middle finger of being mid call trying to tell driver we were there and having it cancelled, then get charged. Abysmal since any dispute is a thousand miles and “Help” pages with no actual help in sight, just like the GPS. Company has gotten to comfortable being the go to app and neglects customers now.
title: Most Denied Rides in a row

review:
Was in a bind and needed a ride because I had to leave my car at my mechanic’s and usually don’t use Uber due to having my own vehicle but Jose came through at 3:00am to save the day. He helped me load my luggage from my car into his and had great conversation. Super knowledgeable guy especially when it came to his Tesla we were driving in. Overall phenomenal experience and made my stressful night turn around just by his positive energy and great attitude and outlook on life. 

Thanks my brotha, 

Michael Longo
title: Jose Gerena

review: Getting a taxi from a downtown hotel to airport used to be a no brainer. They ignored 2 calls & I frantically used Uber for first time since 2021. Driver arrived within minutes in impeccably clean car. Uber driver had a CDL. Drove carefully and expertly and was clearly a thoughtful and intelligent person with whom I had a great conversation. He was direct saying we could talk or be quiet, my choice. He frayed nerves relaxed and my driver made my whole trip to airport much better than it started. Will use Uber again!
title: Better than taxis in Chicago

review: It’s ridiculous that I can’t have the same credit card on multiple phones. Apparently, Uber does not allow that. Now, I am not able to order a ride any of my phones. I have four cards loaded. I can’t even buy Uber cash because of this problem. Really stupid in 2023 that the most disruptive company in the universe can’t figure this out. I understand it’s a fraud  prevention issue, but come on, think of a solution or a way to give me permission to verify that it’s me uploading the same credit card on a different phone number. Time to use my Lyft back-up or use a scooter. Screenshot of review taken, so I can share it.
title: Low star for one reason

review: I just like to see a couple things about Uber. They are the best they’ve helped us out so much my mom at wrecker car. We couldn’t get anywhere for one for Uber. We won’t be able to go anywhere on top of that. Uber should be considered as an emergency vehicle because it’s save so many lives this year from people doing tea, wise and other stupid things at night or during the daytime Uber you should be considered Lifesavers sincerely, Michael Stratman, andAnd Diane Stratman p.s Thank you for saving lives and us
title: Unber

review: I’ve used Uber for a while now and while it’s a life saver at times, it’s also extremely aggravating. The price inflation on this app is disgusting. There are time when I’m being charged 30-35 dollars for a 15 ride I take everyday that shouldn’t be more than $20 (including tip). It often takes very long to find a driver but when the ride is requested it shows that there’s plenty in the area. I also find that the GPS app that’s used needs to be updated. Too often am I being dragged all around when it was a simple A-B ride. Wasting not only my money but my time as well.
title: Do better

review: I’ve used this app dozens of times in the last few months for a ride and not only do the prices fluctuate by the second and can go up 5 dollars a minute, the drivers are extremely unreliable. Some say they are 25 minutes away (not completing a ride or anything) and it takes them 50 minutes to arrive to pick me up. Some have driven illegally, Some had me sit next to dumpster size TRASH BAGS that are full with trash everywhere in their car. The app reroutes my house to a random neighborhood that is across the street after already pinning my location before the ride. Try to find a ride by a friend before using this app.
title: Extremely Unreliable

review: When I set up my ride, the charge was supposed to be just under $37.  After I got to my destination, I saw that Uber had charged me $61.  When I checked the receipt, it showed that they had charged a “surge” charge.  They should have shown there was surge when I was booking my ride and should have shown the true cost of the ride up front.  If they had indicated the ride would cost me $61, I would not have booked it.  Of all the times I’ve gotten rides from Uber, I’ve never experienced this before. It’s a strange coincidence that today I just happened to sign up for a “business profile” through my employer.  Maybe Uber is trying to take advantage of the deep-pockets of big companies by levying surprise charges?
title: False Quote

review: There is no point in scheduling a ride ahead of time. We schedule one a day in advance because we had a reservation at 9am that we needed to get to. We got a notification that our uber was going to show up early to pick us up and that gave us some relief that we will make it in time, but that was a lie, the uber did not even get close to our pickup location until 8:55. We missed our reservation and it would’ve cost us to cancel the ride as well. What is the point of this function if we are not being picked up at the scheduled time? I want my money back and will not recommend anyone to use this service. I’ve always preferred lyft, but I’m in Mexico City so I tried using uber, WHAT A MISTAKE!
title: What’s the point?

review:
Imagine upgrading to Uber one and getting more cancellations and more drivers who are further out of the way. It’s really sad when you’re trying to go to work and these people think you’re rude is insignificant because it’s not paying $20 a trip. 

I’m not sorry drivers can’t do their own math or their own entrepreneurial application with the network of riders Uber gives them access to. If you don’t like how Uber is paying you and you’re this awesome driver like you say you are, why not compete and make your own business and book of clientele to offer rides at a better price but of course you don’t share payment with the app. Y’all really need to think and be brave.
title: Uber One: too many driver cancellations

review: This has happened twice to us…you can’t contact the driver for items left until AFTER you tip & review your driver. Then, once you do that, the driver will either not respond or, they will offer to return your item if you pay them cash. Both cases have happened to us. With the latter case, I had to pay the driver twice the rate. Unfair & unethical practices. With the app, you can’t change a review or tip after these unfortunate events
title: Items accidentally left behind held hostage!

review: I was at the airport requested an Uber and it said he arrived I tried to call him because I didn’t see him he didn’t answer his phone when I called or answer my messages he finally called me back and said I had to walk across the airport to meet him at a different location other than the pick up area. I didn’t even make it to the location before he canceled it and I got stranded at the airport! And of course I got charged for it and forget about calling customer service because it’s a non working number! I sent multiple emails to the customer service in the app and no one ever responded. I even tried to do the instant chat and no one was available to assist it’s been over 2 hours!
title: Scam stranded and robbed

review: My ubber app is charging me over 50 dollars for a trip I booked 2 hours in advanced that normally costs only 8.69 at most. I went on my computer to see if this was real and if it was I would use lyft. But I was surprised that the charge on there was only 8.69. I had several of my coworkera try it out and it was the same 8.69 price why is my app doing this? Not to mention how bad the gps is and the fact that you cannot contact customer service is ridiculous.
title: App is glitching

review: On July 26 we had a crisis of our car braking down and then being broken into while at roadside. We used Uber for the first time and were amazed by the quick response and the arrival of David. David exceeded our expectations with his professionalism and compassion! He was prompt , efficient, professional and personable. His is an exceptional individual and a real asset to Uber. Our experience was of the highest quality with Uber and David. I definitely recommend Uber when you need reliable service.
title: Grateful for David in Carson City Nv

review:
This app is so dangerous. I used it three times tonight, and had a horrible experience each time. The drivers did NOT meet me at the correct pickup location any time that I ordered an Uber. They were typically 1-2 blocks away, which is not safe for pickup. 

My last Uber driver of the night robbed our passengers of cash while we were in his vehicle. He compromised our safety and demanded cash from us, amounting to over 100% of the cost of the trip. 

I reported this robbery to Uber customer support, and they did not even refund the trip. I wasn’t able to speak with a support agent- I only received automated responses. This was a unique and dangerous experience, and it wasn’t acknowledged by the company at all. 

I have heard of people being robbed and kidnapped by Uber drivers, and I personally know a girl who was raped by an Uber driver and won a court case against the company for endangering her. 

It’s clear that they don’t care who their Drivers are, and they don’t care about the safety of their Passengers. I’ve already deleted the app, and I will only ever use Lyft in the future.
title: Unsafe and Unaccountable

review: I’ve been trying to cancel my Uber pass subscription..I’ve tried everything. Can’t even hit enter or select the send message button as I’m attempting to chat with the fourth rep online….I need this subscription canceled, a reimbursement for march, and cancel any pending transaction asap!!
