Someone please contact me. I’ve sent two emails and have heard back from no one. I’ve given this app a TON of money over the years. When you work as a flight attendant, you are using Uber or Lyft..welll guess Lyft will continue to keep my business since I can’t log in to Uber as they rip $24 from my bank account monthly for absolutely nothing.  Poor product, and poor customer service.
title: Haven’t been able to login on app since Feb

review: Company that provides absolutely no customer service in the event of a wrongful charge or for whatever reason you may want to speak with a representative. Uber manipulates it’s consumers into paying extra for something they didn’t agree to. My options for this last ride were to wait 20 minutes for a cheaper fare, or spend more for a 5 minute pick-up. I spent more for the faster pick-up, & it immediately gave me a new time frame of 21 minutes. This is clearly false advertisement, & after calling their 1800 # 3 times, I learned that you have to be a diamond member to unlock the simple option to speak to a representative. Deleting the app as we speak, much smarter ways to get around.
title: Delete the app

review:
They have been spotty for a while now. Exorbitant fees for short rides, last minute cancels and shoddy vehicles but for short rides, they’ve still been convenient.  

That was until today. I scheduled a ride to the airport and I needed it to be on time so I upgraded to a black car. The driver switched an hour before the ride and then showed up 30 minutes early. It wasn’t his fault, the app told him to be there. It was definitely not a black car but Uber still charged me the same thing. I had to rush out of the house, forgetting things on the way.

I’ll use Lyft or drive from now on. It’s just not worth the inconsistency and inconvenience.
title: Close to finished with Uber

review: While on vacation my partner and I took and Uber back to our resort from a bar.  The one driver drove so recklessly and was pulled over. He lied to the cop and got a ticket. When we got home my partner realized she’s left her wallet/phone in the Uber. We called him back. He came back and gave use her hotel fob but claimed the rest wasn’t there. When I called him later after checking find my iPhone he blocked me immediately. We found the phone dumped behind a gas station with all the cash gone. Uber refused to do anything. They even refused to refund us for the ride on principle. I WILL NEVER USE THIS SERVICE AGAIN!!!  Get this the driver still works for them!!! They are morally bankrupt.
title: Reckless driver stole from us! Uber did nothing! He still works for them!!

review:
I don’t have car so I use Uber and Lyft. I have found it useful but not all the time because of the following reasons:
1.It starts giving high charges upon frequent uses despite rush hours so I switch to Lyft in those times. E.g I go to health center in 15$ while it shows 35$ when I return
2. No frequent discount or reward 
3. Drivers lack navigation skills 
4. Often drivers don’t use common sense and take long and opposite routes. Once there was a Latina driver and I asked her to take turn but she didnot listen to me . She used translator app and conveyed that map will drop me destination. It was obvious I will reach my place but it costed me money and 10 extra min. 
Same happened when a driver missed exit and it took us 20$ extra to reach the destination
5. Drivers don’t speak English sometimes so it’s hard to communicate with them 
6. Mostly drivers are talking on phone while driving 
I only like the clean n spacious cars and few min arrival.
title: Useful but faces issues

review: I used to use Uber quite a bit, but I noticed they use the same systems as airports after viewing a ride destination. I viewed a ride for $10 and checked back two minutes later to see they now want another $6 for the same exact ride and it’s not even a busy time. They up charge for no reason and half the time their destination estimates are completely wrong, making you late for the event. This is frustrating and is why I am using Lyft now. I suggest you do the same, unless you enjoy paying more for the same service.
title: Ride prices go up after viewing

review:
I want to understand that things are difficult but to constantly try and shove double or triple the cost on me is unacceptable. Especially given that those rides are 15 to 20 minutes away.

Added issues. 
It’s frustrating that a driver can cancel without penalty after 5 to 10 minutes completely throwing you off your schedule but if you decide to cancel it you’re penalized. I’m really starting to question why I use this app in the first place.
title: Price gouging

review: I don't understand how I get in the car with no issues on time and still received a low rating. I used to be close to a 5, and now I'm at 4.86. I take Uber when I have to, not every day like I used to, but I take the ride. I consistently rate a 5 and tip, and for some reason, people have the audacity to rate me a low rating even if I am doing everything right. It is not fair if I'm giving them a 5 rating and tipping and end up with a 3-4 rating at the end. It would help the riders if you guys showed what drivers rating you
title: Fix rating problem

review: The surge prices and wait times have made me not want to use the app. I use to be able to get to work on time when i had to work early morning shifts, but recently, just getting a driver now has been difficult. I have been late several times to work because there was either no drivers in my area or I had to wait up to 20+ minutes for my driver to pick me up. And there have been a few instances where the driver canceled on me, despite being less than 10 min away. And the surge prices are freaking ridiculous! $40 for a 10 min drive?!?! Really!? Something needs to change because I can no longer rely on this app to help me get to the places I need to go to on time.
title: No longer reliable

review: Honestly, i’ve been using uber for so long i was used to it costing ten bucks to go down the street but ever since Covid and quarantine started up, it’s been absolutely awful. you can pull up the app, close the app and open it again and the price of your ride is like to double, even triple. over the years it’s been nothing but glitches, drivers that take advantage of their system who will leave u in a flash (and will only wait two minutes before doing so) and there’s no really rewards to being a good person, their rating system is useless. oh an if u plan on using u we for work, get ready to sacrifice over half your paycheck and wake up two hours earlier because your scheduled ride is likely to cancel in your sleep🤗
title: horrible

review: I don’t know what really happened but from a month ago until today dated the app are really broken and not working correctly, I had been be forced to pay of rides of drivers that never get  at my house and also charged more to what the principal  payment was . The schedule trip system it’s a miss some days ago I scheduled a trip for 2:20-2:30 pm at 10:00 am to get at work and at the begging it’s was everything fine going on , until this driver start to move up and down to increased the price my trip change from 12$ to 45 $ because of that and also this driver cancel the trip and u get charged by this and also getting to work 2 hours late because of the app issues :3
title: I had being using offer for almost a year

review:
I will be deleting this App due to their open Antisemitism. I loved using Uber. Thank you for showing your true colors. You are on the wrong side of history my friends. Siding with evil will never bring good to you. I’m even sorry for you guys that you feel the need to spread hate towards a nation that throughout history has been blamed for so many things for no reason and still is. I thought you were better but I guess not. Good luck Uber! 
App deleted and account deleted.
title: Antisemites!!!

review: After a 20-hour trip home from France, David was a godsend!  Showed up quickly at the pickup point, helped us load our luggage, and had us on the way home less than 10 minutes after our luggage arrived.  On the way home, David was the perfect combination of polite conversation and respectful silence - he knew we were tired…  When we got to the house he unloaded the bags and even offered to take them to the door.  Probably our best Uber experience ever!   Thanks!
title: David was fantastic!

review: This app allows the drivers to rate the passengers, but I think it’s pretty sad. That drivers are allowed to give you a low rating just because you are unable to tip them as a tip is something you must do and I don’t mind giving a tip. the truth is that I do not always have it because I lived on fixed income, and my check only goes so far so the fact that I was rated though just because I couldn’t tip a driver is absurd the manfor the most part, most drivers are absolutely amazing. Look to the ones taking advantage and doing that kind of ridiculous stuff. Good luck with karma lol.
title: Not what I Prefer

review:
90% of the time the service is great. 
A few times I have drivers scam me out of money. The most recent the driver cancelled the trip mid ride, blamed it on an app glitch and forced me to pay cash (much more than the fare). I did not feel safe and agreed. I contacted Uber asking to be compensated for the additional charge and they told me I was out of luck.
Another time a friend left a phone in an Uber. We contacted him to come back and he demanded $100. We were then also charged by the Uber app for a return fee. 
Be careful not to get exploited by shady drivers. 
I have taken 1000’s of rides with 4.95 rating but will consider using competitors after recent experiences
title: Good most of the time

review: I had a ride with Brad this morning. He has such a great personality and energy about him. I had to drop my vehicle off at the shop and get an Uber home while it’s being fixed. Not the greatest thing happening today to have to get an Uber for, but my mood changed right away after talking to Brad for a few minutes & throughly enjoyed the car ride and conversation. What a great guy. ❤️He is professional. I felt safe. He is a also a great driver on top of being enjoyable to be around.
title: Brad

review: I have been a loyal customer of Uber for awhile now. I’m permanently disabled from a car accident and I rely on Uber to get around in my daily life. I greatly appreciate the experience and compatibility with the company. I wish there were discounts for riders with limited abilities. I thank you for your service and I’m always polite to the drivers and I make sure that they know that I appreciate them and their time. Thank you so much.
title: My experience with hello hello hello hello hi how are you going to die for you looking for

review: I’m upset that there’s no way to turn off promo related notifications. Several apps do this and Uber takes advantage of us needing notifications on to use Uber properly. I don’t like getting bombarded with the promo notifications though, they clog up my Notification Center. Also, I keep getting randomly subscribed to UberOne. Is this happening to anyone else? When I first was enrolled there was no way to cancel the subscription until I updated the app. Extremely odd. I love Uber overall though. I just wish they’d be more user friendly in some aspects of the app.
title: Could be better.

review: The basic service has mostly been fine but last night I spent 20 minutes waiting for an Uber that never showed up bc my rides kept getting cancelled. I tried to find a way to contact customer service bc this was a really frustrating situation unfortunately Uber has decided to cheap out on the customer service end and make it impossible to call them or to enter a specific complaint into their app which doesn’t fit into a pre generated format which means you can’t complain about an issue that they dont want you to complain about. This is really unacceptable for a company as big as Uber to cheap out on such a big part of their platform
title: Non existent customer service

review:
Justice is an amazing human and so very kind. We were very fortunate to have met him and he was gracious in helping us figure out how to add additional stops to our late night Dunkin run. Along the way, we talked about our careers, our hometowns, our interests (we’re students of life- always excited to learn new things), and most importantly, we discussed what things bring us joy :)

Very thankful for the opportunity to meet him and listen to a small part of what’s sure to become his incredible story!
title: WONDERFUL!

review:
Still convenient when it works, but the wait times and car availability no longer have any relationship with whether you get paired with a driver or how long it will take. The app will say “3 minutes away” and then will churn for 5-7 minutes, looking for driver. Then the first driver will cancel, then the second. Sometimes, it will stop looking and tell you to start over, despite the app showing plenty of local drivers.

Uber disrupted a taxi monopoly that had gotten woefully lazy. Now Uber’s service is coming to resemble what it replaced, making it ripe to be disrupted.
title: Used to be reliable

review:
Amex plat & gold card holder users beware!!
When booking trip or ride, if total payment exceeds available cash balance, the app locks up and you are not able to add any additional cash to your account are also unable to redeem gift cards. I am now forced to pay the full balance with a credit card and let uber cash expire at the end of the month due to the issue.  My cash balance of 8.09 cant be offset on a trip that costs 8.68 and am unable to get any assistance from Uber in rectifying the issue to allow me to use the cash balance for the transaction and to use my backup card for the remaining ~.60 cents.
title: Issue with cash balance payments

review:
Eric was a smart Uber driver 
The prior Silver QX60 Infinti driver drove right by me I express to him I was across the street he said he was too but he had passed Gardner as I was waving for him to stop I’m in a dangerous cold corner have give him the address he said I’m across the street but I said your a block away so he canceled on me leaving to fend for myself with two crazy people approaching me while waiting on Eric the second requested charge of $7.73 
Not at all the way I have driven with a 5 star rating fir over three years🚙
title: Uber Scare🚙

review: Adam in OC was such a delight.  Every time I fly into my old town, I am always greeted by just the most kindest and down to earth souls through Uber.  Adam was so heartwarming and friendly, and a complete professional.  I had a nice, quick, and comfortable ride to the airport after visiting Disney.  I don’t like taking Uber’s, but I am so grateful for their service.  Thanks for ride Uber, with the greatest appreciation for this service.  A little bit of kindness can go a long way in life…and I appreciate the help.  🤓👍🏽
title: Delightful Drives in the OC

review: Why aren’t the drivers being charged to cancel rides likes customers???? It’s been far too many times when I’ve waited 10-15 minutes for drivers to complete a trip only to have them cancel on me when they are three minutes out. I’ve spoken to a number of drivers about this and was told that they can see the trip information. Why accept the trip if it’s not one you want to make. This makes me late for work and I don’t like it. They need to be charged $5 for canceling on waiting riders. This is beyond frustrating.
title: Frustrated with the frequent driver cancellations

review: I’m new to Uber and was delighted to learn that I could reserve a car in advance as opposed to finding one on the spot. I was visiting a friend in Winter Park FL and had to make a 6:20am flight back to NY. Uber sent me reminders and the driver introduced himself ahead of time by text. He picked me up on time and was friendly, professional, and a good driver. The fare was very reasonable at $36 and I gave him a cash tip of $10. This was my first experience with Uber and I was very impressed and pleased, and look forward to using them in NY.
title: New to Uber

review: I really appreciate the Uber app and all of the drivers! I have used them in several cities and they are awesome. My only bad experience was at JFK on a Sunday night, but that isn’t so much Uber’s fault. If you’ve seen JFK arrivals on a weekend night, you understand total chaos. The problem was two drivers cancelled. Luckily, the 3rd showed up and got a great tip. All in though, Uber is awesome! The drivers are terrific as well. I don’t even  bother with the other apps because Uber is so dependable and a sure bet.
title: Great app

review: Setting up where the car will pick you up is not user friendly. You pretty much have to be an expert of the local geography to pick where you should be to get picked up. And if you make a mistake, you might be really far from the pick-up location without the ability to change locations without being forced to cancel, incur charges, and start over. So if you’re a cartographer or know precisely where you are at all times, there is nothing wrong with this app. For everyone else, though, it will leave you in a bind at some point.
title: Difficult to use

review:
Worst Uber and  only  bad Uber experience I have ever had. Took almost 2 hours to do a 35 minute ride to the airport 
Freeway half shut down but if his  foreign music wasn’t so loud and he wasn’t yelling in another language the whole time on phone he would have gotten word about the delays and taken alternate route. I had to run to make plane and I left at 815 for an 1130 flight TERRIBLE !!! I forgot to add it over almost 100 degrees I had to ask him
To put air on , and it smelled terrible in there
title: My ride yesterday

review: I’ve been using Uber for a few weeks now but very sporadically as I’m having my car repaired.   I’ve taken maybe 5 rides altogether and 2 were just cancelled.  No explanation . Just cancelled.  I’m not impressed and I cannot depend on them.  I’ll be using Lyft from now on if I need them and hopeful they’ll provide better service without cancellations.   But I must say the cars have been clean and the people friendly.  I would suggest that if the driver is listen to some cheesy talk show  and the discussion is not appropriate for everyone that they be sensitive enough to turn it off until the person has been dropped off.  It may be their car but I’m paying for it during the time I’m the passenger.
title: Cancelled trips

review: I ordered an Uber to an art exhibit in Brooklyn for my birthday. Due to an app error, I was stranded in a completely different borough. It seems like the app couldn’t find my actual location—which was put in correctly—so it took me to a different spot. The trip was around $60 and I haven’t been able to contact anyone since for a refund. I’ve tried numerous times to file a fare review claim but there’s no legitimate people to speak with anymore so the claim keeps getting denied by their refund standards (their checklist doesn’t include scenarios like mine anyway, what a shock). If anyone from the app sees this, I have receipts for you and I’m entitled to a full refund for being left stranded in a random neighborhood on my birthday.
title: GARBAGE Customer Service

review: No matter where I am, what connectivity I have, this app is so slow. Even when I try to schedule rides, the app doesn’t work. I try to find a driver but it takes 20 minutes, on top of the estimated time of arrival for pick up, which is always more than 15 minutes, and I live in a metropolitan area. I scheduled a ride a day in advance, and the ride was 20 minutes late; I scheduled a ride four hours in advance, and the ride was 30 minutes late. And on top of that, if I cancel a ride because the driver takes too long or I don’t want a driver, the app redirects me to the SAME DRIVER; I doesn’t change the driver. Im not sure if the app is bad at management or if it’s just purposefully pushing out the wait times
title: Slow app
developerResponse: {'id': 33101968, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here:\xa0https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-11-11T07:15:18Z'}

review: But there are issues. For one, they have a scripted help section but no means to contact an actual person if an issue falls outside of their script. Also, their proprietary map does not place my house in the correct location (no issues with google or Apple Maps), and there is no way to communicate that to Uber (see earlier). This makes it a process every time we want to get picked up or dropped off (or use Uber Eats). And today, I previously gave a 5 star review to a driver and the months summary email indicates it was 0 stars, though the app itself shows I gave 5 stars.
title: When it works it’s good…

review: Very unreliable drivers, very un real wait times, very poor drivers with bad driving experience and customer service skills. This app will all around just let you down. I’m waiting 30 minutes for a driver to take me 5 minutes down the road. I’m waiting 20 minutes for a driver to pick me up for the grocery store. I’m getting drivers who won’t even move after accepting my trip. This app will let you down, make you late for work and will make you pay 8-5 dollars per driver that lets you down. Not worth it. Just use the bus!
title: This app will make you late for work

review: Seriously use at your own risk. The Uber app is unreliable. It's made to charge you for each mile the driver drives. An honest drive will go the fastest way the dishonest drivers will take the longest route possible and Uber gets to keep the difference. Not only that but they tell no about the safety features in the app meant to protect not only the riders but the drivers.  The navigation system they use make the driver for in circles probably as a way to add miles. And most times they have the address wrong. And we are 2 house up or down from where the driver is waiting on us. I have witnessed this myself. And all they ever say is it's an app issue. FIX THE APP ISSUE AND STOP BLAMING THE APP
title: Uber

review:
My driver took a longer route and I was charged “distance” and “time” fee. Did not get notified, I only noticed it when I checked the receipt. I chose the pickup waiting option to save money, yet was charged more than if I got a faster pickup, AND the ride took longer. Tried to contact customer support, have been waiting for hours and no response.

One time I was charged a $40 cleaning fee after the ride (I did not make a mess, driver was trying to scam me), I wouldn’t have noticed if I didn’t look at past trips. Uber did not notify me I was charged that, clearly they do not want you to notice if you get charged for extra.

Using Uber has always been a horrible experience, Lyft is better.
title: Excessive Charging

review: I found the Uber experience to be pretty smooth, and a realistic, real time ride to my destination. I was shocked to see the initial projected cost of $86 suddenly $167. As I stood there wondering what to do the rate went over $200. So I waited a while 5 minutes maybe and checked again, it went back to $86. So I would advise people to check in advance if possible , the rate of the ride. Then you have an idea of what to expect once your standing there needing a ride, and it should prevent you from overpaying for your ride!  But Uber is very helpful in getting us where we need to go and Robert I think his name was? Was personable and a pleasure to ride with! Thanks Uber!
title: My first Uber ride!

review: Uber is great and all if things work out well but ohh as soon as something goes wrong you’ll be waiting weeks for any customer support and waiting even more days for anyone to get you anywhere towards fixing the problem. I had someone use my information to make an account and then left a balance that now I have to pay, when I don’t even live in the same country has the Uber ride. I contacted Uber support weeks ago and explained everything and even verified everything but it took them 2 weeks just to tell me I’ll have to wait for someone to help me out again. Uber has like millions of dollars in profit but can’t seem to fix their customer support system?
title: Worst customer support

review: The customer service is atrocious. This isn’t the first time I have had an issue with Uber but this is the last straw. I ordered pickup though the app, it routed my order to a restaurant 30 miles away. I try to cancel the order, the cancel order button is buried and takes forever to get to. I try to follow up with a live persons but their “chat function” takes you to a blank screen. This isn’t the first time I’ve had problems with an order, Uber has been unhelpful at best but now they won’t even tell you they are scr*wing you over. Ridiculous way to treat customers given the wide range of competitors. Switching to DoorDash and Seamless permanently.
title: Horrible Customer Service - Seamless is far superior

review: I’m trying to reserve a ride at the same time in the morning that I have always done and the ride is usually about 20 mins and usually costs close to $20 if not $20. But right now I’m trying to schedule a ride for the next day and it’s showing 40 something dollars for the same destination used to cost me less than 20! And when I try going out of the app and going in, it goes down to about 34 something dollars?! I’ve even trying different days and hours to see if it’s a problem with the app and it gives me the same price for everyday/every hour!! It didn’t used to give me this problem so I’m not sure what is going on. I just need the app to work so I can get rides.
title: Prices are inaccurate

review: Never had an issue with Uber before. The other night I took a trip that was displayed to cost 30-50 dollars. Instead I was charged 111. When I reached out to customer service they gave me a 20 dollar credit. That’s all. They keep explaining what dynamic pricing and saying that they are sorry I payed more than expected. I’m contacting them because I PAYED MORE THAN WHAT WAS DISPLAYED. I understand Friday night price surges . What I don’t understand is promising one price and charging a price 2-3 times that. I also don’t understand the failure of customer service to understand and resolve the issue, or to even take the time to understand what the complaint is. I don’t want your 20 dollars, I want an explanation.
title: False pricing and bad customer service

review: I love the fact than Uber drivers who are too stupid to know how to find something as simple as a driveway can work for this company. I had at least 3 different drivers cancel rides because they passed my house going 15+ over the speed limit and I can’t do anything about it because you can’t review drivers who cancel on you. Only the other way around. As someone who relies on Uber and Lyft to get to work it’s insanely frustrating. I’ve started using Lyft more because I deal with less issues like this but getting written up for being late because Uber drivers don’t know how to slow down and drive like a normal person isn’t exactly a good experience. And there’s no way to contact customer support about this issue either.
title: Rather use Lyft

review: I had an Uber driver who had been through life just like me and who understood the hustling I’m in the process of and could be real with me and I appreciate the help he offered me and the advice he gave me to continue working towards the goals I’ve set forth for myself. Thank you! Whether it’s Krishna or Gandhi or Jesus I appreciate the guidance I’ve been able to receive and make sure I acknowledge and learn from it to continue for my growth and for the future. Let’s get moving y’all!
title: Great service

review: I have always had issues with drivers dropping rides after many minutes of waiting for them. For example, the estimated arrival time may indicate 13 minutes and then after waiting 10 minutes the driver drops the job.  Very unhappy and it happens all of the time.  Not cool and it’s upsetting.   Then the next driver takes the job and we again wait for the arrival of the car only to be dropped once again.  Usually wind up waiting45 minutes for another driver to finally show up!  You need to penalize drivers for doing this!
title: Dropped rides by drivers

review:
I’ve only used Uber a few times but reserved a round trip via Uber Black SUV  several days in advanced to attend the John Meyer concert at the CFG Arena in Baltimore. I received confirmation and the names of both drivers. 

However, I just happen to check the site the day before and noticed my trip failed and had been canceled with no explanation and no way of contacting the company for clarity. Luckily, I was able to rebook but only reserved a one-way trip since it was a 10minute walk.

Wish the company could do more to expand possible mishaps and advise customers when reservations are cancelled.
title: Failed

review: I use Uber allot but when I got out of the hospital from a major surgery I couldn’t carry grocery up my stairs or stand up long enough to cook for myself so I started using Uber eats and it saved my life by bringing me groceries and dinners to my door , I save allot of friends from drunk driving by getting them rides home from the bar and it’s very affordable and safe , I’m working on my car rite now and just got car parts almost instantly, I can’t say enough how much I love using Uber !!! ♥️
title: Uber is awesome

review: On September 17, 2023 I ordered an Uber to take me to the airport. I had been waiting for a bus that never showed.  I was desperate to make my flight. The charge, when I booked Uber, would be approximately $80. When the driver arrived, he asked how much I was being charged. I told him. He suggested that I cancel the Uber and pay him $75 in cash or electronic transfer. I was desperate for the ride so I complied. I had put in the wrong airport and the actual airport I was to go to was very close. I told him I should pay him less and he reminded me I had agreed to $75. I paid him. I will caution others about Uber. Uber should do a better job of screening drivers. As a matter of goodwill, Uber should refund my $75 in cash plus the cancellation fee.
title: Dishonest Uber Driver

review: I love Uber but I haven’t used Uber in several years. I don’t have a need for it now that we’re retired. Had a great experience today! I did book a ride ahead of time and no one showed up. Booked another driver this morning at 4:15a.m. Our nicely dressed driver showed up in 4 minutes. He was excellent! Clean car and great driver! He said he’s been an Uber driver for 6 years. Thank you for your loyalty and professionalism! Thanks for getting my son and his family there safe too!  A++++++
title: Great Experience!

review: Driver was polite and drove carefully to my destination. 1 comment on another ride I didn’t get picked up at 30 Ringwood Ave Ringwood NJ . I waited 2 hours for a pick up I kept getting as only minutes away . Each time driver got within a mile or so of my location it got taken by someone else . I then got charged a booking fee with no recourse . I didn’t cancel at any time during the 2 hour wait . Foolish policy. Don’t pick a rider up certainly after 2 hrs waiting then fees shouldn’t be charged .
title: Review

review: Christmas Eve Day - had pre-arranged pickup to go to the airport.  The app continually said “on time for 7am pickup”. But no driver was shown on the map.  Again and again it claimed the 7am pickup was “on time”.  Finally, at 2 min. to 7, I noticed a tiny font at the bottom of the screen:  “A driver may not be available”.   THANKS FOR NOTHING!!  Why not reach out to TELL me that I would be abandoned???  Be honest if you are going to fail me!!  Complaint #2:   Drivers are first shown to be coming to my house, but then they turn away, don’t take the easy turns, go in loops, and the indicated mileage and timing go UP, instead of getting closer.  This has happened twice in a row, and I live in inner eastside Portland.  BAD service last three trips.
title: Messed up 3 x in a row.

review: Stephanie was right on time when she picked me up in Hoboken . She was helpful and kind . Despite differences in beliefs , she showed respect and paid attention  giving feedback to our conversation . As an excellent driver who knew what she was doing , she maneuvered  the difficult  NJ/ NY traffic without complaining or getting irritated which would have made me nervous too. But she dropped me off at the Queens airport right at the predicted time . I’d say it was an easy drive that could have been hectic . Thank you Stephanie.
title: Pleasant

review: Kamal was simply amazing! Although I had no expectations nor requirements for him to help us load our luggage into his vehicle, he took the initiative and did it hisself. So, from the beginning, he was very accommodating and customer service focused. During the drive, he provided us with plenty of helpful information regarding local attractions and much more. He was just an overall pleasant person and you can tell that he’s a genuine soul. I highly recommend him as an Uber driver!
title: Fantastic Person & Great Uber Driver!

review: Just like a drug kingpin, Uber flooded the market with cheap ride alternatives and promising revenue generation. All the while burning cash in tecord fashion to get us all addicted. Now we’re to that point of no return. The prices have skyrocketed and now taking a cab is often cheaper, while drivers earn less than ever before. I rarely find a driver that says they’re happy with Uber. How can this be? All the overhead of a cab company doesn’t exist? Well this company now serves shareholders and not consumers.  I deactivated my account as a frequent business traveler due to their service moving in the opposite direction of their prices. However they hold my account for 30 days, funny they think I’d actually come back, to that I say HA.
title: Shell of Itself

review:
By now, we know this is way better than any taxi. Still true after all the ups and downs. 

Every time I get a ride I make a new friend. This is almost one of the only things like that, now.

Uber, please pay better. I do tips but you know at this point that the platform is mature… Create a foundation and donate the platform as freeware, then go figure out self driving deliveries for stuff and things. People can still be with people, and you guys can still have your home run exit.
title: Not much to add. still good service. Great drivers.

review: For a long time I was not using Uber because I got double charged a few times and now I’ve started back to using Uber versus Lyft, and I absolutely love using Uber!! a lot of the Lyft are rude and hateful and will leave you after three minutes in your stuff will be in the vehicle have never had that done to me when using Uber all drivers have been exceptionally nice to me and very helpful especially since I have a brain injury right now and I’m getting ready to have surgery
title: Love Uber

review: In a world where things are constantly unsafe, and you never know, it’s gonna happen any day. It’s nice to know that a technology company that doesn’t claim to offer rideshare services is invested in the safety of its riders. There is a new feature where you can record your ride with your driver and then have it sent to Uber. If you felt unsafe or uncomfortable, I tried it out just to see how it worked and I really enjoyed the comfort that it brought me.
title: Uber’s new feature about recording rides

review: So since Monday last week on the days that I have to go to and from work was well as the mall on Friday last week the destination of where I was heading was not showing up for my Uber driver even after giving them the PIN number does not show up on their end and on my end it does not show up as well as the estimate time of arrival when heading to my destination it makes no sense whatsoever trying to figure out why!?!
title: Destination issues

review: Not only does it depend on the driver you get, but the price for the same trip fluctuate so much I paid as little as $12 for the trip to work and as much as $26, makes no sense and some of the drivers are cool, and some of them are just ok… I should be driving for Uber, but Uber is not open to people of had any kind of issues in our life, I could do a better job than most of the drivers, I really could and I have a class the commercial drivers license and drove for Boston duck tours in the past, so how do I apply? Gene Ouellette
title: Uber is not consistent

review:
1) The new Vegas “Booking Fee” is ridiculous! Definitely will rarely ever use Uber ever again. 

2) What really peeves me is that I get charged for canceling and drivers do not. If I am waiting 10 minutes at the train station and the driver then cancels, now I have to wait for additional time to get a ride. Now taxis are starting to sound better. 3) Pick up and drop off locations need to be better. Even the drivers know that riders sometimes can’t cross the street to be picked up because it’s a large heavily trafficked road. 4) Lastly, drivers often do not follow Uber’s pickup instructions at airports. They will go to “Arrivals” instead of the instructed “Departures” thus creating a mess!
title: RIDICULOUSLY OVERPRICED
developerResponse: {'id': 1667390, 'body': "We appreciate you reaching out to us with the feedback. You can always reach out to us via the in-App HELP option or on help.uber.com as it allows us to collect more information so that we can resolve your issue quickly. For specific issues, let us know by heading to t.uber.com/contact and we'll be sure to follow up.", 'modified': '2017-11-05T16:15:59Z'}

review: I used to have no problem with Uber but ever since I have been in Denver the drivers cancel on me each time I request a ride, even when I booked the Uber 2 weeks in advance still cancelled and it doesn’t hook you up to a new driver fast enough I almost missed a flight because of this. Sometimes it doesn’t give a new driver. What’s the point of requesting a ride in advance if they are just going to cancel on you and not find you a new ride? I’m an out of state student so when I got flew back and requested a ride they cancelled again. I am losing interest with Uber because of this. I don’t want to have to panic when I’m on a time crunch.
title: Disappointed

review: Every now and then they ask for phone number updating or whatever, and every time  I try to confirm my phone number it says “phone number already taken” when I never gave away my phone number, now I gotta use a text now number because Uber won’t let me use my OWN phone number to get rides, tried to do 2 step-verification and when i put the password it says “incorrect password” even when I reset the password it still says “wrong password” it’s irritating because I use Uber to go to work and it’s not the first time this has happened, fix this issue, it’s not right👎🏽 I got my number completely fine on Uber eats but can’t use it on Uber rides??! Ridiculous man
title: Phone number

review: The app is good but the bait and switch is unbelievable. When I had my foot operated on I took the same route around the same time every day. One day, after I was given the quote and my bank told me that they were putting a hold the amount the driver showed up and without saying anything took me to my destinations and then doubled the charge. It was impossible to get any meaningful communication from Uber and after about a month of frustration I just let it go. It is very difficult to deal with a company that has no customer service. Lift is much better because at least they stick to with what they tell you they’re going to charge you.
title: The app is good but the bait and switch is unbelievable.
developerResponse: {'id': 2900169, 'body': "We appreciate you reaching out to us with the feedback. You can reach out to us via the in-App HELP option or on help.uber.com as it allows us to collect more information so that we can resolve your issue quickly. If there's anything specific, let us know by heading to t.uber.com/contact and we'll follow up.", 'modified': '2018-03-22T12:20:42Z'}

review:
Their own app states that they will send an alert when food has arrived. Also my delivery notes state to “ring doorbell”. Nonetheless my food including soup sat outside for 15+ minutes in 39 degrees until I decided to check outside. For charging over $7 in fees plus over $9 in tip on top of the base order this is unacceptable for me to have no idea my food has arrived. I contacted customer service and the BEST they could offer was a promise to review the order for training purposes.

Use this app only if you care nothing for service or enjoy having to reheat all of your food  or better yet, don’t mind if your neighbors see your food out there and feel like tampering with it.
title: Terrible service and lacking any communication

review: What needs to be fixed is the cost of the rides, there is no way it should cost $25 for a 5 minute ride; Its a finesse. They try to use the excuse of “there aren’t many drivers in the area” but we all know how many people do uber so I’m not sure how this is even an excuse either. Then the uber map has drivers taking the longest possible route available just to make the trip appear longer than what it actually is as an excuse to charge the most ridiculous fee. The “point system” is not great; they’ll give a different amount of points despite traveling to and from the same location.
title: Was better when it first came out

review: They put a hold on your card for the estimate then charge you again sometimes up to three times. Normally when something puts a hold on money in your account they take payment from the money that is on hold. But not Uber! They put 3 separate charges on my account for one ride, overdrawn my account got me a huge overdraft fee and they have no contact number you just have to use the app and pray the problem gets fixed. Never had any issues with the drivers, just with Uber putting too many charges on my account. This happens way too much.
title: Puts hold on money then charges you again multiple times

review: I took an Uber trip recently where i was charged $120 cleaning fee. Upon entering the uber, we had just come from a pool party in Las Vegas. Only one passenger was damp and left a small water mark on the seat. After our ride, the uber proceeded to charge a $120 cleaning fee - mind you that charge is how much a bodily fluids/vomit clean up would be. So clearly the driver was trying to SCAM ME. I reported this to uber and explained the situation. THEY SIDED WITH THE DRIVER. Even after I pulled up their policy multiple times that clearly states “$0 - items that can be thrown away or wiped up quickly; minor mess caused by water”. DO NOT RIDE UVER AT ANY COST!!! THEY WILL SCAM YOU AND THEY WILL SIDE WITH THE DRIVER. Not customer service focused AT ALL. Ride at your own risk - or should i say at your wallets risk.
title: USE LYFT UNLESS YOU LIKE BEING SCAMMED!!!!

review:
Now I’ve been on few continents, using all types of transportation…but when I try to schedule a pick up few days ahead at PIE and this app is saying pick up at this location unavailable in any place I tried around this airport…is completely useless!
When I tried to find a ride now, pick up is available in few minutes…not sure why you cannot reserve ahead instead of last minute? We want peace of mind that the ride will be ready at the time we booked, not whenever they want to show up…like you can see from the majority of reviews. Our time is way more expensive so delays are unacceptable
title: Tampa airport cannot reserve pickup

review: I’ve always hated this company. I swear other than the nice drivers (which they have certainly nothing to do with) they mess up at every turn. I know this review will do nothing or mean nothing to them but they have caused so much frustration and worry every time I fool myself into using this app. Don’t rely on it if you have to catch a flight. Uber will wait until you’re ready to go to tell you to update your credit card info and then cancel the ride. Spending way too much money parking at the airport still feels better than using this garbage app from a company that couldn’t care less. I hope this company fails just like they continue to fail their customers.
title: Actually motivated to review

review: Made a reservation for very early morning.   Was not advised that making a reservation cost an additional $6.   No way to call or check if anyone was actually coming and the    Driver was 15-20 minutes late.  He said sorry, there is no one out at this hour(???)      At the Orlando airport, he dropped me a long ways from my airline’s ticketing counter, saying something it being  safer to drop me there.   Because of this, I didn’t see the curbside check-in, which is quick, and I was in line so long, in addition to walking to the counter and arriving late because the ride was late,  I barely made my flight.   I did get a $10 credit automatically because he was late.   Not a good experience
title: Not a fan

review: I used to use Uber a lot, but recently my experiences have been pretty bad. The last couple of weeks of me trying to get a ride, all the drivers are 15+ minutes away and it constantly pesters me to get a more expensive ride, sometimes it even offers luxury vehicles that are 4x the price. As if though I’m going to choose that and pay $35 instead of $7 to go a couple miles. Then, this morning out of sheer luck I score a regular priced UberX only to discover at the end of the ride, that it took the money from my PayPal AS WELL as the money from my gift card balance! Essentially paying twice for the ride! Go ahead and keep that extra money, Uber. You won’t be getting anymore from me.
title: Terrible.

review:
This is the first time I’ve ever taken an Uber and i was really nervous because I was being picked up at 4:30 a.m. and needed to be to the airport by 5…. Plus I reserved a few weeks in advance.. 
It was a wonderful experience! My driver Kevin showed up well in advance and was so pleasant and courteous.. we had a lively conversation on our way to the airport! 
Total game changer for me for traveling.. No more putting my friends and family out.. no more trying to figure out parking.. YAY FOR UBER!!! 😁😁😁😁😁 5 smiles!
title: First Time Ubering!

review: As a first time Uber App user, I was very impressed with the driver and her customer friendly demeanor. Due to Amanda being so amazing. I will totally continue using Uber. I have also learned that you can not pick a female or male as a driver, but I must let you know as a female, during certain hours or for females who have not had the best experience with men, that option would be a win-win. Thanks Amanda for making me feel safe and getting me to my location safe. You are a rockstar
title: Uber Virgin

review:
So many times I’ve got drivers and they weren’t the driver in the photo uh that’s not ok ! I’ve also got a few where I’ve got drivers asking me and my child private question like do we live where they pick us up at how long have we been there ! Uh really weird I would not answer him there where also ones where they would go in our account and steal our money I don’t care how much money it was it the principal of the matter of what they did so much has happen with this company then one person says oh why don’t you just call customer service there no number on my app !!!! I have had some good people 
Not all of them are like the ones I’ve had
title: What can I say and where do I start

review:
when i first started using uber it was fantastic. there was always a driver available to get me to and from work and i would always be connected with a driver soon after requesting a ride, plus the prices were great. now, i would have to wait at least 10 minutes to get a ride, if they don’t cancel. i’ve been late to work a handful of times because drivers have been canceling on me. i don’t have a car and i have to use uber to get to and from work, and now i can’t rely on it anymore.

another issue i’ve experienced plenty of times is the wait time/arrival time being incorrect. when i go to book a ride it may say 7 minutes away, but i end up waiting twice as long. also, the app used to show in the ride details the time of arrival underneath the address, but this has gone away, so it’s more difficult to tell when i would be arriving at my destination.
title: used to be great, not reliable anymore.

review:
Of all the Uber drivers from the past, that I rode with UBER, he was the best, I cannot say enough about him. He went above his call of duty to help me carry the stuff up the stairs and inside the hallway. I just got off a surgery from the hospital and then the convalescent home and I needed help and he was there he was really GOD-sent.

You have a valuable worker for you he deserves a big raise, and then some.  Please take good care of him. He is a valuable employee.  UBER is very blessed to have him.
title: Ubong , above and beyond, somebody very special

review:
I engaged a chat with my driver like I always do on all my Uber rides. I realized how unfairly this company has been treating his drivers. They only get a small portion of the increasingly high cost of the rides with no benefit and having to spend their own money for gas, insurance and pay their car loans.

I know corporations are heartless. But you need to make an effort to be at least a little bit more fair to your drivers. You only can keep up because of them.
title: Be fair to your drivers!

review:
I used UBER to offer a ride home to a relative and I had to try 4 times to add a tip.  It said something was wrong with my card— but I could not find anything.  So I ended up deleting the card and using a different one. It also reflected a separate .30 charge from I don’t know what (past) and could not get any  info on that.

Lastly, since I didn’t take the ride myself but didn’t want to give a 5 star rating . My relative said the driver was “fine” but then I could not submit without answering more questions that I did not know the answer to— so I gave him a 5 rating just to be done with the whole thing.  

Next time I will try Lyft. This was a drag.
title: App is time consuming to use and frustrating

review:
When I requested a trip, was quoted $60 for the trip (with route that included tolls). However, ended up being charged $70 (additional $10) post-trip where I didn’t change the destination nor pick-up point (with an automated message saying it’s because of tolls and fees).

And now there’s very limited ways for you to contact support directly. In the past, you’re able to chat directly with support when there’s a fare difference to get it rectified (and in the past get a response fairly fast). Now, the App has limited this feature, and you’re only chatting with a bot (if you even get the ability to raise about it)
title: Trip quotes no longer accurate. Random fees & tolls now added post-trip

review: Worst customer service ever both live chat and phone with rep plus “manager”. Seconds after placing our order i was in live chat trying to cancel, the Rep told me i was would still be charged full price if i went forward with the cancellation, this went on for about 30m while still getting notifications saying our canceled order was still being processed. While this was going on being frustrated n all we went to Wendy’s, came back to the hotel to see the Applebees order in front of our room 😡😡🤬🤬🤬….today i called customer service spoke to an individual and a “manager” to be disappointed… never again will i deal with Uber eats
title: Stole my money! Worst customer service

review: I’m a frequent user it’s getting worse all the time . Uber is now letting drivers cancel trips without any penalty and without reason . I just came from an international flight ,I had 4 drivers cancel on me after I waited for each one of them for a few minutes . The final driver ( # 5) said that probably many drivers cancel since they are higher rates in lyft and don’t want to take my ride.  Uber should not allow this
title: Uber getting worse by the moment

review: ive worked in customer service for 6 years. There is no direct phone number, you have to chat in app or email them. i have an issue that has taken 6+ hours to resolve because no one is understanding my issue. If there was a direct line this could’ve been solved in maybe 20 minutes. i’ve contacted their twitter and all they can do is refer me to the app/email. i've never been treated by a company like this in my life 0/5 stars
title: terrible customer service support

review:
At first I was satisfied. Everything worked and I hadn’t had any problems. One day I had a driver cancel a ride; I was not given a reason or refund. I was very unhappy. Less than a year ago I bought a gift card for myself with the cash tips I had earned and applied it to my account without incident. I reserved a ride for a later date and when the time came for the ride it said my ride had been canceled due to an invalid pay method. 
It took forever to find a way to get ahold of the support team and they failed to fix the problem or refund my hard earned money. I will NEVER use any of their services ever again
title: Never Again!

review: It's astonishing and infuriating that you, as a company, seem to believe that one person could be both a rider *and* a driver, and that they'd use different email addresses for the accounts *¿¿but then use the same _phone number_??* Let me be the first to inform you, Yes Uber, it is in fact quite a bit easier to procure a second, third, or forty-second email address than it is to acquire even a second SIM-based phone number. I know, I thought it was a wild dream, too. But it's real, and your table indexes should reflect it. Unless you really want to senselessly stymie your own ability to receive money from a cross-section of your customers. I'm sure that Lyft isn't complaining.
title: Drop Unique Index idx_phone_number On Table users;

review: I’m unable to use my Uber cash to order a ride, the Uber cash i have is over $100 and is set as my default payment method. When I try to order a ride it asks me to select a payment method while the app selects the Uber cash as the default payment and doesn’t recognize the cash as a payment method, when I try to select a gift card as a payment method it asks to input the pin of a new gift card, it’s so frustrating.
title: Uber Ride app doesn’t recognize my Uber cash

review: Earlier this year I was going to the airport.  First Uber didn’t show.  App says try again.  Second Uber didn’t show.  I changed my flight (which I would have missed otherwise) and called a taxi.  When reviewing my Amex I see that not only did they charge me, but it was Uber Amsterdam - a fraudulent charge with foreign currency.  I filed fraud report and am waiting on my replacement Amex card.  The Amex rep said this happens all the time where they have bad charge and with one customer who didn’t catch it, their whole credit line was wiped out a year later with charges.  Check your credit card - compare it with your trips!  Stop this nonsense.  Time for Lyft!
title: No show and then charge me in a foreign country

review: Now y’all i don’t even do reviews but yesterday I took a ride that’s literally like 15 mins away and I was charged $21 something which I was ok with and then later that day they changed it to $41 because the driver took a different route then they suggested which wasn’t even my decision and when I brought it to their attention they changed it back and today I was charged the rest of the $41 because THEY CHANGED IT BACK AGAIN to an incorrect total and I text them and they said they were unable to do anything even though I had screenshots and all. They were no help whatsoever and wasn’t trying to find a solution it was just oh I can’t do anything about that even though THEY CHARGED MY CARD THE INCORRECT AMOUNT !

Really hope Uber can have better ways to let the driver know the ride is a scheduled ride instead of the ride that goes right away. It’s been happened a lot of times that the driver would cancel the ride in a minute or so after they arrived to pickup spot and I can’t got a actual ride until the time pasted the time I need.

After chatting with some of the drivers, the drivers said that the notification to show it’s a scheduled ride is hardly noticeable so a lot of time they will assume is the regular ride.
title: About Pre-scheduled Ride

review: I was not notified about Surge pricing, and I would have just taken Lyft instead of paying double.  This is what I will do from now on, and I already took a Lyft for my way back from the airport. Lyft always sticks to its price estimate, unlike you who abuse the trust I put in you by giving you my credit card information to charge double. What kind of surge definition are using in order to justify applying surge pricing to a trip taken at 5 AM? Thieves!
title: Charged double for a tripbat 5 AM, because of "surge"

review: I’m having an issue with payment methods on the app, I added 3 different credit cards from 3 different banks and none of them are being accepted as a payment method, I checked with my banks and they said there is not issues or hold ups from their sides so I contacted Uber and they said they will look into it and few days later they said they can’t help me with the issue and they won’t respond back to my messages as there is nothing they can do!!!!!! What does that mean!! If they can’t help me on their app who can! I’m so surprised by the answer and by the lack of their effort to help me fix this issue, I’m abroad and I use Uber constantly as my transportation method and this is what I get from them.
title: Customer service

review: App was great - very convenient for getting around. However, I set up a family profile to cover the rides of my loved ones. Now I cannot access the family profile on my app. I’ve been looking for a customer service rep to speak to - only to be told to go to the help center, which instructs me to look in settings for the family profile tab - which does not exist. What is going on? This is frustrating beyond belief.
title: Family Profile not working

review: The first Uber driver that I requested for this pick up was a nightmare not speak English didn’t want to go to the pick up wanted it to be outside of LAX. Even from the Uber pick up I asked him if he was not gonna go and he said, no I said does this cancel the Uber he said yes and then charge for the cancellation. I don’t understand this. Luckily the second Uber driver turned out to be a godsend, wonderful young man. Wonderful conversation very cordial, great manners, and a good driver. Thank you so much.
title: My 2nd Uber Driver for same request

review: I have a 4.5 rider rating and have used Uber multiple times a week for years; i even pay extra for Uber one. So I needed to get to the airport today and decided to try the pre-book feature because I’ve been having a lot of Ubers cancel after the ride was already confirmed. So I woke up, checked the app: all good! 15 minutes before my ride, checked again: a driver was assigned, he was five minutes away! I go out to meet him, and there’s no car. Then I get a cancellation alert  and “sorry we were unable to find you a driver message.” Um, I had a driver? What happened? Thanks Uber for making me almost miss my flight, and then offering no alternatives or compensation.
title: Pre booking a ride is a joke

review: This app makes fifteen minutes rides be over $30. It should not be that expensive for a quick ride. And if the weather is rainy or anything but sunny then the prices jump 2x that rate. The wait time for the Uber to pick you up is sometimes over 10 or 15 minutes. So don’t ever use them if you’re in a rush. The shared rides are not a specific price, they’re a price range and it’ll say something like $13-$18 and then charge you the highest price listed anyway. It’s just a scam to get you to pay the high prices making you think you’ll get a cheaper price. And it won’t tell you how much you’ll be paying until after you already get into the car. That’s extremely stupid
title: Overpriced
developerResponse: {'id': 16356724, 'body': "Hi Sara, the trip fare and pricing is subjective to demand and supply in the area at the time. It constantly changes with the rise/fall in either factor. We are working towards the fare policies to make it fair for both our riders and partners. For further queries, reach out to us at t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2020-07-02T09:05:22Z'}

review: I Booked a ride and realized the reservation was  an hour after, I did not know how to cancel because I never had to cancel a ride before but figured I could call them. I could not find a phone #only a 3rd party chatbot. Then finnally I did get someone on the chatbot on the app and all they said was we will look into it and would hear back in 24 hours. Then charged me for canceling. I just needed to know where I go to cancel the ride or if they could change it to earlier. So I had to make a new reservation so I got charged twice for the same ride and a cancelation fee hopefully they will  refund and I’ll change the review but they asked for a rateing so here it is.
title: Could not find customer service

review: It would have been nice if he could have understood my question.  I was confused as I have never got an Uber before and wanted to know if I could pay cash or will it go to my Credit card since I did give all that information when scheduling my ride.  Not sure what to dom husband gave him $40 but then took back $20. He did a good job driving and getting us there on time but should have been able to understand can't communication having to do with the job. I am not happy that a 6 min trip cost me over $50 all because of a language barrier.
title: Language barrier

review:
Daniel is the most professional driver in had. He’s was very courteous, appropriate, great conversationist, well mannered and again, very professional. I enjoy conversations and he didn’t mind as well. What can I say, he was everything I wanted in an Uber driver. I was very pleased and over the top with Daniel. He is the absolute best, he was AWESOME!!!!
Again, Daniel was the best an complied with everything I requested. Uber need to hire more professional drivers like Daniel. I say anything but I enjoyed the entire experience.

A. Reeves
title: Professional

review: I had the luck to be connected with David when my BMW broke down. David arrived promptly in his spotless Tesla 3, with a cooler in the ‘frunk’ with water. He helped unload the BMW, took me to the hotel, helped unload again,  all within 15 minutes. I called him later seeking lost vehicle keys. Sure enough I dropped them in his car. He returned within 30 minutes so BMW could work on my car. All-in-all a great experience. Professional and friendly, I recommend him to all.
title: David, the Firefighter in Corpus Christi, is exceptional!

review: I don’t like your app.  It is very tough to swap between personal and business profiles and payment methods. Often, my business rides end up on my personal card and they use the Uber rewears $ too.  So I end up with no personal rewards.  Further, you are impossible to contact to resolve issues.  Also, many times you try to make airport pickups default to the main terminal.  But many pilots like myself go to FBO businesses elsewhere on the airport. This makes drivers get mad at us because we haven’t put throw the pick up location because we’re unable to do so. Let me choose to tell the driver where I actually am on the airport instead of to faulting me to a place I am not. This app is very uncool.
title: Uncool App

review:
Last night we ate at a restaurant across from the street where we ate tonight. We requested a ride, and was picked up in front of the restaurant last night and taken Directly to our lodging. 

Tonight we requested a ride from 35 n Illinois twice. The drivers both ended up at 700 north Illinois. I contacted the one and he just ended up ghosting us. The second driver we contacted also went to 700 north Illinois, roughly 6.5 blocks from our location. I sent him texts, he was argumentative with me, and wanted us to hoof it over 6 blocks to his location instead of coming to where we were at. 

I’m a disabled military veteran, and cannot walk that far. And also a senior citizen. 

I understand I was charged partially for the two no shows. This is unfair, and certainly no my fault in any way shape or form.  If this is the way that Uber is operating, I’ll not be using this service ever again. 

I only use this service rarely, not likely again in the future. This service was just horrible, unfair, and totally unacceptable.  

Regards, Rick Gibbs
title: Uber completely failed this time.

review: I was in Indiana a couple of weeks ago. I did not use Uber since 2019 I took two Uber and paid the charges and tips and then I was charged $5.44. When I look at the app I see that there was a cancel right in JFK airport in April 20 20 this was the height of Covid and I reside in the US Virgin Islands where I was somebody try to use my Uber account when I logged into the account and put my new credit card in 2023 Uber charge me the $5.54. I tried contacting them but there’s no way to contact them, I send a text message on the app. This is horrible. I expected better from a company like uber. where is the customer service? It is poor. There should be regulations against such horrible business practice.
title: fraudulent company

review: I have been ordering on Uber for years and I tip well. I made an order today and the app, which already has my address, messed up and sent the delivery man about 15 miles away. He called me and we had a short talk and he said he would call uber. Uber messed up and got the wrong address because they choose to fill their pockets instead of bettering their online system. They sent me some dumb email saying I would be charged for the order because the food was already made. I don’t need another dumb response from Uber, I am happy with never using it again. This is just to warn other people that Uber is just another ghetto app that doesn’t admit their own mistakes.
title: Charged Me For Their Mistake

review: Uber Eats will rip you off Told me my order was coming never came after hours I called the store to confirm the order it was never sent to them Uber then finally cancelled my order and put the money into my Uber Wallet but I didn’t want to use the app anymore I just drove and got it. Today I decided I’ll try and get something and the almost 50 dollar refund is just gone and the order says cancelled not refunded it’s pathetic and I won’t use this app again
title: Scammers
developerResponse: {'id': 33469775, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest", 'modified': '2022-12-01T08:48:15Z'}

review: I waste more time contacting uber to have fees adjusted than anything.  This is not a critic about the drivers, I have only had one horrible one.  For the most part the drivers are great.  But the backend billing is horrid.  I have been fighting with them back and forth over a fee I never should have been charged in Oct!  Have used it all of Nov and then in Dec the same fee is back.  If this app does not get paid at the time of requesting a ride YOU DO NOT RIDE.  So its beyond my comprehension why they have charged me for the same fee 4times.  Forget speaking to someone they give you a number and you call it an automated voice says sorry we do not recognize the number.  I rather pay for a regular taxi or drive.
title: Just over it

review: I have been using Lyft and Uber for the past few months to get to work every day. The only reason you should ever use Uber is because there are no lyfts available. Uber’s rides are more expensive, by about 25%. This gets worse when trying to schedule a ride, as sometimes Uber will try to charge you $35 for a ten minute ride, whereas Lyft will keep it at $10. Plus half the features on Uber like adding stops don’t even work anyway.
title: Get Lyft, Uber is a last resort

review: We requested the largest Uber we could get and twice now the driver has showed up in a Prius. Both times I had left written instructions, saying that there were four passengers and six pieces of luggage. The second time a Prius showed up the driver argued that it was the largest vehicle that Uber had. after I canceled them within five minutes a large Toyota van showed up on both occasions and we were able to get our rides. Both of the van drivers were very good. However the driver of the second Prius was anything but polite.
title: Uber vehicle sizes.

review: I use über frequently and über eats as well. The über 1 membership has come in handy. The only negative so far has been leaving restaurant reviews, which is limited. And then getting a refund is wonky on those rare occasions when an order gets messed up. To be fair, it’s only happened once, which I cannot say about other platforms. Nevertheless, the über cash refund was supposed to be $5 according to the email. Looks like it was $2 or  $3 then it conveniently disappeared. Still less nonsense than other platforms.
title: Uber 1

review:
Update: every time I try to use Uber from an airport it switches my driver 3-4 times, wasting 20-30 minutes.  It’s getting too frustrating, I’m genuinely hopeful someone comes along and drives them out of business or forces them to make the service better. 

Original: I don’t know what happened to Uber, but it’s getting worse and worse. Aside from the incredibly long waits and unexplained driver cancellations, the routes it sends to drivers are 5-10 minutes slower than the best routes. Seriously awful, I only use Lyft now, and am considering going back to regular taxis. Sad, but it’s true! Elegant user interface can’t save poor service and poor functionality.
title: Overpriced and slow drivers, bad routes

review: I always used Uber to get to and from places when the weather was too cold or If it got too dark. I still don’t know why I was charged so much for a ride that had my pick up and drop off location exactly the same when I MADE sure I had the destination set to my home(for some reason it didn’t set to my home). I was then advised by my Uber driver to change my drop off location to my actual destination however it charged me $15 extra even though we never moved from where I was picked up. I tried to search everywhere on google to see if they had a phone number or email to reach a real person but to no avail. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE CENTER IN SIGHT!
title: Horrible/Nonexistent Customer Service

review: I use Uber a lot for personal and professional travel, and the Future Rides UX is sorely lacking and highly frustrating. It’s frustrating that after you book a future ride, you’re not able see anything about it apart from the minimal, “untappable” info in Rides > Future rides. Where is the map? The driver info? The driver’s messages? The content you see when you book a “Now” ride? Messages from my driver disappear if I don’t access them via my notification on my phone… why would the not show up in “Messages”? All so annoying.
title: Great rides, Clunky app!

review: So I sexually assaulted driving October 10th 2021. They did nothing but make it possible for the guy to get away with it. I lost my job,my car and everything and now they won’t any of my cards so I can go to the emergency room or Apple Pay or anything. My life has been a nightmare because of them and can’t afford any other way to get there and the time wasted and they just let me ad a card and then it declines at the end and whips the card out and try a different card and does the same. Put money on Apple Pay and then it only comes up Venmo and it declined that too. They are literally costing me and please use someone else for rides and stop using them.
title: What they have done to me is just crazy

review: Quirky app.  Schedule two rides.  I noticed it but couldn’t get back to the first ride it scheduled ( two hours wait time).  I scheduled another ride because I couldn’t find the first ride in the app after looking and looking and looking and looking.  The 2nd ride was there within 5 minutes!  I kept looking for the 2nd ride all the way home and never found it in the app.  1-1/2 hours later another driver said he /she was at the pickup point.  He/she also said they were sharing the driver app and there was a different car/different driver named to pick me up.  Now I’m out $30+ because this app doesn’t work where you can see and cancel a mistaken order!
title: Quirky app.  Costs you for their quirky app

review: I have never tried Uber until I flew into an airport recently . Before I flew in to my destination, I downloaded the Uber app to see how much a ride would cost. It ranged around $70 so thought I would try Uber when I arrived. When I landed, I launched the app and the cost was around $125, almost double but I was in need so tried to get a driver. After a minute search it said no drivers available, try again in one minute. When I search the second time, the price jumped to $220. I guess the business model is to take advantage of people they can identify as in need. I took a Taxi and deleted the app from my phone. At least I can say Uber never made any money from me and never will.
title: Not there when I needed

review: This app was good until greed took over. First, they dont pay their drivers enough for it to be worth it. Second, all the rides you pick up at 20+ minutes away to wait for a driver, then if you cancel the ride it charges you a fee even claiming its for the driver even though they dont pay their drivers when sending them to pick someone up, only after the ride actually starts and even then its only 30% the cost of the ride. Uber claimed to raise the costs to be more accommodating fr its drives yet pockets most the money and took away nearly all the incentives for drives then wonders why no one wants to work for them anymore. Awful company, not worth it in the least.
title: Horrible app

review:
Uber sometimes is unable to authorize credit card for a ride due to failure at their end on particular day . I had paid the driver in cash. But when I opened the app the next day it’s asking me to authorize the credit card payment for a past ride which I had already paid in cash. 

Even upon writing (you can’t call or talk to Uber CS, there is no contact number) multiple times the customer services they provide standard answer that “cannot make changes to past trip”. It’s horrible that Uber is attempting to charge credit card for the ride that I already paid in cash .  And their customer service seems to not care about the experience
title: Unhelpful Customer Service

review: Charles was early to pick me up which was great because I was ready early too (but Uber notified me he’d wait until the pickup time).  The car was clean and comfortable.  He knew the route well from Winston-Salem to the Raleigh Durham airport and he drove safely and well.  He pulled over at Departures but I wanted to go to curbside checkin which was a bit further down and he was accommodating.  We talked some and then didn’t which was just fine.  All in all, a good, safe and comfortable ride.
title: Charles In Winston-Salem great driver

review: Thank you to Brenda for hanging around a few minutes while my daughter who was in a car accident got everything situated. My daughter said she was very nice . Brenda even came back after she noticed my daughter left something in the car. Sometimes for people it’s about money  only then sometimes it’s also about compassion and lending a helping hand. Thank you Brenda for your compassion and lending a helping hand on one of my daughters worse days.
title: Accident

review: This would be a 5 star review if not for what just happened to me. I have always been a super happy customer up until this point. I requested an Uber at 4:30 am to get to the airport and it was reserved. I woke up this morning to my requested ride being cancelled and now i have to wake up my family member to take me to the airport which I am so blessed to have. Why am I able to request an Uber for it just to get cancelled when I wake up the morning I need to leave??? Everything else is wonderful!
title: Problems getting Uber

review: When requesting ride, I would hope the driver would get my exact location based on my gps.  I had to specifically type a message asking to come to the hotel because the app was directing the driver to a location a couple blocks away from me.  I was at a hotel so I’m not sure why the app was directing the driver somewhere else.  That wasn’t the drivers fault.  Luckily he saw my message and found me at the correct location.
title: Location

review: It gets me where i need to be. I dont like that I accept a price and then get charged a crazy booking fee. But when i dont have a car i get where im going. The location needs to be updated though. I live in apartments that the parking lot is in the middle and a large like yard that is connected to all apartments and i go out my front door to the parking lot ans requested a ride at my location and everytime the driver ends up on the left or righr street behind the apartments
title: Nice app

review:
After a long and difficult trip from the west coast my wife and I were in need of a ride home from the airport. Too late for friends so I tried Uber. I had the app and fumbled around with the request. I was shown the price and was able to make the arrangements. The app was good enough for a first timer to complete. 
The ride came in minutes and Colby, our driver was great. 

Home at last after a bad day an efficient friendly  and welcomed end. Thank you Uber
title: Uber home

review:
Since sister company PostMates wants to blow off customers I’m here say be very careful with ANY Uber owned businesses. 

Postmates today June 10th 2023 failed to deliver my order after nearly 2 hours of waiting. This order was in Las Vegas and after having looked into other reviews it appears the Postmates and Uber devices have declined tremendously, especially in this area! 

Driver “Richard” literally drove right past my home, (I was waiting eagerly bc it was taking so long) when I tried to contact him to let him
Know he missed my house he never responded, Postmates wasn’t even able to get ahold of him after the fact.

Later a photo of my meal was sent from some random address I don’t know. 

Customer service was terrible!!! They don’t care about blue collar workers needing to get back to work bc they got their money. 

I was told a refund would hit my account in 3-5 days however I had to ASK for my tip back!! 

READ ALL REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING!!!! These companies are going down hill fast and care less about you once they get your money!!
title: Since PostMates won’t listen

review:
I do not like the way this app works as far as confirming pick up location. When traveling in a foreign country it is difficult to know if the location is correct and I couldn’t find a way to easily change a location. One time I confirmed a location only to find it was incorrect.
