     Also after ordering an Uber the driver picked us up and everything was fine. A few minutes later the Uber app activated and said it was trying to find me another driver for the ride that was already completed. Then I was charged a cancellation fee for a ride that I did not order. Frustrating experience.
title: Frustrated

review:
If you have issues with the app involving changing your phone number or uploading an image to your profile, you are prompted to answer to a messaging system. 
I use apple pay and they ask me to verify my first 6 digits of a card - I don’t have a card I have Apply Pay.
This became an entire issue. I just wanted to change my phone number. I was able to change it after days of contacting support and getting ahold of the manager named Joy who interrupted/cut me off during my explanation several times. It’s almost like they can’t believe you would have an issue using the app or get an error message at all. 
The app has horrible system service.
title: Contact support is finicky

review: Last night I was so tired i dropped my phone in my driver car without realizing it and got home when straight to sleep to wake up the next morning to a panic luckily I was fortunate enough to have been blessed wit an angel as my driver on my latest trip for after and hour of goin back and forth with Uber contact support (s/o to them) and an hour of waiting my driver called my coworker and dropped my phone off with in 15 minutes truly a life saver
title: Best driver ever

review: Although Uber and Uber Eats are easy to use, the after-sales services almost do not exist.  I can’t find someone to help me when I discovered discrepancies after the fact.  Because there is a lag in when I use the services versus when it shows up on my bank statements. The options available through the automated system do not offer enough choices that reflect my circumstances.  I don’t understand a service company making itself unavailable to assist. It’s like Facebook, a terrible terrible company.
title: Need better access to a live customer service

review: Not only was this guy polite and courteous. But he held a certain professionalism  that I don’t see too often. I too work in the hospitality industry I am a professional poker dealer/supervisor and also bartend and serve on the side. If I could get this guy dealing cards in my room amongst serving or even bartending for me I would be honored and privileged . I have had many Uber drivers throughout the years and to say this is the best one I’ve ever had is an understatement! This guy needs a raise asap!!
title: Best Uber driver I have ever had !!

review: Armen picked us up at LAX within minutes of our order. As we were on our way, I received a call that I left a bag at the airport. We were 15 minutes away and Armen turned around, got us back, waited til my bag was retrieved then we continued to our destination. He never complained or made me feel badly about my stupid mistake. Armen was a complete gentleman and helped with our 5 big bags and helped me with my blind husband getting in and out of the van safely. Thank you Armen!!!!
title: Patient and kind

review: We sometimes come across people who only talk but doesn’t listen. But with Gary it was like in a flow state. He was so attentive in our conversation and I didn’t even realize how fast we arrived to our destination. He surely is a man with a lot of experiences in life who understands the environment. If we want to talk, he will make our day. If we don’t want, he still will manage to be the best person to ride with! I have the highest recommendation for him, if I could make one.
title: Wonderful conversation

review: Somehow they got my original review removed… but their drivers are manipulating the price of rides, using both driver apps (Ubers competition) to drive up prices, will cancel rides for no reason or simply not pick people up. I had a driver accept my ride then pull over and park before picking me up to force me to cancel. I took pictures and a video of the driver sitting in his car playing on his phone and Uber didn’t even respond to me. I left my last review and they responded to the review with a link to send a complaint to make it look like they care. But they didn’t reply to that either. They have ruined transportation in San Francisco and I wish the taxis would come back.
title: Uber has ruined transportation in San Francisco
developerResponse: {'id': 34246686, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-01-12T10:49:52Z'}

review: Do not rely on Uber. Ever. Scheduled rides will always be late, and your driver will often times accept the ride, and drive the opposite direction for 20 minutes before heading to you. If you cancel you’ll be charged, and if not then you’re reassigned to the same wrong way driver. Forced to be 30 minutes to an hour late, risking your job because someone else can’t do there’s right. When I am on the premium service you think there would be a little professionalism. The drivers don’t answer the phone or text at all even when it shows their car is parked. These people don’t seem screened to me
title: Nothing you can do

review: Pre-scheduled a ride for our family to the airport in Kauai a day in advance at the end of our Hawaiian vacation. Pick up time was confirmed for 5:10-5:20 AM. Next morning all 7 of us including multiple small children are ready with bags out front when the app texted at 5:18 AM that no driver was available - by that time no Lyft or Taxi was available either to get us to airport in time. Clearly they should have known this even 20 min before at 5 AM or even earlier which would have given us time to make back up arrangements. So frustrating. Sent a $5 coupon for our inconvenience - Um yeah the inconvenience is going to be a lot more than that.
title: Cancelled ride to airport - last minute and missed flight

review: Decided to delete uber and just only use Lyft if needed. This uber app spams me with notifications to request a ride or use uber as if somehow I will magically use uber for no reason when unneeded. The spam is far too annoying and insults the users’ intelligence. They think spamming someone to randomly use uber even when they don’t need it is smart marketing like getting someone to impulsively eat a pizza or something. Too bad for the idiots in charge because I’ve had the last straw and deleted it and ironically their bad spam strategy has pushed me to only using their competitor which offers the same service but no random unsolicited spam notifications.
title: annoying incessant spam notifications

review: Alyn from chat was not helpful at all. Her response is ridiculous all my information is on the account including name birthday address email phone number and she can’t delete the associated drivers license (my friends). Her response is to have to create another one, how does that make sense?? This is ridiculous I already have two trips booked under this account the primary driver shows my name and now I’ll lose my savings and vehicles booked because she cannot unlink/delete that drivers license from my account. If this is true then this is a terrible app because why would you all accept the driver license in the first place when it doesn’t match the account information.
title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE

review:
When you need to report an issue, the app limits you to only report the things they want.  There is no option to report a driver that cancels a pre-reserved trip for example, leave you late for a flight.  
I had a pre-reserved trip that the driver appeared to cancel but the app never alerted me.  Uber did not reading a new driver.  I also had no option to request a different driver.  I ended up taking my own car to the airport, which will cost about $200 more over the length of my trip.
2 hours after the pickup time, I canceled the trip.  Uber gave a $10 credit, with no option to contact or speak with any one.  Poor app, poor service, poor business.
title: App is as bad as the service

review: Uber is definitely a ripoff‼️I wish I would have did my homework before signing up for the uber app. They have given billions to BLM after burning down cities and small businesses. They also keep pushing “the science” from the CDC website. The CDC is not a government entity. They are owned in partnership by philanthropist,corporations,organizations and it appears uber maybe one of them. It takes over 45 minutes for someone to answer the help line & the on line chat can only answer certain questions of course. And from what most drivers have told me they get ripped off just as much as we do they just have a better way to make contact with a real live rep. than the customer. APP DELETED ‼️
title: Plenty of regrets

review: My ride yesterday ended up going from 54 dollars to 73 dollars because of this terrible feature. I can’t tell if it’s a glitch or greed but it makes the prices ridiculously higher and it causes a delay in getting a ride by way too long!! I was at the airport for an extra HOUR and 30 minutes waiting to get an overpriced ride only for them to charge me significantly more anyways and I would like an explanation for the issue. EVERY TIME I try to use the Uber app now it keeps telling me my ride is at a higher price and it’s ridiculous I almost can’t use the app anymore. And the app is perfectly up to date for me thanks. Still messing up
title: Your ride is now a higher price mess

review: I had the best experience I’ve ever had with an Uber driver very polite, excellent driving skills, excellent clean car. He help me out carrying my groceries because I am on disability and have injury. He took me to the pharmacy and then home very polite. This is the best experience I’ve had in a long time with customer service. I would recommend him to anybody and I wish him well and I think that having this employee in your company is a great service to customers. Thank you, Eric.
title: My Uber trip

review: Evil experience- we reserved an Uber 2 days in advance for cheap pricing to get to a bus station that was going to take us to an AIRPORT IN AUSTIN FOR A PLANE. This Uber driver, a woman, pulled up to our house the night of the ride and then cancelled our drive right outside just so that we would try to re-book it and pay her more money for surge pricing since it’s downpour raining right now. We of course missed the timeframe we had to get to the bus station that’s an hour away not including rain traffic. OUR BUS TICKETS WERE $100 RESERVATIONS AND NONREFUNDABLE. So now we lost our money to the bus station and have no way to the airport. UBER SHOULD NOT ALLOW MULTIPLE DAY RESERVATIONS TO BE CANCELLED BY THE DRIVER THEMSELVES. That is extremely inhumane, horrific, just disgusting behavior. Is this mature??
title: HORRIBLE DRIVER

review: William is a gentleman!! Very prompt , on time and professional. His car is clean and tidy. I came out about four minutes early to wait for him and when it reached the exact time for us to leave, I thought he was running late so I began to text him “how long more are you away from me’ , ‘I’m waiting outside’. He was covered by another car of the same color as his. Then he pressed the horn and then I saw him. He said he’s been waiting 15 minutes!!!!! What a guy!!!!!
title: My Uber Driver

review:
I happen to mess up on my destination ( didnt realize that “home” was an old address) luckily my new address waa not that far away, and driver took it in stride and simply changed the address in his gps map App.  And we got to the correct location no problem. 
( AND, it turned out that he was a car guy ( “gear head”, as I had been a long time ago, and we talked cars and motors and upgrades the entire trip!  The guy was cool!)
Conclusion; TOP NOTCH! (10.0)

TGK
title: Good guy, on time and on target

review: According to the fee on the app and comparing it to the flat rates for the taxi’s, this should have been about $5 cheaper for the Uber. It ended up costing $5 MORE. If I knew that I wouldn’t have tipped. I also got stuck with a $1.50 “waiting fee,” because the driver sat there for less than two minutes while I looked for the stall. When I booked the ride it said he was 4 minutes out, but it took over 10 minutes. The taxi would have been faster and cheaper. Never again will I use Uber unless I’m desperate. I’ve never had this problem anywhere else, but now they have completely turned me off to using them again unless I have no other good options.
title: Total Scam in Vegas

review: Completely depends on the driver. Some drivers are incredible and have a 5.0 rating for a reason. Others, decide not to answer the phone call when you call to see why you have waited and now they are moving further away from the pick up location or stay in one spot for 30 minutes. Not okay to not “show up.” At least answer your phone or message. Then i end up canceling.
title: Fairly reliable

review: For some reason driver was given a baritone place   I had given the exact address but he was given a restaurant. I use a walker so I could not go look for the place. I sent a message to the driver giving him address I was at. It was uncomfortable as I feared he would not come where I was but he did. Very polite man. I would have loved  to give him a larger tip but could not afford. I am on ss pension. I would like to know why my fare went up $5. In a matter of minutes. I think $25 was way to much did I get my 20% off?
title: Complaining

review: For two weeks now, this app makes me late. I don’t know if they don’t have enough drivers but it’s like crazy. I supposed to be at work at 7.00 am, and use to order by 6:15 or 6:20, the app said that they have drivers 10mn or 13mn from the house but the driver comes always 16mn or more later. So for an order by 6:15 to be at work at 7.00 you get a driver at 6:50 for a 18mn trip! the wait time is excessive. How to get up earlier and be late at work only because of Uber. Better take a bus pay less, than pay more with a bad service. It was fine before but now it’s like 😡. I am not happy about this app for a moment now.
title: Delay

review: Made reservations the night before to go to the airport. Got the message that this did not mean that a driver would except. The next morning halfway through the morning, finally got a note that someone had accepted the ride. 45 Texas Gal Austin Galminutes later they canceled. Panic stricken went back to see app and reserved again and was able to get someone to come out who happen to be nearby. She gave me the case of the nerves for a while. My driver was great and timely
title: Case of the nerves

review: We had trouble for 15 min with the app getting stuck (crashing) and making us start all over again. I had to go back to Safari on my iPhone 14, and then I was able to request our Uber ride to the airport from our hotel.  Then I was able to use the app to follow my Uber driver to our location.  The Uber driver was friendly, excellent, came quickly to the hotel when we were able to get everything to go through, and we felt safe all the way to the airport!
title: 1st Uber ride ever

review: I hope I do not need to use again. My driver WAS to be Conception. I was outside waiting for a hour and a half. Very unprofessional. I called he would not pick up the phone, I called several times. Left a message saying it went from 9 minutes till arrival to 15. Stayed at 15 and 16 minutes for over an hour. I did call repeatedly and left a message of what’s the point of leaving a number if he wasn’t going to answer. Was wondering if you were coming. Guess he cancelled the ride. So I was outside in the cold for an hour and a half, an hour late to work, so he could not show up. So thank you for me paying when I’m losing money and catching a cold. Horrible service.
title: Horrible service

review: I got back on Uber after some years because my starter went. They have changed a great deal from when they started- and not for the better. I had a $50 Uber gift card which was swallowed up because the app wouldn’t allow me to use the proper location! I went to Walmart with the $50 and by the end of the day my balance was $9. The trip there and back was approximately $25 so where did the rest go🤔? Then it keeps declining my payments and almost made me late dropping my son off for his field trip! Then their GPS takes the drivers around the bend and back again😫…  Do better Uber!!!
title: Steals money and confuses drivers

review: Absolutely terrible. The service is disgusting. Every single driver now calls you to find out your destination and instantly cancel when they see how much money they will not be making off your ride. This app turned into absolute trash. What a joke. This also isn’t a one time occurrence. This keeps happening and I’ve been using Uber a lot. Vet your drivers before giving them the ability to drive customers. Better yet get a car and drive your self. You don’t save money anyway and it’ll save a lot of nerves if you can actually drive. I can’t even find a number to call customer service. Should be delegated off the App Store abs shut down. Terrible.
title: Constant cancelations

review: Hello,  I was delayed by 15 minutes today because a selected Uber driver decided to cancel the pick a minute before picking me up. That is unacceptable. We depend on drivers to be on time to the airport and other places. When drivers cancel a pick up at the last minute they create a new delay because another driver has to do the pick up.  Fortunately the next driver made the pick up and we were able to make the flight.  Drivers that accept a pick must fulfill the task.  Otherwise customers would loose confidence on this service.
title: Delayed because Uber driver cancelled trip

review: I never write reviews but using Uber recently has been horrible and exhausting. The directions the app gives the driver takes them to the back gate of my complex which doesn’t open. I wrote it in my directions where the front gate is located and I also send the driver a message beforehand so they know the directions are wrong. Come to find out none of my rides speak English so they can’t understand me and we cannot communicate. This has happened about 5 times all resulting in me being late for work. Please add a feature where it’s better to communicate with drivers who speak different languages.
title: I hate this app

review: Needed a ride to get my car that was left at work because of unfortunate circumstances. Tried at 5:30pm and for hours after; at 9 I decided that this app is absolutely horrid, no drivers in these areas, would’ve paid way extra just to get my car but no option to charge extra for faster acceptance. Also kept saying “we will get a driver shortly.” Yeah okay, not one was accepted, also put transactions on my history that my bank ended up blocking because of a few attempts. I’m fed up with false information and supporting of apps that subject users to wasting time and effort. Absolutely never using Uber, Lyft or any of these transportation apps that capitalize on pyramid schemes.
title: Worst apps to date.

review: Uber so expensive y’all don’t think about other bills people have to paid also some drivers are really bad some off them canceling you when the 2,3 minutes from you I have kids two little one it’s not fair for waiting 23,30 minutes when is time for them to here the canceled you I have to take the stairs to go back inside with two little kids I m also pregnant y’all need to do something about that
title: Bad service

review: There are issues with the drivers that collect for unwarranted wait times.  On a recent trip to Ft Lauderdale,  I used Uber over. Dozen times. Each time clear direction was given for the pick point and tracked.  Upon receiving and reviewing the final cost,  more than half the times had charges for driver waiting.  The costs were minimal around $1. But unwarranted. Uber did credit the wait time. But beware of the charges they add up if you use Uber a lot
title: Wait time costs

review: it is true that when you are on a rush you gotta ask for a quick ride, but you have to give to much info so you get the ride. I paid for the Uber gift card and the app doesn’t accept it every once in a while… I don’t have a card, so it is very difficult to use other alternatives. Now I’m late for work because the app didn’t accept  my payment :) thanks Uber, for the very non-efficient way of getting somewhere.
title: The worst experience

review: I’ve been using Uber for years and when they first launched their service was good and affordable. Now all I get is high prices, long waits and poor service. They claim to use their tracking to help improve service but all they do is use it to price gouge. And when you try to contact customer support all you get is automated questions that are in no way related to your problem. And they can never explain why their prices double and triples after your first initially ride to a destination. I will definitely be looking for an alternative because this is no longer acceptable.
title: Ridiculous Prices and Poor Services

review: There are many good things I like about uber. However I am writing this review about an improvement recommendation. There is no easy way to make a complaint about the app through the mobile app. It only let’s us complain about the drivers. This is really bad customer experience. Recently uber had the wrong address for a location in the app so I had to walk a block from the drop off. Uber should have a complaint feature if the app does something unsatisfactory.
title: Complaint

review:
Uber is an amazing app and has helped me alot around my travels but right now I’m in islamabad pakistan and in here i have faced this problem more than 5 times I’ve missed my appointment twice and last night my dad got sick for standing in the hospital gate for a driver to come pick us up this has happened 5 or 6 times i order a ride a driver accepts and asks for location i gove the location then he keeps me waiting for 5-6 minutes then cancels the ride and the other one does the same last night i waited 40
Minutes the driver’s kept accepting and canceling back to back when i cancel a ride i get charged for it but when the driver’s keep canceling back to back nothing
title: Driver’s cancelling the ride

review: For the last 3 months I have either had to cancel my ride with Uber or there were no cars available (this is metropolitan Orange County California, not some rural area!).  Nowadays I’ll open the app and it will say a driver is 15 minutes away.  Not great, but ok.  Once I click the confirmation, it will start saying looking for a driver and I watch as the estimate goes up and up, 20 minutes away…. 25 minutes away…. 30 minutes away…. *cancel and order a Lyft instead*.  To make matters worse now I get constant reminders to sign up for Uber one and Uber pass.  Like why bother people when you can’t even handle the business you have?!?!
title: Uber service used to be so good, what happened?

review: 1. If the driver doesn’t get tipped they will rate you lower and lower which it will make it harder to find a ride and because they cancel last minute it puts not only stress on me but my dad I’m about to start a job and it’s $10 for a ride my dad said we should consider Lyft because I can’t afford to be late to work and because of this happening so much keep In mind I’m respectful and am on my phone and respect boundaries and etc but because of this it’s caused me to be yelled at by my father because they found a ride that’s going to pay them $10 more I believe Uber needs to rethink some things but from the drivers that haven’t canceled they were pretty chill and cool people that I met
title: Why You Should Not Uber

review: What’s the point of scheduling a ride diligently ahead of time to be on time somewhere only to be shuffled between drivers and suddenly have them arriving half an hour late? In the end your job is to get us from point A to point B safely and on time. If I’m half an hour late — you’ve failed. When it comes to safe- not sure if ratings mean anything anymore - some drivers are great, others tailgate or drive dangerously and scare me to half to death. Some cars are clean and others are plain gross. As a woman I’d say I feel actually unsafe 20% of the time. I’m not seeing these differences reflected in ratings consistencies and it’s absolutely impacted your brand.
title: Late

review: I have to come here to give uber a bad review because my girlfriend is so nice to uber and she doesn’t want to make anyone feel bad. My girlfriend used to go to work by Uber but nothing happened until yesterday. She got in the car and asked the driver to wear the mask, and he did it. By the end of the day, she checked her email and she saw the email from uber that the Uber driver reported she didn’t wear a mask on the time she in the uber and required her to take her selfie picture before using service next time. Uber treated us so nice for 80$ and 17$ tip each way. I think we have so many other choices, my family and friends won’t use it anymore. Thanks for your terrible service.
title: Avoid this scam if you can

review: Me and my wife had an appointment set up a couple days in advance for an early morning ride to the airport. Probably due to fraud alert because of us being out of state, there was a problem with our card and it cancelled our ride which is one thing, but cancelling it two hours before we had to leave at 2:30 in the morning is ridiculous! Thankfully my wife happened to wake up early and look at her phone to see this in time for us to use a different payment method. Long story short this app could leave you stranded and not let you know about it until it’s too late. Unreliable app, would recommend another service.
title: Cancels Rides in the Middle of the Night

review:
Drivers are not getting their tips, because some bug in the app is not adding the tips correctly! 

For every ride I’ve taken in the past year at least, I found when I leave a tip, it confirms on the receipt screen, however, when I get the email receipt I notice no tip was added. So I ALWAYS RECHECK either a few minutes later or later that evening, I go back in the app, pull up previous trips to double check the tip, I ALWAYS find that no tip was left after the confirmation screen, so I MANUALLY add the tip again through the PREVIOUS TRIPS page. Then and only then will the tip show up, and I get an updated email. 

I can only imagine the million of riders who post a tip at the end of their ride and the many drivers who are not receiving their EARNED tips! 

UBER YOU CAN DO BETTER!
title: Tip Function robbing Drivers of Tips

review: Uber is great ..... when they actually show up. More often the App says a car may be available at an outrageously higher rate. The rate keeps escalating. Of late, no car is ever available. I reserved a car for the following day. Received confirmation. At the appointed time, I received notice that no car was coming. It’s become unreliable. I’m encouraged through email to use my points, but, how can I do that if no car is available.
title: Disappointing

review: This is by far the worst ride sharing app ever! I just arrived from a long 9 hour flight and called an uber. Had to wait 15 minutes watching him stay in the same position and slowly moving until he cancelled on me. Guess what I got charged a cancellation fee and now there is NO way to CONTACT SUPPORT??? What. So you guys wasted my time and charged me? I need to go to work tomorrow morning this service is the most unreliable ever. I even forgot to mention there was also a second driver who did the exact same thing! Lol as I am writing this review they credited me $5 to use on the uber app and not even refunded my money. I already deleted this app and will contact my bank to dispute this charge.
title: What happened to Uber?

review: Impossible to make a change to the time when booking in advance. UBER put the wrong time, tried to correct in every way conceivable. Impossible. Their “chat feature is a fraud. No matter what is asked they send you to a page where you first have to agree to pay them(after a short free trial) Zero chance to talk or really “chat “ and the site doesn’t allow changes to pick up time. awful
title: Website;”help”is beyond awful

review: Anything longer than a few miles is going to stack up fast. Don’t even bother using the food section, you can’t cancel orders from the Uber app. You have to download UberEats to cancel any order, but just use DoorDash instead. It’s quicker, cheaper, and doesn’t Mickey Mouse you trying to cancel an order because there’s no drivers. I got $30 off a $34 order and still wound up having to pay $25 in fees. Then when I cancelled because my order was in limbo for two hours, I was charged a $6 cancellation fee where DoorDash gives you credit back. Wouldn’t recommend, just take the bus.
title: Only use for short rides

review: Terrible first of all if someone orders an Uber on business obviously they are going to work so why is it that this app pairs you with people who are finishing a drop. If I need to get to work in 20 minutes I order 25 mintutes ahead and guess what nope your Uber will get there in time to get there when you only have 10 minutes to get you there because they have to drive from there last stop to you and then get you to work 5 min late or more sometimes cause the drivers won’t know where there going. My point is start pairing us with people who already finished a ride or like a taxi have them on call even when nothing is happening. I’m just gonna take the bus its the same thing same time just more people
title: Trash

review: I use to use Uber anywhere I go because it used to be cheaper than Lyft and I used to be subscribed to the get a set price for cheap  to get to one destination to another but the price got inflated  for the subscription and the ride cost. Now anytime I request a ride that’s typically $10 the drivers send a notification saying their price is $21 or $37 or even sometimes $50, which is ridiculous. They shouldn’t allow their drivers to change the pricing like that. I hate having to spend 15 minutes declining those ridiculously high prices to then be told no drivers available. I ended up downloading Lyft who is way cheaper and more reliable. I hate what Uber has become.
title: Used to be great, but..

review:
It was a most comfortable ride from Midway airport to my destination. Jimmy was on time, efficient, and knowledgable about my trip and destination.  We enjoyed a lovely conversation all along the way. 
His car was comfortable and quiet. He turned the radio down so we could speak to each other. He was very helpful with the bags and I was able to relax while being in a new city with unfamiliar surroundings.  I wish him the best! I thank him for his service.
title: Jimmy’s ride was excellent!

review: I left my phone in Javier’s car on the way to the funeral home. I did not realize that I didn’t have it until late in the evening. I did not  expect to see it again and he brought it back to the funeral home…The next day .at the church a relative came up to me with the phone. I was shocked to see it again. it’s great to see how people can care for one another and I applaud him for his unbelievable customer service.. the best Uber driver I have ever used.
title: List phone

review:
I have them a 5 star , not because everything has been perfect, obviously nothing completely perfect. However, through out the issues that I have had; Uber has always addressed the situation and corrected it. And because of that. I give them. 5star. Customer service is priority now and days. Even the hospitals are based on customer service and not quality of care. 
Thanks Uber!
title: Over all review throughout time I’ve been Uber and Uber eats

review:
On July 12, 2023 I was on a mission to Austin,Texas to be with my friend for her birthday and chemo treatment. I requested my first Uber when I arrived. Jackson was my driver and he was prompt courteous and best of all, he brought my phone back to me the next morning that I left in the car! I can’t thank him enough! We were getting ready to go to chemo treatments and I was lost without my phone. I’m so very grateful for Jackson and his dedication to helping people. I’m now a loyal Uber rider. 
Sincerely, 
Overwhelmed Traveler
Susie Stegall
title: Lost Phone

review:
I love the service and have never had a bad driver.  All have been excellent.  It is also extremely convenient.  The problem is the app.  I sometimes travel with my parents who have physical disabilities and walkers and it is hard to get them in certain types of cars/SUVs.  Today there were 4 in our party (2 of them being my parents) and traveling from the airport.  It would be nice if we can add comments, like travel bags as walker, so the driver knows if he could accommodate our needs.  Also, it’s hard for us to select an XL size vehicle because they are too high for my mom to get into without a step.  

Again, let me restate “I love the service, just wish we could add comments”.
title: Kalli

review:
I got hacked for 300$, someone was taking rides in New York (I live in CA and have never been to NY)and this has been the most painful process trying to speak to someone. There is no phone number to call, no one to speak with, communicating via chat with their customer service is like talking to a wall. Even after exposing the situation, providing the requested information, they are still expecting ME to pay for almost 10 rides I never even took. I’m never using this app again and do not trust them with personal information. SCAMMERS

Update: 
3 months later and no one has contacted me from Uber, this company is a joke and does not care about their customers. Shame
title: Worst customer service

review:
My driver Mr. Shafiqualla treated me with such kindness and care. His customer service skills are excellent, and his ability to connect with his riders should not go unnoticed. Mr. Shafiqualla is currently studying abroad to become a doctor, and has a beautiful family of a wife and 4 kids who are awaiting his success back home in the beautiful country of Afghanistan. 
Mr. Shafiqualla deserves to be noticed, and should be recognized. Thank you, من ارتباط انسانی ایجاد شده را فراموش نمی کنم و آن لحظه را برای سال های آینده به یاد خواهم آورد. از آشنایی با شما آقای شفیق الله لذت بردم، موفق خواهید شد.
title: Best Uber experience I’ve ever had.

review:
Roberto picked me up at the Physicians Regional Hospital’s ER, Pine Ridge Rd, Naples, Sat., May 20th at 2 a.m. to return to AVE MARIA UNIV.  Mentally I was in another planet bc if my friend having a heart attack, and knowing no one. I told him the name of the dormitory bldg, but didn’t have the address.  He said, “no worries, he’ll find it.”  He did.  Then I had a long walk to the bldg door at 2:30 a.m..  He told me he wld walk me to the door and make sure my key worked!  I was so relieved.  
     I have told so many of his kindness to me.  He was so great!
title: My early Sat morning with Roberto

review: I take Uber very often and lately every single time I Uber into Manhattan through the Lincoln tunnel I’m being charged a toll for both directions even though I go one way. Then when I complain it’s always the same response with no actual comprehension of what I’m saying just reiterating the total toll and then I always have to argue it a second time to get someone to refund me the money I shouldn’t have been charged in the first place. It used to be once and a while now it’s every single time and no one actually reads the messages where I say this keeps happening to me. It’s ridiculous
title: You need to fix this issue

review: Add the time the ride started. I should be able to read when the ride started while I’m still on a trip. You should be able to let your drivers know what side of the road you are on so they can take a better route to be on the correct side of the road. If a driver accepts you but they are like 20mins away and you would rather look for someone else closer to select your trip then you should be able to easily select that option. I have had drivers keep selecting you after you cancel even though they are too far away.
title: Add the time ride started while you’re still on the trip

review: Other than the fact it wouldn’t let me change my location drop off as I was leaving the hospital, I was given medicine that made me super drowsy, i was sent the wrong address and didn’t notice till like maybe 2 mins after and tried to change location drop off and it told me the price change but wouldn’t let me change it thankfully I had an amazing driver…she was really the best!!!
title: Fix the change of drop off

review:
Leaving a customer while waiting for Uber driver pick up and the Uber driver does not show up nor answers their phone number listed with Uber, is unsatisfactory and very unprofessional! Thereafter Uber charges my card $6.50 cancellation fee! I did not cancel my ride. Yet waited over an hour and ordered a ride through another company called Lyft for a ride and was pleased with their service. 

I waited for my Uber driver and watched on my phone as the Uber driver entered the shopping center where I was waiting. The driver “never came” to the exact address where I was waiting outside of a store front.  Nor did the Uber driver call my phone number that was listed with Uber. 

It was night time and I had to wait and reach out to a competitor, LYFT. 

I called the number provided by Uber for the driver contact and no one answered. 

I’m over 61 years old and this was a bad experience for me with Uber. Calling or contacting the Uber company was no success. 

Unsatisfied elder customer,
title: Driver did not show up at customer pick up and Uber charged my card $6.50 for cancellation!!!

review: I’m only writing this review because it’s now happened on several occasions. I’m booked for a ride and the driver decides to decline the ride without actually declining the trip. I typically take Uber because it’s time sensitive. Arrival by 755 become 825 today. I think most Americans realize that could be a problem. My issue is you can’t report the drivers and they don’t comp the ride. It’s your problem, not mine as a paying customer.
title: Uber doesn’t hold its drivers responsible

review: Uber lets me drink till i cant stand and get home safe, wake up tip the driver a ton and go about my day in life of america where my car is home and i can get to my job cause I didn’t get a dui from the night befor, the uber personnel are always interesting people very talkative very very nice hard workers the ubr people each have their own story and characteristics that make them amazing definitely try uber give it a chance
title: Uber is the A- list app i need to survive life without a dui

review: We had to break from our group in France because my son started feeling bad and progressively got worse. Although the driver spoke a little English, he was extremely pleasant and very patient and nice when my son got sick on the ride home. Thank God my wife had some trash bags … still he was awesome. I think he was relieved, though when I translated the fact that my son had idiotically eaten some undercooked food earlier that day! So thank you Uber and Google translate.
title: Sick kid in foreign country

review: Made well to equip the public with safeguard drivers but there’s always one out there!?? Mostly it’s a great app then there’s the Uber Eats for craves and shopping made simple. Only difference between Uber and OG taxis is maybe just more younger drivers who are more interested! But the OG play too! Thanks Uber and if more people would’ve listened to me in 2002 when I thought of a similar thing but wasn’t computer savvy to do the app and Bzness! Ok I’m out, have to get a ride to the store…. Lol 😎😂🙏🏾💪🏾
title: Taxi fusion

review: Joseph took me on Sunday to a concert at the Artemus Hamm Concert Hall at UNLV. I had never been there. The campus is confusing. He got out of the car and looked at a directory. When I didn’t think we were at the right place, he waited for me to check. In the interim my husband called my cell and gave me directions which Joseph followed. I got there he waited again for me to check. He was very friendly and most helpful. It was my first Uber experience. It won’t be my last.
title: Review for Joseph

review:
My first time attempting to use Uber for a ride……. My ride kept getting cancelled or switched to a different driver without any explanation resulting in my pickup time constantly changing. When I tried to use the app to get assistance, I found that there was no way to talk with support. Based on my situation, I really needed immediate assistance from Uber. 

The app provides very limited support options and if your topic is not listed there is no option to chat with or talk to a representative. Very frustrating. Please correct this by providing a way to get assistance with questions that have not been thought of by the developers. 

Is this the experience Uber wants to provide to new users?
title: Impossible to get help

review: I understand that raising prices when the demand for ride shares is higher than normal seems like basic economics, however quadrupling prices when people are trying to avoid driving under the influence seems like price gouging. Also, almost every ride I try to take has between 1-3 drivers drop the requested ride. This has affected me by making me late to multiple events. It would be nice to get some info as to why the ride gets dropped so that if it is an issue on my end I can try to resolve it.
title: Surge pricing is out of hand, and drivers drop rides too much.

review: Uber driver, Arturo was the most positively professional driver and quite honestly, this was one of the best Uber experiences I have had. My ride was extended due to a stalled CTA bus and Arturo made me feel comfortable, safe and assured that he would get me to my destination despite the adversities he faced with traffic, delays and the Uber gps issuing him incorrect directions. Arturo’s professionalism and knowledgeability of the downtown Chicago area, not only got me to my destination, but, also got me there safely and I highly appreciate that.
title: Arturo, Best Uber Driver

review: The app is convenient and easy to navigate but when it messes up it’s a huge ordeal. Finding a ride is inconsistent and there have been multiple days where the searching would take 20 minutes without results then i would restart to only be in the same situation. I have been late to a number of important events when the only commute available to me was this service. Also the app also auto maxes the volume while a trip is active, I’ll turn it down only for it to auto adjust to full volume again
title: Numerous App Issues

review:
Vert charge invalid fees and would not refund me. I will never use Uber again. I will only use Lyft. I suggest everyone else does the same. Avoid Uber. 

I never intentionally signed up for an Uber eats subscription, but was charged $10 every month for nine months. I did not notice these charges at first because it was not listed as Uber eats subscription in my credit card statement, so I thought it was for rides. In my Uber history charges were not showing in my Uber app. 

When I finally discovered these fraudulent charges, I called Uber and ask them to refund the fees since they were not authorized by me. They would only refund one month. So, they admitted that that it was invalid but would not refund the full amount.

In addition, approximately 90% of the time estimates given for how long it will take a driver to get to me are grossly wrong. It usually takes double the time that is estimated.

Invalid or fraudulent charges like this and misleading business practices in general from Uber should be stopped by the better business bureau.
title: Hidden charges

review: Be aware and even price compare with another app if you use this for business… I constantly click the first ride as these rides are expenses by my the company I work for when traveling for work.  I switched the card and check for pricing with girlfriend, both of us checked our Uber apps.  Hers showed a $25 ride 5 minutes away while mine showed a $45 ride 5 minutes away…. Ubers excuse when I asked why this was: because they raise prices to attract drivers… complete lie as we accepted the cheaper ride and it showed in 5 minutes.  Needless to say that experience will be my last with Uber.
title: Beware if you have Business Account

review: Even using Uber India for sometime now and it was fine before,  but recently the drivers have started to call up and then when you say your destination they hang up and cut the call. It’s bcm unreliable to use Uber. Had this experience as recently as yesterday where 5-6 drivers refused my trip and cancelled. My trip was in city limits n accessible by road at all times so it’s not the destination that’s the problem. Uber please review you app n have the drivers see the destination so they can choose or educate you drivers. Otherwise you guys are gonna loose customers to other similar services.
title: Drivers refusing pickup and cancelling

review:
I had and still have a problem with a weird unrecognizable charge. That was fine because problems and bugs do happen. Expected a smooth refund. 
HOWEVER as it turns, they have no hotline to contact. You only get to chat with extremely unprofessional and poorly trained customer support. Chatted with over 5 agents and they all send you robotic replies without attempting to understand your actual problem. Took me a month now and seems like I won’t get my rights back or even the chance to submit an official complain.
It’s like it’s impossible to reach Uber to do an actual complain. 
They lost their credibility to me! Worst service provider ever.
title: You will never get your problem solved

review:
Had a driver cancel my ride RIGHT when he pulled up and i was walking out, he canceled and then left while i was RIGHT THERE! i got charged a cancellation fee of $5 for a ride i didn't even cancel, can't even get in contact with anyone to report it or get a refund. AND!!!! now my account is disabled because they say i'm not of age, WHICH i am 18! and even showed proof that i was!! Hate Uber! They need to have better security on rides and a way to get in contact with headquarters if there is a problem!!! HORRIBLE APP!

Update! I am now 19 now and STILL can't get my account reactivated i go through the same process over and over again trying to get my account back but it's the same thing as before.
title: Horrible

review: The app is not working. Tried to log in but it wouldn’t allow me because “that email is already associated with an account.”  I know - it’s mine! But no option to indicate I’m just using a different phone. Forced to create a new account, but app wouldn’t let me reserve a ride. Logged out and now can’t log back in. Multiple attempts to log in - app keeps making me try to create a new account, but it freezes and won’t move forward.
title: Broken

review: I just had to dispute transactions with my financial institution/bank. Hubert decided that they were going to run my card without my permission. Also when I decided to delete the account and delete every account with Uber that you have. Also and this is where the bill where comes in they hold your information for about seven years for their legal or regulatory measures. So if you do not want your information in their hands for them to use for or against you or just in general do not download do not get an account! Keep in mind I did not have any cards on the account. I had them on my Apple Pay. So they drafted it and took the money from there. Beware do not use them.
title: BEWARE

review:
We left a very expensive pair of prescription glasses in the Uber car ( gave a $20 cash tip) we left about 30 messages that night, explaining my partner could not see without them & that we were flying out the next day—- Uber left messages saying maybe the driver didn t get the 30 messages & that they are not responsible,  Isn t it common courtesy to give someone a call back or for Uber to follow up with the driver or Uber to not change for the trip, after no one calling us back??? It s now 10 days after the trip & now the driver leaves a message ,saying he found the glasses, this is after we already spent $$$ on a new pair,
Terrible service!
title: Lost items ,bad customer service

review: The app generally works fine but lately there has been a bug which does not allow you to schedule food pickup or delivery. On the home page the scheduling works fine but when you select any store to schedule an order it says the store is unavailable, reschedule. On trying to reschedule it does not give all time slots but instead some odd hours are provided. I never had any issues with the app for more than 2 years that I have been using this but the recent change in scheduling food pickup/delivery is annoying.
title: Unable schedule

review: Uber Brazil has major issues. The drivers always complain about being underpaid, and I have about one driver each day cancel despite my high rating. If they accept, they often have a ton of questions such as “Are you paying in cash?” “where are you going?” “do you have a lot of bags?” Before they ever arrive. If they don’t like the answer to any of these questions they cancel. If I find a driver on another app and cancel while waiting on the app to find another driver then I get penalized. By the way, it’s unnecessary for drivers to send so many messages before arrival (your location shows on that map, I know you are on the way.) I’m using 99 so much more.
title: Problematic Service

review:
Face verification with masks for riders? Have the driver verify the person is if wearing and they can cancel, no need for uber to have our images too. Also i think you misunderstand your place in the market, you are a convenience not a necessity, purely something that people can use. Once you just slightly overstep that level of convenience you lose your customer base, for example, me. Hope your investors like being hit in the money

Edit: lyft does it right, driver may cancel if rider is not wearing a mask. Yall are real dumb, but was a good ride for a while. Looking forward to not using again. Also i have seen that only some riders may be required if they havent previously? Please look at your drivers cameras youll find i have.
title: Mask picture for riders

review:
I own a restaurant and am on the Uber Eats platform for 2 years now. Since joining the Uber Eats platform, my personal rider account has been linked to my Restaurant Manager account. I have been unable to use Uber as a customer, cant order rides, cant order food, I have the Uber Credit Card that redeems points and cash, but I cant use them. I have American Express Platinum card and again can not use the monthly credits. This is ridiculous it has been two years! 

The “help” section on the app is literally automated messages using different names. It has been a nightmare, I am so frustrated I am writing this review wishing someone from Uber can get back to me. Please. Help. Me.
title: 2 years and still not working

review:
It was three of us traveling via Delta from Dayton, Ohio. We arrived at Little Rock airport at 6 pm. We had reserved a car from Enterprise 
Via AAA August 14 th but they didn’t have any cars available or a record of the reservation. 
Hertz and Avis rentals had no cars available.
One of the travelers with me had an Uber app but never used it. I requested a driver and immediately got a response. Driver responded and text that he would be there in 19 minutes 
It was great. Our driver was wonderful. It was his first day as an Uber driver. Took us to pine Bluff to the exact address without any issues.
I myself decided to download the Uber App and made reservations September 29 to drive us back to the airport in Little Rock, Arkansas 
Great experience. Professional and on time 
I love how the driver sent us a photo of the driver, name and his car.
title: First Time Uber experience

review:
I never use this app unless I’m traveling after a few drinks AND I’m with pets. Otherwise I just uninstall it and install it if I need too. It’s ridiculous the amount of unnecessary notifications. NO I don’t want to drive for you, with the amount of useless CRAP you send to your customers, I can’t imagine the overload of the poor, poor, souls who are unfortunate enough to work with you. The notifications are why I’ll use Lyft unless there are fur babies with me. To prove my point, I reinstalled this Saturday and forgot to uninstall it. I get 3/4 notifications a day trying to sale me on something. 

P.S. Don’t call me, I’ll call you!
title: Notification BOMBARDMENT

review: I just had a problem with DoorDash because Uber was closed. I prefer Uber over DoorDash any day. I just wish that they stayed open longer after like 12 or one. Uber closes where I live and I can’t get food late but besides that I’ll always go with Uber. I literally deleted my DoorDash account. I always have so many problems with them. I learned to just order a little early thank you Uber you’re the best being a Uber One Member is also really awesome!!
title: Love Uber !!

review: When I questioned my driver this morning about the route he was taking, he said it was faster.  He took a much longer way to avoids, 1:20 instead of 45 minutes.  I had upgraded for $75 for A3 SW boarding pass.  Barely got to the gate as the B line was boarding.  He could have asked & I would have paid him extra.  I want you text him & tell him I know why he did what he did & that he ruined my 1st business trip.  Thank you
title: Need Customer Support Call

review: The San Antonio Airport address for passenger pickup seems to display a different address for the Uber drivers- this has has happened on several occasions. Navigates the drivers somewhere else by the airport but not the most obvious location where you only have one direction go to . I use the message chat to explain what pickup zone I am at.  It eventually works out. I fly often, so just text me the preferred San Antonio Airport address Uber would like for me to use so that the drivers are not confused. Thanks 🙂
title: Location Address

review: The driver arrived to pick me up at the train station. Here I was an 80 yr old with 3 pieces of luggage with me but the driver remained in his car. So I put m  to carryon in the back seat. I  asked him where I should put my bags & he said, in the trunk l. When  I made no move, he got out & opened it. I was struggling a bit & he said, Do you want some help. I said half kiddingly but with a smile, It  depends on how big a tip you want. He flipped out. He said, This ride is canceled! I don’t like your attitude and threw my carryon bag in the street, damaging it and some of my items in it. I took photos.  Uber immediately texted me saying another driver was on the way and I said no. So Uber charged me $5 cancelling fee! Unbelievable!!
title: Terrible experience!

review: This is the first ride I’ve taken with Uber. Frances was my driver and not only was she there in 5 mins but the drive home for 40 was relaxing and she was a pleasure to talk to while getting me home safely! Remember to tip your drivers because when you get 5 star treatment these are the people we need in customer service. They should be tipped for their above and beyond service! Thank you for a wonderful safe ride home after a long day at work in Healthcare! ❤️
title: Wonderful Ride

review:
So boom im with someone, nobody in my family likes, but we got eloped behind everyone back. Since I live with them right now still,  I have to sneak to see him or what not until we get new place. 
So boom he sneaks to my house and we have sex outside in the back yard. In the back of my family work shed, I ran outside to get the gentiles and he gave them to me. 

So boom he needed a ride home and uber came through at 4am like some real stand up individuals. Im so happy thank you uber
title: Yall some real nighas

review: Cheaper than lyft first of all. Second, uber literally saved me. I was using the bus when I accidentally got on the wrong one. I ended up about 8 cities away from my house and didn’t know where I was or how id get home. Scared out of my mind so I ordered uber and since it gets your location and automatically puts a pick up spot for you (thank god for this feature) im safe at home. (Not to mention the homeless guy that was following me as well)
title: Thank you

review:
This was my first time using Uber; downloaded the app ... took at bit for it to verify me .... and my rate jumped close to $30 in that period of time.  Was getting ready to cancel, but decided to shut it down and re-open ... it went back to the original price so I booked.

Rachel was timely, friendly and a pleasure to ride with.  I opened her eyes to a new little town about 25 minutes from her home that she'll get to come back to explore someday!
title: Rachel - Boulder City Nevada

review:
I don’t like how I was able to Cashout immediately to my payment and now as of today I have to wait 1-2 business days. That instant cash out was helpful when needed so I don’t like that you all are making me wait. I have given you all 5 stars because of how well the surveys are going and instant cash out. I would like you all to offer more money, stop ending the surveys, add videos to earn more money and cash out at any amount.

Thanks!
title: Payout

review: I attempted to get an Uber and I started through the process of ordering an Uber. I saw that it would take them over 30 minutes to get to my location so I cancelled the ride. They charged me $13 for a ride I never got. How are you going to rob me of my hard earned money for a ride I never even took. I will never take an Uber ever again unless someone from Uber makes this right and proves they aren’t a soulless company.
title: This company stole money from me.

review: Using Uber has become a complete nightmare. Especially for the food delivery aspect of the company. Runaway from Uber and use something else. There are Zero barriers/standards to drive for Uber. Every time you have an order or pickup, something that relates to their lack of standards or complete mismanagement of the company creates problems that create a whole ordeal you have to deal with. They then will not refund. You now are not able to adjust tips after receiving a ride or order. People regularly steal your food and then Uber will still charge your bank account to tip the thief and will claim they cannot change the tip now. Do not tip upfront and wait to add a tip after if you still use this app.
title: Nightmare

review:
Goat for a while was a good platform to buy or sell shoes but recently they no longer have been following their policies in regards to canceling and replica shoes.

The company does not do a good job reviewing their orders and has been shipping out fake or replica shoes. Obviously this is an issue for a company based on the trust of their “Authentication Process”.

If you attempt to cancel and order within 3 hours of an accepted offer you are able to cancel, this is not always the case as they will just try and stick you with the bill despite having this policy in place.

Customer service on items like this is slow. I canceled and order 3 minutes after an offer was accepted and was not able to cancel. Then when the shoes were not new and they did not cancel the order they offered an $8 discount, laughable at best. They should’ve allowed for a cancellation right then and there.

Not only do they not stand by their policies but they are slow to respond and sell fakes. You are best to look elsewhere.
title: Will no longer be using GOAT, switch to EBAY

review: I’ve been with Uber for 4 years using it for rides and eats, they delivered me food that I had listed there is an allergy issue to, never refunded them even though that is their policy, forcing me to dispute the charges with my credit card company, once my card company credited me because the evidence was clear and I submitted all documents to prove the policy and their refusal to abide by it, then now I can’t book rides in the main Uber app even after deleting Uber eats because it’s asking me to pay the disputed amount again first…. Pathetic company with very pathetic customer service, DO NOT RECOMMEND, execs should be ashamed — switching to Lyft just like I had to switch to DoorDash
title: Worst customer service for even loyal members

review: I loved using this app i used to use it everyday due to me having to go to school i am NOT rich but i could afford a 12 dollar ride to school it was so problem i scheduled it the day before everyday for school at the same time absolutely no change at all and then one day out of the blue when i scheduled a ride the price changed and not just but a few dollars i’m talking about like triple the price how does a 12 dollar ride turn into a 31 dollar ride? how does this happen? i uninstalled the app i signed in and signed out and it’s still the same problem this is so frustrating i switched to lyft as soon as i could this is just ridiculous.
title: used to love this app now i HATE it

review:
A typical user will want notifications set to “on” for Uber so one can know when one’s driver is approaching, etc. but Uber takes advantage of this system setting to push annoying ads announcing promotions and other garbage. 

This is an abuse of this system functionality and should be able to be filtered. There should be a setting for “necessary” or “usage related” notifications that is distinct from harassing promotional notifications. 

Notifications started in iOS for urgent matters that need one’s attention, not to push trash advertisements! If this isn’t addressed by Uber, Apple should address it, and if Apple doesn’t address it, congress should.
title: App Uses Crucial Notification Space for Ads

review: I waited for 30 minutes for a driver and then the trip was canceled by the driver. There is no way to report this behavior. I should be given refund for wasting my time but there is no way to even request it. Who will give my 30 minutes back to me? Uber is an insensitive company which does not care for its customers. If I don’t get a refund for this experience I am never using this disgusting app again.
title: Cancellation after 30 minutes wait

review: Does the Uber app not want me to tip drivers afterwards?? Every time I go to the trip details, it rarely lets me tap on anything other than support pages. It’s really frustrating because I try to rate and tip driver’s immediately, but instances like today, I let the drivers know I can’t tip right away because I get paid later. I got paid a few hours ago and I went to tip a few of the drivers and it WONT LET ME! Maybe if I logged into the website? I shouldn’t have to…
title: Why is the app preventing me from tipping and rating afterwards??!

review: Honestly y’all need to stop doing unnecessary updates on your app. Why would you add a schedule a ride feature, give me the option to pick my preferred time and then not honor my decision? If I say I want my ride to arrive 8:30-8:40 don’t send me a notification saying oh your driver is going to arrive 10 or 15 mins early. Excuse me? If I wanted my ride at 8:15 or 8:20 I would have scheduled it for 8:15 or 8:20.  But now I’m forced to rush out the door ahead of my comfort zone because you care more about being fast and tech savvy than you do about respecting the customers you are serving. Terribly unprofessional and I would expect better from a paid ride service
title: What’s the point of scheduled rides?

review: They do not read messages at all. You tell them your waiting but they don’t read the messages at all. Then they have you waiting for hours or minutes right before they cancel on you. They don’t value a rider at all. All they know how to do is cancel. They won’t even respond at all that they are not coming. I been waiting for hours on a guarantee ride. Drivers don’t care at all. Most aren’t trying to get to the trying to get home or work. They need to be kicked off for not responding or some type of punishment. This is ridiculous
title: Drivers

review: Reserved an Uber black a day in advance for 9:00pm. They never showed and charged us a cancellation fee. Then we called another Uber and they canceled, and we were charged another fee. We tried one more time and they canceled again with another fee!!! We were stranded 45 minutes from home with no help and corporate basically told us nothing they could do other than refund the fees. Needless to say, it was 11:15pm and we were stranded. We then called a LYFT and they showed up right away and took us home. The fact that they canceled a one day Uber black reservation with no notice is beyond acceptable. They have lost us for life after we have used them for 5+ years.
title: Canceled an UBER black reservation 3 times!!!

review:
Since the pandemic has struck apparently many of the former Uber drivers are able to earn more driving for DoorDash and other companies, which means in rural and suburban areas like mine there are often no drivers available. 

I tried using Uber’s “schedule a ride” feature instead. I figured I’d be good since, if I’m scheduling the ride several hours ahead of time, I would know I had a ride. After all, that is what “scheduled” means: a driver is scheduled. Nope.  It turns out that all a scheduled ride does is search for a driver when the time comes, and if they don’t find one after ten minutes of trying the shrug their shoulders and send you a note saying that they’re sorry. Great. I’ll starting walking home at 11pm.
title: Leaves me in the lurch

review: I haven’t used Uber in over a year.  When I went to login, I was asked for my credit card number “for security” reasons.  That card was lost a long time ago and replaced with a new one.  I’ll contact customer support to get help logging back in.  Their reply included that they need the credit card number in order to login!!!  I responded that the credit card number no longer exist and got the exact same response.  Obviously an automated reply.  It shouldn’t be this hard to recover your account... even with:  taking security super super seriously here at Uber.  Thank goodness I still have Lyft.  Bye Uber!
title: Impossible to log in if you’ve been idle for a few months

review: I signed up with Uber about a year ago. First, they wouldn’t let me use my 2014 Chevrolet Spark as transportation because they claimed it was a two door, even though it is a four door vehicle. Then I bought a 2005 Dodge Grand Caravan in September 2020. I got a notification in January stating that Uber was updating their vehicle years to 2006 or newer and that after March 1, 2021, I will no longer be able to drive for Uber unless I purchase another vehicle. I’m not made out of money or can just go out and buy vehicles left and right whenever the need arises. No way to email them, text or call to speak to a human. Wish they would just go ahead and cancel my account!
title: Can’t drive after March 1, 2021

review: Our flight landed at MSP after midnight and the hotel shuttle wasn’t running. I ordered an Uber for the first time in four years and it was slick. Our driver was prompt, friendly and his vehicle was clean! During our conversation, we found out he’s only lived here for five years. His English was fabulous, which we appreciated, since my husband and I both have difficulty hearing everything. We hope he gets his wife and daughter here soon!
title: After midnight

review: I live in another town and my friend needed to get to work. I just got out the hospital and she came all the way down here to get me. I got the Uber and Ted was so extremely nice and understanding. He was so nice and I was on the phone and we were laughing and I wasn’t there but I enjoyed the ride. Not many people know what you are going through but can make your day better because I could not get there to help under my heath conditions. Thank you Ted❤️
title: Friend Trip

review:
A few days a ago I had accidentally ordered food delivery through a separate app. I ordered it to my job by mistake so I ordered an Uber delivery.
My coworker handed the driver my food and he proceeded to drive to a completely separate town and ignore me.
I reported the incident multiple times and Uber kept giving me a run around saying they can give mt
Information to the driver so he can return my stolen items. I never got to actually get help for my stolen food or reimbursed for at least the delivery charge. Instead they gave that driver my personal information and now he’s harassing me and
 Uber sent me a warning message saying that I put an inappropriate object for delivery.
title: Driver stole my delivery, and Uber punished me

review: I’ve been on hold with customer service chat for 24+hrs regarding potential account compromise. There is no alternative to chat like phone number, etc. I’ve gotten 1 message 4hrs after my first request. The message seemed autogenerated because the message response didn’t realize I already provided the information in my inquire introduction via message body. All that’s said for status is “customer service will get with you with next available representative”. Very murky and unresponsive customer service. Lacking transparency and is expecting “give me money consumer and receive the bare minimum which includes horrible/unresponsive customer service”.
title: Horrible Customer Service

review: This was a very last minute rescue of a friend who needed to catch a flight to Chicago but could not find a parking spot at the airport. I took Uber and met her at a local hotel and I then dropped her at the Airport and drove her car to my home. We had a tight timeframe to get to the airport. She made it and all was good. Michael was very reassuring and very good at keeping our conversation light which calmed me down as we drove from my home to the hotel to get my friend and her two children!!
title: Excellent Driver

review: Maybe I don’t understand the lingo between a credit voucher and a promo for opening a new account and being a first time user. We ordered three items and used the $20 credit but the $25 promo did not apply. This is just a regular Asian indie restaurant that is overall less expensive than Chili’s etc. But the $20 credit was wiped out by fees and a tip. And the food came cold (like pre-packaged food that I had to add water and microwave myself). I don’t understand why I need to tip if there is already a delivery fee. The bill in our opinion was rather high. I dip my feet into this industry, and I draw the line at how much Uber makes off such service. Truly disappointing.
title: Sticker Shock and Promo Didn’t Apply

review: I love Lyft. Always use Lyft vs. the "other one". Tonight I canceled my ride as my driver was pulling up because my coworker asked me why I was sitting outside rather than going home. I told them I was waiting for my Lyft and we realized we were literally neighbors in the same neighborhood so they gave me a ride. Lyft charged me $5 which is totally understandable. Please allow customers to tip drivers for cancelled rides. Felt bad. Still willing to tip him on the lost $20 ride.
title: Please Allow Tips For Canceled Rides

review: I had reserved an Uber for early Saturday morning. Driver came on time. However, he asked me for a pin number that I did not know nor had anyone asked me for. He said he would not take me without the pin number. He knew my name, and that I had reserved the car. He eventually asked me for cash. I declined that offer. He then requested that I cancel the trip and get out of the vehicle. I have never been so embarrassed, nor humiliated. I was getting short on time so I could only try to Uber because I was in a hurry. The second Uber did come quickly and the driver didn’t get me to the airport. This was a very humiliating experience that I hope I never have to deal with this again.
title: Bad Driver Experience

review:
The drivers that I get are so so nice. They put your groceries in the car for you & you end up having a very great conversation. The next thing you know you’re at your destination. One driver Ramy bought my phone to my apartment because I wasn’t paying attention & left it on the back seat. That was very kind & thoughtful of him. He saved me a lot of hassle to have to get another phone. 
Ramy thank you, you went above and beyond!!!!!
title: Driver & passenger connection

review: Brandon was our saving grace, tonight. My elderly mom & I flew in from VA for a family emergency. The flight was late, the weather was abysmal & we were tired. All Lyfts, taxis & other Ubers were canceling or going to be very late. He arrived within 10 minutes of the request & was one of the few drivers on the roads, at all. His driving was superb & he was very pleasant. His vehicle was spotless. He had just gotten it within the past couple of weeks. Thanks, Brandon!
title: One of the few brave

review: I had placed a cancellation fee and in the two minutes they had received and processed my order I was charged $16 to cancel my order. Two minutes for 16$! After reaching out to the support team they did not help rather left me on read. All three people I spoke to did not try and help me understand what the “maximum delivery” time frame was( the main reason they kept telling me I was being charged, and still decided not to tell me what the time frame is). Oh as well I would like to mention I was an UBER ONE MEMBER at the time in which the main purpose of it is for you to save money. Do not waste your money on signing up it does not let you save a lot of money!!!
title: !!!!!!Absurd cancellation fee!!!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 34874275, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-02-15T04:20:51Z'}

review: So, Josh was a great experience today. My first Uber driver canceled the trip as he was driving up to my house. Probably cancelled because he though he was gonna have to wait in traffic in route to Eagles game. Josh picked me up and provided great conversation the whole trip.  Didn’t complain once. I Got out a few blocks away from destination by my request to allow him to pickup his next fare quicker without having to wait in traffic. Birds won!
title: Great experience

review: My driver Natasha was attentive offering to adjust temperature, seat, and even offered to stop for a morning cup of coffee. Her driving was outstanding. She is high caliber, everything you would want if you were a celebrity or wealthy person and I am just regular folk. We had good conversation and before I knew it we had arrived over 30 miles away and through traffic. Kudos for having her on your team. She is definitely an asset.
title: Great experience for first time rider

review: Ismael was an excellent driver and had great conversation! He arrived as expected and his car was clean, music was low and the vehicle didn’t smell like cigarette or marijuana smoke.  He was helpful in directing me to exit the vehicle and I reached my destination safely and on time. He reassured me that Uber drivers are available for quick errands and even emergencies.  Thank you for restoring what’s easy to forget: that there are still kind AND competent people in this world.
title: There are still kind customer service

review: When I’m in the United States the Uber is a very professional very pleasant very clean and swift with a lot of sense of urgency to their job but when I’m in the Dominican republic they’re rude obnoxious they steal as well as a false report and last week I was kidnapped by a Uber driver in the Dominican republic so when you’re in the United States I recommend this app very much but for those travelers especially in the Dominican republic I suggest that you stay away from the app
title: Uber in the United States versus Dominican Republic

review:
Jeremy takes impeccable care of his beautiful Tesla. And as a native New Yorker he was a perfect gentleman. He loaded my baggage and ensuring that I was will settle before he took off. For the very first time I was offered to select a station to my liking, which I declined. But I truly appreciate the offer.
Kindness and consideration truly appreciated these days and times. As a senior let me just say. Jeremy you would make your mother proud. Well of course your dad to. Have a good and prosperous holiday season.
title: Curtesy and Style

review:
I had such a negative experience trying to book a ride that I’m giving up on Uber. I was trying to get to a doctors appointment; first the app declined my payment method even though I could see for a fact that I had plenty of funds. So I tried using a different card, and then a third card; finally it worked on the third card.

Then I go to book the ride and it shows me a driver, but minutes later that driver disappears and it shows me a different driver. This process repeats until finally the app shows that I have a driver but for several minutes the driver doesn’t move. Cancelled the trip, got charged $5. I’m done with Uber.
title: Glitchy app, super stressful trying to use

review:
I have been many countries and toke many different Ubers. Which means I have so many experience on Uber. I would like to share that Switzerland Uber it’s really bad. 
For example. I called a Uber and someone pick it up. I have wait for long time and the driver doesn’t move at all. When I have to cancel the trip and the Uber charge my more than I happy to pay to normal taxi. So I am really disappointing how Uber work in Switzerland. Bad bad bad.
title: Giving too much trust on driver

review: Why does a rider get charged a fee for canceling a ride? A driver can cancel just because they feel like it and nothing happens. I’ve been late to work multiple times because of things like this and it’s infuriating. If my first driver says 30 min away and cancels at the 10-15 min mark they should lose ratings and I shouldn’t have to pay as much for my next ride. Why make me wait that long just to cancel the ride and  potentially make me late to wherever Im trying to go? I don’t understand how it’s fair to the people that generate the cash flow for this business to get tossed aside without any time of apology for bad service.
title: Why do drivers get to cancel rides with no repercussions!

review: I scheduled a ride for my daughter and I to go to airport.  The app did not actually schedule the ride and said try again later.  But, then charged my PayPal account!  There is no place on their help screen to request a refund.  You can request for issues with a trip - but since no trip was ever registered on the app - no way to request a refund.  Even the unauthorized charge section of help doesnt work correctly when you try to enter your credit card expiration date.   WHAT A SCAM!  No way to get ahold of a human when they take your money.   They don’t even send a email acknowledgment reply to let you know if they will ever respond to a request for help.
title: Scammed me when scheduling a ride

review: Uber is a very fraudulent business they continue to raise prices for small distances and are very undependable and useless.
