I can never get a ride that can get me to work on time and why should I have to pay an extra $10 to $15 for a ride that is more than 20 minutes away just because its busy when my destination is only 10 minutes away. The extra money they charge on the customer doesn’t even go to the driver. This is business is totally unprofessional to both the customer and the drivers and I will continue to dislike Uber and I really hope they lose all their business.
title: Takes your money and the driver doesn’t even any of it

review: I have been using Uber for travel and for when I don’t feel like driving and today I redeemed my free meal and when I got to checkout I never saw the promotion applied I communicated with there customer support and they were terrible there is no number and they will just ignore everything and forward you the the next person. When I finally got a response they told me that I violated there policy by trying to comment fraudulent activity…WHAT? I was told in the app I could apply the promo but there is a glitch. I will never be using Uber they are terrible and the 4 and above stars are consumers who haven’t been using the platform that long. They do there loyal customers to grimy.
title: Uber is a scam

review:
I find it easy to use the Uber app. It’s also great that you can schedule a ride closest to the time you need to get somewhere. However, it’s happened quite often where I book a ride and no one shows up. 
I wish that the Uber app would tell you that no drivers are currently available and I wouldn’t be late looking for a ride to work! 
I’ve used Uber quite a lot and see that the drivers are always so nice/polite to which I have no complain in that sense. I just wish Uber would notify me ahead of time if there are no people available 🤷🏻‍♀️
title: Great/bad

review: App has been acting very slow lately. Does not respond when changing pick up spots. Be careful because drivers can cancel on you anytime but when you cancel it’s a $6 charge. You’ll also get a charge if the driver doesn’t want to find you because they have a better paying ride. Customer service is hard to find in the app. If it’s not concerning a ride you won’t get any help on other issues. Uber cash is a joke!!! You’ll put money on the app and a authorization hold is still placed on your card for each trip. Uber cash is sometimes also unavailable….oh no guess what outta luck
title: App does not work

review: I have been using Uber for years and I and a premium member. But the recent increase in price surge activity is encouraging driving to delay pick upsand play games so you will cancel so they do not incur penalty. My last request the driver was only 3 minutes away, yet I watched for 36 minutes as he drove all around the area and then finally canceled on me. I called the help line and they offered me $20, but when I went to rebook the trip the fares had more than double. So not only did I waste 30 minutes if my time, the meager offering didn’t even cover my increased expenses. Not the first time this has happened. Disgusting behavior. Use Lyft, they are cheaper anyway.
title: Prices Surges Encourage Driver Cancelations

review: I’m giving Josh the best Uber driver ever award. On vacation hanging out at Disney land Josh pick me up take me to my hotel. Airhead here left his phone in his backseat. He was totally on. It went through some real hoops just to figure out how to contact me through my emergency number on the phone, which was my daughter at which point my daughter gave him my girlfriends phone number and immediately called it and Wala, I got my phone back thank you thank you thank you, Josh
title: Best Uber driver ever

review: I was picked up from the airport and starving so I asked my driver to take me to a favorite drive through, to which he did with no problem. He did roll down the windows when I got my food, but I respect that because he has other riders and has a nice car. He provided great music and drive safe. My only complaint is t really a complaint but a personal preference. He spoke no English and communication was a solid barrier. All in all he was a 5 star.
title: Safe Ride

review:
My daughter had down load app, and show me how to use it. If my 3 kids can’t take me they tell me to call Uber, I’m a permanently disabled veteran with hopes to take them to Maine and eat a fresh lobster. 
1 bad experience but I couldn’t remember the store name, he just moved here so really it’s my fault. She waited to make sure I made 15 steps to my door, asked what normal tip is she said $1, I said what, I opened my phone gave her my phone cause I don’t know how to round trip a ride. Super Mom!!!
title: Driver

review: Not being acquainted with the area, we wanted to use an Uber to get to our destination without difficulty. We were successful in connecting with Rosemarie, who was on time and an excellent guide to our area. She gave us background information as well as help with finding a restaurant all the while taking us to our hotel. She is very friendly, courteous and has a very clean car, something that we do not often run into. Kudos to Rosemarie.
title: Rosemarie

review: This fool started the whole trip off complaining that my 7 year old grandchild didn’t have a car seat, but then proceeded to drive them some of the way. Then the jerk got mad at my daughter that his app didn’t refresh the final destination. And despite my daughter trying repeatedly to show him what the app said, that jerk kicked them out of the car. A woman and two kids. This person should not be a driver. Thank god the spot they dropped them off was close to my house. What if he’d had his attitude in the middle of nowhere? What if something had happened to my family? This person has no business driving anyone anywhere.
title: Dropped My Family Off In The Middle of Nowhere

review: My Uber driver, Connie from Oklahoma City Hass to be the best person for the public people. She was there instantly she was happy to do it and she took me from Oklahoma all the way to Bridgeport Texas. She was great Uber. It’s self has always been very reliable. I can always count on Uber. I can always always count on Uber for my riding needs and getting around. Thank you Ever for being so affordable. I really appreciate you saved my life today.
title: I took Uber from one state to another

review: My husband doesn't drive due to have epilepsy. So I usually have to pack up all the kiddos to take his to work. It's sooooo exhausting. This is our first time trying Uber and it's a lifesaver. Although very nerve racking because I was watching through the app my hubby getting there safely. He's a GrowN men BIG SHOULDER Mississippi breed man and I was STILL worrying about him getting there. All and all it's a BLESSING! Because before I would have to pack the kiddos up TWICE there and back.
title: Got my BIG baby there safely!

review: I’m Lyft driver and my rate is 5 star and my accountTemporary on hold more than month and the send me email tell me will contact you very soon but no one contact with me and I try a lot of time to contact them but no way to reattach any one that very bad feeling  I recommend Uber app you can call costumer service easy and they care about driver more than Lyft ,Im Uber driver for 4 years and my account now 4.99 star because I do good job and im okey but I did that for new driver if you work with left you lose your account for no reason so don’t work with this company and for the company don’t put very thing on driver when you have very bad costumer support didn’t do them work .
title: Very bad driver support

review: I orderer an Uber for the very first time for someone else & used the app for first time ever and Ana came to our request ♥️. There was a misunderstanding & Ana came back to the spot where I requested the Uber, and she explained to me that when I have a issue how I should and shouldn’t handle it. She took the time to help and explain to me and I greatly appreciated her professionalism and understanding. I would recommend her and for this I give her 5 star review. Thank you again so so much Ana !
title: WONDERFUL UNDERSTANDING & ABOVE AVERAGE

review: Fernando was an extremely professional driver with a great personality - which was exactly what I needed this morning when having a pre-flight meltdown! He is a credit to your company and adds to Uber’s reputation as a successful venture. I am confident he will succeed no matter what field he chooses to pursue; however, Uber would be hard pressed to find more employees matching his skill set and should reward him accordingly. Thank you, Maureen Power
title: Terrific Service; Will Definitely Recommend!

review: Arrived from out of town to learn the metro line stopped working to to a point. Requested an Uber driver to take me to the metro to pick my car from the metro parking lot. Driver picked me up at the exact time and location. He was extremely kind and professional. When I arrived at the metro parking, the driver waited for me to get in the car since the area was dark and my car was the only vehicle parked! Thank you for making me and all of your customer feel safe.
title: Best Driver Ever!

review:
Ronnie made sure we were at the right hotel. Because the hotel recently changed names, google maps took him to the wrong place. He told us to wait while he checked with staff. He returned and said the hotel was a block away. He delivered us to the right place.
I mention this because another couple who also took Uber were dropped at the wrong hotel and had to pull there luggage down the street!
Ronnie did a good job.
I
title: Above and Beyond

review: I would like to say the driver that I had today she was very courteous she said good afternoon to me as I open the door she also went on to ask me how was my Christmas and I respond. My Christmas was great. I asked her how was her? She said hers was great. Also, we need more drivers like her. She have a rating of 100% excellency I would like to have her more next time I use your drivers I would like to use her more often navigate to catch her name, but she was excellent
title: Excellent

review: Uber practically stole money from me and I will never use Uber Eats again. I told them about a delivery where the driver came on a city bike in the rain with my order, destroyed, I informed them over a dozen times from the gate, and all they could do was ask me for a photo of a delivery that was not made because contents were splattered all over the interior of the bag. Little did I know, I had to take a picture of the biker and the destroyed bag hanging from the bar handles. Even more disheartening, is the driver or cyclist in this case took the money and tip without informing Uber on my behalf. The worst and last experience. Not to mention, I am a Platinum Amex holder. Good riddance Uber. You all do NOT put customer service first.
title: Uber Eats

review: Julian was on time. Actually he was early by a half hour and called me to let me know that he was arrived. This was such a relief because I was so stressed out, hoping I wouldn’t miss my flight, but he came through the whole trip from my home to the airport was very pleasant. He listened and had a great conversation. I also helped him out with who he could go to for an air conditioning issue and he was very happy I would definitely recommend this driver!
title: Kindness

review:
The driver was trying to contact me, but since they aren’t allowed to call directly, the communication was delivered through the app. It was at this moment that the app crashed, logged me out, and refused let me log in.

I received a call from customer support: the driver needed my address was was allegedly entered incorrectly. I couldn’t verify, since the app refused to let me log in. Customer support connected me to the driver via three-way call, but had my voice muted, so I was not able to speak with the driver. It was during this time that I heard the driver screaming in rage because I wasn’t responding, an issue that would not have arose if there wasn’t a pointless middleman trying to connect us like an 1800’s style operator.

Three minutes after that call ended, during which I gave permission for the driver to call me directly (why did they need permission!?), I received no call and my order was cancelled by the driver.

My first experience with Uber Eats/Postmates (same company, btw) and I promise it will be my last.
title: Lazy Drivers and a Broken App

review: Carlos went above and beyond today. He waited almost 1 hour while we secured our suburban to be transported back to Northern Michigan, very patiently. His customer service was above board. Too bad you don’t have all your Uber drivers as friendly as Carlos. I’m driving to the airport we found out his son had recently moved to Detroit, which is our hometown and know the exact city where his son now lives. Talk about a small world. Carlos was great and we appreciated his patience.
title: Carlos

review: Uber is the perfect example of the corporate takeover effect in play. They lured us in with lower prices than cabs and more convenience, now theyre 8-15$ more expensive than a cab, and they treat you like garbage. 2 minutes? Thats the amount of time i have to get from my apartment down to the ground floor with whatever bags i have and find the uber driver on whatever part of the street they decided to park on, in new york, in the winter, are you out of your minds? Stop cheaping out on the public, if your drivers are complaining, pay them more or find another incentive to alleviate the stress of accommodating people. You built this company with the guise of convenience, honor that, stop with these absurd policies.
title: I miss cabs

review: I had a lady report me and said we left her car a mess. 11mins of talking to her while driving from one hotel to another in Vegas. Everyone was vibing with her. No intoxication or drugs were in play. We were on our way to a pool party. Pool was actually close. Marie offered us open bottles of water. She had a black head scarf on, and black attire with cat hair all over it. Her car was not the best. Unfortunately I believe she was trying to get more money out of us. She is a scammer. She was very concerned about how long we were staying. Today I left and then I noticed my bank account was debited for her Uber ride. Fraudulent!!!!!!!! I reported her. Waiting for the company to respond.
title: Fraudulent Reports just to make money

review: I tried cancelling an order with Uber eats before the order was even picked up, I was told right after ordering that plans changed and tried cancelling it immediately after. 3 minutes haven’t even passed since I had ordered, it took customer service so long to connect me to someone to try and cancel that they wouldn’t even give me a refund at that point. So I had to pay for something that we didn’t even want because they took too long to get with me so I can cancel, unfair. The representative I was talking to didn’t even sound like he knew what was going on. Train your employees better and stop screwing people out of their money.
title: Horrible customer service

review:
I started using Uber about 2 weeks ago now and I had a bad experience once and decided hey I’ll give it one more chance. This morning I was treated like the bottom of someone’s shoe. The driver was racist and refused to allow me and my 4 children into his car. Then he refused to cancel the trip so I was charged a wait fee because he parked his car and just let time run instead of canceling the trip. 

There is no customer service number to reach a live agent and discuss what’s going on which is not a good deal. You have to go into the app and hope someone will pick up your issue and resolve it. That was my last straw with Uber you all deserve a negative 5 stars honestly
title: Horrible Service

review: It’s alright but completely unreliable and honestly a waste of time. Drivers will just cancel on you if they don’t want to make the drive, prices rise up to 5x original price when there are less drivers, your request will sit on ONE driver for 20+ minutes until they finally deny your request. Most drivers don’t even follow directions. It’s okay when someone actually accepts your request but absolutely terrible when no one wants to. You’ll have better luck with an actual taxi company or lyft - plus lyft is WAY cheaper.
title: Alright but a waste of time

review: I’ve had multiple issues with Uber over the years ranging from rude drivers to refusing to wear masks at the height of the pandemic but my last straw was, by far, the fact that I missed a $700 flight because I had 3 Uber drivers cancel the trip and it took over 45 minutes to get an Uber. On top of that, they charged me over $100 to go 13 miles and “properly adjusted” the price down to $89 when I brought the issue to their attention. They claimed the $15 discount was appropriate despite them being the sole reason I’m now out $800. The drivers are extremely unreliable and their customer service is focused only on stealing money from riders. I hate this company with a passion.
title: $800 later

review:
The app has requested I take a selfie wearing a mask now before I am able to request a ride. I disagree with having to prove that I am complying. First off, without my own opinions of mask policy, I do not believe that Uber should request a selfie from clients based off of a driver reporting mask usage. If a driver has an issue with mask usage they should ask the ride participants to comply prior to reporting it to the app.  
Further more, the fact that uber is immediately, and without verification, enforcing a probing policy to reveal private citizens is off putting.  
I have no had a negative experience with uber at all until I was reported by a driver who did not request myself and passengers to wear masks.
title: Requests selfie for driver report

review:
When is Uber going to figure it out and get some accountability of their drivers? Saturday morning was the worst morning I’ve had all fall and Uber totally let me down. 

I had an Uber scheduled 3-weeks in advance and 2 hours before my ride (1:30 AM), they cancel, telling me there’s some error. Lyft let me down too, and no taxis were available. I was stranded for hours, unable to leave university to get to the airport to see my family. I comprehend that riders are in sort supply this year (2021), but this is a bigger hole is Uber’s business model. Work is work. There needs to be some accountability taken with drivers. It can’t be at their convenience at the expense of the rider. 

Here’s a simple solution: have drivers sign up for shifts. Drivers are designated early-morning, rush-hour, low-activity-time, etc drivers. Or something else. They have people with degrees who figure these solutions out.  The fact that is CLEAR that rides are NOT guaranteed seems like a stupid problem for a company so popular. Come ON.

Fix it.
title: Get Some Accountability

review: I’ve been an Uber driver for two years in Atlanta and let me start off by saying that this company will do whatever it takes to not pay you what is owed pay is based off of miles when it should be off time , the Uber support agents can NEVER diagnose an issue and lastly Uber supports a classist point system from which you earn points and receive benefits however if you don’t keep your rating above a 4.8 I repeat a 4.8 than you lose all your benefits which are crucial for your success with this company if I could rate Uber with a -100,000,000 I absolutely would try Lyft or burning yourself alive anything is better than Uber
title: Driving for Uber is condemning your soul

review:
If you have an issue with a ride that fits one of their canned topics from their auto assistant then you can get support but if you just want to provide app or service feedback there is no easy way to send an email or chat from the app.

Also Uber does not have a priority pickup option like Lyft. Uber may estimate 9 minutes but then assign you to a driver 21 minutes away. I can keep cancelling and selecting other drivers but the reverse auction can’t be avoided. On Lyft I just priority pickup and the driver is there in less than the estimated time
title: No feedback/question tool

review: Riders beware. Uber does not tell the drivers where they are going ahead of time. So if you have somewhere to go, on a tight schedule, Uber is not your choice. I needed to go to the nearby airport for a flight and THREE Uber drivers showed up and one after the other said NO they won’t take me because they do not have credentials to pick people up at the airport. So I asked them why they accepted the ride and all THREE said that Uber did not tell them where the trip ended. I get it, why go somewhere that you cannot make money on the stunt home. Makes sense but, come on Uber. I would’ve paid more to compensate. Very inconvenient for a convenience based company…
title: What an absolute nightmare

review: Visiting California and I thought it would be good to start using Uber again after a year or more. On the first ride they offered me a free trial of Uber Pass for discounts and I accepted. It turns out it doesn't apply to California. That's nice. Why was it offered to me in California ? Then, they charged me for the whole month before my free trial was up, because you have to cancel the one week trial on day 5 or you will be charged for the whole month. Nice job Uber , you've really figured out how to stick it to your customers through fine print and careful product management. Enjoy your $25. I'll make it my mission to avoid your company at all costs in the future.
title: Took me for $25

review: I wish this app had the option to add a stop to scheduled rides. For example if my car is at the dealership overnight, and I need to use Uber to ride with my children to drop off them off at school (we don’t have buses), and come back home, it would be nice to be able to schedule that ahead of time in the app. There is not a driver app that offers that option. Please Uber make that change in your next update for us single moms who work from home.
title: Interface needs improvement

review: They estimated a ridiculous route and I asked the driver to take the normal route, which he did. The drive took a small fraction of the estimated time. There’s NO WAY to contest the charges. Every option in their Trip Help section leads back to a pop-up saying they only charged what was estimated and no more. Great, so they charged a ridiculous estimate based on a route I knew they wouldn’t take, and now there’s no way to talk to anyone about how they’re charging for an amount for an estimated 22 min trip when it only took 5 mins. I guess I’ll contest the charges through my credit card and star using Lyft exclusively. Bye Uber.
title: Can’t contest charges even when the route was shorter than estimated

review:
What a wonderful wonderful experience. This is my first time using Uber my flight was delayed. I’m so so tired it’s like one 1:34 in the morning but ginsing  waited over an hour for me and around an hour. Whatever it was it was just amazing that I didn’t have to worry about how I was getting to my hotel room after such a crazy trip so I definitely recommend it!!  He was so Professional!!!
And great, clean, very nice vehicle!!!! Thank you!!!!
title: First time using Uber!!!

review: I scheduled an Uber for 9:45 AM and Aung was here at 9:40. I was at San Francisco airport by 10:15 and I was at the gate by 11:15. It helps that I have  Clear, but it didn’t help that they had to X-ray my carry-on twice.  I had time for a leisurely lunch before the flight to Ontario. In Ontario I got an Uber within twenty minutes. Yolanda took me right to Claremont to my sister’s house, no problem. The morning cost me about $66 and the afternoon ride about $40. Well worth it.
title: Uber made my life convenient today.

review:
For full discrepancy I have multiple ride share apps so that I can compare them against each other. 

Furthermore, I have had the Uber app for 7yrs now, and in that time I can not recall having had a dissatisfaction in the app until now. Almost 75-85% of the time when I look for a ride it’s either constantly searching for drivers or the screen is stuck on “finalizing driver details” nobody should have to wait over 15-20+ minutes waiting for driver details. This app has just fallen so behind its competitors in the last few years Uber may have better vehicles to offer but their lack of reliability makes them the last picked for me.
title: The Downfall of Uber

review:
Many of the features are great on this app, but when I first used it I found it very confusing. Now that I’m more adjusted it’s ok, but I still find it confusing to put in the starting point. There are 3 things to potentially click on and I always forget which one and have to go by trial and error each time. I also wish it would make it more clear that the ride is confirmed and that I didn’t mess something up. 

But thanks for the rides!  Much appreciate the service.
title: Uber App

review: We were a party of two traveling from a Los Angeles suburb to LAX for a 9:00 AM flight departure. Our driver was already waiting curbside for us when we arrived at the pickup site near our home. The Uber driver identified us verbally and loaded our bags. He verified our airport terminal at LAX. While driving, he was courteous, respectful, and professional. The interior of the vehicle was clean. Upon arrival at the airport departure site, the driver removed our bags to the curb and bade us a safe and pleasant flight.
title: Excellent Uber Trip to LAX

review: In a bind on a Friday morning, car was in the shop and I had to get to work. Lawerence showed up exactly on time, knew exactly where I was going and also knew the most efficient way to get me to my job on time. Arrived 20 minutes early and safely, because Lawrence knew the most efficient route he had no need to rush and we had a nice relaxing ride, I will definitely use Uber again and will request Lawrence if at all possible
title: Friday morning

review: I gave our ride a 5 star because our 2nd driver Larry was terrific Our first driver Ayele drove past the meet and then drove away after he arrived, forcing us to wait again another 15-18 minutes for a new Uber car. He had pulled up too far and didn’t want to wait for us to get our luggage on the rack and over to him. We were not impressed. Or happy. However Larry came to us , helped us with our luggage and made up for the mistake Ayele made
title: Uber

review: I live in Virginia across the Potomac from DC and often have to decide whether to take the metro, drive and pay for parking, or take an Uber. Uber way underestimates arrival times when I select a ride which has caused me to be late.  The app will say pick in 4 minutes but once I select the ride it will change to 8 or 10 min and the drive will arrive 20 minutes later. I wish they would just be honest about pickup times so I’d know when to request the ride or whether to drive or take metro. It’s not fair to me or to the driver.
title: Uber’s Estimated Arrival Times are way off

review: I have used Uber for a while and enjoy the service … in other countries.  Where I live in Argentina, the app is utterly useless!  I have 3 methods of payment, and none of the are accepted to book any ride.  I used to use the cash option.  Now it says cash is unavailable. My credit card is not accepted even though it is a valid card and I have removed it and added it several times.  When I go to use my preferred method, my Argentine debit card, I receive the message that debit cards cannot be used for larger transactions.  The ride I am trying to book is under $10 USD.  Really, Uber??!!
title: Decent service.  App is useless

review: My driver arrived quick and was very personable when I got in the car. I was on my way to work at 5:45 am and it was nice that he made friendly conversation with me on the way. It can feel awkward and uncomfortable when you get in the car of a stranger and they don’t show any interest in communicating with you. Samuel was courteous and friendly and did not make the ride feel awkward at all. It was a pleasant early ride to work. Thanks Samuel!
title: Ride from Samuel

review:
We have used Uber 4 times in last 6 months and a few other times prior. We have had positive experiences. Especially the last four since moving here to the BA Beach. 
Nice clean cars. Good drivers. Pleasant folks. Security features like license plate check and drivers pics. Plus their rating and also driver rating us as customers. We will keep using them. Like the occasional discounted rates that’s offered when book ride.
title: So far loving Uber

review: I had ordered his Uber and hadn’t realized I needed an Fl for our luggage to get to the airport. We were running behind on time and it was early morning. We were very stressed out and exhausted. He said he never puts luggage in the seats and my bossy friend was trying to be helpful but was coming off rude. He was patient and professional, figured a way to make it work and got us to the airport on time and we made our flight home. Thank you!
title: Very accommodating and patient

review: Uber stopped accepting my card for no reason. I spoke with my bank to make sure it wasn’t an issue on my end and everything is good, but Uber won’t allow me to use my card anymore. I’ve used it for over 2 weeks while traveling in South America with no issue and suddenly they stopped accepting my card. After talking to customer service for a couple of days, I’ve gotten no answer about why my card won’t be accepted. Zero help about why my card is being declined and they keep telling me that there is no issue but I send screenshots about the issue and still I’ve gotten no help. Very disappointed about the service.
title: Uber customer service is no help

review: My Uber account was hacked and I was locked out of my account 2.5 weeks ago. First, it was very hard to get in touch with Uber because you have to log onto your app to contact customer service, which I don’t have access to. After I finally managed to submit a complaint, I just got an email saying “we see your problem has been resolved so we’re closing this complaint “. When I replied saying that my problem hadn’t been resolved, I got a form email saying that you can’t reply to a resolved issue. I am still locked out of my account and I have no way to contact Uber so I am resorting to leaving reviews on the app.
title: Uber does not care about customers

review: Used Uber for years with my corporate job. Recently was laid off and drove for Uber. They lied about my earnings by far margins. Averaging less than $10 an hour without my gas and car expenses! Unfortunately I don’t think Uber realizes that their drivers are also their customers. Literally slave labor and paying below minimum wage and taking advantage of people in many ways. Not only will I not be using Uber, but also making sure people I know realize how disingenuous they are. Apparently they raised their take on fares and reduced payouts. I cannot in good faith support a company that is so greedy to treat their employees as such. Support taxi companies that make sure their employees are paid decently.
title: Unethical company

review: I have positive experiences with uber overall, but one issue I couldn’t seem to report was the driver’s icon being slow to change location? I cancelled a ride because the driver hadn’t moved, only for him to show up 5 minutes later after I’d already called a new ride. He didn’t know I’d cancelled. Is this an issue that other drivers have? Is it device specific or app specific? I hope someone solves this soon to make things less awkward for both parties.
title: Slow on driver’s end?

review: I can’t call an uber with any consistency. There are so many times I have a driver arrive and just drive off even though I am outside. There are so many times it takes 30+ min for me to get a ride because drivers are able to randomly just randomly cancel after making you wait 8-15 min…… I am also fed up that there is not simple customer service for this overpaid corrupt company. I cannot even call a darn number to get compensation for all of my messed up ride attempts that at this point happen so often they almost feel like a target.
title: Rich company that barely functions for the consumer

review: The service works well and is seemingly very streamlined when ordering a ride until you try to tip your driver and the app says that “there was an issue with your payment method” or “something went wrong”. I don’t carry cash on hand at all and would like to tip my Uber driver but am unable to through the app or the website. My payments have all been approved and I have the statements for them but I still can’t tip.
title: Can’t tip

review: My ride today was great, except that getting in and out of the vehicle was dangerous.  Did you know that some people, millions actually, use wheelchairs?  I do, and I cannot stand.  So seats much taller than car seats are dangerous to transfer to and from, a fall can break bones.  Yet all this is completely preventable with simple changes to software!  Uber USED to allow riders to specify that they require a CAR as opposed to a van, SUV, or crossover vehicle, then you just stopped.  Why????   This is immoral, wasteful, and a gross violation of the ADA.  So fix it!
title: Uber violates the ADA.

review: Used this app daily to get home from work since I get out at 2 AM. I ordered one the other night after work and everything was normal; it was a quiet ride UNTIL I woke up later that morning to find I got charged a cleaning fee for $150 after doing NOTHING and I mean NOTHING wrong.  So I say “okay I’ll just message support and see what’s happening” WRONG I sent them a message TWO days ago and I still haven’t heard back with $150 still gone from my bank account  and is most likely in the wallet of the driver that scammed me. Thank you Uber for taking my hard earned money and giving it to scammers and ignoring me after I’ve used and supported your services for years now.
title: Got scammed

review: So I book an Uber for $59. Fair enough. It claims it can find a driver in 17 seconds but then says “please be patient”. 10 minutes later no driver is found and the Uber app tells me to cancel and research, leading to a price tag of over $100. in a few minutes. Ok I’m not paying for this anyways, so I go ahead and book it. Guess what? No driver found AGAIN. I cancel and book again, for $79, and finally after an unreal amount of time, a driver is found. If you need a ride to anything, please just use Lyft. Don’t ever rely on this piece of garbage for getting you anywhere on time. I’m ashamed to have even applied to this company as a Software Engineer Intern.
title: Worst app I have ever had the displeasure of using

review: Had a 4:15 am reservation confirmed the evening before…. 4:15 next morning no driver. Then it said the driver was 20 miles away and would arrive at 4:55 for my 4:15 reservation. Then that time just increased from 4:55 to 5:28 to 5:55?!? I tried calling the driver multiple times because he wasn’t getting any closer but no answer. Finally at 5:20 I canceled and was charged $25 cancellation fee for my reserved ride that was going to show up almost 2 hours late. Good luck trying to reach anyone. No one should have confidence in this service because there is no recourse should they mess up and leave you hanging AND then charge you for you being inconvenienced and late for your appointment.
title: Never showed

review: I will never order an Uber again after the experience I had. My driver made several advances at me and made me feel extremely uncomfortable. He turned my destination off and drove me around for several minutes not taking me home. I was frightened for my own safety. When I reached out to Uber to report him, they did absolutely nothing. They told me on multiple occasions someone would reach out to check and follow up with me and no one ever did. This driver is still out there and it is frightening to know he may be doing the same thing to another woman. I am very disappointed to say the least and do not trust this company at all.
title: Did not take my safety seriously

review: Uber has gotten more and more greedy. Now drivers cannot easily access data that shows how much of their hard-earned money goes to Uber executives’ pockets (usually around 60%). If you’re paying $30 for a half-hour ride, your driver gets maybe $10. The bonuses and boosts are few and far-between, and they don’t even make up for gas prices. The gas surcharge hasn’t been updated to reflect rising gas prices. Uber support also says that earnings are above minimum wage IF PASSENGERS TIP, which Is rare. Not to mention Uber still owes me $232 because of an error in their app. It’s a scam. Use Wridz, it’s cheaper and more of the fare goes to the person risking their life and car for you.
title: Use Wridz

review: A lot of time I’ll check how much a trip cost then cancel without confirming. However lately I’ve run into instances where I simply get a loading screen which I close out of. Later I get a notification that my driver is on the way and I have to pay a cancellation fee for a trip I never confirmed. Uber is confirming trips on your behalf and there is no recourse or customer service to help
title: Forced to pay cancellation fees for trips you never confirmed

review: This was our first time using Uber. We are on vacation in Florida, so we called an Uber to take us from the airport to the hotel. Our driver was very nice, and amazing to us. The only problem was, he only spoke Spanish, while we spoke English. It took us awhile to communicate, which we ended up using a translating app, but our driver was still very patient and nice. I’m suggesting a way to choose which language you speak so it’s easy to communicate with your driver, and not have this huge barrier between us.
title: Language barrier

review:
Uber makes it easy to get a ride from A to B but there are problems on some occasions. For example I booked an Uber and waited a while. Driver seemed to have made a few wrong turns and then it said on the way… so the only thing I could do was cancel because my phone call attempt didn’t work. And there was no option to request new driver or anything. Just to accept the fee.

It’s fine now because I got a refund notification soon after I requested support.
title: It’s almost great but…

review: If my issue doesn’t fit one of their help categories, or is not about a specific ride, but a general question about a consistent problem with the app taking drivers to the wrong location at certain airports, there appears to be no way to send a message to Uber.  Why do they make it so hard? A simple email address or even a chat link is all I ask. I can’t even ask a general question such as how to send a Waze or Google route directly to the drivers app to show the driver where I’m trying to go to.
title: Customer support non existent

review:
When I realized that I couldn’t drive any longer I quickly found alternatives means of transportation.. after trying many ride services I’ve come to rely on Uber the most. The app makes setting up a ride easy and the service is always top notch! I’m never re-routed to different drivers and the pick up and drop off time are accurate.
I find the fees comparable in the market.
Thanks for making my life easier!!!
title: Non-driver loves her Uber!!!!

review: I love Uber but the pandemic has affected its service in the suburbs. Places where I used to be able to use Uber I have not been able to do so. Within the past 4 months I’ve had one bad experience (driver said we had no masks on and we did…it was dark and pouring rain..and she refused to stop), one place we couldn’t get a ride due to lack of drivers, and more recently in the city of Philadelphia where we got a prompt ride with a great driver. I love the service Uber provides and will continue to use it
title: Pros and cons

review: It takes forever to get a ride and the prices are ridiculous. I get that you’re trying to get drivers back but why should that be at the expense of the riders?? Driver also tried to force me to cancel the trip when he was only 3 minutes away so that I would be charged and so that he wouldn’t lose any of his rating. The driver kept driving further away then messaged me saying he was at my location when I could clearly see he was not then he just up and cancelled on me. Y’all aren’t going to need more drivers if you end up losing all your riders due to poor service. Do better.
title: Just Awful

review:
I like Uber. Typically you can find a ride using the Uber app. My vibe to pick is that they out a hood on the credit card for almost a week. 

If you add a tip. They will recharge the entire trip plus the tip while the original charge is STILL pending. 

My recent trip the driver was not at the pick up spot and Uber decided to charge me a “late fee” of .22 cents but recharged the entire fee again. The company should be smart and able enough to just charge a difference unless this somehow benefits them to continuously Homs into the consumers money.
title: Credit Card Holds Way too long

review:
I had two rides with Uber, one at 2:30pm in Orlando for a trip to the airport and one from Greene Airport in Providence at 8:45pm for a trip to Fairhaven, MA. 
 Both of these rides were 5 star. I enjoyed speaking with the young woman in Orlando, got to practice some of my long lost Spanish with her and it made the trip that much more enjoyable for me. Manuel picked me up right on time and I enjoyed a great conversation with him too. Both drivers love driving and are an asset to Uber's fleet. Thank you. Robert Bruce
title: Smooth Groove

review: My driver Christian drove a dark gray Toyota. I can’t say that I had any issues at all! The forts Uber driver to legit stop at my house instead of across the street. And not just in front be backed in the driveway so I didn’t have to bring the kids by the road. His car was clean as well as his person being clean. He was polite in a way that not be intrusive or too much. He even opened the door for me to get out!! What a gentleman! Thaaank you Christian ! Bless you ALWAYS
title: Uber driver

review: Alexander was the best Uber driver by far. We spoke during our trip and he is well deserved to have an award. It’s hard to find people at work who actually care about people. I feel like he drives just to help others. If there was a way I could choose him as my only driver/preferred Uber I would. The only thing that would of been better if I had the money to be able to give him a tip because he deserves that
title: The man behind the ride

review: I’ve been switching between Uber and Lyft for a while now and today I finally decided lyft is my go to. Not only are the drivers more friendly but the wait times are also much shorter. Lyft gives a priority pick up option where uber does not and as someone who likes to be at work on time it’s super helpful. I’ve ordered Ubers 30+ minutes in advance and still wound up late to work and today they charged me 10$ to cancel a ride? Not sure how that works but from what it seems they have been losing customers faster than they can keep ‘em. All in all I’d say Lyft is better option when choosing between car ride services.
title: LONG WAIT TIMES AND CRAZY CANCELLATION FEES !!

review: My mom needs a wheelchair van to take her to appointments. Most senior transposition services like PACE often take too long for a round trip. So, the Uber WAV service is perfect and much needed. I’m so glad to be able to use the app to get a WAV van for mom. There’s no advance scheduling anymore. Bummer. But the wait time is usually between 15 and 25 minutes. So that’s not too bad comparatively speaking. We are grateful for the wheelchair van option. Thank you Uber.
title: So glad Uber has WAV Service

review: Taking me home. My Uber driver was amazing. He got there on time and despite that there was a little technical difficulty with the reception. He quickly fixed it and was on his way to drop me off. His car was super neat and smelled super good. He was very professional. He was a safe driver and he deserved a $20 tip. Merry Christmas to my last Uber driver who did a fantastic job not just driving, but driving safely. The energy in the air was amazing as well. May God continue to bless him.
title: Uber driver

review: The pricing on Uber is just a scam. When they see that you wanna get a ride they bump the price up $20 extra even though it is less than a literal 4 minute walk. sometimes the app can be great but that’s only when I am barely using it because then the prices are lower. They continue to over change anyone upwards of $4 or more for a ride never even letting you know they will be doing that. If I could give 0 stars I would. You are a multibillion dollar company but still want to scam customers of their money, then give them an extra slap in the face by returning $0.03 CENTS as if that’s ok, when they stole $4 or more dollars from you.
title: Charges $20 for a 3 minute length walk

review: This is going to be a very specific review, but the price gouging at LAX is absolutely ridiculous. I landed at 12:45 and checked the app, and Uber black (which picks up directly at the terminal) was $70 and Uber X (which you have to take a shuttle/walk to a parking lot for) was $23. Checked 5 mins later and Uber X had gone up to $70. Got off my plane and got outside, and X was back down to $23, so I figured I’d take the shuttle to save $50 instead of paying for Black. Ended up having to walk, and I got to the parking lot and it was back up to $70. I waited 10 minutes praying it would go down, but nope. Prices should not fluctuate 50 dollars in the matter of minutes for the exact same ride.
title: Price Gouging

review: My driver never showed up then I got a text from Uber that said someone else is coming that was 30 minutes late from when I was supposed to be picked up in the first time and my doctors appointments canceled so the second person that showed up I had an issue with the 2nd driver because my doctor appointment got canceled so i had to cancel her trip and I’m gonna have to pay the money for it but you can’t call Uber I really wish you call them because the only thing you do is text him so there’s no way to get a hold of them or anything it’s very, very frustrating.  I’m left with anger and frustration. I’ll never use Uber again.
title: Driver never showed up

review: When I was at children hospital I I tried to get a Uber it ant come to where I was at he call me and say I change my location when I did it and say can I walk out to where he at I told him no cause he should be where my location was so he canceled the trip and other Uber driver going tell me he was at the cross walk of the hospital and when I told him I ant see him he canceled the trip and to today when I tried to get one he had a drop off close to where I was at he took the trip but canceled it when he was 3 minutes away
title: Uber drivers cancel trips

review: App gives the message “oops something went wrong” repeatedly, with an authorization thing through on my card each time it gives that message. Some days I am charged 3-4 times before the ride goes through. Although I EVENTUALLY get my money back, it’s a waiting period with the bank. The app recently updated and not its even working now. The oops message comes through and now I can’t even order a ride at all. Yesterday I tried about 30 times in a row with no luck. Uber messaging to say it’s just an “authorization” means little even its four of them for $25 each for a single ride. That’s still money I don’t have access to for a week.
title: App Issues

review:
I have spent a week talking to customer service including supervisors. At the end they wanted me to contact them with my other account which i told them I can NOT sign in. Funny huh? there is more, they removed every information but not my old phone number that i wanted to change. And now they gave me a phone number me to call for premium support but guess what, when i call the number i am not on the list but my old phone number is! Lol there is more, i can not re open the ticket, when i reopen it it suddenly closed by itself.
By the way i had a uber pass. So you think that is gonna save you? Well done uber well done
title: Customer Service for Riders..

review:
I was at work and I order food around 5:12pm and when I was checking out it said it will take from 30-45 min I agreed because its a normal wait time. But after I checked out it was saying it will be here at my job at 6pm -6:35pm so there was no reason for me to wait that long for food i was leaving work at 6:30. 
I cancelled it and keep on nobody had picked up my order and they charged me $23 fee for a driver that was not even assigned yet and the restaurant. Called their support team to refund me the money because that fee is crazy and they were all just so rude and so unhelpful. never ordering  from there again horrible app
title: Do not use!!! I would give 0 star if i could

review: I have used Uber for at least a year never had a problem until now someone hit the back of the Tesla car that I was in, Uber only looked at me as money in their pocket, because they never physically had anyone to reach out to me to get information or accommodate me back for my situation that  I was in before I went to work. I’ve given so much money to them over the years and I never got one phone call update.
title: Uber

review: I live in a mid-sized city in California, there used to be dozens of drivers available, but now we get sketchy drivers whose scores are too low to compete in the metropolis, and very rarely at that. Additionally, my rating is still just .06 away from retaining 5-star status and I still can’t get a ride. And after your request times out the first time, the app ratchets up the price for your same exact ride by 300%. Uber’s leading competitors don’t do that. I’ll be sticking to them in the future while I freeze my fingers off waiting huddled under an overhang, rather than wait 15 minutes to have my ride request rejected and the price of my fare gouged.
title: Not cheap, not reliable, and not safe.

review: The app works okay, but I’ve become so annoyed by Uber exploiting and abusing the Notification feature, I am switching to Lyft and deleting the Uber app altogether. If you have an Apple Watch, Uber will sporadically send you UNSOLICITED ads telling you to book a ride. You can’t turn off the ads without turning off all Uber notices, so the option is only to receive relevant ride notifications AND unsolicited advertisements, or no notification at all. Well, Uber, how about NO Uber app at all? Stop pestering customers with Notifications that are just junk mail!  Apple should ban such practices.
title: I deleted my App! Too many ads!

review: In all honesty run to lyft or any other thing! I’ve been using uber for maybe 3 years with out a problem. All of a sudden I get banned right after spending 150 on a gift card and put it in my account. That means 150 right down the drain I can’t touch it I can’t put it in another account or anything, and then this company doesn’t have a phone number or anything and the only support you can get is through your account. How am I supposed to go through if they banned my account. And not to mention the fact that I did absolutely nothing in order for them to ban me. When I get in it’s simply hi how are you this and that and I just sit there on my phone.
title: L company

review: Uber drivers will cancel on me right after dropping someone off near my pick up location. You can’t even rate the drivers that cancel on you either. The drivers better be lucky you can’t rate them after that because they’d have a bad rating. The drivers that do cancel are around 4.80+ rating and it makes me wonder how that rating got high enough since they want to cancel on certain rides AFTER accepting it. Just don’t accept it. It could just be my area but either way those drivers shouldn’t even be allowed to except it if they’re gonna cancel literally not even 3 minutes away.
title: Uber drivers keep canceling on me and you can’t rate them

review:
I’ve recently got into an accident and due to that most of my travel is done with my own 2 feet. But from time to time I like to get a ride here and if not only to make things easier for my kid so she doesn’t have to walk the distance I walk. 
So I find it a little annoying when fare rates go up according to traffic and nothing else, and it’s not a slight jump, it’s a huge leap in price 3xs the amount actually. 
It’s unfair to the same folks it set out to make this service for in hopes of helping. But this is anything but helpful.
title: Advantage over Pedestrians

review: I’ve had multiple bad experiences with Uber for rides and for Ubereats food delivery, and anytime I report an issue to their support team, I’m repeatedly told that they’re sorry and there’s nothing that can be done about it. I’ve received cold food and had promo codes not work and there was no resolution to my issue at all or any way to offer feedback on my experience with their service. For the high price and added fees on every service provided by Uber, you’d expect that they’d put any effort at all into supporting their customers. I will not be using Uber services in the future, and I encourage you to think carefully before giving them business.
title: Bad Customer Service

review: First thing the fair is almost doubled and the drivers oh my god THE ARE TOTALLY UNPROFESSIONAL !!!! Like they do what they want and what they find the best for them not what I “ as a customer “ need and also money wise they need to have more change i had to walk THE WHOLE STREET to find change just because he is too bothered to carry some change or walk a little bit and find me some change??? They also cancel the rides without even telling, first they call and know where I’m going and if it’s too far for them the just cancel it WITHOUT NOTICE!!!!!!! Sorry but the app deteriorated and it needs to get back to how professional their drivers were!
title: Lately it’ve been my worst experience

review: I scheduled a trip the night before, and I am still getting to the airport later for a flight, because the driver canceled the trip within the last 3 minutes of the pick up. Then I had to wait another 22 minutes for a new pick up. How is that if I cancel 5 minutes out for a trip I get charged for an inconvenience, but my driver can do it with no penalty? It should be a 2 way street. Shouldn’t I get at least a $5 credit for my Inconvenience what’s the point of planning a trip ahead?
title: Years later and still no accountability

review: I love Uber it’s pretty sweet, but I wish they would make it so I could call back the same Uber to pick me up next time . Because sometimes you have a good conversation and a good trip you wanna call the same person back but you can’t. Cause I always tip them if I enjoy my ride. But overall Uber is the way to go. Also one more thing I wish Uber would pay the drivers more cause they only get half of what you pay for the ride. But 4 star rating. 🙌
title: Uber- request same driver

review: I never travel I never booked but they charged me. I feel pathetic service first they have to check why and who and how cancelled. These thing happen on feb 2020 feb 13 as per them I booked a taxi on 7:55 pm from turbhe to nerul. But same day 7:59 pm I booked Ola from nerul to chatapatiji Shivaji. So why should I booked from turbhe to nerul when I have to leave from nerul to airport. And I got flight for USA after a year when I came to mumbai they suddenly charged and when I ask taxi they said yougot balance of cancellation so when I check the timing it’s only 4 minute different so how I can be in turbhe when I left from Nerul mumbai secondly their customer service I call switch off pathetic service
title: Cancellation fee

review: I usually use Lyft but the prices were high on a certain day and decided to try out Uber. When I was waiting for a car, they changed my driver THREE times. Then out of nowhere it said that my ride was going to cost more??? I didn’t even have a destined driver and it’s telling me that the rates have changed?? So then the ride ended up being the exact same price as Lyft. What a scam. I know the drivers are nice and safe, but the app itself is just terrible. If I knew the rates were going to change I would’ve stayed with Lyft, I would’ve saved time and wouldn’t be late for work!!!
title: Almost late to work

review: I decided to take an Uber to the train station and was very nervous about doing so. You just never know. However, Frank arrived to pick me up and from the beginning it was as if I was riding with a friend. We talked the entire trip and I told him it was such an enjoyable trip that he could just drive around for a little longer. He didn’t but the trip definitely soothed my nerves and I was grateful to have lucked out with such a great guy for a driver.
title: A great trip

review:
On Friday, September 15, I had a cardiac emergency and was taken by ambulance from my Primary Care physician’s office in Holly Springs to WakeMed Cary Hospital for emergency care. 

For the first time, I had to set-up an Uber account in order to get a ride back to Holly Springs to get my car. 

This young man was a very safe & professional driver, had a very nice & polite personality, and he kept his car immaculately clean. 

I am always a very anxious person unless I am driving. 

Thank God this experience was different, after the rough day I had been through.  

We had a very nice conversation throughout the trip from Cary to Holly Springs! After the day and health scare I had just experienced, this ride and the wonderful personality of this young man was very calming for me. 

Thanks so very much to this driver for a wonderful experience with Uber!
title: Diane

review: First of all this app has helped me on many occasions where I was stuck at work from going back home and Uber has helped me in pinch time to time although the only thing I would say is for creators of Uber to bring the app back to the Apple Watch I say was the most convenient method of checking when you ordered a Uber if your phones battery was running low so please bring the Uber app back to the Apple Watch
title: Best app ever made

review:
After having taken a train to Connecticut from New York, we found no taxis at the train station. When I first contacted Uber, the rate that I got was $37. It literally is 6 miles away. I thought that was outrageous. Luckily I was able to catch a bus over to an area, and when I put in for an Uber request again, it was under $10 which was reasonable.

Luckily, we got Hermon. He was friendly nice, personable, and easy to talk with. I highly recommend him.
title: Hermon in CT

review: I had an amazing experience with this Uber driver! They were not only a skilled and safe driver, but they also had such a cool and friendly personality. Our conversation throughout the ride was engaging and enjoyable. It felt like I was chatting with an old friend. Their positive energy and great sense of humor made the journey feel short and delightful. I truly appreciate their professionalism and the effort they put into making my ride memorable. Definitely a 5-star ride!
title: Uber excellence

review:
Alicia was excellent, on time, is a safe driver, is OK. Do you know what I want to go to the bathroom because I have a lot of traffic going all the way home OK OK thank you very pleasant and has a very clean car. It was wonderful to be able to see her photo & that of car that she’d be driving. She also called my phone just as she arrived- great way to ID herself.  Thank you, Alicia.
Thank you so I can wait and find me get $10 off your first order.
title: Great experience

review: Last night I was at the bar and had about 9 beers. First time I’d ever been to a bar, my plan was to get an Uber to get home. I live in a town of 15k so I thought surely there’s Uber around here. I tried to get a ride twice in the app and both times it ended up telling me no drivers were available. Kinda dumb that there’s no Uber drivers at night in a decently sized town. I ended up calling my parents to give me a ride, which I felt bad about but still better than driving drunk. If you don’t want drunk drivers on the streets then you need better access to Uber in more areas. Next time I will call a cab instead.
title: Was drunk and couldn’t get an Uber (still didn’t drive btw)

review: I’m being diamond driver and I have 2400 trip over 4 months the support you get is really bad lots of agent you cannot understand what they speak and they say when you are diamond you get the VIP support which they supposed to answer for you I tried to call So many and time they put me on hold for over 35 minute nothing get fixed for my problem and the payment is really low which is not worth your drive and your time left been better company to work for which you made good money and you got a really quick support no matter if you are diamond or silver or platinum. Don’t waste your time and keep working for this company.
title: Bad company to work for

review: Horrible. I tried Uber Delivery for the free $30 for first order. It was a horrible experience. I’ve been using DoorDash for year and decided to try Uber Delivery. I had driver after driver accept the order and then cancel once they got to the restaurant. This happened 4 times. Then when the drivers finally accepted and picked up the food, Ubers gps sent them to the completely wrong address a mile down the road even though the delivery address was correct on my end. Then the driver cancelled and would not answer the phone for me to direct him to the correct location. Absolutely horrible experience. Will stick with DoorDash and not use Uber for anything food.
title: Uber Deliver

review:
Booked a ride when I got off work , waited for
20 minutes , called my driver and nothing happened . My driver canceled,  no check in or anything , and Uber charged me 18$ for that .. on top of them putting a hold on my account for the 68$ ride . Waste of my time , the driver is trash , couldn’t even call to let me know he’s canceling . Why would I use Uber again if it can’t do what it’s designed to do. Don’t recommend.
title: Cancellation fee for nothing

review:
I agree on a pickup based how long it's going to take for the car to arrive so if it's says 2-3 minutes and then changes to 5-7 min I have to wait longer than expected and be late. 
 But when the passenger makes Uber driver wait the passenger gets charged a fee?  If the Uber is late the price should be adjusted for the wait time of the passenger.  
Then it'll stay on “5minutes” when 2 or 3 minutes have passed. Ive been in ubers where the driver got mad when I asked him to turn a different way and started dangerously speeding because he got upset, and my favorite: this lady decided to do a U-turn and got pulled over while I was on my way to work.
title: Wait time is inaccurate
developerResponse: {'id': 9000927, 'body': "Hi, this sounds like an unpleasant experience. Let us know about any specific incident by dropping specific details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.", 'modified': '2019-06-04T07:57:51Z'}

review: The UI has become far more confusing than earlier simple and clean interface. If someone is not using the app frequently it takes longer than optimal to reorient. I had reserved a ride the night before my trip but it was hard for me to tell for sure if my reservation was still active. Why should I  be prompted for ordering another ride or making another reservation right away? That should be an easily accessible option but it’s not likely my immediately next action.  As a UI designer put yourself in the shoes of the customers. I know this is only one user story.
title: Confusing

review: Hello I just wanted to put my review in because this is my first ever over experience and my drivers name with Matt he was very prompt on time considerate I drove excellent by the time we got to where I was going I couldn’t believe we’re already there we were talking and having a good time but he was driving and watching the road like a professional thank you Matt very much for my first experience you are a professional
title: First Uber experience

review: If something isn’t broken, don’t fix it… I’ve always liked the UBER app compared to the other one, because if there are no drivers available, there would be no “15 Min away” listed.   Now they’re trying to be like the other app and have that listed instead of being blank when no drivers are available.  CHANGE IT BACK!! I do use the app 4-5 times a week to get home from work, it’s frustrating to always see “15 Min away” when there are no drivers available.  I do live in a small town and most drivers stay in the city thats about 12 miles away, and other cities that are just past that one.
title: Dont like the new update

review: I had to catch a 5 pm train from my office today. When I first opened my Uber app to request a ride, the app gave me an arrival time at the train station of 4:36 pm. After the app found a driver and booked my trip, it gave me an arrival time of 4:47 pm, which was a lot tighter. I’d prefer not to be given an ETA if its going to change, particularly after I have already booked the trip. Otherwise I like the app and my driver was great (i told him I was in a rush and he got me to the train station ahead of the forecasted arrival time).
title: Time estimated on Uber app

review:
I requested a ride from SFO airport. The app quoted a estimated price, then searched for a few mins for a driver. Then the app dropped the search without explanation, and when I immediately restarted the search, the estimated price had gone up 25%. Meantime I’d wasted time and could have used Lyft faster for the same or lower price. 

This is unethical in the same way that if you were in a restaurant, had ordered your food and then after several minutes the owner came to say that the prices had risen since you looked at the menu and your meal would now be 25% more expensive, if you still wanted them to make it….
title: Unethical changing of pricing while the app is looking for a driver
developerResponse: {'id': 34475387, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-01-25T10:10:07Z'}

review:
I tried to reserve an Uber eight hours ahead of scheduled pickup. I was denied based upon my location. I should have been allowed based on my rating and not the city. 

I know there’s a problem in the city I am attached but that is not me. I got to my destination with three minutes to spare. I had one person cancel on me and had to make a decision as to when to bail. I got a driver with 10 minutes to spare. 

No fare.
title: Why Can’t I Reserve Based On My Location?

review:
Dear Andrea, 

Thank you so much for assisting us with our groceries in the storm today & I really appreciate it so much & my daughter migraine & my knees were hurting so badly & you really are very special & thank you so much for helping us with our things!  You are an Angel & May God Bless you dearly Abundantly & Family & you’re an Angel& Have a Beautiful God Blessed Fun Happy Healthy Wealthy Christmas & Happy Healthy Wealthy Fun Great Prosperity New Year!  Much hugs to you!  Thank you so much dearly abundantly!  🥰♥️
title: Andrea is an Amazing awesome humanitarian

review: My account was hacked, orders were made in a different state than where I live. I was able to get the money back eventually but then my account was locked and wasn’t Allowing me to log back in. This happened in July 2022, it’s now October 2022 and I still have not had access to my account!! I have been calling the support team and emailing back and forth but nothing has been done!
title: Account was hacked and I’m being punished!

review: Terrible company. I will try to use cans as much as I can going forward. Here is why: I ordered food as usual and was waiting for my order to come. Received a call from the driver who notified me that he was near my house. Turns out that he wasn’t, he went to deliver food to a completely different address. When I told him it wasn’t my address he refused to deliver my food. I never got my order and Uber charged me for it. I disputed the charge with my papal and won the dispute only to find out that they charged me again for this order. Unbelievable thieves!!! Shame on you, your horrible customer service and shady policies. I hope you go out of business!!! Thieves!!!
title: Awful company

review: On be4 i used daily uber nothing happened the driver and all is very professional but this days what going on idk. and about cancellation please solved it, supposed if i cancel the trip after reaching my location then its fine to cut money but idk suddenly when we called the driver he ask the fare rate and then the driver itself canceled it afterwards cancellation fee will come on me again what is this please solve it this one, then we will be so thankful.
title: cancellation

review: I received an email from Uber this morning stating I was charged a cancellation fee yesterday for a ride I did not schedule. At the time of the supposed charge I was asleep and my right arm was hooked up to a dialysis machine with approximately 20 witnesses. Alas, how do I contact Uber? Removing app and will only install when I need to use. Their new, faster update that coincidentally was done that same day, is way too slick for me!
title: Charged cancellation fee for ride I did not schedule

review: I ordered my first Uber and the app said they were 12 min then 9min and kept going down then the time went right back to 12 min. The time kept going up and down for 20min then finally when it said they were 2min away, then they canceled. So I ordered another Uber after 25 minutes of waiting for the first one, and the same thing happened with that one and we waited for the second one for another 20min. Finally after the second one the third one came through after waiting only 15min. I just don’t understand what is the point of this app if the drivers keep canceling the ride over and over.
title: Make sure you got time to wait around

review: I’m so tired of waiting for 15 minutes only to have drivers cancel on you at the very last minute. This evening, I waited over 15 minutes for a driver to complete nearby trips. I was literally 100 feet away from him watching him come around the corner and he canceled our trip because there was a rate spike and I locked him in for half the price 15 minutes earlier. I wish I could say this is the first time this has happened in uber, but it’s not, and I actually have status in uber. I’m blocking uber now, I’m done with them, local cabs of lift. I wish I could write this driver a horrible review, if you ever get Virginia plates UCL 5899 cancel him.
title: Drivers leave you waiting for 15 to cancel

review:
Have a had a terrible time with Uber since covid began and especially afterwards. You will pay a premium on every ride additionally if you try to schedule a ride it rarely works and leaves you hanging at the mercy of the premium.

Be prepared to wait 20 minutes for a ride. Have had to request refunds the last few rides as they have up charged or not provided the service quoted.

Additionally app has severe glitches drivers side that have caused my trip to be increased by 20 minutes as it froze.

Contacted customer support and they refused to refund me. Have spent thousands of dollars with their company for them not to give me 20 bucks back when they’re app malfunctions.
Almost impossible to get rides now in previously busy cities.

Will just start calling taxis as at least you’re witness to the charge and they’re more reliable.

Terrible and lazy service from customer service as they refused to research it and it’s just someone burning through help emails giving copy paste responses.
title: Terrible Post Covid & Driver situation

review: I like doing Uber so I don’t want to completely give it a bad rating but I haven’t gotten paid yet so I’m trying to call someone and figure out the issue. I was on hold for like 10 minutes and then when I got off hold it was like no one knew I was there. As I’m writing this I am still on the phone and I hear people in the background having conversations and this lady is clearly making googoo sounds towards a baby. I am so mad because my issue still isn’t resolved. This is the worst support on any app that I have ever experienced.
title: Horrible Support

review:
I’m a really good customer of Uber. But their customer support and arrogance is the worst! They continuously make changes to their app, and change or take out features without informing their customers. 
Family profiles is completely gone right now. I have someone that is using my Uber that I want to remove and I can’t now. Their support documentation still has family profiles, no mention of not supporting it at all. Or what to do in my situation? How do you make a major change like that, and not update your support documentation?! And nothing on the web either. I also updated my version thinking that might be the problem. No luck! I’m pretty sure I’m moving to Lyft after this.
title: The worst support ever!

review: It snowed a ton and my car wouldn’t make it to work with all the hills. I’m a nurse and didn’t want to call in due to short staffing. I agreed to pay the $55 (surge amount). My driver showed up in a Prius and naturally got stuck and took additional time to get me to work. By the time I arrived Uber charged me an additional $70. I contacted them and was given a $30 ride credit. Wow thank you. Absolutely despise this company. Feel like my money was stolen considering I never agreed to that amount. Ended up paying over $120 for a 10 min ride to work due to snow, and my driver taking an alternative route...because they showed up in a PRIUS and couldn’t make it up the snowy hills. Does not make sense why that falls on the rider to have to pay more.
title: Snow day

review: I have been an uber user for over 4 years...daily! They were amazing in the beginning and prices couldn’t be beat. Now...it can never even find my destination when leaving my house. I have to wait for the driver to pull over and put my destination address in their own maps app and get back on the road to wherever I’m going. I try to give drivers directions instead but they don’t listen (understandably), and want to wait to get directions from app or web. And then I’m late to wherever I’m going. Every. Single. Time. This never used to happen. What’s going on?
title: Used to be good...
developerResponse: {'id': 7503208, 'body': "Hi, we're always looking to improve your experience with Uber. Anything specific we can look into for you? Let us know by sending a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2019-02-28T05:23:12Z'}

review: My driver Joe was exceptional. He not only helped me find a great spot to eat in a new city while I had a few hours to kill before my flight, but also found a place at the hotel for me to store my bags so I didn’t have to drag them around with me all day. He even covered the unexpected $5 charge for it himself. He was so kind and helpful! One of the best Uber drivers I have ever had. If I could give him 10 stars, I would!
title: My driver Joe was exceptional

review: We reserved a ride over a day in advance. Confirmed ride and driver details for it to be canceled 30 minutes before the scheduled time. Several more Uber canceled drivers over the next 20 minutes. 10 minutes before we were scheduled to picked up, we received a message from Uber, “sorry, we couldn’t meet your expectations.” That was it. Our ride was cancelled. Rides were not $40 over what we were quoted and drivers were 30 minutes out. Uber is always more expensive than a cab, but the added convenience is not worth it if I can’t count on a ride. Especially, in an unfamiliar city.
title: Confirmed reservation canceled by Uber with last minute notice

review: I’ve been using Uber for a almost a year now and at first everything was fine, but recently there have been 2 rides that I requested for and the people who picked up my request just didn’t move for 10+ minutes each and had to cancel due to me finding a ride else where yet Uber took my money and never issued a refund for the 2 rides I never took. Im currently requesting another ride as I’m writing this and it’s been stuck on " ride requested, finalizing driver details" for 20 minutes and can’t even cancel it because if I do I’ll lose my money for a ride I didn’t even take.
title: Stolen money

review:
I was in the middle of creating a 2 stop Uber ride and then received notification that a driver had been assigned.  When I cancelled to put my information in again I was charged a cancellation fee.  

I’m going with Lyft since you have no Customer Service even though I received an email stating you can now call to schedule a ride.  It didn’t work and O didn’t get a ride because you had old information in.  I’m very disappointed since I wanted to have a daily pickup/delivery done.  I was then asked to pay to ask questions.  This is VERY POOR customer service.

Thanks but no thanks.  I would give a Zero rating but it wasn’t available.
title: Bad Experience

review:
Couldn’t have been more pleased with my trip. I had a bad day yesterday when my car broke down and didn’t know how I was going to get to work. But Uber came through for me and got me to work on time. Leroy not only turned off his radio but talked to me and made me feel more at ease and made me feel like things were going to get better. It was just a bump in the road. 

Thank you Leroy for brightening my Friday. 🥰
title: Very Professional

review:
For any users reading this, be aware of them, now I will not trust any company, I thought uber respect the money of users, it has been months I am trying to cancel my “uber pass membership” they don’t put the option the cancel the membership. Now all of them want to put features for membership but the worst part uber don’t put the option to cancel it, I don’t like when people take my money, my money is energy, I always used it wisely, I will not allow you to take my money like that, I will try to cancel it again, if you don’t put the option back I will take further action.

PLEASE EARN YOUR MONEY FAIRLY!!!

I trusted you as an innovative company.
title: Uber pass

review: I had ordered an Uber before Charles picked my daughter and I up and the previous driver was very rude, inconsiderate, and unprofessional. Charles was very very polite and courteous. He put our bags in the car without hesitation. His car was clean and the music was very entertaining. He had great conversation and drove with care. He should get 10 stars. I wish I could check all of the boxes to describe my Uber experience but Above and Beyond is the one that describes him.
title: Above and Beyond 5 stars

review:
I’ve been trying to reserve a ride for my trip next month but neither the app nor the website can access my flight with Avelo Airlines and what makes it worse is that I cannot complete the reservation because the software doesn’t allow me pass the flight number entry.
  I haven’t found a way to contact Uber for directions on this problem because they don’t offer much help outside of the FAQs arena.
