   So I’m posting this 3 star review because of the lack of offering help for using their software.
title: Flight coordination is weak

review: Uber shut down because it didn’t recognize my face. Really it’s my face. Then you can’t get anybody or I should say a real person to even check it. It’s all AI and they don’t care if it messes up. Now today it’s shut down to do a background check. Now I have been driving for years. Why would you shut me down. Why wouldn’t you just do the background check and shut me down if it comes back bad! This makes no sense. I am signing up for Lyft. If they run their business better. I’m done driving for Uber. There’s no driver help. It’s all automated. Uber keeps over half the fare. Not to mention the millions u we makes off the data they sell.
title: Shut down

review: Now traveling more post Covid both professionally and personally, the experience with Uber drivers is much improved: on time, clean, professional, safe driving.  That said, the almost complete lack of customer service for riders and ongoing issues with accepting credit cards is frustrating to the point where I had to use another ride application because Ubers well documented issue with accepting riders credit cards has not been resolved.
title: Improved service, worse payment issues and customers service

review: He was actually about 15 minutes early and that was ok because we were ready. Very Friendly Conversationalist and got us to the airport stress free. Dropped us off right where we needed to be. Hardly no extra walking to be done. We checked in went through security in no time at all, partly because he knew just where we needed to be dropped off with a lot less walking on our part. Best Uber Driver Ever!
title: MDW, Very Friendly and Stress Free

review:
It took me 20 minutes to find how to tip my driver today…. and I just happened by accident to trip across something that allowed me to do so. Please redesign your entire app from the view of the riders not your Geeks!
    Also, I spent half an hour trying to find the driver I had the yesterday. There was no favorite button. There was no request driver option that showed.  (WE WHO PAY FOR EVERYTHING should not have to go looking beating the bushes, looking high and low for what should be right there!).  

    Nothing but nothing allowed me to get what I wanted & needed today . Is that a good way to run a company?   

     Thank God I enjoyed both rides and so that is a tip of the hat to your drivers. They deserve a lot more from you too.  

    Thank you and hopefully somebody will see this. And then do something!
title: Love the rides but the APP ~not so much.

review:
Paul picked me up at the hotel on time and brought me to my appointment. I gave him the wrong address!!  I typed in 420 and it was actually a 240 address! We quickly remedied that and smiled and laughed during our goodbye as it was a “whew” moment. 

The UBER system is very reliable; I’ve used it here in Santa Monica and in Las Vegas and Orlando, all with great experiences and fun, conversive drivers. I’m so glad that we have UBER to turn to when needed! I’m a very happy customer!
title: Post-op Patient-UBER Assist gave “Peace of Mind”

review:
This morning was my first Uber trip. To say that I was a little nervous is an understatement, but my baby sister put the app on and I was going to be a brave 72 year old and go for it. 
The Uber app was shamefully easy, within 2 minutes I knew who my driver was, and updated on who, what, where and when on a constant need to know basis.
Soooooo my driver is due to arrive at 5:30am to take me to the airport… OMG she is early by 20minutes, she simply texted me to let me know she was in the driveway. I so loved that 
because I am timely! She was a young LADY!! My heart was so relieved. She was kind, quiet, and shared her love for her full time job as a Uber driver, and the incredible benefits which included tuition. She was delightful!
Thank you Hayden!!! You truly represent Uber… and you alleviated all of my fears with your pleasant demeanor!! 
Roxann
title: First Uber ride

review: My driver picked me up not knowing I was having a really annoyingly bad day. Usually I’m abrasive or standoffish in those moods, but found myself soon just venting and enjoying my ride and actually exiting the car (super clean btw) feeling better about my day and a little more relaxed. Very personable, very nice (not fake gimme 5 stars nice)… first time Uber riding for  myself. If every driver was even half of the good vibes she brought with the ride, the world would be a better place..
title: Backseat Therapy

review: I am a rookie with Uber and had confusion on today’s “practice trip”. When booking, I did not see where to request pickup at a particular time. I wanted pickup in 40 minutes. A driver was assigned and I was told pickup would be in about 8 minutes. I responded I wanted pickup in 40 minutes. Driver showed up in about 8 minutes and told me my booking was cancelled and I would have to make a new booking.  3 minutes later, before I could make a new booking, a second driver showed up.  That was about 30 minutes earlier than I wanted, but I went with him. Drive was fine and driver very friendly.
title: Confused

review: Super great driver really nice guy. I would recommend using him again he’s patient he cares about people and that’s mainly what I think is wonderful. If you’re dealing with somebody in this business he’s there for you. He waited for us and helped us out a lot. He’s a big deal I appreciated it. I hope he has a wonderful evening and a great month and I hope that he makes a lot of money this year maybe he’ll open up another enemies store
title: Gregg

review: I don’t like that I am unable to give 4 stars without choosing (up to 5) issues I had with the trip. I feel like I’m being forced to give 5 stars when it wasn’t a 5 star trip. I consider 5 stars as exceptional service. 4 stars would be good service because I made it to my destination safely and the driver was considerate. 4 stars does not mean there was an issue, only that I wasn’t ‘blown away’ by the service received. Uber should consider changing the options or adding a ‘no issue ‘ option for those of us 4 star reviewers.
title: App Changes

review: I love Uber, it’s a great way to get around.  I’m visually impaired, so I can’t drive. I used to take taxi cabs or catch the bus. But when Uber was introduced to our state, I started riding. I love when I’m going out, instead of calling a taxi, I call for an Uber. To me, it’s much nicer than a taxi and some of the cars are fabulous. If I’m all dressed up, I want to go out in a nice car and beat of all, it’s one flat rate where ever you go. Keep up the good work Uber!
title: A group way to travel.

review: I was a late adapter to Uber.  I was not sure of the quality of the drivers- but finally realized that cab drivers are less vetted and worse!  Now I can’t stop singing it’s praises. I never have to wait more than 10 minutes, the app is amazing-even for a technophobe like me.  I don’t use it at 2 in the morning leaving drunk from a bar- so I’ve never experienced problems often cited in news stories.
title: Always dependable

review: After taking an unfortunate trip to the wrong airport with a 40 minute drive to the other I grabbed my Uber app with the fear of missing my flight and expecting to just have to take the next flight out. My driver arrived in less than 5 minutes, got me there quickly and safely and was so kind! I would recommend to anyone. Even traveling alone the safety features of Uber made me feel so much better
title: My AMAZING experience

review: The driver was really safe to be with, really quick for pick up, professional, quick GPS route to get me home, car was clean, as well as the driver, didn’t have loud noises or was talking on the phone while driving, and didn’t have windows open like most of the drivers I get always have the windows open. Driver had all it takes to have a nice ride, be safe, comfortable, and be happy to ride with Uber.
title: Why 5 stars

review: I was issued vouchers from my work for transport to and from the airport. But I had to actively search and had many trial and errors to get the vouchers to actually appear in my payment options. This was frustrating and too complicated. Customers shouldn’t have to search for a hidden “toggle” button (like an Easter egg) to use vouchers their employers give them. They should automatically appear. Yes they were technically IN my account “wallet” but they don’t automatically migrate to your payment options. Fix this please!
title: Voucher access too complicated

review: So I love the rides. BUT I will say the Uber eats needs work!! The app messed up on a few of my friends but I tried it anyways… So my first order said there was an error? But TOOK MY MONEY. I made a second order (not relaxing they took my money, because it simply looked as if it didn’t work at all) Then all of sudden it was showing two orders. Took money out of my account for both. I contact them and was told there was only one order. They will email the other team and disconnect from the chat. LIKE WOW. okay Customer service is SO not on their list. I am convinced they love taking money on their Uber eats.
title: No to Uber eats tab

review:
Sometimes when I book an hour in advance for a ride to work it’ll tell me that it’s been scheduled then when the time arrives when I’m supposed to be at said location they tell me no drivers where available….why wouldn’t you tell me that to begin with?? Also some of
The drivers have zero idea where they are going since they just moved here even with GPS
title: Terrible communication usually polite drivers

review:
The drivers are fine, Uber in general is an unprofessional mess. The app stopped allowing me to book trips or pay part way through a business trip. 20 minutes of time wasted with customer service trying to blame everything except their app. Two cards from two banks didn’t work, Venmo didn’t work, PayPal didn’t work and Uber still tried to say it was my bank.. Uber then said my phone had to be reverified because apparently they had an error with that too. Then they couldn’t reverify because of more errors.

Same cards work fine with Lyft so my whole team is switching over. Literally had one job Uber 🙄🙄🙄🙄🙄.
title: Garbage Service - Went Lyft

review:
Ordered Uber. Driver cancelled in me and Uber turns around and charged me for cancellation bc driver had to wait.

Well, before accepting the trip, the app showed me 11 min wait. Driver showed up in 5 min. So he had to wait for additional 5 min. Uber policy says that is fair. How? If u tell me 11 min before driver comes them i hv that 11 min. Not my problems if he/she shows up early!!!!  I would rather get TAXI or I guess time to try out Lyft and other companies. Uber is just going down in services. And some drivers are just not as well screened!
title: Uber policies are not fair to the customer

review: Both Uber and Lyft used to offer coupons and discounts before the pandemic hit, but ever since they’ve used it as an excuse to gouge customers for all they can. And conveniently at times when it’s “busy” (even if traffic isn’t even that bad) the price triples. It’s still cheaper than Lyft, but marginally. The reason I gave two stars is because to be fair, most of the drivers I’ve had through this app have been great. But I’m beyond sick and tired of paying more for two trips than I do for gas every week just because I needed a ride for whatever reason. It’s literally highway robbery.
title: Total rip-off since COVID

review: Honestly such a stupid app and thing. Like first, you’re gonna make people pay an arm and a leg just to travel a couple miles. Then you give people the option to schedule ahead. But, drivers are never on time, probably because of the way the app sends out the rides to their drivers. If someone has requested a specific time frame, uber should have the driver pick up in that time frame otherwise what’s the point of having the schedule ahead. Like it’s actually ridiculous making people late for work, and you can’t even cancel unless you wanna pay a fee on top of the $20 you already spent for like a 10 minute ride….
title: Get a taxi

review:
This app would be better if opening after a ride actually went to the tip and review section like it used to instead of relentlessly pushing me to order food every single time.

Also, the “add to your tip” feature has inconsistent/confusing wording. It says add, not adjust . Makes sense. But then the screen comes up showing the base fare and asks if you want to set the new tip, not add it. But it is still adding, not re-setting.

I know the development team can’t be small enough to miss this kind of stuff out of lack of people.
title: Really simple fixes…

review: I decided to take Uber today to a medical appointment from Downtown Los Angeles and had a driver who only speaks a foreign language (of which his name is Pogos) that I do not know of and asks me of some kind of number which I couldn’t understand. He was absolutely rude and told me to get out of the car. I’ll be switching to Lyft instead. As a result, I was not able to make it to my appointment and had to reschedule. Furthermore, customer service on the app should be improved and provide a customer service phone number for riders. I will no longer be using Uber as also the wait times are so long and ridiculous. I would give Uber zero starts if I could.
title: Terrible experience today

review: it’s literally always something with this app. They charge you a price and then change it 2 days later to & make it way more expensive god knows why that happens or how that even makes sense but if that’s the case they need to tell you the exact price when you order it and not two days later trying to charge you something more. Its always unnecessarily expensive from the beginning any way, literally over $20 for somewhere 10 minutes away or less but is also the same price for somewhere that’s probably 20-30 minutes away like it just makes no sense. Dont use this app, use lyft its better.
title: Lyft is better!

review: Tried calling Uber to pick me up at the airport and my flight was delayed 8 hour. I wanted to go To a nearby restaurant 1 mile away. The car they were sending today was 22 miles away. So I canceled it and ordered a taxi. Uber still charged me for the ride,. In these cases the driver usually cancels the ride because it’s too far away for such a short distance. But Uber charged me anyway. I use them as little as possible because Lyft pays their drivers more and you can actually communicate with their service, quite unlike Uber. I had to search several minutes online to contact U. They made it so there is no way to do that directly.  Awful company
title: Just awful

review:
The rides are fine. When I needed a one time ride for work, I used the free trial for a Uber pass, and I CANCELLED it and deleted the app after using it, 
(since I only needed it for a one time ride) but the app not only CHARGED my card after I cancelled one of the rides 
(didn’t give me my money back), BUT charged me for the UBER PASS 2 days ago, even though I swore I cancelled it before deleting the app. I’m boiled. 25 dollars stolen from my account, for a pass I literally will never use, AND not able to get a refund even though I never used the pass yet. Absolutely not. Will never use this app again. Money hungry.
title: Uber Pass

review: Very convenient but the only issue I’ve been having lately is that when I schedule a ride it will say 8 min away but then I’ll look at my phone 2 or 3 min later and it will say Uber is here(or almost here) without even notifying me so I have to run downstairs so they don’t over charge me. Other problem is I’m not getting people that don’t speak English. And it’s hard for me to communicate with them. So when it comes time to pick me up from my job or my apt they either get here and I can’t explain them exactly where I’m at and I get charged for the ride, which is not fair at all.
title: Good

review:
Very happy with this driver, however, had bad experience yesterday with Uber….
Driver claims he could not get to me after the ball game and asked me to come to his pick up point… I could not is I cannot walk well as I’m on a cane… cannot easily walk.
He charged me for the trip, which I think was not right as he never could pick me up.
I would like to be reimbursed for the charge from uber
Thanks, Dennis Adams
title: Happy today… unhappy with Uber yesterday

review: I’ve been an Yber user for years but I had 3 fraudulent charges on my credit card. The first charge was in August 2023 for Uber Eats. This month I ordered a meal for my friend on her birthday but it was not delivered. Uber refunded the charge for the meal but not the tip for a meal that wasn’t delivered. I contacted my credit card company. They canceled the card & issued a new card. Uber charged the new credit card for the fraudulent charge from a different state. I contacted Uber and spent 30 minutes chat messaging with what I hope was a live agent not AI. No resolution yet. I will close Uber account and go to a different ride share platform
title: Fraudulent charges

review:
I’ve been using UBER for a number of years. I have never had a problem ever. The responses are quick. I truly feel safe. The drivers have always been courteous, and I have always reached my destinations fast.
Whether I have gone 15 miles or a half mile, they have always got me to where I am going as quick and safe. I am very satisfied as a customer. California, Florida, Alabama, or Indiana. I can depend on them; so far. Thanks Uber !!!!!
title: Best Drivers

review: Every time I try and use the Uber app there’s always this extra surcharge for going anywhere. I live 5 miles away from my house and it’s always 12-15 dollars. Lyft is much more affordable and pocket friendly for the same distance I usually only pay 8-9 dollars. I’ve had the WORST OF THE WORST experiences with Uber today was the final straw. Spent over 40 dollars to get coffee then didn’t receive the coffee you would think I’d get my money back but Uber absolutely refused then couldn’t even tell me where in the terms and conditions it states that a refund is not possible due to my situation. Customer service is horrible and they outsource outside of the US.
title: Too expensive

review: I will never understand the point of making ppl wait up to 10 minutes for an Uber but the drivers can’t wait for no more than 2 minutes until it leaves and an additional no show charge. That makes no sense. I feel the amount of time it took for us as customers to wait for the Uber to get there is the amount of time the Uber should wait until it drives off. It’s absolutely no fair as customers that we get the short end of the stick with this kind of service. Also, if the driver isn’t within a 1-2 mile radius, they shouldn’t take the call
title: Unfairness

review: The drivers are nice and try to be very professional and helpful. The problem is with the app. I have already added ‘my home location’ and it still give the option and make me got ta a nearby pick up location?! Maybe I do something wrong, but when the place has a clear address, why is the need to give an option “pick up location”?
title: The app adds a pick up location when not needed(there is an address already)

review: Sometimes the ap tells driver to turn left when it should say right.  This has happened on several occasions with different vehicles and drivers.  That’s why I believe it is your GPS service.  Drivers that don’t know the area go out of their way… hope they get help soon.  Frustrating to riders who know where they are going yet have to endure the ‘scenic’ route … and be late for an appointment.
title: Directions

review: I used uber because i didn’t have another option. But UBER is a scammer. It charged me $27 for like a 5 minute drive to my house. And my uber only got paid $12. Its crazy how uber charges so much money for rides and they dont even pay the drivers good. Which are the ones putting their own car and gas to drive people around. This is a corrupted business. And i have used it many times and its not worth it. This is good for emergencies ONLY. But the prices are ridiculously overpriced. I dont get why its so expwnaive when the drivers barely even get paid. Uber keeps most of the money whoch is insane.
title: Rip off

review:
“CHECKR” 100% SELLS YOUR INFO YOU WILL GET CALLS FROM SCAMS IF U PUT YOUR INFO INTO CHECKR

I am now currently on week 3.5 of waiting for my background check to clear. (I understand that background checks take some time but I was able to get a DOT background check to clear before Uber was and the DOT check was done a week after I submitted Ubers)

I was really counting on this to make some money. Every time I call support for help it’s like they don’t even hear what I’m saying I have to repeat myself 6 times before they understand. Also when I try and talk to support through chat it’s more of the same runaround they don’t even read what I’m typing. Very disappointed with Uber,
title: Disappointed

review: What can I say!  Thank you Janis for being in the right place when we needed a Uber after experiencing car trouble.  You were very professional, a safe driver and very comfortable ride in your Outback.  We appreciated your attention to detail in providing the iPad that we could choose to listen to music of our choosing or even a movie and enjoyed sharing our Uber experiences.  Thanks again for the ride home!
title: Excellent!

review:
I live in Lambertville, and I needed to get downtown and quickly.  The car of the friend who was going to take me had trouble, and called me 15 minutes before he was going to be picking me up to tell me he couldn’t. And to try Uber.
In a very timely fashion, I was picked up and taken to my appointment a half an hour before I absolutely needed to be there. And Michael was very sociable, and yet kept his eyes on the road, and I am very pleased.
title: Great response time

review: The app is fine. It’s gotten pricier over the years, which I hate, but whatever. But you’d better hope and pray you don’t have any kind of problem that you need resolved. I got charged twice on two separate cards— they do not make it easy to report your issue, and once you do, pretty sure you are talking to a bot (or a VERY single-minded person). My issue is the type of thing that if I could just explain it to a human being, we could figure this out, but because it’s multiple charges/cards, I have to put in multiple reports and start the process multiple times, and I am getting nowhere. This is a nightmare.
title: TERRIBLE customer support

review: My first time using Uber. First driver canceled on me because he couldn’t/wouldn’t drive around the hospital and find me at the emergency room entrance. I was standing outside and it was freezing cold. Second driver just never came. His 7 minute arrival time never changed. So I canceled that driver and got a new driver in 5 minutes. And he arrived in a Tesla! Only time I’ll ever ride in one of those. He was super nice, asked me if I was ok after leaving the hospital, and he showed me all about his car, which I just loved. So, thank you #3 for giving me the ride of my life.
title: Third times a charm

review: The app continues to spam me with unwanted promotional notifications, even though I have explicitly disabled them on the website itself. There appears to be no way to Unsubscribe from promotional notifications from the app itself. Even though I went through this whole process on the website, I’m still getting spam notifications on my phone. It’s the worst thing you can possibly due to a user: promotional advertising, via notification alert, not at the time of commercial intent, after such notifications have been disabled and user has opted out of promotional Notifications. One star
title: Spam notifications can’t be disabled

review: This is my first solo Uber adventure, I am a truck driver by trade and most cases it is difficult to find ride or to costly to utilize taxi services, John my Uber driver was fantastic, not being familiar with the app or options I can utilize within the app John walked me through, taking his time to work with me so I understand what the app does an giving different options hat work best for me, h wa professional, courteous and very knowledgeable, thank you Uber and thank you John .
title: 1st time Uber user

review:
Morcos ended up having to wait well over an hour from landing to getting luggage.  He was patient and communicated well regarding to  where he was parked.  

The drive was very pleasant  Marcos shared a lot of great facts about the parks and even some history.  Our drive started at 12:30 in the morning!  He was engaging, friendly and professional.   Thank you for a wonderful experience .  Thanks for the laughs and the ride to our home Morcos!
title: Great ride and driver!

review: I love apps that are intuitive and this one has that going in spades. It does what you would expect it to do and does it in a simple, straightforward way. Booking a ride is a couple of clicks, and when they driver shows up at your location on the screen he shows up there in person. I never have to do much as type an address in. It’s an absolute pleasure to use.
title: Does what it’s supposed to do and does it well

review: I was in other city and sadly I left my cell phone in the Uber, I did everything they asked me to try to contact the driver, I gave them the information of the vehicle, the color and the license plate and they did not help me at all, I called 27 times to my cell phone and in the end they turned it off!!  your customer service is the worst, my cell phone was stolen and you guys didn't help me at all.
title: Uber has the worst costumer service!!!

review:
I live in the USA and travel to Brazil at least twice a year. Whenever I try to use Uber in Brazil I get an error message saying the app does not accept cash payment’s for rides, even though I have inserted a valid credit card information. I have tried to contact Uber and since I can never talk to a real person, the entire conversation is done through messages, I was never able to solve my problem.

I have deleted the app, Re-installed it, I have tried and USA issued credit card, a Brazilian issued credit card and nothing works.

Very frustrating and I don’t know what else to do, except to download another ride app.
title: Impossible to use Uber in Brazil

review: Uber decides to cancel out rides quite a bit and it charges my account sometimes I get the money back and sometimes I don’t I have reached the support team about it plenty of times and showed screenshots and documentation of it being taken out of my account and not added back into my account and I get nothing but run around. Happened 3 times and I’m over it one charge being over $42 for a ride I didn’t even ride in. Was just a canceled payment. Never received payment back for ride I requested. Pretty crappy if you ask me for me to be dumb and give them try after try and they’re just ripping people off.
title: Canceled rides with no payment return

review: I was using Uber when I was in NC. As I was using the app it was great not a single weird/unprofessional ride. The only thing I have to complain about is that the app somehow subscribed me for the 25$ monthly subscription and I didn’t know about it until today. I contacted support and they couldn’t refund me for the whole year that I wasn’t using it. They could see in my history that I haven’t  used the app since last year October, what they said was basically I lost all the money that had been charged all year and the last two months of last year(which is 300$ excluding this month) which is outrageous.
title: Somehow Subscribed When I used it back in 2021

review:
Hello your app is great but the drivers in Dominican Republic are scamming people and making them pay in cash with out you telling you they also use your app to find people and then make up there own prices. I would highly stay away from the sdq airport. The Santo Domingo airport are n republican Republic they are abusing your app my family was a victim of this!

You guys just need to get a under cover driver and note them.
title: Great app but huge scam on drivers

review: I requested an Uber to drive my sister to the emergency room. I carefully entered her pick up address and the address of the hospital, but the screen gave a totally different address than the one I entered. I could not change or correct it, I could find no number to call. I live out of town and rushed to her apartment and personally drove her to the hospital. Cancelling it was impossible. Nevertheless I got charged in full. I’m a senior citizen and this has been one of the most stressful days in recent memory. My sister was admitted to the hospital. I don’t see how I can ever trust Uber again. Why would they show on screen a totally different address than the one I entered?
title: Wrong address

review:
I had a ride from Washington DC (crossing of H-St and 17th ) to my home in Springfield Virginia The driver didn’t know the route made two vital mistakes to get to I-395 we swank by same parts of Constitution Avenue
The the system has the audacity to add distance charge of $26+ This is not acceptable I am stopping the payment ASAP
It is ridiculous that the Uber driver didn’t know the route - Instead of taking Springfield/Franconia exit 644 he kept on driving on I-95 south and finally took the Franconia exit that added at least 6-7 miles and 12 minutes to the ride Under no circumstances I am going to pay more for a ride that took longer time/driving distance due to driver errors
title: Ride from Washington DC

review: As uber driver I have experience trauma onto their platform while working for them, I was robbed on 29 July!!! By a passenger and Uber on the police seems to know little about what will happen to my expense and for the days it cost me not working. Uber needs to protect its partners since as we make them so much money if that person had decided to shoot me nothing would’ve happened and a person would’ve got no way there’s no life insurance or not guarantee if something happens while I’m working for Uber or if one of your passengers decides to rob me or kill me. It Alarming how Uber state that pepper sprays aren’t allowed on Ubers but they don’t have any insurance to protect its partners life.
title: Uber driver life is at risk!

review:
I’ve disabled push notifications for promotions, news, discounts, etc. Just ride notifications.

And I still get ads

I got another this morning.

My ability to use my phone without getting distracted, considering I have ADHD, is a premium I value. Breaking settings like this is something that will get this app jailed in having no notifications enabled whatsoever.

And, truly, those notifications are optional. Rides frequently come fast enough that — in waiting for them — I just remain in the app. So disabling notifications entirely isn’t a big deal to me.

Breaking a promise not to distract me when I configure the settings is the big deal. In an otherwise quite competent and pleasant to use app, that gets you knocked down two stars at once rather than my regular one star per noticeable flaw. Because it matters to me that much.
title: Does not honor its own notification settings.

review: Uber used your needs to make money. I can’t count how many times this has happened to me, but this morning I ordered an Uber at 4:30am (I had to be somewhere by 5:15) and it took forever to find a driver, then didn’t find one and canceled my trip, and then prices had TRIPLED. It said it’s because they were busy but I highly doubt they y were that busy at 4:30am. I can’t count how many times Uber has made me late or made it so I had to scramble for other last second plans. Do not use this option for anywhere important or if you need to be in time. It is NOT reliable.
title: Ridiculously Manipulative

review: If Uber had the Uber Pet option in South Bay Area like it does in other areas, I would totally give it 5 stars. I’ve always used Uber ever since it first launched and no one knew about it. I don’t have a car so I always use Uber to take me places but when I want to take my dog with me, most Uber drivers don’t allow me unless I tip them generously. I understand the reasoning behind this but I’d much rather ride with drivers that are pet friendly and don’t give me a rude look when I have my dog with me.
title: Uber Pet?

review: Ordered food, after an hour and a half, gos has the driver there, contact Uber eats they cancel my order and tell me to call the driver myself, asked 30 plus times a simple why was it canceled and I received no response, I wanted to know why don’t order food again wait 2 hours and don’t get it, they would give no honest answer they blamed the restaurant and blamed the driver but would not contact them to find out what happened, an honest answer would have solved my issue but they were unwilling to investigate, I would not use Uber eats or recommend to anyone, there are many more delivery services with good customer service
title: Two hours no food no explanation

review: I mean what a joke. Don’t use this app if you want to get anywhere on time. Wait time is between 3 and 30 minutes and it could be even higher. I keep getting drivers who are 10 miles away and I live in the busiest part of Los Angeles. This app has become utter garbage and I would not recommend to anyone. This app can make you lose your job and has lost all semblance of professionalism. The app alone isn’t responsible, though. These drivers take their sweet time and use inefficient roots god knows why. The combination of unprofessional drivers and a dated app is why the once great Uber has fallen as far as it has and is now a scam. It’s really a shame
title: Absolute Garbage

review: I am really upset with Uber as I feel that they are deceptive.   We got an Uber to a concert from my house.  The Uber cost 18 dollars.   We had a good time at the concert and a few beers, so obviously we had used Uber so that we would not have to drive to the concert or back home.   When it came time to leave, I was shocked when the same ride was 55 dollars!   This is TRIPLE the amount of the first ride!   Of course we were trapped at that point, as we had taken the Uber to the concert and had no ride home.   Uber forced us to pay 55 dollars (plus tip) for a ride hike.   It feels a little sketchy.
title: Tripled price for Ride home - very deceptive

review:
So the application itself is pretty easy to use BUT the company UBER is pretty worthless now. There’s been several times where I book a ride, then the driver accepts, calls me, ask me where I’m going and tells me they can’t take me after all and cancels on me. 
Another thing I can’t stand, I was sitting waiting for the app to locate a driver when 5 drivers were waiting right in front of me also saying they were looking for riders, but yet as I wait the rate went from $38 to $72 (I’m not making this up), we were waiting for so long the Uber driver said I can just Venmo him the amount it said it would cost. 

This is getting ridiculous
title: This App Has Gone To Crap

review: This is my second time using Uber although the first time I had an awesome experience but this second time was not so great I lost my ring. After I got to the house I went I realized I lost it so I contact the driver he wanted to meet half way.I offer him some more cash for him to bring it to me and he agreed.I am now waiting for the call back and it’s been THREE hours since I have not heard from it. I did what I did I let the customer service people know also nothing I need my ring back ASAP! 😡 i also tried calling the guy who drove and he does not pick up. Uber im highly disappointed.
title: Driver not responding 😡

review: I have used Uber at least 5 times weekly for over 4 months now and I have been extremely disappointed with the customer service response to 2 rides I have has that ultimately have ended up being unsafe. When’s you’re already in the car it is quite difficult to get out in the middle of nowhere and wait for another ride when you’re on your way to work. Drivers often accept rides from 20+ mins away as well in the SLC area so it needs to be planned out in order to make it anywhere on time. They are not empathetic and provide a platform for unsafe and uncomfortable riding scenarios with drivers. NOT OKAY!
title: Terrible support, unsafe rides

review: So I was scheduling a ride and I realized if you schedule over 2 h it charges you extra, in my case 32 dollars, but if you schedule with less than 2 hours it’s charge you less it was 19. The thing is not the price, but when I schedule to charge 19 it says my card was decline, but when I am willing to pay 32 dollars it’s accept. I do not want to pay extra because I only schedule because I can put the exactly time I get out work but I don’t want to pay 10 extra dollars I don’t even live that far to pay 32 dollars
title: As much I like the app it

review: I have had such a struggle with Uber eats today! What a frustrating experience.. first of all, it absolutely doesn’t remember my order history.. so every time I got out of the app and relaunch, I had to find the restaurant again and add my food again! Then when I finally go to checkout, it says restaurant is no longer taking my order! Why did it even allow me to choose items if the restaurant doesn’t want to take the order.. then when I find another, it doesn’t let me add items to my cart... also 90% of the restaurants in the list don’t have drivers/couriers hence I am unable to order.. uggghhhh.. giving up!
title: Uber eats in Uber app is the worst ever

review: Recently booked a Uber in Vegas and had a driver arrive exactly as the app mapped them. They had all my information names, location, etc., but different car and after getting in I got a call from actually driver. In short the real driver canceled the trip, which cause the guy who’s car we were in to demand cash or we could be let out in a dark side area in Vegas. I contacted Uber refunded the cancellation fee, won’t address the cash I was forced to pay and won’t tell me if it was honest an app screw up or a safety issue with someone getting this info from Uber. There customer service has been worry less and now my wife doesn’t feel safe using Uber as they can’t be honest and straightforward.
title: Uber Safety Concerns

review:
Called for a ride— after a few minutes, it didn’t say I received one so I made another reservation and I got a ride. A minute later I get a notification saying I had ANOTHER ride. So two. I could interact with one of my rides but only got notifications from the other. I could not see the other’s location nor could I message or cancel the ride. I had to cancel the one ride I could see since the ghost one showed up first, but it said I canceled that one as well... so I was stuck with no ride.

Now I’m sitting here at a stop sign at 10pm waiting for my sister to pick me up because I couldn’t be bothered to deal with this crap again.
title: Confusion!!

review: I scheduled an Uber for 8:45-8:50. My driver came 20 minutes early. So I told him I’ll be out at 8:45 because that’s the time I scheduled for. He canceled and left. So when I canceled the Uber, they charged me for canceling when my driver was the one who left. Every time I scheduled an Uber, the driver wants me to leave 20 minutes early. I scheduled one for a reason, not to be at work 20 minutes early. I’ve been using Uber for years and since this scheduling has become a thing, drivers are being more impatient. They can see the time I scheduled for, yet they rush me to leave extremely early.
title: Charging for cancellation

review:
I enjoyed the ride with Raymond. He was very friendly and easy to talk to. We had a great conversation. 
I have an issue with the Uber website. I tried to put in my payment information and book the reservation and it says “Information is already entered please enter another payment form. “ So it would not book the reservation. I finally had to use the app on my phone to get it booked.
title: First trip using Uber.

review: I love, love, love, love, love, Uber. It is simple to request an Uber ride, and the Uber car pulls up to your home; you get in the car and ride it feels so comfortable. Also, it is affordable. It lifts the burden off of me depending on people to come by to pick me up and take me home. It gives me the freedom to go wherever I want to go, and it lifts the burden of driving off my mom. As long I have places to go in Jacksonville. I’m taking Uber. I would recommend Uber to anyone.
title: Uber

review: I was running late to my internship but my deposit from freelancing hadn’t hit my account yet but I still tried to call an Uber despite what my account said and Uber allowed me to ride free  temporary If I agreed to pay later. Things like this is why I choose Uber instead of Lyft. Lyft is cheaper sometimes but Uber offers so much more. Truly greatful I made it to my internship and I look forward to paying u we back!
title: Get a ride on credit !

review: I am trying to use Uber for the first time in about five years.  I took a trip where the GPS malfunctioned and showed me teleporting all around the city with a price about 10 times what it should’ve been. After talking to Uber customer service on the phone three or four times. They agreed it was an error and credited my trip, but then kept recharging me the same amount. Every time they credit this happened over and over. That was many years ago and I had forgotten about it. But now I open the app needing a ride home tonight and they want to charge me for this again. Awful service.
title: No customer service help for errors in trips

review: Fernando, is an amazing man! He drives for Uber! Joseph call us from the place Fernando dropped him off. Joseph called us with his IPad to contact Fernando ‘cause he forgot his cellphone in his car. We got so worry, cause my son’s cellphone and his IPad are the only tools that he daily use to work. We contacted Fernando and immediately he replied back and went back to give my son his cellphone. Thank you so much!!! Fernando is a good man!!! Blessings to you and your family!
title: Re: my son Joseph’s cellphone

review: The ride was comfortable. He managed me and my walker well. Very professional and polite. Would request him again if possible. It would be helpful to have a comment part. I have a walker and I had to change the time by 5 minutes but no way to do that. So I had to cancel that ride and immediately make a new reservation 5 minutes later. Could I have done that easier?
title: Comment spot on reservation

review: Last night I got a Uber driver named "chequita" to go to a store with my baby. First she was not at the right pick up location seeing as I had to carry a car seat which was heavy she did not try to get near to help me out. Then once I got to her and put my baby in the car she didn't wait for me to put the seat belt on her she just started driving!!! She was speeding hit the breaks so fast we almost crashed. She was also texting while driving. Worst driver I have ever gotten!!!! I'm no longer using Uber. Way too dangerous with my infant. And Uber just gave me $5 credit? I don't want that I want a refund I'm not going to use Uber again why do I want that !!!!
title: Don't use Uber!

review: I knew my driver could tell I was a bit frustrated because my car got towed. But I thank him so much  for interacting with my children and teaching them how to count in different languages  within that short period of time. I don’t think they’ll forget this moment. It’s the little things that counts. It takes a village. It definitely cheered me up a bit. I really appreciate his service. Thanks again!
title: Worth the ride!!!

review: My driver told me that he rented this beautiful spotless Toyota Highlander on the weekends so that he could do Uber driving. I had my walker with me and he was very helpful getting it in and out of the car and getting me set up before he took off, It was my first time taking Uber, and I certainly will do it again. My driver was prompt and courteous, and I felt good giving him a tip in cash in addition to whatever he was making through the company.
title: Josef

review: I book an Uber ride to the airport today and the driver took 12 minute to pick me up because he passed me several times, the driver were high and tired at that time. It was early in the morning and he said that he been working since last night and only took and short nap around 3 am, which make me feel unsafe, and also he missed the turn to the highway too and ultimately causing me to miss the flight but so I have to pay for another flight with more for the Uber rides to get me home and to the airport. But Uber only pay me first ride, I don’t might paying for the flight but at least pay for my third ride.
title: Unsafe driving experience

review: My driver India, was a gem.  I left my phone in the backseat and after drop off I realized it, but it was too late and I had no way to reach her.  I assumed my phone was gone.  And at 11:30 pm she knocks in my apt door with my phone.  This was a few hours later.  She didn’t even know my apt number but she took the time and effort to find me!  Thanks again, if only more people were so genuine and concerned for others!!
title: Wonderful experience

review: We don’t have many options.  Uber is everywhere but the customer service when you have an issue is absolutely horrible.  They do not care about the customer.   I had a food order that was delivered to the wrong address.   I asked for a credit since I never got my order and they told me the order was canceled.  Then they charged me for the tip the next day.  They made me pay a tip for an order I never received.  My bad for assuming that when they say the order is cancelled and I will get a refund that I will get a complete refund.  Ridiculous that I had to pay for a tip on an order that was never delivered.
title: Horrible customer service.

review: The refunds are only available to those that qualify for it and another thing is that section is in the receipt part about if the ride didn’t get used and then you would choose the pick up problem part and after that the I didn’t use this ride. So another thing is that is on the Uber app is reward points for the rides that we get from the Uber.
title: The Uber App gives refunds

review: As a person who lost their drivers license, this app helps me get to work and get home. City transportation is nice too but their routes and scheduled times are very limiting. IMO, Uber is better than Lyft. Ubers app for iOS has a much smoother experience than Lyfts. I always have a hard time getting payment methods set up on Lyft app but no problems with Uber app. Plus you got Uber eats! Lyft just needs to hurry up and go down!
title: An app that makes my life waaay easier!

review: Whoever has designed the sign in help flow should be fired immediately. I have changed my previous number and there is no way for me to sign in or recover. I have to write to either submit a request and wait for X number of days  or chuck it and use some other app. The login with credit card/ debit card is also broken. Why can’t you guys send the recovery link on email normally?
title: Sing up is broken

review:
About a month ago my payment stopped processing in the app. I’ve tried multiple card options and nothing works. All cards work outside of the Uber app so the issue must be a technical error on their end.

I’ve gone through the prompts on the app’s help section and none work, they’re also obvious for anybody to do on their own. The only way to contact then is to submit an issue. After submitting an issue somebody finally responded suggesting I do exactly what I had tried. Nothing worked and they advised me a specialized team would reach out to help. No team has reached out and it’s been a month.

The frustration really lies in the fact that I can’t just call a support person and instead have to go through Ubers horrible help interface. I’ve been able to continue using the app while carrying a balance but now I’m concerned that may hurt my credit score.

All around horrible experience trying to solve what should be a very easy fix.
title: Terrible Customer Support (ADD A CALL CENTER)

review: The app and the service are both unreliable and lack the decency to COMMUNICATE when your ride or food aren’t coming. Do the drivers even get vetted? One smelled like weed (I’m sure that’s safe) and another arrived with their child in the back seat, which meant that even though we ordered the XL car, our party of 5 didn’t fit in the car. My Uber eats order never arrived, despite being ordered 3 hours in advance, with 0 notification about the cancellation from Uber. Ruined a celebration as everyone waited for food that never arrived (but I still got charged with). Don’t waste your time with this company! They’ve lost me and my family as customers for life.
title: Absolute GARBAGE

review:
I don’t know why Uber keeps asking me to put in my card information on the app to pay before ordering a ride, when I can either pay with cash or transfer. 
Not everyone has a card, so why can’t we have a list of payment methods to choose from? Why force me to put a card detail I don’t have ? 
Fix this please
title: Unable to use Uber Apps due to the payment option available

review: The app should provide the option to give feedback about cancelled trips, I requested an Uber and the driver was supposed to arrive in 8 minutes, after 10 minutes I messaged the driver and asked if he was on his way and he never replied, I could see in the map that he was driving to other places, after 35 minutes I canceled the ride because in was still “12 minutes away”, I wasn’t charged but there was no option to report this or give feedback. Very unprofessional and disappointing.
title: Late drivers

review: I’ve been using Uber for years the more I use it the more I hate them. I’ve had over 100 rides price updated days later because of “ time” most of the time drivers will park very far or out of view and then you will get charged a late fee or a cancel fee even if you’re calling and texting them and they don’t respond Uber steals you’re money , I almost lost my job because I’ve a ubers drive 30mins just to cancel as soon as they get to me or up my time to make an extra buck , if Lyft matched Uber prices I’d be using them but it seems ima have to come off a little extra anyways so might as well use Lyft (Customer service is the WORST)
title: Do not use Uber

review: The driver was OK! But I had to walk five houses down to get to the ride because they ponged the address incorrectly. My address has. It changed. How do we go about correcting that? It was very icy, cold & slippery out this morning. Had I not been able to see the car out the window when she turned around at the wrong house, I would have missed the ride, been charged & had to call for another ride. I could t find a phone number to call the driver, although she said she sent me a text, I never saw one. Not good!
title: Address is input incorrectly

review: We had a terrible experience with Uber in Texas recently. Our group (and the hundred people around us) had their rides denied time and time again because rates went down momentarily, and the drivers were denying rides until they could get paid more for their service ($100+ rather than the $50 Uber was quoting through the app). Uber had no control over what was going on and the drivers were making as much money as they deemed reasonable. Uber tried blaming the internet connection in the area, but everyone around us had plenty of service. Get your **** together Uber.
title: Price hikes

review: I used Uber one day and the driver packed all my belongings along with another man and I went upstairs to double check hotel room and when I returned all my things were gone. iPad, the newest one, clothes, and at least $800 worth of camping gear, tents, cooler, radios, flashlights,etc. to which was supposed to be donated to a homeless person. I was left stranded and the app changed payment to a different card and when it was addressed it was said to be an error in payment to which doesn’t leave my belongings paid for or returned. Uber has been unhelpful and has many errors. You cannot use Uber honestly after this occurred and I still don’t know what to do.
title: Uber burglary

review: Uber needs to get their app procedure working better. The past several times I have confirmed an Uber and then no drivers are available and I have to figure something out. Then today I had pre scheduled a ride to the airport from my hotel. When the driver got there he said he wasn’t sure he could get me all the way to the airport. Why would you not let your drivers know what the riders destinations are.
title: Unreliable

review: The map has no logic.  I've worked with other applications and the map is simple to know where to go uber offers an order and we can't know where to go if there is another order in progress the map doesn't appear if there is an offer it's two orders I always reject it because I don't know where going to look by the name of the city doesn't help because the city is big
title: Need atualiz

review: I downloaded the app and created an account.  It took 4 tries to get my address correct.  Scheduled a ride 15 hours in advance.  Got a confirmation email.  The next day got a call and text from the driver who was 30 miles away.  Gave him my ride info and a request for a ride home with a wait request.  The driver agreed and said goodbye.  Five minutes later I received notification that my ride was canceled.  Received a second ride notification that was 11 minutes after the pick up time; then received another cancellation.  I asked myself “What am I doing here?”  I deleted the app.
title: UBER IS A FARCE

review: I am a frequent traveler and could really use a reliably understandable app. This app is confusing to figure out! When I’m waiting for a ride and trying to message driver - which should have an audio message option - when pickup needs more details than the map shows - I can’t see my message screen and still see driver!! Very difficult where you don’t know the street names etc.! As when traveling. When you need to view messages and driver location. Time sensitive! This app could be so much better!
title: Horribly confusing convenient please fix it Uber!

review: Problems with the application, I charge a gift card and it won't let me use the balance, and it seems that it only makes a cash payment, I have uninstalled the application about 5 times and the same problem continues. The same happened to a friend, having his card registered only gives him the option to pay in cash (baltimore)
title: Problems with the pay

review: I spend $200 a week, $800 a month using Uber 4 days a week to go to work and back home. The first couple of months it was great and now all of a sudden it is horrible! I always request the ride either the night before or an hour before I I leave work,     drivers will pick up the fare then cancel right at the time I am to be picked up. This has happened several times and you cannot speak to anyone from Uber in person to rectify the problem. I am a platinum rider and the service I get is unbelievable for someone that uses it all the time and the money that is spent !! Uber you need to do better!!!!
title: Dissatisfied Uber Customer

review: Over 10 messages back and forward and it’s like they don’t read my messages, unable to use apple pay but they asume that I don’t know how to add a card even if i send screenshot of the wallet. One of then were talking about Paypal while i was talking about Apple Pay, it’s like they don’t know what is an Apple Pay and Apple Card. They didn’t troubleshoot my issue with this payment method, they just keep saying the same answer  every time and I keep saying the same answer to different person every time, it’s like an auto-reply. So, I am unable to receive 3% cash back reward as Apple Card promise.
title: Bad support, unable to receive 3% reward Apple Card

review:
Every time I try to use this app something goes wrong and there is no immediate customer support. This time I was left at the airport with no ride because I couldn’t add any form of payment since I got a new card. I tried debit, credit, and Venmo. I tried reinstalling the app, restarting my phone and adding from a different device. I called my bank and they said there was nothing wrong with my cards or accounts. 

With no uber number to call, yellow cab got my money and frankly I’ll be deleting Uber now. When I need to rely on a service I expect some sort of customer support and Uber is the opposite of reliable. They clearly don’t care.
title: Always leaves me hanging

review:
Yesterday I took a ride that was listed at $40. This morning I woke up to a charge of $70. Thé help options in the app are extremely unhelpful. It claims I was charged the amount I was shown before hand which is untrue. I was comparing prices to Lyft and specifically chose Uber because the fare was $9 cheaper. 

They make it impossible to speak to a representative or even compare the price shown before to the price you were charged so you can see for yourself.

How can they almost double my charge and pretend like that’s okay??? What the actual

Update: 
Finally got in contact with support by jumping through a bunch of hoops. 

They reimbursed me ~$17 and mentioned something called “dynamic pricing”. Apparently that’s when you lie about how much you’re going to charge someone and then almost double the price. Just be up front with what you’re charging!!
title: Charged way higher than what was shown upfront

review:
Outstanding I can say how much a enjoy his company and how safe I feel during the ride. The car was super clean and smells nice the driver have a very professional presentation him self he was very very patient with me I was in my way to the airport and I have to do 3 stops and he was a a very nice mood all the way. 
Recomiendo que viajen con este conductor es una persona muy profesional y agradable me dio la sensación que estaba segura y muy amigable y súper paciente con migo ya que tuve varios stops de camino al aeropuerto
Totalmente recomendado si carro muy limpio y un aroma agradable .
title: Upstanding

review: I had to fly out of Newark Airport early Tuesday morning.  All my peeps were working. So I downloaded the app which was so easy to do. Sometimes we “Baby Boomers” can be technically challenged. But my Uber driver Juan came early !His car was squeaky clean and  we had a pleasant conversation on our journey. Although there was crazy turnpike traffic he got me to the airport safely and 10 minutes early !!! Great first time Ubering experience! Thank you Juan and Uber !!!
title: First time Ubering

review:
I ordered Uber packages for a delivery. Brianna was the driver and I got a confirmation text that she picked up my package. After picking the package Brianna canceled the trip her self. I never received the package. Contacted Uber through the app since that the only way to contact them and non of the customer service wanted to help me out. They can’t ending the chat. They keep saying we will have a specialist work on the case and I asked for a number to contact the specialist and they won’t respond. It has been 2 weeks now my package is gone. Oh they also charged me for cancellation as well.. 
THE PEOPLE RUNNING THE UBER CHAT DONT CARE ABOUT YOU
title: Beware driver steal packages and Uber don’t care about you/your package

review: So I’ve been using Uber for a month because my car broke down and also have to carry my tools the most least compact I can take and usually tip the drivers and I have no complaints for all the drivers. All of them were cool except the service. I noticed I kept getting charged for a service I didn’t take and no one has my info other than the Uber service. Also they refunded me “Uber cash” but they took it out of my bank to make it seem like I got a refund. I don’t mind taking the city bus at all but there’s always something going on right? If you can try and get a ride from someone else and actually pay them.
title: Scam

review: I’ve ridden in Uber before in larger cities. This time I came to town for an anniversary party and needed a ride home from the local pub. I actually downloaded the app to my phone and ordered a ride back to the hotel (I had always ridden with someone else in their Uber). Carly was a very engaging and knowledgeable driver. Car was clean and smelled nice. I felt safe with her as a female alone taking a ride. Thanks for being one of the highlights of this trip!
title: Carly was amazing!!

review: After just being released from the hospital after a week stay for a major health issue, the specific medications that the surgeon could not be delivered due to Federal Law. Consequently, I requested Uber, and shortly thereafter, a very helpful young guy showed up and made the shirt trip between my home and the pharmacy without hesitation. Lance was cheerful and grateful to receive the fare and max tip. Plus he had a big comfortable Denali Special that helped me a lot. Cheers!
title: Lance was a great help!

review:
My driver went above and beyond to make sure that my family had a ride home. This was my first time using the app and didn’t know how to navigate through it. It was so stressful because the wifi connection was poor. The Uber app wasn’t working at the airport, once the plane landed. After waiting and searching, our driver called us and we finally found each other. 
So grateful!!!
title: Excellent driver

review: We had an emergency while on vacation and needed to Uber to the local hospital.  We were stressed but Teresa (Yan) our driver, arrived in 3 minutes to pick us up and she was so nice —she made the trip enjoyable(as much as could be under our circumstances) and  the car was super clean and comfortable.  We only UBER on our holiday vacations but if she is a representative of this company we will recommend UBER to our other (older) friends and family.
title: Great ride

review: He was so wonderful and made me feel very comfortable.  I never take Uber alone. I’m a 50-year-old woman and simply only like to do things with my husband. However, today was my first time driving by myself with an Uber driver and my driver could not have been more wonderful more helpful with my suitcase more personable just an overall pleasure to except a ride with I gave him two thumbs up and 10 stars thank you
title: My driver

review:
Having problems getting your software to update on my Apple 6s. I have to reload it when it goes to the cloud. I have to delete and reinstall. After that, it keeps asking for me to update the software.
After that, It will not recognize my location and asks me to enter it, then the software loops back to the install update screen and I have to try again.
Please fix this bug. People don’t buy new phones because an application won’t run on it, they change applications.
title: Software issues!

review: I just remembered that I didn’t used to have to walk, train, and/or bus to a different terminal to get a quick, cheap ride home from the airport. Uber’s hands-off approach to rides, to avoid paying their drivers as employees, means inconsistent and unreliable experiences. The number of times my driver can’t find me, or has a gross car, or is a bad driver, or how hard it is to get to an Uber at the airport — it makes up for the times you have a smooth experience.
title: Cabs were  actually better

review: Was picked up by Hugh who wanted to take me to University and Lindsey when I wanted to go to Gilbert and McKellips . So after a discussion about how far it was he dropped me at my daughters about 2.5 miles from pickup 6 minutes in vehicle. I feel it was too much money to pay for such a short distance. Although Hugh was very polite have no idea how he got my final destination when it was never given! Please adjust my bill Thank You.
title: Uber Ride

review:
We arrived at the Roanoke Airport at 12:24 am wondering how we were to get home. I called Uber after picking up our luggage from luggage claims” and Uber had a driver already there to pick up anyone in our situation.  And the driver had a 3000 “5 star endorsement” for getting “riders” to their destination safely in his Uber profile. 

With that kind of service, who would not call Uber to take them to their destination? I will”!!
title: Connection to Home

review:
First time I request uper in Paris and I was waiting until it shows in the map that the driver he reached my location but I didn’t see him and I was trying to call him but he didn’t speak English and i was waiting in the same spot more than five minutes and I got a message from uper saying that my request was canceled and they charged me 7.50 € as a cancellation fee. 
I think that some uper drivers are not well experienced and honest with the people.
title: First time bad experience

review:
Bill was terrific.  He was a careful and safe driver and was very efficient.  We gave him a good cash tip.  I like the way you have organized the shuttle bus to the parking lot with the numbered canopy waiting areas.  There were two very helpful people when we got off the shuttle who gave us directions and umbrellas as it was raining.  We are very pleased.  Thank you!!!
Why do I have to have a nickname?  Frustrating as it will not send? Little Drakes
title: Customer

review: Just used Uber to pick up food at a location that is not on the list of Uber restaurants.  Kind of clunky.  Had to basically reserve a ride starting at the location of the pickup, then wait for the driver to contact me when I wasn’t there to meet him so I could explain the plan.  Fortunately he was helpful and glad to do it.  But would be much better if there was a way to arrange a “custom” food pickup from a location not on the list.
title: Using Uber to pick up food

review: uber is one of my favorite apps because almost all the time it’s cheaper then lyft lol😂 but we if uber had a 30 day pass? a 30 day ride pass that costed $150 every 30 days like a bill to have ride somewhere, but you don’t have to get on the bus public transit you can actually get an a regular uber pickup car? 🤔🤔 SOMEONE RECOMMEND THIS UBER I guarantee it’s have more users & make more money! that’s why 4 stars rating for me!
title: 30 day uber pass $150???

review: I wanted to do Uber to earn some extra income, but it’s been over a week and I STILL can’t add my banking information so I can get paid. The security codes don’t send to confirm it’s me, and customer support sends you in circles with robots, and when you finally get a human being on the phone, there are communication errors because English is a second or third language to the CS rep. I don’t blame the people at all, but the system is so confusing and aggravating. Two stars is only because the base app works well. It’s when you get into settings that it becomes a total nightmare.
title: So many issues

review: I like Uber, but as of late I have a problem with my drop off for the past 2 days. I entered the correct address I needed to be dropped off, but for some reason on the driver’s screen it shows them a different location to drop me off (it’s a block away on the opposite side from where I needed to be). Thankfully the drivers were understanding and dropped me off in my actual location.
title: App is glitchy

review: Uber is Uber. Just a note when you reserve ahead, they should be transparent in saying that is going to be a for sure “surge” in price. I wish they would give more information ahead of time so I could plan for the extra expense of surge rates - which in general, I’m ok with. But why does when you get a surge have to be a mystery?  I went 15 minutes to my local airport, for $24.  But, tried to book it last night or even an hour ahead this morning, it was more than double $55. WHY????????  I guess you pay for the peace of mind. But I would have been nice to know that’s how they roll.
title: Pluses and Minuses

review: Two things that come to mind in regards of this driver app. First thing is if you try to log off you could get a ride that shows up where the sign off button is that and you can accidentally except the ride that you didn’t have to cancel which is a point against you. Also they have a destination feature that doesn’t work. When you turn it on you still get right going to opposite direction taking you further away from your spot. They said they were going to fix it but it’s been mini mini months. Still does not work.
title: Anti-driver app

review:
Charge too much money to go somewhere they can charge you what they want. It’s way too much money. I would not take over again. Most of the drivers are nice and some of them aren’t just OK but the west of the Hoover drivers are very good they when you want to talk to him it has to be if I text and I’m not gonna give information out. If it’s someone who I do not know you can’t call them and you can’t complain. I wish we could so that’s the only thing is wet the company when I went to my class at North Shore they took me home but they did charge $70 to come from North Shore to Seattle so that’s why I would never use that 
Use the service again no more
title: Danny

review: Launched Uber App in the airport, it could not connect with the network using LTE, so logged into the ‘free unsecured airport WiFi; Uber App works fine. I do not commit to the ride because I have to find the pick-up area. Get to the pick-up area and attempt to book the ride only to find the app crashes multiple times with ‘something went wrong’ nag. Waste a half hour.  Went back into the terminal, tried one more time (using airport public network); the Uber app worked and I was able to book the ride. I suspect the App crashes because I am using a Virtual Private Network on my I phone.  It would be nice if Uber tested their software.
title: Buggy App, May not work with VPN

review: Uber is the cheapest out of all the PUVs in Doha if you do not want to use other public transportation. I took this afternoon trip, then they charged me twice for it. I received the notification the next day early morning, I emailed them TWICE via the app but THEY DIDN’T refund me. My debit card was connected to the app. It happened before as well but I didn’t notice it as the texts would popped up later. Sometimes, the Uber driver arrives late to my location then charge me extra as well. This app used to be good. Now they are scamming people. Better to use other app guys!! This is so horrible.
title: I was charged twice!!

review: The App is too bloated. It is easy to request a car but I spent 10 minutes unsuccessfully trying to text the driver so he could find me in a large busy airport. I finally found the Messages menu, tried to get by the long privacy notice, safety precautions, etc. but could not figure out how to send my driver a message. I didn’t have this problem texting when I used the older App.
title: The App is too bloated.

review:
Twice last week I had drivers cancel on me and I am charged each time!! Once at airport another time at home. Another time last week I booked, traveled as planned and later received a bill of additional charges with explanation that fees are higher during high demand times. Why not tell the rider before they ride instead of after?? 
Thus, I paid an additional 20 euros last week due to these changes by Uber. Mega hidden costs for one week and three rides. Not worth it. And drivers don’t come when estimates. Either late or earlier.
title: Hidden costs. Drivers cancel, don’t show up as planned

review:
This app is straight up garbage. They will cancel your ride or cancel your order when it’s mere minutes away without any explanation. Maybe they’ll charge you for it and maybe you’ll have to go through a bunch of stuff to get refunded or maybe they won’t charge you for it. But even if they don’t, God knows they won’t give you anything else for your trouble. Hey, you don’t get to go to the place you were going to on time? Or you didn’t get the food that you wanted on time? Oh well! At least we didn’t charge you! 

GARBAGE.
title: Garbage

review: Worst case experiences!! My family and I recently took a trip to Alaska and used Uber for the first time. Unfortunately they take your rights away by requiring a mask but whatever we used one anyways but then we had a driver get nasty to me because I pulled mine down to take a drink of water? The heck? Then I get a message from Uber saying that they want me to take pictures of my mask on ti verify j have one? Terrible company. Will never ever use again. My family and I all deleted the app and will absolutely never use it again. We will go old fashioned and use a taxi if need be but never again support or use this app.
title: AWFUL!!! Uses its huge user base but is horrible company!!

review: UBER is supposed to be about getting a fast, reliable ride... in my city this is the worst service ever... I literally talking 1 hour waiting for rides that cancel of never arrive it is literally so stressful. I have been using UBER for more than two years every day more than twice I day so I am not just speaking out of one experience. They should take the time to fix this. I repeat this is in my city worst ever.
title: Not fast at all.

review: If you’re planning on using the app during times of low activity, be ready to be passed around by drivers endlessly at the expense of your own time. I had a driver accept my ride then proceed to drive in the complete opposite direction for 10 minutes before cancelling, at which point I was passed around by other drivers for another 10 minutes before I finally cancelled to try and find a Lyft. I’ve used Uber often and have a 4.91 user rating and make the same ride often, but this was ridiculous. You’re better off going to their competitors because these guys clearly don’t give a care about user experience.
title: Wastes your time

review: I’ve been using Uber for a long time but lately I have been left feeling ver disappointed and taken advantage of by the service. Numerous times now I have paid $45 to go 5 miles or less and waited 20+ minutes for the ride to even get picked up by a driver. Not sure if the drivers are sitting there waiting for prices to surge, or if Uber is doing it for them, or even if there are less drivers. Honestly the rates are just getting absurd, especially for the time we are expected to wait for a ride, at least in my area. At least the drivers are nice and respectful.
title: Disappointed

review: It seems to me as an older person who used to like taking a Uber that it is more and more difficult to use.  Why can’t I add the tip after I check my trip it used to be EZ now it’s complicated.  Also you have my address wrong and it is almost impossible for me to figure out how to correct it.   Thank you need to keep older people in mind as you constantly mess around with this app people in our age group that is in their 70s 80s and 90s are probably a large part of your users.  Keep it simple!!!
title: App getting harder to use

review: I can’t even get a ride sometimes in the morning, even when I schedule a ride. And when I finally do, and I’m already over an hour late, they jack up the price. I usually ride to and from work for $25-30, I’ve been paying $60-70. This makes no sense. I know your drivers a part time nowBut there are those of us that still work in the early morning hours in the late hours at night. Please fix this. It is not right that I have to wait as long as I have to forA ride and then have to pay the outrageous prices that I have to pay when normally they are three times as low as that. I might have to go to Lyft from now on
title: No rides

review: There are a million reasons I’m giving Uber 1 star. How about the last time I took an Uber from LAX, where the system has been completely overhauled and made extremely inconvenient- I waited about half an hour for a ride, was told it would cost 32$ and then was charged over 90$ because of a 5x surcharge I wasn’t told about due to low availability of drivers? Maybe more drivers would be available if you hadn’t completely screwed them by lobbying so hard to pass Prop. 22. Rides have gotten more and more expensive, more and more unavailable, and it’s just become clear Uber has 0 ethics. After this review I’m deleting the app and will never use Uber again.
title: Next time I’ll just use a taxi

review: uber does Not care about customers, or their drivers; they only care about squeezing out as much cash as they can. there is no reason that i shouldnt be able to cancel my order when it has literally been one singular minute since i submitted. obvious grab for cash & blatant disregard for customers. deleting the app & exclusively using lyft & doordash from now on. im now out 40$,,, evidently if an order is accidentally submitted you have about 15 seconds before the cancel option disappears. otherwise, uber just keeps your money! even when the delivery wont be here for over an hour! if you decide to download this app, enjoy having your time and money wasted regularly :)
title: cancelling orders and cars

review: Worst app I’ve ever seen and their customer service and any kind of help is hidden away so that I just remain unable to use the service with no way to fix it.  Uber has given me the worst experience I’ve ever had with a company & I really would think it best if Lyft took all their business & everyone that works at Uber be arrested for contributing to this holocaust of an app.  I can’t begin to explain the myriad of problems and ways in which Uber has bent me over -not just a barrel-, but a cactus dripping hot sauce.  Give me back my Uber cash that you won’t let me use and give me my $30 Uber eats coupon that I couldn’t use and is now expired.  How do I get help.
title: Worst company and app

review: He was early, loaded our luggage, car very clean, music nice, chatted with us when asked. And what a life saver! I left my phone in the car and it was on silent. My friend called several times and left a message. We could track it. He made it 20 minutes away and finally we saw he was coming back to the airport. He finally answered and told us he would meet me where he dropped us off!
title: Jesus was exceptional!

review: I do not understand what happened with Uber, I got the app when it first launched and it’s been great since but now they will give you a “range” between let’s say $14-$19 and then go ahead and charge you &27-$30 once your trip is done. I don’t understand what has happened to Uber but this has been a great disappointment. Just be upfront and honest about your prices, don’t try to be sneaky and then try and get away with it by having practically no customer support that isn’t for the drivers. Terrible practice. If you have this same issue please freeze your card and call your bank about the charge. They do not deserve the money.
title: Garbage

review: Kenneth is truly one of the last gentlemen and scholars in Chicago. My car broke causing me to book an Uber ride. After an exhausting early morning surgery I planned to sleep on the long ride home. Kenneth put my work supplies in his trunk before I could help and told me to get comfortable and rest.  We started a conversation and solved the problems of society when I arrived home. You’d be lucky to have him as your driver and friend.
title: Delightful to ride with
