review: Best ride and experience ever since having an Uber account.. this driver right here went above and beyond , makes the ride ,fun , safe ,and very very  enjoyable please if you guys can I ask that he gets. Enter employment opportunities within the company he’s a very hard working , caring individual I ask if anything you guys take anything ,please show this driver the recognition he needs…🙏🙏🤲
title: Best Uber experience since using Uber back in 2019!!!!

review:
Today is the day I delete Uber. I waited about an hour and a half before Uber finally let me cancel the ride. I was thankfully in a safe location, but this is EXTREMELY concerning and NOT a safe application to utilize, given the dishonest wait times. 

My ride went from 10mins, to 20, to 15, to 11, to 10, to 8 and it was stuck at 8 mins for about 30mins until it finally jumped to 24mins and then allowed me to cancel the ride after waiting a total of an hour and a half. Thankfully I ordered a Lyft and they arrived within the timeframe outlined, maybe a minute before. 

DO NOT RECOMMEND FOR ANY WOMEN, CHILDREN OR ANYONE SMOL as they are dishonest and will potentially put you in an unsafe situation.
title: LONG WAIT TIMES

review:
Application makes it difficult to select alternate pickup spots making it easier for both driver and passenger. For example terminal c level 1 was out of control, I was more than willing to meet driver and vehicle on level 3 departures. 
Uber needs to work with Port Authority to have dedicated pickup spots for terminal B and C. For example, why can’t the port authority create a dedicated space for car rides in the short term parking area? In other countries and localities in the US airports have dedicated areas exclusively for car rides!!
title: EWR Airport

review: Uber has been there for me on many occasions and I totally appreciate it. However, in the past year and a half or so, the rates in my area more than doubled, and for no reason. Gas is down, there aren’t any new regulations that increased using transport in my area, and the service hasn’t got any better or worse. A ride across the neighborhood used to cost $6.50. A year ago it went to $8.50. Earlier this year it was at 9.50 and now it’s $13-$15 dollars for the exact same route. I now use it less, if at all, because this is unaffordable. Wish they showed more care for their customers - people who Uber don’t do it because they’re wealthy.
title: Price Gouging

review:
First 0250 to airport pick up was excellent and he was very kind loaded up my luggage, clean car. 
Return flight trip, driver was fine. App didn’t work outside airport, many people with issues till I asked one of the traffic dudes why I couldn’t connect. Not Uber problem airport problem.  But driver drove too slow, I was on a timeline 23mph in a 40 is too slow. 55 on a 65 too slow. But arrived safely, had to load and unload my bags. Tipped anyhow just bc they work their butts off
title: First timer

review:
Rediculous! 
I canceled a ride because the ride originally said it would take 3 mins to be picked up but once I pressed order rode it never confined & kept saying confirming ride over and over. So I then Canceled the ride. My wife ordered a ride from her account and we made it to our destination smoothly, then 30 mins later I received a text saying my Uber driver has arrived to pick you up. I was already 30 mins removed from that original pick up. Then Uber tried to charge me the full amount, and once I texted the driver I cancelled the trip prior, they charged me a $5 cancellation fee! 
No thanks! Horrible service
title: Charging for rides that didn’t happen

review: All of my Uber drivers have been amazing. I wish I could remember all of their names. The last 3, (female and I really liked her), Bryant, and Calvin made me feel like we were friends already. They know the way around and know how to zip through traffic to get you to your destination. I’ll be back and I can’t decide if I want to meet more Uber drivers or stick these. If you can, please tell who the female driver was, maybe Amalie(???)
title: Carla Hereford

review: I downloaded the app. Set up account. Selected the appropriate car/ride. Revcd notification and drivers lic# and vehicle make. Watched the real time screen map showing drivers approach. Recognized the driver. Got into the backseat of  a clean and comfortable vehicle. Music ambiance volume was down low, subtle and lovely. Driver respectful and courageous, not trying to be my friend, nor chatty. Focused on road and obeying speed limits and pedestrian traffic. Professional. Thank you Antonio.
title: First Time Rider

review: Trying to get a ride from the airport it would pre authorize a charge of $80 and then fail to find a driver. So I tried the Uber comfort which was closer with a pre authorization of $90. That failed to find a driver even though it said 6 mins away it charged to 25 mins and after 10 mins alerted me they couldn’t find a driver. This happened another three more times of trying to book an Uber X and XL and a Comfort to get home. Having Uber hold over $400 is absurd when it’s a fault on their end. I can’t imagine being back in college and trying to find a ride home and this happening. That business model needs to change.
title: Pending Charges are absurd

review:
This app is surprisingly unintuitive. I tried to change the address for an Uber eats order after I had selected the restaurant and filled up my cart. Kept trying to refine the address from my current location to the correct number. Wouldn't let me. I realized I had to enter my address from the Uber eats home page of the app. 

Also, trying to see the receipt of a food order delivered about an hour ago and it shows no receipt was found. Also, can't find a way to adjust tip for driver even though I tapped on the notification to do so. 

So far, not impressed.
title: Unintuitive UX

review:
My Uber pet driver Lou was the best he didn’t mind when I’m from north port with hurricane damage from Ian that I’m here with 3 dogs waiting for my vehicle to be fixed to go and have lunch and shop at Walmart and there good behaved dogs I tipped him and then he came back and found us we left our wallet and a bag full of credit cards and id’s so we tipped him a gain twice what we tipped him before
Merry Christmas & Happy New Year Lou
title: Lou the Great Uber driver when you went thru a hurricane Ian

review: I made a reservation to the airport.  I was given the price.  But on the receipt there was a reservation fee along with a booking fee as part of the total.  So, the question is if I just requested the ride when I needed it, would the fare be the same.  I wonder if the driver gets any part of the reservation fee or the booking fee.  Fortunately, The trip was my best ride ever; great driver and immaculate car.  Jose was ver personable even though he didn’t speak much English and I don’t speak much Spanish.
title: Caution reservation fee

review: I booked a trip based on the price estimate at the time of booking. The trip was completed, and ONLY AFTER checking the charge on my credit card did I realize that Uber had charged an extra $3.45, indicating the initial estimate didn’t cover the cost. As a customer, one of the reasons I use Uber is also the convenience of being my cost ahead of time. The “surprise” at the END of the trip is a scam, and something that will push me to consider alternative means of transportation. First time I’ve seen it, very disappointed.
title: Incremental charges

review: I (young female) have been harassed by 2 male drivers, and physically assaulted by another, uber did literally nothing besides refund my ride and couldn’t even update me on the status on either of the drivers. Just told me they would no longer be able to give me rides, and the fact that they take assault so lightly those men could be out there still making money and harassing/assaulting more women. I no longer use uber as i’m scared for my safety. I initially ordered the ride as I was out drinking with friends and didn’t feel comfortable driving home, my uber took advantage of me and the thought of ever getting in an uber again makes my skin crawl.
title: Harassed/Assaulted by driver

review:
I was incorrectly charged because drivers took a long route or incorrect route and many times Uber showed a long route. 

Well, in case of drivers taking long route, I used to pay doesn’t matter what I was charged. Later, I found out about refund policy and started asking refunds for drivers’ mistake. 

Just today, it happened the same. I was extremely late already and was supposed to be dropped off at 10:12 am but Uber driver took a wrong turn and deliberately made the trip longer than what was shown in Uber. And in such a stressful moment, Uber charges me higher!! Are you kidding Uber? I kept silent and asked Uber to review the trip. 

But Uber replied saying that I am not eligible or my refund has reached maximum. What??? So, if a driver keeps taking long route and make my prices higher from now on, I would be denied for refund and charged higher saying that I am not eligible.
title: Uber stopped refunding me for Uber and driver mistakes

review: ….I like riding Uber, I’m very grateful. For me as a person I have a huge fear of driving so I don’t drive. Also I am a single mother with a special needs child so at times it can be challenging to get around. Just an idea but maybe Uber can make some changes to where they can bring in more diverse. I feel like I’m not just speaking for myself, I’m also speaking others as well, for the ones who are in similar situation or just simply need a ride!!! #makeitworkforeveryone
title: Need more drivers!

review:
I found my driver easy to talk to but when I requested her to stop speeding, she refused and justified herself to drive 7 mi above the speed limit. (70 mph) on 101 southbound San Mateo. CA. 
Then I explained to her I was hit 7x in 57 years, so I asked her to slow down and just go the speed of the traffic; she responded that she can stop and let me out to get a different driver. ** I responded to that “ IF THAT IS WHAT YOU WANT TO DO, ok”
She responded; “ no I don’t want too”
Then car was quiet.
title: Uber Driver is easy to talk to

review:
I love Uber and the convenience but 3 issues 
Lately the drivers when dropping off at the airport decide where they will stop instead of at your gate.
The fare comparison with Lyft, UBER is much higher, no difference in service. 
The app is not very friendly with making any changes to your account. 
And please have real customer service email, app, or phone number that has real humans to understand and provide troubleshooting to customers.
title: Overall good option

review: A great and safe way to travel distances for a relatively good price... One question though, it should be a requirement that whoever rides in a car using your app is always instructed to put on their seatbelt before the driver takes off. How come in the last 3 years of using this app…. Have I only been asked to put on my seatbelt before the drive was taken off maybe 12 times. That’s ridiculous.
title: Safe Trips

review:
Uber failed to picked me up when I needed the most. The driver cancelled the trip (after 15 minutes wait) when driver was less than a minute from my home. Basically down the block. I could do nothing. Customer service did not help at all. CS was useless. I got really late to my appointment. 

The driver had 5 stars rating with 12k trips. How come. Obviously the rating is rigged
title: Uber does not care for the customer

review: I was just charged $48 for roughly the same distance that cost me $14 15 minutes ago. It was a roughly a 20 minute drive both trips. By comparison I spent $38 for a 1 hour ride yesterday. I had a doctor’s appt so I had to accept the fare. But this is price gouging & unethical business practice even with premium traffic pricing. Also traffic was no different than when I came 15 minutes before to previous location, it is very difficult to contact someone for this in help in uber app. I am sick & tired of price gouging by uber. I would like uber to refund me some of this and charge fair pricing for the trip.
title: Price gouging

review: I dunno if this is just some weird happenstance or coincidence or whatever just in my area, but recently it takes forever for me to find a ride at all. I’ll wait up to longer than the actual driving time and go without a ride— OR sometimes after waiting a while, someone will accept the ride, but they’ll cancel it out of nowhere???? It’s incredibly frustrating. For someone who heavily relies on rides because walking around in my town is scary for me, this is very disappointing to deal with.
title: being canceled-on CONSTANTLY

review: I ordered an Uber ride for my mom and dad to get to a doctors appointment. I ordered it 35 minutes prior and the ride was for about 4 miles away, about a 10 minute drive. The app told me I would make it in 20 minutes. But the driver kept changing and the ride ended up taking an hour. Nothing against the driver but the app doesn’t let you cancel without being charged or anything. They don’t care if you needed to be there at a certain time. They just want their money. I’ll never use Uber again, and I wouldn’t recommend it to anybody else.
title: Lock you in and will make you wait until they’re ready to take you. Use anything but Uber.

review: I purchased a few hundred $ in gift cards to be sent out the day of my purchase, got a confirmation email saying it’d be 8 days out, plus up to 10 business days for delivery…I needed this person to receive the cards asap, so I sent an email for a refund and went out and bought my own card to send out. First email said I’d be guaranteed to talk to someone live, I never did. Ultimately they said no refunds (even though their site changed the date) and that I’d receive my purchase electronically now. I figured I’d use it up eventually…Then I find out they still mailed the card, and now I’ve sent double what I intended.
title: Customer Care Does NOT Exist!!!

review: Just a suggestion - I am using the latest version of Uber on iOS 15.3.1 and iPhone 8. I wanted to suggest that when I do an advance booking of a ride (e.g to the airport ) . The ride doesn’t really show up on Home Screen of the app. Since it is a ride in future - wouldn’t a good cx would be to have card intimating the user about it whenever he launched the app. I have to tap on “person icon” go to ride and select “upcoming” from somewhat an obscure drop down on the right . I don’t think this is the right use exp.
title: Suggestion for advanced booking of rides

review: I recently took a trip and dropped my phone in a drivers van. I immediately contacted uber via the app and I have not received a response or even an acknowledgment of my message. I have called and been hung up on. I am unable to use the service that i have used since 2016 because my device is where I request rides from. I use this service 3 times a day there is no reason why I cannot get in touch with my driver nor a customer service agent. This is poor customer service and I am extremely disappointed.
title: I lost my phone and nobody has contacted me in over 24 hours

review:
Uber is charging criminally high prices for rides in Los Angeles. A ride from Westwood to Santa Monica used to cost $15 in 2019. I just went to order one today at 2pm (non rushour) and it was a $40 fee with a 20 minute wait for the Uber. 
I understand the pandemic has shifted the workers around, however it seems they could do much more to incentivize more drivers and keep prices down. Drivers are the pillar of their business model, why don’t they offer more incentives? I know creative and well paid people work at their headquarters, so they should be able to come up with a solution to these soaring costs.
title: Prices Soaring

review: Lyft implemented a new system “wait and save” and you will save $1-5, with a guaranteed ride within a window, in my experience within 15 minutes. Also in my experience the ride never comes when the rates go up. So I’m just sitting around waiting for a ride, the rates go up, and I have to call a new ride with higher rates to get a ride, which would have been $10 cheaper if I just went with the normal (not wait and save) ride the first time. Essentially users de-prioritize themselves in the ride queue with false pretenses that they will get ride. Dishonest. this feature itself lost my belief in the company caring about it’s consumers.
title: Wait & save… waist of time

review: Multiple Times me and my family try to use Uber for one reason another and it has the same problem with drivers getting sent to us as wedding 15 to 20 minutes and then the driver canceled it doesn’t happen one time on one day and having multiple times on one attempt this is a ridiculous problem to have the worst part is there’s no penalty for the driver canceling but if you were to cancel your ride there is definitely a Penalty It doo oh sent seem to mater If it’s Priority or not This app Is unseeable like  this I’d hate to have to use this in an emergency
title: Uber is just Awful

review: I’ve been a long time UBER user, platinum member whatever, and this new policy of automatically canceling trips shortly after the driver arrives is completely asinine. Because of this, I have gotten downstairs from my apartment only to discover NO UBER! This results in unpredictable delays, and is very inconvenient in conditions of harsh weather etc. and is NOT helped by the recent exorbitant price increases. While I can understand the utility of this feature, I think the amount of time before automatically cancelling should be lengthened and drivers should have more say in whether or not to cancel. Will re-rate when UBER debugs this idiotic anti-feature.
title: Stop cancelling my trips!!

review: The new requirement of taking a photo of yourself wearing a mask - makes no sense at all. First off, you’re already made to check a box confirming you’re wearing a mask prior to a ride being ordered. Why does this step exist if you’re going to have to take a photo? Then the required photo of you wearing a mask - anyone could throw a mask on and immediately take it off. Wearing a mask in a photo proves nothing. The moment of truth is if you’re wearing a mask when your car actually arrives. This feels like nothing more than a ploy by Uber to use Covid as an excuse to log photos of clients into their database - information they have no need for or right to.
title: Uber Taking Advantage of Covid

review:
I chose uber to do médicales tests. The driver saw that I was wearing a big boot brace and a neck brace. When I tried to get in the car the driver could definitely see I was having difficulty getting my boot in. The back seat was pushed all the way back and he didn’t offer help nor did he offer to pull the seat forward to help with spacing. Once I got in I had to ask to pull forward the seat as it barely gave me room for my less difficulty since the seat was moved forward. 
Note: once I got in the car was comfortable. 
When I got home I dad a little less
title: Getting into the vehicle

review: My Driver Josh was absolutely amazing!!  First: he immediately used my first name and had a huge smile on his face.  Was absolutely courteous: opened all the doors for me and asked if he could put my luggage into the car.  Had a basket of mints and water bottles for me.  He was a great and safe driver and conversation was absolutely pleasant!!  There was an accident up ahead of us and he had no problem going a secondary route.   Best Uber experience I’ve ever had!!
title: Josh my Driver

review: I think this app needs to have a feature that lowers the Uber costs when your drivers cancels the ride on you. There has been too many situations where I have to wait over an hour to get an Uber willing to take me where I need to go. Sometimes they accept the ride and then once they see where they’ll be heading, they cancel the ride midway. I feel as though nobody should be paying the same price for that ride if the drivers themselves aren't willing to go through with it.
title: Lowering Uber Costs

review: This was the first time I’ve ever used any share drive agency ..so I picked Uber . My driver was spot on time no waiting at the airport I just got off the plane went to my designated location for pick up and got into the Uber vehicle , it was such a smooth transition , the driver was courteous and attentive, my experience was great . Thank you Uber  for great service.I will be using you again in the near future.
title: First time I ever use any share drive agency Uber

review:
I ordered an Uber recently. In their price bee lift so I went with it. As soon as I hit confirm I got a note from Uber that said the rate had gone up now it was more expensive than Lyft. Immediately I hit the cancel button. Then they slap me with a five dollar fee for canceling! Even though I did it as soon as possible and even though they change the rate on me. This is a classic bait and switch. .

And of course there’s no way to contact Uber to get this problem resolved. Customer Service is nonexistent. Very very poor experience. They also have cut into driver rates on drivers making it hard on them as well. Not a good company at all.
title: Bait and Switch

review: So I book a trip for my son… Stated $14 to book -not a problem… Driver never showed up & stated the trip took 32 minutes. Driver also stated she completed the trip 😤. Mind you app shows you locations she was in. Reached out clearly upset to customer service. Called 1st time stated they put in ticket to have someone call me. So I logged in on app again & seen I have a surge charge… so the fare my son didn’t received went up to $35. So I contacted support again they hung up on me. Called again they stated no ticket was put in the 1st time… wouldn’t have a problem paying but the driver never showed up and have the nerve to say she completed trip….
title: DO NOT USE! USE LYFT INSTEAD

review: They make their regular service just terrible enough for you to pay for their Uber One and it’s cool if you get the free trial but I wouldn’t pay for it honestly. The “benefits” are not worth it and you could honestly do without it. For Uber Eats however, I can’t even lie and say it’s not worth it. My only complaint is that I wish that since I’m paying for a premium service that my food could get to me ASAP and not having to wait for the driver to make multiple deliveries. Beside that way better than Lyft in every aspect.
title: Hit or miss

review: Uber services seem to get worse. Nothing but constant problems. Either Uber or the driver changing pick up or drop off destinations. Or not turning off the meter after we get dropped off. This time we had our supposed driver go all the way to DC when our pick up destination was in Alexandria. There was no way to get a hold of her and time was ticking. Had to cancel the trip because she kept going further and further from us. On top of that, Uber charges me a cancellation fee. Why if it was the driver’s fault? This is definitely the last time I use the app.
title: More bad than good

review: I had to unexpectedly leave my car at the Dodge dealership and hadn’t arranged for a ride back home. First time to Uber (EVER) and was fortunate enough to get John. He was awesome and his car was immaculately clean. I didn’t speak a word during the 30-minute drive home as I sat calculating the cost of my impending car repair bill, but felt very safe in his vehicle and was impressed with his driving skills. Hope he’s in the area the NEXT time I need an Uber!
title: Best Uber Ride EVER!

review:
I locked my keys in the car at 120° in Phoenix. I called the Uber driver he was there promptly. He was very nice drove wonderful. Took me back to my house to grab my keys waited for me there and then brought me back to the store where I locked my keys in the car with the car running. My groceries were inside the car He was very efficient. He drove beautiful. He got me where I needed to go. Thank you so much  Uber  you have a great driver here

Regards, Robert Morse
title: Good luck charm

review: After a long day of multiple delayed flights, and then finally, I canceled one we were stuck in Dallas Fort Worth grabbed a quick hotel, called an Uber. Our first driver, Mohammed drove right past us as I was waving my arms, and stepping out in the road at him and then canceled the ride, but the second driver found us immediately, and was an extremely efficient driver. The app is very user-friendly and easy to use.
title: DFW Airport Pickup

review:
I arrived in Montreal at 2 AM and there were no taxis and limited Uber drivers. Philip called me the minute he arrived, because there were other travelers trying to get drivers, but he waited for me.

During our ride, he gave me advice for taking some of my clients out while in Montreal and we practiced speaking our multiple languages!

It’s always nice to have a safe, clean and pleasant ride after a long journey.
title: Super Service & Friendly

review: This was my very first time having to use a ride share service ! I didn’t know what to expect ! All I know is I signed up and requested a ride and 6 minutes later the driver was there to pick me up ! He helped me with my groceries and the conversation was good! Overall I rate my first time experience 5 stars for sure ! Thank you driver for all that you do ! Your act of kindness went a long way !
title: Five star service

review: I had to catch an Uber home from work because they were shooting a movie on the block I work and there was no where to park. I was a bit hesitant because I had not been in an Uber in years. I wasn’t in the best mood because of the inconvenience the film shoot caused. However, that all changed. My driver felt like an old friend. We had such an engaging conversation. I felt so stress free by the time I got home.
title: Great driver and great conversation

review:
You will wait longer and arrive later than the app tells you that you will. This has always been true, but in my area, it has risen to the point where I am now canceling rides, consistently and preferring Uber’s competitors. Things happen, in the future is difficult to predict, I understand. However, when an app is consistently wrong in a direction that hurts me, I stop using it.

Try competing apps. They are dramatically better at delivering a car and arriving at the destination on time.
title: Lies about time, I have moved elsewhere

review: Can I request a reduction of my cancelation fee for Saturday night trip placement error I made. I am 82 and have difficulty with order by text. I ordered a ride  to frankfort il from chicago il but I accidentally left the address in Olympia fields as my destination when it should have been destination home in Frankfort, had to cancel and reordered but  I have been charged a fifty one dollar cancel fee .  Please my son is in the hospital in chicago.
title: Mistaken order

review: Uber has never failed me but they few times they did i swear i deleted the app for a while. So  my Uber driver tells me they moved out of the parking because a school bus was coming through which was understandable but i call them and they said exactly what i just said and said they would circle around i said thank you and waited and they canceled the ride and i had an interview to get to like if you couldn’t do the ride just say that don’t waste another adults time and this wasn’t even the first time i’ve been disappointed like this.
title: some of the drivers are real lame

review: Uber is a great app except in areas where Uber don’t allow their drivers to see where the rider has requested as a destination. It wastes a lot of time and causes frustration when a driver accepts my ride, then sends me a msg or calls me to ask where I’m going and then cancels the ride if they don’t want to take me there. It would be better for drivers to accept rides knowing the riders destination to reduce this frustration.
title: Great - except….

review: Ordered some food and I instantly put the payment thinking it was to my work. Nope it was to my house so I texted the driver and asked to drop it off at my work cus it’s closer, nope so while I’m doing my job she says “where” and I already gave the address and the name and I couldn’t text due to me working and well the order was never finished cus I texted her 3 min after the order was made and they canceled my order and on top of that said since they “already made the food” there wouldn’t be a refund. I’m doing grub hub and actually been saving 3x more money and I get free food and the discounts are higher, I actually recommend it.
title: Won’t use Uber ever again

review: I have to stop using this app at this point and switch to lyft. The past 7 out of 10 drivers ive had were talking on the phone or on their phone. They don’t pay attention because of that and have missed my exits or turns making me late to work, speeding up randomly and breaking or driving insanely slow. It’s astonishing how they have drivers licenses. The last driver I had the car smelled like pee and was dirty with trash. They all have 4.7 ratings and up and I honestly dont think that’s true. Never using this service again, lyft has much better and safer drivers.
title: Drivers constantly on phone and dont know how to drive

review:
Upon arriving at my airport and after getting my bags I checked to see what Uber was available.
I chose a Uber that was $62 and change to my destination. As soon as I clicked on that fair, I then double clicked my Apple Pay and it started to go through, but then a window appeared that said “oops something went wrong try again”. 
I then went back to the fair page and the same Uber had gone from $62-$112 and changed in the spur of the moment. But mind you I had already excepted and clicked pay with Apple Pay.  DOUBLING THE PRICE AFTER I ACCEPTED THE $62 EAS WRONG aka price gouging!
Obviously I did not choose that Uber and chose another $40 less than the one that doubled the price.
The Uber driver I had, after subsequently choosing another was great period.
But whatever happened with the first choice based on price taking me from $62  to $112 was just plain wrong. Area JAX.
title: Price more than doubled

review: We should be able to rate drivers who cancel rides to early!!!! Today my first driver cancelled after ignoring two calls and two text messages! I tried to explain to him that he was on the other side of my building and that it takes awhile to get there! I tried to give him the correct pickup spot but he ignored! I ran all the way down there carrying a car seat, a baby bag, and a “heavy” 2 year old! As I was walking up (running up) the driver pulled off not even noticing I was right behind him!! I was furious that I couldn’t give this guy the zero rating that he deserved because all of his information vanished when he cancelled!!!!
title: Cancelled rides

review: Because of weather delay at airport, we needed to be taken over 50 miles to another airport at 2:45 AM. He showed up a few minutes earlier was cordial and polite. Have a very clean acceptable vehicle enjoyed some conversation on the way and I would certainly recommend his service, and I certainly will use him again if the chance comes around… For sure, a five-star experience. Thank you.
title: Very nice person

review: I was very pleased with Mr. Joseph professionalism and kind demeanor. He derived on time. Communicated with me. Opened the door. Offered an umbrella as it was raining. Drove me safely. I felt safe and respected as if I were with a family member. Carried a conversation and was very comforting before arriving to my appointment. I highly recommend him and appreciate there are people like him with Uber especially when the ride is a long one. To feel safe comfortable and treated nicely. Many thanks!
title: The best Uber driver

review: We just finished an amazing, fun weekend trip to Vegas and the entire city and strip was crazy busy for NYE weekend and the Niner/Raider game. We counted on Uber to get us from place to place all weekend and they did not disappoint! We always had a ride that was on-time and reliable, and each driver was friendly, courteous and knew their way around the city. Will look forward to our next trip to LV and will definitely use Uber to get around.
title: Love LV Uber!

review: I basically was getting the hang of using this app and apparently they’ve taken my money twice today and yesterday and charged me while no driver was even in the area or headed towards me. I still had to pay again twice today and only one was for a ride. Not including yesterdays no ride I got charged for.  In most cases you should be able to cancel and get your money since you didn’t get a ride or driver around you shouldn’t be charged but I guess I’ll wait to see if I get any refund on all that and if Uber cars about there new customers or take advantage of them.
title: My Uber experience during emergency snow today and yesterday

review:
I am 49 yrs old and today I took my very FIRST Uber ride!! And fate knew it because it sent me your driver “George”! He was right on time, perfectly polite and most importantly very personable!! In our current world, where the culture has moved toward the extinction of customer service, George is definitely the exception! He was courteous, safe and again most importantly, FUN! 
George has gained Uber, your company, a new family of Uber customers!!! Thank you George!!
title: George popped my Uber cherry!!

review: After my ride last night I attempted to tip the driver. The app requires (in addition to a tip) a rating. I gave the driver 4 stars, no real issue, just no greeting or interaction at all. The app then asks me to choose a reason, none of which were appropriate, and won’t allow me to just tip the guy. Thus he got no tip and I end up feeling bad but didn’t want to give a misleading review. Why can’t I leave a tip without a rating, or why can’t I fill in my own reasons for the rating rather than choose from the too limited list provided?
title: Problem with app
developerResponse: {'id': 8755151, 'body': "Hi, we are sorry to hear that you were charged a cancellation fee. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please visit https://ubr.to/2FM3FMF for issues regarding cancellation. For further queries, reach out to t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.", 'modified': '2019-05-20T10:40:45Z'}

review: I have contacted customer help support on the app several times for being charged for rides I did not take and ridiculous add on fees  to original price that make no sense. I’ve tried several times to get in touch with an agent an actual person that can resolve my issues but all I get is automatic responses that you can’t even reply to. I’m tired of Uber stealing from me. I am no longer a member of the Uber one, which is a rip off to begin with. I’m done with Uber their whole system is trash!! Let me know when ya get some real customer service reps. No one wants credit or discounts, We want real help for our real problems.
title: Customer support is Trash!

review:
In the beginning I wasn’t having any issues with Uber and I enjoyed the Ubers rewards and would help out if I had any kind of issues.
But as of recently, everything is going downhill-you’ll get ‘support’ but won’t really fixed the issue.

I had decided to sign up for their new program Uber One as they would ‘help’ you save but honestly they’re making you spend more money then save. ESPECIALLY on rides 

I had contacted the support team with an issue with canceling the membership as it would STILL appear on my account and they claim to have help me and would offered to give me Uber cash but I receive nothing nor did the membership get cleared out.
I’ve emailed them a few times with screenshot and they just stop replying.

I liked Uber when they first came out& for awhile I like it- but because I relied heavily on them for a source of transportation their whole system isn’t cutting out for me
title: It just got worse

review: Uber makes it impossible to contact them unless you have a predetermined issue.  I tried to contact them for an hour jumping through hoops to just email an issue I had with the app locking up and doubling the tip.     Impossible!  And you cannot edit the tip after your trip so I could not fix it.  I tipped well so when I was charged twice it was a bummer.  No good deed goes unpunished I guess.    Uber fix this!!!!!  People have issues and you are not all knowing to guess what people want.  Listen to your customers!  Arrogance is the decline of good customer experience!
title: Cannot contact them

review:
I used the app to order food, but Uber’s scam is immediately apparent. Uber charges illegal “tax” that is NOT required by either the state or the locality. If you do some digging, Uber charges customers arbitrary fees that are not disclosed and are simply an unfair way to inflate the cost of the food to make money that does not go to the driver.

In many instances, Uber also artificially inflates the cost of items and keeps the difference.  I received a receipt with my meal and the price of each item was significantly lower than the price Uber charged. This is ILLEGAL. 

Beware! This is illegal in California. There should be a class action for unfair business practices.
title: Beware: Uber charges more than the Restaurant

review: All the past two months, Uber has deteriorated greatly. I’ve had four consecutive issues with ordering issues either from Uber eats or ordering a ride. They purposely make it so hard for you to speak or communicate with customer service to resolve the issue that he finally gave up. But this time it was ridiculous. I scheduled a ride for the next day but they made the ride that same day. Then the driver during that inappropriately timed the ride was saying that they could not find the location and subsequently cancel it. But Uber charged me $27. I still am trying to speak to someone. If this doesn’t get resolved it’s a wrap
title: I’m done with Uber

review: Not sure if they get paid literal dirt or if they’re divas expecting to make a living off a part time opportunity but I spend anywhere from 15-45 minutes watching people accept then decline my ride? Drivers should be penalized for too many cancellations, it’s gross how consistent this happens. Will I get to work an hour early or barely scrape in on time? It’s a dice roll, especially because scheduling a ride is literally no different than just requesting one plus there’s a $30 up charge… For what? If im receiving no guaranteed ride or any incentive to schedule than what is this minimum for
title: Picky drivers

review: Upon showing me a driver 9 minutes out so I decided to book the ride. Lo and be hold, my connected driver was 21 minutes out with a drop off along the way. We decided patience is a virtue and waited.  20 minutes into waiting he canceled. I proceed to book another trip again 20 minutes out with a drop off and stops along the way. Now waiting 40 minutes for a 5 mile car ride just wasn’t worth it. 👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽 long story short is If the app says drivers are 10 minutes out before you book. Don’t book a driver that takes 30 minutes with a stop to come get me. I’ll pay extra for a Taxi.
title: Horrible experience

review: At first I was being charged decent amount right around twenty to ten dollars per ride about ten miles or so. Now I can’t travel even close the distance without the prices being around forty dollars and more recently I got a price that was right about 92 dollars for one was regular ride. No way to contact support and they won’t even look into the crazy fluctuation. Taxis don’t even charge that much.
title: Insanely high prices

review: Schedule a pick up while I was driving and 15 min out,  gave the drive a call so I could let him know what time I need him to pick me up.  His response was that he wasn’t going to be able to make it until 40 mins later and if I need sooner that I need to cancel pick up and try again.   Well seeing I need to get to airport I canceled the request and was charged a 6$ fee for his time.   What time is this 6$ for a 30 sec phone call just to be told he would be late.   What a rip off.   I wonder how many Uber drivers do this and get away with it.   6$ for cancel fee 2 min after I schedule.     What a hack.
title: No customer service and a rip-off

review: Been using Uber myself for many years even use them for my business rides for my clients. No more. This company Jack’s prices. Takes hours to get a hold of support. $30 for a 2 mile trip with no traffic. $20 to the airport that’s fine with traffic then $60 for that trip back with no traffic. Ridiculous. Never again. I’m done with Uber. I don’t recommend them. Also their drivers are notorious to drive off without stopping charging you no rider fees which requires you to contact support to get it waived. Just terrible. Local taxis are better at taking care of clients and have regular pricing.
title: Been a long time customer and no longer

review: First time using Uber in the Philly Area at first it was quick and simple very straightforward. Typed my destination, select the type of car service and bam i got myself a ride. Few days later at the end of my trip, i needed an uber to go to the airport to go home. Out of nowhere, I was having some payment issue. My card wasn’t going through and i tried other cards and also did not work. I ended ordering a taxi. Just be mindful that the payment is unreliable and messy.
title: Good Concept/Service Horrible Reliability/Consistency

review: My ride canceled on me and I’m trying to go to work but unfortunately I have to Uber and the time it said for my ride to get here was 4 minutes so I requested it thinking it would be here in 4 minutes I was waiting by my door when I looked back at the app and it says that my ride won’t be here for 10-12 minutes!!! Which I found ridiculous so I tried to cancel and it said that it would charge me 5 dollars when he was still in the same spot which makes no sense I love Uber but I have been having bad trips like this and I do not recommend it.
title: Wrong timing with rides !!

review: I was waiting for my Uber, the driver drives right by me and keeps going. I called no answer, then 10 minutes later I get a notification saying I was charged and asking how my trip went. I submitted a claim saying the driver never picked me up. Uber says they can’t prove I wasn’t picked up. I even provided a tracking report from another app to show I was stuck there for 30 minutes after the driver said he had picked me up. Uber refused to give me a refund. After doing research I have found they do this all the time and get away with it. It’s a scam and Uber doesn’t care one bit and keeps your money. Deleting my UBER!!
title: Scam Pick Ups and still charged

review: My Uber driver was on time, super nice and it was a good ride. However, the app is very flawed...I tried to schedule my pick up time for 9 AM and when I would go to pay the app kept telling me that something went wrong and couldn’t schedule the pick up. So around 8:30 I had one pick me up “ASAP” I paid the driver and went on. It wasn’t until I got TO the airport that the app alerted me that another driver was waiting outside my hotel for me (at 9AM). Then when I canceled it (because I already paid my other driver and was at my destination) they made me pay a 13$ cancellation fee!!! Even though the app told me that a driver couldn’t pick me up because there was an error in scheduling a time.
title: The App

review:
Today I scheduled a ride in the Uber App 45 minutes before needed and followed progress all the way to 2 minutes after the ride was due to arrive.  The ride disappeared and then when I tried to find status I found that no cars in my car class were available.  Seriously?  This app does not notify the user that a car is not available until AFTER the ride time has passed?  This ride was to the Philadelphia airport to catch a flight, so a No-show due to app deficiencies is not ok.
This is an unacceptable disposition. I have removed the app, and will be canceling my account.  Lyft app is reliable and works perfectly.  That company has won my business and Uber is a Luser.
title: Uber App is a Failure

review: This was a very pleasant ride and the driver Was an excellent driver, he was driving within the zone limit, a very nice gentleman. I forgot my phone in his car and he came back to give me my phone. I really needed my phone more than any other time, I needed to call AAA to have them towed my car., and couldn’t have done it without my phone. I thank God for sending me am angle. Thank you Uber and thank you angle driver.
title: Thank you angle driver.

review: I used to work at Uber and I decided I would never support the company again until I had the need recently and at least for the customer it has become a better convenience than before. I made a reservation with three anticipated days and my driver Maileen was perfect.  The service has gone from very basic to top notch.  Although it was more on the expensive side. For 7min ride I paid 12$ . But it was worth it at 5am.
title: Excellent for the customer

review: So far I haven’t had any problems other than a miss turn once when getting an Uber driver. Just wish they could find a way to make it cheaper in this economy for both me and the driver. If there is any improvements I do not see anyway it could improve further than what is already good for now. Highly recommend it if you need to get to a place ASAP.
title: Great app. Greater people

review:
Ordering ride was very easy and the car arrived in 
3 minutes. Car was clean and I had a pleasant talk with the driver, Jeremy.  When I got to the terminal he helped with the bags and told me where my airline bag drop was.  Payment was already set up, so that didn’t take additional time. Couldn’t have asked for more and it was less expensive than any other option from downtown to JAX.
title: Get Me To My Flight On Time

review: After blowing a tire w no spare & all Auto/Tire stores closed while being 2 hours from home, I thought I was doomed. Not only did Uber get me a ride, Emils & Edward were beyond excellent. They ‘get’ it. They know when to be conversant or just listen to music. Emils vehicle was also clean & comfortable. Last but not least, he was a very observant & careful driver. I could not have been more pleased. He’s a credit to your company. Thank you 🙏🏽
title: Godsend

review: Ahmad was a great driver, and was an even better host for our drive from SeaTac to our home in Mukilteo.  My son and I enjoyed our conversations with Ahmad during the whole trip.  Ahmad is a very kind man, and was a joy to ride with.  I would highly recommend him, and his beautiful vehicle if you ever need an Uber ride.  It was very nice to meet you Ahmad, and thank you very much for taking us home after a long trip!
title: Great Uber trip home from SeaTac with Ahmad

review: The Uber app was easy to use; it found me a driver (Keith) right away. He was close and picked me up within 3 minutes. Keith was very nice, polite and personable. Keith was an excellent driver, was familiar with the city (Wichita), knew the way to my destination and got me there without issue. Couldn’t have been any easier or convenient; would use both Uber and Keith again if I needed a ride.
title: Both Uber and Driver - Easy, Convenient & Friendly

review: Aurelio was our most recent driver and he was superb! He didn’t just sit and wait in the car like some drivers. He got out, helped load bags into the car (actually he loaded them all himself), he opened and closed the door for my wife, unloaded the bags, was super personable and overall an amazing driver. Felt like I was using a limo service rather than an Uber ride. I wish all the drivers were like Aurelio.
title: Our last ride

review: I have used Uber for years. However for some reason when I schedule a reserve trip, they do not come to my house anymore as they did 5 years ago. I think it’s because their maps are wrong. The last 3 trips from airport to my house showed the wrong directions. I would prefer scheduling rides from my house to airport, instead of coming down the hill to meet.
title: Old service

review: I ordered my uber eats and I have my house as my set address but it sent it to a completely different address I had never heard of before or ordered an uber or delivery to. I’ve had so many bad experiences when I’ve taken Ubers. The smell of one of the Ubers caused me to throw up. Another time I was sitting in the back wearing my face mask (because I was about to visit my grandmother who is elderly) just minding my own business looking at my phone and the driver tells me to take my mask off. I don’t even care if people wear masks or not but it was annoying because I just felt more comfortable wearing my mask and then I had to take it off.
title: Uber Eats Sends Food To Incorrect Adresses

review: I don’t take Uber too often because normally I have to rent a car but this driver was very nice. Flight probably waited a little extra more than he was supposed to, but we were getting off a cruise ship and he understood we communicated through the app and it was excellent. Kudos to his driving skills and taking good care of us. Thank you sir, for all you did for us that day.
title: Super clean car and super clean driver

review: My account was deactivated after a background check. I was using the app just fine and then they did another background check on me because it had been a year. My report stated that I had a invalid drivers license. The license it was referring to was from a state I no longer live in and haven’t lived in for a few years at that point. I have a valid license in my state and showed this to the service that provides the background check as well as Uber, but a year later my account still is deactivated. Without any effort from either company to resolve my issue, I will use another service.
title: Was deactivated for no reason

review: I must say I love this app. I set up a ride and they are here on time , they don’t make you wait hours and all the drivers have been friendly even helped carry in a bag of stuff for me.. they seem to actually care about customer service and there aren’t many companies that care anymore.. you have a customer for life is customer service Is always like this.
title: Everything perfect

review: Wonderful driver, extremely professional, outstandingly courteous, patient, kind and I felt extremely safe with him in control of the DRIVING!!!!!   Not to mention- I love the vehicle!!!. Kudos for Uber for having such an outstanding, remarkable and safe  driver. I hope that I can have him drive me again.I just wanted to comment on this wonderful driverr, and I rarely take the time to do that-however I felt compelled to remark on his wonderful service!
title: Mario IS ABOVE and BEYOND  EXPECTATIONS !

review: I’ve been trying to verify different information all day, won’t accept any of my payment methods. I tried to download a gift card and it literally wouldn’t process any of my payments on any website(just for Uber). Terrible service. I wish I could give this -10, do not rely on this app if you are traveling out of town, your better off spending the extra money with Lyft.
title: Uber Is a scam

review: Upon request, App said walk to pick up location and request again once there. while walking to Lax it location, I did not see the “confirm pickup”, thus loss the first ride and had to request a new ride and wait. Maybe say Confirm pick up location, then proceed to pick up location driver will wait x minutes. Or contact driver. But I do see where the driver may have to wait for the delay of walking or shuttle specifically at lax.
title: App ride confirmation

review: When requesting an Uber, it can be tricky if you don’t confirm your ride on the 1st screen & 1st time. Otherwise, it does not reserve your ride. I don’t use Uber all of the time, so I have to remember that tricky part when requesting an Uber. Other than that, Uber is a lifesaver. Moving from a small town where calling a friend or relative is your ride option, Uber has been a carnival for me! Especially providing the information about the car and driver! Thanks!
title: Tricky Reservation on App

review: I am grateful for all the drivers. They are my every day hero’s. I am disabled. If it was not for Uber drivers I would be stranded. Tmost help with grocers and are very kind. My only wish would be maybe a price break some fore senior disabled. Thank you again too all the drivers that are so wonderful and caring. Be safe please. We are counting on you in many ways and appreciate all that you do for us.
title: People helping disabled  thank you

review: I have used Uber consistently (daily) for over 6 years in NYC. However, post COVID I find trip prices exorbitant to the point where I would rather chose alternatives that I don’t like as much just to allow me to continue to use car transport. Post COVID the quality of drivers have decreased and the wait times often increased. For those that don’t have any financial limits, Uber is still the most reliable best option out there.
title: Uber is reliable but comes at a price

review: Last Thursday Uber released new features such as trip radar, even though gas prices was raised up they changed fares and decreased in long trips, on the other hand waiting time between trips   increased due to trip radar. So it might be cause in this situation drivers stop driving and it’s not worth  to drive for low fares with long time waiting.
title: New feature and changes are awful and horrible

review:
I’m literally 25 years old and I had one driver report me as a minor on the way to my friends’ wedding and without any warning or notification or even opportunity to dispute this, my whole Uber account was taken from me. Now Uber eats doesn’t work either so I’m using other platforms for personal and work. I’ve reported this issue 3 times and have received no help since January. 

I just got my account back on the 4th attempt to correct this problem more than 6 months after it happened because every time I tried to before the online support and app support would glitch and close.
title: Whole Account Ripped Away

review: The customer support is horrible for drivers, they are based out of another country so have a hard time communicating with you. Somehow they disabled my payment, & it’s been 3 days of trying to cash out with still nothing fixed. When you call the customer service number they can’t help with anything & tell you that you have to wait for a message from security. That message comes & they’re useless also…so I’m still not able to cash out money that I earned through them…I don’t understand why a company based in the US has a call center in another country
title: Horrible customer support for drivers

review: I like the idea of this new program only if it worked. It lets me go through the steps to schedule a ride ahead of time from the airport and shows me the normal Uberx offer and pricing only to then register it is an airport where I have to fill out the information again and match my flight # (which is a cool aspect if it aligns with any delay or cancellation type of scheduling) but then it only displays Uber black pricing which are over double the price it displayed for the UberX originally. If it’s designed to only allow the Uber black booking for airport rides than that is just unfortunate but otherwise, seems like an app issue. Please fix
title: Airport reserve

review: I called a driver at 12:45 Sunday morning to pick me up at a friends house- who lives in a very nice area. Immediately upon receiving a message that the driver had arrived, we went out front to see a driver slowly turn around and bolt off down the road. I never cancelled the ride. I had to order another ride, wait another 15 minutes- and was charged a cancellation fee. I never canceled. This is the second ‘cancellation’ fee I’ve received from Uber in the past 6 months. Disputed the first- didn’t have to pay. Disputing this one, also, but I’m finished with Uber. No clear contact information for how to discuss this with the company.
title: Cancellation scams

review:
Driver just drove in circles and then stopped 12 minutes away and waited there for 10 minutes. I’ve been waiting for a pickup for over 20 minutes now after being told that a driver was 5 minutes away three different times. There’s no obvious way to call customer service to find out what’s going on. Never had this problem with Lyft.

Edit: also took a ride to the airport that I scheduled in advance, and when I saw the receipt later, it turns out they added more than $20 in extra fees, including $10 for scheduling in advance, which Lyft and taxi companies don’t charge extra for.
title: Drivers don’t show up

review:
Overall the app does whats needed to be done. With that being said I do have a few problems.

Firstly, I wanna say something bout the payment. I dont think the timing is right. I been on my last $20 trying to get to work and its take 30 minutes to find a driver. When stuff like this happens,  makes me late to work. In that time i could have used the money to find my own ride.

My second issue is with the drop off time. How can I have a dropoff time with no driver. This can be upsetting as it can make some think that they already have a driver on the way. 

My last issue (For Now) isn’t really an issue, it just might be helpful. Add the pickup notes to the start of ordering a ride. With wait times like mine, customers can easily forget to give the driver helpful instructions on how to get to them (such as gate codes, etc)
title: A few tweaks needed

review: Loyal user of Uber for the past year and found out there is a rewards program. It doesn’t appear in my app although I meet the criteria. Contacted support and did everything they asked me to do yet they could not find a solution. Went through support multiple times and I get the same automated messages and no real help. My latest support told me that they are aware of the situation and will get back to me. This was a month ago and as someone who uses Uber/Uber eats almost everyday I would like to benefit from the rewards program.
title: Uber rewards not available for everyone?

review: Since this is the only way to contact someone at Uber, I am leaving this review because you charged my account $9.99 for some thing that I did not ask to be a part of. I feel as though it’s really shady. I never signed up for anything extra. I’m guessing the Uber places buttons to sign up for things in convenient locations where you might end up accidentally pressing them when closing out the app or waiting for your ride. I have no interest in extras I was just using them as a ride service. I would like a refund.
title: Mysteriously signed up for Uber 1 or pass?

review: Not gonna lie it used to be a great app. PAST tense. Uber is the most overpriced riding app I have ever used for ridiculously small trips while also letting just anyone ride for them. One of my drivers had just gotten out of jail, another one was straight up drinking while driving (almost got us in a car accident) and not to mention all those irritated drivers that end up cancelling on you cause they’re not skilled enough to even use an app and YOU are the one that has to pay a fee? It’s a matter of time for this app to go bankrupt, save your money for a company that actually values its customers. i’m done
title: I’d rather walk for days than take an uber

review: I made a reservation for my ride over 72 hours in advance and locked in a trip price of 67$. When we exited bottlerock we were waiting in the Uber pickup spot and it said that my ride cancelled. Suddenly my reservation was gone and I had no ride and had to make a new one…. For 167$ straight up extortion! I would have paid it except for the fact that after 45min of waiting not a single car was available even though there were Uber’s just waiting everywhere. Honestly I’ll never use this service again and I hope no one else does either. It’s not safe and it’s literally stealing money from you.
title: Got stranded after bottlerock

review: Tried Uber eats with a business account twice through my Uber app failed both times. First time app wouldn't load my card. Second time, card was loaded, order placed, used a 20$ coupon from my email, driver didn’t drop off order, charged my card. Called driver’s number, and was blocked. Could not get in touch with any kind of customer service. Tried to get a refund through the app, which is apparently the only way to get one. Had my money refunded into UBER CREDIT INSTEAD OF ACTUAL MONEY AND IT DIDN'T REFUND THE DRIVERS TIP. So that guy got a free tip and probably a free lunch. And my coupon is gone… I’ll never use Uber eats again. Trash app.
title: Uber eats stole my money, trash app.

review: This review is in the same tone as Steve Martin in planes, trains, and automobiles. I scheduled an Uber for after a concert at 4pm for pick up at midnight. After seeing tons of ubers picking up, ours never came. After an hour, I got a text that there were “no drivers in the area”.   Then we got back into the queue and the price jumped to $58, then couldn’t connect to a driver again. Got back in the queue and it was $60+. 2 HOURS after the concert we finally connected to a driver. So, I really don’t care for the way your company left us in the middle of nowhere, with a text for Uber that isn’t there, only to wait for an hour because they want a higher rate.
title: Stranded

review: I’m so mad at Uber they are ridiculous, they gave you price and then they send you a receive way more then what they said you would pay. Besides the charges are getting out of place, I don’t blame the drivers I blame the company that’s greedy. If you gonna put a price keep it that way because of your greedy personality you don’t give as a chance to tip the driver with such a high rate 😤shame on you
title: Seriously

review: Very disappointed. Used to be an app to help you get somewhere fast and now the closest car is 20 minutes away. Is way faster to go wait for the bus than asking for an Uber. This is definitely my last ride with this app and I strongly recommend not to download it, not to use it and not to pay for the poor service they are giving this days.
title: Useless

review: Its ok i only ride cause it cheaper than lyft but the wait time for each pick up is too long, ive been late to work numerous times because i order the uber 30 mins before i go in and still get a wait time of 22 minutes until my driver gets here... thats way too long and if i try to cancel you take a little bit of money everytime like come on atleast get me to work on time when i put in a half hour before im even scheduled and my job is literally right up the street they give me someone that’s already doing a trip 10 miles away to come get me for my 2 mile drive up the road, it’s ridiculous
title: Wait tome too long

review: I never write reviews, but as I’m in the 25th minute of waiting for an Uber, I might as well use this time to vent about how frustrating it is when Uber drivers drive around for 15 minutes (when they’re originally 3 minutes away) and then cancel on you. There seems to be no repercussion for drivers doing this, while if I cancel a ride I have to pay Uber. It’s so infuriating, and seems to happen almost every other ride. I didn’t have Lyft set up in my phone and didn’t want to bother, but I’m absolutely switching now and seeing if they’re better about this
title: Terrible service and they don’t hold drivers accountable

review: I prebooked a ride to the airport 3 weeks in advance. The day of said ride, Uber canceled it 10 mins after the ride was scheduled to be there. I was freaking out trying to get to the airport on time. I ended up driving and parking in the garage and I’m sure it’s going to cost me $250 when I come back. What in the actual EFF, Uber? These are time sensitive rides, you can’t be acting like this when it comes to airport rides!! My company uses Uber for their corporate travel. I will be making a formal complaint to them about this app and tell them what happened. I will convince EVERYONE at work to use Lyft instead. Good Uber. That was a huge customer for you.
title: Unreliable

review: I like uber and used to use it frequently when we were allowed to go out. I have had so many issues recently with the app deleting my payment methods, or not allowing me to schedule a pickup. When you go on the app or website there’s no actual option for speaking to representative. It’s all just quick links. Seems like they don’t actually have a desire to help a customer in need.
title: No actual customer service

review: Be careful with split rides the Uber driver told me there was a glitch in the system and  said I had to reorder ride . He charged my card 4 x’s and it’s been 2 days and NO one has responded to my messages I sent photo evidence and all support keeps sending automated messages telling me to make sure a friend didn’t use my account .. I am very disappointed and unhappy that I was scammed and I can’t even speak to anyone. Once I call my bank my Uber account won’t work anymore. I guess I’ll have to pay extra for Lyft just to know my card won’t be over charged and nothing will be done about !! Be careful for scammers working for Uber!!
title: Scammed

review: It was my first time calling Uber I was at the airport departure terminal and the driver went to arrivals and picked up a random person while I was stranded. It was my first time using the app so I called my daughter and she requested me a new ride. When we got home my daughter went to the app to request help but UBER said that because the driver made the trip we would still be charged!! Even though I have the evidence of the alternate ride my daughter called me at the exact time for the same address they refused. Even though the second Uber driver was a witness for me and my wife Uber REFUSES to refund me this fraudulent purchase. Don’t let your fathers and mothers siblings and children get scammed by this greedy app.
title: BEWARE FRAUDULENT CHARGES REFUSAL TO REFUND

review:
I was broken down on the side of the road in the middle of the night and my driver actually found me on the side of the highway! I couldn’t believe it! I started with Lyft and they wanted to charge me 110$ to take me 13 miles?🤮I downloaded Uber, meanwhile my phone is dying! And my driver found me in the dark, picked me up, for less than 25$!!! I started to cry for the relief and then suddenly, I missed my ex-husban? 
🤢it was really cold and scary tbh🤷🏻‍♀️
title: Saved me!

review: My rating was 5 stars for over a year, mostly because I only used Uber a few times. Then recently my score was 4.5! I checked, and a closed account from 2018 (different phone, different email, different country) was resurrected and attached to my current account. I’ve had OTHER accounts in 2019, 2020, and 2021 with other phones in other countries, but they’re missing. I asked how this is being determined with closed accounts? Customer service, always someone with an Indian name, has sent me three replies, each one repeating an explanation of the rating system. I AM NOT ASKING ABOUT THE RATING SYSTEM! 你們看不懂英文嗎？Sprechen Sie English?
title: Abysmal customer service

review:
Very respectful and pleasant. I gave in a $3.00 tip in person. What I don’t understand is that I had to call Uber 2 times for my ride. After I call the first time and wait, my ride didn’t show up and then when I was going to check what happens, it showed that the rifa was canceled an I had to call again because I didn’t cancel it. I was waiting. I hip you didn’t charge me twice. Thank you.
New Haven, Ct
title: Ride to 130 Eastern St.

review: Really nice n respectful n there was loyalty thanks for returning my daughters wallet u a lot of urbers drivers wouldn’t do that I drop my phone in the urber got off at my apartments n with in 10 seconds I knew my phone was in the urber I called them text them to let them know my phone was in there n he reply to me he can’t come back wow really n he was in sight of me smh but thank god there’s real urber drivers out there n I really appreciated it man
title: God bless u

review: I love the concept of Uber but their service has degraded significantly.  I started using in 2017 and been a faithful user since.  Unfortunately will be moving to door dash for food and cabs or something else for drivers.  Worst of all is that Uber doesn’t care about any issue.  Good take an hour to be delivered and it arrives cold.  Not their issue.  Drivers keep canceling and their estimated times are not even close.  Uber says it’s not their issue and they do their best.     They have moved into that mode of automated support messages and not caring for what their core purpose is.  Sad.
title: Uber isn’t what it used to be

review:
What a gentleman!!! Arrived early in a suit. What a nice young man. 
Couple suggestions; ask about our timing on arriving to our destination (SeaTac). There was no need (for our sake) to drive so fast. We had planned on arriving two hours in advance of our plane departure. Arriving 2:40 hours early. Also, tone down a little on the comments of “Asian car drivers.”
Other than these two negs, I’d say Evance was one of the best drivers we’ve ever had!
title: Evance

review:
I use Uber a lot however recently including tonight drivers refused to bring me to my destination because it was too far , not worth their time etc …
This is terrible if you accept the job why do the drivers refuse to take you if it’s far ?
Very disappointing my first driver tonight Xavier just flat out refused to take me after booking the ride and he left me off in the middle of nowhere!!!!!
Not a good thing !
title: Not good

review: Peter had a hard time navigating where we were because there was a graduation at GICC. Security also wouldn’t let him simply turn around either, which would’ve definitely been easier. What would’ve frustrated most didn’t seem to even phase him. And please don’t get me started on his music!!! Phenomenal all the way around. If you’re lucky enough to get him you’re in for a treat.
title: Excellent!

review:
An excellent driver with Uber makes for an excellent drive, excellent conversation, and a ride in a nice clean car. Unfortunately the same can be said for a lowbrow driver, a frightening drive, and breaking of traffic safety rules that could cost one (and other drivers) severe injury or worse.

Worst of all is the fare rules that „play“ with the ridership and are packed with arbitrary decisions concerning the amount of the fare, based on criteria which cannot be deciphered.

Thank God for the excellent drivers.
title: Drivers MAKE Uber; Fare rules make no sense

review:
I reserved a ride to CDG in France for my family and I. The driver arrived as expected but after dropping us off did not end the trip. Due to this, I have been charged almost 2x for the ride over what I was initially quoted. 

Feature Gaps: I had no way to alert my driver he forgot to end the trip (trying to assume the best intentions here). I could also not flag the issue to Uber in real time to help with any disputes. 

Bugs: When I tried to alert Uber of the issue, that the trip was not ended by the driver, the app would not allow me to report the issue. It just says “Error. Problem on our end. Please try again later”
title: Serious Gaps and App Failures

review: Russell was absolutely amazing. The seats were extremely comfortable and he was absolutely wonderful during the entire 30 minute drive from the airport to our daughters house! He even saved us a lot of trouble when he realized I had left my cell phone in the back seat of his car and brought it back to us!!! Thank you so much, Russell, for such a pleasant Uber experience!!! Larry and Sandra Willis 😋
title: Very enjoyable ride!!!

review: It was my first time using Uber and it was horrible. I reserved a ride one week ahead and thought everything was okay. Then the night before my assignment appointment/reservation the drivers kept canceling. I had to get to the airport by 5:00 am and the last driver canceled 30 mins to my time and the system kept saying they couldn’t find a driver/ride. Finally I went on Lyft and got a ride in 2 mins. When I went to cancel the Uber they charged me $30 dollar for cancellation the ride that didn’t get booked because it was with 60 mins. Never again will I use Uber. I would give a negative if that was an option.
title: Worst experience

review: Delivered a message to my daughter for me because I was not able to make to her cheer competition in Las Vegas as I’m in Houston She called my daughter by her name and told her her daddy loves her and good luck 🍀..I know it felt good coming from a stranger in a place my 6year old has never been..I know she eased some of the nervousness..thank you timara ❤️(sorry if I misspelled your name!..never even took a Uber with her before because I’m in Houston BUT I HIGHLY RECOMMEND ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
title: Greatest Uber Driver Ever

review: I’ve been getting charged for Uber Pass for a while now even though I don’t have a subscription. So far, they have charged me over $100. When I originally reached out for help, they took a long time to look into it only to tell me they don’t know why I’m being charged and to dispute it with my bank. I did dispute it, got a new debit card, and they’re still charging me! Now I’ve reached out again and they best they can tell me is that their “specialized team” is looking into it. Now customer service just stopped responding to me.
title: Do not support this criminal company and the terrifying future of customer service they stand for.

review: This was my first Uber trip. I had reserved a rental car and then canceled it as the Uber was considerably less expensive. As there was a change in price and with the tip it turned out to be about the same price. However, I didn’t have to drive and I enjoyed the hour and a half with Jose. Jose had a great personality and is perfectly suited for the job. His car was clean and he obviously has pride in his work.
title: Enjoyable ride

review: My Uber driver must’ve had a very bad night… that’s all I can figure.  I have never in all of my experiences riding Uber had a bad driver, but Leandro from Houston was the worst. He was rude, his distasteful music was loud, and his vehicle had an unusual smell. I asked twice if he would turn the music down a little. I guess it really agitated him because he informed me that he it was his music and he was listening to it. He then informed me that if I was dissatisfied me could cancel my trip and put me out. Wow.. to top it off, after arriving to the airport, wrong terminal, he knocked my bag over while closing his trunk and did not apologize. What a way to start the day!! Geesh…
title: Early morning nightmare

review: Thomas picked me up from Bradley Airport on Thursday, February 16th. He was excellent in all areas!! I felt very safe riding with him. I engaged him in conversation and found him to be polite, intelligent and professional. I could not have asked for a more relaxing and interesting ride. Honestly, you should consider giving him a raise because he was, by far, one of the best Uber drivers I’ve ever had! You are extremely lucky to have him as an employee!
title: Review for Thomas

review: For three days now it’s been almost impossible for me to get a ride even with multiple drivers apparently being in my area. This is my main form of transportation to and from work and this makes it extremely frustrating. I don’t want to be late to work and when you’re bouncing between Uber drivers waiting for 20+ minutes or have one cancel on you last minute, it makes you want to pull your hair out. Other than that the app is pretty easy to use
title: Ride requests

review: Drivers are careful and efficient!  Uber vehicles are always clean, inside & out. The app on my phone is NOT efficient!  Today it was so unnecessarily repetitive. App just continued to go in circles, same info over & over again!  I was not able to correct the pickup address to include an apartment number. Only building number!  Adding a stop is never easy and if I’m able to add a stop, it doesn’t save the info!
title: App goes in circles, updates are just impossible

review: Uber is terrible and all ways. I simply wish there was another ride share platform that would drive this one into the ground.. they have terrible drivers who are rude and unprofessional and the customer service agents are no better. If you have a problem just know it’ll never be solved they always try to “transfer” you, but to what? No one will reach back out or even solve your problems ever. No actual phone line so they don’t really have to deal with issues. And they take over 50% of the drivers earnings. If anything use Lyft if you have to, but they’re really no better. Just more friendly drivers
title: Worst app ever

review: Bad service for reservation for 11:30 am.  The driver didn’t show up nor contacted me. I waited over 40 minutes can’t figure out how to contact him or Uber.  I finally I decided to request another trip. Aerial just 8 minutes to get her he was easy to identify. Just a great experience overall with him. I would highly recommend him.
title: Reserved a car last night at but the driver never  showed

review: Request to have a choice to pick and choose who we Uber with. For example, if we have a pleasant experience with an Uber driver or not so pleasant experience with another one. We should choose who we ride with. Or for example choose age ranges or gender. Some people feel more comfortable with different ages or gender. Not to say this to be prejudice but just to have that option would be nice
title: App Update Request

review:
Getting the Excel type car was chaotic. People were everywhere trying to get a ride. We needed a larger car and none were visible.  We had to actively look for a larger one. There were some larger cars parked in the lot with no driver visible. It was real luck that we found Imran parked in the lot and then shared the pin provided by the Uber App. to activate the ride. 

The drive after that was smooth and uneventful. Imran drove well and was very courteous. 

Will use the app again.
title: Chaotic Pickup at Mumbai Airport

review: I was always apprehensive about using Uber.  My wife and I have always been using taxi in all our travels.  It seems that Uber is very widely used in Orlando Florida so we tried the app for the first time.  Just downloaded the app yesterday and so far our experience on our first 3 rides has been great.  Clean cars, polite drivers, and people willing to work, and safe driving.  This has changed our views of Uber.
title: Uber Novice

review:
Mostly I like Uber. 
What I love is that in st pete PIE airport the PaSTA (muni) rate was awesome and same as regular Uber. A great partnership every city should adopt.  What I also love is the sharing of drivers license plate just before pickup. That made me feel extra safe since car was white but black on the app. What could be better: each time I log in it’s a lot of gymnastics, 2-3 texted codes to enter, etc. But with a little patience, it all works out.
title: I like Uber, mostly

review:
I am an Uber driver as well As an Uber customer and let me say I am very thankful. For both!
Always there when I need a ride and always opportunity so I can put money aside. Customer service always friendly and helpful. I feel like I am important to the person on the other line every time. Thank you UBER for ever.
