                                                 Driver/Passenger
                                                 Benjamin Beaumier
title: Great company

review: Recently I haven’t been able to drive to work so I used Uber. They initially quoted me around $18 for the ride. When I got there it cost $33. The next ride said it would be $20. When I got there it was $35. There wasn’t an issue with either ride. They didn’t take longer than they should’ve or take any detours. The app just straight up lied and cost me far more than I was told. When I tried to get in touch with customer support I found the only real “solution” is a bunch of pre-written solutions for problems that I don’t have. Very frustrating
title: Costed Almost Twice As Much As The Quote

review: Uber was great until I ran into an issue where the driver way overcharged me a $150 cleaning fee.  He said the backseat was wet so he accused us of spilling something back there even though none of us brought drinks inside the vehicle, but even if I’m getting blamed for someone else or he is just saying we did so he can get a quick $150, that price seems a little outrageous but anyways I’m trying to dispute the case and all I get is automated responses and no real help at all they don’t have a phone line for riders apparently… hope that Uber driver enjoys that Christmas bonus he gave himself from me.
title: Driver theft

review: I ordered an Uber 4am to drive me to the Orlando Airport.  After driving for about 40 minutes i started seeing familiar signs. We were back to where we started at my hotel. We didn’t get to the airport until 5:15. Needless to say i missed my flight. No flights out until Monday. It ended up costing me over $300 to get home. Very disappointed. I probably won’t use an Uber again. Too expensive!!!!
title: Very costly Uber ride…

review: UI is not intuitive. When you type an address and you click "return" on the keyboard, it doesn't work. You have to click the list option below. When you have put in all your addresses and want to schedule a time, sorry, you gotta go back to home page and start over from another entry point. The food ordering system is buggy, if you ever have to order something with more than 10 options, the app crashes
title: The design is not human, very hard to use

review:
I started using Uber in 2019 and it seemed to be working well for most of the time.  However now you put in an address and it takes you to another address. For example my home address hasn’t changed but Uber now takes me a mile away from my house. I have to always drop a pin and change the address to get home.  It’s the same thing for many rides I take. Always have to drop a pin to get somewhere. 
It’s also shameful that drivers can cancel on you so easily without any repercussions. I’ve had drivers cancel because they saw I had groceries or luggage.
title: Almost always takes me to the wrong address

review:
I thank God for services like Uber and Lift.

However, at times such services can cause stress.   It seems that complaints other than the preset complaints are not permitted.  

For example, how does one complain about the delayed time of arrival after the time has been?  One selects, for example, a $9:67 ride that offers to arrive in 5 minute.  But once selected, the time of arrival changes to 8 minutes.  
Because of this , I once selected a “wait and save ride” that actually arrived sooner than a standard ride; and I saved a dollar.

Or

I select a ride that says will arrive in 1 minute, but I waits for 5 minutes or longer as the “1 minute to arrive” time doesn’t move.

Obviously, rates vary according to time of arrival.  But if I select a ride to pick me up sooner than later and pay for it,  how is it that I get picked up later, but my rate remains the same?

Some fixes are in order.  Wouldn’t you agree?
title: Rider review

review: Uber is famous for adding fees onto rides. I had to go through the app to call my Uber driver as he was driving away from my house because I left something in the car. Uber charged me $15 for calling my Uber driver to return the item although he hadn’t left my neighborhood yet. There is count less other fees Uber will add onto rides unexpectedly. This company values profits over people.
title: Will place last minute fees on rides

review: Uber used to be a really good app but not anymore. I’ve been getting so many Ubers who’s cars doesn’t match the description Uber gives AT ALL!! I don’t like that I feel as though that is a safety issue. Then on top of that EVERY single ride they always alter the charge AFTER which I really don’t like because the charge that’s given at the time I’m purchasing the Uber should be the final charge unless Ive given a tip. Only reason I gave three stars instead of two or one is because the drivers are really really nice.
title: Review

review:
An import part of any product, especially something based on software is availability. Even though I have a 4.88 user rating (even considering the fact that I’m never tardy and tip the drivers), I’ve had cases where drivers repeatedly accept the ride offers and then cancel when they see my destination (usually at an airport, with a 40 mile mostly highway drive for reference). There are penalties if I cancel, but there seem to be none for the drivers when for all intents and purposes, the service leaves you stranded. 

DON’T USE IF YOU ARE ON A TIME CRUNCH AND NEED SOMETHING DEPENDABLE AND AVAILABLE.
title: Bad Service, Bad Dependability

review: I wanted to update my form of payment.   First I used my Platinum AMEX and it didn’t work.   I tried using my Apple Payment, it said it couldn’t be processed.  Then I tried adding my debit card, that didn’t work.  I contacted support.  They didn’t respond until over an hour afterwards.  And they couldn’t fix the issue.  I deleted the app twice and re-installed.  No change!  I followed the direction of their so-called app support and kept saying the same things to fix the problem.  But nothing changed!  I even called AMEX and they said my Account is working properly.  This app and its support are horrible.
title: It doesn’t take any form of payment.

review: I have used Uber a few times to get a ride to a choice of my destination and back home. It’s been pretty good on that point but coming down to ordering food for delivery, it was pretty good except when I ordered pizza for delivery, my pizza putter plastic bag was open and one pizza slice was taken from the box.  I really don’t mind if the driver would ask me before taking 8 extra minutes to deliver the piazza
title: Overall Pretty Good

review: uber has been on a downhill slide. there are never drivers, the map hasn’t been accurate in the last year and a half, and there have been very hostile drivers. i even had one stalk me before i reported them ( i think they still drive). i use uber to get to/from work, and i am always late. even when i schedule, ESPECIALLY when i schedule i get no driver. i live in a college city, there’s an abundance of people needing uber. uber hasn’t payed their employees what they deserve and need, this creating a shortage of drivers. i am so annoyed with this service. lyft is a bit better.
title: awful

review:
Some of the drivers are super nice and go above and beyond for you. There are ones you get that are rude and have poor customer service. 

There are times I was made late to work because there are some drivers that will message you “Sorry I can’t pick you up.” after accepting the ride.

The drivers have no consequence to their actions and us paying riders who are paying astronomical prices are stressed. I ride with Uber almost every day. I just wish the prices were more affordable. Use this app at your risk.
title: Hit or miss app

review: There are a lot of businesses on airport property, FBOs in particular, that are no where near the terminal.  Yet, when you try to  book an Uber from anywhere on airport property it forces you to use the terminal as your pickup location.  This needs to be fixed! I wrote Uber years ago about this and received only canned messages back.  The problem is still there.
title: Airport other than terminal doesn’t work

review: I’m frustrated with Uber right now, prices have gone up since I started using it and they rarely get me to where I need to be on time. Tired of paying 30 bucks (and scheduling almost an hour I’m advance) for them to tell me I’ll arrive 10 min early and then after I’ve ordered it they show the car 25 miles away. That’s ridiculous I live in the SLC area there are plenty of drivers and I don’t understand why they give me cars that have no potential of getting me to where I need to go on time.
title: Grateful and annoyed

review:
Two rides today were heavy with cigarette smell. And I’m a non-smoker and both trips 35-40 minutes. I couldn’t change and take a different vehicle as I had appointments to catch.
.
PLEASE GIVE US AN OPTION TO CHOOSE A NON-SMOKING VEHICLE.
.
Second complaint. No obvious way to provide written feedback, even with the Other option. You’re missing out on millions of data points to help improve your service. And don’t say ‘it is there’. I’m in IT and I didn’t see it. And if I didn’t see it, most people not seeing it either. You can do better. It’s not rocket science.
title: Non-smoking Option and Poor Feedback Feature

review: I’ve had a few problems recently where I needed to cancel my ride. One because the driver asked me to cancel and another because the estimated wait was 7 min when I requested and then 17 minutes when a driver confirmed. Both times I cancelled right away and requested a refund, which I received. There is no option to give feedback that the driver requested the cancellation. There is also no option to provide feedback that the cancellation is due to an inaccurate predicted wait time from the ap (nothing to do with the driver).
title: cancellation feedback options are limited

review:
Uber and Uber Eats has had NUMEROUS issues when it comes to processing payments. Myself, as well as 7 friends of mine have experienced the exact same issue. 

My issue occurred at 2am trying to reserve a ride home. It refused to process my card. It continuously popped up with an error message stating “unable to process payment”. I then proceeded to try 3 different cards. It provided the exact same message each time. I guarantee you all the information I inputted for all cards were 100% accurate. There is consistently large sums of funds in each account. The issue is Uber. 

This has happened to several friends of mine, as stated above. Two of those friends tried to use their cards on Uber Eats. They experienced the same error message, simply trying to order food for their office. 

I deleted this app and only use Lyft now. Don’t waste your time unless you want to risk being stranded 10 miles from your home in the middle of the night.
title: “Unable to process payment”

review: We need more people like Rhoel . As soon as we meet he got off helped me with my luggage . Super friendly . He has a little iPad for us to watch whatever and charge our phones . Super nice and thoughtful guy . My ride was over 2 hours long and we talked the whole way . He is amazing . The real vibe . Smooth ride . Good driver . Such a safe driver.  I wish I would got his contact . Oh and by the way ! His car smells good and is clean .
title: The best

review:
Our driver was known in previous reviews as, “good with conversation”. We, however, were very tired from a full day of travel, and we’re not looking forward to much conversation.

We hinted at that, and our driver was able to pick up the clues that a quiet ride would be best. His black Camry was comfortable and quiet. He was skilled at navigating through pretty bad traffic on I 85 to Alpharetta. I would recommend him to anyone.
title: Perfect!

review:
While I was in Boston, a couple of weeks ago, I sent for an Uber, and it took no less than two hours for an Uber to come!
After that, I decided to order one in advance, which worked out fine. However, now my app will only do reserve an Uber. I cannot just order an Uber now for the present time!
Today’s return trip from 16 Park Pl. to 320 Riverside Dr., took such a long time because they couldn’t find a driver and the driver arrived eight minutes late, and I was overcharged by almost $10.
title: Have too much trouble with Uber App

review: My two small dogs and I had gone out for a walk before it started raining. It was not forecasted to rain. We had waited 45 minutes under a cover and it didn’t look like it was going to stop anytime soon. David was so kind and helped the dogs get into the back. We had a wonderful conversation on the way back to my hotel. Thank you, David, for a wonderful Uber experience.
title: Pouring down rain

review: Because you all charge a price for a ride, tell us how long we set a price for a ride, tell us how long we're going to be there, and when it’s almost at the house you change it that puts me late for work but I paid the same price and I would’ve been on time going to be there and when it’s almost at the house you change it that puts me late for work but I paid the same price and I would’ve been on time
title: Rider

review: Chris I hope you see this review. I can’t thank you enough. You are a beautiful human. As a 49 year old female attending my first music concert in 20 years, I was anxious and nervous. You made us feel so comfortable and safe. To me…that is soooo valuable. Thank you to the moon and back. Safe. That’s the key word. And you’re so sweet and funny and adorable. Your mama raised you right. I hope we cross paths again. I wish you nothing but success.
title: The best driver EVER!!!

review:
Flew into Tampa dead tired. Logged into UBER and ordered a ride.  First driver never came. Second driver drove 200 feet past us in spite of the fact that I indicated we were in wheelchairs. He called me and I asked him to back up and get us. He disconnected the line and drove off. Finally the third driver showed up. By now we have been waiting 30 minutes for a pickup that should have taken 5 minutes. Once on the interstate the third driver started texting and speeding. 

Not very happy with UBER right now!
title: Never been cancelled before

review: ..I started using App Uber in Turkey, my observations on the drivers are that they exploit the passengers by taking more amounts under the pretext of many reasons (the passenger is supposed to ask before walking on the paid or unpaid route) and does not abide by the amount written in the father, for example, he does not have an exchange .... etc. I imagine that These behaviors have a bad effect on you.. Please do not be disturbed by my opinion
title: Uber app

review: We have used Uber many times in the past for getting to and from the airport since we live an hour away from the closest one. The last few times, we have had drivers accept the drive but when they get to us to pick us up, they say “no I can’t go that far” and cancel.  We were told they don’t see the destination. So we wait 10-20 mins for someone to get to us and then they cancel and we have to start over. We missed our flight today because we had FIVE people say yes and all then say no.  We didn’t have time to find someone else to take us and no time to get a rental car
title: Unreliable

review:
I started using Uber because we only have one car now. It was going well , the price stayed the same for the first week , that good right. 
 Ok , now my second week the prices have gone up n I’m don’t see how it why. I was charged for a luxury car when I didn’t ask for one , I asked for a share ride. Well the proud man told me , well this is a luxury car u know, really an Acura RDX, well a hoopty will do for me , it’s ably 3 1/2 miles away. 
 So let’s see how my next week goes. If it goes up , I’m outa here . 
 Thank u
title: Prices keep going up!!

review: Uber driver was ahead of schedule even drove down the road to find me running towards the Uber. Pick up location very gracious and humble young lady. Her driving was very safe and she even had a manual transmission. She could’ve been older than 24 and still you have a drive manual! Kudos I never tip but I definitely did this time. Great driver two thumbs up to Uber. Thanks for the safe trip home.
title: Spring time fun leads to Uber needed

review: Someone needs to explain to me the logic of when a rider calls for a driver, and thirty seconds in if the rider wants to cancel they are sometimes forced a charge of $5 or more. But when a rider calls for a driver and the wait time is is close to thirty minutes, the rider will wait for the rider to be only five minutes away and then either the driver finds a more convenient ride or the app reassigns a driver because it recognizes how long the rider has been waiting and the newly assigned driver is now an additional ten plus minutes away. And there is absolutely no compensation for the rider. Tell me how that’s fair for the rider, the paying customer.
title: This app is a scam

review: I came to a different country for 3 months for vacation and tried to cancel my Uber one subscription while I was away since I can't use it here. BUT THERE IS NO “END MY SUBSCRIPTION” button and I am left with $ 9.99 charges each month without even being able to use the app or cancel it. I don't know if I am able to get a refund for it after I return to the US or what to do. I tried deleting the account, I tried to contact customer support but was unsuccessful and “HELP” option won't even work. This is so frustrating and I am just left without a solution. I can't use my US phone number and I don't know what to do.
title: I CANT EVEN CANCEL UBER ONE

review: After flying into Sydney AU, I scheduled an Uber pickup to take my wife and I to the hotel. We were instructed to proceed to the ride share lot for pickup. We arrived about 3 minutes before our scheduled pickup time. After waiting for approximately 30 minutes and watching numerous other Uber customers arrive and leave, I discovered that our ride had been cancelled. I rescheduled another pickup which went smoothly as the driver was on time and new where to go to pick us up. When checking my bill I saw l had been charged a $10 cancellation fee as a no show. Obviously I was not happy since the driver had been the no show.
title: Missed pickup

review:
Being an Uber customer for the last couple years, I write this review in the hopes of improvement with Customer Service in my area. 

I currently reside in Holland, Massachusetts, 0152. To my dissatisfaction, It is virtually nearly impossible to get an Uber driver to pick me up from my residence and bring me to my place of work or anywhere therefrom. If there’s anyway possible for this to be reviewed and improved it would be to the greatest satisfaction and appreciation of the customers that reside in that area. 

Thank you very much for any concern and or assistance of this Customer review
title: Disappointed Uber customer

review: This driver was very kind and understanding as we accidentally got into Wei g Toyota Sienna at ANC airport. The other driver took us all the way to Spenard before I realized something was wrong. The other driver brought us back to airport (also kindly) and as we were getting out of the wrong vehicle, our first driver’s fare showed up in our correct car so we both got into wrong car. We swapped and all was well.
title: Got into wrong white Toyota Sienna at airport

review:
My car is in the shop, so took an Uber over 50miles to work. Used the pre-book option for the first time. My driver was punctual, and just an absolute pleasure to ride with. I have to say, I have never had a negative experience. In fact, normally I meet the most interesting, professional, and kind people. 
Car troubles are stressful, but I am truly grateful for the ease and affordability of Uber!
title: Always a pleasure!

review: My Uber to Newark is always around $20-$30. Everytime I try to get one at 7:20 for school they bump the prices up to $40-$50. They took Uber points off so I cannot request half off or even 1 free ride. I’ve been taking Uber for 6 years I got up to platinum yet they cannot even help people out with prices. Ridiculous. Always burning holes in peoples wallet. Uber needs to change its pricing.
title: Bullsh’t better off with Lyft.

review: Uber is doing really well for me except schedule trips…. Early morning trips to the airport need to be able to be scheduled and you need to allow drivers to accept them the night before and if they don’t show up, you don’t them or cancel them from being a driver and then use your current system as a backup maybe. I don’t know the answer but I have to use other services because of it.
title: Scheduled trips need much work

review: While I have always liked Uber I have found recently that their surge pricing and algorithms are basically price gauging.  It used to be no more than $40 to ride from Seattle airport to Bellevue and now I am being quoted over $72.  So I am now taking a fixed rate taxi which is only $50. That is the service I will use in the future until uber eliminates their price gauging alogrhythims.
title: Uber getting too expensive

review:
Uber blows lyft away for faster service and their drivers are much more professional friendly and courteous!  Uber rocks!!  Also, I love the professional delivery service. If I have a document that needs to be signed in person and fast I can count on Uber and their drivers to professionally deliver and complete the task at hand.  No more unsigned and late documents. 
Thank you Uber for your vast, professional service.
title: SPEEDY SERVICE

review: I have used uber for about a year as my car likes to have sleep overs at the shop she is high maintenance and everytime i call uber they are there within minutes and i am always in a hurry and all the drivers have been very nice and respectful thank you uber for getting me to my destinations when i’m having problems with my car
title: my car is always in the shop

review: Best app for ride services and far superior to its competitors in geo-locating and in any area where cellular service may be limited. Also love that Uber doesn't make you wait for a credit or refund if you are searching for a ride and may have to cancel unlike its competitors. After more than 1,000 miles with Uber, I have to say it's been a great journey everywhere I've traveled!
title: Superior Service in Every Way

review: We were in town for 1 night staying by the airport. We decided to go to the Sabres game but didn’t have any idea where to arrange the pickup. A police officer gave us a location but when we got to the point they weren’t allowing cars in. Jeffrey our Uber driver was patient, guided us to a point where he waited for us and got us out quick. Friendly conversation and a good ride to the hotel. Very good job Jeffrey.
title: A Real Trooper

review: Idky but on the app it makes my home address 2 blocks down the street. It has been doing that recently because before I haven’t had any issues with it. So something is wrong with the location service on this app!!! I’ve had to cancel several Ubers because they refused to come to my actual location and only wanted to follow the GPS!!
title: Location

review: With several great drivers along the way it’s still not much to right home about. Prices change arbitrarily and drivers can and will cancel your ride after making you wait but when they do it they don’t have to pay us the same fee. No matter how long we are made to wait or how we are inconvenienced. If there were other ways to get around to handle my affairs I would not go through the hassle even though majority of my drivers have deserved the maximum stars.
title: Overall

review: I used to drive for Uber and it seemed like a quality app. However, the rider side has gone the way of every app and company out there. You can’t actually talk to people on the phone regarding customer service. They say they have 24/7 customer service assistance but that’s false. It just filling out tickets and then Folks getting back to you IF they get back to you.
title: Customer Service

review: Customer service has become awful it’s been impossible to reach my driver in customer service it used to be very easy to use you can’t even call Uber anymore and talk to a real person this is becoming very frustrating drivers are always friendly and helpful it’s customer service of app and when you lose a item
title: Poor Customer care

review:
After getting screwed by DART GOPASS I decided to jump ship and call my 1st ever Uber ride. When signing up for a ride I was told to verify the and make sure that the car and tag matched info given to me. Driver called and said he’d be in a completely different car and tag. I asked how do I know you’re not a killer? He texted back I find that highly insulting! I’m cancelleng as your driver! I’m 
I felt so bad I paid for his time anyway…..not. 
Ain’t no way I’m jumping in a car with a man who identity Is completely different. 2nd driver was wonderful and his car was clean. And smelled good (His car ok? His car!)
title: Not sure

review: It’s sad when I am in Laughlin, Nevada I can use Uber because there is no rides available to me which is very inconvenient because everything is so spread out and people without a car or don’t drive makes it harder like me. I use to love in la and used it to go a lot of places and now I see no point in even having the app if there is not even any drivers. It’s sad that they can big cities but not a small town. Taxi’s are expensive out here so it’s not an option and the bus out here is not as reliable as you may think. You should get more drivers for small areas like mine so it can help more people out.
title: Not able to use

review: Generally, my experience with Uber has been excellent, but I have one problem. When I’ve requested a ride in the past, the driver will accept the ride before they were even done dropping off the person in their car. They would take a route when they were in the middle of one, and I think that the app should be fixed in that drivers should only be allowed to take one ride at a time.
title: Generally good, but…

review: My driver never showed up. I had a 5:30p pick up in North Myrtle Beach. My text from Uber said it would be there between 5:30 and 5:40pm. We got to the pick up location at 5:25p ( 8 women!)We stood on the correct corner !  I got a text a 5:36p saying my ride was canceled because we were not there. We were most definitely there… and there early!  I got a notification from my uber driver, Davis, at 5:36p. Stating trip canceled and an ~8.50 additional charge!! For not being there😳!  I don’t want frggin uber credit to my account. I want a refund to my card for extra amount you had absolutely not right to charge me for to begin with. !!!!
title: Crappy company

review: I like Uber in all but when it comes to the morning time I really dislike using the app because instead of giving you someone closer in your area they give you drivers that 25 minute from you which causes people to be late to there destinations and we done been paid all that money to be late y’all really need to fix that because the drop off time be so inaccurate for real so it’s like your lying just to get us to book it.
title: High fares and makes me late literally every other morning

review: Driver was very much in our business. All we needed was the obvious… A ride on St Patricks Day (night). Way to pushy and after finding him on Instagram, we saw that he should of put his family first rather than leaving his young daughter in charge of an even younger son at night just to Uber. Take a look at your employees alittle more. For a guy that filed bankruptcy years ago, married and divorced multiple times, has many children (half of which don’t even talk to him, yes we found this out while riding) seems a bit much. Unstable. Will not be riding with this person anymore. Dave Mangual Raleigh, NC Black Nissan SUV ride and I am a female rider. App was fine, but driver was not.
title: Raleigh, NC

review: Uber is “offering” a service that will now allow you reserve rides in advance. DO NOT USE THIS FEATURE unless you want to be completely hosed. I reserved a ride to take me to the airport on the busiest travel day of the year, only to have the ride cancel on me 10 minutes after the scheduled pick up time. The next closest ride was a half hour away and double the cost of what I had reserved. Uber sent me a $10 apology credit as if that would help in any way, and there is no way to even contact customer service through their app to help. What an absolute joke. Thankfully Lyft was able to get us within minutes.
title: Reserve a ride is a scam.

review:
If you’ve never used Uber before don’t start now. 
I’ve used this app a lot to get around and even have travelled long distances with it. I haven’t had many issues until I tried taking a trip from an airport at night.  When I first checked the price in baggage claim the price was almost $50 cheaper and when I could actually request the ride the price had jumped! “Surge pricing” is fine when it’s fair and the airport is busy, but this was price gouging. 

I’ve been trying to submit appeals for the rate with no luck… this has put a terrible feeling behind this app and I will likely no longer support it.
title: Frequent Uber User

review: The app will show a ride $5 bucks, but update to like $20 right before you book. In smaller cities, it’s takes 30-40 minutes just for an uber to get to you & the prices are double what they’d be in a larger metroplex. Uber should do better at recruiting drivers in smaller cities. It like $40 just go 10 minutes up the street in some small cities. That’s ridiculous.
title: Misleading at Times

review: I don’t know what happened to Uber to be this poorly managed. I’ve set a trip at 3:40 pm and my driver didn’t even care and was going the opposite direction of my location. He was late 30 mins from the agreed time and I missed my class. He didn’t even show up I had to cancel my trip to find a serious driver. Uber should give me a free ride or something but nah they charged me a cancellation fee. Even though he was late 30 mins and wasn’t even heading to me. This is terrible. Like how you even don’t have a system that charge your drivers when they pass the deadline of the planed trip! Won’t use it ever again
title: Lyft is better and cheaper

review:
Ok so I’m giving this a 4 bc I haven’t used the app but you really need to fix this problem,when I was putting in my phone number of    Someone has had my number before me to ig they had this app but I moved on to the next step and it said”welcome back ANA” my name ISNT Ana so I thought it was a mistake so I asked to reset the password and to the reset password and I was an email that wasn’t mine so I’m uninstalling this app after this review is. 
 Posted
title: I haven’t even got to use the app

review: I have used the Uber app for a few years at this point and when it suddenly started requesting that I photo verify that I have a mask on I thought it was just a policy change but as I encountered friends and even drivers who were unaware of this practice I became disgusted with Uber. I don’t like taking photos of myself, generally I avoid using Face ID technology altogether so I was not to happy about the request but when I found out family and friends who also use the app have never been asked to do so I realized I was being singled out by the app. I will be deleting this app and refusing to use it from now on.
title: Photo request discrimination

review: Starting from the way to complain. I had to come to this space in the AppStore to report that not only the system of Uber is terrible in Mexico also is so bad that the App does not have an option to report a bad feature of Uber. So in short Uber allows the drivers to accept rides before any driver had finished their current/last service. This results in a waste of time for we the users who pays for Uber to exist. Our time is more important that your way to run algorithms for your drivers. I will change for other service shortly.
title: So bad service from Uber

review: I’ve been using Uber for quite a while now. Used to be super easy to order a ride in advance, but now you have to try eight or nine times because everytime you confirm your ride, it will give you an error message, or change your pickup location. I’m not the only one who has had this experience: my sister deleted the entire app off her phone because of how frustrating it is to use. I rely on Uber to take me to work and their most basic functionality doesn’t even work properly. Use at your own discretion
title: App is hard to use lately

review:
I’ve been using Uber for about 4 months now for this new job due to Covid and Uber has been ringing my pockets dry! No matter the rewards that one may get while using Uber, it still rounds back up to the typical price amount before you would apply the rewards to a ride. And the timing as well. I have put in for a ride numerous of times and it’ll give me a 10 minute wait time then it’ll become a 20 minute wait. This is horrible. Better off using Lyft.

Again today I requested a trip at no later than 8:10AM. The time set to get to work from that ride was 8:43. It is now 8:49am when I will make it there🤦🏾‍♀️ this is ridiculous. And again I used the rewards lol
title: Inconsistency

review:
Obied stationed near the Metro station while having a coffee so time between I click request and actual arrival is 55 seconds. 

So in return I asked for a small detour, actually shorter distance, and introduced him an almost hidden small shopping plaza that have a convenience store and a pizza place.

Car is exceptionally clean, ride is smooth, nothing but praises, he represents Uber in the best possible way.
title: Excellent service

review: I’ve used Uber for about three years now, since switching from the Lyft app because that app sucked. I never have to worry about ridiculous prices and drivers constantly switching when they saw my location. The drivers are exceptionally good at their drop offs and delivery services. Also love using the Uber driver app because it’s a great side hustle if you live in a busy city! Thanks Uber!
title: Amazing Service!!!🤩🤩

review: Uber Eats continues to charge my account for Uber Eats that was never delivered to my client back on June 23, 2023. When I called Uber Eats there was response was “it is too late.” The Uber Eats experience was embarrassing and irritating, so I disputed the charge with American Express. I won the dispute, American Express refused to pay for services that were never rendered, and I thought it was over. Nope! Went to get an Uber ride two days ago on September 23 with a different credit card and Uber Eats charged the full cost for the Uber Eats that was never delivered 3 months earlier on June 23. Uber Eats lost a customer, and Uber has lost a customer!
title: Uber keeps charging my account… endless fight

review:
I have been using Uber service twice a month for several months. My experience has always been great. The cars are usually clean and the drivers have always been very polite. I very much appreciate this service because I do not drive. I no longer have to bother family members to run errands or for doctor appointments as Uber is always fast and convenient. 

For me, Uber s a godsend.💜👵🏼💜
title: MY UBER EXPERIENCE

review: As an Uber driver, this was my first experience with Uber as a passenger. I ordered an Uber XL to accommodate up to six. The car only had four seats, the same as the car I drive for normal UberX (not XL) not set up for more than four. Although the car was a Cherokee, with more rear legroom and room for luggage, etc., I was expecting UberXL to have an extra row of seats. Maybe my expectations were unrealistic, as I did not have extra time to review, or rather preview my options.
title: Extra expectations from UberXL?

review: I used to use Uber for work everyday because it’s 10 minutes from my house, this usually cost me $15 but recently it’s been raised to $20 and that’s IF someone even comes to pick me up… I work at MGM one of the most popular places in the city there is no reason the 10 Ubers drivers within 5 mins of me won’t pick me up. And on TOP of that I’ve received fraudulent charges from Uber which I’ve had to take up with my bank, I was contacted by Uber customer service about it but was ghosted when I replied. Used to be reliable, not so much now. Go with Lyft.
title: Getting unreliable

review:
Charges users for order transactions that are not completed. In app notification indicates order canceled by Uber Support only for a receipt and charge to appear the next morning. In app notification then changes to indicate that I’d be charged. Transaction settles 2-3 business days later which is only way to see if transaction was canceled or not given the conflicting notifications. 
This timeframe is beyond the 48 hours Uber offers to support a failed order from when it’s made. It is one thing to fail to deliver. It is another to fraudulently change app notifications and transaction history to support a charge.
title: Uber

review:
My driver was very nice but he was not a fluent English speaker. This posed a problem when I was dropped off at the wrong terminal at the airport, and had to be shuttled (with three suitcases in tow) to the correct terminal. 
Needless to say, I was annoyed because I told him on several occasions that I needed to go to terminal A. I was told terminal A was closed ( (in very broken English) and that terminal C was being used instead.  This was not the case.
title: Driver was not fluent in English

review: I’ve used Uber for quite a while, and their service is good. The reason for this not great review is the awful push notifications that I keep getting from both Uber and Uber Eats! I’ve tried opting out of their sales notifications multiple times, and yet I still get them. I’ve had to block ALL notifications from these apps, which means now I can’t get notified about important order info or shared ride info. If they fix it 5 stars, if not I’m using Lyft.
title: Good, except for the pushy sales notifications

review: in terms of providing the uber pickup experience the app and UX is fantastic, 5 stars. however, they cram promotions and ads during that experience which i find quite annoying especially since that money Uber is making isn’t passed down to the consumer cause the rates for Uber drives are a lot more expensive now. Need an “opt out” of these annoying ads and promos. fine, bill me an extra 5% higher rate to opt out
title: great app but too many adds & promos

review: When I first started using Uber and UberEats, it was fine. But I got the UberOne subscription expecting it to be better, since it claims to pick the “top rated drivers.” However, since getting the subscription, these “top-rated drivers” have only been getting worse. I’ve had times when I’ve waited over 20 min for drivers that were 3-5 min away (they wouldn’t move from that location). I’ve had drivers not know where they were going so I had to get off early to just walk the leftover miles. To call these top-rates drivers? Do better.
title: Mediocre

review: I feel that it’s unfair that the Uber drivers pull up away from your house and then you look out the window and they’re not there but they’re up the street and then you get charge extra and I feel that it’s unfair that the Uber drivers don’t be having a car cleaned all the time and you guys charge us extra money but we don’t get anything when you guys are doing a great job on your behalf but we have to pay when something doesn’t benefit you guys. How does that work so when something doesn’t benefit us should we be able to get something out of that? I feel that we need to fix that.
title: Unfair

review: The first driver I requested kept going around in circles on the way to pick me up from what I saw on the app when it was tracking the Uber’s location. Right when it was about to turn on my block, it would just pass by and go around and further away every time. I swear I thought he was driving drunk or high. I canceled it and requested a new Uber, who was on time and gave me excellent service, though I arrived late to my event because of that first mishap. I would say Uber, you’re a hit or miss.
title: Had to cancel first Uber

review: Uber has gotten to a point that they raise they price to an unreasonable amount and then they don’t pass that money onto the drivers resulting in sooo many drivers canceling once they see that the ride is longer than 10-12 minutes.  This has become a huge problem when trying to make it to the airport on time when you wait 5-10 minutes just for an Uber to accept to have them cancel and have to wait all over again. Uber really needs to work on paying their drivers better so it stops hurting the passengers (customer) and the business as a whole.
title: Was INCREDIBLE.. now who knows.

review: A couple of times the driver makes unnecessary turns following his GPS, when my destination is literally following the pattern of an L, from my home. My head is down in my phone, and he’s starts to turn right. And he shows me where the GPS is directing him. It has happened at least 3 times, a different driver each time. And it was not redirecting us because of any issues happening in real time. It’s very scary when your driver starts taking detours on your trip, whether accidental or not 😡
title: Please Update Your GPS

review: I don't usually take the time to review apps but I was so pleasantly surprised today. Ordered an uber and it said payment failed, there was fraud activity on my card so the bank blocked it. I sighed in utter frustration and then got a message from uber that said, "you are a loyal customer so accept this ride on us!" My heart leapt for joy!! Thank you Uber so much, I truly appreciated this ❤️🙏🏾
title: Uber gave me a free ride when my payment was declined

review: I have a important package that i need tonight because im traveling and was mess up with other uber because my friend confused the Uber car, but Vincent was above and beyond with his service and was patient and wait until the package was return to be able to delivered to me!!! Im happy this service and I would recommend this service and Vincent 100%. Thanks for the service again!!!
title: Outstanding service by Vincent

review: If we could give double the stars to Sabrina we would so! She was very friendly from the moment we met her. After traveling the better part of the day, just to see her warm and welcoming smile, made our trip better! She is an excellent driver! Someone pulled out right in front of her and her very quick response avoided an accident. Thank you so much Sabrina! It was an absolute pleasure meeting you!
title: Wonderful!!

review: Yemur, I hope I got the name right was great. He showed up actually a little early which was great when I was going to the airport. Very nice and social. His Toyota was emasculated, very clean and roomy. Dropped me off right where I was suppose to be and relieved me of the stress of getting to the airport early in the morning even helping with where to go. I would recommend this driver anytime and will be using him again. Thank you very much.
title: Awsome

review: Every week it is more difficult to find a driver, the waiting time for finding a driver increases every time!  For example, yesterday morning (7am) ​​I request the Uber to get to the point I needed (2.4mi away) in addition to the fact that my waiting time was 20 minutes, the amount of the trip cost me $20 (remember, the distance from point to point 2,4 mi).  P.C. I found out from many people who works in Uber, what their salary is and how much they receive from each trip ... Now I understand why there are fewer and fewer drivers, because many simply will not work for this money!
title: The Uber company is heading towards its end!

review:
I was at the Phoenix airport and you canceled my Uber four times before I was able to get this driver. Within a five minute period you changed my rate from approximately $26 to $43. That is utterly criminal. Unless I absolutely am stuck, I will avoid using your company simply because of what you did to me last night.

Samuel was a delight. The only good part of your company. Because of what you did to me you should really credit me back $20. $43 to just go a few miles because you canceled on me. This is just extremely unethical. And since I am here for a conference, I will make sure to tell everybody that I know about my experience.
title: Rip off

review: A company like Uber should have a better way of resolving issues pertaining to their drivers. The communication between the guest & the driver should be easier. I left my phone in my Uber last week & I reached out to Uber (no call option, only the auto replies from the computers) telling me the same thing I heard all day long. Only for the driver to steal my phone. No one could tell me if he was talking other guests or anything. He just kept ignoring their messages…. I ended up getting s new phone the next day. The whole experience was horrible.
title: Bad customer service

review: Initially I was hesitant to try Uber due to early negative press about “ safety concerns “ but my friend convinced me to try them & I'm glad I did.  I’ve had GREAT drivers so far  & it’s saved me time & expense over taking a taxi.  Just had BEAU take me from my friends home to the RENO airport & he showed up within 6 minutes, helped me with my bags, got me to the airport in record time & was very personable.  I am now an UBER FAN!  THANK YOU for the time saving GREAT SERVICE😄👍👍👍
title: I ❤️UBER!

review: As long as I’ve been using Uber, I noticed actually PAYING for a subscription does nothing to give you a discount. After I subscribed my first trip was $6 more than without subscribing. I had Uber cash they refused to apply to my trip and after hounding them for an explanation, they claimed they couldn’t SEE the trip I was referring to. And also took AWAY my Uber cash to make it seem like I was wrong. During the holiday game where you had to collect full coke bottles. Truly a joke of customer service   and the perfect example of who not to trust your money with. Good luck. Unsubscribed and won’t be throwing my money away on scammers.
title: All About Profit

review:
I’m in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. Many drivers are terrible. If you don’t pay them cash , they cancel the trip ahead in the app.   It’s happened so many times when long trips are requested. 

Most cars are in the worst condition ever. Don’t have back  seatbelts , all dirty , and even worse , drivers keep using their cell phones on the other hand when driving.  Very stressful. 

The worst part is , that situations with “Burundanga “ have been the  issue lately. I don’t let my kids ride in Uber. 

Some drivers start hitting in girls asking pernicious questions making them feel uncomfortable. 

Don’t think this is good …. Drivers and their cars are not screened out. At first , I was written that all drivers and their cars go  through a very thorough inspection but not. It cannot really be the truth.
title: One common person using Uber very often but not anymore.

review: There should be capacity to contact; not necessarily to reprimand driver; nor, due to complaints; have capability to leave review of ride/driver. Yes, I’ve service dog, I wasn’t denied ride instead, listening to complaints and/or unsubstantiated fears. For example, one was adamant scratch his leather seats, did NOT scratch it; driver complained UBER should’ve stated, there’s an animal riding, duration less than 3 mi; next, complaining entire length of ride (22 mi) and it’s stressful ride, fur did shed. Other rides been fairly positive experience.
title: Disabled Rider

review: It’s nice to know thatUber can see your payment history and will let you ride without a credit card in case something happens. Really appreciated the feature this morning and would have been clutch in case I was traveling and had to report my saved credit card as missing.
title: Bank cancelled credit card but able to ride

review:
App scams / deceives you into enrolling in Uber one and then used your payment info for rides. Then, when you go to cancel it - surprise, no cancel option. Then when you go to remove your card info, surprise - now you’re enrolled for an annual subscription.  Then when you contact customer support, surprise - no one is there to help and the app closes your request.
I’ve now been able to delete my payment info, contest the charge with my credit card company and will be deleting the app.  
Such a shame, I’ve been a rider for several years and this shady business means I’ll never be a customer again.
title: Uber One scam

review:
My husband uses Uber since his car was totaled.  He is 83 yrs and has Parkinson’s.
We have found the drivers to be courteous and professional- many even going beyond to hold door open for him.
They drive safely and always arrive as expected.  I don’t know how difficult the job is as I’ve never done it, but congratulations to all the drivers - they kept my husband going to gym every day👍
title: Surprise of Uber

review: This app sooo irritating man like when we late to get in our ride they be soo quick to charge us yet i will literally call a Uber a whole hour before I have to go to work that is literally a 10 minutes away and I’m still late because they literally waitt all day to find a driver then when they find a driver they already be completing trips so I have to wait longer then they take they sweet time 😒 now sometimes I get good drivers but yall need to better manage yall app ah something cause ain’t no way
title: Decent

review: Dallas: uber has gotten so bad. only reason i keep it because of points and even then it takes an eternity for you to get anything for them. drivers are just any person with any car, absolutely no standards, feels really unsafe and unprofessional at times. drivers have gotten very comfy cancelling out of the blue for no real reason. had a driver accept a ride, show up late, then tell us he’s not taking us to our destination when we got in the car. overall just very poor business. pricing is hit or miss. other companies do it a lot better.
title: gone so downhill

review: I don’t know if it’s because Uber doesn’t pay their drivers a living wage or they don’t vet their drivers well enough. You are better off walking to your destination in New Orleans. There are never enough drivers and the few they have left are clearly not the best. The app used to be reliable and the drivers would always show up shortly. Recently this has been the opposite. There are never any drivers available and the prices have increased to a ridiculous amount considering you will have a late and incompetent driver. This app has gotten worse and worse by the day. It’s essentially comparable to Lyft now.
title: Uber New Orleans

review: If you need help with a wheelchair, scooter, walker or anything else, you better look elsewhere. Uber has launched a war against disabled users by claiming they are not a transportation service. You can look up the case from the DOJ online. Too many of us are left behind due to outright refusal of service by drivers. I have a list of cancellations in my app after I try to give them a heads up of my needs. This company is not ADA friendly and does not deserve your business. *Please don’t reply to my comment Uber staff, you haven’t been helpful resolving my last case of an ADA violation and anything you say is just PR tactics to save face.
title: Avoid due to ADA violations

review: I lost my Apple Watch in one of my Ubers in a different state and there is no way for me to get in contact with the driver. I tried using the online “help” services where it says “lost an item” but it does not work. Not only did it NOT connect me back with the driver I never got a call back. It is absolutely ridiculous that there is no way to retrieve something when it was accidentally left in someone’s car. I got a ride to the airport with a friend using their Uber app. I’m leaving the state and I have no way to get my stuff back. There should be a better way when something like this happens.
title: lost item and no help to retrieve

review: Have been using Uber for work going on a few months now. The drivers are so so, most of the time the drivers arrive on time or close to on time, but the app itself is very inconsistent and sometimes completely wrong. The times stated for pickup/ drop off are almost always wrong, there are even times where the driver is "on the way" and after waiting for most of the "estimated time" the app decides to switch to another driver much farther away, resulting in wasted time for the same price. Overall the times stated for pickup are very unreliable. Would not recommend as a reliable source for transportation.
title: Inconsistent

review: Uber needs a lot of improvement. First of all it’s obvious that uber needs more drivers. But also quality drivers. Some of my most recent rides have been with incompetent drivers , either reckless driving or smelly cars. Uber probably needs a better pay raise and more thorough background checks . I am grateful for Uber,  but is there room for improvement ?? Absolutely yes!!
title: Long waits. Unreasonable charges

review: Scheduled an hour before I needed to arrive. And I ended up getting a driver who was 40min away that wouldn’t ARRIVE until the time that I needed to be dropped off at. So it’s like if I can get a ride and wait 10-15min to get picked up and arrive within 10min of my arrival time. Why would/should I schedule a ride an hour in advance just to show up 30min late of when I was actually supposed to arrive? Doesn’t make sense to me. Not to mention you pay more to schedule a ride in advance!
title: Schedule rides could use work

review: I was wrongly charged over $230 for a ride I never took years ago. They never cleared the charge even though my bank reimbursed me my money back that same week. I stopped using Uber because of it. When they bought out Postmates, my accounts became connected to Uber and now I can’t use Postmates because of the previous charge - and even more money down the drain because I subscribed to a prepaid Postmates membership for a year. I contacted Uber Support and they said they would get it fixed “as quickly as possible”. It’s been a whole two months and not a single word from them.
title: Charge hasn’t been cleared for years

review: I was a past Uber fan. But it has become very common to get your trip canceled by the driver we’ll into the wait. Tonight, 25 minutes wasted by 2 cancellations. And this happens regardless of where we try to use Uber. As a customer, cancelling a ride comes with a penalty (as it should).  Apparently, drivers can dump a fare whenever something more convenient comes along.
title: Drivers cancel WAY too frequently

review: After confirming my $20 dollar trip, I get in the Uber to see that my prices has changed to $300 dollars as soon as I put my foot inside. After asking our driver to see his phone screen to see what his end looks like from a drivers/company perspective, i learned a driver is unable to see how much we are charged as customers and how much they are paid each trip in correlation. In short, the driver would only to be paid the 12 dollars and change for the trip, and Uber was to take the 200+.  I had to cancel my trip, which of course they charged me for. Absolutely shameful. Boycott necessary.
title: A shameful company—must boycott

review:
I won’t write a poem long comment. 
It’s simple, if you are not a driver but the actual customer, only customer support that you can get is a chat option - How it works ? you write a message and if you will get lucky during the 24 hour time period you will get a response - helpful? if you were overcharged for the trip for no reason, the response will be really similar to the following: 
- “... the charge amount for the requested trip info is correct. Thank you,”
I personally will not die without $100 that I was charges extra, but I will not give that for free either. 
Thank you, no Thank you.
title: One star is a lot for Uber

review: When it comes to ordering a cab it works you can contact customer service no problem and also get a refund pretty easily but when it comes to everything else on the Uber app it is extremely difficult to get in contact with customer service and for some reason in order to be able to contact uber you either have to sign in via your web browser or download the app to contact customer service which makes no sense for Uber eats specifically
title: Give too many options and not even Features

review: I accidentally left my phone in the Uber when I got out at the airport.  It had fallen under the driver’s seat.  I was able to reach Randy through the app once I was home and he immediately checked for it, found it, and mailed it to me.  What a great guy and great service.  The app made it easy to connect with my driver and he made it easy to get my phone back.  I am very appreciative of both Randy and Uber!
title: Randy’s trip

review: I scheduled a ride to the airport as I was in a major city and it seemed weird that it was about $20 more than when I left the airport from the exact same address. When I looked at my receipt I was charged about $15 in “booking” and “reservation” fees on top of the base fare, and since I called an Uber when I got to the airport the first time I wasn’t charged those. I wasn’t informed about these beforehand and these little to no information about what these are. Complete crap, Uber’s just trying to make money off of us regardless of distance or location.
title: Zero transparency

review:
I been using Uber for 4 years and it definitely got me places but they will tell you a ride will be there in 4 mins before calling the ride and then it ends up being 8 mins making me late to work sometimes, Uber needs to work on being truthful when it comes to requesting rides 
I also had an issue with a driver charging me $16 because I took 5 mins in the hairstore when I requested him as a 2- STOP RIDE and HE WENT IN WITH ME ! Uber is good but they will just take money from you, never save your card information on there, NEVER.
title: It’s reliable but it’s very misleading

review:
Needed to get to airport.  Took way too long to sort out ANY ride, then it was rerouted within 3 blocks of me so now waited AGAIN for next nearest ride.  I was in Hyde Park, Chicago on an easy to get to street n well travelled roads in N/S & E/W.  Expressway not far either, all to say I was not in some isolated hard to find/hard to get to location. Thankfully driver drove fairly fast (safely- as fast as other traffic) as long as he could.  Too bad for me traffic got tight getting me to airport with no time to spare.

Routing algorithm needs some refinement.
title: Rerouting

review: Uber stands behind their drivers before they stand behind riders. They provide guidance on how drivers rate passengers but they don’t have published guidance for riders. For example being in wrong location or slamming their door the driver could rate the rider lower than a 5. If you don’t get a perfect driver/car consider this when rating them. Such as loud music, disco/laser lights, a cracked windshield, loose floor mats or the driver being on the phone the entire trip. These things have indeed happened during my rides.
title: Driver ratings by riders not well defined

review: Mr Nigel helped us find the place we needed to be to board a bus, we was given the wrong address and he didn’t wanna leave us alone in the wrong spot. He helped us get to our right destination on time because we were stranded overnight in Orlando and needed to get to Ft Lauderdale, we boarded the bus are we’re in route to our Vacation spot, Thanks again for helping us on the right path, Have a Blessed Day
title: He went beyond and above

review: My adult sons car was out of commission and he was without his wallet or phone. I used the app to get him picked up. Cheryl made to pickup and stayed in touch with me during the trip. She advised me how to add stops so he could get things he needed. She waited on him at the stops and got him where he needed to be. She let him call me with his phone to coordinate. It was like having your best friend doing you a big favor!
title: Saved the day!!!

review: 99% of time I have nothing but thumbs up for the Uber app. I have experienced issues with the user friendly app. Currently the language is not my preferred language and to add insult to injury I do not have the menu bar in the upper left corner of the app. I’d like to be able to make changes to my profile in the app with the same ease the app charges my credit card.
title: 5stars most of the time

review: This was truly the best service that I could have ever imagined. I’ve never used Uber before and frankly was exceedingly nervous. But Douglas needs to get *****, because he made the ride enjoyable and reassuring that I was safe. Douglas, in a world where there is major insanity,  I just want to say that I so appreciate you and because of you I’ll most definitely use Uber transportation services again. God bless you, yours and ours.
title: First Time Ever

review:
Went through all the right steps to set up when I was at home. I go to use it this morning in Riyadh and I get treated like a criminal by your company. I understand the importance of security. At same time it was daunting to have to give that information all over again. Besides why would you say my device is different etc?
I finally figured it out via email sign in ( would be nice if you had humans to help on a phone),finally got myself back to hotel
Now you are going to torture me with trying to find a nickname that hasn’t been used
title: New to Uber

review: For past 2 weeks the Uber Cash toggle is turned on automatically. Default should be to off. I do not use the wallet. It is a pain to remember to toggle it off every use. I have tried to change it in settings and it is not available as a setting. I have paid drivers with Mpesa and then the next time I use the app I am told I did not pay and will be charged for the last trip. Very annoying update. Please change this.
title: Please allow uber cash default to off in settings

review:
Most of the cars are dirty. All the drivers ask where you will go! I use another no. This no I kept close for UBER! So sad to see how carelessly they are performing in Dhaka. I just came back from Singapore yesterday. 4 days we use GRAB! What a beautiful, painless, sympathetic service. Definitely price was high. Unfortunately , when they started Uber in Dhaka, we all expected  a wonder service. But Alas! The way the driver talks, the speed they give, so sad. 
Once I was in X! The driver an arrogant youngster stopped another car  in the highway irrespective of asking him not to do that!
It seems no monitoring. Even it happens like that- driver came, I was waiting on the road, asked me if I’m gonna pay in cash or Bkash! I said bkash , he went away. 
In Dhaka 90 % cars are dirty & drivers are reckless!
40-50% arrogant
Less than 5% are good chauffeurs. 
Drivers need to be trained to improve their attitude, quality &  need to be monitored vigorously.
title: Uber!!!

review: The most stupid support and service I have ever met , the first thing they answer very long , the second , they charge AFTER TRIP the money EXTRA  !!! Without to make you know , you just find it like a surprise! That from your account was taking money … explaining like it was traffic , bad roads ( like is the clients fault cuz of bad roads or tips for drivers 😂, even it wasn’t like this , is crazy really , never heard about it before , I was one the bests clients , cuz I take very often taxi , pity that they don’t care about clients , but good that they are other many applications , with a better rating of the service , don’t recommend it !!!
title: Scam

review: It  took me more than 20 min to find a car and that was unusual for  me. When I finally did. I texted Alan and told him that I was very close to boarding . He took care of my emergence with the agency it required and we made it safely. I made it and almost missed the flight. If he had not taken  me seriously by 3 min I would have been stuck in the airport till noon for a 5:30 flight.
title: Above and Beyond

review: On the way to the airport, we heard over the radio that a major accident would cause at least a 45- minute delay, putting me at risk with my flight. My driver calmly explained that he already had a plan for swooping around the mess and getting me to the airport on time!  I was so relieved. I’ve had some taxi drivers in years past who would have just sat there and said there was nothing to do. Great guy!
title: Great driver

review: My wife and I had never used Uber, but we decided, since we were in a big city and totally lost, we would try.  What a great experience-our driver, Ammar, was at our doorstep in less than 5 minutes and was very helpful and informative.  The car was clean, the ride was smooth and the conversation was friendly. Sold on continuing our relationship with UBER.
title: First Time User and Very Pleased

review: As a First-Time User, overall, I’ve had a pretty decent experience. The App notified us when the Driver arrived. The Driver arrived earlier than expected. Initially, the driver wasn’t at the exact pick-up location. However, after contacting him, we were promptly picked up, a few moments later. The Driver goes by the name, Kingsley. He’s pretty professional. The vehicle is clean. If it wasn’t for the slight confusion at the beginning, he would’ve gotten five stars.
title: First Time Experience

review: The new Terminal A at Newark Airport makes taking Uber easy with minimal wait time and quick escape from the Airport. My driver as usual was professional and courteous. Why would you ever wait for your wife again to pick you up, get caught in traffic and not know where to go, when you can get home without any arguments before your wife would be pulling out of your driveway???
title: The best way to travel.

review: Incredible all the things he did to make sure we arrived to Breckenridge from Denver airport safe. We also had a van of my family following us, and in the middle of a storm Carlos lead us to our stay in Breck, always with an incredible disposition to help. Its incredible how you can consider someone a friend because their personality and kindness is rare. All the family is grateful!
title: Carlos my uber drives saved our trip

review: Recently I was convinced by an Uber driver to allow him to cancel my trip claiming he wanted to help me out considering I was disabled and on a fixed income. Unaware of how Uber worked and being new to using Uber I did. He took advantage of me and left my original trip going and took my cash so he was double paid for my ride. Then last night the driver could not make it in time and even now shows I’m still searching for a driver she canceled my ride and claimed, according to the very nice Uber driver I just had, that she proceeded with my trip I thought I canceled and was paid $20 for a trip I never got
title: Being taken advantage of by Uber drivers

review:
I finally learned that when reserving a ride, you can’t make Any changes. I tend to use a Reservation when the trip is related to work and I can’t take a chance upon a driver not being available in my area. But this doesn’t mean I don’t need flexibility as well. 
This ride today was very good and my driver was very flexible concerning the route to my destination. Uber noted the extra mileage in the fare price, which was helpful.
title: App needs clarity about Reserving a Ride

review: The app works fine to get around major US cities, but the wait times are often 3-5 minutes off, which is a problem when you’re in the middle of winter in Chicago, freezing while waiting outside. The arrival times for transportation from the airport are also consistently off (app will show 3-5 minutes and change to 10-16 as soon as you book a ride). I travel frequently for work and do not want to wait 15 min for a 30-40 min ride—if I knew the actual wait time, I’d often opt for a taxi. Uber needs to work on this or it’s going to lose business customers.
title: Displayed Wait Times Significantly Off

review: I keep having this same issue where I try to order an Uber right before work and no one in the area wants to pick up my ride. A regulation on cancelation of rides would greatly help the rider experience. If we’re trying to get to work it doesn’t help having to wait 15 minutes extra just to find a ride because the drivers don’t want to accept the ride. That’s their job that’s what they are getting paid for is their service. I’ve seen plenty of drivers to it while I was in the car with them. Please regulate your employees or whatever Uber calls them to not give them benefits.
title: Driver cancelations

review:
I used Uber in the UK with UK phone number. Since I was now using my US number I needed to change the number. Since Uber has no customer service number I had to use Chat. I am in my 70s & technically challenged. I asked chat how to change the number and they were unable to tell me even though the fix was simple. Finally I got hold of my son & he told me what to do. Terrible customer service. 
I have other issues with the app taking my money in foreign currency & then another country not being available. 
Uber has replaced taxis for the better. The drivers are Great. But Uber as Corporate entity is very poor
title: Uber is cheap & horrible

review: I reached out because the driver had left 2 or 3 minutes before with my purse in the back seat of his car. This was my trip from Oakland  airport to 5325 Miles Ave. The drivers name is Jiawei. I tried to call but couldn’t reach him. You said you would send him a message. 14 hours later, there has been no communication from either Uber or the driver. Shortly after I reported the lost item, I found out that one of my credit cards had been used fraudulently. There had been attempted uses of two other cards. I know I am responsible for having left my purse behind but I don’t think Uber has made any effort to help.
title: Lost item

review: I have ridden in Arizona are used to take an Uber every night to the casino down the street with mine service animal and they never giving me a problem. They’re also very nice to me. I love you Uber most the time that you aguys have a little heart everybody does. Thank you. Also been taking you to the doctors for quite a few years. Thank you to my insurance. Thank you.
title: 2006  I have been with Uber

review: I am getting frustrated with Uber drivers canceling within minutes before arrival. More than once, I have had THREE drivers canceling after making me waiting more than 5 mins per driver. I have missed appointments and be late for work (I reserved these rides 20 mins in advance and ended up late because of drivers canceling on me). I think driver should PAY us if they decide to cancel after making us wait if we have to pay them if we cancel. Fair is fair!
title: Driver should pay the passenger cancellation fee

review: I’ve always appreciated how Uber listens to concerns and responds accordingly.  I’ve used Uber in several countries over the years and decided while in the UK recently that the service there was not the best.  Not sure why, but it might be worth looking into.  Otherwise I’ve found Uber to be reliable and competitive in its pricing.  Most of the drivers have been decent, polite and helpful.
title: Typically have good experience!!

review: Yesterday evening I reserved an Uber for 6am this morning. I immediately received a message that Uber was looking for a driver. Every half hour I looked to see if Uber assigned a driver. The next morning at 4am, I checked to see if Uber assigned a driver, but one had not been assigned. I needed to check into the airport 3 hours early, and if I did not take an Uber I would have had to take mass transit from Queens, NY to Newark Liberty International Airport. Luckily, at the last minute I canceled my request, applied for a Uber and someone finally came.
title: Reserved Uber Never Confirmed or Assigned

review: Drivers are rude and disrespectful sometimes even petty. Sometimes they act like they don’t want to work. U pay Uber for comfort and don’t even get comfort. They will be on the phone while you are trying to ask them a question and you end up being ignored. Sometimes when they accept a ride then will wait till they are close to you then cancel the ride. I do not recommend if you use Uber for work even if that leave an hour and a half early at that.
title: Expected better

review: Truth is Uber and Uber eats are not good at all. They treat customers like crap and look for reasons to make it to wear their policy’s are satisfactory to themselves. They’re rude to customers and do not look at anything to even try to protect the common interests. I have taken down both of the Uber apps and will stick with Lyft and door dash since they are good to me. Unlike Uber.
title: It would be one star if the Uber eats screwed you over in your food

review:
Uber has the no way to connect with customer service through chat, email or phone. When you have an issue that doesn’t fall within their preselected issues there’s no one available to help you. 

I had an issue with my drop off and location. After submitting a claim through the app I received a generic response that there was no issue and it had been resolved. 

There needs to be a way to elevate these issues to an actual person and their needs to resolutions that actually help the customer.
title: No Customer Support

review:
Needed a ride home. App worked a few days earlier. Opened the app and was greeted with a message that I needed to update the app. Inconvenient but opened the App Store and tried to download a newer version. Got a message that they no longer supported my version of iOS (14.1) and I wasn’t going to be downloading a 4Gb iOS update just to catch a ride, so I downloaded Lyft, set up an account, and was good to go.

Moral of the story: If you consider yourself a “tech” company either design your apps to be resilient enough to work on models more that 18 months old or warn users ahead of time that they will need to update their app soon
title: Switched to Lyft Due to Forced Update

review: Uber is very Expensive, I thought that by not having a Car I could still get around with uber but I was very WRONG. $15 dollars one way for places that are 10 minutes away or so. There’s no posible way for a regular working person to commute to work using UBER. They need to figure out a way to slip cost or share with other people to cut down the cost of the ride. To summarize: If you DONT HAVE A CAR YOU WONT GO ANYWHERE, every weekend trip comes with $100 price tag including the things that your going to do while you are out.
title: You get to your Destination but with your wallet EMPTY

review: The people on this app aren’t as good as they say they are , this app is supposed to get you to the places you need to be within a good time frame . One thing I don’t like is how the drivers can just cancel a ride anytime they feel like it , if your two minutes away from the destination I need to be picked up at & I pay for you to come get me , why would you cancel it and give me a ride that’s 25 minutes away? If that’s the case I would’ve walked to where I needed to be . It’s very frustrating & 15$ just to go down the street that’s a five minute DRIVE ?! & no wonder people think Lyft is a better app .
title: Horrible app

review: The driver cancelled the ride and I was still charged. I’m not able to rate them because supposedly nothing happened. I should be able to rate anyone that charges me a fee even if it’s a cancellation fee. I had a very important doctors appointment. I was coming downstairs with a double stroller and my kids. The Uber driver was there less than 5 minutes before he left. I recommend using Lyft or another service besides Uber. I will rate the driver on Yelp since Uber can’t do its job. I should be able to rate the driver on Yelp and there should be a count that shows how many times the driver cancels the ride.
title: Drivers who Cancel Rides Should be Rated

review: Do not expect to be able to count on this app. Very unstable and, for me, gets frozen in the map mode with no way out but to delete and redownload it to be able to use the app. Then, it often schedules rides without confirming with the user causing you to cancel the ride many times after just trying to check the price of a ride. If you are going to use this app, I would also suggest downloading Lyft right next to it as it can be difficult to redownload an app while you are away from home.
title: Be careful with this service

review: Reliable ride, but could you give us more control to the users because I know that drivers have the power to choose us, you could give us control to choose the uber that we want, sometimes it has happened to me that it doesn’t find me and the driver cancel to me and when I give to return to  using uber is the same person who don’t knows where my address is, is frustrating😨
title: Good

review: I’ve had issues with settling my payments with uber twice now and not to be rude but it’s quiet irritating. The first time I had to go through a very long process to get it figured out and all they did was give me uber cash which in some cases isn’t very helpful. Secondly they charged my card yet say I haven’t payed for it on the app. With this inconvenience I have no customer service to call and figure it out with. Also none of the help options cover my issue on helping me get this dispute covered. I use uber very often so this unfortunately upsets me very much.
title: Payments

review: I requested a ride a day in advance for my family and I to take us to an airboat ride while we were in Orlando.  The driver called and said he was on his way, which he was already late.  I looked back at the app and it said the ride was cancelled. There was no way to request another ride as we were already late. Fortunately my brother was at the same hotel and lent us his rental car, otherwise we would have lost our money for the airboat ride.  I tried to call the driver but was blocked, and I to contact customer service but was also unable.  There’s no way to get in touch with anyone on this app.
title: Horrible app, Uber is horrible.

review: Usually very easy to use but today I selected my destination, confirmed booking, without price and when I click confirm after agreeing to wear a mask, I got, “Oops, something went wrong. Looks like this vehicle is no longer available.” But I was never assigned a vehicle, so I’m confused. I have repeated the process over and over and updated the app hoping that it was a glitch. It is a glitch but the update doesn’t address this.
title: Is something wrong with the app?

review: The prices are way too high. It charges me over 60 bucks just to go to work and my job is not even 20 minutes away , they are taking granted of people who don't have cars I’m already struggling as it is how do they expect you to tip after paying a ridiculous price , getting In touch with a Uber customer service person is so hard the only thing they have is button after button , is this how you show you value your customers. I have been using this app for over 3 years but I have had enough. TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSE WHERE .
title: Convenient BUT...

review: Even as someone with platinum services I still get written off by the support line.
