Half the time my evidence isn’t even checked I just get an automated message, also they don’t even have good options for getting support. You just kind of have to click around and hope something even comes close to your problem. I’ve sent multiple screenshots to prove that I have not taken a ride and they just wrote me off and threatened me with denial of service because they don’t want to look at my screenshots or anything. This app and it’s delivery service have been shoddy at best for the years I’ve tried to work with it. It’s just not getting better
title: No support
developerResponse: {'id': 15359451, 'body': 'Hi, the trip fare and dynamic pricing are subjective to demand and supply in the area at the time. It constantly changes with the rise/fall in either factor. However, we would like to take a closer look into this for you. Please send us a note regarding this at t.uber.com/contact and we will do the needful.\r\n     ', 'modified': '2020-05-16T16:00:28Z'}

review: The delivery service on Uber for food compared to other competitors such as DoorDash has surpassed it fully being more convenient and priced accordingly. This being said this is to my area only but the rides are decent waiting time differ during the morning but overall the app is a good 8.5/10. I rate it a 5 for the pricing and service offered Uber has a great way of catching the customer.
title: Great Serviced Offered

review:
You had my home address when I called for an Uber ride
Then I was told to walk to a location nearby which was difficult as I had to cross an extremely busy intersection 
I was given an address which I did not know where to go for the pickup 
I am 89 years old and expect to be picked up at my home location ( Ridley Howard Ct Decatur). It was disappointing for me and stressful to walk to a pickup place. 
Lilian Bryan
title: GPS
developerResponse: {'id': 9003995, 'body': "Hi, sorry to know about the issue with the driver. We'd like to help. Please send in a note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.", 'modified': '2019-06-04T10:03:56Z'}

review: South Florida is notorious for its bad drivers, and I’ve witnessed some horrendous “skills” on the road. And here is Saintyl, just moved to South Florida 6 months ago, and I drives like he’s lived here all his life. He not only knows and understands how to navigate through heavy traffic but he also knows his car and it’s power. Saintyl got me to the airport in record time, without driving like a maniac. Hats off buddy, keep up the great work.
title: Great ride on time

review: I keep getting late to work because of this app, I’ll get a driver maybe 5-6 minutes away and then they cancel. Here’s the thing though, sometimes I’ll get the same driver more than one, maybe 2-3 times max and they will just cancel the ride, but then they cancel or they’re gonna be sitting there for 10 minutes not moving. Funnily enough this exact thing is happening right now too, I’m late for work again because I had the same driver cancel on me and the other drivers I get have a longer than 10 minute wait for my workplace that isn’t within walking distance.
title: I KEEP GETTING LATE TO WORK

review: Last night I requested a ride from the airport to home. Per the app, I waited at Door #2. When the app showed the vehicle arriving, I received a message from the driver that he was not proceeding to pickup area, instead I should meet him at the rental car area. When I replied that I did not know where that was and was waiting at the assigned spot, he canceled my ride! As an older, single woman traveling alone I was not comfortable leaving the assigned and well lit door area, per an unknown, male driver’s direction. Now, today I get charged $5.00+ for his inconvenience and cannot find a way to dispute this charge! I am shocked at this rip off! Never again!!
title: Rip off

review:
Nathan was not only on time but early. Also my bags were outside of the door breezeway. He had already loaded them and was waiting patiently. He was professional and kind and represented your company. Amazingly !! I have not used Uber in two years. Nathan made a  poistive difference in my day and coming back to Uber as a client!  Because of 
Nathan ! And his customer service ! He put joy in a stressful day !  Thank u Nathan 👍
title: Nathan

review:
We were late for our show we spent hundreds of dollars on tickets and because of Uber we were late. The first driver blew us off did not answer his phone. The second driver blew us off. Do not answer his phone.
The third driver answered his phone picked us up, but at this time it was too late already. We ended up getting to our show late.
Our first pick up time gave us 40 minutes to go just over a mile. This trip from the Venetian to planet Hollywood has made me question the reliability of Uber if there is any compensation for these mistakes that were made, I’d like to hear about them.
title: From the Venetian to planet Hollywood

review:
They put algorithms in place, in the app, to get us for every penny possible. Say It gets them an extra 20 cents per ride, and no one complains, because who has time to argue the 20 cents difference right? You have to go in the app and complain that you were overcharged, and the app lets you have it back. It’s petty in the small picture, but for Uber it adds up to millions of dollars! It’s not right, and without us, you’d have nothing! So show some appreciation Uber smh
Thanks!
title: Sorry No appreciation for members just money

review: My first ride with Uber was great. I matched the license plate number and driver’s photo before I entered the car.  I was out of town and unfamiliar with my surroundings. The driver had the GPS directions playing through the car speakers which made me comfortable in knowing I was headed in the right direction. It was easy transportation for me, a senior citizen     I still like being independent and riding with Uber helped me keep my independence.
title: Senior Citizens

review:
My original ride was Cancelled. Which upset me and within two minutes I got my new ride.

Sometimes good things come out of things that can get you angry. This was the most amazing ride. An amazing driver. He was kind, professional, Car was beautiful and clean. He knew what he was doing and where he was going. Thank you so much for making my ride the best I’ve ever had in an Uber. You rocked!
title: Amazing!!!

review: Your business is clearly focused on saving money and not customer support your call center isn't in the US and isn't even for riders. It takes forever to get ahold of someone after your (specialized rider team) is supposed to send a email and when it does arrive you cant even reply back when the email does not fix the problem. Why does the uber account deactivate for no reason with no way to activate without jumping over a bunch of hurdles? No one to call for that problem also. Cutting your own expenses making other peoples lives more difficult sounds about right.
title: Horrible support

review: Driver was quiet and drove smoothly. His driving style was conservative: a couple of aggressive drivers cut in front or “challenged” him and he merely slowed a bit and made us feel safe. Everything was smooth and he left large margins when lane changing. 3 minutes out, we asked for a slightly different drop off point which he cheerfully and smoothly handled. Keyword: professional.
title: Tacoma to Renton, Professional Ride

review: Enjoyed him because he have a very interesting conversation and once we got to my home it was raining so hard that after he drove in my driveway; he drove back out and backup closer to the house that gave me a chance to leave the car without getting wet. I felt my tip was not enough. Suggestion change it and give us a chance to do more for superior service given. Brown leader
title: Evening driver Elmer

review:
I waited 10 minutes for my uber. Michael, dark red Toyota Suv. I saw him when he dropped off other customer, 1 minute away-he spoke (had to stop at the stop sign) and said he would be right back. He was on the opposite side of the street and as i proceeded to cross, he said wait one second- i stepped back on the curb, he pulled off and didn’t come back. I then had to wait an additional 15 minutes for my good driver. I spent almost 30 minutes simply waiting to get a ride less the 2 miles away. Thanks for out late graduation dinner.
My actual driver was kind, and courteous. Cash tip well deserved!
title: First driver Looked me in my face and pulled off

review:
Andrew is a great Uber driver! Probably my best Uber experience ever.  He was considerate, respectful, and I felt really safe and comfortable. 
A lot of people, including friends I have ridden with, drive too fast or too close to other cars, but Andrew didn't; I felt really comfortable. I wish my son drove that well...It was a bit harrowing driving around Denver the last few days on my trip. Thanks, Uber and Andrew!!
title: My Uber experience with Andrew

review: I use Uber often because I need to go long distances and for the most part I always manage to find a ride. I just get frustrated that we can’t rate the drivers that cancel within 2 minute distance from you because I feel like if you are given the information before hand then you shouldn’t click accept. And it would be fair to riders that are inconvenienced by these type of drivers.
title: I’m my opinion

review: After Covid, I experienced less than desirable drivers so I quit using Uber. Their cars were filthy. The drivers were less than “adequate “. Today my beautiful 66 Mustang “died” on me while visiting Walt’s Hitching Post for dinner.  I was forced to call Uber for a ride home.  Robert was there so quickly.  He was most gracious and thoughtful driver I’ve had in a long time.  I was so impressed I gave him a most generous cash tip. One word to Uber: Please keep awesome drivers with nice cars
title: First time in a long time

review: The prior driver was supposed to pick us up and we were in a hurry to get to the airport, running late and he was across the street signaling to us it look like he was asking us to put on mask which we started to reach for air bags and we looked up and he just turned away and canceled our pick up. It took him about 10 seconds to make that decision without even clearly notify us his request or verifying that we were able to do you do it or not very disappointing
title: Driver canceled pick up

review: Lost my keys on July 4th. Tried contacting my driver and Uber “Customer Service” 10+ times and they always had to start from the beginning when I did. Had to re-explain what happened. They would give me the same run around. The driver never contacted me back. Uber never contacted me back. Just an all in all terrible experience. Uber needs to do a better job communicating with their drivers and holding them to a certain standard. They also need to be more easily accessible to their customer base. Not just communicating through an instant chat. I will only use Uber if Lyft is unavailable.
title: Terrible customer support

review: Eyuel went above and beyond!!! My husband left his phone on the back seat and this wonderful man noticed it after he dropped us off. When he stopped after dropping us off from our trip from the airport, he turned around and brought it back to our house!! Wow!  He deserves a 100% review!! On top of that, car was beautifully clean and the pickup, ride and drop off seamless!! THANK YOU!
title: Above and beyond!!!

review: Where do I begin? Colin was by far the best driver I have ever had. From the time he picked me up until the time he dropped me off he was the most professional and respectful person. I wish he could always be my driver. You company should be proud to have him and I hope to get him again in the future. He has a great personality and his knowledge of the area is spectacular. Five Stars to Colin !!!
title: Outstanding

review: Good service like always but i hate the driver’s that one’s they see how far is the trip they are able to cancel it doesn’t matter if is close or far they are doing a job I think they should get fine or suspended if they cancel the trip please fix this issue i have to wait extra 12 minutes because the first driver cancel the trip
title: Good service

review: Be extremely careful when ordering a cab to get a cheaper rate because what they don’t mention is that unlike Lyft that send you a driver within your wait time, UBER does not. They make you wait the expected time which is understandable but after your 10 minute wait is up you may have to wait additional up to another 5-7 once they assign you a driver. So in total you are actually paying to wait more than 15 minutes at times, give or take. All this just to save a $1 or 2. NOT WORTH IT AND TOTALLY MISLEADING ON TIME.
title: Misleading and not worth it, in wait and save

review: Juan was scheduled to pick me up at a scheduled location and time.  If there, I would have gotten to work on time.  Instead the map showed Juan 14 minutes away.  I called repeated times getting g no response.  I texted with no response.  I looked to cancel but was threatened a huge fee if cancelling at that time. I then got a text from UBER letting me know that Juan had cancelled and s new driver was assigned.  This half hour delay caused me yo be half hour late.  I fully tipped the new driver because he was courteous and his vehicle clean and comfortable.  Overall disappointed with this experience and the lack of access to immediate help on the APP and elsewhere.
title: Made Me Late

review: I’ve not used a ride share since I was in the military back in ‘97 and it was a local taxi. This new technology is amazing. Picked up in less than five minutes and cost was way better than a traditional taxi service. My driver was Salem. His car was clean and he was very professional. Thank you Uber, this was my first but certainly not the last time utilizing Uber. Thank you, 10/10.
title: 1st time Uber

review: I love the options for different “luxury” but I refuse to pay 15$ to get a ride less than 3 miles up the road! My phone service is 30$ and lasts me a whole month not a 10 minute car ride for 15$!! I don’t have the convenience of paying someone gas money I’m trying to save for a vehicle but end up spending more money getting to and from work than I make! It’s so stupid and inconvenient to be wasting so much money when the money doesn’t even go to the drivers! Uber takes all the money and barely pays their drivers it’s a rip off
title: Overpriced/overrated

review: It’s -9 degrees outside, Uber said to be at location 5-H.  I waited for a while, and decided to walk to location 5-G since it looked like a car was waiting. No license plate on the front (new car), and back plate had snow covering it.  Sure enough it was my car. Let her know she was at the wrong location, and that I couldn’t see the plates.  If using a new car, they should require the plate number and drivers name posted on the windshield so we know it’s our car, and for us to keep safe.
title: Need to have car license plates visible

review: I had been waiting on a local cab company for 4 hours.  When I finally got the Uber app installed, the Uber driver was at the hospital in 8 minutes.  We had to fine tune information about the pickup location but it only took a minute or two.  The car was nice, the driver professional, and the cost a pleasant surprise.  I’ve been recommending to friends and relatives.
title: Recommend !!!!

review:
I have used Uber many times and have been happy with the results.

But I have a problem since the app won’t go into night mode.  I’ml putting this here since I don’t see a way of contacting customer support.  To turn on night mode in the app I am supposed to go to profile and tgen find app settings.  But the app settings don’t show up on the latest version.  My iphone is set up for dark mode but the Uber app disregards that.
title: App night mode disapeared

review:
Uber is good if you DONT MIND BEING LATE

but I hate how it tells you an Uber is a certain minutes away and when you pay for it the time gets longer. Please don’t tell us where a car is and use an estimate like Lyft so because I don’t need to be late because y’all want to be lying saying that they are 8 minutes away and when they decline it it goes from 8 minutes to 15 minutes people have places to go 

Other than that it’s an okay app
title: Lying about being picked up at a certain time

review:
While this is a good way to find a ride, Uber has become a master at deceiving users. Today, the markup for a ride that I normally pay $13 or $14 for was $30. After we go in the car my wife checked the app on her phone and price was back down to the normal price. On top of that, it suggested that it suggested a percentage tip.

On my previous ride, the driver told me that he switched to Uber from driving a taxi because more people were using it. However, most of the money goes to Uber as they set the price they pay for the driver and they keep part of the tip.

These ar things you don’t hear about.
title: Uber rips off the unsuspecting
developerResponse: {'id': 32667220, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-10-19T11:34:10Z'}

review: The new Ride scheduling doesn’t make any sense I have to schedule a ride 30 minutes before I would like to leave but when I do it 30 minutes exactly it tells me I have to do it 30 minutes or more and if I schedule it for 31 minutes you triple the price of the Uber that makes absolutely no sense. why even let people schedule a ride if you’re going to give them the absolute most expensive price for scheduling a ride vs if I get the ride on the spot it’s three times as cheaper. please fix that because that makes absolutely no sense this whole 30 minute scheduling thing is useless
title: Uber scheduling

review: I have recurring problems with this app in New York City when I try booking a ride after exiting Penn Station. It selects a pickup point for me and does not let me change it. Not only that, but it requires me to walk a block or two away from the station. I don’t know my away around that area and I haven’t the time to figure it out once I’ve confirmed the ride. The last time this happened, I ended up walking the polar opposite of the pickup spot and the driver cancelled on me. I ended up being thirteen minutes late to an important commitment. This is a majorly unacceptable inconvenience that must stop.
title: Poor functionality and canceling drivers.

review:
My 5 year old child and I were stranded at night in a foreign country and Uber stopped working! I cannot request a ride. It was so difficult to contact customer service in the app and there is no phone number to call. I had to change my phone number in the app to the local number and after one ride kept asking me to verify my card again and again. 

After that I could no longer request any rides and the email response was that I was using it fraudulently and irregular use. How is that fraudulent or irregular when I travel to a different country I need to change the phone number? 

They told me they will not reinstate my account and I can no longer use Uber. They did not provide any phone number to speak to anyone and respond with cookie-cutter responses

The app has so many bugs and glitches and it was no fault of mine. Why are the customers being punished for their technical issues?
title: Zero customer support

review: I cannot figure out what the issue is and apparently no one can: Up until today I have used Uber, but suddenly now that I am hundreds of miles away from home and I need a ride to the airport in the morning my payment keeps failing saying my payment method is invalid and I need to update my payment methods. Except nothing has changed. I don’t have new cards, my funds are sufficient, I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app. I’ve taken all of my cards off and re-entered them. And Uber wants to tell me to check with my financial institutions. So today I switched to Lyft. No problems with my payment there 🤷🏽‍♀️
title: Payment Error

review:
Dear Uber.

My payment methods do not have insufficient funds. I find it very upsetting that there is a bug when it comes to tipping my driver. Not only did I have to repeatedly try to use the same payment method and checked my bank account, but the app won’t allow me to input a new payment method. I wanted to give you 5 stars because the drivers and service has been sufficient. However, because this tipping bug has blocked me from reserving any more rides, I will have to delete the app and use a different service in the future.
title: Please process payments

review:
Uber had become an app I can use to get to work…. Sometimes.

There will be times where there are no drivers at all and the app will be searching for 10 minutes with no success. I have drivers in my area telling me that people don’t want to drive because of the payment they receive. But, I have been super grateful for the ability to get to work because of this! So thank you for coming to my city :)
title: It Has Its Moments

review: I use Uber every morning to get to work and it’s like I’m gambling. The app will tell my there’s a ride 3 minutes away and then when you book it’s 6 mins away and then 2 minutes later it reroutes me with someone else who is completing a ride near by and since it’s more convenient for the driver the consumer who is US has to wait. So there goes me being late for work…. Again at no fault to my own. This is ridiculous. I have now switched to calling a car service and using cash because honestly I can’t play this game with Uber anymore
title: Disappointing

review:
So annoying.   I use Uber all the time. But I hate it recently because Uber eats interferes with and pops up after each ride. I do not want to buy food!!! I just need to get from point A to B. That is all. I can’t even close Uber Eats. I have to reboot my phone to use Uber again. Can’t even complain about it on the uber app- no more humans anymore. 

Why did they add uber eats on the uber rides app? There is a separate uber eats app. If I want food I will use it.  I hate the uber app now. It’s just annoying and useless. It does not work!! 

Going to use Lyft I guess.
title: Why is uber eats interfering on the uber app?

review: My Uber account was hacked by an Uber driver. I had to cancel all my credit cards and debit card. I have no access to any money until I get new cards in 5 days. Uber has been zero help, offered nothing for my terrible inconvenience. No free rides and they won’t  even give me back my Uber points that I earned. I used them to ride to work every day. They do not value their customers at all. Their response to my problem has been cold and They just keep sending me robotic form reply’s.  This is the worst company  ever.  Meanwhile there is a driver out there scamming riders and they’re doing nothing about it.
title: Worst / nonexistent customer service

review: Every time I have tried to use this app there are many errors. Finding a ride proves difficult with long wait times and constant changing prices. It will find you a ride at a certain price have you wait 10 minutes then say your ride price has gone up if you want to get a ride you need to pay more. This app is so unreliable! It tells you you’ve found a ride and they are on the way the driver gets close then cancels or when it is time to get picked up the ride glitches.
title: Unreliable!!! This app has gone down the drain!

review:
The app did not show tip that I had already included, and no email receipt that included tip. I went back to tip and it doubled the tip. Please fix. I’m running my disabled brother Dr, store, dentist, etc and can’t afford double tips.

6 months later, app still doesn’t work right. The app asks for a tip, after i have tipped, wondering “did the driver get the tip”?  Due the quality of this app, they received 2 tips.
title: Issue with Uber App
developerResponse: {'id': 14299168, 'body': "Hi, we're sorry to hear that you've had an issue wherein the app charged your tip twice. We would like to take a closer look into this for you. Please send us a note regarding this at t.uber.com/contact and we will do the needful.    ", 'modified': '2020-03-28T09:15:31Z'}

review:
Before the pandemic Uber was great. Now it is all about the money. I get they probably took a big hit during the pandemic. But a ride from Ohare to Chicago is $62 when Lyft is just charging $53. 

Also if you want to try to save money and plan ahead that service is also terrible. I had a driver arrive early when I scheduled. Just for them to cancel and take 20 minutes to find me another drive. In a major city getting a car should never take that long. 

The one other time I’ve used Uber recently it costed me and $60 for a 2 mile trip.
title: Going down hill

review: I have been using Uber a lot for the past year or so and it has been good at times but most of the time it is very unreliable in the pricing because price spike up randomly and without warning which makes find a ride at times impossible, if you could even find one because when the prices are atleast a little reasonable my ride never gets taken and I have to wait for someone to accept my ride long than it would have taken for me to get where I’m going, it is just a dice roll whether you’ll get a good experience or a bad one, and mine have been mostly bad ones.
title: Unreliable and inconvenient

review:
I don’t understand how these drivers can charge for wait time and you’re outside before they reach. You contact the company and they claim they understand and apologize but don’t reimburse you. What kind of foolishness is that?!?!?!

Update: Thus wait time foolishness is still going on and on top of it they claim to give you a price and then when your trip is over that price goes up $1 or more with the wait time when you’re outside before the car and they don’t want to give you the original price that you saw and no changes were made during the trip. It’s the same pick up and drop off location. Uber company are some real scammers.
title: Wait time

review: I have had Uber downloaded for a while now and every single time I’ve needed a ride the app stalls out and I have to try requesting a ride several times before having to delete the app and redownload it. I always start requesting my rides 45mins before I have to be somewhere and every single time I have been late to work though my place of work is not even a 5 minute drive from my house, standing outside for 30 minutes because my ride that was 22 mins away 40mins ago is now 35mins away and has sent me a text saying “sry. Trafic” it took my driver an hour and 15 minutes to reach me for a 6 minute trip before. Will be switching to Lyft.
title: Horrible.

review: One of the best laidback drivers that I can possibly ever have. Looking forward to having this guys again…hopefully, in the near future. I had a lot of other guys that were my drivers in the past and most of them I didn’t like for many reasons, but Farhan, you better stay with the company. Hope to see you soon! Thank you…I appreciate you, sir. Take care!
title: Top Drivers-Farhan

review:
The app took a while till it started working and it took another several minutes till I was able to book my appointment. 
After fining a driver who was 8 minutes away, both the distance and ETA of the driver did not change for 10 minutes. I texted the driver, but didn’t hear back from the driver. 
It turned out neither the driver and my Uber app were working. 
It seems like Uber is having a technical problem  over a week. 
Uber needs to notify customers and updates drivers with those issues and when it will be fixed approximately.
title: Uber app is not working.

review: Uber rocks in Cabo San Lucas. They pick up with in minutes and are always kind and courteous. It is super cheap to ride Uber here and then you can bless your drivers with a good tip. A cash tip is best. It is much better than the taxi service because if you have the Uber app and a card on file, you get the best exchange rate. Don’t have to sit there and boggle your head about how much to pay in pesos or dollars! Happy traveling!
title: Uber rocks

review: A rental valet service provided by Uber?! Dream come true. But it might just be a dream. Got halfway thru the reservation process in the Uber app (Uber partners with Avis), but would not let me complete the booking process (Avis web views in the Uber app) - got a weird error and could never get past it with multiple attempts. However my Avis app does have my reservation but Uber has been unable to confirm they will in fact valet deliver the car. - Multiple chats with a resolution that I’ve been handed off to a “specialized team” and an email is imminent. Nada. In theory seems like a great idea. Guess I’ll wait to see if a car shows up.
title: Uber Valet - To be or not to be

review: It’s good but waaaay too often the driver accepts your ride then their car doesn’t even move and they’ll just leave you hanging until you cancel then you get charged a fee and they get paid for doing nothing. Even if you state that’s why.  The Uber help button always just goes to a loading screen that never loads.  This year I’ve been charged probably $40 in canceled rides because they never came to get me and that makes me late for work often.  Then those drivers you can’t even give them a bad review because they never showed up
title: Nice when the driver actually shows up

review:
It was my very first time ever use Uber services. Just dropped my car off at Tesla store then couldn’t get back home so I asked the service rep how can I get Uber? Was told to download the Uber app and schedule for Uber to pick me up so I did. Just 3 minutes later one of the car pulled in I saw the license plate umber matched the one on the app so hopped on it. She said hi how are you? The driver was very friendly and kind. I enjoy the ride. Love it. 
Wanna give 👍👍
Thanks. 
First time Uber user
title: Riding Uber

review: Waited over 10 minutes for Uber to “finalize my ride”. When I finally got a ride after waiting and rerequesting multiple times, I asked the driver if there was an issue with Uber today. She let me know that she was only getting $12 for the trip even though I was paying Uber $25! Because of that, many drivers had refused the ride before she finally accepted. It’s unfair for Uber to take more than 50% when the driver is providing the car and their time. It’s also an inconvenience to me. I never had to wait so long in the taxi line back in the day…
title: Uber pays too little for me to get a ride quickly

review:
The one trouble with the phone app is it seems to have an exact order to enter information, but no indication of that fact on the first screen that opens.

If you simply swap a pick up address first with one other than your home, with your home being changed to the final destination, on the first screen that opens, the time set is for immediately, and I could not find an easy way to change it.

Seems if home is not the pickup point, time of pick up is the first thing you have to set, but it’s not on the first screen that appears?
Clumsy….. confusing

My PU location has terrible Internet reception, even calls from there are dicey, so I made the reservation while at home.
title: Time

review:
We depend on Uber and Uber has been great except recently when a driver forced my son, a young African American male who had just had knee surgery, to get out of her car- after she picked him up and had driven almost a half mile away from his pick up location- his home. 

She asked him how old he was and he was honest and told her 17.  And she told him to get out.

On top of that she reported him and he’s been blocked from using Uber and Uber Eats.  There should be a better policy in place that allows parental approval of rides or something rather than putting a kid out on the street, on a cane, without a way to get back home.  

Happy to help formulate a better and safer procedure.  Fortunately my son was able to make it back home safe but not without pain and suffering during the walk.   But the next child may not be so lucky.
title: Uber is great but not to minors

review: Very friendly, made the ride feel comfortable, followed the directions given to him by the gps and dropped me off right in front of my destination without making me feel uncomfortable. He offered one of the best Uber services I have experienced. I usually have issues with other drivers in finding or leaving me at my destination, but this driver was awesome!
title: Great service

review: I scheduled a ride the driver never arrived.  You could see he never moved from Harvey Louisiana and my pick up location was Nee Orleans East!  I waited and finally 5mins before my pick up time I cancelled because I had to get to the airport for a flight.  I was charged at $25 fee for there drivers poor service.  I am very disappointed in Uber.  Try to dispute and tried to find a phone number to call customer service.  This app doesn’t give you any way to do either.  I feel this drive scammed me out of that fee.  There was no way he could get to my location in 5 minutes and get me to the airport!  COMPLETE SCAM!
title: No customer service

review: Very professional and respectful driver. Jorge.  He asked if he could answer a phone call, then thanked us for letting him do that.  Haven’t had that level of respect lately.  Car was so clean and plenty of room for our luggage.  We had 2 large pieces and 2 carry ons. There were 2 of us.  Great service! We reserved ahead of time and he was there a few minutes early.  Great service!!!!!
title: Old Key West to Orlando airport-Jorge

review: Hi I would like to know the reason why Uber cost so much. Whenever I go on the app and I see a cheap or a cheaper or the cheapest Uber, when I tap on it to get it, it always showing that” There’s No Car” those are always unavailable, that’s the catch Uber is using to trick customers. Sometimes I would be there waiting to get an Uber to see if it will get cheaper but instead it get more expensive. Uber is too expensive
title: Too Expensive

review: Thank you Ronald for not giving up on a terrible traffic afternoon.  I was fading fast after my medical treatment that ran later than usual at Piedmont West.  I was feeling exhausted and actually quite a bit discouraged.  Ronald not only got me home in good time he brightened my day and my out look on life.  I didn’t need a bartender…I needed a Uber Driver!  Thanks to all the unsung heroes that we encounter during our day.
title: Ronald saved the day!

review:
I just got an Uber from ORD (Chicago) to Munster, IN - and they charged me $122. Its not that long of a drive. I come to find out they are paying the driver only $40 on that trip. 

These Uber drivers were on strike for 3 days in Jan 2023 but that did not fix it. These are good people working hard to pay their families and Uber pays them $40 on a $122 ride. 

There’s no version of that story that is ok. A lot of these people are driving to put food on the table. This is a fact.  And now Uber is reaching into their pockets. Disgusting.  If the drivers are getting screwed by Uber corporate, we’ll need to do something to change this.

Uber should be ashamed of themselves, but of course they're not, they keep taking and cutting as deep as they can.

Until we say enough is enough.

There are solutions to this and we will act (non-violent). 

Driver strikes are only the beginning of Uber can’t start showing some common decency in how the treat and compensate the drivers.
title: Unethical corporate business

review: I can’t drive after back surgery and needed to check on my 96 year old mother in her assisted living facility in Katy. Both of my drivers Javed from S Braeswood to Sunrise Senior Living  in Katy and Onurcan from Sunrise Senior Living to my home, were very friendly and interesting to speak with. I felt safe and they were very helpful as I can’t lift anything and had to bring a rolling cart with things for my Mom. Great five star drivers!
title: Great drivers

review:
So tonight we tried the save $1 and wait 1-10 mins feature. So on December 25th which is already inflated $$$ pricing I thought I’d try to save a buck.  We got canceled on by the 1st driver  which started our wait time over 3 times. (I have a 5 star rating btw) 
Then they allowed a driver to except our fair when he was way over off the I-17 and we live in Tempe? So then we had to wait an additional 20 mins just for him to get here. Cheaper than Lyft these days for a reason. Don’t do the save money feature unless your time isn’t valuable.
title: Cheaper than Lyft for a reason

review: My dad and brother had never used UBER. My brother has Down syndrome and walks really slow. They had a bad day, missed a flight, got in 3 hours late. I am in Kansas, but using my app to help them UBER. David was so patient, waited for them to walk to the only destination UBERS can pick up. They were at the wrong place. He called me, got details of what they were wearing so he can watch for them. Thank You David!!
title: David was wonderful.

review:
My driver was extremely courteous. His vehicle picked me up in less than 5 minutes after I requested service. I found the car to be immaculate inside. He is a phenomenal careful driver. Even though it was heavy rain and flooding I felt very safe during my entire trip. 
Uber is quite fortunate to have such an outstanding team member. 
I gave him a generous tip in cash and he was grateful. 
Thank you so much.
title: My UBER Experience

review:
Horrible! Horrible! Horrible! Customer service 
So hard to get in touch with customer representatives. Then when you get someone they give you nonsense excuses and Trouble shooting excuses instead of the request or issue on hand! 3 different people with a bunch of emails back and forth with nothing being fixed!!! 

Uber you owe me $ and receipts! 
Get it together already.
title: Customer Service

review:
The app works well enough for ride requests but if I want to update my profile with a photo so that drivers can easily find me I have to do it through Uber Driver - even if I’ve never used the driver app and just created a profile to find out more about the program. Then I go to Uber Driver app and when attempting to add a profile picture it tells me my request is being reviewed when I did not submit a request. This is confusing and frustrating. 
Uber cannot separate from Uber Driver feel like you are dealing with a novice app.
title: Frustrating app
developerResponse: {'id': 33394426, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-11-28T04:38:23Z'}

review: 3 times I had different drivers cancel and instead of the app finding another driver not only did I get charged a cancellation fee even though each time it was a driver that cancelled but than because the app didn’t search for another driver at the same price like it’s supposed to if it’s the driver cancelling you have to reorder and pay whatever the new price is plus the cancellation fee so Uber gets paid more and the driver who cancelled that should have taken the hit gets the cancellation fee you was charged encouraging drivers to make free money in cancellation fees
title: Use Lyft you won’t get double charged three times

review: I use ride share services a lot and the only reason I use Uber more than Lyft was Uber’s reward program. Lyft is usually a bit less expensive but I liked having the rewards discount for longer trips. I was bummed when they changed the amount of points you needed for 10 percent off but I figured that with gas prices it made sense. Now I see that they’re getting rid of it all together come October, so it will make more sense for me to stop using Uber all together since Lyft has better rates.
title: Really stupid to get rid of the rewards program

review:
We got back from a trip, called an Uber, and connected with a driver (San Francisco, Mohammad, Toyota Camry, 8XAB218) for a $38 fare. He called us, asked to verify the last four of our phone number, then proceeded to start and end the ride. The fare immediately jumped to $108. He ignored our calls to see if he was coming, and once I did get ahold of him, he quickly hung up after realizing who I was. 

It was absolutely impossible to get ahold of anyone on Uber’s customer support team, whether that be via chat or phone. They’re rider support simply doesn’t exist.

Now we get to deal with Chase. Luckily their CS is a breeze to work with.
title: Rider Beware | Be ready to be scammed

review: Don’t bother signing up for Uber Pass, the terms have changed & I was not notified. Uber Pass used to provide protection from surge pricing but it doesn’t. It’s actually cheaper to grab a cab if one is available. Uber also has horrible customer service, they send you this automated response so you can’t get a hold of a liver person. I don’t think this is legal.
title: Uber Pass is a waste of money

review: Every time I would take a trip they would charge me multiple times or the price would change after taking the ride even with my card being locked. The second charge will be pending which they say don’t come out of your account which has multiple times and I have yet to get my money back. When I contact support they take forever to respond back or don’t, but when they finally help they don’t investigate they just show you the original trip you selected and basically tell you there is no problem. Please use another app if you can!
title: Horrible service.

review:
Poor experience of booking for an Uber few days back at KHI airport upon arrival and driver was not moving on map. Sent me a message to call him and when I called he said pay me in cash and he will come. I said I will pay by credit card to Uber and he refused to come. When I asked cancel from his side he did not cancel it and then I had to cancel it and uber was asking for cancellation charges. What a scam!
Uber needs to fix these basics.
title: Poor experience

review: This is one of several times that I have paid for an overpriced ride to work or the airport and a driver hasn’t been scheduled. This has happened during the day and at night. I have scheduled long before the needed pickup time and Uber promises a driver will pick me up. Yet when that time comes, no one has been assigned and I end up not having any means of transportation. I get that there may not be drivers out there to assign and that Uber doesn’t care if they lose my business, but that doesn’t change the fact that this has inconvenienced me too many times. In summary, screw you Uber.
title: Unbelievable

review: This useless app sends out multiple notifications about random crap, and I’m left with the choices, keep my notifications on and keep receiving these stupid unnecessary notifications and get alerted when my ride is here, or turn off the notifications and miss out the notification when my ride is here.  Not a choice should have to make Uber.  App works fine, Ubers service is fine.  But when your blowing up my phone for no reason and I’m left with the ultimatum above, you’ve got a problem.
title: Notifications other than “ride here”

review: Not only do a lot of the drivers care very little about actually getting you to your destination on time, but they accept requests before even finishing their current rides. I’ve been late so many times to work. There are also a lot of hidden fees that they don’t information you of upon requesting the ride, which to me screams false advertising but I’m no expert. Lastly , the gps system they have is beyond terrible. The gps always shows the longest possible route, and half the time the drivers themselves have trouble following them. I’ve had enough of the deception and blatant disrespect.
title: So much bull crap

review: I frequently use Uber for the trip from my local airport to my house and vice versa.  Well, for a trip that should have been around $30, Uber decided to charge me $80! Do to my schedule, I unfortunately did not have another viable option. Uber used unethical practices in taking advantage of its customer and pricing the ride at an EXTREMELY high rate.  Uber allows you to rate the driver but no other aspect of the trip. The driver deserved and received 5 stars. But Uber deserved no stars for this fare. I am very disappointed with this company and will seek alternative options after this experience.
title: Uber May have just lost a longtime customer

review: Between Rides and Eats, Uber has changed the way I get around and interact with my city. Always new features being added to make the experience for customers that much better. I’m loyal to Uber apps and have been able to take advantage of many bonus programs to save money on orders too. There’s no going back after getting on Uber!
title: A must-have app for any smartphone user.

review: I had to go to the airport and decided to use Uber to take me there. They completely flaked on me and I almost missed my flight. This is not a one-time thing as this as happened countless times before. Uber flakes on you all the time, with no warning or notification, leaving you unaware and most likely late to whatever you’re going to. If you need a quick ride for something unimportant then Uber would be somewhat fine but DO NOT use it for getting to important places. They are unprofessional in this way, you shouldn’t leave your customers waiting and then don’t show up.
title: Completely unreliable

review: I was an Uber-ite from the beginning. I worked walking distance from my home and gym in a downtown type area. I owned a car but rarely drove it. I was taking an Uber whenever I went out. I was so convenient and I ran the numbers and I was actually planning to get rid of my car. It was cheaper for me to use Uber and not have the expenses associated with owning a car. Perfect for me and the planet. Then greedy people in government started to target Uber and the service started to become more expensive and less good. Then COVID hit and Uber was finished. I now look at Uber and say it is extremely over priced and the service is crap.
title: Uber was great…was

review: I refuse to use Uber any more. When Uber first started it was fast, safe, and affordable. You knew the price up front and a driver would be to your door in minutes. Now it’s worthless to even try and get a ride. Now the drivers can bargain their own prices which means you will get 2x and 3x charged. For example, a $20 downtown ride will now typically cost $40 or $60 depending on the time of day. If you reject the higher priced offer then you will not get a ride. It’s a shame that Uber made the taxi industry essentially go out of business, then Uber became worthless and there is now no longer options for taxis.
title: Uber has changed

review: PLEASE bring back the ability to change the drop off location after calling a ride or during a ride, as well as the ability to add additional drop off or pickup points. Many times plans change and you have to go to a different destination while on your way. And many times you want to pick up a friend but can’t do that now. Makes riding Uber so much harder now
title: Bring back features

review: This app has gotten progressively worse and is pretty trash. Used to laugh at considering Lyft, now I’ll be deleting and sticking with straight Lyft. They give you a time you’ll get there then the time gets pushed back to an unacceptable time and you don’t get money back, no credit, and then they’ll charge you for trying to cancel. The status can read 15 minutes away, dropping off someone else and they’ll still charge you for canceling as if they’re choosing where they drop off the last person by where you are. Only a matter of time until they end up like taxis.
title: Market capitalization

review: .  This is the second time  I have been unable to receive a ride due to no drivers being available in that area.  Why would you provide a 24/7 car service if you CANNOT GUARANTEE that their will be a driver available to you when you need them.  This false information you had posted led me to believe I would be able to get home when needed and has ultimately left me stranded with no transportation home.  I even had my ride scheduled for 45 minutes and within that time frame you still couldn't find someone to drive? Thank you so much Uber for leaving a young girl stuck in the freezing cold.
title: 24/7 transportation advertisement is FALSE

review: It’s just so frustrating dealing with Uber. Pretty much every time I order a ride it put 2 holds on my card. Sometimes I just request a ride, it loads for a while, puts a hold on a card, keeps me waiting for minutes while Uber is allegedly “looking for a driver” and then it just throws me back to home page of the app. It’s impossible to reach support. Nope. Absolutely no way. Right now I’m trying to use my Tesla voucher listed as my payment method and Uber still keeps charging and double charging my card. I’d never go back to Uber if not for this voucher. Save yourself sometime and download Lyft or even call a regular cab - should be faster and cheaper
title: Just the worst

review: I needed a round trip but being unfamiliar as this was my virgin journey I didn’t know how to book it or make it a round trip! The problem was with the language barrier we weren’t able to make it happen so maybe a bit of help via Uber corp with a specialized handbook or on line video allowing any driver to access the information in their own language
title: First Time Uber user

review: I feel so safe with my protection of the drivers for Uber and I was going home from Naples and the driver took a route a never had before been aware that it was correct way to my home and the driver insured me that this was the best way to get to the home because of the construction of the road that were going on and it’s my pleasure to use Uber for all my needs to get anywhere!
title: Safety

review: Mohomed went above and beyond as a driver … I had an emergency happen couldn’t pick up my son from school and w very short notice not only was he available for pick up , he was on time and actually went into school to do the sign out for my son . Excellent service and communication was excellent let me know all details as they were happening thx for great work
title: Above and beyond

review: I had Uber for years every time I had an issue they could never help me or resolve the issue the last straw was a couple of weeks ago I lost an expensive item that also had personal value as well due the fact that it was a gift from my wife they did nothing as expected but they were always willing to take my money just like during the pandemic when they took advantage of people jacking up their prices in a time where people had no choice I had spent so much money on Uber I will never use Uber again or recommend it to anyone
title: I have come to really dislike Uber

review:
Why am I being charged a fee if the driver never showed up at the pickup point and supposedly he canceled because he had to wait when most likely he was waiting at the wrong pick up point? 
This policy is totally wrong… like this, the drivers can the cancel any ride and just report that the client never showed up and make money without doing anything at all!
We waited and waited at the pick up point and the driver never showed up! and later we get notified that the driver had to cancel the ride and we get charged for it…shouldn’t the driver be charged instead?
title: Charge for cancellation by the driver

review: I was picked up at the emergency room after having a fall. The security guard helped me into the car. When I arrived at home, I believe a more concerned driver would have gotten out open the door for me and made sure that I made it into my house. I specifically had to ask him to wait until I got my garage door open. Otherwise, he would’ve just left me standing.
title: My drive

review: Uber has been wonderful for us on our travels and for numerous other needs. We have used it a lot and have always been very happy. We have never had a problem or bad experience. All of our drivers have been very nice, friendly and accommodating. Using it also earns us double points on our Southwest Rapid Rewards card. I highly recommend using Uber!
title: Uber is Great

review:
So if I take a ride and I have to wait for them 20 mins and I can't effort that time I have to pay THEM 6 dollars for the 18 dollars trip to cancel? I know you guys do it for the money but this is just bad on your side. Be better.
Note: I used again in desperate times. Still terrible. Charged me 10 dollars more than what promised which is just horrible manners in business. Came here to give it the one star that it definitely doesn't deserve and remembered that it's the second time they're showing their scammer side to me. If you have a shadow of doubt about how terrible they are, just don't...
title: Robbers in disguise

review:
I am 82 years old and have been a psychologist for 57 years, so I think I might be more thorough and accurate than many others.
John is a young, motivated, and well educated person. As a driver, he is very friendly and sensitive to customer’s styles. He engages people in conversation readily. 

His car is new, very clean, and comfortable. Overall he is probably one of the best rides you’ve ever had.
title: Excellent ride

review: I was on Uber, requesting a drive at Miami Airport to my hotel. Amazing experience with the person in the car. He is fabulous and tells me  all about his vacation in Singapore. He said the food was amazing, especially the sushi! He arrived to my hotel and offered to sleepover tonight in my room. I said it is fine because there is two beds. He is now my husband and we always laugh about this today.
title: Uber

review: I was using Uber for 5+ years and across multiple countries. Here In Chicago I have the worst experience - the app became glitchy, finding a ride is always a lottery: the app will show you the price and available cars, then spend 5 minutes looking and say "ooops sorry, couldn't find anybody, try later or may me pay double. No promises though". Next round you may or may not find a car finally - and be late to any plan you had. It happens every so file time I try to use Uber app in Illinois, so now I prefer walking to this husstle
title: Can't rely on the app

review: Always easy to find a ride with best Background Checked RideShare drivers. I even like the safety features integrated into the App that make me as a rider feel safe knowing the UBER background support is always watching and keeping a birds-eye view of all things happening. And the constant updates to the App keeps things running smoothly.  - Beware of imitators there is only 1 UBER
title: RideShare App Navigation at its Best!

review: Unless you are in dire need and have too, I recommend staying away from uber. As someone who has been using it constantly for the pass year, I can say for certain that the wait times they give you are completely made up. Almost every time i order an uber the time to wait they give me and the real time are completely different, and that doesn’t even include the uber driver’s cancelling your ride at-least once or twice per wait time it feels. Tdlr don’t use Uber unless you don’t have anywhere to be urgently otherwise fashionably late is going to be you’re new thing.
title: Wait Times

review:
New account, have tried two valid payment methods & a prepaid gift card i got for a present.  App always returns “Payment Error. Contact support.”

Spent over a month with support getting the same pat answers “Try a different card” or “We dont refund gift cards” with no one able to figure out why the app doesn’t work on a new iPhone.  They basically stole the funds for that gift card because i cant use it or transfer it to anyone who has a working account.

Big companies like this prey on people, stealing money & never facing consequences for it. Don't give them your business.
title: Trash App from Trash Company

review: While I’ve never really had problems with the drivers, tha app itself has gone down hill. I used uber quite frequently until recently. It started taking 10-20 minutes just to get a ride! I live in West Hollywood, CA and am requesting rides during the middle of the day. No idea what’s going on, but after missing my flight this morning due to waiting for an uber for 40 minutes, I will not be using the service anymore. Maybe this is a local problem in Los Angeles? Either way, Lyft is the superior ride service and I’m happy to pay more so a car actually arrives in a timely manor.
title: What’s going on at Uber?

review: Uber itself is great I’ve had nice drivers for the most part but my problem is with Uber eats. They’ve gotten my order either completely wrong or partially wrong and every time I would talk to their support all they would say is there is nothing they can do about it. I’ve given picture proof and everything but they just don’t care and won’t tell me why I can’t get a refund or even offer to redo my order. Best believe I will no longer be using Uber eats. I’m sticking to DoorDash.
title: My experience

review:
To whom it may concern, 
I had to request an Uber for a 3rd time tonight because the first 2 times the app quit searching for a driver and went back to the home screen. I was going from Ground Zero down in Mlps out to Bloomington, Mn. The first one was  priced at $46 ($20 more than the ride down there. Then the second one Jumped up to & 51. But still nobody came and again the app went back to the home screen. I had to request a third time   and this time was suggested that I use priority, which I did and after 35 minutes one accepted. 
PS my card just alerted me that I was charged for all three trips to include tips I never authorized. Which I will be contacting my Credit card company to refuse payment on the first 2 including the tips.
Disappointed,

Dean A. McNeal
title: Kicked off twice

review:
This was our first time using the app. We were at the BWI airport, downloaded the app, selected the first vehicle that popped up, and within minutes, Lloyd appeared.  His vehicle was spotless and extremely comfortable, but most importantly, Lloyd is an excellent driver. We felt very safe with him.  Lloyd also engaged in a wonderful conversation with us, which made the drive even more pleasurable.  
Thank you Lloyd.
title: Our first time using Uber App

review: I don’t believe drivers should be allowed to counsel when within one minute of picking you up. If riders are not allowed to do so on short notice and have a monetary penalty, then the drivers should be held to the same accountability. I had several drivers do this and ended up waiting over an hour for a driver to actually pick me up to take me to the airport. Totally unacceptable service.
title: Driver canceling, when within one minute of you

review: Lately the app has been saying sorry fares are high because it’s busy well they have been busy for the past 4 days. What usually costs me $8 is now costing me $35+ anytime of the day. Idk what happened  but Uber is the worst. Charge for wait time if not outside to me ready. I’m not going to sit outside at 2am in the morning where there are junkies walking around just to be ready when it arrives that’s not fair. Also I get charged extras at times for trips that say I have been dropped off at a different location and it’s more money. Legit HATE Uber but it is what it is when you dnt have a car.
title: Worst type of transportation

review: Yes I am an OG. Never used Uber before. What a great experience. I thought I was in the middle of no where but my driver Peter was there with in 5 minutes. He was friendly and personable and the pricing was fair. Although I think Uber should pay their drivers a bigger share of the cost based on my understanding of how the process works. Will definitely use the service again.
title: 1st time using Uber

review: I messaged Dana he would be driving my 18yr old son who usually doesn’t travel alone and asked him to make sure he sees my son get to the correct place and enters safely, I had also asked if he would remind my son to call. Dana went out of his way to fulfill my requests and my son said Dana was very nice and drove great. Thank you Again for making me feel safer letting my son travel alone.
title: Above and Beyond

review: We are missionaries for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints and are in SLC for training on my medical responsibilities and we’re without a car. We found Uber rides rapidly, drove us where we wanted to go and return to our hotel at a fairly reasonable price. I love the app. It makes everything clear, Shows you when the driver is about to arrive and gives you a way to tip the driver.
title: Getting around Salt Lake City

review: This was one of the best Uber Ride experiences that I have ever had. I was greeted with a warm smile and such kindness. The vehicle was so clean that it looked like it just came off of a car lot brand new and road amazingly well with such comfort. If you are trying to choose a driver I can help you make your choice. Choose this one. I highly recommend this driver!!! He has a great personality and drove safely.
title: What A Luxurious Ride!!!!

review:
This was my first time using Uber.  I usually use Lyft because it’s cheaper, however, after having to wait for over 2hours and still nothing, I downloaded Uber.  

To be honest, I have been hesitant to use Uber with all the bad press and riders getting killed or some thing else.  

Tonight I was admittedly surprised at what great service I had. I will be using Uber again.
title: My driver was prompt, very courteous….

review: Initially it was said that my trip would cost $12. The driver did not wait for me for a long time, I immediately sat down, drove without stops and any problems, the driver was very polite, I have no complaints about him. But in the end, for some reason, twice as much was deducted from my card - $ 24. And there is no explanation about this in the application. Moreover, it is impossible to contact the support service, I just stumble upon some inappropriate pre-written answers. I will no longer use this irresponsible service. I do not recommend.
title: I paid twice as much as I should have. But the driver is very polite and punctual.

review: Their prices are ridiculous and the reasons they give are also ridiculous. A $9 is $25 because of a surge at 7am. You’re basically almost paying for three rides on one because they understand it’s busy and they want to capitalize as much as they can taking advantage of those who rely on Uber. They know you need it so they raised the price on purpose to make extra money. And don’t get me started on tax and fees for food. There’s a surcharge for everything it’s ridiculous just go out and get your food this app is a waste of money.
title: Randomly Expensive

review: I’m so frustrated by Uber’s lack of customer support. Lyft and Door Dash do a much better job. I am a frequent customer for both Uber Eats and Uber, but when something goes wrong, they make it impossible to connect with a representative who can actually resolve. For my last order the driver’s ID scanner was not working. Both the driver and I spent 30min trying to contact support and resolve. Ultimately we were unsuccessful and I was charged a restocking fee. Now the support chat says there’s nothing they can do. So frustrated with this whole experience. I canceled my Uber one subscription and am changing to Lyft and Doordash.
title: Terrible Customer Support

review: I have been riding with Uber for the last month because I don’t have a car at the moment. A lot of the drivers don’t have the decency to clean their car or get rid of the smell of smoke. And I the last three days I have ordered the same order the first time the just took my food the second time they came all the way to my house then left with my food and the third time I tried to schedule it a few hours in advance and they never even started making my food even though it said my order was confirmed. Personally multi experience was terrible and I’m still hungry.
title: Very unprofessional

review: I travel quite a bit all over the world and in North America during the pandemic things were hit and miss. But in the last year during 2022 I have to say that Uber seems to be back and better than ever. Rather than rent a car at my destinations I have found even several Uber trips during my stay still come in more cost-effective.
title: Uber is back

review: Uber is my only ride share resource. But since COVID…the drivers are impossible to book if the rides are inexpensive. The drivers cancel on you while you’re waiting on them. They say “it’s not worth their trouble because Uber takes so much of their income.” It’s annoying that I am waiting up to 30 mins for someone to take me somewhere when drivers used to just be happy to pick someone up. I’m perplexed. I hope Uber figures something out of the drivers start feeling like they’re getting paid the appropriate amount. Good luck!
title: What’s Happening?

review: I have been having so much trouble using the Uber app for a couple years and no other driver could or wanted to suggest what I needed to do to solve the problem. He did!! I think we solved that problem and he showed me a truck for my family to be able to follow when I’m on an Uber ride. I’m so impressed with him!! I hope I get him again
title: Wonderful, friendly and helpful driver

review: I normally have no issues with Uber but I’d like to rescind all positive feedback I once held for this app because ever since the update- it won’t open! At all! I’ve tried multiple times and even thought that maybe I just a didn’t have the space for it... nope! The app just refuses to work now. It’s so frustrating and I hope they fix it soon.
title: App won’t open.

review: The drivers are usually good and always punctual,  but whenever i buy an  online gift card it seems  to almost always fail to send especially when using PAYPAL. Theres no one to call, no instant help line and nowhere on the websight to find the history for  the cards i purchased. The people i buy for need the card within hours not a day or 2.
title: E-gift cards

review: I’ve reserved driving multiple times and every time I am unable to cancel it when I need to. I know the policy you have to cancel it before 60 minutes mark and I tried canceling yesterday on the app it said I don’t have reserved driving to cancel but I did receive emails which was one to notify me that reservation was complete. Now I was charged a $20 fee for a reservation I tried to cancel multiple times….. This glitch or bug they have, really needs to be fixed.
title: Reserve driving

review: My husband had to go to rehab and the facility he was going to send an Uber to pick him up. when he arrived at the facility his wallet fell out of his back pocket and stayed in the backseat of the Uber the facility contacted the driver to see if the driver would bring the wallet back to the facility or have me meet the driver somewhere to get the wallet. the driver agreed, but never showed up. I contacted Uber customer service and they gave me no help at all saying that it wasn’t their problem anymore and despite my husband being in rehab, he would have to file the complaint himself, despite not having any way to contact them.
title: Customer Service

review: I was left in 30 degrees because the guy got tired of waiting after 3 minutes  from my schedule pick up time. Which was 7:25-7:35. I stepped off the shuttle at 7:28 to find out my Uber already left. There was no other drivers in the area. I couldn’t order a new Uber. (Carson city small town) I had to walk 30 minutes before I could get ahold of family to pick me up by the time I was halfway home. I work graveyard I gotta schedule to follow I feel like people who accepts a schedule should follow through with it. I’m not hating Uber I’m hating on it’s drivers
title: Stranded

review: I had a driver refuse to follow all gps even my dropoff location. When I finally said something, the driver got so angry and said they will drop me off where ever it’s easier for them. The driver got so angry they kicked me out before my destination and almost drove off before I could exit the vehicle. A Brazilian accented lady named “Maria”. This driver has severe anger management issues. I made uber support aware and all they did was delete my account without refunding my prepaid full year of UberOne. Now I just use Lyft and all of their drivers tell me they hate uber and that uber doesn’t care about it’s customers nor their drivers.
title: Dangerous drivers

review: Uber is been literally robing their drivers, friend of mine  got charged $65 on a run and the driver got paid $35… you tell me if this this an honest way to make business, no wonder many people, including my self is no longer using this scam company ever again, Lyft is paying much better to their drivers!  That’s an abused way to do business. Shame on everyone who’s been part of this scam. !
title: Embarrassment!!

review: I’ve used Uber for quite some time and You’ll are just getting worse and worse from riders being sexual harassed to cancelling in without a 5minute grace period, and male drivers acting like they’re being forced to drive and even drivers having the audacity to pick people up in dirty vehicles. Today will be the last time I ever spend my money with you’ll. #DOBETTER
title: Never Using Uber Again

review: Well we met each other standing outside and neither of us knew we were waiting for each other.  We started laughing.  I was having surgery that day and I was so scared and Dave and I started talking and laughing, he took my mind off of it for the whole drive and I so appreciated it. So Dave thank you for the stories and the laughs. I would double the stars if I could.
title: Great first Uber ride

review:
Every time I make a reservation for a ride to reserve the price, I always end up waiting more because my drivers frequently cancel on me because they have to wait. I don’t care if you have to wait for me to get out at 4:00-4:10, you HAVE to wait because it’s signed up for. You have to do ALL of the work, not just the work you want to do. Uber drivers are incredibly unprofessional for this.

I need to make a reservation because I get out of work at 4:00 and I cant afford to pay $15 if I use the app to make a short notice drive.
title: If you reserve a ride, prepare for drivers canceling on you by the minute.

review: Every time I arrive at LAX, I try this app. Unfortunately, it’s been about 4 times now that I’ll get a ride at an apparently decent price, but once I confirm the ride and then wait around 10-20min for the driver to arrive, I get told at the last minute that the ride was cancelled. The app then gets stuck in a loading screen for 30min till I cancel the ride and try to get another, which of course had magically doubled in price. Lyft has been pricier lately but at least they don’t pull this bait and switch, trying to get you with a cheap price that doesn’t exist. Huge waste of time, every time.
title: Bait and Switch every time

review: I just used Uber for the first time and not going to lie I only decided to use it because a friend of mine had told me the prices were cheaper than Lyft and when I went to book a ride I had checked both apps and it was cheaper by a dollar so I booked Uber. I patiently waited for my ride to get to my location and I got the notification it was here so I was walking outside to my pickup and I opened the door and my driver left right in front of me and canceled the ride. Very disappointed in the service and I know in my experience a Lyft driver never left right in front of me and canceled. Use at your own risk y’all.
title: Lyft is better

review: Trying to tip my driver and the app keeps saying it’s not available at this time. Going on 2 days now. I would have called a customer service line but it only takes you through their online help center which doesn’t help. The number I called sent me to a recording and hung up. Only gave it two stars because I’ve always had amazing drivers.
title: Faulty app

review:
My husband is in the hospital and I had to get there during visiting hours. Your web site is so confusing and unclear that I had to get my daughter, who lives far away, to help me.
There must be a way to make it more user friendly & easier to deal with. Today I got a friend to drive me there rather than deal with your site!
Any shortcut advise would be appreciated!
title: My first time

review: I was not comfortable with the thought of having Uber take us to the airport.  No need to worry, our driver was right on time, very pleasant and we had plenty of time before our flight.  The one question I do have is why don’t they  contact you the day before so that you are less anxious about your pickup and you have a way of contacting them if you need to.
title: Very pleased

review: I hate this app. Drivers never on time. Then they’ll switch drivers after they done already connected you to one and gave you a waiting then turn around having you wait double the time they already told you. I’m currently as a type late for work dealing with Uber. I suppose to be at work at 12 I order a Uber at 11:30 and I’m still sitting in my house at 12:10 🤦🏾‍♂️ my job is only a 7 min drive from my house so I shouldn’t be late for work if I ordered a Uber at 11:30. I’m done with this app I dnt recommend this app to no one I rather you find someone you cool with that’s okay with taking you to work Uber just taking your money 💯
title: I DONT RECOMMEND THIS APP TO NO ONE

review: I created an account a long time ago and I had a great experience until I got the Uber Pass trial. I use it for a week and didn’t like it. So I tried to cancel it through the app and my computer but it never worked. All this happened within the week of the beginning of the trial. I kept trying to cancel it but the app kept showing the error. I tried to use the Help option and I couldn’t find the customer service email or phone. Now they are trying to charge me $25 monthly because the app doesn’t let me to cancel it.
title: Unreasonable charge and no customer service

review:
Stanley arrived in 5 minutes. I did not expect that kind of response is a smaller city like Brunswich Ga. Response time was excellent, Stanley’s service was excellent, and I had a better experience than I do in most big cities. 
I will certainly use Uber again and most likely to try them in small towns instead of trying to find a rental car. 
I gave it a 5 star rating.
title: From Brunswick to St. Simon’s East Beach

review:
Uber is easy to use, makes remembering where the car is parked at the airport a non-issue. 
The app is clear & easy to follow. Love the realtime map of the driver’s location & ability to cancel the ride request. Love that you can call for emergency assistance and share location during the ride with a designated person. Easy to tip & rate drivers. Need more flexibility for comments.
title: Lifesaver

review: I appreciate the feature that allows passengers to get up to 20% off of shared rides. However, the more I use the feature and more time is being taken away from me for my ride, I’ve realized that I should just stick to a regular uber ride and avoid the shared riding at all. Because if I am riding with a corider and taking 3x more time to get to my destination and only getting 1-2 dollars off, there is literally no use 😭
title: Saved Rides

review:
Sharon Was very nice. However she had to talk to her kids about why school was important. And accidentally made Racists slurs.
That wasn’t so bad I get it. I’m a mom. I’m not familiar with The Dallas Area. I’ve been told It’s really not a safe place. So with all that I was shocked and scared when she pulled into a very dark and not lite up parking lot, to make a short cut to the airport. And is not familiar with drop off locations.
title: 1st time Uber person

review: Jesus was an exceptional Uber ride with an outstanding driver. From their punctuality to their professionalism, everything was top-notch. The driver was friendly, creating a comfortable atmosphere, and their excellent knowledge of the city's routes ensured a smooth and efficient journey. The car was spotless, and their commitment to safety was commendable. I highly recommend this driver for a reliable and enjoyable ride. Thank you for the excellent service!
title: Boston Trip

review:
TL;DR: The app worked well in the past, but now it is useless except as a font of frustration.

I have been using this app since college, but the app no longer functions. The app no longer uses Apple Pay or PayPal, and it will no longer accept any of my cards. On top of that, there are no **viable** customer support options (in-app bots that cannot provide anything other than canned-responses of course do not count). 

I have called my bank multiple times, and each time I am told that Uber never even tried billing me. The app is now quite simply broken to the point of uselessness.
title: Uber No Longer Functions

review: I love how easy it is to request a ride and how sometimes the prices are cheap and how long it tells you when the rides are here….. but the things I hate is when I want to request a ride early to go to work early the prices are sooooo high $22-33 for a 8 min ride??? Wow and some of the drivers love being petty and not put in the work !!!!! Lower the prices for people of work!!!! Sometimes I end up going to work late still even when I request a ride an 1hr 2hr early being of worker pettiness with pricing!!!!!
title: Love & hate:(

review:
I recently came to the Oakland area and on to Napa, CA. My Uber ride to Napa, was OK, but the driver kept telling me how he wouldn’t make enough money because he probably wouldn’t get a fare back, etc.  It made me very uncomfortable. I ended up giving him a large tip in cash out of guilt
My ride from Napa was so much different! Scott was nothing but lovely. He was friendly but completely professional and the trip was the best UBER ride I have ever had! Kudos and thank you to Scott!
title: Scott is the very BEST!

review:
1. UberOne subscription no longer offers discounted rides. Instead you get cash back, which you can only decide to use all at once, or not at all. Useless.
2. Doing everything possible to avoid customer contact. No phone number. The never ending loop trying to reach support chat. Help section barely help.
3. Family account is a hit or miss when it’s time to track a trip. Really bad for parents/guardians trying to keep up with younger riders.
4. Definitely a recent price increase, even for the shortest trips.
title: Unappreciative business practices

review: As a physician, I need to be efficient with my time. When I’m trying to get a ride (to the hospital, for example), there are way too many pop-ups. They range from asking for leaving a review of a recent trip, to recent deals for food in the area. Honestly, we really don’t need all these repetitive pop-ups. They can actually be a big hindrance from the task I’m actually trying to accomplish (booking an urgent ride, for example). Please find a solution for this in the future updates, or allow users to opt out. Thank you.
