title: Too many popups

review:
IMO just the worst ethics. You'd think they'd learn from their poor ethics of the past. 
The story: Ran a competition with their drivers in FL, make 1000 hrs of deliveries with diamond level service in a certain period of time, get a scholarship to ASU online. My friend's son gears up, and accomplishes this very difficult feat. He is notified he wins. Registers for ASU and they accept his application. Very suspiciously he was then subsequently fired for an accident he had... when he was 17! Yet they had hired him with this accident on his record. Hmmmm. 

Yes, this story is hearsay. And yes, I don't have all the details, but I also have 0.0 bad data points from Lyft. Use Lyft.
title: IMO, the worst ethics contiue

review: The only issue I had was the credit card I previously had on file, for some reason would not be excepted, even though I used it for other things without any issues, suggesting that the credit card was not canceled or over, charged or anything like that .
title: Credit card previously on file.

review: The app has said “We can’t reach our network right now.  Please check your connection.”  It has said this for two hours when the driver was only two minutes away.  However, he picked me up on time as expected and got me to destination at the time promised.  I got the email that confirmed the charge, too, but I have been unable to tip him.  Yes, I have closed and reopened app.  I even turned my phone completely off for an hour.  All to no avail.
title: Great driver, App problems, 1st trip ever

review: The app is great not really any problems. The only thing I hate with this app is that o get off work at 3:00pm and order an Uber everyday after work. It be other drivers at my job dropping people off and I guess just got a different person when they drop them off, my problem is the fact y’all give me a Uber driver that 30mins out from me and I’m not a impatient person but when it’s Friday and your ready to get home I’m pretty sure nobody wants to wait 30+ for a ride.
title: Give me closer drivers!!!

review:
If you don’t have Uber one the fees and delivery is basically going to be like you ordering 2 deliveries in one! 
The prices are outrageous and if you don’t tip 25% or more they basically gonna deliver your food with no consideration or it’s gonna arrive cold and late… and if you call to complain about your order they going to say they going to give you a credit but not actually give you a credit they charge you twice trying to trick you into thinking you got credited but you didn’t! Just be careful with their services…
title: Really not worth the money

review:
Multiple drivers cancelled on us 15 mins after confirming. One driver cancelled just a min before picking up. 

Once a driver accepts a ride, Uber should make sure that the driver doesn’t cancel without penalizing the driver. If the driver cancels, Uber should compensate the customer for the delay caused. Uber is making customers pay waiting charges when they make the driver wait. It is fair for the customer to expect the same when a delay is caused by the driver or change of driver.
title: Drivers cancelling in the last min

review: I was a loyal user since Uber started and did all of my work and personal business with them even to the point of not getting rental cars on most trips where I had in the past; however my customer service experience from support and from driver has fallen off a cliff. I almost got into an accident on my last trip in uber black, the driver before that ripped me off, I have had multiple restaurants orders get canceled by uber after waiting an hour plus for food that never arrives meaning I didnt eat dinner on several occasions. It is no longer reliable or enjoyable for me to use.
title: Had enough

review:
Yesterday, I ordered an Uber for a ride from Vienna city centre to my doctor appointment in 22nd district. I knew I was late but did not worry and told Reza this.
I think he was either on meds/or drunk. He kept talking in very bad English and bad German (I am fluent in both) in a very dated slow manner. His driving was strange: stopping two car lengths behind and almost missing green lights. One green light, I had to tell him to GO. 
He yawned many times and seemed dazed.
I considered getting off, but needed to get to my destination somehow.
I all my 15 years using Uber all over the world, this was my first experience bad enough to write a review.
title: Bad experience with Reza

review: I was in the St. Petersburg/Tampa area and needed a ride. This was my first time using Uber and will definitely be taking more rides in the future.  I made my reservation online for an early morning appointment.  The transaction was very easy.  The next morning, I received notifications that my ride was assigned and information on the driver.  The driver was on time and I made it to my appointment safely and early.
title: First ride with Uber

review:
It has been an entire calendar year and two days since I’ve began attempts to receive a refund of funds I purchased and loaded onto my account that have been sitting dormant for a year since then. Over two years ago I loaded money onto my Uber account and any attempt to contact support for a refund I receive an automated message saying
We’re aware of this issue and working to fix it. We hope to solve the problem soon” 
This is literally not even a proper response to my problem. Automated messages, no customer service. This is why I don’t use Uber. Trash company.
title: Won’t refund my money

review: At two airports now, I have wanted to be picked up on the cargo side, which is nowhere near the passenger terminal. When I input the pickup address, the app automatically forces me to choose a passenger terminal. Thankfully in EWR I had a stellar driver who patiently listened to my directions to the cargo building. What’s worse, there is no place on the app to give feedback about issues like this. The only options are to complain about drivers, report billing problems or report a safety incident. So here I am, leaving a 1-star review on the App Store and wondering if anyone from Uber will even see this.
title: There’s more to an airport than just the passenger terminal

review: I left my keys in my Uber Driver car. After 4 hrs of Uber support reaching out to no avail I got my keys. How can Uber employ these individuals but have no control of the business. That drivers respond if they feel like or keep our items. Me and two sons waited outside for hrs and Uber couldn’t do anything but say their sorry. I don’t wanna hear sorry when I’m stuck with a 7 and 2 yr old outside. They gave her my information and she still hasn’t returned my keys. That’s my last time ever doing business with this company. If you get Josefina hold on to your seat and check for  all your stuff. Uber I’m so disappointed
title: Left my keys
developerResponse: {'id': 35161700, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-03-02T10:00:25Z'}

review: Price and wait time triple or double after you’ve already paid. I been late to work several times now because my Uber went from an 8min wait to 21mins with no explanation or compensation. Prices have literally only been higher since I got the “Uber one” membership. No actual customer support line to contact just silly question prompts that lead nowhere.
title: Scummy app

review: Christopher took care of me when the address I went was not correct and I came from another state. I wasn’t got stuck because he waited for me to make sure I am safe. He drove me to find something to eat at midnight and took me to my hotel. He is really a great driver and takes care of his client above and beyond. I am so grateful to you Christopher. God bless your beautiful heart.
title: I would call him the Great Samaritan

review: Due to my truck deciding to die on Christmas Eve I was forced to download the uber app and give it a try. I had to get to work on Christmas Day (today) and I couldn’t rent a car so I was pleasantly surprised when my driver showed up as quickly as he did. Javier was good driver, friendly and easy to talk to. Now let’s see if I can get a ride back home this evening. Two thumbs up!!
title: Great first time experience!

review:
Uber app should be improved to -
1. Keep passengers in better informed about connected/contracted drivers not showing up and why. Otherwise, passengers stay in limbo.
2. Uber should automatically keep searching for drivers when a connected/contracted driver does not show up. Passengers should not be left wondering, sometimes waiting in difficult conditions, like bad weather etc.
title: When drivers do not show up

review: I often travel off hours due to my schedule so I appreciate that even in the wee hours of the morning I can get a ride.  It is a bit nerve wracking when drivers accept the request then for whatever reason cancel.  Thankfully so far, another driver accepts the request.  I know life happens and I haven’t missed a flight or train.  Thanks Uber!
title: Grateful for early morning service

review: The driver was there promptly,he was extremely courteous,I had groceries and the bags were really heavy he made a u-turn just so I didn’t have to lug all the bags across the street and did so even though he had to go the opposite way to my house. I thought that was just a nice gesture considering how nasty people can be today. THANK YOU MAMANDO. I Hope I spelled your name correctly my apologies if I didn’t.
title: My Uber experience

review:
The driver I eventually got was perfect 

However, the first driver was sent to the wrong address, two blocks away from my home.  I requested that he come to my location.  I begged him saying please, please.  My ride was canceled and I was charged. $5.00.

I tried to call Uber on the phone and my efforts were fruitless.  Every time I attempted to get a ride, home would appear on map two blocks away from the home, that was listed on my phone.  

Not being computer literate, Again I tried to call Uber, on the phone.  At one point something came on the screen requesting my credit card number 

Everyone is not computer literate.  Uber has no customer courtesy. 

My frantic efforts to resolved the problem could have been corrected with assistance from Ubers customers service 

I am Out of $5.00 and was late going to my destination.

Oh, I had to go to reserve a ride to get my home address on the map
title: Uber no customer service available

review:
Before iOS 16, I was able to send a note to the driver through the app, as a Uber driver chat screen opened up. Now it pops open an ordinary iMessage screen with the phone number of the driver — not at all the same thing. Afraid to use this “new” feature fearing the driver won’t know it’s a customer.

UPDATE: App fixed !! Everything is back to normal.
title: Sending Note to Driver Jumps Out of Program

review: This used to be a reliable, go-to transportation app. Now, you can only count on endless waiting times between ride request and confirmation, exponentially growing prices, dirty cars that smell like sweat and old food, cancelled rides, and completely arbitrary ETAs that change every 30 seconds. A 15-minute pickup time that turns into 30 minutes waiting is absolutely unacceptable and unsustainable — and is a continuous reminder to your customers that Uber is now synonymous with INconvenience and canceled plans.
title: Declining Service

review: I started requesting a ride (20 minute trip) around 755 this morning. I was cancelled on by drivers multiple times. I then was told to make another request. I did that and was cancelled on again. It’s so incredibly frustrating!! I had an appointment that I completely missed because your service wasn’t reliable. I could have found another way to travel but after this happened multiple times it became too late. Why do you connect me with drivers if they aren’t going to pick me up? If drivers confirm before you connect us it would reduce the frustration and unreliability.
title: Unreliable
developerResponse: {'id': 32658611, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your recent interaction with us, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2022-10-19T05:18:18Z'}

review: The very worst aspect of the Uber system is responding to The receipt email after a ride.  The effort required to access the tip and rating is VERY frustrating password and the use of the third party verification is enough to make me just delete the email and not bother to rate or tip.  It usually takes 5-10 minutes to get it done. Ridiculous.
title: Review of Uber driver tipping and rating site

review: My driver going to the airport gave me attitude and was grumpy the whole way there. I requested an Uber for my trip back home from the airport and the application said a driver was 3 minutes away, approximately 1 mile. The driver went the wrong way for about 5 miles and tried to come back so he could pick me up. After 15 minutes waiting the driver canceled on me because he could not navigate the airport. It took another 5 minutes for my second Uber drive to arrive. It would of been cheaper and faster if I drove and parked my car myself. This trip was very expensive.
title: Too Expensive for Poor Service

review: Good news 📰!Uber is a nice transportation app. It’s very helpful. Saves a lot of time than reaching your hand out for a taxi. BAD NEWS 🗞! The map the app uses is wrong 😑. The map is inaccurate. The size of countries matter! Plus, Greenland 🇬🇱 is larger than Africa. Fact for this map: Greenland is supposed to be 14 times smaller than Africa. Tip to change this map problem: Use the political map 🗺 -_-
title: Map is wrong. The size matters.

review: Eric arrived at the hospital. I didn’t know that was the Uber for me had had not been told the color, am having difficulty walking and had to walk, using my cane, a bit of a distance to see if this nondescript car which I had not been told what color it was was my ride. I think when arriving at a hospital the driver should get out, The color of the car should be indicated and I would’ve liked it if the driver had worn a mask.

The experience is okay but it takes forever to find a ride. I waited one hour to find a ride in Bryant, ar if anyone knows Bryant it’s a big city.. it took one hour to get the ride not including the time it took for them to get to me, 26 mins. I went inside for 10 mins and placed another Uber only to wait another hour before I just gave up. The app will say 10mins but it’ll take longer. Overall if you can get a ride you’ll be fine, it’s just the getting the ride part
title: Good idea

review:
TL;DR? Use Lyft instead.

This used to be a remarkable app for ridesharing, now it is a challenge to use.

I was at a HUGE airport where there was tons of activity and I had attempted to book an Uber 4-5 times. Each time, it was selected, then canceled by the other party.

When I finally got a ride that didn't cancel me immediately, they waited fifteen minutes (going nowhere according to the GPS), didn't call or contact me, then started my trip, proceeding to charge me $70. I have a 5 star rating on Uber because I tip well and don't disturb, so it is strange that I kept getting canceled.

By this point I was still at the airport and exhausted, so I ended up just downloading Lyft. For a fraction of the price of any Uber I could find, I was picked up by a Lyft driver in 2 minutes and finally on my way.

Uber used to be good, but now you have insane prices for incomplete services. To their credit, the refund for the ride was swiftly back in my account.
title: Downhill fast

review: My driver, Hank, was fantastic! He drove me from Punta Gorda to Fort Myers airport and I made my flight on time. It was a last minute, early morning pick up and he made it easy. In my rush to catch my flight, I left my jacket in his car. Before I landed, Uber had sent and email letting me know how to get my jacket back. I connected with Hank and he mailed my jacket to me. I'd say that's top notch service from start to finish!
title: Great Experience!

review: If you have any understanding in business you will understand customer service is at the top of the priorities. Just like many other mainstream services it is one one of the worst you could possibly imagine. Called 3 times and they disconnected me instead of letting me wait or any other possible option. Great concept but I hope this business is taken over by another that actually cares about its customers. Terrible service (AKA no service). If any of the admins want to contact me to correct this please feel free but I’m sick of this crap service with the excuse of Corona.
title: Terrible Customer Service

review: I have been using Uber for years. It helps for a lot of last minute rides. However, I don’t enjoy the fact that it increases the price of fare when you check it a couple of times. I’m a college student so I can’t afford some of the rides.  Sometimes I go to look to check the price and availability, and sometimes I call it later. I was checking to get a ride home and it went from $30-$50 in ten minutes which is an extreme jump. I just think there needs to be some sort of fix in that.
title: Needs a couple of fixes

review: So I ordered an Uber one dark morning in Las Vegas and the Uber app wouldn’t let me move my location to the hotel front door opting instead to put me across the road at the convention center. Instead of moving across the road 50yrds he canceled my ride and was able to charge me $5.40 on top of being rude and degrading on the Uber text message and then the Jackwagon honked when he drove by us!! I complained to Uber and they initially refunded my money, which would have kept me as a frequent customer. Then I got charged the $5.40 and they won’t respond to my email requesting clarification. So now, I’m going to Lyft!
title: Driver was rude and ripped me off

review:
I am writing this out of frustration after 3 incidents that occurred in the past few weeks. The drivers continue to drop rides at the last minute specially to and from LAX. I almost missed my flight last week because 4 drivers cancelled even though I have booked 5 hours earlier. And last night 3 drivers cancelled after confirming and I had to take a regular taxi from LAX.
If Uber drivers are becoming choosy, then this service is worthless especially that there are no means to communicate with anyone
title: Too many dropped rides

review: Are use the time sometimes and when I do, I get pretty darn good drivers and they take me on trips exactly where I need to go and when I get there I said thank you and they smile and wave goodbye and then later if I need another ride. I do the same thing and I get another person to pick me up and it works the same every single time all of the time.
title: A driving app indeed

review: It’s been a long time since I used Uber. I arrived at JFK airport from Los Angeles and decided renting a car would be very complex so I decided to try Uber. It took a bit to figure it out. Not bad for the first time in about seven years the airport was crazy but he was able to direct me walking which guided me straight to his car no hassle no stress a beautiful ride from the airport to the Kimberly
title: How did they find me?

review: Just terrible. I’m traveling to Vancouver, BC and I reserved a pickup for roughly the time I’ll be arriving. We’re now running late and can’t change the pickup time(which, before booking said that I’d be able to change it) but can’t cancel without having a cancellation fee. My only option is to pay a cancellation fee at this point or be charged for the whole trip when I don’t show up on time for my ride. And OF course they don’t actually have a person you can talk to. I’ve been judging from link to link and I always end up in the same spot, the “help center” that’s not helpful AT ALL
title: Awful

review:
The Uber app still misguides drivers, despite my address being on the map for 10+ months now. I always have to message drivers my address and tell them to use Google maps. 

*Update* so now the stupid app doesn’t even let me type my address in because its map STILL doesn’t recognize it! I had to put a nearby business as my destination and then ask my driver to put my actual address in Google maps. Uber decided to cancel the trip, charge me a cancellation fee, and not bother to pay the driver. This is asinine. How long does it take to update your fecking map??
title: Poor GPS and Timings

review: Something is wrong with the app when I use UberEats (tried the promotion, didn’t want to download another app). You can’t go back to the previous menu. You have to close the entire app and reopen it. For instance, I went to pay, picked PayPal and then changed my mind. No button to go back, no way to get out of the PayPal screen. Had to close the app and reopen and search the restaurant again. Very annoying. I closed the app when my food was on the way, now there is seemingly no way to go back to give a review to my driver.
title: Can’t go back

review:
Drivers steal money by pulling up, waiting literally 20 seconds and driving off before people can get downstairs. Multiple drivers have done this.

PLUS the $27 of unauthorized membership chargers that Uber charged to my card randomly 2 days ago, even though I haven’t used nor been subscribed to Uber in 3 or 4 months🤦🏽‍♂️😡

And the icing on the cake is that there seems to be NO way to reach Uber customer service by phone, and their chat customer support takes AGES to even reply, let alone refund you👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎
title: Never using Uber again!

review:
Dave was not Moy an excellent driver but a kind man, good people. He made me feel comfortable and that made me enjoy the ride that much more. I do not like taking Ubers but Dave has made me realize that taking an Uber could be a good experience again for me. Dave is by far the best Uber driver I’ve had to date- he reinstalled my faith in your company, without Dave I would not call Uber again but now I will
Thanks Dave
title: My Uber trip

review:
Lorena is the best driver I have EVER had.  She was so accommodating, polite and professional.   She made the experience very stress-free and relaxing.  She is also the hardest working Uber driver I have ever heard of.  She has done over 3,000 rides in ONE YEAR!   
So impressive.  You guys are truly lucky to have a dedicated, hard-working individual like her on your staff.  
Whatever your highest ranking reward is, you guys should give her two of them.
title: Lorena

review: What a great trip with Michael.  We booked an Uber to take us to Dulles Airport from Fredericksburg, Virginia.  Michael arrived a little early, we had great contact from him through the app, he helped us with our luggage, was nice to our cat, and we enjoyed a sparkling conversation with him.  A 90 minute trip just flew by as Michael was very engaging.  Best trip we have ever had.  Michael is a wonderful driver and human being.  Thank you!
title: Great Trip with Michael

review:
You wait at least 1 min till someone takes the trip. Then you hope that they won’t cancel after you have been waiting a few minutes. 

Even worse, they often take the trip and then ask the customer to cancel to protect their metrics. If you refuse to cancel, they can sometimes keep you stuck for a long time. 
Sometimes after you already made alternative arrangements they will show up and wait a few minutes and then cancel with an excuse that you did not come so you were charged a cancellation fee.
title: Terrible outside of big cities

review: I usually have no problem getting to where I am going…. However, here lately with Uber I have had drivers cancel on me the last minute and has made my husband late to work, and I have been rescheduled to dentist appointments because of this after already paying for the ride and not making it in time and as a result I was not seen. This is extremely frustrating because it happens more often than not! I wish I could get refunds for all the times I was late and didn’t accomplish my tasks because of my late Uber driver but I’m sure that is next to impossible.
title: Cancelled rides

review: The first driver they sent was very rude and his name was Bobby. He never showed up at the right apartment because I watched him on the navigation app. He was adamant that he drove through here three times and no one ever came out and then he says you can just call and cancel because I’m going to get my son. the app is hard enough for me to follow so I definitely don’t need his attitude!!! I cancel that one and Chelsea picked me up and was very nice. I just gave her cash for her tip instead of putting it on the app.
title: Canceled ride

review: As of lately, I’ve only been able to rely on Uber for transportation. Whenever I order food from this app this past month, I have been disappointed. The first time I ordered $34 in food and service fees and I summed it up to a mistake but these past 2 times, I’ve watched the Uber eats driver pass my house up and drive off without delivering anything. I’m highly upset and I’m hungry writing this review. Either Uber is not correcting filtering through their delivery drivers or they are a part of the problem and enabling this type of poor service.
title: Scammed

review: I just had few money in my bank account & i didnt have enough to get a ride so uber told me my ride is going to be on them for now i just have to pay after when im able to. regardless, Im so grateful because it was an emergency & i had to come home, uber saved my night! (U just have to be a valid user so they know u are reliable to pay for the rides)
title: The best app ever fr 😭

review:
I did get my ride from Joseph. It’s not my fault that you sent other drivers. Please charge me for your mistake. I will take you to court and report this on the news 
You have no way of contact Uber to cancel when I was in a Uber car seeing drivers come to the my location. So, please do not change me for your mistake of sending drivers to my location address.
Not happy and will not use Uber again! They charge people for sending drivers when you are in a Uber car that they send . 

Not happy how Uber does their business on canceling drivers coming to the same place.
title: Confused

review: This was a most pleasant ride in an extra clean car with a courteous informed driver who willingly answered questions.  It was a smooth ride on a less crowded route.  Loved the sun roof!  Even able to charge our phones in the car!  He knew where he was going.  Unlike our ride into the city in which the  other drivers ( not UBER) driving made me literally carsick!  Great experience.
title: Reserve him!

review: Would be better if you had it set somehow to not charge a person super high because it’s Friday/Saturday when you’re taking them to the same place you take them regularly, for example my rides to work are roughly $9/trip but on weekends it’s about $14 maybe more. I’m not going to a bar or club I’m going to the same work place you’ve taken me 4 other day this week when my rides are only $9
title: App suggestion.

review: The UI for this app is so bad! Way too many icons and tiles and buttons and choices when you’re trying to take care of basic task like figure out where my driver is and where I need to go. The “maps” are awful. I’m supposed to walk somewhere to find a pick up spot and I have no idea which direction I’m supposed to walk in.  I have no idea where on the map I am because I don’t live in this city I’m currently visiting. Then the driver is texting me and I have no idea how to text him back. He ended up canceling the ride. Thanks useless Uber app
title: Horrible UI

review: My app stopped working so support told me to delete and reinstall the app. Ever since I did this a little over a month ago, I’ve been incorrectly charged ~3X for every single ride. My last ride should have been around 40 bucks but I was charged $110! I take this route almost every morning and it never costs that much. Something is broken. I price match with Lyft every time and would never take a ride with that much of a price discrepancy. I’ve written into support multiple times and the issue never gets resolved. THE APP IS BROKEN.
title: Something is broken and they’re now charging me 3X on every ride!

review: We knew we were going to need transportation on our trip to Las Vegas, our hotel advisor said to use Uber over taxi for cost. Uber was very easy to set up account and use the app. Our driver texted us were he was parked and we had his picture and car ID. Super easy and we also had a very good driver who took our bags and loaded and unloaded them. Great service.
title: Our first time using

review: Excellent method as I wrote on the title however when there is a demand or shortage of Uber driver 1st thing that Uber does is raise fare double last night no gas to be found issue at port of Everglades therefore so I parked at a gas station at 8:15pm Uber home $59 this morning at peak hours Uber to the gas station $22 my point I mention to the driver the money is given to the company not to the driver
title: Uber is a Great way of moving from point A to N

review:
I am beyond pleased with the experience. Oyumari made it to where I felt comfortable. I had reservations because I had never been in an Uber and gone through the process: 
From the App download, to adding a method of payment and familiarizing myself with it. 

He was very courteous, his car was exceptionally clean and the most important part “As a first time Uber customer, I FELT SAFE”.
title: My First Uber experience.

review: As soon as he pulled up I knew my ride with Ricky was going to be a joy! I felt safe and so well taken care of and looked after, especially after I found out he was almost to his home and done for the day until he go a ride request. I was waiting for almost an hour for any other ride so he really did save the day for me! So thankful for this kind soul.
title: Such a joy!

review: I like Uber more than lyft but I really wish they had an option to get an average on the cost your rides are for people that have health issues that rely on this app to get to and from work that aren’t wealthy that they have to budget their paychecks. So I only give 3 stars because they didn’t even have consumer support to answer my question about this, besides pre-generated questions that I couldn’t contact customer about. Thanks for the communication through the app. Uber.
title: Ride amounts

review:
In this day and time customer service seems to be a thing of the past almost an ancient art craft, but not so, John. He was personable, not necessarily over talkative, but just enough to engage you and put you at ease regardless of whatever challenge or difficulty you may have faced.
Thanks, John will definitely be booking with you again!! Highly recommended!!
title: Awesome Customer Service

review: ….., the scheduled pickups are a joke b/c schedule a pick up in Colorado outside Denver for 6 AM and at 7 AM, they still had not “found a ride to pick me up” and ended up having to drive to the airport to make sure we caught our plane, parking lot parking in long-term parking for two weeks. Then ended  up charging me for non-pick up& 12 hours later and some guy called from the place we were staying and said, where are you?
title: Great concept, but…..

review:
Carlos was friendly, very professional and was also playing fun uplifting music, taking us down memory lane,  hubby and I couldn’t stop humming singing and then finally “ California dreaming came on “ as we are to LAX going back to cold New York and we asked him to blast it in the car so we could dance and take an Instagram story!!
Best Uber ride !!! 
Thx Carlos for going along w our craziness !!!
title: Friendly Professional & Best Music

review:
Uber as a company does not make it easy to communicate with the driver in the event the passenger accidentally left something behind this happens more often than not unfortunately.

So as awesome as Uber is, there should be a quick easy fix to remedy this for the convenience of his passengers, and its drivers any upgrade to. This would greatly appreciate it, and would take me rating the app from a 4 to a 5 star.
title: Items left behind

review:
I cut and pasted my address location and Uber gave me the same exact address as a choice.  So I select it and my driver could not find me.  When I zoomed into the Uber map, the drop pin was in the right location but the driver claimed he had a different house number and he canceled my ride.

I rebooked and this time I typed in the address. However, Uber’s map showed my location s street away.  I ended up texting my location to the driver who found me.
title: Incorrect map location on Uber

review:
I would like to be able change my reservation without completely canceling and doing the reservation again.   The weather changed to the worst and I wanted to move the time earlier.   

I would also like to be able to see the drivers photo and information soon.  It was not until driver was on his way before I could bring that up.
title: Change reservation time

review: Uber is a scam. I order an Uber and it will be for $12 and then a driver can pick up the ride and drop it until prices spike up (which can happen in 2 mins). The other day I ordered an Uber, it quoted me $12 and then 2 different drivers picked it up and cancelled it right away. Next thing I know the price went up to $20 in the matter of minutes due to “unusually busyness”. It’s not right and drivers should not be able to pick up and then cancel a ride for no reason and Uber should be able to spike the prices like that. If I got quoted $12 on the initial request it should stay $12 until a rider responds.
title: Scammers

review: I’ve had Uber drivers make me feel rushed when losing out unloading seeming irritated if I take too long….not Garth! He was patient, thoughtful, helpful and even reminded me to get my keys out of my car that was at the repair shop. I wish all Uber drivers could take a class from Garth on how to do their jobs with heart and not just for a fast buck. Many blessings and thanks for serving our country Garth!!!🇺🇸
title: Best Uber driver EVER!

review: When drivers accept a ride they should be on the road and ready.  I am noticing long wait times before they get going.  I have asked and they say they are in apt when accept so it takes more time than customer is told.  If driver cancels on customer after waiting 5 minutes customer should get some kind of credit!
title: Ready

review: About a month ago I got an error message that the Uber app needs to be updated. I tried to update and it told me my phone is too old but I could download the most recent compatible version. I said OK but the update can’t be completed and I still can’t use Uber. Shame on Uber for not testing this before rolling out their new app.
title: I have an iPhone 6 and can’t use Uber

review: Not sure when the customer service portion of the service changed, but lately I’ve been disappointed with driver quality. One person stopped to get gas with me en tow, and another didn’t offer to help with luggage (for a ride to the airport) then spent a significant portion of the ride chatting on the phone. Add to that the fact that the share ride feature isn’t working and I’m definitely going to opt for a competitor/a taxi next time round…
title: Driver quality and safety feature problems

review: The reserve ahead function seems great - especially for going to the airport early in the morning. However, I’ve now had drivers accept the ride and cancel. There is no notification from Uber; they don’t try to give the ride to another driver; best of all, it doesn’t even appear in your trips list so you can’t complain or give the driver a rating. It relies on you to monitor and notice that no one is coming anymore — at which point there is usually no other options for getting yo the airport. Won’t be using Uber again for this; these drivers will continue to mess with people.
title: Reserve Ahead Scam

review: I was taking an early flight and scheduled a ride the night before my travel to avoid last minutes hassle. Sure enough, driver canceled my ride 1 min before my schedule pickup, I was left with no alternate drivers. If not for my wife, I would have surely missed the flight. The best part is I was charged for cancelled, complete nuts. Horrible experience.
title: Scheduled Airport Ride and Driver cancelled 1 min before

review:
I have used Uber for years and only started having problems last year. The prices would change on you so you were waiting to get rides it was out rages what the prices were. 
Now I can request a ride and can’t find any I’m always late because of lack of drivers   Even when u schedule the nite before they don’t show.
title: Waiting

review: I did successfully use Uber for a few years without exceptional issues, so I won’t give them 1 star - but recently, my account was compromised due to their poor cyber security network. Repeated attempted to contact tech support were frustrating (no way to bypass the automated system which clearly did not understand my problem) and only resulted in me getting emails indicating that “someone would contact me soon.” Instead I’m a full time Lyft user. Uber does not care about your information security or customer loyalty!
title: Poor cyber security goes unfixed

review:
Thanks Uber, you’re great.

Here are several ideas to make the User/ Rider even more EXCLUSIVELY IMPORTANT like Four Seasons Hotel:

#1: Rider should have the year they started riding with Uber. (5 year Rider 🌟)

#2: Rider should be able to have Rating quantities like the driver has “5 Star 5000 trips.

#3: Rider should have personality Ratings. Such  as :A) Read Books 📚 B) Music listener 🎧 C) Grocery Shopper D) Quiet 🤫 E) Conversationalist 

#4) A link to FB when traveling /check in Uber and when you check in - it will shower your Status: “Diamond RIDER” Check in Uber Rider in NYC . Like when you check in a restaurant or other. 

#5) goes with #4.....Get rewarded for checking in. That way you get free advertisement and we get points that lead to $7.00 rewards towards rides etc. 

A few ideas 💡
title: Customer focus

review: I used to be a regular user of Uber, it was always reliable and fairly quick. Lately every time I’ve tried to use Uber, I end up waiting forever for a ride, I have multiple drivers cancel on me after messaging me asking where they’re taking me, and their estimated arrival time is always incorrect. Just now I waited forever for a ride, only to have it just cancel on me without any notification or explanation. I waited for so much time that all the fares across all apps have gone up. Extremely frustrating. I’m going to stick to Lyft.
title: Completely frustrating, my rides have not been coming

review: Uber becoming more and more like terrible company. I used to be Uber eats best customer. Now the app is not working and it’s combined with Uber drive. Unable to comment, to report issues, to reply to driver, to edit tips. To make a good app you need basic Emotion Intelligence, you have non. I like the companies selection comparing to the other food apps. But this is too much. You are so bad. I am deleting this app! Get back to me once you hire better people to program apps and care about your customer base rather than making money. I hope you’ll lose more customers cause that’s the only way you’ll get it
title: Worse app ever

review: I’m struggling with this rating because I used to ride uber all the freaking time, and I loved it! There are literally ZERO cars available in my area though. It’s RIGHT outside the big city, so I don’t really understand why this is happening. I used to get rides every time I requested them. I can see how this wouldn’t necessarily be Uber’s fault, just a lack of drivers, but I am struggling here. Just for the sake of not getting where I need to go. There are only so many Lyft drivers, you know?😆 help😭
title: Nothing available

review: I have used Uber for 5+ years and it has been getting more pricey as the years went on. It’s about as expensive as a taxi cab now and on top of that the service is mediocre. I have to wait 15 to 20 mins now to use it for work and don’t let me have cancellations, it will push me back from getting to work on time. I am disgraced at the greed of this app that was so easy to use at one point.
title: Inconvenient

review: My mother was picked up from the airport by Uber. She confirmed the city they were traveling to when she got in the vehicle. The driver took her 30 minutes the wrong way to a completely different city. This resulted in her total drive with Uber to be over an hour and over $120. The driver even stopped for gas along the way. He didn’t speak during their ride. Did not apologize for the mix up then even hit her with the trunk when she was dropped off. When this was brought to Ubers attention, they refunded a total of $7.95. I have always been and will continue to be a Lyft rider, where customer safety and service is a top priority.
title: Make it right Uber

review: This was my first trip to Columbus Oh. I was traveling for a work conference. I had not used Uber before and was new to the whole process. Djiby was very helpful and explained everything to me and where to go to meet him. He is a very nice gentleman and I enjoyed my ride to the hotel. His vehicle was very clean and I felt comfortable and safe with him. Thank you Djiby for your courteousness! You were fabulous!!!
title: First trip to Columbus Oh

review: I requested Uber package service and stole my packages, each package is valued at $120 and they are lost, I contacted Uber customer service and they only said they would contact the driver and communicate with me and then the driver would not respond and they would call me, I am frustrated as those packages must reach my customers and I cannot fail them, it is the first time I used package service as my car doesn't work and I get away with this, I have security video where it is clearly seen that the driver carries the packages in hand, you must take responsibility for this
title: I requested Uber package service and stole my packages

review: I had a driver who had his phone between his legs texting and swerving into traffic, he went through multiple stop signs without stopping and even went through the red light to get on the expressway and also got hit by a semi. The only thing Uber did was give me $10 Uber cash. I was told that I would receive a response within 6-12 hours and it’s been longer than that with no response. I asked for a refund and to have my account deactivated, I have to pay my own hard earned money for someone to put my life in danger and it’s only worth $10 Uber cash…
title: I do not recommend

review: I’m telling you- this is the absolute first time this country girl has to use an Uber in San Francisco to get to ICU room straight out the airport. I couldn’t have asked for anything more- Uber made it easy, the description of the car the app gives and the directions were enough. And once in the car everything was wonderful. Right at ease with Khelaff. God Bless y’all!
title: First timer

review: Dawson was great. He came all the way from Fairbanks to pick me up in North Pole. I extended my trip to make it better worth his time. His rig was clean, he was clean and he has been a long time Fairbanks resident like myself so we had plenty to chat about. I was surprised how easy it was to get the ride and I expect to use the service again as well as recommending it to others.
title: Great first experience

review: Tonight was the first time I have used Uber since the Pandemic. I like the updated version of the app. My car arrived in a timely fashion. I did not have to wait a long time. DianeMarie was Great! We a nice conversation on the ride home. This is Good Uber! Because pre Pandemic I stopped using Uber due to the excessive minutia from male drivers .  I was reluctant this evening to use Uber services but DianeMarie was the saving grace.
title: First Time Since The Great Panini aka Pandemic

review: James Ford went above and beyond helping after being in a car accident. Even waiting at the pharmacy to fill my meds, helping me get a charger. Waiting extra time to make sure I was taken care of. He even helped me to my room with my belongings made sure I was A ok before he left. I recommend James Ford to everyone who needs to be picked up by Uber.
title: Excellent customer service

review: Excellent driver even better navigation skills got me through construction and extremely heavy traffic very quickly and found an alternate route that save me nine minutes in travel time! Got me to my destination ahead of schedule, and carried on an excellent conversation!! if I was able to give a six star review, I would highly recommend Jerrodfor all your Uber travels. Period.🙂😇
title: Driver, Jerrod

review: I had to get a ride to the airport for my elderly father and I needed someone who would be flexible on time. My dad was not ready when Greg showed up and Greg waited patiently for almost a half an hour. This is really the reason why I use Uber, Greg’s a great driver and got my dad to the airport without a hitch, which is a big concern for my family. These days, service means everything, this is why Greg earned a 25% tip.
title: Greg is great.

review: The constant update of Uber app makes me nervous as I depend on this app a lot. It’s hard to know when accessibility of voiceover is going to be broken. For example to make a phone call to contact the driver it’s just impossible to do. Every time I click call driver it just does not work using voiceover. As a blind person is very critical for me to use this feature so I can let the driver know where I am so he or she can find me. This needs to be fixed right away. This cannot be that complicated.
title: Accessibility issue for voiceover user who is blind

review:
I have never used any company such as Uber. My first experience will make me an Uber fan going forward. My driver was Roger and deserves 10 stars out of 5 (I get the math) but he was truly someone I would trust again and he represents his employer well. 
The Uber app was very easy to use, despite my anxiety of trusting that I would be picked up and dropped off on time. Uber did not disappoint.
title: First time rider

review: Uber is a fantastic idea and is super convenient when it works as it should. However, I think generally the other ride-sharing apps are better. I always open Uber and its competitor app to see which is faster and cheaper. Sometimes I will choose Uber even though it is more expensive because the wait time is lower, but many times UberX will show 3 or 4 minutes and as soon as I hit confirm it shoots up to 7, 10, or even 15 minutes. By that time if I cancel, I risk lowering my rating. It is getting super annoying and if it continues to happen I will stop using Uber altogether.
title: Great in Theory

review: Today started out very stressful, but it will get better. Today is my birthday and I had to figure out this ride sharing thing (😂yes I’m older). The first ride share company I tried showed me a price under $20 by the time I finished it was up to $50…for 7 miles! I downloaded Uber, I was very happy that I did. Sarah was very friendly and seems to enjoy what she does.
title: First Time Taking An Uber

review: I have been using Uber for a long time and really loved when you could “reserve” a car.  I did that as recently as 2 months ago and last night when I tried to reserve a car, the app would not let me, I tried it again early this morning to no avail.  My driver was very nice but I might have not been able to get one…
title: Unusual occurrence today

review:
If Uber doesn’t start incentivizing drivers to actually pick up their customers, then a nice looking app is pointless. Localities have much more reliable options that are just a bit harder to find. Uber is expensive and has horribly long wait times because drivers just drive away for ten minutes without any penalty.

Over it. Switching to local cab options.
title: Consistently, drivers accept the ride and speed off in the other direction

review: First time user and only time user. My “5 star” host gave us a dirty car. Tried to blame us for booking our vehicle late. She told us we could go get it cleaned ourselves. Then when we returned the vehicle, she claimed that we had left “cannabis” all over her car. The pictures of the interior did not even match the pictures of the car we had and you can tell by the first pictures they uploaded. Interiors did not match. Tried to talk to Turo “support” but they don’t care and just sided with the host. Just be careful with the hosts you choose to rent from if you choose to use this app.
title: Easy to use app, support and hosts stink.

review: I have taken Uber in the United States and several states I have taken Uber in Europe throughout Italy, France, and a couple other countries. The bottom line is that it works. It is convenient, and I’ve never experienced any difficulty with any of the drivers. In fact, they have all been extremely professional and friendly.
title: It just works right

review: I’ve never Uber’d for transport before but it’s very convenient. Kodi was our driver here in New Orleans and his driving was good but his conversation was better. Having someone else drive you, especially a stranger, can make for a very anxious ride but good conversation goes along way and Kodi certainly made good talk. His ride was clean and comfortable. His driving was careful and considerate. I definitely recommend Uber and Kodi.
title: Good conversation

review: Alex had a difficult time finding the right location, however he didn’t give up until he found me.  He was very apologetic, even though he was not really late, his eta was 2 mins behind, he was more upset then I was, in fact I hadn’t noticed until he pointed it out to me and apologized over and over again.  Alex is the kind of person any service organization would be lucky to employ.  Good job Alex!
title: Hard Worker

review: My Uber driver Kizzee, was such a chivalrous person. I am going on a long trip so I packed 2 suitcases so I was worried how I was going to roll two bags simultaneously but Kizzee got out of the car, opened my door, picked up my bags without me having to ask for help and put them in the trunk. He was so chivalrous, respectful, and he was so pleasant to converse with. I was blown away with such a positive Uber experience.
title: Exceptional Service

review: Make sure to never have any problems occur with uber because all they will do is repeatedly send you the same automated response no matter what you say to them. Been trying to get back into my account because they locked it over fraudulent charges that my bank refunded me for. All they have done is sent me the same fake message and link to pay despite me explaining the situation at least 10 times. They have no phone number or live chat to talk to because they don’t want to fix your problems just take your money. Corporate greed in full effect.
title: Trash customer support
developerResponse: {'id': 34764326, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-02-09T05:35:55Z'}

review: While I like the convenience of the app for both food and rides, I absolutely hate the routing the app gives to drivers.  My trips would be significantly shorter if drivers would take the best route.  They won’t take the best route because the app directs them to a longer, more expensive way every single time.  Please add the possibility of picking the route the customer wishes to be taken.  Not only do we know more about our local roads, it’s actually safer and easier to identify if the drivers are taking the correct route.
title: Routing is terrible.

review: It was such a treat to be picked up by such a quality man as Faisal. He treated me with the upmost respect, and was so kind. He even waited for me when I was late. Also, his car was spotless, and he drove absolutely perfect and made me feel at such ease. This is the best experience I’ve ever had with an Uber driver, and I hope that everyone gets to experience Faisal one day. It is such a treat it will make your life better.
title: Faizul

review:
Our Driver Auberuto in San Juan Puerto Rico was Fantastic. When we get back to Puerto Rico, we will ask for him again!!
I canceled two reservations prior to this one because of confusion on address. The app has charged me 5 times. The ride was delayed due to traffic. Uber tried to contact me multiple times in Spanish to make sure everything was okay. Sorry I don’t speak Spanish. According to our driver it appears that Uber cancelled our trip right when we arrived at the port. No way to contact a real person. Not happy with the app!!!
title: Uber Driver was Fantastic!! Uber app, not so good.

review:
I logged in to book my first Uber trip since February 2021 today. I was very surprised ti see at 35 minute ETA. A quick Google search showed me this is not uncommon in the last year. Various articles provided different reasons but whatever the cause, Uber needs to get their arrival times below 10 minutes max. 

Anish, the driver for this trip, was great and his service was perfect.
title: 35 minute wait?

review: They are horrible!!!! The drivers do not take you where you ask to go!!!! They take you where they want to go. If you complain to Uber they will not refund your money. They add extra charges. How does adding extra charges help me? They just rip you off any way they can. The driver told me to cancel and redo my trip and what do I get extra fees. And I still was not taken where I was asked to go!!!!! And, I wanted the fee refunded because the driver is to blame if she had told me I would be charged extra I would of said no just go to where I asked to go and uber will just block your from contacting them.
title: Uber

review: I’ve had great service with Uber drivers and use of the app for cars.  But WARNING do not use for food deliveries unless you are happy to risk exorbitant cancellation fees.  In our case, we cancelled a mistaken order within 3 minutes, confirmed with the vendor that they never began the order and did not charge us, but Uber Eats still charged us the FULL value of the order.  Customer service could not be swayed and we disputed the charge through the credit card company- complete hassle.
title: 3 Up, 2 Down

review: The lady that canceled my trip lied to my face,I asked her three times ,the first two times she seen me and she was not trying to have eye contact, she texted me before coming said she was on the way,I’m Muslim and I had my cuffie on,is why she didn’t want to take me,tge third time I actually asked her first two times was gestures trying to approach her,so she rolled the window down, I asked her was she here to pick up Reginald,she lol me in my face and told me no,I would have respected her more if she just told me she wasn’t taking the trip,imma good Muslim,I pray 5 times a day to deal with people like her,probably a Christian lol,all they do is lie
title: Driver of CT’s black

review: I called a ride at 8pm, and by 830 the ride was never called. After 30min of waiting I cancelled and tried again and Uber immediately linked me with another driver for twice the money. Uber doesn’t care about you, even if you call a ride. If they want to raises the price while you are waiting outside they will
title: Tried to overcharge me even after ride was ordered

review: Since there’s no way to contact Uber I guess I’ll have to do it on here! How is it that I spend $60-$70 a week on Uber and I haven’t earned not one point in about a year! And it said on your app that you are not stopping with the point until November 2022, so I don’t find it fair anyway even if there was something that could be done that I only have a month to gather any points! How come I haven’t been earning any points? I know I’m signed in! And why is it impossible to contact Uber if we have a problem? It’s very frustrating!
title: How come no points?

review: A tricky feature that confuses people especially when you want to cancel it. I made a reservation for a 11:30 PM ride thinking that I will go home late. But since I could go home an hour earlier, I tried to cancel it and wanted to get another ride. But the app does not work to cancel even I tried many times. So, I went to get another Uber ride and went home. Now, Uber is charging me $45 for my cancellation fee? The Reason,  to compensate the unknown driver that went to pick me up from a designated place at 11:30PM but I’m already home from an Uber ride. What the heck! This is crazy! Now, I’m over with Uber!
title: Reservation

review: My friends and I went to Atlanta and a trip was canceled due to the driver not picking us up but still started the trip in progress. I immediately submitted a refund request and it was taken care of ASAP! I was not paying for a trip that I didn’t even take and it wasn’t our fault. We enjoyed using the Ubers around the city and had great drivers!
title: Quick with refunds

review: I travel a lot I depend on company like Uber as seeing how I have a health condition that keeps me from moving to much or walking I use Uber to doctors appointments that sometimes are out of state I don’t get rides from hospitals I contacted Uber several times it keeps me going to bed hungry with no food depending on Uber in a state and city I’ve never been and don’t have anything I’m use to to go to a painful appointment supposed to eat for procedures and I order food at 5 it never showed up it then canceled and told me sorry I can’t tell my doctor sorry I didn’t eat and when I’m stranded at airport what do I do
title: Never ever what Uber promises

review:
I spend hundreds on Uber every month, but for some reason Uber has started to still send push notification ads with no way to disable them. 

To keep using Uber I will need to disable all push notifications, including needed driver messages. 

What’s growth product Manager thought this was a good idea??
title: Unstoppable push notification ads

review: after being an uber user for years, i am severely dissatisfied. there are multiple times where i cant get an uber because the driver wont take the ride and it wont offer it to another driver, itll just show me the same car waiting for 20 minutes but not give me the ride. then when i cancel that to try to get a Comfort Car or a different one, it says “its busy, rates are a lot higher than usual” and tries to charge me over $50 to go less than 7 miles (15 minutes away) which is absolutely ridiculous. i am fed up with the unreliability and inconsistency of Uber.
title: absolutely horrible

review: I received a text from Uber saying that someone will be picked up and will be on his way to us soon. I don’t know the person but when I logged into Uber, his ride showed up. I tried to contact Uber to tell them the driver (a young looking woman) might be in danger because it appeared the rider was using my app fraudulently. There wasn’t an option in help for that nor is there a number to call and get that sort of help. As a woman, I was really scared for the driver, but my hands were tied by the poor decision to not have a number that you can talk to a live person. Shame on you!
title: It’s a super scary way to do business.

review: I do not plan to use uber anymore. As i had a issue a while back where somehow my pick up and drop off location were the same spot. I was charged $21 for someone hanging out at my hotel when I was across town trying to get a ride there. I’ve never had this happen did not know what to do. Tried getting contact with customer support. My only options were to blame the driver for a list of different reasons. It wasn’t a driver issue it was an app issue. But Uber doesn’t have customer service to help. But it’s fine I use Lyft when using Lyft and no issues.
title: No customer support

review: After endless “go to payment method and add fund” They started telling me the stupid credit stuff. I do not have any credit and I do know how to add fund it’s just won’t let me. I have clicked the add fund button many times and nothing happened! Stop copying and pasting the meaningless stuff. All these contacts act like robots. It’s ridiculous!
title: There is no customer service at all

review: I’ve had two experiences where drivers left me waiting for over 30min but would not cancel and if I canceled I was going to be charged. It is entirely too difficult to figure out how to file a complaint to get my money back. If the arrival time reflects a specific time, UBER should have an alert within the app to charge the driver or discount the rider or cancel the d driver to find another closer available driver  if the original driver is more than 10min late and/ or allow a reason why the rider will cancel or some sort of penalty put in place for drivers who misuse the app.
title: Drivers are not held Accountable

review:
Why even offer using Apple Pay if you can’t use it conveniently?

My car broke down and I figured this was cheaper than renting a car. Since this is for work commuting, I figured I’d always schedule my trips in advance for maximum convenience. in finding that there’s a discount for using Apple Pay, I was excited.

But nooooo. We can’t use Apple Pay for scheduled trips? Why? And if you can’t really USE the Apple Pay, why even bother offering it? Please fix this.
title: No Apple Pay for scheduled trips

review: I’m a busy person and don’t have a car yet and need to get around in a decent amount of time. Lately Uber has been giving me drivers that are 15+ minuets away! Today I even requested a driver 10 MINUETS before I arrived at a certain spot to be picked up from and it gave me one 7 minuets away. Then OUT OF NOWHERE IT CHANGES TO A DRIVER THAT IS 21 MINUETS AWAY!!!! I can’t believe this because my time is very precious and I have to be at places very punctually. I’m appalled that it CHANGED THE DRIVER! I hate this app and lyft isn’t any better. I would give this app negative 100 stars if I could and I hate that I have no choice but to rely on this garbage app.
title: PURPOSEFULLY GIVES ME DRIVERS THAT ARE FURTHER!

review: Please fix the app to verify the credit card that is used. I have a business (work) credit card and a personal credit card. The Business Profile sometimes charges to my personal card and my personal profile sometimes charges my business credit card. I should not have to put in payment change requests because the app does not verify the correct payment card.
title: Fix payment method selection

review:
The times to pickup and drop off the app provides consistently overpromise and under deliver. 5 minutes to pickup? It’s really 15+, never 5. Uber has all the data to provide accurate info, but chooses to lie so you don’t use another app. 
My last driver accepted the ride, never picked me up and went on a 45 minute joyride while I waited in sun freezing weather. Customer service offered nothing but victim blaming. 
The company is notorious for being a bunch of SF bros who don’t look after their drivers. Guess they don’t look after their customers either. Deleted after this last encounter.
title: Times are blatantly wrong, service is nothing but excuses

review:
Uber has not been providing accurate information about what the approximate arrival time would be before you get matched to a driver. If I knew I had to wait 20 minutes for my driver to arrive, I wouldn’t have confirmed my ride and would have looked on another app before doing so.
I also think Uber needs to allow passengers to cancel rides because some drivers just take way too long to get to the pick up spot because they get lost (at least it looks like it on the map) and so sometimes the wait time drags on forever.
title: Has been disappointing lately

review: I use Uber often but the cancellation fees and the wait times are starting to really annoy me. I order Uber’s that say 10 minute wait then I’m stuck waiting 20-25 minutes making me late sometimes. But the main issue is the cancellation fee lately when I order a Uber the drive has been about 10 minutes away but after accepting my ride they just stop and sit in one spot for 10 - 30 minutes sometimes and I have places to be so I cancel to get another driver then I’m charged a fee for a driver not coming to pick me up like I’m paying for.
title: Cancellation fee and wait time

review: If we could request specific drivers, I would request the young lady that I had today! My car had broken down and she was so patient as I was having to gather things out of my car. She also provided a very pleasant conversation during my ride to work! Very kind. She also arrived within the expected arrival time!
title: Special Request

review: I never order Uber rides anymore. Haven’t for a long time. I was not in shape to drive today and I was grateful to have a ride where I felt safe and taken care of. John was kind, personable and the minimal conversation we had was….easy. I would order a ride again if I should need it, but I’d love John as my driver. Amazing ride for a space where I did not feel to well at the time.
title: Uber Driver - John

review:
My driver, Mohammed, was kind, helpful, and a safe and excellent driver!

However, I’m down rating Uber because as I logged on for my very first Uber experience, the pricing was $86. I entered credit card info, then hesitating to clarify how the process worked, I returned to app to confirm, all pricing options had suddenly jumped to over $109! I checked for any ‘coupons’ to get closer to original price options, but no luck. Bait & switch is not a good practice, Uber!

I hope you treat your excellent driver better than you treat your customer.
title: Excellent driver, but poor pricing protocol!

review:
I am staying at The Peninsula Hotel in room 1617 LaBarge and left an umbrella and raincoat in the car. If the driver could drop them off I would pay the Uber cost again. 

Also my current password is not being accepted and while my cell phone is correct my e mail address is no longer current and I cannot find a way to update my e mail to the current one.
title: Left an umbrella and raincoat in the car

review: After I reserved a drop off I needed to change a pick up time which was less than one hour away, but was actually 55 minutes away. I was going to be charged a $33 cancellation fee so I had to wait one hour so I was not charged the fee. I am disappointed that Uber does not allow a change which is over 45 minutes in advance. That is a long time to wait!
title: Reserved ride cancellation policy

review: If I could give this app a zero I would. The app and its drivers do not care to get you where you need to be on time- or where you need to be at all. I've had multiple times where I needed to get to work and I was constantly late because Uber would get a driver not even close to me, increasing the estimated time way past what it was promised initially. And on top of the unnecessary long waiting time, some of these drivers would cancel the ride last minute! Now I have to scramble to find ANOTHER driver with the fare tripled then when I initially requested. This is unbelievable. Do better.
title: Went downhill

review:
I don’t know how to get in touch with ANYONE from uber.  So i will put it here.! 
I clicked on ride share option that says up to 20%… i got 6%!  What do you have to do to get 20%?  Also, either person was at wrong location uber sent us to wrong location,  ended waiting over 5 minutes for passenger.  Added 20 minutes to my ride!
title: 20% ride share hoax

review: Planned a scheduled ride with Uber 1 week in advance since I was flying to Tampa late at night, the driver canceled on me and others coming in for the same training program. so I called Uber for my money back since that was all the money I had left. Uber told me everything would be taken of and they will get another ride for me. That was a lie, they hung up and when I called again they kept transferring calls so I was left stranded at the airport. Uber doesn’t keep their word they let terrible drivers take your money and they never take care of their customers.
title: Terrible customer service

review: Timothy was excellent.  However, the cost seems excessive.  It is not Tim’s fault.  We ordered an Uber and was told by Sahin he would be the driver.  The cost would have been under $200.  He kept informing us of his location up to him being 10 minutes away.  Then there was no more contact.  We had to start over and there were no Uber drivers available at the lower rate so we had to use Tim.  Additionally, there was no mention that tolls would be added on.
title: Unanticipated Cost

review: I used to get rides on time for work, however every time I order an Uber, it’ll say I’ll be at work 10 minutes prior to work at the latest, and by the time I get an Uber I end up being 10-20 minutes late instead. Not only that but it’s happened multiple times where it’ll say a rider is 5 minutes away, and they’ll stay 5 minutes away for 20-25 minutes. How is that possible? Then I end up being late and looking bad at work. My car broke down unfortunately, and unfortunately there aren’t many ways to transport to work.
title: Rides don’t come on time

review: Several times now, including today, Uber directed the driver to another location than where I was. Today it was the alley behind the build as I waited in front of the building. And one of the many times, it was in San Francisco, right at a major intersection downtown, the driver said he could not find me & left, costing me dearly. (I was late for my appointment) Uber paid the driver & charged me. And of course with these tech companies, it is all one sided, You get to talk to a computer or bot instead of a human being. Sure hope someone comes up with an alternative to them.
title: Frustrated with Uber & their technology

review: What are the odds that one car gets towed and when you hop in the other one to drive to the mechanic and pick up the loaner vehicle that your second car won’t start?  That was how this morning began, but thanks to our driver we were able to get to work!  Thanks for all of your help, friendliness and willingness to add another stop so we wouldn’t be late!!
title: Thank you!

review:
I don’t know why I had to redo all my payment options for the app.  Took more than 30 minutes to do.  Many times it appeared to take it but then after pushing buy it came back and said invalid payment or it was wrong or something else.
Wouldn’t take my business debt card anymore, nor Apple Pay balance, think I had to try PayPal or business checking for it to work.
Don’t trust it will work immediately,  prepare way prior to booking a ride!!
title: Payment types

review:
Luis is an amazing driver, he made the drive smooth, car was super clean, and his conversation was on point.
 I was impressed at how fast he got to us at LAX and in the time in which he got us home was done in a timely manner. 
This was my Mom’s first time using the Uber service and she was in awe of the service that was provided by Luis and she made sure to remind me to write a good review.
title: Excellent Driver, better person.

review: My only problem with my Uber rides today is that I am not dropped at my requested location.  We were dropped off a block -est- from where our bus would pickup then this afternoon we were about that same distance to our pickup.  If this is how it is done please explain to the customer - I am a first time user and appreciative of the service but in a city I know nothing about it was rather scary
title: Location

review: This driver was a gift from God this morning as I sat with my anxious kiddos scared of a psa test! Not only was I able to relax while he drove us. The atmosphere he brought was uplifting our spirits! Thx again for sending an angel driver to us! Please send him our deepest positive vibes for his time! We sent him a 8% gratuity tip! I don’t write reviews but he was too exceptional not to give credit!
title: Customer service is exceptional

review: When needed the app worked well. Transportation and safety was there, quality drivers during my trip to Chicago. Reason for the three star is due to the fact you can’t cancel the membership if you are within 7 days of the membership renewing, or 7 days after. I get this is to try and prevent having to charge back/pro-rate rides or discounts, but I’ve been chasing this for 4 months and haven’t been able to cancel. Finally after doing research found the 7 day thing.
title: Good luck canceling. Rides were great, poor ending.

review:
Drivers are assigned new riders while still in the MIDDLE of completing other rides. The customer is given an “estimated time” that is based off of flawed data. These estimates are rarely accurate. Often wildly inaccurate. 

Uber pays drivers less while placing them in terrible circumstances. Assign new riders AFTER the driver completes a ride. The customers are suffering because of Uber’s greed and poor logistical planning. Pay the drivers more (the way the company was built) and more people will want to drive for Uber. More drives, better customer experience. Or buy another yacht.
title: Greed has ruined the customer experience.

review: We flew into Miami last night and needed an Uber XL due to lots of luggage. Initial check of rates was $160 to our home. Two minutes later it was $203. Timing for driver to arrive for pickup was initially 2 minutes. When selected it was 6 minutes then went to 8 minutes. It actually took over 15 minutes. The airport was not busy. The driver did not speak any English only Spanish. His car had a headlight out so he was forced to drive with his high beams on for the 79 mile trip home. What’s happened to Uber. Don’t even get me started about Uber eats.
title: Miami Trip

review:
Alexander arrived 5 minutes Early at our Rental Car Lot and drove us to the airport without a problem at all. We saved $65 by using Uber instead of ‘off hour’ car service offered to us for a fee of $110! We chose the comfort option with Uber so we paid a little more but I’m sure the standard option would have been Fine! Thx Alexander and Uber

Mike
title: Mike

review: Drivers did not speak English and I did not speak Portuguese. We had difficulty talking on the phone to meet. First one cancelled. I didn’t have enough time to find the pickup location at the airport. Second driver sounded like he was asking me to let him speak to an officer. I found one and it worked out great. The driver and police officer were kind and patient considering the circumstances. I will continue using Uber. It is convenient. I understand language barriers can be a challenge.
title: Language barriers

review: I bought a gift card to set aside an allowance to use for Uber.  I loaded this to my account and every time I’d go to use it, I got an error saying to “try another payment method”. I wrote support numerous times over a period of 2 months. I was told the issue was fixed a couple of times (it wasn’t), that the issue would be escalated to the tech team (it wasn’t) and that I have a problem with another form of payment on my account (I don’t). The support team gives any old generic answer to a problem without looking into or fixing it. Don’t buy Uber gift cards!!
title: Uber Scammed me out of $110

review: First time using Uber-EVER! It was super easy, very smooth and Luigi picked us up just as our bags came out to claim area. We were able to see just where he was and when he arrived. Perfect and reasonable with a great person to drive us. He knew where we were going and how to manage traffic in Orlando. We did not. Another plus for using Uber. Great app. Great service.
title: First time Uber user

review:
Used Uber eats to order food, said the driver picked it up and then got a message that “all items have been removed” and we were unable to contact the drive. Then 30 minutes later out of the blue, it said items were delivered but we could not find them anywhere. 

When asking for a refund, they clearly use a bot that continues to repeat the order is “not eligible for a refund” even though the food was never delivered. How are issues supposed to be resolved if it’s just formulaic answers with no other way to get information/help?
title: Terrible customer service

review: We ordered an Uber. We waited for 20 minutes and when he arrived, we got in the car only to be told rudely to get out that he wasn’t driving that far. It was a 15 minute Uber ride. We protested as we waited that long. He was extremely rude and then started talking down to my girlfriend like she wasn’t even human. Literally the worst experience I’ve had with any company. Uber support did nothing because they claimed refunding my money was good enough. Allowing employees to display these actions make them your actions as well. Therefore Uber is sexist and will not get my business ever again.
title: Customer support allows sexism

review: I’ve been using Uber to get to and from for a while now. If I’m being really honest I wish there was an option to choose wether u prefer English or Spanish drivers because everytime I get a Hispanic driver they get lost and don’t know where to go and because I don’t know Spanish it’s hard and even when I use google translate it still doesn’t work. I’ve spent over twenty dollars one time paying for TWO more Ubers because they all couldn’t understand me. And then it takes forever for me to get a ride in the morning.
title: The honest truth
developerResponse: {'id': 34628936, 'body': "Hi, we're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-02-02T07:14:39Z'}

review: I made a reservation about a week ago for today at 3:15 am, and it confirm via email since, but today nobody showed up and had to call for another rude at the last minute. Uber should confirm by a call or message confirming  the ride the day before to make sure that the passenger is notified and fir the peace of mind of the rider. Very disappointed about that.
title: No show

review: After my drop off at the airport, I realized I had left my purse in the cab.  I panicked with no phone.  The airport called Uber and we were able to get them enough information to contact my driver.  After 30 min, he arrived with my lost purse and I was able to make my flight!  Thank you for ALL your help!  Your drivers are kind and trustworthy!
title: Excellent service

review: Over the past year, I’ve had a few different cancellations after you wait about 10 minutes plus and then they say driver canceled, just never used to happen once they found out where they’re going, they pick and choose too often and leave the client stranded
title: To many times I’ve been cancelled?
