Why leave someone waiting for so long? (My rating is close to 5 stars)
title: Unreliable Rides

review: WoW!  He knows his way around.  Courteous Friendly, he picked me up within minutes of me finally installing the ap & figuring it out - ( I will be 70 next B’day.). This was my first Uber ever.  Jose has set the satisfaction bar really high for anyone who follows him.  You got me there on time in a relaxed atmosphere as if there were no growing rush hour traffic.  Well Done. Good Driver.  Nice Car.  Thanks.
title: Jose’s ride !

review:
My family and I used the service to and from the airport. I gave the service going to the airport 4 stars because he didn’t offer AC and instead opened the windows in the express way. The service coming from the airport was bad and I gave it two stars because of politeness, cleanliness, and bad odor, and again no AC was offered but windows open in the express way. Maybe they do not use AC to save on gas. 
Without a clima control the trips are unpleasantly.
title: Clima control

review:
The app needs to do something about cancel after waiting.  At Newark airport I waited for two rides. Both cancelled after they got there. I think they also got rides on another app as I saw “my” car (black Tesla) with someone else git in and drive off. At first I thought it was not my ride but after it drove off and my ride — which was showing as arriving then cancelled it seemed obvious it was “my” ride. 

Cancelling like that should really hurt the rating. One driver was a 5.0 rating and the other was 4.9 — it would have been faster to take a cab.
title: Cancelling after waiting

review:
I was on vacation on Maui. Ordered Taco Bell around 10:30 pm for me and my kids. 
I got notification that order will be delivered by 11 pm. Latest by 12:20 am.
The order kept on delaying by 10 minute durations. 
Finally I asked for a refund and customer service guys kept on sending same answers that it will be delivered by 12:20 am. Finally at 12:05 am. They cancelled the order.
By that time I had talked to 3 customer service representatives. The last one asked me to wait 3 minutes while he gets a “resolution” on the issue. After 5 minutes comes back and says we are sorry and you will not be charged. 
Waiting for 2 hours on an order which they ultimately cancelled and he was helping me by telling me that I won’t be charged. 
Cancelling my Uber and Uber eats account. Door dash and other services are a lot better. More reliable. Never coming back to Uber.
title: Terrible experience - stuck in Maui

review: FIX THE SYSTEM FOR CONFIRMING PICK UPS!!!!!! It takes longer than usual and sometimes no pick up is confirmed states that a driver will confirm the pick up within 10 minutes (something like that), IT DOES NOT WORK! Also, when loading a driver, it locates one nearby, but it’s like the system freezes and all you see is the driver details loading with a driver nearby is  on screen but no ride pick up is confirmed. Because of this, I was late for work and nearly fired. Uber is good, but needs to be more responsible and can be improved and better!
title: Waiting to Confirm a Pick Up

review:
Some of the time these Uber agents thinks you are an idiot, when you call them about a situation or to resolve a problem. They always tell you, delete, install app again and you will be fine. THAT IS A LIE. 
They tell you to go to a better area where there is a high demand but you are in a high demand.
When the app has a problem, they don’t tell you until you call them and their is long wait now. 
They transfer you to multiple agents or they just hang up on you.
Customers don’t tip anymore so if you think picking a 2 3 5 dollars orders thinking you might get a bigger tip, 😂😂😂.
Orders only come better only at night time.
It’s a shame when you are trying to understand something but they keep saying, Your account is good and no problem bye bye and your like what the what.
Don’t let Uber f up your car for low demands.
Found something else because it’s time.
title: Disappointed

review: Te lost item function is so trash. I lost my wifi puk in Australia and when I tried using the option on the app, all I got was for them to call me back.  How I’m I going to receive a call to my phone number if my phone number isn’t connected. There should be a way to receive calls in the app. And when they tried calling me, which obviously didn’t go through, the blocked the contact driver option. It’s been about a week now and I haven’t heard from Uber or anything. That’s why I prefer using Lyft and unfortunately there’s no Lyft in Australia.
title: Lost item

review: I was picked up on time by the amazing driver. His car was clean. He was clean. He was well mannered he knew how to have a conversation with his customers. We got to the airport on time. There was no cussing and swearing about traffic. I would ride with him anytime my first Uber ride from the Omni hotel Yale. To the LaGuardia airport American Airlines an amazing experience.
title: From the Omni hotel, Yale in New Haven, Connecticut to the LaGuardia airport

review: I use both national apps for service . Uber hands down dominance on when others fail to render services hands down . I’ll flip between both Lyft & Uber to compare time and price Uber faster cheaper and there employees honestly are funny and new to the country majority I’ve notice full of life . Lyft feels like teens at fast food business running it Smdh .
title: Life Saver

review: I have lower back  issues so  Coco helped me with all my bags. She was sweet and uplifting . I wasn’t having a good day until  i spoke to her . She listened to me.  She made me feel better. I felt she was a safe driver, was puntual and easy to be around. Thank you! I never written an U er review so this is just to show how much it meant to me to feel supported in every way.
title: My ride with Miss  Coco

review: I sit for a painstaking hour everytime I request an uber and my app will either reset the search or just not call me a ride. If punctuality is a must, I would not recommend using uber all the time. They have a non existent support system when I would rather speak to a representative. I have been sitting once again for hours waiting for a ride “confirmation” and I am booked with a driver an hour away instead of the five drivers within a mile of my location. I would very much like feedback and a discussion with someone or im chucking this app.
title: Slow to confirm

review: The Uber app was playing about when I landed in Dallas/ Fort Worth airport. However when it finally resolved, then Douglas was with me in a couple of minutes. A cool car on a stuffy, stormy day was welcome, as was Douglas’ sunny disposition and laid back Kenny G smooth jazz. He was a safe pair of hands and a level head in some crazy local traffic! I was blessed to have a great talk with him; he was a warm welcome to Texas.
title: Great welcome to Texas

review: Had two bugs cause me to order double my Uber eats order. Uber customer service wasn’t able to help me because they couldn’t look up my order with my account information because I was a participant but not the one who placed the order. Interesting story given that I was able to look up my own order from my account. Must be another bug on their end? Or maybe just creating their own loop hole to jump through so we don’t have to take responsibility for our own app. Pretty terrible Uber…
title: Full of bugs and bad customer service

review:
Badly need a telephone number for emergency customer service. I reserved a ride for an airport drop for an international flight. Got my driver only 10 minutes before my scheduled pickup time. No alerts or message updates from Uber before then.
I was panicked and very tense.
No telephone number to call. Asked a friend to drop me in case my Uber didn’t come.
Sent a message and got a chatbot response from Uber 10 minutes after I was already in the car. Wanted me to go to the Activity tab in the app. I had been there for almost 15 minutes. Totally unacceptable.
No understanding of customer service in the business model. Reserving is paying extra to secure a confirmed ride for peace of mind.
I would have missed my flight as I had no other transportation means available at such short time.
Really need to get your act together!
title: Contacting Uber

review:
Thank you so much for my first time using Uber , was such an easy and safe experience!! Was very pleased to work the app and it be so easy , I’m not great with reading or electronics! My driver kenneth was very kind and professional! My daughter really enjoyed her ride home , the driver made her feel safe and comfortable! When we got home 
she said I like that man !
title: My first Uber ride

review: The past two months have been terrible for uber in houston. Cars circle and circle and never pick up. Trips reserved in advance (8 hours and also 40 mins) are canceled due to an inability to find a driver. Cars 3 blocks away circle around in circuitous routes often doubling time to show up. What is going on? I have started using black car service to avoid the uncertainty. Even booked a car to drive to airport and car showed up and driver saw suitcase and refused to take to airport. Uber is broken.
title: Uber is broken in Houston

review: Made a reservation a day in advance for pickup at the airport. The plane landed 10 minutes early, I spoke with the driver before getting off the plane about the pickup location. Within 10 minutes I received an alert of a new driver that was 45 minutes away. What is the point of making a reservation based on the flight arrival time if an Uber driver will not honor the arrangement. When I tried to cancel the ride for closer and cheaper ride, the app indicated I would be charged for the cancellation fee at a rate higher than the original cost.
title: Scheduled airport pickup didn’t work

review: Ayyy! Most of the time, the drivers are pretty dope! There are some of them who try to game the system but the customer service don’t play and can help you with those issues! This app id recommend it for anyone just going to a city for a few days and need a quick, simple, and decent safety standards to get around town!
title: Traveling made fun!

review: Today was my very 1st. time using Uber. I had no transportation to my doctors appt., therefore I had to use Uber. I was afraid at 1st. b/c I’m disabled walking with a cane. He was so patient & kind!! Wordz can’t begin to explain how blessed I was to have Mr. Migaul has my Uber driver, I prayed to have a good driver, 😇an Angel! Mr. Mughal was exceptional, an AWSOME driver!😇Thx for sending him as my driver!🙏🏾 He ‘s the reason I pla to continue to!🙌🏾🙌🏾👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽My RATE:⭐️⭐️🌟⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️🌟
title: Re: Miguel’s ratting review.

review: I have tried so many times do use or option to wait for a car to come like 10 minutes later or whatever and it’s just a nightmare when you do that on the app it’s very confusing whether you’ve actually ordered a car or not etc.
title: Waiting option

review: Tarun picked me up at the Halifax airport. First time taking Uber from this location (plus tired after a red eye flight), I had difficulty finding the pick up spot (on a different level, across the street and closer to Departures). Tarun called and guided me there, handled my bags and took excellent care of me. He was courteous, professional, helpful and got me to my destination efficiently.
title: Tarun was amazing

review: I am someone in a crap position right now so I have been having to use Uber to get to/from work daily. For the most part it has been a great, mostly affordable option. The past couple wks however have progressively gotten worse!!!! Takes a minimum of AN HOUR to get a driver! Sometimes it says someone is 5 mins away but seemingly gets stuck not finalizing completely only to timeout & you’re back to square one! WHY OFFER A SERVICE IN AN AREA YOU CANNOT SEEM TO GET SERVICE TO?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? HOW DO YOU NOT HAVE WAYS TO COMPENSATE CUSTOMERS WHEN THIS HAPPENS?!?!?!? WHY ARE YOU OK FORCING PPL TO BUILD UNRELIABLE REPUTATIONS SOLELY BASED ON THE ABILITY TO GET TO WORK?!?!?!?!
title: WORSE AND WORSE BY THE DAY!

review: I scheduled a pick up for my grandson and the driver Maria, never called or came to the house. I watched her stop at Whole Foods and come past the guards. She turned onto our street but kept going past the house. My grandson was very late to school as I had to schedule another driver. He arrived, was very polite and got my grandson to school safely Maria deserved no stars for this trip
title: Driver never arrived

review: Excellent driver! Eduardo was on time and I didn’t have to wait on him. The app only allowed me to put in a limited location to pick-up. I was a little ways away from the original pick-up, but he was able to find me and get me to my destination! Wish I could use this driver for all of my future rides.
title: Excellent Driver & Service

review: We wasted 15 minutes of our time trying to secure a ride to a specific part of town, but driver after driver kept canceling. Each of us who attempted to secure a ride have 5 star ratings on Uber. Despite this, we never secured a ride, and Uber eventually told us that the route was “unavailable at this time,” and to “try again later.” Trying again later doesn’t fly when we need a ride NOW! If I can’t trust Uber to guarantee my way back home, then it’s existence should be illegal. Get out of the taxi industry’s way immediately.
title: Unreliable trash. I’ll take a taxi instead.

review:
The Uber app works so intuitively, my thumb can call a driver with only light supervision.

My only complaint about the app is really about promotional notifications. I’ve found them distracting enough that I’ve begun turning notifications off and then turning them on when I need an Uber ride. If there’s a separate toggle for promotional notifications, I’ve overlooked it, and I would surely use it if I found it.
title: “Thumb” a Ride!

review:
Anyone had a case where the ride suddenly gets cancelled, or there's a "bug" or "freeze" or something odd, and when you schedule a new trip, the fare has hiked? I'm sure everyone reading this knows it. They undoubtedly force freeze to make you pay more and hide it under the guise of "its your fault"

When you try to get your account and data deleted, good luck. They'll do anything to avoid stopping processing your data.

8 years with Uber. Total scam. I'm out, and you're deleting my data whether you like it or not
title: Use Lyft, this company has become a total scam

review: From the moment he pulled up, he made us feel welcomed to Houston.  He gave us insite about where to eat, sites to see, and things to do in general.  He was the perfect mix of friendly and professional.  I appreciate his service and would definitely recommend and/or request (if I could) his service to anyone.
title: Randall was the best Uber driver I ever rode with.

review: Got on the app to book a ride home to JoCo from KCI just moments before 8pm. We paused as our luggage came off the carousel, we went back to finishing the trip request, by then it was 1 minute after. We were stunned to see that our fare jumped from $46 up to $82. Didn’t have much of a choice at that point. Our driver told us he was the same driver that responded to both requests just 3 minutes apart. He didn’t make any more on the trip; gouge and money grab by Uber just because it was “late hours” after 8 o’clock.
title: Jacked up fare

review: Why, in large, Uber is a pretty convenient. Way to get a ride to and from the airport. I have two major complaints however. Number one is that the mapping software directs the driver to the wrong location, and there’s no way to get that updated. Number two is that there is no way to communicate with Uber to talk about any problems that you have except through their online system, which they never respond to.
title: Uber review

review: Been stuck for more than 24hrs in a foreign country as my passport dropped in an Uber. No one responds. The driver does not respond and Uber does not respond. Whether they find or not my passport is a different story but the total and complete lack of support it’s absolutely ridiculous, in any other industry this would be completely unacceptable.
title: Worst Customer Service Ever

review: First I had an issue with an Uber eats order . The food was burnt. Uber told me to contact the restaurant and the restaurant told me to contact Uber. King story short I didn’t get a refund (so now I use doordash for food orders. Secondly Uber rides always seem to go down the wrong street. They claim it’s the Uber maps app. I also get charged for Uber one days before I was supposed to, and guess what the cancel option in the app is no where to be found. Sometimes it’s there and sometimes not.
title: 2 Star Review: Good luck Getting support from Uber support

review: It takes SO long to get an uber. sometimes it’ll take over 30 mins to find a car but I live in a huge city. it’s a recent glitch I think because just a few months ago it wasn’t like this. i’m an uber one customer so this especially bothers me. just yesterday I was leaving a busy airport in the uber pick up section and it took me 40 minutes to get a car - saying there were no ubers available 3 times. meanwhile everyone around me was getting ubers just fine. it’s so annoying I use uber every day please fix this.
title: The app has been so bad lately

review: I’ve had plenty of alright drivers, but I’ve continuously sworn off on using Uber after the countless CREEPS on there!!!! I use Uber simply to get to work and yet multiple times I’ve been hounded in the car to take my mask off, to give personal information, to meet up with them later, etc etc! I report these drivers and yet Uber still allows them to accept my ride requests :( I don’t think Uber really cares for the safety of their customers.
title: USE AT YOUR OWN RISK

review: For an app that’s supposed to make communication and transportation easier, it has been the polar opposite. I downloaded this to get a ride back to my car dealership, but it wouldn’t let me request a ride since it needed to verify my mobile number (which it already had when I downloaded the app).  When I tried to enter the pin, it kept saying unknown error, and when I did the help chat, they said tech support would get back to me via email. Meanwhile, I still can’t get a ride to my dealership. Do yourself a favor; download Lyft instead.
title: Didn’t work when needed

review:
Hey guys
What do you think if you add the update where i can’t only see the car’s available but able to click on them to pick the driver or to see details about the driver and Car details 
If i pick that driver for a ride he has the right to deny it but i can still pick who pick me ups
Hope it make sense!😀
title: Some ideas

review:
On a Monday night, 2 drivers cancelled on me after waiting for 15 minutes for each. No gifts for me, I wonder if there are fees for the drivers. Then I ordered a new Uber. After waiting for 10 minutes I saw a yellow cab. And I cancelled the Uber. I was charged $6. It seems a bit greedy for Uber to charge me cancellation fee while I get nothing for my wasted time of
30 minutes. I will use alternatives first and will use Uber as the last resort. Note: Even after the $6 cancellation fee, a NYC yellow cab was 50% cheaper.
title: Getting worse

review: My first time using Uber, a driver agreed to pick me up then immediately said they wouldn’t be able to. They then refused to cancel the ride so that they would be able to collect from the cancellation fee. I tried to contact support and when I got them on the phone they said they couldn’t help me, referred me to the help section on the app which didn’t have anything to help with this situation, then hung up on me. Terrible service, they really don’t care to steal your money because they know that many will continue to use the app.
title: No support available

review:
Uber changes cost after the ride. I have contacted them about this a few times. Now I take a screenshot of the cost beforehand to make sure I am not up charged.

They do not allow you to contact them via the app. You have to go to website to send email.

The customer reps are nice but the automated emails are so disrespectful. Once I was charged Uber eats for a delivery issue and they sent auto email scolding me for repeated refund requests. Even tho that wasn’t what I wanted. App is not rider friendly
title: Uber Changes PRICE after ride

review: I am a teenager trying to save up for a car so I use Uber to take me to work. I never had problems with Uber until today. My pick up was “home” and the drop off was “work” it’s not the first time I have used this app so it’s always put in. The driver named Miguel drove to the destination instead of the pickup. He told me to cancel it so I did. I realized they charged me 15 dollars because I canceled it. He told me to cancel it so he could get the money that’s why he didn’t cancel it. How can you scam a teenager? That’s sick!
title: Scamming drivers.

review: Spent about an hour on this app looking for a customer support phone number to report a problem and there was nothing to be found. When I called the multiple phone numbers on their website I was redirected MULTIPLE times to likes that did not connect. So disappointed
title: Customer support?! Good luck

review: I scheduled an early morning Uber ride and the driver texted 5min before the pick up time to let me know she was running more than 20min late. I had to drive myself to the airport so as not to miss my flight. Uber still charged me more than $100 for the ride. This is not the first time time that Uber proves unreliable. Drivers commonly cancel on their way to pick up, sometime multiple time, making passenger wait for sometime an hour. Also, good luck connecting to any type of customer support. It is inaccessible through the app.
title: Charged even when driver didn’t show up

review:
I had scheduled an Uber XL ride one week in advance, received confirmation for the charge and the ride for a 6am departure from Princeton Jn to EWR. 

Fast forward to day of departure, I get notified via app around 5:30am, that ‘your pickup is in 30 mins’ and the clock counts down. Time passes well after 6am and then around 6:15am receive notification that no drivers are available leaving me scrambling in the last minute looking for an alternative to take 5 family members to the airport !!!

I understand how Uber works, but doesn’t Uber have enough past data points to notify me well in advance that this location/ time/ weekday is unlikely to confirm a ride? Absolutely unacceptable

Schedule feature is useless in many such locations/ time of day and should not be an option to choose.

If you plan to use this option, have a backup!!!
title: Have a backup option for ‘Schedule a ride’. It’s unreliable!

review: So I’ve been using Uber pretty much from the beginning. And I understand do you the pandemic, life isn’t quite like how it used to. But I feel like it’s frustrating when I schedule an Uber for a certain time or a driver agrees to pick me up, but then cancels at the last minute is not right. If they accepted to take your ride then they should somehow be locked into place unless there some sort of issue. But I keep getting those that are almost to my pick up location and then cancel, forced to wait longer
title: I like this Uber but it has one big issue

review:
Recently EVERY ride cancels after making me wait 10-15 minutes. Then the next driver does the same exact thing. It takes literally hours to get a ride anywhere. Uber needs to compensate us for multiple canceled rides. It says 5 minutes but can take over an hour just to get into a car. 

On top of that Uber charges us for cancellation!
title: Drivers don’t show up

review: This driver was already going to get a five star because he made me feel safe and secure on the way to the doctors. But now he should get 10 stars, because I left something in the backseat of his car and he realized it and turned all the way around to return it to me. I am ever so grateful. He is quite a guy and I highly recommend him.
title: Super Driver

review:
Uber really needs to set some standards with their drivers. Some of them don’t speak English in nyc/nj area which can cause some real issues if customer can’t communicate with them. Also, drivers use Waze and set their settings to avoid tolls. I had to go to the airport and there was zero traffic at 6 am, the driver almost went entirely LOCAL to Newark airport from fort Lee NJ. Are you kidding me? 
Have some standards Uber and implement some changes
title: Uber drivers don’t speak English

review: I want to say he’s very patient and understanding I had a package delivery and pick up that was very troublesome however instead of complaining and refusing to accept Amanuel did not only accept but spent time to find the correct address and delivery the package in a professional and courteous manner. I am forever grateful for his hard work and dedication.
title: very patient

review: Don’t expect customer service to help you fix something like double charges, payment methods, etc. you literally have to google information to speak to somebody. But wait, there’s more bad news. Customer service is answered by adults who sound like kids who obviously don’t know what their doing. Also, forget callbacks. At first, the app was cool, until you run into a problem. They’ll take your money, but don’t expect it returned if service is terrible. I’m done.
title: Forget HELP when you need it

review:
This was my first experience with Uber. I was very nervous about the situation, but my driver was excellent. He talked me all the way through my trip, and was VERY helpful telling me about which routes to take back to my hotel after picking up my rental car. He was very professional as well. I highly recommend  him to ANYONE that needs this service!

John K.
title: Eder was Fantastic!

review: Ryan was terrific! This was only the second time I have done an Uber and I was in town bc my daughter was in a terrible accident. I was at the hospital which had multiple entrances and I didn’t know which one I was at. He communicated with me and finally found me in spite of the extra time it took. He had a great attitude and got me safely to my hotel. Great driver! Nice person!
title: Ryan
userName: I just want to thank Ryan

review:
As Uber has grown the services have become insanely expansive and overall hard to use. Not to mention the money grabbing UI that tricks users into purchasing rides they don’t want.

Today I paid 50 dollars for a ride share that I didn’t ask for. Uber sent me a messaging saying: would you like to share the ride? I pressed “back to Uber x” assuming that meant I wouldn’t be sharing a ride but I was wrong… and I paid the same amount for an Uber x as a ride share which is ridiculous. 

Use Lyft they pay their drivers more and it’s not as scammy feeling.
title: Getting worse

review: Stephen was one of the nicest drivers that I have ever met in my life. He waited for us, even though we were lost at the pick up location. She told us so many stories about his life and kept us entertained throughout the whole ride. People who get him as a driver are lucky! Thank you Steven and wishing you all the best in life.
title: What an awesome driver and a perfect ride!

review:
I received a one month free promotion for Uber and got charged for it. I’m frustrated because I had membership with Uber EATS but not with Uber. It’s very misleading because I used the membership on ANOTHER APP, and I’m being charged on this app. It doesn’t make sense that the two apps are linked when it comes to subscriptions. 

Uber has terrible customer service. When I bring this issue up to them, they say there’s nothing they can do, and Emma actually put the blame on me for not checking my credit card sooner. Uber is a untrustworthy company.
title: Terrible subscription service

review: No need to exchange cash.  Both rider and driver can be assured that getting from A to B is the most important.  Better than cab?  Ok can you tell, I’m both rider AND 5.00 driver.  I keep an incredibly clean car and always try hard to have fun with my passengers.  I love Uber.  I’m sure Lyft is good too, but I have my loyalty from the beginning.
title: It’s a great way to get around

review: I got off at Portland airport, call Uber go to my motel 26$ something , but end up got to the place that I have no idea where it was, looking down to the app show with completely different address , I think the app generated it by itself or else because most mistake people make when they’ve enter wrong either northbound or southbound , after correcting and find out the motel I want to get check in location was close to where whose get it wrong, so we have to get there anyway .then finally I get surprise with the bill almost double!….
title: I got rip off

review: Iunknowingly, rushing to get home from the airport, left my phone in Kuldip’s car. I did not know until Kuldip arrived at my home an hour after he dropped us off.  The trouble I would have gone through to find my phone was alleviated by this nice man’s extra effort. Thank you for going the extra distance, you are a good human!!!
title: Saved the day

review: Twice now When scheduling a ride in Chicago the map showed a exact route and address for the driver but they stopped a bock away. When I walked to the drivers location their app showed the address where they were sitting. Neither seemed concerned their app took them to a different address than my order. Is this a common issue? Why does it occur.
title: Exact Location issue

review:
The promo said I’ll get a 10% off. 
First, it asked me to pay in advance.
None of the Rental companies in the market ask you to pay in advance. I was in a hurry and trusted Uber, so I went ahead and paid for it.
Two days later, I checked rental prices in the market and realized I got ripped off by Uber.
So, I went into the app to cancel the booking and found two bookings in the app. There was a duplicate booking and they charged me twice!

Immediately, I tried to cancel the booking, but the Uber app won’t let me cancel. So, I called the rental company directly and canceled the booking. They assured me a full refund. 

One month and countless refund inquiries later, I still haven’t received my refund. Every time I raise a request, they say,’ we are looking into it’ and close my case. 

And I just realized I never received that 10% discount either.

Uber ripped me off $300. Don’t try Uber rental!
title: Don’t use Uber Rental!

review: I was coming home from a party and had nothing on me but my phone. I rarely use the app and I was trying to order an Uber so I wouldn’t go into public transportation at 1 am. For some weird reason I couldn’t make that happen because it needed to verify who I was, after a year or more of using this app, now that I needed it the most with nothing on me but my phone is asking me for an id or passport to very who I was. I got home safely after I had to call a taxi which overcharged me but at least I didn’t walked or took public transportation.
title: One year from using the app

review: Today was my first Uber ride and because of the gentlemen who picked me up, the bar is now set very high. He was friendly, a great driver and while perhaps conversation does not always occur in Uber rides; I like to talk and I enjoyed greatly enjoyed our interaction. Can’t say enough….I hope all my future Uber trips will be this good, high bar though!
title: Perfect first Uber

review:
Our driver was outstanding however over last couple years we have noticed a change in Uber procedure. 
It said pick up in 12 mins but ended up taking 25 mins. Uber is assigning drivers to pickups before they have dropped there existing ride off. 
Worse thing is they don’t contemplate it in the pick up time calculation. This has happened to me at least 3 times. 
Was late for a critical meeting one of the times. 
Be real!
title: John

review:
You will not be disappointed. You will leave this ride feeling better about yourself and your outlook on the world. 
I believe that my ride today will change how productive I am in the future and the journey I am on. 
Simply a blessing and honor to have ridden with him today!!!! 

Keep smiling and shining your light on others my new friend!!!!!
title: Simply a bright light!

review: The driver was excellent and arrived for pick up early.  The Uber map tried to take a route 40 minutes longer that the most direct route.  The driver and I both knew the best route which was the common route.  This was a early morning route so no reason why the Uber map tried to take a different route.
title: Route Map

review: Honestly used to love Lyft and used it everywhere (especially for the Delta miles), but now it has been constantly giving me the wrong wait time and searching for drivers endlessly. I have hours to plan for my ride. Don’t say I can be picked up in 5 minutes when it’s actually going to be 30. Not a one time thing, consistent week after week now…. And yes I know I can schedule, but Uber makes sure the driver arrives 5 minutes early. Lyft warns you that the driver might arrive 15 minutes late.
title: Review

review:
I having change of schedule and needed a way to go from MCO to Fort  Myers and my first driver showed up to tell me he wouldn’t drive that far. So I tried again and got the best long distance ride I could have hoped for. Drove not too slow, not too fast, very considerate and just a really nice person.

Thank you for helping me salvage a bad day!
title: The very best !

review: We decided to Uber to the Fort Lauderdale Water Taxi. Both of our drivers, Rodrigo and Francis, were great. Our ride both ways was excellent. There was no waiting for them to arrive. The app let us see where they were too. As always with Uber, the service was wonderful and the drivers were very friendly and professional.
title: Visiting Fort Lauderdale

review: I am over 70 years old, and traveling alone. They were friendly warm and helpful. I felt very safe with them.  They waited with me until I checked in, and helped me find my room and helped  me get my luggage to my room.  They are exemplary staff. You are lucky to have such an amazing couple working for your company.
title: Great ride. Robert and his wife were excellent!

review: I just had a ride from the airport on LI to my home. The driver was very helpful with getting my luggage in and allowing my child to sit where she wanted. It was a packed out ride and the driver was cool as a cucumber. The ride was clean and the driver was friendly. He had no problem taking a different route than what was on his gps. I’m a very happy Uber rider!
title: Safe comfortable accommodating

review:
William is what I want in a Uber driver. Super safe, knew the best route, knew traffic trends and patterns and his vehicle was super clean. 
He was helpful in getting our luggage in and out of his vehicle. This was important since we are elderly and somewhat disabled. He was super friendly and helpful. 
William is a veteran and we were grateful to have him as our Uber driver. 
God bless you William. All the best to you!
title: Exceptional driver

review: Booking this last  ride sucked. The driver was great eventually but for 20 minutes I kept getting told that they were trying to find a driver , Two  drivers showed up and offered to take me but I couldn’t cancel my initial Uber. I thought if I logged out of Uber and log back in then it would clear the circular error but it wouldn’t then I was charged for the cancellation and apparently it used  my five dollars of Uber cash. I’m  about to get rid of the app because you can’t ever speak to anyone to resolve your problems.
title: Unable to cancel, no confirmation received

review: Recently in NYC the fare was $23 more than a cab to airport. No special events going on to warrant a surge charge and less you did it because it was raining which is absolutely ridiculous. Now in the cities where I have a cab available I will always compare rates because I feel that this is a ridiculous up charge.
title: Surge charges

review:
He was very great, extremely personable, car clean and very safe driver and good conversationalist. 
I have been taking Ubers intermittently for the last few years 
Now more frequently because I have had car problems. Luckily tonight the price was 12$ each time whereas usually it it a lot more 
I would say he is the best driver that I ever had
title: Stephani

review: One of the best Uber drivers I’ve ever had he was so friendly and a safe driver he even came back to bring my son his phone that he had forgot in the car. My family was so grateful he drove us an hour and a half to our destination. Very professional 10 out of 10 would recommend.
title: 5 star quality

review:
Gabriel  is wonderful,
He came quickly came up my driveway to get my bags and never complained that I had a box in addition to the suitcase. He helped me with everything. And then I left my purse in his Uber! I could not find any way to get in touch with Uber. But he called me and brought it back to me very quickly. I am so grateful. What a wonderful man!
title: Gabriel is great. I am so grateful

review: Every time I use this app they charge me extra fees on top of the original price. Doesn’t matter if I have extra stops on time or not!! They take atleast an extra 10-20 dollars A WEEK and it’s annoying because you can’t even talk to ANYONE. They have a phone for drivers to call but not riders . Then they’ll “update” a payment and out of the blue 10-20 dollars is taken from my account when the updated charge be about 2-3 dollars . It’s unfair and they are definitely ripping people off . PAY CLOSE ATTENTION TO YOUR ACCOUNT BECAUSE THEY ARE KNOWN FOR TAKING EXTRA MONEY EVEN AFTER A CHARGE IS COMPLETE!!!
title: STRONGLY do NOT recommend

review: Gary was so friendly, very professional and made me feel really comfortable. He knew exactly where I was going and took some short cuts to get me there on time. We had great driving conversations lol, and it made me more relaxed ready for my business weekend here in Houston !!!! I appreciate his time and love his work ethic. He is the best!!!!
title: One of the best Uber rides I have had

review: I have a ridewith Uber for sometime now, and the prices have went up extremely high even however I do understand with the course 11 in inflation everything has went up, but the average working person like me my income hasn’t gotten raised, so I am struggling now trying to pay for a ride
title: Prices, are extremely high

review:
Hello Uber,

I am having a more difficult time getting drivers at San Diego airport. Sometimes I get multiple drivers who apparently cancel when they see I need to go to Carlsbad in North County, San Diego, about a 35-40 minute drive. Lately I have also been having problems getting an Uber ride from Carlsbad to the San Diego airport, to the point where I’m waiting on the driver for > 30 minutes, putting my flight connection in peril. 

This is getting to the point to where I am forced to look at other ways to get back and forth to the airport. Not sure what is going on, but if I cannot get reliable service with Uber, I will simply use another solution.

Regards,

Thomas Maxwell 
A prolific Uber user
title: Harder to get drivers at San Diego Airport

review: Earlier today I called for an Uber the young lady who’s name I cannot remember never showed up I texted her called to make sure she was ok I never got a response back causing me to be late to my job had to call another Uber once I got downtown Charlotte and the gentleman was on time and very friendly the young lady tho I would not request her again that’s all over all satisfied with service
title: Earlier today

review:
Needs better familiar drivers (GEORGIA) 

There’s no reason why a driver with a GPS in addition to a live streaming Feed, should be asking a passenger “where to go”..

It’s in front of you, on GPS, guiding you. 

Another thing, why is a drop off available at one point of the day, but in the afternoon there’s parameter. So, during a certain time the exact location is blocked off—

Third- do better with assigning meeting spots. 

It doesn’t tell you ahead of time, just gives an automatic meeting point outside of walking distance. 

Fourth, I don’t appreciate drivers who don’t even try to find the address or a simple change of location even with a live feed. You can hear the excuse in their voice. It’s not rocket science. 

Not everyone needs to be hired .
title: Needs Sensible Drivers.

review: Uber is really lousy and hire anyone. Use at your own risk. I will no longer be using Uber soon. The prices or overpriced and the surge at anytime for no reason making it harder and expensive to travel. There are times I would rather call a cab then use Uber. Lyft is a little better just can be overpriced at times too. But Uber is worse also. They takes extra money out of you account for extra fees and was not total in the first charge. Lyft charge you one time and they charge one payment. I am lookin forward to the day Uber is shut down.
title: A hit or a miss

review: I use Uber and Uber Eats often for corporate rides and meals, but frequently have the same issue when expensing these items. The time stamp on the receipts is never the actual time of the food or ride order/completion. This causes issues every time I expense a meal or ride. Please add better time information to receipts, it’s currently just showing when the card transaction processed (typically the next morning which is useless info).
title: Corporate expensing issues

review: I was able to stay in areas where it was always busy and there were lots of rides but now with the new app update. It takes me too far from home and  away from the areas where it’s more busy. It is a hassle to come back to where you want. This will make Uber loose a lot of money and drivers and customers . We should be able to go make money where we want and where is needed but they want to keep control and send you off very far and then fighting and wasting time to get back.
title: they changed destination mode settings

review: Uber’s quality has been really deteriorating lately. #1) I wasn’t able to schedule a ride at least 24 hours before because Uber does not offer that service in my location, but Lyft does. #2) Two of my drivers canceled on me after waiting for each for about 15-20 minutes each. This wasted a total of 30-40 minutes of my time waiting for a ride that never came in the cold windy weather. After wasting so much time I gave up and used another service. Please improve! Otherwise seems like I will be deleting the app.
title: Unreliable

review: App doesn’t show if your driver is completing a ride before your pick up. It’s frustrating to watch your drive change routes on the map and not even get an notification that he or she is dropping off before heading towards you. After a long day, you just want a simple pick up and not get annoyed wondering why your driver is taking weird routes. The app used to state if a driver is dropping off before coming towards you. App has bugs still that needs to be fixed.
title: Ride queue

review:
I recently downloaded the app and made a new account even though I have used it before. I’m currently without a personal vehicle and downloaded it to have ready just in case. I haven’t needed it yet, and after about a week someone from Uber called me saying they noticed I haven’t scheduled a ride.

I don’t appreciate unsolicited calls. If I have trouble scheduling a ride I will reach out. That is the quickest way to get your customers to delete the app/their accounts and move to a competitor.
title: Download if you want to be called and asked why you haven’t scheduled a ride

review: I hope Uber goes out of business. I used to use it ALL THE TIME until I found out that they’re massive transphobes who don’t care at all about their customers. A transgender man was attacked in my town and then his Uber driver threatened him and kicked him out for being trans. Uber simply gave him ten dollars and said sorry, they wouldn’t ban the driver. They also refuse to let trans drivers change to their preferred names and pronouns. So transphobes are fine to drive but transgender people aren’t? Screw you, Uber, I hope you lose all your customers. I will never use this app again.
title: Disgusting business

review:
My account was hacked TWICE in four months. Both times it was impossible to get a live person on support, endless emails asking the same questions and wanting more screenshots. Both times it came down to me having to get a new bank account, and all the work it takes to make that change with all my utilities and other vendors. 

My account was used for car rides in a city almost 3000 miles from me. And the lack of urgency-or ANY meaningful response from Uber was beyond anything they can make an excuse for. 

DO NOT USE UBER!!
title: Completely unsafe!!

review: I’m a new user. The first time I used the app to set up a ride for the next day, it called a driver for me immediately. Fortunately I was able to cancel. I then successfully set up a ride for the next day. 30 minutes before the ride was scheduled to arrive, I received a Uber app notification to confirm the ride. Next thing I know, at app said the driver would arrive within 5 minutes. I then took the ride, only to find out there was another driver waiting to pick me up at the scheduled time- so I got charged twice for the ride. Horrible app!
title: Confusing app. Don’t use.

review: I will NEVER use Uber again. Drivers are always late, come to the wrong pick up locations and charge you after they drop you off. Most recently I was charged for a ride double the mileage of my original ride. The driver was new and must not have ended the ride when I was dropped off. Looks like I paid for her to drive home that day. Uber support was useless and said they can’t issue a refund. Use Lyft, or better yet, get a bike, unicycle, roller blades - literally anything except these horrible ride services that add more stress to your day and dig deep in your pockets
title: I’d rather walk

review:
Someone stole my credit card number, used it for Ubers and my bank disputed the charges, as they are typically pretty good about when cards are stolen. 

However, Uber locked me out of my account and anytime I try to contact them, they tell me that I have an unpaid balance left on my account. So I explain what happened and apparently that’s not good enough for them as if they don’t make plenty of money as is. 

It’s very clear there aren’t actual humans behind the support line and that they really don’t care about making their customers happy. They closed my ticket without any type of resolution.

I have been using Lyft and will be using Lyft from now on. I don’t seem to have any issues there. It would be nice to have multiple ride sharing services but it’s not necessary. Lyft works great for me. I would not recommend Uber to anyone.
title: Stealing Money from Me - Zero Customer Service

review: Today I had to use Uber to get to school. I live 25-30 minutes away. I could either take an Uber or Lyft or leave 2.5 hours early to take the bus and train. I was going to try to use Uber but it wouldn’t let me confirm a pick up without ID verification. Now, I don’t have any ID other than my current college ID, but Uber doesn’t accept student ID’s. This was really inconvenient and it made me thirty minutes for class when I had wait for another service. REALLY INCONVENIENT! I would love to use Uber if they included student ID’s.
title: Really Inconvenient if you don’t have driver’s license, state ID, or passport ID

review:
I am just trying to request a ride, but there seems to be a bug of some sort….  I can’t select a pickup place or a destination. Ideally the app would let me type in the text box, but it takes me to a non-functional map every time instead. The map is all Gray, no matter where I look ( and I live in a large city, almost 2x Atlanta, GA). I have tried select several spots around the city and the app isn’t letting me select anything.

The “help” menu says put your pin where you want to go/get picked up, but there’s no pin on my phone…
title: App isn’t working on my phone…

review: I wasn’t prompted to double click the power button like usual when ordering my ride. Then I noticed the Uber App had changed my default payment method from Apple Pay to my debit card. When I tried to “Switch” it to Apple Pay, it said I can’t change methods during a ride. After the ride I RESET my default payment method to Apple Pay AGAIN and deleted my debit card as an option to make sure it won’t do that again! 🤨 Meanwhile the app is now cluttered up with ads, including one offering that I can get 3% for using Apple Pay. Jerks!
title: App changed my ApplePay default

review: Over here in Bahrain Uber is a necessity. I signed up for an account as it’s my only means of transportation unless I’m walking in the middle eastern heat. After signing up for an account is when my issues arose. I wasn’t able to book a ride due to my account being deactivated mine you I just created the account a few minutes prior. So, I attempted to create another account. When linking my card to the second account it said my card was banned. That’s right BANNED. I’ve never personally had a ride with Uber so I’m a bit frustrated. I emailed the support team and haven’t received a response. Thanks Uber.
title: Frustrations

review: I ordered a scheduled ride today for 5pm when I got off work. I had to lock the front door and walk around the building. It took me approximately 1.5 minutes to do so and as I was walking up behind the vehicle (LEHU32, “Ris”) drove away before 2 minutes had even passed. I got charged $5 for the ride and now I have no way home. I tried to wave the car down but he kept driving, ignoring my attempts. I am done with this company. He got his money and I have nothing to show for it. Somehow this driver has 4.9 stars, how? I am so infuriated by this process, I won’t be ordering anymore Ubers in the future.
title: Horrible customer service

review: This/my Uber driver is one of the best driver ever. I got sick at work and called an Uber to take me home. I got worse in his cab and he went beyond his duties by stopping his car waited for me while I sat on the curb hoping to feel better, he gave me alcohol on tissues that stopped my upset stomach.  Who knew!  He was kind, sympathetic, knowledgeable and most of all he was prepared.
title: My Dr (Uber driver) to the rescue

review: Jimmy was so nice. We were trying to get to our dinner reservation and the traffic in the city was awful. Jimmy was so kind and patient and did all he could to get us to our destination as quickly as possible. He even offered us some candy do enjoy while we sat in the traffic jam. Highly recommend Jimmy
title: Traffic Ninja

review: Several weeks ago, I had my access to UberEats suspended for reasons that I still don’t understand well. Since then, I have had repeated email exchanges and placed calls to customer service seeking support to no avail. This is one of the most frustrating customer service experiences I’ve ever had, particularly when I’ve been paying for UberOne and been unable to receive all the benefits of the service. This is not a company that places its customers first. I will limit my use of them as much as possible going forward.
title: Customer Service

review:
So I was given sum Uber cash as a refund for a bad Uber ride. So I used the Uber cash for a ride, well Uber didn’t use the Uber cash going towards my ride fare but instead charged me for the whole amount for the ride and then used the Uber cash to give to the driver as a tip. Like I didn’t appreciate being misused and when I write to Uber they still haven’t responded to my message request regarding the ride. Yes Uber will take money out of your account even when u cancel the ride and then make u wait 5 days to get your fake money back (Uber Cash) 
Uber is a ripoff
title: There not right

review: My car broke down so I called an Uber to drive me and my kids to school. When the driver showed up, he looked at us, said something inaudible and just drove away. We waited 15 minutes for him to show up. My kids both are super upset and they’re both going to be very late to school. This caused a massive problem and I can’t even call customer service because they don’t have a phone number. Companies like Uber don’t care about their customers… at all. Don’t reward companies like this by using their services.
title: Uber has no customer service

review: Very frustrating to be getting additional charges after the fact for various made up sounding fees. Waiting in a fee, fi, fo, fun fee to appear. Also found on one trip that a driver took the toll road and I was charged for it even though I’d requested to avoid it. The lack of transparency for the costs is ridiculous. A $52 ride plus $8ish dollar tip should not suddenly be $100 a few days later.
title: Charges after the fact that don’t make sense

review: My boyfriend paid for my daughters Uber ride from 31st in Downing to 72nd and Commerce City. The next day, my boyfriend had someone take out $300 out of his account from Commerce City. We are wondering how this happened we never go to commerce city Colorado. My daughter needed a ride and was dropped off and was off, so picked up and went home. Someone went to a gas station in Commerce City in withdrew money from his account and tried it over and over and they would’ve cleaned out his account but we had it blocked. How does this happen and it is strange it was from Commerce City.
title: Card was compromised

review:
I think your app is very user unfriendly and stress inducing. 

I have used Uber many times in the past with the app on my spouse’s phone. I added it on my phone so that I could pay for additional cars since I’m with a group. It has been a disaster area. I’ve had to confirm the card each time, three times, rescan it, re-put it in and this considering that I have two cards in the system. I hope I never have to use it again after this trip. we have taken one Uber and one taxi because it’s such a pain and such a waste of time.
title: Your app is a pain

review: I had to find a new ride from the airport to my hotel after my car service failed to show up. Only took 5 mins for new driver from Uber to show up and drive me to my hotel. Drivers car was clean and it was a great ride to replace the one that didn’t show up!
title: Replacement for no show car service

review: Claudia was kind and friendly. We had broken down, had our vehicle towed and were stuck waiting in the heat for about an hour before we could even call for an Uber and leave.  Claudia came and picked us up and made our really bad day a little brighter and had us all smiling by the end of the trip!
title: Claudia was Awesome!

review: Uber saved me from sitting at the airport hours before my flight. That wouldn’t have been the case if I’d used a long distance airport shuttle or if a family member had dropped me off on their way to work. Uber was my first call and my driver knew the area well. No wrong turns causing a delay. Thanks Uber!
title: First resort instead of the last resort

review: Another 5 star ride! This is why I’ll always use Uber. Every time I’ve tried Uber it’s always a 5 Star ride. The car is nice the driver is always professional and the ride is perfect. Thank you Uber! I’ll be your customer for a long time. And thank the drivers too! They’re the one’s taking care of the customers.
title: 5 Star Ride

review: Our driver Annette was wonderful! She arrived early which was fine with us. Very pleasant personality, super knowledgeable related to all of the road construction, safe driving following road regulations. We felt very safe riding with her. We would definitely highly recommend Annette and would use her again given the opportunity.
title: First Uber ride using the app

review: Julietta picked us up after I had fallen and scraped my arm. She saw to it we got the bandages & disinfectant we needed at the nearest pharmacy, waiting graciously because the pharmacy lines were long. While my wife was in the pharmacy, Julietta made me laugh and forget my pain. Then she made sure we got safely to our destination. She is simply the best we've ever seen !
title: Julietta was wonderful. . .

review:
Isaiah, thanks for making my ride to the airport an exceptional one. From within a few seconds we met at my house, I saw your diligence, your prompt service, assisting me immediately with a smile and an attitude of service. 

You are the type of Uber driver that need to be elevated so that others can learn from you. 

You are a shining example to the company Uber. It is drivers like you that are the foundation and backbone of Uber, who conduct their service with deep commitment and professionalism.

All the very best Isaiah and today you are not just my driver, you are now my friend.
Continue to do excellent work and I wish you the very best.
title: The Best Uber Driver I ever had, absolutely!!!

review:
Where to start? Besides the fact that have been several instances here in San Francisco where the driver does NOT match the picture - this case was one of them. My wallet got stolen from the driver - call him to ask to bring the wallet and a woman answers the phone saying she has no
Idea why her number is linked with Uber. (Mind you I was connected with the driver via Uber app).

First place he goes is to gas station - my credit card company verified this and then he does a shopping spree around. Uber not only didn’t help, but they dragged the case for a while until nothing it was done.

Its truly concerning to see how often the picture doesn’t match the driver, how the driver gets the wallet goes on a shopping spree, and how poor the customer service is.

If you are in the Bay Area, avoid Uber. You are better off a taxi.
title: Got robbed from my Uber driver in San Francisco and they never followed up

review: This is the best Uber experience I’ve ever had. We were stranded in another city with an awful Uber driver before that canceled on us. This driver was very very patient with us and took the time to find us through concert traffic and made sure we got home safe. I cannot thank this guy enough for what he did tonight! Above and beyond expectations!
title: Angel driver

review: After a whirlwind 5 days in Madison, I was returning home, feeling enervated, and a little throaty. Fortunately, my bag was one of the first off the carousel at Burbank. I’m a newbie to Uber. Quickly download the app, and arranged the ride. Mohammed showed up in minutes. He was helpful, a good driver, and we had a nice short conversation. Before I knew it, I was back home.
title: Great fast ride back home

review: I thoroughly enjoyed my drive with William this morning. Easy to set drive reservation. Relieved to have one less this to do this trip. On time - actually a few minutes early. Clean car. Smooth drive. Friendly and pleasant company. Looking forward to my next uber experience.
title: Uber always gets me where I need to go

review: Alicia ( white Chevy bolt) was super sweet and compassionate to my situation. We spoke about life, my cats, my kids, my family. She made me feel safe and secure on my ride home. I was feeling very anxious and upset and speaking with her calmed my soul. She is an excellent Uber driver. I’m so grateful for her service and her getting me home safely. Thank you so much Alicia. God bless you. You are a beautiful person.
title: Excellent driver

review: Waiting five minutes as they look for a ride after telling me it’s 2 minutes away, drivers cancel all the time and are not trained to be professional. The app and the drivers just do whatever they want. The app is a complete joke, use Lyft and you can be home in the time it takes Uber to spin around in circles and do nothing just to tell you “durr, sorry nobody can pick you up” what is the point of this app at all then? Do better. The app needs fixing. Train your drivers. Please. Everything about Uber is so wrong!
title: Really Uber? Do better.

review:
I had the pleasure of riding with Chiedu
from 7th Street to my home on Columbia Road. We had a fascinating conversation, and was very impressed with his knowledge and in-depth understanding of all of the issues of the day.  I know it’s not very often that it happens, but I would look forward to riding with him again, and continuing our conversation I wish him all the best.
title: Chiedu

review: Despite the roads being closed all around Plaza Mayor and me not knowing my way around town (first time visitor), Joe was super patient with me and communicated well as to where we can meet and waited for me! Thank you so much as it was important that we get your services right then and there to make our flight on time!
title: Patient and friendly driver

review: While the driver was timely and a conscientiousó driver. Driver D dropped me off with a extra large and heavy luggage not at the airport curbside but the furrherest Lane during the peak drop off period. I didn’t think that a very safe location to drop off a rider with oversized heavy luggage. Next time, think of the safety of rider and not convenience of the driver to possibly pick up another fare!
title: Safety First

review: Had a late night flight arrival, which was delayed until 2:00am.  App asks for flight date and flight number.  Couldn’t put in yesterday for pickup, but when entering todays date, it still had arrival as 11:55pm, 22 hours too late.  So could not book ahead of time, had to wait until I got there, and then say pick me up from my current location (NOT the airport)
title: Problems if late flight delayed until next day

review: Mike made my Uber experience very pleasant. I felt safe and comfortable. His car was meticulously clean and he was very kind. He drove very safely and brought me to my destination efficiently. I highly recommend. I noticed that he only had 4.99 stars and I would like to say to the person that did not give him five stars that it is you not him.
title: Wonderful personality

review: Stupid app, tried to book a ride in SLC, wouldn’t let me select an option “I’ve been waiting for over 5 minutes” then paid for a premium ride, more than twice as much, driver accepted the ride and didn’t move for the next 5 minutes, only options were wait, call driver or cancel, I tried to call the driver and was kicked back to the previous screen, they don’t give a crap about you or the drivers, that’s why I always accept the driver’s personal ‘driving services’ cards. And use that when possible instead of Uber.
title: Dumb app

review:
Are used to love using Uber… Use it all over the world. However, a new pattern has emerged with drivers. 
They accept your ride and then they don’t show for three 5-10 minutes. You cancel and order a new ride however because you canceled after 2 1/2 minutes you get charged. 

In order to reverse the charges you have to write to Uber corporate. A total pain. I am seriously considering never using Uber again. This is an issue that corporate should address.
title: Drivers gaming the system

review:
I was leaving my local grocery store today when I spotted a person in distress. When I asked him what I could help him with, he said he needed a ride. The gentleman had just gotten out of the hospital and was stranded with no money or transportation to his destination, and he was exhausted. 

I took a chance and contacted Uber with my request to pick up this man and take him to his destination. I couldn’t wait for him as I am a caretaker and needed to get back to my charge. I communicated this to my Uber driver, Richard. 

Kudos to Richard for understanding this mans and my dilemma and agreeing to help me and this gentleman with this unusual request. 

Tank you Richard. 
The world needs more Richards!!!’
title: My Faith is Restored

review: Dascio was the epitome of professional! Very polite gentleman , with a clean and comfortable vehicle, who nailed it! I left my phone in his vehicle upon being dropped off and didn’t realize it until security screening. My daughter called my phone, Dascio answered it and he came through for me. He circled back to airport and handed it directly to me! That is above and beyond and Dascio is a solid gentleman!!!
title: Above and Beyond

review:
Double check your card statements if you use Uber regularly. I was automatically enrolled in Uber one and have been charged monthly for something I never use. If your card has a charge block make sure to block reoccurring $9.99 payments from Uber One.

Uber will not email you or notify when payments are processed, they are clearly tricking people into paying for this meaningless subscription. 

Don’t be fooled like I was and check your statements. When I messaged Uber to refund me their response was “you should have noticed sooner”.
title: Uber One - Tricked Into Payment
developerResponse: {'id': 35161655, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-03-02T09:58:56Z'}

review: I didn’t realize I left my phone in drive’s car until I had been dropped off. I was panicking because my phone was on silent and didn’t know if he would even hear it vibrating. Within a few minutes he had returned with my phone. You have one awesome employee. I appreciated him so much for that.
title: Phone

review: The service is great.  The drivers are usually courteous and friendly.  Most drivers will turn around to make sure that you can exit the car safely, while others will make you walk across a busy street, rather than turn their car around for you, although that's a rare.  Overall, their service is pretty reliable.
title: Great Service

review:
I’m in Guadalajara, and 98% of the ppl have been so nice & understanding of my limited Spanish and they’ve been so helpful.

 I appreciate the Uber service being there for foreign travelers. I could stay away from hotel & out & about w/ the locals & friends knowing when the bus stops running Uber got my back & will get me home, Lol! Back to my Hotel safely. Thank You!
title: Foreign Traveler

review: I misplaced a request by one click — and then “Immediately” clicked cancel button BEFORE any driver was matched — but the screen simply freaking froze and didn’t do anything — I had to contact the driver and asked him to cancel on this end (all the while trying to understand what he’s saying).  The Cancel button is basically non-existent and there is NO WAY to contact ANY sort of customer support within the app!!  HORRIBLE!!  And they charged me a cancellation fee???? As long as my company pays for my rides I will never use Uber again!
title: Cancellation button doesn’t work!!!

review: To whom it may concern. I greatly appreciate the functionality of your app. Not only here state side, internationally as well. We have been using your app. in Brasil, it was very helpful. Not only to us, but to the people that are there struggling to make a living.  Ubber is a doorway to opportunity they do not have elsewhere. Congratulations, I wish you all success in 2023.
title: Company global review.

review: I got robbed twice today. Two of the drivers decided not to even show up. I wasted money and spent twenty minutes trying to get a cab. One of the drivers canceled the ride. 37 weeks pregnant with two toddlers standing waiting with s bag of groceries. I had to get someone else to call a cab for me. A stranger! so I wouldn’t get robbed again for canceling two rides because your drivers wanted to play. I guess my destination was a waste of time to them because my distance was under 10 minutes. Never have this problem with Lyft ever. I will never use Uber again.
title: Robbed

review:
I was shocked to see a booking fee. That’s about 12% upcharge. There was also a route change. The reason that happened is that he was in a exit only lane. I had told him to move over to center lane. He didn’t even help me unload the trunk knowing I was handicapped. He was nice tho. I did give him a 20% tip. If I knew I would have to unload the trunk myself, I probably would have lowered the tip. 
Rarely, do I give unsatisfactory reviews but I always base my review on my experience.
title: Booking fee
developerResponse: {'id': 34101041, 'body': "Hi, We're extremely sorry to hear about your concern regarding your recent experience. This is certainly something we'd want to deep dive into. For us to be able to resolve your concern, fill in your details here: https://bit.ly/343HNsE. We shall get back to you at the earliest.", 'modified': '2023-01-05T04:23:31Z'}

review: I’ve been experiencing excellent drivers as of late, and wanted to write this review in order to shout out Uber with their selection. Most, if not all of the drivers that come to pick me up are professional, and at least welcome me into the vehicle and drive safely to the destinations. I can’t ask for any more than that and anything beyond that.
title: Excellent Driver Selections

review: My flight landed at 8:40. Picked up bags at 8:50…..had to wait 40 minutes till I finally got a driver. Got 5 messages from uber stating that there were no uberX drivers available and to wait a few moments before requesting again….but I watched people who arrived after me get rides before me…..
title: App doesn’t seem to prioritize who requests first

review: I have not heard from anyone yet but I’m still waiting to hear back from them thy fired me because I would decline deliveries to bad sections in the city of St. Louis east St. Louis unhygienic give us the option to take our order so if we don’t want them why give us the option to take or deny thy did never release my earning to my card thy told me since I was fired thy keep my earnings I’m a disabled person who has no money there a 500 company y would they take from a disabled person that goes against our constitution I need to talk to someone in charge not a foreigner
title: Kept my money

review:
Undoubtedly, UBER is a very convenient way of travel these days. But these days, often the drivers cancel the rides after knowing the destination. Sometimes, after waiting for long periods for a connected ride for the completion of a so called nearby ride, the drivers cancel the rides. If these issues can be addressed, UBER would be more helpful! 
Thanks!
title: Cancellation of calls by drivers

review: Overall I’ve been happy with with Uber but I have had a issue recently. So if I book a ride and cancel I am charged five dollars. This is fine because plans change and I expect drivers to be compensated. However if a driver cancels on me I am stuck waiting for another driver, if I can get one. How is this fair to me?
title: Double standards need to go.

review: I love using Uber app; however since getting my IPhone 13, I have consistent problems with using the app when I’m in NE Florida. Any other location it seems to work fine. Is there a software issue with this location and or IPhone 13s? A concerned client
title: Intermittent issues with unable to reach your network while in Northeast Florida

review:
Can I make a request, please, can’t you provide a monthly statement Email for my Uber ride,so it’s easy to know how much I spend on my Uber the whole months and yearly, and I think this is convenient for everyone , like myself, I am a loyal customer on Uber ride, I don’t drive so I’m more on relying on Uber ride as a commuter.

Much thanks!!
title: My Request as your loyal customer

review: The car quality of drivers is diminishing, many are dirty, trunks full, broken lights/missing bumpers. Uber don’t pay higher quality drivers with luxury vehicles and better service drivers pay is based on quality of rides or who brings greater revenue to company.  Uber’s customer services is horrible, it’s via text message only with a response in 24 to 48 hours.  Nearly impossible to dispute or resolve issues, customers will always be at fault.
title: Customer service is poor

review: After spending 8+ hours being in airports and having to fly all I wanted to do was go home. The directions for the place to meet my driver where unclear and when I finally got there I couldn’t find my driver. Not only was the car on the app the wrong car to look for but the driver never even got out to look for me. I only then realized that the car I saw was my driver was because I FaceTimed my sister to ask if I was in the right spot and she confirmed, being a former driver herself. It was my first and last time I will ever use this app. Worst experience ever.
title: Terrible app

review: Uber started taking 50% of (already dismally low) driver pay in Mexico. Their rates are usually twice as high as other competitors now. Deleted the app because it keeps begging me to get vaxxed in the USA , I’m already vaxxed in Mexico, you can leave me alone already. Also this is literally the only company on earth that can’t seem to consistently bill either of my credit cards successfully or email me login codes consistently and I am tired of contacting support over and over and over only to be blamed as if the payment problem is not on their end.
title: Deleted

review:
I’ve used Uber quite a bit while traveling for work. I’d guess 25+ times per year. I tip every driver generously and only ever had one trip be experience.

Today I ordered an Uber and was forced to take a picture of myself wearing a mask. I’ve been respectful of the mask policy and donned a mask every trip to protect the drivers. For me, requiring a picture is crossing the line of respect a business should show customers in return. I’m on my last Uber ride right now. The drivers have been great, it’s the business policy pushing me to other services. I’ll pay extra for a taxi.
title: Big Brother Uber

review: I put this app on my phone in 2019 to use when traveling. Didn’t use it at all in 2020, but the first time I used it this year, it got hacked. The customer support was absolutely horrible and told me they couldn’t help me after my info had all been stolen. I’ve worked in customer service my whole life so it takes a LOT for me to say that it’s bad. They didn’t care in the least and I’m still hoping I can someday get my card info off the app. I’ll be using Lyft from now on.
title: Use at your own risk

review:
Terrible navigation system, they take the worst and longest route every time. Uber needs to work on their navigation system, it never can tell what side of the street a certain address is, and without fail it always takes the longest, worst routs. (Or at least for my city they are absolutely horrible) 
Some drivers have figured out that they can use Waze as their navigation system for uber instead and that makes the ride much better and faster.
title: Terrible navigation system, they take the worst and longest route every time.

review: why is there NO place to easy access to leave a tip or give review? Sorry I was busy when your pop up asked to rate and then totally disappeared? what is this?  absolutely no place to add a tip, no menu, nothing. just the trip showing a driver and absolutely no way to add a tip!  fix it!  you have to dig deep to get instructions on how to tip, yet they don’t match the app at all, yet the instructions ask you to do something that doesn’t exist in this app. lame
title: what???

review: Uber may be considered a great company.   However this experience was not good.  I was first scheduled to be picked up by Anthony.  Then after waiting for 25 minutes my driver was changed to Paul and was set to wait for another 25 minutes.  Both of these drivers kept us waiting while they completed another ride.  Uber drivers should not commit to a ride until they have completed their current drive.  This is inconsiderate to the riders and it limits other drivers from a chance to pick up a fare.  I cancelled the ride and went with Lyft.  Get your act together and then go back into service.
title: Waited too long

review: After a smooth and noneventful trip to the airport, my husband and I got out of ones Uber and he realized he had lost his wallet in the car! Panic set in… After mini trials, we got through to Ron and he immediately turned around and returned the wallet to us within 10 to 15 minutes! He is our hero of the day — 10 stars!!
title: Lost wallet

review: Some very interesting people drive UBER.  My only dissatisfaction with UBER is the outrageous “BOOKING-FEE COST”.  This is an arbitrary figure UBER uses to add to the cost of the ride.  I’m hoping we can get enough people to understand that if you lower the booking fee, which is like an additional tax charged to the consumer from UBER that doesn’t go to the driver, more people will ride UBER.  But UBER like every other person in control of taxes thinks they are going to make more money by raising their fee.
title: DonnieK

review:
Love being able to use Uber when needed, and always feel comfortable with the service! 
However, l hate the amount of fees they tack-on when making a reservation- more than 25% seems to go to fees! Sometimes taking a shuttle more than an hours ride distance is the same price as an Uber reservation that’s 25% of the distance. So they get 4 stars instead of 5.
title: Uber’s a great resource!

review: Uber outsources customer support to a group who is not engaged or interested in solving customer disputes. Uber double charged me for a food order 20 months after the original order was placed and paid for. After I naturally disputed the charge, they placed a lock on all my Uber accounts and will not restore access until I agree to pay for the old food order a 2nd time. Their support group does nothing but copy/paste generic responses, and it is impossible to speak to a real human over the phone. They do not even list a number to call.
title: Abysmal Customer Support

review: Sami is a very pleasant, friendly and kind person.  He also has good taste is movies to stream!!  It is always refreshing to meet someone so memorable.  He also has good driving habits/skills.  I’m a bit of a back seat driver and not once did i feel uncomfortable.  Pleasant Uber drive all the way from Sky Harbor to Buckeye.
title: Pleasant Experience as it should be…

review: I don’t understand why it won’t take my credit card for payment. I tried multiple credit cards, and none of them would process. eventually had to go to Apple Pay because none of my credit cards were excepted.
title: Credit card payment

review: Today I had an awful experience with hertz in north brunswick nj. 2 cars rented. 1 broken 1 stunk like marijuana. I called to have car replaced. They set up the rental in Flemington nj. I drove 40 min and they didn’t have a car and laughed at me that the car stunk like marijuana. I was stranded and Gerard was my driver. He’s the nicest person and got me home safely.
title: Saved me from being stranded

review: I picked Uber since it said the driver was only 4 minutes away.  This happened at Newark airport.  The Toyota Camry supposedly arrived so I looked for it everywhere. Then all of a sudden it disappeared off the map in the app!  Then the app started searching for another driver who was about 10 minutes away!  If I had known that I would have to wait 15 minutes for a ride, then I would have chosen Lyft.  But they also play games with their time of arrivals.  You can’t trust either app unfortunately.
title: Phantom Car/Driver
